1.desc: Headquartered in New York and with offices in three states, Hometeam transforms the in-home care and aging experience by providing clients with personalized care planning, expert caregiver matching, custom mobile technology, and proactive case management to improve older adults’ health and well-being while giving their families peace of mind.What we're looking for:As an Account Manager on our Care Coordination team, you will have the opportunity to directly impact the lives of families and their elderly loved ones by enhancing quality of life on a daily basis. You will be the client-facing voice of Hometeam as you partner with licensed caregivers to deliver the best in-home care in the industry. Forming strong, proactive working relationships with our clients and caregivers will be paramount to our success.We’re looking for individuals who have a genuine desire to help others and a track-record of success in account management or other client-facing roles. In addition to gaining valuable client and project management experience, you will have unique opportunity to grow with Hometeam as we expand nationwide. Our Account Managers are crucial to our momentum!Responsibilities:Manage up to 50 client relationships; constantly look for unique and creative ways to create beautiful days, weeks, and months for every client in your portfolio, while also ensuring basic needs are metDevelop and execute a unique plan of care for each client in your portfolio, incorporating aspects of well-being, interests, hobbies, as well as clinical needs following a nurse’s assessmentManage Caregiver-specific issues, such as feedback and coaching, logistics, and disciplinary actionCommunicate with the family and other stakeholders to keep them up to date on details of careCollaborate with sales, engineering, and operations to coordinate service for your clientsIdentify and execute improvements to current processes, reporting, and documentation, and support your teammates in problem solving and task executionExceed monthly and quarterly client retention and satisfaction objectives for your portfolio of clients

6.desc: The Pew Charitable Trusts is driven by the power of knowledge to solve today's most challenging problems. Pew applies a rigorous, analytical approach to improve public policy, inform the public and invigorate civic life.We are an independent nonprofit organization – the sole beneficiary of seven individual trusts established between 1948 and 1979 by two sons and two daughters of Sun Oil Company founder Joseph N. Pew and his wife, Mary Anderson Pew.Our work lays the foundation for effective policy solutions by informing and engaging citizens, linking diverse interests to pursue common cause and insisting on tangible results. Our projects encourage efficient, responsive governments – at the local, state, national and international levels – serving the public interests.With offices in Philadelphia, Washington, DC, Brussels and London and staff in other regions of the United States as well as Australia, Pew provides an exciting learning environment and the opportunity to work with highly talented individuals. We are a dynamic, rapidly evolving organization that values creativity and innovative thinking and fosters strong teamwork with mutual respect.Government Performance:Government Performance (GP), an internal operating division of The Pew Charitable Trusts, identifies and advances effective policy approaches to critical issues. It researches emerging topics, develops data-driven reports, and highlights innovative approaches to complex problems. When the facts are clear, GP advocates for nonpartisan, pragmatic solutions.GP initiatives focuses on six areas: (1) strengthening the economic well-being of America's families; (2) promoting fiscal health at the state, federal and local levels; (3) advancing innovative, data-driven state policy in targeted areas, such as corrections, elections, and children's dental health; (4) ensuring a safe food supply; (5) encouraging safety and innovation in drugs and medical devices; and (6) fostering cutting-edge biomedical research. GP makes use of the basic tools required to help explore and advance effective policies, regardless of the issue: credible, timely, and user-friendly research; assessments of public support for change; strategic outreach and dissemination to ensure that good information is widely communicated to decision-makers, media, influential stakeholders, and the public; the capacity to bring together diverse perspectives and find common ground; and the ability to identify and apply approaches that have proven successful elsewhere.Position OverviewThe Officer position will serve as a senior in-house expert on survey development and analysis for Pew's Government Performance (GP) and Environment Departments and its Philadelphia Research Initiative. Specifically, the Officer will provide expert advice to project teams with respect to scope of research questions, sampling frames, questionnaire design, and preparation of the methods sections of research products and will serve as principal liaison with the Pew Research Center. The Officer will provide statistical and data analysis expertise to project teams as needed. The Officer will: (1) work closely with the Center's senior methodologist in reviewing all surveys of The Pew Charitable Trusts; and (2) help project teams ensure that work submitted to the Center for review is of high quality. In addition, the Officer will provide advice to GP project teams in other areas of research design and methods beyond survey methodology and participate directly in data collection and analysis performed by project teams.•	Provide senior level survey methods expertise and advice to project teams across The Pew Charitable Trusts.•	Lead and collaborate with project teams in designing sampling plans and strategies, writing questionnaires and other data collection instruments, analyzing the data (using advanced analytical and multivariate techniques where appropriate), and preparing the methodological sections of research reports.•	Provide broader advice to project teams on statistical analysis and quantitative and/or qualitative research design and methods.•	Manage workflow with the Pew Research Center; where necessary, provide or obtain guidance on workload priorities.•	Guide colleagues in selecting contractors, defining their work, and reviewing deliverables.•	Build and maintain productive working relationships with colleagues across The Pew Charitable Trusts and the Pew Research Center.•	Maintain awareness of best practices and new practices in survey methods.•	Provide assistance and guidance to project teams on the effective use of focus groups, case studies, and interviews.•	Respond efficiently and effectively to requests for research assistance.•	Occasional travel, including business meetings and conferences as required.

9.desc: Entertainment Cruises is the nation’s largest dining cruise company with a fleet of 30 ships in nine cities including: Baltimore, Boston, Chicago, National Harbor, MD, Norfolk, VA, Philadelphia, New York, Washington, DC and Weehawken, N.J., South Florida. 10.desc: Position: Internship - Software Engineer/Developer [Practical Learning Position for Investment Firm (i.e., Private equity/Hedge fund/Venture capital asset)]Function: Software Engineer/Developer (IoT, Big Data, Web Applications/Security/Social Media)Industry: Finance (Alternative Investment - Private equity, Hedge fund, Venture capital)Company: Ennovance Capital (www.ennovance.com) Location:  Downtown (16th & Walnut St.), Philadelphia, PAPosition Type:  Practical Learning Position (Unpaid/Course-credit/Volunteer internship opportunity)Start date:  ImmediatelyInternship term: Full time in summer (Part-time during school semester)eMail Reference, Resume, Transcripts, class schedule to: career@ennovance.comDescription: Ennovance Capital is a niche specialty and sophisticated alternative (Private equity, Hedge fund, Venture Capital) investor for chemicals, healthcare, clean-tech and materials related industry. 14.position: SAGA Fellow SY16-17 (Chicago, New York City
14.desc: ATTENTION Class of 2016! Are you looking to take a gap year or to do a year of post-graduate service? Look no further  join SAGA Innovations TODAY!Who WE AreSAGA transforms the lives of at-risk students giving them the skills, the attention and the self-esteem they need to achieve. Our tool is tutoring. Not your average, once-a-week, after school tutoring, but rather high dosage tutoring: personalized instructionfrom professional fellows who tutorfor one class period every dayfor an entire school year.Like most innovations, the concept is simple but the results are profound. Data shows that our tutoring methods dramatically improve what students can achieve. Which is everything. Because the ability to achieve can transform even the most hopeless student. And when you transform a student, you transform a life.Who YOU AreSAGA Fellows are full-time tutors working with students in some of the most disadvantaged school districts in the nation  the students nobody thinks can succeed. In our 10-month program, SAGA Fellows help transform these students through daily, personalized tutoring in a program that is achieving extraordinary results. In Chicago, for example, SAGA students gained more than 2.5 years of growth in math in just one year of tutoring.SAGA Fellows are recent college grads, mid-life career changers, recent retirees  anyone dedicated to social justice and looking for a profound experience in helping students to achieve. While we require Fellows to have a college degree, most do not have a degree in education. We do require strong math skills, as our program is currently focused on tutoring 9th grade Algebra. What YOU DoSAGA Fellows serve a year in a Chicago or New York City public school. Fellows spend the service year tutoring math, working with the same 14 students every day in groups of 1 tutor: 2 students. SAGA tutoring occurs as a stand-alone class period and is built into the regular school day as an elective course for credit. As a SAGA Fellow, you will:	Tutor 14 students. Youll spend one school year working with the same students every day, two at a time, serving as their mentor and helping them achieve specific academic goals.	Develop tutoring skills. Youll receive in-depth training in tutoring techniques and in managing student behavior, and youll receive constant daily feedback from your site director to help you improve as a tutor.	Build relationships. In addition to strong relationships with your students, youll communicate regularly with their families to create the most successful and supportive learning environment for your pupils. WHY JoinWant to transform American public education? Want to eliminate, not narrow the achievement gap? Want to transform the life of a student? Then apply to be a SAGA Fellow TODAY! People join for many reasons. Some are taking a gap-year before graduate/professional school and want to do something meaningful. Others are interested in exploring a career in non-profits or education, or simply are passionate about social justice.

15.company: NYC Office of Management and Budget
15.desc: As part of the Office of the Mayor, the New York City Office of Management and Budget (OMB), is responsible for preparing the Mayor’s Preliminary and Executive Budgets and overseeing an annual budget of $81.7 billion. Additionally, OMB advises the Mayor on issues affecting the City’s fiscal health and the efficiency of City services and programs.  As the City’s chief financial office, OMB examines each aspect of government, looking for ways to improve existing services and forecasting how current trends will impact the City and its economy.OMB is offering a summer internship opportunity to several students interested in gaining invaluable experience working in City government. Interns will be paired with an analyst in an OMB Task Force and will assist with the day-to-day analysis, research and/or financial planning conducted by the unit.  Internships will be available in various Task Forces within the agency.  During their time at OMB, interns may work with a budget analyst to analyze the operations, projects, and expense, capital or revenue budgets of a New York City agency. Interns with coursework in statistics and econometrics may also help conduct research on a wide range of public policy topics such as income inequality or housing and economic development.

21.desc: The Washington D.C. office of Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP is seeking a new Economist (Energy Analyst). The Economist (Energy Analyst) works closely with attorneys in the firm to provide high quality, timely analysis regarding energy market and energy and environmental regulatory developments affecting the electricity, natural gas, and oil industries, including issues pertaining to renewable energy and climate change. The Economist is expected to engage in data gathering, research, analysis, and writing.  Primary responsibilities include conducting research on the market impacts of factors influencing energy supply and demand, including weather, energy and environmental regulations, and energy and environmental policy;  help assess potential price trends and risks for oil, natural gas, and electricity; writing regularly for multiple research publications; and performing analysis on and visualizing complex quantitative data.

Working alongside some of the smartest and most passionate innovators, you will join our powerhouse sales team. You will be fully immersed in growing our company, and will gain invaluable, life-long communication skills. Our sales team is vital to the companys success, and we need A+ talent to come in and help take our company to the next level. YOU: Are driven to succeed in everything you do, and you NEVER give up  Are outgoing, with a great personality and good people skills Are interested in the start-up world, interactive media space, and cutting-edge technology Want to contribute immediately to a team-oriented environment Have a strong and focused work ethic; Are able to handle a daily grind Want to learn and get better everyday Take the initiative to go above and beyond Are a self-starter  Are career oriented, and looking for growth Have a sharp, professional demeanor  Are excited by high-energy, fast paced settings  Are competitive  Are looking to get into sales THE JOB:  Call on and speak with small business owners across the country, consulting on HomeAdvisors services and products - We will provide all leads, and you will be cold-calling before you have follow-ups/warm calls or a pipeline in place  Drive new business acquisition  Learn sales techniques and help to develop new, creative sales strategies  Share feedback and ideas with upper management  Develop excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills REQUIREMENTS:  Must have PASSION  Must have FUN  Take challenges head-on, and face rejection with a consistently positive attitude!  Desire to put in 115%  Ability to work independently, while also actively contributing within a team  Excellent time management and organization skills required  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Advanced MS Office skills, including Outlook, Word and Excel, and strong familiarity with e-mail and Internet  Bachelors degree as of 12/2015 Sales experience a plus, but not necessary We offer a competitive base plus commission compensation package, as well as a comprehensive benefits program, including: o Health insurance, with options for dental and vision coverage o A relaxed work atmosphere o Paid vacation, personal, and sick time o 401k o Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner ** All benefits listed are subject to change.Equal opportunity employer

23.desc: At PennyPop, our mission is to bring people together through the power of play. We believe in teamwork, intellectual honesty, and high quality craftsmanship and work hard to create simple, beautiful and massively social games that expand the possibility space of people’s lives.We are passionate, boot-strapped and profitable. Our 45 person team is made up of the best artists, developers and designers in the world. We have developed over 55 top 25 applications in the App Store and our latest game, Battle Camp, is the world’s largest mobile MMO with over 30 million downloads. Battle Camp was the App Store’s Best Multiplayer Game and is a Top 100 Grossing App in 100 countries on iOS and Android.The Role:PennyPop is seeking a data junkie with a passion for growing our user base and expanding our audience.  You have a passion for looking at data, making connections to optimization and a strong desire to actually take action on your analysis. You have a side passion for all things technical. Whether you're experienced in mobile analytics or come from the financial industry, at the core of this role is doing analysis and implementing actual change that impacts our users and business. This is a summer Internship and a great opportunity for those passionate about mobile to be at the forefront, as well as for people with a finance background looking to break into the startup world. We consider ourselves innovators in speed, analytics and execution, and this duly applies to our growth strategy.  We’re itching for the next brilliant mind to walk in the door and join us in a nimble data driven environment.Come join PennyPop's Growth Team that has delivered the #1 Top New Free App on Android (Google Play - August 2014), officially awarded the Best Multiplayer Game by Apple and Editors' Choice by Google, and consistently ranked Top 100 Grossing in 100 countries on Android and iOS! Work with bright minds from Penn, UChicago, Berkeley with industry experience spanning Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, Intel and more.Responsibilities:Help us grow our mobile user base through paid advertisingDeep dive into marketing performance, yield analysis, and engagementProvide analytical insight into trends and strategize adjustments to meet goalsOwn and drive innovative marketing experimentation through A/B testing and creative iterationCollaborate with engineering team to develop new tools for deeper analytical insightsOwn our user acquisition in key marketing channelsMaintain and cultivate relationships with key partners and companies.Sound Good?Our offices are located in the heart of San Francisco, and are easily accessible by local, regional transit (BART, Muni, etc.).  You can also visit us online at www.pennypop.com. While we work hard to make the best games out there, we support a casual, open environment where we’re all in this together!If this sounds like you, please send us your resume and cover letter telling us about your experience and favorite games to Jobs@mirpartners.com. If it applies, please make sure to include the exact job title in the subject line.

24.desc: Procurement is a pioneering, influencing function; with over 900 members across more than 50 countries we buy goods and services on a global scale. But we do more in global procurement than just purchase things. We partner with business units to drive value from supplier relationships to support GSK’s strategies and targets to ensure a secure supply in all areas of our business – from consumer health products to pharmaceutical development.Worksite is located in Philadelphia Naval Yard. The 208,000 square foot glass-encased building includes an open floor plan, a four-story central atrium, a grand central staircase, a coffee shop, cafeteria, fitness center, meeting centers and a large multi-purpose room.Internships within Procurement offer the opportunity to work on an assignment as part of one of the category teams. This internship will be focused on the NA Commercial team. We are looking for someone to support us across the category team with ensuring that some of our key strategic priorities for 2016 are delivered.   This includes, ensuring that we have full contract compliance with our suppliers, supporting Procurement with Novartis/GSK integration activities, and implementation of SAP for P2P activities.  During this time you will be provided with the appropriate level of support and training. Some of the project work undertaken on previous internships includes:•	Developing a supply chain map for a new product to simplify the supply chain•	Development of cost analysis tools to support supplier negotiations•	Working with supply chains in emerging markets•	Supporting and negotiating supply agreements•	Contributing to purchasing strategy developmentWhat do I need to have to be successful?•	We are seeking students commercially driven and possess the energy, passion, and positive attitude to succeed and take on real responsibility during the internship. •	An ideal candidate would possess excellent communication skills (verbal and written); the ability to build good working relationships as you’ll be interacting with various colleagues at different levels within the organization; and a ‘business curiosity’ to engage with people both inside and outside of GSK.  •	Strong Excel and project management skills would be an asset.GSK Internship/Co-op Program is jointly managed between GSK and Zero Chaos.  Students will be employed as Zero Chaos employees but assigned to GSK. Selected Intern/Co-op student is responsible for his/her relocation (housing and transportation). GSK does not provide subsidies for housing or travel for this position.Job Specific Questions:•	“What do you know about Procurement?” •	“Will you be at least a Junior or Senior at the time this internship?” •	“Are you available at the time of the internship for a 12 week period?” •	“Are you available to work from the Philadelphia location?”•	“Tell me about your experience using excel?” •	“Tell me about an example of when you have had to have strong project management skills.”

25.desc: Intern - BankMobile Marketing & Strategy May to July 2016 Park Ave South, New York, NYChanging the World + the World of Banking. BankMobile is on a mission to make banking affordable, effortless, and financially empowering for Gen Z, millennials, and the underbanked. We have free ATMs nationwide, offer completely free checking & savings accounts, and provide free financial empowerment coaching. Through our simple mobile platform, banking has never been easier!Do you want to join the #LiveFreeBankFree revolution & work for the most innovative, fastest growing bank in the country? Well, we’re looking for someone to join our stellar team and contribute great marketing and strategic ideas to help us continue to grow while fulfilling our social mission.  What could a typical day entail?●	Identify new marketing strategies for customer acquisition ○	Research, development, and execution ●	Create marketing content○	Writing blogs, social media posts, emails, press releases, etc●	Identify and Develop Strategic Partnerships○	With both fintech and lifestyle focused companies  ●	Develop and execute guerilla marketing strategies ○	Supporting the team off-site at campus job fairs, local street fairs, and regional appearances

26.desc: ABOUT THE COMPANY I'm Sorry To Hear is an exciting Philadelphia consumer-tech startup focused on the $30B funeral industry and improving the consumer experience in funeral and end-of-life planning. As a leader in the “death-tech” movement, our online marketplace assists families with the vendor discovery process connecting families with critical information on funeral vendors, products, planning tools, & educational resources.  OUR MISSION is to digitize funeral planning by bringing the offline process online, facilitating the whole vendor discovery, scheduling, and purchasing processes online while guiding consumers through life’s final event.Touted as the “TripAdvisor“ or “Yelp” of funeral planning, our online community combines a comprehensive, searchable funeral vendor marketplace, education, and planning tools to make the funeral planning process simpler, quicker, and more transparent.Launched in October 2012 the company has been featured in numerous media outlets (In The News) as a disruptor to the stagnant funeral industry.  I’m Sorry to Hear is a current Project Liberty company, operating from the newsroom floor at the Philadelphia Inquirer. We are gearing up to fully rebrand, redesign, and redevelop the marketplace into a modern, mobile-friendly, and interactive website with more robust features and better flow for both user and vendors alike.JOB DESCRIPTION: I’m Sorry to Hear is seeking an experienced front-end web-developer with a strong portfolio and experience building responsive marketplace-oriented websites. Must be available full-time throughout our website rebranding, redesign and redevelopment project (approximate timeframe March-June).  You will be an integral part of our core-team, closely working with all members to achieve the launch of 2.0. You will be responsible for implementing the new web designs and flow of the website and providing feedback and ideas for improving website look and feel.You will be working closely with the UI/UX Designer and back-end developers.

27.position: Lead UI and UX Web Designer
27.desc: ABOUT THE COMPANY I'm Sorry To Hear is an exciting Philadelphia consumer-tech startup focused on the $30B funeral industry and improving the consumer experience in funeral and end-of-life planning. As a leader in the “death-tech” movement, our online marketplace assists families with the vendor discovery process connecting families with critical information on funeral vendors, products, planning tools, & educational resources.  OUR MISSION is to digitize funeral planning by bringing the offline process online, facilitating the whole vendor discovery, scheduling, and purchasing processes online while guiding consumers through life’s final event.Touted as the “TripAdvisor“ or “Yelp” of funeral planning, our online community combines a comprehensive, searchable funeral vendor marketplace, education, and planning tools to make the funeral planning process simpler, quicker, and more transparent.Launched in October 2012 the company has been featured in numerous media outlets (In The News) as a disruptor to the stagnant funeral industry.  I’m Sorry to Hear is a current Project Liberty company, operating from the newsroom floor at the Philadelphia Inquirer. 28.desc: Interested in law firm experience before grad or law school?  Girard Gibbs LLP is a national law firm that represents plaintiffs in class action and other complex litigation. Our cases range from abuses of consumer and privacy laws to matters involving antitrust and securities violations. We litigate against some of the countrys largest corporations. Girard Gibbs LLP is seeking a Litigation Assistant for our San Francisco office. In this position you will perform case investigations, conduct legal research, interview potential clients, and assist with litigation.  The ideal candidate will be motivated, detail oriented, take pride in their work, and enjoy being challenged.  Bachelors degree and strong written and verbal communication skills are required.  Our firm is proud to offer a dynamic and team-oriented atmosphere, where everyone has an opportunity to meaningfully contribute.  For consideration to the position of Litigation Assistant, please email your resume and cover letter as attachments to:Valerie AdmanaOffice Managervla@girardgibbs.com

29.position: Match Corps: An AmeriCorps Service Year Impacting Kids in Boston
29.desc: Match Corps members spend a year in Boston, building relationships with a small handful of students enrolled in the Match Schools in Boston and working with them to reach their academic goals in daily, small group instructional sessions. If youre in search of a service year opportunity that brings together like-minded people from across the country to make a meaningful impact in the lives of young people, then please read on. Match Corps might be the perfect experience for you!The Match Corps currently has over 700 alumni across the nation and this past spring, celebrated its 10 year anniversary. This video highlights what current and former Match students had to say about the Match Corps: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQKN72I-Bhc&feature=youtu.beTHE MATCH SCHOOL:The Match School is a nationally recognized, high performing school network that serves low-income students in Boston. The school has four campuses: Match Community Day, Match Next, Match Middle School, and Match High School, cumulatively serving grades Pre-K through 12. Our mission is to prepare ALL of our students to succeed in college and beyond. Many of our students arrive to our school several grade levels behind. We believe with great teachers, tutors, and staff, quality instruction, and uncompromising expectations, these students can and will succeed. Our work is done through a combination of innovation, drive, and an emphasis on relationship building with students and their families. You can learn more about our students here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OEFQyO_vNzs&feature=player_embeddedMATCH CORPS PROGRAM DESCRIPTION:Match Corps members spend a service year tutoring and building relationships with students in the Match School.The Match Corps is not just for future teachers.  Many of our tutors join the program because they are searching for a service year experience---either because they are taking a gap year before graduate or professional school and want to do something meaningful for a year, are interested in exploring a career in non-profits or education policy, or are simply passionate about social justice.This service year takes place at one of Match's four campuses. Match Corps members serve as full-time tutors to small groups of students in core subjects while building strong relationships with their families. The Match Corps play a vital role in our school as members provide individualized attention to students, which has proven to have tremendous impact on their academic success.In addition to tutoring, Match Corps members also have the opportunity to work alongside school leaders, staff, and teachers as teaching assistants or administrative assistants. Corps members especially enjoy this aspect as it provides them with opportunities to learn more about urban education and explore different careers within the sector. Corps members also have the opportunity to attend education reform panels hosted by Match throughout the school year. This is great for those who want meet and hear from key players in the education reform community.Another aspect Corps members enjoy in their service year is the sense of community at the school. Match Corps members often develop very close bonds with each other and in many cases end up leaving the program with life-long friends and strong professional networks.Our newest partnership with AmeriCorps allows Corps members to receive a few unique benefits as well.-	Upon completing their year of service, Match Corps members can earn a $5,775.00 education award, applicable toward eligible post-secondary institution costs and qualified student loans.-	They can also apply for loan forbearance or deferment on eligible loans, allowing them to postpone loan payments until after their year of service has completed.-	Match Corps members may also eligible for childcare subsidies, and a number of other benefits unique to AmeriCorps.Click here to find out more about Match Corps: http://www.matcheducation.org/join/match-corps/Desired Skills and Experience: - Bachelors degree- U.S. citizen, national, or permanent resident status- Dedicated to constantly improving- Strong communication and writing skills - Relentless work ethic - Committed to spending a year working with students in an exciting, fast-paced school settingIf youre interested in pairing your Match Corps experience with dynamic teacher training in an urban school environment, click here to learn more about Match Teacher Residency: http://www.matcheducation.org/join/match-teacher-residency/

30.desc: AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply Do you want to teach but are worried that youre not ready to jump right into the classroom? Do you want the decision of where you teach to be up to you? Do you want the opportunity to receive a Masters Degree but dont want to spend a year away from students doing so?Then the Match Teacher Residency in Boston and the Sposato Graduate School of Education might be for you.Heres how it works:1.	You spend a year in Boston helping a small group of students in a high-performing, high-needs school called the Match School. Youll be a member of the Match Corps.2.	When you aren't working with your students, youll be receiving the practical training youll need to be a strong rookie teacher from the Sposato Graduate School of Education. You can read about Lindsey, a current Match Teacher Resident, in a recent article in Bridge Magazine.3.	After your year in Boston helping a small group of students, youll be hired as a full-time, rookie teacher in a high-performing, high-needs school in Boston or elsewhere. 4.	100% of Match Teacher Residents are hired in full-time teaching jobs. Check out where our alumni were hired by clicking here: http://www.sposatogse.org/people/alumni/5.	During your rookie year teaching youll complete individualized coursework and support, and receive a Masters Degree from the Massachusetts Board of Higher Education approved Sposato Graduate School of Education. Want to learn more?Check out our websites:www.matchschools.orgwww.sposatogse.orgWant to apply?Click here: https://matchrecruiting.quickbase.com/db/bhbqq2dbsfor the application to become both a Match Corps member and a student in the Sposato Graduate School of Education.Applications are accepted and reviewed on a rolling basis until all corps members are hired.  If you have specific questions about the Match Corps job or application process please feel free to shoot us an email at recruiting@matcheducation.org.  We look forward to hearing from you!Follow us on Twitter @MatchCorps/@MatchEducation and like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/matcheducation!

31.desc: PublicRelay is looking for analysts to provide in-depth media intelligence and executive level reporting to Fortune 500 level companies, national trade associations, and federal government agencies. About PublicRelayPublicRelay has developed a sophisticated software and service which allows analysts to identify actionable media insights for communications, marketing, and strategy executives. Our analysis enables executive level clients to understand their media landscape and assess the impact of their teams’ efforts. PublicRelay is headquartered just outside of Washington, D.C., in Tysons Corner, VA. We are Metro-accessible and just a 5-minute walk from the Silver Line. Media Analyst RoleAnalysts assess traditional, social, and broadcast media from all over the world to provide clients with a highly refined view of their most important coverage. The media intelligence that PublicRelay provides allows our clients to develop sophisticated strategies for promoting their companies and brands.  Successful candidates possess a mix of intelligence and interpersonal skills which allow them to build personal relationships with C-suite clientele. Candidates must be highly analytical, self-motivated, and have demonstrated the ability to work quickly and efficiently under deadline pressure to support daily client deliverables.  Due to our clients’ need for timely analysis, the willingness to work a schedule that is shifted to early morning hours (e.g., 6AM) is important.  Responsibilities• Utilize our proprietary systems to prioritize and filter domestic and international media content • Build relationships with executive level clients to understand their needs and provide concise analysis• Research and gather additional data for clients to provide a more comprehensive picture of people and events in the news• Build complex analytic reports based on coverage analysis to identify patterns and trends

32.desc: The Pulse is a one-hour, weekly radio show that airs on Friday at 9 a.m. and Sunday at 10 a.m. It is a production of WHYY’s Health and Science desk.Health & Science interns will: •	Learn to report audio and web stories for the WHYY health and science desk;•	Assist reporters in seeking out health and science related story ideas in the Philadelphia region;•	Learn to pitch stories and to research story ideas;•	Attend press events and learn to write daily news spots.  The Pulse interns will:•	Help seek out sound-rich health and science related ideas for the show;•	Assist H&S reporters and producers on weekly production tasks;•	Learn to research story ideas and to pitch story ideas;•	Assist in transcribing interviews;•	Will collaborate with producers on recurring segments;•	Assist in sending out weekly online media kits to help promote coverage.Interns should be able to devote two full days a week to the internship.

33.desc: Fox Rothschild LLP has an opening in the Philadelphia, Pa. office for an entry level Paralegal in the Litigation Department. Must be detail oriented and possess excellent communication, writing, organizational and computer skills. Bachelor’s degree required and minimum GPA of 3.6.  This is an exciting opportunity to work in a National Law Firm with more than 600 attorneys practicing in 21 offices coast to coast. We’ve been serving clients for more than a century, and we’ve been climbing the ranks of the nation’s 250 largest firms for many years, according to The National Law Journal.

34.desc: Company Description:Located in Philadelphia, PA, Reason Research provides full-service market research services to pharmaceutical, biotech & medical device clients.Job Description:Reason Research is a full-service healthcare market research consultancy. We are currently looking to fill a full-time research analyst position to help support our team of lead researchers working on market research for Pharmaceutical & Biotech companies. Your work will support custom research designs that help our clients manage their brands, messaging, marketing spend and more.The ideal candidate has a strong quantitative orientation, an interest in the Pharmaceutical & Biotech industry and a desire to pursue a career in market research.Your job role and responsibilities will include: (1) Attending and participating in regularly scheduled client and internal project team meetings; (2) Testing online surveys to ensure accurate programming; (3) Analyzing qualitative (coding open ends) and quantitative data (SPSS); (4) Creating PowerPoint reports of data and insights; (5) Quality checking of all client deliverables; and (6) Communicating with our external vendors to manage survey programming, respondent recruiting, and data delivery.This client and internal-facing position requires great communications skills, a strong interest in survey-based research, a familiarity with basic survey research methodologies, quantitative skills (e.g., Excel, SPSS), and a desire to learn and work hard. This position offers considerable opportunity for learning and advancement for the right person.

35.desc: The Russian American Foundation (RAF) operates an internationally acclaimed youth program in partnership with Moscow's Bolshoi Ballet Academy, one of the oldest and most established schools for classical ballet training.  The Program takes place for 6 weeks during the summer on a campus of a prestigious private school in Connecticut and in New York City.  RAF is looking for mature, responsible, outgoing individuals for the following positions. CT Staff are required to live on campus for the duration / NY positions may have flexibility. RAF is always looking for intelligent, engaging, responsible students who are interested in the arts, education, international affairs.  Summer positions often lead to more long-term opportunities with RAF. 1) JOB DESCRIPTION: Overnight Counselor CT (6/23 – 8/6/16)Counselors will be responsible for supervising participants (ages 9 -14yrs), as well as planning and running some extracurricular activities (i.e. - non-contact outdoor games, arts & crafts, music, acting, etc.).Required:- Experience with overseeing children. - Age 18 or older.- Sensitivity to/appreciation of other cultures and foreign studentsCompensation:- $1800 for the period + housing & meals + bonus for exceptional performance of responsibilities- 5 days off will be assigned during the period 2) JOB DESCRIPTION: Sr. Staff / Stretch & Dance CT (6/23 – 8/16/16)Required:- Professional experience teaching modern or jazz dance to youth. - Age 18 or older.- Sensitivity to/appreciation of other cultures and foreign studentsCompensation:- $3000 for the period + housing & meals- 5 days off will be assigned during the period 3) JOB DESCRIPTION: Ballet Translator (6/23 – 8/6/15 NYC or CT)Staff/Translator will be responsible for translating during ballet classes from Russian language to English language. Ability to conduct a stretch class for dancers is a plus. Some participant overseeing duties will be assigned also.Required:- Knowledge of ballet terminology- Advanced fluency in English and Russian languages- Experience with minors and sensitivity to/appreciation of other cultures and foreign students- Age 18 or olderCompensation:- $3000 for the period + housing & meals- 5 days off will be assigned during the period*If housing is not needed in NYC, different terms can be discussed.

36.desc: DRW is a principal trading organization.  Unlike hedge funds, brokerage firms and banks, DRW has no investors, clients or customers.  We trade for our account using software we develop.  DRW is active in a wide range of asset classes both domestically and internationally.DRW is headquartered in Chicago and has offices in London, Montreal, New York, San Francisco and Singapore.  We currently employ over 600 people worldwide from many different disciplines and backgrounds.We are seeking undergraduate and graduate students for our full-time Software Engineer positions. Prior knowledge of financial markets is not required.  Please note that you must apply for positions with DRW through your University’s career services website and also directly on our company website using the following link: https://goo.gl/C2eHQq.Responsibilities•Design, develop and test proprietary software.  Examples include:    - Trading strategy simulation software optimized for distributed computation     -Large scale data acquisition, storage, accessibility, and visualization     -Ultra low-latency trading systems     -Complex algorithmic trading systems     -Real time trade management and risk analysis•Work directly with Traders, Quantitative Researchers, Business Analysts and other Software Engineers in cross-functional team environments

37.desc: This is a position requiring professional phone skills, independent thinking, and advanced scheduling/registration techniques. The Access Services Specialist will plan, coordinate, schedule and register outpatient appointments as well as complex procedures to optimize patient flow for designated area of responsibilities. The scheduling duties will involve coordinating and scheduling outpatient appointments as well as procedures (depending on scheduling area) The registration duties will involve verifying and updating patient demographic, referring physician, and insurance information. Responsibilities will also include verifying insurance eligibility as well as providing co-payment/payment requirements as it relates to scheduled outpatient appointment(s).   The Children's Hospital of Philadelphia is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, national or ethnic origin, disability or protected veteran status.

38.position: Policy Intern (Summer 2016 - located in Washington, DC office
38.desc: Lumina Foundation - Policy Intern (Summer 2016 - located in Washington, DC office)Information at https://www.luminafoundation.org/careers-at-lumina/dc-policy-intern-summer-2016Duration	12-15 weeks	May 2– August 12 (dates open to negotiation)Compensation$18-$22, depending on experienceSchedule	Minimum 20 hours/week, 30-40 hours preferred	Flexibility negotiated with supervisor (additional hours per week may also be negotiated)ResponsibilitiesThe candidate will be required to provide support and assistance on the delivery of specific projects across the DC based staff. This will involve minimal administrative support; liaising with a wide variety of people and organizations, undertaking background research and literature reviews; writing, proofing and editing of important deliverables; and the organization of events.	Work with Strategy Directors and Officers to conduct federal policy and student financial support outreach;	Conduct research on policy issues, and help staff in the development of relevant deliverables; and 	Assist Strategy Officers with the tracking, collecting and monitoring of databases relevant to strategy work.Required	Strong communication (written and oral) & analytical skills	Ability to work independently	Digital & technical literacy 	Ability to collaborate and willingness to work with a team	Familiarity with federal policy environment	Familiarity with higher education policy, especially barriers to completion for today’s students (students of color, low income students, first generation students, adults, veterans, etc.)	Familiarity with barriers, policy issues, and effective practice related to student financial support, with an emphasis on state and federal financial aid modelsQualifications	A currently enrolled graduate student or doctoral candidate	Recent graduates of Masters/Doctoral/professional programs also consideredApplicants should send, to the e-mail address below, a letter of interest and resume/curriculum vitae as attachments outlining experience relevant to the position and desired compensation. Please specify the position you are applying for in the subject line. Applications are considered on a rolling basis; posting will close by Wednesday, March 9, 2015.David CroomStrategy Officerluminaintern@luminafoundation.org

39.desc: GHS Global Health 2016-2017 Fellowship ProgramIf you are a graduate (spring/summer 2016) who is passionate about improving global health through communications and advocacy, the Global Health Strategies (GHS) one-year Fellowship Program offers a unique opportunity for professional growth and learning.Our fellows are entrepreneurial, innovative and strategic thinkers with excellent communications and analytical skills. Fellows are team players and have a strong commitment to our clients. They also bring a sense of humor and enjoy having fun.Objectives of the GHS Fellowship Program:The GHS Fellowship Program affords young professionals the opportunity to:• Gain exposure to the field of global health communications and advocacy• Hone their writing, research and strategic thinking skills• Work with high-profile clients on high-impact projects• Attend presentations and trainings with leaders in the global health field• Receive professional evaluation, assessment and mentorshipThe Fellow Experience:Fellows work closely with GHS staff to assist in the design and implementation of communications and advocacy strategies for a range of in issues in global health, including infectious disease, immunization, women’s health and universal health coverage. Fellows are provided hands-on experience meaningfully contributing to client goals.Fellows spend the majority of their time on client work and are also provided opportunities for training and development.Client work may include:• Contributing to the research and writing of strategy memos, media materials and issue briefs• Monitoring and analyzing media coverage and advocate conversations about global health issues• Providing logistics support for conferences, meetings and events that GHS organizes on behalf of clients• Managing databases of global health media, policymakers and opinion leaders• Assisting GHS staff with project management (e.g., drafting meeting minutes, updating work plans, tracking budgets)Training and development opportunities may include:• Weekly support with a fellow manager; monthly mentorship with member of the GHS senior management team• Access to skills trainings, reading list and lunch and learns at GHS with leaders in the global health field• Sponsorship to attend global health events in NYC• Opportunity to become an expert on a particular issue within global healthHow to Apply for June 2016-2017 Fellowship Program:    Applications Accepted February 8 – March 11    Candidates Contacted for Interviews March 14 – March 18    Candidate Interview Period (3 rounds via web conferencing and onsite) March 21 – April 8    GHS 2016 Fellowship Offers Extended April 11 – April 22    Fellows Start at GHS June 13* Timeline may be adjusted by GHS *Please submit your cover letter, resume, writing sample and three professional or academic references (references should include name, org, email and/or tel only) via online submission via: http://globalhealthstrategies.com/usa-opportunities by March 11, 2016. We will contact you if your background matches our job qualifications.For more information about careers at GHS, please visit http://www.globalhealthstrategies.com/career-opportunities.GHS is an equal opportunity employer and encourages people of diverse background to apply.About GHS:Global Health Strategies (GHS) is an international consulting company that works with clients to ensure development and worldwide delivery of health products, technologies and information. GHS has offices in New York, New Delhi, Nairobi, Rio de Janeiro and Beijing and supports work in diverse countries in Africa, Asia, Europe and the Americas. We specialize in global health communications, advocacy, research and strategy. We focus on international public health issues that impact developing nations and emerging markets. Our clients include foundations, industry, NGOs, government agencies, academic institutions and product development partnerships.

40.desc: Associate - New YorkApply here: http://bit.ly/1QbP0N1AlphaSights is seeking ambitious 2015/2016 graduates to join our client service team. If you are competitive, commercially motivated and excited about early responsibility and a steep learning curve, we’d love to hear from you.A HIGH-GROWTH COMPANYRegularly ranked as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world (The Sunday Times Fast Track 100, Crain’s List, Inc 5000), AlphaSights was founded in 2008 and now has a worldwide team of over 300 professionals based across our offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Dubai and Hong Kong.Our client service team works alongside strategy consultants, private equity, hedge funds, investors and corporate decision-makers, connecting them with handpicked industry experts who bring highly relevant knowledge to address our clients’ challenges. Through our service, we help our clients access the insights and expertise they need to decide and execute more quickly and effectively.A FRONTLINE ROLEAs a new joiner, your role is to act as the intermediary between our clients and specific industry experts. You will focus on understanding our clients' knowledge gaps and defining the relevant expertise required to fill them. You then identify, engage and qualify experts who possess that knowledge. This involves researching companies and sectors, contacting seasoned professionals and evaluating their relevance. You then connect these professionals with our clients through direct conversations and face-to-face meetings. You will be in a fast-paced, communication-intense frontline role, driven by client demand and stretch targets - you should expect to run several projects concurrently, mastering competing deadlines and fast turnaround times.A CLEAR CAREER PATHAlphaSights provides a clear path for our people to develop into confident, autonomously operating business leaders who can win new business, grow client relationships, and recruit, train and inspire colleagues. Once you excel at the core requirements of the entry-level role, you will take on additional responsibilities, including project management, relationship management, and coaching of new team members. You will receive intensive training along the core dimensions it takes to become a commercial leader, including account management, business development, negotiation, leadership, recruitment, and talent development.Read more about our career path at http://www.alphasights.com/careers/your-pathWHAT WE LOOK FOR:We look for the following features when assessing and selecting new team members:You can articulate a clear direction for your early-stage career and how AlphaSights fits with your journeyYou have the confidence to lead conversations with senior executives in diverse markets and functionsYou excel in a high-growth, high-performance environment that can be uncertain and complexYou have an infectious, positive ‘can-do’ attitude and desire to make an impactYou empathise, connect with others and build meaningful relationshipsYou get a buzz from driving results and generating revenue

41.desc: Client Protection Associate, New YorkAt AlphaSights, we deliver an unmatched client service experience to the world’s leading investors and decision makers. As we continue our rapid growth, building a robust, proactive and innovative Client Protection Team is critical.We need someone to anticipate our clients’ concerns and enact internal policies that ensure our clients maximize the benefits of our service - we’re not looking for someone to sit around waiting for questions to arise. Client Protection Associates monitor every project, implement new policies, train our employees, and ensure that everyone plays by the rules. If you are a meticulous team player with an interest in operations, law, risk management, or compliance, this is the place for you.Our Company AlphaSights is a next-generation information services firm with offices in New York, London, Dubai, and Hong Kong. We operate at the nexus between our global client base (decision-makers from private equity, hedge funds, consultancy and corporate strategy) and experienced industry practitioners who bring highly relevant insight and expertise to our clients’ decisions. Founded in 2008, we are now a worldwide team of 250+ and growing rapidly.Your role:You will be joining a global team and you will work closely with our Client Services Team to ensure our clients are always served to the highest standards. On a day-to-day basis, you will:Monitor active client services projects to flag and mitigate potential risksDesign and implement office-wide operational policies that protect our clientsRespond to and effectively manage compliance-related crisesCreate and distribute training materials to our Client Services TeamWhat we look for:Career maturity and alignment – clear about direction, committed to getting there and aware of how Client Protection at AlphaSights fits with your journeyInnate personal confidence – able to thrive in an environment that at times can be volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous (VUCA)Rigorous attention to detail – able to anticipate potential risks and proactively find ways to prevent compliance-related crisesPeople-oriented, emotionally intelligent team player – able to de-escalate situations patiently and calmly, yet quickly and effectivelyGenuine interest in operations, compliance, risk management, or law (experience in these fields is not required)

42.position: Executive Director, Blavatnik and Global Science Awards, New York Academy of Sciences
42.desc: ORGANIZATION:  The New York Academy of Sciences (NYAS)			The New York Academy of Sciences is an independent, not-for-profit organization committed to advancing science and technology since 1817. With over 20,000 members in 100 countries, the Academy has one of the world’s most elite networks of experts and partner organizations. Its President’s Council includes 27 Nobel Laureates, as well as CEOs, philanthropists, and leaders of national science funding agencies. It participates in alliances with over 40 universities and academic medical centers, as well as scores of multinational companies and NGOs. The Academy uses these networks to catalyze path-breaking initiatives for scientific, social, and economic benefit, both locally, in New York, and globally, in developed economies and emerging markets. The Academy employs about 100 professional and support staff and has an annual operating budget of over $20 million. The Academy of Sciences is located at 7 World Trade Center in lower Manhattan. More information can be found on the NYAS website: www.nyas.orgPOSITION OVERVIEW:The Blavatnik Awards for Young Scientists is a landmark national award for young scientists 42 years of age or younger. Established in 2007, the program recognizes early-career scientists who have made innovative advances in the life sciences, physical sciences and engineering, and chemistry. The awards are managed by the NYAS and funded by the Blavatnik Family Foundation, an active supporter of numerous leading educational, scientific, and cultural institutions throughout the United States and the world. The Blavatnik Family Foundation was founded by Len Blavatnik, an American industrialist and chairman of Access Industries—a privately-held, global industrial group.Until 2013, the Blavatnik Awards were limited to young scientists in the New York Tri-State area. However, due to the tremendous importance and success of the program, the Academy, with the support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, expanded the geographical coverage of the awards to include scientists nationally from across all of the United States. The Academy is seeking an entrepreneurial and dynamic executive director to lead the continuing growth of this program and other scientific awards at the Academy. He/she will oversee the continued development and implementation of the regional and U.S. programs, while seeking opportunities to expand the concept to other awards programs globally.  The executive director will manage a department of five full-time professionals, including three Ph.D. scientists representing the scientific disciplines in which the awards are made. He/she will report to the Academy’s executive vice president/chief operating officer.(For more information about NYAS and the Blavatnik Awards for Young Scientists, visit www.nyas.org/blavatnikawards.)RESPONSIBILITIES: The specific responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to the following: •	Develop an extensive understanding of the Academy, its mission, strategy and programs. •	In collaboration with the Blavatnik Family Foundation, continue to implement and expand the national and regional programs, including branding and communication, application, judging and selection, and presentation of the awards. •	Work with the Academy’s communications team and outside marketing firm to develop and implement a comprehensive communications/marketing strategy that positions the Blavatnik Awards for Young Scientists as the landmark national program for young scientists, lays the foundation for creating a unique brand and network of young scientists, and generates significant interest in the program. •	Work with the Academy’s development team to craft and present proposals for new additional awards programs, as well as new initiatives that build upon and enrich existing programs•	Be the public face of the program; develop relationships with the leaders and stakeholders of prestigious national academic and research institutions; gain commitment for the program, resulting in a high level of award applications from a large geographic base.•	Develop and maintain relationships with program sponsors and work closely with their representatives to secure sustaining support for current programs and additional funding for new initiatives.•	Establish strong working relationships with other departments at the Academy and develop a level of support and enthusiasm for the program throughout the NYAS.•	Continue to research best practices and develop the policies and procedures that guide the application, evaluation, and selection process with unquestionable objectivity and fairness.•	Lead the identification and recruitment of judges; nurture the relationship with the Scientific Advisory Panel; and oversee the nominations and consecutive rounds of selection.•	Work with the Academy’s operations team and outside event-planning firm to develop and execute the regional and national awards ceremonies and other events.•	Manage the department budget; provide timely forecasts and all financial and programmatic reporting, as necessary.•	Supervise five full-time employees; recruit and train additional staff, as needed

43.desc: JOB DESCRIPTION: International Equity Research AnalystCopeland Capital Management (“CCM”) is seeking a Research Analyst to join the International team. The Research Analyst will be working directly with the two International Portfolio Managers to source, analyze and monitor public equity investments across three international strategies. The Research Analyst will also be a critical team member in enhancing CCM’s quantitative models and analytical tools. CCM is a fast growing firm with a differentiated investment philosophy, entrepreneurial culture, and strong institutional client base. The position offers the opportunity to be a crucial member of the CCM team with exceptional career development potential. RESPONSIBILITIES: Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: •	Identify and research new investment ideas. •	Analyze industries and businesses through fundamental research; conduct detailed financial analysis, competitive advantage analysis and valuation assessment; build investment cases, draft investment memos, and make recommendations to the team. •	Monitor and analyze existing investment holdings across multiple geographies and sectors.•	Conduct leading edge research in statistical and fundamental quantitative   methods, models and tools. COMPANY DESCRIPTION: CCM is a rapidly growing $2 billion+ AUM equity investment management firm headquartered in Greater Philadelphia (Conshohocken). We believe that CCM’s dividend growth investment philosophy consistently produces superior risk adjusted returns by applying CCM’s quantitative methods and thorough fundamental research to our universe of dividend growth stocks. CCM deploys this investment approach across long-only as well as hedge fund strategies, domestically and internationally. 100% company owned, CCM has 22 employees and 9 investment professionals. CCM has a strong base of institutional clients across pension funds, foundations, and municipalities.

44.desc: Are you looking to start an entry-level position in sales with a company where you take charge of your career trajectory?  Pop Promos, Philadelphia 100’s #1 fastest growing company for 2015, and a leading supplier in the 25 billion dollar US promotional products industry, is seeking a full-time Junior Sales Account Executive to join its team.  This is the perfect opportunity for entry-level professional to explore a career in sales.  As the Junior Sales Account Executive, you will work with our VP of Midwest Sales, to help to grow sales within the Midwest and our business as a whole.  Typically, our Junior Sales Account Executives can expect a promotion to Senior Account Executive within 12 months based on performance.Keeping an eye on brand integrity and providing clients with custom solutions are two important aspects to this position.  As a small business, we are seeking out new entrepreneurial team members who want to invest their time in learning the ins and outs of our company to help grow and build our business.   Our office is a team environment and as such we celebrate milestones with after hours events such as happy hours, bowling and other activities.Essential Responsibilities:•Prospect for new clients•Process new orders•Provide clients with product and order information over email and phone•Handle customer service requests from clients•Follow-up with existing clients•Instruct design team on product design for individual projects•Organize client purchase orders and enter order information in automated CRM system•Communicate with production team to ensure client orders are delivered on time

45.desc: Success Academy’s commitment to world-class schooling goes beyond delivering high-quality instruction. It also requires operational excellence and the creation of safe, functional, and aesthetically beautiful learning spaces for our scholars. Success Academy is seeking ambitious Operations Renovations Associates to support operational objectives for facilities and renovations for a region of schools across our growing network. About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, and the brightest. We value excellence, ethics, and celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.

46.position: Paid Accounting Internship - Corporate Office & Day Camps 2016
46.desc: PAID ACCOUNTING INTERNSHIPEXCELLENT WORK EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITYAccounting intern to assist Controller in the management of CampGroup, LLC, which owns and operates 15 children’s summer camps.Assignments will involve basic accounting practices such as entering invoices & cash receipts, paying bills, recording manual checks & journal entries. You will also be involved in the preparation of staff payroll and tracking of staff advances. Responsibilities also include reconciling Petty Cash funds as well as camper spending accounts. Analytical reports and special projects may also be necessary. Some clerical assistance will be required.Number of Positions:Corporate Office - Six (6) spots availableDay Camp - One (1) spot availableCompensation:$10 per hour: $400 for 40-hour workweek    Duration:Approximately 12 weeks (June 6th through August 26, 2016)Location:Corporate office - 4 New King Street, Suite 130, White Plains, New York. Conveniently located adjacent to Westchester County Airport, off exit 2 on Route 684.Day Camp – Pomona, New York

47.desc: Senior Landscape ArchitectOehme, van Sweden & Associates, Inc (OvS), an internationally recognized, award-winning landscape architecture firm located on historic Capitol Hill in Washington, DC, is seeking a qualified, dynamic, candidate with eight to ten years of experience. OvS’ widely diversified mix of clients includes government agencies, public institutions, businesses, and private residences

48.desc: Migali Scientific is conveniently located in Camden, NJ just a short ride across the bridge from Philadelphia. Migali manufactures medical-grade refrigerators and freezer units for blood banks, clinical laboratories and vaccine storage. If you would like to hear more about this tremendous opportunity to work for an American, family owned company that's celebrating 61 years in business, please apply. The ideal candidate would have training and/or experience in designing appliances, sheet metal work and/or refrigeration systems.  The position requires the individual to assist in  designing refrigerators and freezers with Solidworks, convert the 3D design into a BOM, and export the information for programming factory machines for production. (turret punches, brake bending machines, shears, etc).

49.desc: Source4Teachers – The School District of Philadelphia Be part of the change in Philadelphia. Source4Teachers is now hiring K-12 substitute teachers to work in the School District of Philadelphia for the 2015/16 school year. The district serves nearly 200,000 students, 80% of whom are eligible for free or reduced price lunch. On average, 407 Philadelphia classrooms go without substitute coverage each day. Substitute teaching is a critical role in bridging this gap and providing Philadelphia students with the classroom continuity they need to succeed in education and life. Established in 2000, Source4Teachers manages the substitute program of 200+ school districts throughout the East Coast. We currently employ more than 40,000 qualified substitute teachers, paraprofessionals, and school support staff. Excited to bring our program to Philadelphia, we need your help to enhance the educational experience for Philadelphia’s students!Why become a Source4Teachers substitute?•	Choose when, where, and how often you’d like to work with up-to-the minute notifications of job opportunities•	Advance your skills with our interactive training opportunities and comprehensive support•	Get your foot in the door with a school district – our partner districts hire 300+ Source4Teachers substitutes as full-time teachers each year!•	Participate in our health benefits and 401(k) program•	Make a difference in your community and the lives of studentsPrimary Responsibilities:•	Provide meaningful instruction and classroom management to students in an assigned classroom while the regular teacher is absent•	Implement the teacher's lesson plans while adhering to school policies, procedures, and routines•	Establish and maintain a safe and orderly classroom environment•	Communicate clearly and effectively to students, faculty, and staff•	Report all student injuries, accidents, illnesses, and serious discipline problems to school administration as soon as possible•	Demonstrate flexibility in performing other related duties as assigned

50.desc: Change the Lives of Thousands While Changing Your Own. Join Urban Teachers in Baltimore, Dallas* or Washington, DC 	Urban Teachers is transforming the way people are prepared for a career in teaching. Through hands-on training, coaching and peer supports, we give teachers the skills they need to improve outcomes for students in high-need communities. By doing so, our teachers are changing the lives of the students, families and communities they serve, as well their own.  Urban Teachers is now taking applications for our Baltimore, Dallas and Washington, DC Corps for the 2015-16 school year, with placement in mid- to late June 2016. Our recruitment process is selective. While there is no restriction on undergraduate or graduate major, we look for applicants who have exhibited academic excellence by maintaining a 3.0 GPA or higher, who gravitate to big challenges and have experience working with children. Urban Teachers participants are part of an unprecedented commitment to student performance: only those who demonstrate effective teaching practice, student learning gains and growth mindset/professionalism are recommended for certification (general and special education) and complete the full four-year program.Urban Teachers participants are among the most expert and result-oriented in the nation because: •	We provide the best teacher preparation available. During the first year of the four-year program, before you start teaching on your own, you’ll spend 1,500 hours working with students in urban classrooms. •	During this time you also begin graduate coursework for a Master of Science in Education degree from the Johns Hopkins University School of Education**—ranked #1 in the country. All coursework is clinically based, allowing for immediate practice of learned skills in the classroom and equipping you with a toolbox of proven strategies for working with all students. •	Our four (4) years of mentoring and support tailored to your needs—from coaches and peers—is available longer than any other preparation program. This includes three (3) full years of one-on-one coaching to ensure you grow into an effective teacher. And, because Urban Teachers prepares you for the job from day one, you'll be able to quickly grow into a teacher leader, providing support and guidance to your colleagues in your school and city.During the first year, participants receive a stipend from Urban Teachers. Starting your second year, you are the teacher of record and participants begin to receive full teacher’s pay. (Teacher salaries in Baltimore and DC are some of the highest in the nation. Both cities allow an effective teacher to earn six figures.)As part of an Urban Teachers cohort in every school, you’re never alone. Being with other Urban Teachers participants provides an immediate network—in your school and in the thriving—Baltimore, Dallas or Washington, DC. Urban Teachers educators are trusted by and form partnerships with their colleagues across schools. Teachers are respected community and civic leaders. Whether you’re doing home visits or running into your students’ families at the market, you’ll be having an impact on improving the neighborhood and community you’re living in. Urban Teachers is an Employer of National Service. Our next application deadline is March 28th, and spaces are filling fast! For more information or to start an application, visit us on the web at www.urbanteachers.org. See what others are saying about Urban Teachersat @Urban_Teachers and follow us on Facebook.*pending state approval**pending approval by the Maryland Higher Education Commission
