53.position: Assistant Vice President, Social Media Director
53.desc: NYCEDC is seeking a talented social media director with a writing, digital/new media, and/or marketing background to develop and implement a comprehensive social media marketing strategy that will elevate awareness of NYCEDC's mission and involvement in New York City.This individual should be skilled in content strategy and creation, and demonstrate mastery of prominent social media platforms and tracking applications.Position Overview:NYCEDC has a robust and expanding 170K+ social media following. The Social Media Director will oversee the maintenance and audience growth strategy for 5 channels that include Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Tumblr, in addition to the NYCEDC.com blog and YouTube.The ideal candidate will be proficient with social content creation, and able to cultivate the friendly yet professional voice of a government agency. An eye for branding, editorial messaging, and visual storytelling is essential. The Social Media Director must possess strong people skills to work across departments and secure compelling stories that help craft an inclusive message on behalf of the company. This position requires collaboration with other city agencies, as well as occasional coordination with City Hall on citywide messaging.Responsibilities:* Develop and execute NYCEDC's overall social media plan and strategy* Create and manage the day-to-day content for NYCEDC's suite of social media accounts, including weekly content for the blog* Measure the impact of social marketing efforts, developing reports and implementing strategies and tactics for improving results* Monitor trends in the social media domain and make recommendations for incorporating relevant tools and channels into NYCEDC's ongoing marketing efforts* Leverage existing social media and digital marketing activities as a tool for community engagement and reaching more New Yorkers than ever before* Strategize with the rest of the Marketing department and others stakeholders in the company to* Integrate relevant social media techniques into the company culture and all of the company's products and services* Oversee regular meetings with representatives from all EDC divisions to monitor key upcoming events and integrate input into planning document* Lead social media input at bi-weekly Editorial Meeting

54.desc: Position Overview:The primary responsibilities include serving as a primary spokesperson for NYCEDC, and working closely with the Senior Vice President of Public Affairs on development and execution of media events, crisis communications, and development of internal and press materials on a variety of subjects. The Vice President will also work directly with the City Hall communications staff to develop messaging and oversee interaction with the media. Candidates must have experience developing and executing communications strategies and proactively and reactively arranging media opportunities to advance key messages to target audiences.Responsibilities: •	Serves as the agency's chief spokesperson and works closely with City Hall communications staff to develop and oversee daily messages and interactions with the media.•	Key executor of plans relating to media relations, crisis communications, and press releases on a wide array of subjects.•	Develops and executes a multi-faceted press strategy and proactively arranges media interviews and speaking opportunities to advance key messages to target audiences.•	Determines hiring needs, recruits and selects employees. Delegates and assigns work as appropriate to employees' capabilities and NYCEDC needs.•	Ensures all employees are oriented to their position and provided with appropriate training and development and continuing education. Monitors performance, provides coaching and feedback on an ongoing basis.Minimum Qualifications:•	Bachelor's Degree or equivalent•	8+ years professional experience in political campaign, media relations, journalism, public relations, and/or government agency-related work•	Track record of proactive and original media initiatives•	Ability to develop story angles and effectively communicate complex issues•	Experience managing direct reports, colleagues and/or consultants as assigned, short or long term as needed•	Displays confidence and leadership•	Strong written and verbal communications skills•	Strong media relations skills, and ability to cultivate relationships with reporters•	Experience with social and digital media strategy•	Creative, independent thinker, strong research and analytical skillsPreferred Qualifications: Displays confidence and leadership; Demonstrable interest in public policy, urban affairs and public affairs. Working knowledge of New York City government operations and current local issuesAbout the Public Affairs Department The Public Affairs team oversees all external messaging involving NYCEDC. In collaboration with the Mayor's office and every other department at NYCEDC, Public Affairs advances the City's economic development agenda by stewarding an overall organization-wide narrative while promoting NYCEDC projects and initiatives to media outlets, civic organizations, and the public at large. Public Affairs develops and implements a comprehensive communications strategy including media relations; development of written collateral such as press releases, media statements, Letters to the Editor, and op-ed columns; and press events. Public Affairs also manages all speeches and public events involving NYCEDC, writing public remarks as well as testimony before legislative bodies, while cultivating speaking opportunities that increase NYCEDC's visibility and promote our agenda.About NYCEDCNew York City Economic Development Corporation is the City's primary vehicle for promoting economic growth in each of the five boroughs. NYCEDC's mission is to stimulate job growth through expansion and redevelopment programs that encourage investment, generate prosperity and strengthen the City's competitive position. NYCEDC serves as an advocate to the business community by building relationships with companies that allow them to take advantage of New York City's many opportunities. Additional information on NYCEDC can be found by visiting http://www.nycedc.com/. Our Diversity & Inclusion Mission is to attract, retain, and engage a diverse workforce comprised of talented people. Like the city of New York, NYCEDC knows our strength comes from each of our connected parts, making the fabric of our organization better and stronger because of our unique employees' talents. NYCEDC employees can expect to work as part of a highly engaged, passionate and inclusive workforce where everyone's contributions are valued, respected and make an impact on one of the best and most diverse cities in the world!The New York City Economic Development Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. NYCEDC offers excellent benefits, including company-paid 401 (a) pension plan, 457(b) tax-advantaged retirement savings plans, medical, dental and vision benefits, and discounted gym memberships and movie tickets.

55.desc: PROSPERO America Inc. is looking to hire a self motivated Business Analyst, as a summer Intern. The company is based in Philadelphia, with its headquarters downtown.   PAI is the US subsidiary of the UK-based Prospero System Ltd. We entered the US market in 2011 with the intention of replicating our UK financial institution incentive program in the USA and today, the company provides more than 50 banks, financial intuitions and corporations with consumer loyalty programs all funded by national merchants such as CVS/pharmacy, Lowe’s and Whole Foods.  Our mission is to help both our Channel and national Merchant Partners enhance their growth, profitability and free cash generation. We help Channel Partners with issues such as customer recruitment, retention and loyalty. We help Merchant Partners generate incremental sales and profits by reaching new customers and by increasing business from existing customers. This position will provide the intern with the thrill and experience of working with a fast-growing and dynamic young company.  Skills that we need include strong communication skills, self-motivation and the ability to learn quickly and with little direct supervision. Responsibilities will include : Performing research tasks with a view to gather data pertaining to industry, company and customer trends • Analyze qualitative and quantitative date to uncover competition and industry information • Assist business analysis teams in gathering and analyzing project requirements  • Evaluate pertinent data by performing a variety of task analysis and business processes • Provide support in preparing business plans and strategies • Perform evaluation on newly set up system resources • Develop detailed reports on market research initiatives and provide ideas on how this research fits into current projects • Work to identify and evaluate upcoming business opportunities • Assist in developing marketing material with a view to support the company’s marketing strategies • Design workflow charts and write requirements for system changes • Implement modifications to existing projects in a bid to improve systems • Assist in in monitoring project processes and resolving issues along the way • Write and publish progress reports, identify project milestones and recommend needed modifications • Assist in developing rapport with existing and new customers with a view to increase sales Critical thinking and analytical skills are a plus. The current internship offering is unpaid, with the chance of future employment following a successful summer. We would prefer a Junior or Senior for this position.  Dates can be flexible, depending on class schedule, but the opening runs from June-August 2016.

56.company: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE
56.desc: Position Description:The Office of Budget and Program Evaluation is looking to recruit a skilled and experienced Assistant Budget Director to work in a high profile, fast paced and rapidly changing environment. This position will report directly to the Deputy Budget Director for Program Evaluation. The Assistant Budget Director will support the Deputy Budget Director for Program Evaluation in a number of special projects, including the City’s move to program-based budgeting, the design and implementation of a new budgeting system, and the annual development of the City’s Five-Year Plan. The position will require coordination with fiscal and other agency staff to enable the successful execution of these projects. More routine support may also be required at key points in the budget cycle. Duties will include, but are not limited to, the following:•	Support the Deputy Budget Director for Program Evaluation in the planning and execution of the Budget Office’s move towards program-based budgeting•	Assist with information gathering and writing of the City of Philadelphia’s Five-Year Financial and Strategic Plan •	Work closely with vendors, budgetary staff and departmental leads to support the City’s move to a new budgeting system •	Collect, analyze and present budgetary and performance data as needed•	Attend city council budget hearings to ensure that any follow up issues/items are accurately recorded for City agencies Salary Range:The salary range for this position is $45,000-$60,000, depending upon experience and fit with the position requirements.Essential Qualifications and Criteria: Successful candidates will have experience working with performance management and/or public sector finance and budgeting. Candidates must be able to think strategically while also possessing strong analytical and interpersonal skills. An ability to work effectively with colleagues and be comfortable working under tight deadlines is required. Strong writing, data analysis, and presentation skills, as well as proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) technologies and Internet search engines are necessary. The City of Philadelphia has a residency requirement. This is an exempt position.Please send cover letter (with salary requirements) and resumes to Tamika McCray, Human Resources Manager, at Tamika.McCray@phila.gov, closing date for submission is April 15, 2016.Note:  Must establish residency in the City of Philadelphia within 6 months of appointment

57.company: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE
57.position: Assistant to the Director of Finance
57.desc: The Office of the Director of Finance is looking to recruit a skilled Assistant Finance Director to work in a dynamic, high profile environment. This position will support the Finance Director and senior members of the Administration with special projects and analysis, perform high level research, and provide input on policy development. The Office of the Director of Finance oversees the City’s financial, accounting and budgetary functions, including establishing fiscal policy guidelines; overseeing the City’s budget and financial management programs; and recording and accounting all City financial activities.•	Degree from an accredited college or university in finance, business, economics, public policy or related field. •	Experience working in public sector finance and budgeting. •	Ability to think strategically while also possessing strong analytical and interpersonal skills. Position will involve working under tight deadlines.•	Strong writing, data analysis, and oral communication skills, as well as proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) technologies and Internet search engines are necessary. •	The City of Philadelphia has a residency requirement. Please send cover letter (with salary requirements) and resumes to Tamika McCray, Human Resources Professional, at Tamika.McCray@phila.gov.  The closing date for submissions is March 11, 2016.Applicants must be a resident of the City of Philadelphia or be willing to become a resident within six (6) months of appointment as a condition of employment.

58.desc: SocialCode is a technology and insights company that manages digital advertising for the world's leading consumer brands across the world’s largest social platforms: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, & Pinterest. We are a subsidiary of Graham Holdings Company (formerly The Washington Post Company), but operate independently. We have an open office environment that fosters a free exchange of ideas and we’re looking to add more bright, enthusiastic talent eager to make a big impact on our business.  Do you have the quantitative skills it takes to run sophisticated social campaigns for the world’s most valuable brands?How you can make an impact:Set-up, launch and quality assurance for major social media ad campaignsMonitoring of daily reporting statistics for accuracyTesting and analysis of key metrics to optimize performance and meet business objectivesCommunication with internal teams regarding campaign delivery and support for client reporting deliverablesRecommending changes to existing products, policies, and processes that improve overall performanceBrainstorming new ways to improve advertising and engagement on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest

59.desc: ABOUT THE SCHOOLExcel Academy Public Charter School is Washington’s first public school for girls serving 800 Preschool through 7th grade girls. Our mission is to provide our students with a solid academic foundation and enrichment opportunities to prepare them to succeed in high school and college and to develop the skills and confidence they need to make healthy, positive lifestyle choices.For additional information about Excel Academy, visit www.excelpubliccharterschool.org. RESPONSIBILITIES The Director of Student Support Services will: •	Promote school-wide responsibility and high expectations for the success of all students, including those with disabilities •	Lead and manage the special education service delivery system including supervising special education teachers and managing external service providers•	Manage and use data to continually improve student outcomes•	Identify and implement high-impact instructional programs and resources to support the learning of students with disabilities•	Partner with Assistant Principals and other instructional leaders to ensure effective collaboration between general and special education teachers during the process of planning, teaching, and assessment•	Oversee the development of assessment administration plans that effectively meet the needs of students with disabilities •	Develop high-performing special education staff; recruit and hire staff when necessary•	Provide research-based, effective professional development on educating students with disabilities for all staff•	Oversee Individualized Education Program (IEP) processes including facilitating meetings •	Ensure effective implementation of the Child Find process•	Oversee the SST process•	Oversee school compliance with the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, and all other laws, regulations, and mandates applicable to students with disabilities Connect with special education team to ensure all team members, including parents, are prepared for IEP meetings•	Oversee implementation of recommendations from documents such as Quality Assurance Review (QAR) •	Coordinate and collaborate with the Public Charter School Board (PCSB) and the Office of the State Superintendent of Education (OSSE), as appropriate

60.desc: Our sites and apps educate and entertain 60+ million people every year. We want you to grow with us.Job DescriptionAlthough all of our developers are full-stack, the focus of this hire is mainly on frontend & design with some jQuery + HTML/CSS, and responsive email HTML. There's plenty of opportunity to expand and learn other parts of the stack...* we run a typical LAMP stack. We're frequently writing SQL and PHP for everything from feature development to data analysis and automation. You will likely pick up some PHP merely by proximity.* we're using a little bit of nodejs for some frontend unit testing, but not looking to expand it much beyond that.* we're in the process of testing some backbone for a few different projects; we're intently waiting for ng-2.0.* there's plenty of Android & iOS coding to be done if you want to expand into it.* there's no Ruby or any MS stack languages, and we have no intention to expand into them. There's also no python, and although we may consider it for future projects, there aren't any on the horizon yet where it'd be a good fit.Using these tools, you'll do things like:* Design & build out new user features in our sites and apps, with a focus on frontend development.* Develop and design responsive email messages.* Develop and implement split tests and lean tests across a large userbase (some people call them multivariate or A/B tests).* Unit test your code, version control everything.Perks, Benefits, and Culture:* Autonomy - creative types deserve protection from micromanagement.* Opportunities - our sites get 100m+ pageviews a year & our apps have get thousands of downloads every month. If you can't find something high impact to work on, you're doing it wrong.* Powerful hardware and large dual monitors.* Fully paid premiums for health and dental insurance.* Company outings include BBQs, happy hour, billiards & bowling, movie day, meetups, hackathons, and more.* This position is on-site, in-house only. Travel is minimal to none, and there's little to no telecommute. Candidates must be local or able to relocate to the Washington DC metro area, and already inside the continental United States.If you're on OPT/F1/CPT or will otherwise require visa sponsorship in the future, please mention that in your email to us.

61.desc: iFly.vc is currently seeking two associates to join the investment team ASAP. Based in San Francisco/Palo Alto, this associate will be involved in all aspects of the venture business, such as:- Develop investment thesis- Assess investment opportunities- Conduct due diligence- Assist entrepreneurs in the portfolio- Manage internal process and external networkInternship opportunities are also available.

62.desc: Emily Wren Photography, a successful and rapidly growing wedding photography business based in Philadelphia.  Business has been going strong for 9 years, and we are looking to start expanding. We are in search of a part time (3 days a week) in-house studio assistant with room for growth within the company.Ideal candidate would have a digital photography background, with a working knowledge of Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop.Responsibilities would include photo editing, culling, wedding album design (software based), and digital file management.Starting pay would be $15/hr, 3 days a week.Opportunity to train to become a second-shooter, and eventually a full-fledged associate photographer. Other opportunities within company as well.

63.company: Office of Philadelphia City Councilman Kenyatta Johnson
63.desc: There are internship opportunities at City Hall in the Office of Philadelphia City Councilman Kenyatta Johnson. Interns can work flexible hours and will be introduced to community outreach, press relations, policy research, and events coordination, as well as the public political process in the City of Philadelphia. This internship is ideal for undergraduate students interested in gaining experience in the workings of government. This internship is unpaid.Interested students should contact Peter Elliot at Peter.Elliot@Phila.Gov and include a resume and times of availability. Additional information is available upon request via email or at 215-686-3412.

64.desc: May to July 2016 Park Ave South, New York, NYChanging the World + the World of Banking. BankMobile is on a mission to make banking affordable, effortless, and financially empowering for Gen Z,millennials, and the underbanked. We have free ATMs nationwide, offer completely free checking & savings accounts, and provide free financial empowerment coaching. Through our simple mobile platform, banking has never been easier!Do you want to join the #LiveFreeBankFree revolution & work for the most innovative, fastest growing bank in the country? Well, we’re looking for someone to join our team supporting the Head of our College Ambassador Program in the search for new ambassadors and helping us continue to build an innovative ambassador program!   What could a typical day entail?●	Manage up to 100 ambassadors○	Building relationships - communicating with ambassadors, ensuring they are supported ○	Reviewing monthly task completions - ensuring tasks are completed on time and correctly●	Recruit new ambassadors○	Contacting relevant school departments to advertise for new ambassadors ○	Writing job specs○	Advertising on social media - using your own social networks○	Interviewing potential ambassadors●	Strategic development○	Develop and execute creative strategies to build ambassador loyalty and BankMobile brand awareness on college campuses●	Attend external fairs○	Supporting the team off-site at campus job fairs, local street fairs, and regional appearances

65.desc: JRI America, Inc., (JRI-A) is seeking sharp, talented, and energetic graduates with a desire to be part of an intensive mentorship program in information security. If you are passionate about an exciting and rewarding career, we want to speak with you! This is an opportunity to become a member of our Information Security team in New York and to learn highly valued technical skills in order to maintain the integrity of our data, counter threats, and protect our information assets.Who we are:JRI-A provides innovative IT solutions for Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC), the core member of Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), a Tokyo-based bank holding company with 68,000 employees in 40+ countries and $1.5 trillion assets under management, placing SMBC among the largest 25 banks globally by assets. JRI-A supports SMBC’s operations in the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Africa. JRI-A is a subsidiary of the Japan Research Institute Ltd., the IT specialist subsidiary of SMFG.We invest in you. JRI-A provides SMBC with the information security required of a rapidly growing multinational bank with an expanding portfolio of financial products and services across the capital markets. As a member of our 2016 Security Practitioner Development Program, you will earn a competitive full-time salary and receive intensive mentorship on the latest enterprise class information security technologies. You will also work on projects to develop the next generation of IT security principles and practices. JRI-A’s mentorship program combines the close and collaborative spirit of a start-up with the backing of one of the largest and most respected institutions in the world.

66.desc: ABOUT THE SCHOOLThe William E. Doar Jr Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ) blends rigorous academics with world-class arts instruction provided by artists from renowned dance, musical, theatrical, and visual arts institutions. WEDJ is the only public charter school in Washington, DC to provide professional-caliber arts training for students in PreK through eighth grade at no cost to families. WEDJ serves more than 430 elementary and middle school students, a majority of whom are African American, and 85% of whom qualify for free/reduced priced lunch.Teachers at WEDJ benefit from extensive instructional coaching and professional development, curriculum and planning support, and school and classroom culture development. For additional information about WEDJ, visit www.wedjschool.us. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWEDJ is looking for a middle school math teacher to fill an immediate vacancy. The position is a full-time, 10-month position. A teacher at WEDJ is responsible for the following:Curriculum and Planning•	Creating curriculum including unit and lesson plans aligned to Common Core standards•	Structuring compelling, standards-based lessons that challenge students’ critical thinking and align with lesson, unit, and grade-level objectivesInstruction•	Utilizing strong content knowledge to effectively present material to students•	Incorporating joy and rigor in lessons and so that students are excited about and invested in their academic excellence  •	Employing multiple methods to accommodate different learning styles and abilities, including special education students and English language learners•	Participating in all professional development opportunitiesAssessment•	Assessing students academic and developmental growth through observation and a variety of assessment methods•	Tracking and monitor assessment results in order to regularly refine teaching practices and design differentiated lesson plansSchool Culture•	Create a positive learning environment that promotes high expectations and provides opportunities for all students to experience success •	Maintaining positive, professional relationships with students, families, and colleagues •	Communicating with students, parents, school staff to ensure that students are on-track in their learning and making progress towards goals

67.desc: TFS Capital is a quantitatively driven, boutique asset management firm. We manage three mutual funds, and two private investment hedge funds. We are looking for an outstanding individual to take on the role of quantitative analyst to help us generate and backtest unique ideas that can add value to our portfolios.TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.Key responsibilities•	Originate and simulate automatable, high-alpha quantitative strategies in multiple financial markets.  •	Identify, on-board, clean, and manage large databases and turn them into tradable information.•	Code highly accurate portfolio simulations drawing on the latest literature in risk minimization, portfolio optimization, and other financial methods.•	Work with quantitative developers to incorporate strategy concepts into our production infrastructure.About TFS•	TFS is a boutique asset manager with approximately $1 billion in assets under management, providing portfolio management services to both mutual funds and private investment funds (“hedge funds”).  These funds are primarily alternative mutual funds utilizing proprietary quantitative investment strategies. Our mutual fund products are: the TFS Market Neutral Fund (TFSMX), a long/short U.S. equity fund; the TFS Small Cap Fund (TFSSX), a long-only small cap fund; and the TFS Hedged Futures Fund (TFSHX) which invests in long and short futures and forward contract positions. Prior to applying, please read about our firm and philosophy on our website at www.tfscapital.com.   •	We have a flat, entrepreneurial organizational structure.  The feel is very academic—we are smart people working together to solve interesting quantitative problems.•	TFS is located in West Chester, PA - about 40 minutes west of Philadelphia. It's a great little town, with dozens of restaurants and shops within walking distance of our office. West Chester is centrally located, just 2½ hours from DC, 2½ hours from New York, and ½ hour from the Philadelphia International Airport.TFS CAPITAL LLC RESERVES THE RIGHT TO MODIFY, INTERPRET OR APPLY THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN ANY WAY TFS CAPITAL DESIRES.  THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN NO WAY IMPLIES THAT THESE ARE THE ONLY DUTIES, INCLUDING ESSENTIAL DUTIES, TO BE PERFORMED BY THE EMPLOYEE OCCUPYING THIS POSITION. THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IS NOT AN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, IMPLIED OR OTHERWISE. TFS CAPITAL REMAINS AN “AT-WILL” EMPLOYER AND THE EMPLOYEE OCCUPYING THIS POSITION REMAINS AN “AT-WILL” EMPLOYEE. QUALIFIED EMPLOYEES WHO REQUIRE REASONABLE ACCOMODATIONS TO PERFORM THE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION SHOULD NOTIFY THE HIRING MANAGER.TFS CAPITAL LLC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. WE DO NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, RELIGION, COLOR, CREED, SEX, AGE, NATIONAL ORIGIN OR ANCESTRY, GENETIC INFORMATION, VETERAN STATUS, DISABILITY OR ANY OTHER STATUS OR CONDITION PROTECTED BY FEDERAL AND/OR STATE LAWS.  TFS Capital is not accepting applications submitted by search firms. Recruiters are asked not to submit applications for this position or to contact any TFS Capital employee about this position. All resumes and candidate contact information submitted via recruiters becomes the property of TFS. All candidates must submit their applications directly to be considered for this position.

69.desc: Dedicated to giving every child the chance to attend a great school, we partner with the nation's best educators to create public charter school buildings. Civic Builders, a non-profit real estate developer, is currently seeking an experienced real estate development professional to take a leadership role in sourcing and managing both turnkey and owner's representative public charter school projects. The individual will engage with new clients and ensure that our high-quality, client-centric school buildings are built on-time and on-budget.You know the real estate and development field inside and outYou have extensive experience managing projects. From cooking the deal all the way through to execution, you are practiced and knowledgeable about all sides of the process.You're a playmakerYou will source partnerships and bring clients to the organization. Your energetic and outgoing attitude help you sell Civic Builders and our services. You take initiative on projects from the start and know how to bring people together and get things done. You require minimal direction and can jump in day one.You're a top-notch communicatorBoth internally and externally, you will keep everyone in the loop on Civic Builders' projects and services. You are highly professional and an expert at disseminating information in the appropriate format. You embrace public speaking and conversing with stakeholders and clients.You possess impeccable follow-throughDetails do not escape you. You dot each 'I' and cross each 'T'. You understand that each step of the process is integral, and you know how to manage a project with organizational prowess.Specific responsibilities include:Sourcing New Clients•	Work with the real estate and strategy teams to identify charter school clients who need Civic Builders' services•	Present Civic Builders' value proposition to prospective charter school clients•	Drive Civic and prospective clients to a development deal•	Manage client relationships and engage with school leadership at the staff and board levels.Site Search & Evaluation•	Lead real estate site search activities to identify site opportunities•	Conduct preliminary site due diligence including architectural, environmental, and economic feasibility•	Maintain database of site opportunitiesThe individual will need 7+ years of relevant experience in real estate development and analytic project management, and a demonstrated interest in Civic Builders' mission and business.How to applyPlease send resume, cover letter and salary requirements to: sapounakis@civicbuilders.org  OR TO:Civic Builders Attn: Kali Sapounakis 304 Hudson Street, Suite 301New York, NY 10013

72.position: Senior Associate, State Policy, Pew-MacArthur Results First Initiative
72.desc: Project DescriptionIn the current fiscal environment, most states are facing tough budget choices and are lacking the resources needed to support traditional levels of public services. Increasingly, policy makers are seeking those combinations of programs and policies that will yield the greatest benefits in the most cost-effective way. The Pew-MacArthur Results First Initiative (Results First), a project of The Pew Charitable Trusts and the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation, works with states to implement an innovative evidence-based policymaking approach that helps them invest in policies and programs that are proven to work.Results First is working intensively in selected states in targeted policy areas to embed evidence-based policymaking into their decision-making processes. This work is focused on both helping states customize and implement a benefit-cost tool originally developed by the Washington State Institute for Public Policy (WSIPP) and linking this analysis to states' policy and budget processes so that leaders can use the results to inform difficult decisions. Results First is also developing related evidence-based policy tools that enable states to use the results of meta-analyses performed by additional organizations to better inform their policy and budget choices; these organizations include Blueprints for Healthy Youth Development, the Institute of Education Sciences' What Works Clearinghouse, the Office of Justice Programs' CrimeSolutions.gov, and the RAND Promising Practices Network.Position OverviewThe Senior Associate, State Policy, will provide strategic support to all aspects of the project's state policy work, with a particular focus on intensive assistance in policy areas related to public health. This position, based in Pew's Washington, DC office, will report to the Manager, State Policy, and will be hired for an initial period through June 30, 2017 with the possibility of renewal.Responsibilities    * In collaboration with the Director and state policy team, support selected states implementing the Results First approach and using its results in policy and budget decisions, with a particular focus on health policy; this will include developing state-specific strategies, communicating regularly with state partners, working closely with Results First's technical assistance providers, conducting frequent in-person site visits, and guiding and monitoring states' progress toward goals.    * Become highly familiar with the Results First benefit-cost tool and other promising models and resources.    * Build and maintain relationships with policymakers, staff, and stakeholders in assigned states to collect information, track policy efforts related to Results First, and develop partnerships and advocacy and education strategies to advance the project's agenda and expertise.    * Develop a deep understanding of the policy and political landscape in selected states; monitor and identify emerging issues relevant to project goals.    * Organize and facilitate meetings with stakeholders in selected states and contribute to the team's effort in planning and hosting annual convenings.    * Assist in ensuring all of the major technical assistance and outreach efforts are well-coordinated and strategically focused.    * Help design and execute strategies for effective dissemination of research and communications documents to advance policy change in selected states.    * Assist in evaluating states for ongoing and future participation in the project.    * Represent Results First at conferences, meetings, and other events, including preparing materials for distribution and making presentations, as needed.    * Assist in building and maintaining relationships with current and potential donors to ensure the success of the Results First state health policy work.    * Collaborate closely with other Pew colleagues as needed.Job Requirements    * At least five years of relevant professional experience.    * Bachelor's degree required; advanced degree in public health, public policy, public administration, or a related discipline strongly preferred.    * Experience implementing complex projects aimed at informing and advancing effective public health policy.    * Solid knowledge of policymaking and issue campaigns at the state level; with a keen and demonstrated focus in public health policy.    * Demonstrated project management and organizational skills; able to meet multiple deadlines by setting priorities and identifying resources.    * Excellent applied research and analytical skills, including an ability to synthesize information and identify themes.    * Acute political awareness and non-partisan perspective and approach; demonstrated ability to build relationships among individuals and organizations with a range of interests and perspectives.    * Excellent written and oral communication skills; able to communicate complex concepts in a clear, effective manner for a general audience.    * Ability to exercise a logical and resourceful approach to evaluating and addressing problems.    * Strong interpersonal skills, including an ability to develop and manage productive and collaborative relationships both internally and externally; comfortable working both independently and as part of a team.    * Experience interacting with donors from a diverse range of foundations and organizations.    * Ability to think strategically, juggle multiple priorities, adjust to changing circumstances, resolve problems creatively and logically, organize time efficiently and remain attentive to details.Compensation:We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits package.TravelIt is anticipated that the Senior Associate, State Policy will undertake regular travel, approximately two to three trips per month, for conducting site visits and attending professional conferences.Pew is an equal opportunity employer.Apply Here: http://www.Click2apply.net/z6j35h774hPI92882952

73.desc: JRI America, Inc., (JRI-A) is seeking sharp, talented, and energetic graduates with the desire to be part of an intensive mentorship program in software development. If you are passionate about an exciting and rewarding career, we want to speak with you! This is an opportunity to join our Software Development Craftsmanship Program in New York and become a member of the team responsible for the technology infrastructure that supports our clients and associates across multiple borders and languages. Who we are:JRI-A provides innovative IT solutions for Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC), the core member of Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), a Tokyo-based bank holding company with 68,000 employees in 40+ countries and $1.5 trillion assets under management, placing SMBC among the largest 25 banks globally by assets. JRI-A supports SMBC’s operations in the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Africa. JRI-A is a subsidiary of the Japan Research Institute Ltd., the IT specialist subsidiary of SMFG. We invest in you.JRI-A provides SMBC with the technological capabilities required of a rapidly growing multinational bank with an expanding portfolio of financial products and services. As a member of our 2016 Software Development Craftsmanship Program, you will earn a competitive full-time salary and receive intensive mentorship from experienced developers skilled in enterprise class software development principles and practices. JRI-A’s mentorship program combines the close and collaborative spirit of a start-up with the backing of one of the largest and most respected institutions in the world.

74.desc: TFS Capital LLC is a boutique asset management firm in West Chester, PA. We are seeking a well-rounded software developer to join our development team.  This developer will help maintain and expand our proprietary automated data-driven trading systems.  As a key member of a small development team, you will be an integral part of all aspects of our mission-critical trading infrastructure.  In addition to working with existing systems, you will be assisting with making and implementing design decisions for new and improved data and software architecture.  The position is full-time in our West Chester, PA office.Technology is at the heart of our business.  At TFS, you and the rest of the technology team will work directly with traders, quants, and portfolio managers to solve interesting and challenging problems using technology.  Your actions will directly impact the success of our business.TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.Key responsibilities	Work with the rest of the development team to expand and maintain the firm’s proprietary software systems	Work directly with the trading desk, analysis team, portfolio managers, and other business groups to support existing systems and implement new ideas	Onboard new, diverse, large datasets and create appropriate ETL processesAbout the IT TeamWe are a small team of developers and operations admins who work together to develop, maintain, and expand our in-house trading software.  In addition to our code, we integrate and assist with development of code from other teams, including the traders and analysts.  We work directly with traders and analysts daily, and most of the TFS team on a regular basis.We’re primarily a Windows shop, but use Linux where it fits best.  The bulk of our software is written in Java, but we also have a ton of Perl and MATLAB, and some Python and C#.  We use Microsoft SQL Server for relational data storage.  About TFS CapitalTFS Capital is a quantitative asset management firm with approximately $1 billion in assets under management, providing portfolio management services to both mutual funds and private investment funds (“hedge funds”).  These funds are primarily alternative mutual funds utilizing proprietary quantitative investment strategies. Prior to applying, please read about our firm and philosophy on our website at tfscapital.com.TFS has a flat, entrepreneurial organizational structure. The feel is very academic—we are smart people working together to solve interesting quantitative problems.  Our office is located in West Chester, PA – about 40 minutes west of Philadelphia. It’s a great little town, with dozens of restaurants and shops within walking distance of our office.  West Chester is centrally located, just 2½ hours from DC, 2½ hours from New York, and ½ hour from the Philadelphia International Airport.TFS CAPITAL LLC RESERVES THE RIGHT TO MODIFY, INTERPRET OR APPLY THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN ANY WAY TFS CAPITAL DESIRES.  THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN NO WAY IMPLIES THAT THESE ARE THE ONLY DUTIES, INCLUDING ESSENTIAL DUTIES, TO BE PERFORMED BY THE EMPLOYEE OCCUPYING THIS POSITION. THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IS NOT AN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, IMPLIED OR OTHERWISE. TFS CAPITAL REMAINS AN “AT-WILL” EMPLOYER AND THE EMPLOYEE OCCUPYING THIS POSITION REMAINS AN “AT-WILL” EMPLOYEE. QUALIFIED EMPLOYEES WHO REQUIRE REASONABLE ACCOMODATIONS TO PERFORM THE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION SHOULD NOTIFY THE HIRING MANAGER.TFS CAPITAL LLC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. WE DO NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, RELIGION, COLOR, CREED, SEX, AGE, NATIONAL ORIGIN OR ANCESTRY, GENETIC INFORMATION, VETERAN STATUS, DISABILITY OR ANY OTHER STATUS OR CONDITION PROTECTED BY FEDERAL AND/OR STATE LAWS.  TFS Capital is not accepting applications submitted by search firms. Recruiters are asked not to submit applications for this position or to contact any TFS Capital employee about this position. All resumes and candidate contact information submitted via recruiters becomes the property of TFS. All candidates must submit their applications directly to be considered for this position.

76.desc: We hire software development engineer interns into our technical teams based in Seattle, Washington. Our interns and co-ops write real software and partner with a select group of experienced software development engineers, who both help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our customers.Impact: As a member of the Amazon development team, you’ll be given the opportunity to have direct impact on the evolution of the Amazon e-commerce platform and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, optimization, scalability, security and tweaking algorithms, just to name a few.Innovation: Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Are you interested in finding the best intersection of features vs. performance? Are you up to the task of delivering innovative technology that offers millions of unique products to thousands of suppliers, to tens of millions of customers around the world? Many of the technical challenges Amazon encounters have never been dealt with before on this scale, if at all. Come help lead the way in e-commerce innovation.

77.desc: Our CompanyWilliams-Sonoma, Inc. is a specialty retailer of home furnishings and gourmet cookware prided for “enhancing the quality of life at home.” We offer high-quality, stylish products for every room in the house: from the kitchen to the living room, bedroom, home office and even the hall closet. Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, PBteen, West Elm, Mark & Graham, and Rejuvenation are the strong, growing brands that allow us to reach a diverse customer group throughout different stages of life. Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is a vertically integrated company pursuing business through three channels: retail, catalog and e-Commerce.Internship ProgramThe Williams-Sonoma, Inc. internship program provides 3rd year undergraduate students with the opportunity to demonstrate skills in business acumen, retail management, marketing, and design. In order to provide you with a truly comprehensive view of our company, we are offering an internship program to experience both the retail and corporate sides of our business. The internships available at corporate are in the following departments:* Merchandising* Inventory Management* e-Commerce* Retail Operations* Product Development & Visual* Finance* Internet Creative* Marketing* Human ResourcesRetail PortionFor one (1) week of your internship, we will place you in one of our Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, or Williams-Sonoma retail stores in the Bay Area. While in the stores, you will work with District and General Managers to learn how a retail store runs and operates, allowing you the opportunity to learn sales, customer service, payroll, live inventory, and how to manage a team. You will also have the chance to spend time directly with the customers, seeing firsthand the impact the retail stores have on the overall success of the business. Learning our retail business provides a strong foundation for the corporate portion of the internship.Corporate PortionFor the remaining nine (9) weeks of your internship you will be working at our Williams-Sonoma, Inc. Corporate Headquarters in San Francisco. You will be placed in and matched with a department based on your interviews, interests, and skill set. These departments are Merchandising, Inventory Management, Sourcing, E-Commerce, Retail Operations, Creative Services, IT and Marketing. During these weeks, you will have the opportunity to attend business critical meetings, assist on projects, and gain experience in cross-functional partnerships.In addition to your daily tasks, you will participate in a group project. The group project will include other cross-functional interns and will require each intern to contribute their department knowledge and insights to deliver an overall business plan. You will also partake in weekly sessions with the other interns, participating in personal and professional trainings as well as attending meetings with the executive leaders of the company and brands.DurationThe nine week program begins on Monday, June 13th and ends on Friday, August 19th.LocationWeek 1-- Orientation at Corporate Headquarters, San Francisco, CA & Retail stores within the Bay AreaWeeks 2-10 -- Corporate Headquarters, San Francisco, CA

78.position: Summer Internship - United Nations Information Center
78.desc: INTERNSHIPS AT UNIC WASHINGTONOrganization OverviewEstablished in 1946, the United Nations Information Center is responsible for US/UN issues and serves as a liaison to Congress, the US government and foundations in Washington as well as to the media, academic institutions and public across the United States. The Center includes a small reference library that houses official UN documents as well as other materials published by the United Nations. The office also supports high-level visitors from headquarters and field offices around the world. UNIC’s internship program presents an enormous opportunity for college students and post-graduates seeking challenging intern-work experience in international relations. The Center accepts interns three times a year (Fall, Winter/Spring and Summer) with deadlines posted on the website on a unpaid basis for a period of three months or more.Position Description/Duties and ResponsibilitiesInterns of the United Nations Information Center (UNIC) have a broad range of responsibilities that include everything from representing the office at Washington events to fielding public inquiries. As part of the program, interns attend Capitol Hill hearings and NGO/think tank briefings on a variety of international subjects and report back to the office and UN headquarters on what was said. UNIC works with each intern to enable him/her to attend meetings on topics of particular interest. Another facet of the internship program involves monitoring international and regional news and keeping UNIC abreast of important UN-related developments. In addition to these primary responsibilities, interns are responsible for assisting with UN events, outreach and public inquiries. They are also given the opportunity to help write UNIC’s weekly newsletter and assist with visits of UN officials and conduct research for UN staff and projects. Likewise, interns are expected to assist with some administrative duties and contribute to the day-to-day functioning of the office.

79.desc: The Office of Responsible Research Training of the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia Research Institute has an opportunity for a Junior Project Coordinator. The Coordinator will work with internal team to assist in organizing the various components needed to initiate, run and conclude designated summer programs. Duties include assisting in coordinating schedules and activities, as well as tracking progress and results. Skill requirements include: good computer skills, excellent communication skills, detail oriented, ability to quickly pick-up new skills, and work well in a team environment. The Project Coordinator must be available to work one early evening shift per week, and up to three short weekend shifts over the course of the summer.

80.position: Summer Patient Care Technician for Nursing Students
80.desc: Exciting New Summer Patient Care Technician Openings at BIDMC: Who We Are: BIDMC is a major teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, located in the Longwood Medical Area of Boston, MA.  BIDMC is a fully integrated medical center providing adult services from cardiology to obstetrics, gastrointestinal disorders to cancer care.  Our mission at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center is to provide extraordinary care, where the patient comes first, supported by world-class education and research. Nursing Support is an important group within BIDMC’s care team!More about the Opportunities: We are seeking currently enrolled BSN Students! We have 20+ Opportunities are 40 hours per week for May- August 2016 with the potential of continuing on a per diem basis during school breaks. Positions are available on a variety of medical and surgical units where you will have an opportunity to work with our staff and care for acutely ill patients with a broad range of conditions.Responsibilities:•            Collaborates with a registered nurse on developing a patient's care plan•            Develops and maintains competencies as delegated by a registered nurse. This includes sterile dressing changes and urinary catheter insertion•            Maintains the safety of patients who have been identified at risk for preventable injury by the implementation of nursing safety interventions or the use of protective devices/equipment under the supervision of the registered nurse•            Reports all patient activity to the registered nurse in a timely mannerHow to apply: We currently have 20+ full time available positions posted on our career site at:  http://jobs.bidmc.org/  You may search by category “Nursing Support” or requisition number “15612BR” to view this job posting.

81.desc: Summit Tutoring Corps, an Americorps program in partnership with Match Education, is a one year, urban education fellowship.  Summit Corps members focus on supporting groups of students with learning content, improving literacy and math skills, and building the strong study skills and habits needed to be successful in high school and college. Summit Corps members build strong relationships with the students and with their families, and with the Summit community.  Summit Corps members also have the opportunity to observe and support teachers and school leaders in order to gain a better understanding of the career paths available in education.  We are looking for applicants who are passionate about a career in education, We are currently hiring Summit Corps members for all Summit campuses - in California, San Jose, Redwood City, Daly City, Sunnyvale, and Richmond, and, in Washington State, Tacoma and Seattle.

82.desc: About TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient BankTD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, is one of the 10 largest banks in the U.S., providing more than 8 million customers with a full range of retail, small business and commercial banking products and services at approximately 1,300 convenient locations throughout the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, Metro D.C., the Carolinas and Florida. In addition, TD Bank and its subsidiaries offer customized private banking and wealth management services through TD Wealth®, and vehicle financing and dealer commercial services through TD Auto Finance. TD Bank is headquartered in Cherry Hill, N.J. To learn more, visit www.tdbank.com. Find TD Bank on Facebook at www.facebook.com/TDBank and on Twitter at www.twitter.com/TDBank US.TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, is a member of TD Bank Group and a subsidiary of The Toronto-Dominion Bank of Toronto, Canada, a top 10 financial services company in North America. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the New York and Toronto stock exchanges under the ticker symbol

83.desc: Exceptionally gifted front-end engineers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded interdisciplinary research group based in New York City.  These hires will work closely with our world-class team of chemists, biologists, and computer scientists on developing web and mobile information-management interfaces that are critical to our research efforts. Successful candidates will design and implement dynamic websites that deliver rich and intuitive user experiences using Javascript, Python, HTML, and CSS.  In addition to UI/UX development,  relevant areas of expertise might include WebGL, D3, SQL, Django, Flask, Numpy, and Matplotlib, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement.  D. E. Shaw Research is pursuing long-term projects aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the fields of biochemistry and molecular biology using high-performance computation for molecular dynamics simulation. We are developing multiple generations of the Anton special-purpose supercomputer, as well as a variety of simulation tools that run on commodity clusters and GPUs, with the aim of fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery. We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation to candidates of truly exceptional ability. To submit an application, please use the link provided below: http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/UIDD. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

84.desc: AquaMobile Swim School is looking for experienced and qualified swimming instructors and lifeguards to teach at home private swim lessons at clients' home swimming pools and/or provide at-home event lifeguarding in their surrounding geographical area. We currently have part-time swim instructor and lifeguard positions available for the spring/summer of 2016.We pay very competitive wages from $25-35/hr depending on level of swim experience and offer flexible hours as instructors work based on their own availability.Swim instructors and lifeguards will travel to clients' home swimming pools within the travel radius you indicate in the Philadelphia Metro Area and surrounding areas.AquaMobile also serves cities in Florida, Georgia, Texas, Arizona, Nevada, California, Washington, Colorado, New York, New Jersey, North Carolina, South Carolina, Massachusetts, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah, Virginia, & Ontario

85.desc: Spott, Lucey & Wall is seeking top level accounting graduates who are committed to a lifelong career in public accounting and who aspire to eventual ownership in our firm. Our firm offers a diversity of professional experiences that begins during the first month with on-the-job experience in all aspects of accounting. You will be working directly with clients as soon as possible and help them make important decisions in their business. In addition, new staff members actively participate in staff meetings and have a voice in making decisions affecting the firm. If this is the career you are looking for and San Francisco is where you want to work, please contact us.

86.desc: Intern SummaryInterns would be responsible for helping to solicit and cultivate advertising partners and sponsors on behalf of the Philadelphia Film Society under the direction of the Director of Institutional Partnerships. Responsibilities •	Researching prospects from the local business community •	Cultivate funding and in-kind support•	Keep careful records of research and communication•	Distribute materials and conduct follow-up calls with staff•	Manage data, including program attendance and demographicsTime Requirements•	May-August 2016•	2 days/week in office + some evenings

87.desc: Analyst, Research and InsightsThe Advisory Board Company (NASDAQ: ABCO)www.advisory.comForbes: Ranked one of the 200 Best Small Companies Vault.com: Listed among Top 50 Consulting Firms Modern Healthcare: Best Places to WorkFinalist, Washington Business Journal's Business Philanthropy AwardsModern Healthcare: Listed among the Largest Healthcare Management ConsultantsAbout The Advisory Board Company:The Advisory Board Company (NASDAQ: ABCO) is a global technology, research and consulting firm partnering with 238,000 leaders in 4,200+ organizations across health care and higher education. We combine the expertise of our 3,000+ employees around the world to find solutions to the most pressing challenges in health care. Our performance technology products offer user-friendly, Web-enabled dashboard platforms with tremendous analytic capabilities that generate more than $700 million in realized value annually for our members. These solutions focus on strategically important areas, including physician alignment, revenue cycle, accountable care, and surgical profitability. We thrive on innovation and the knowledge that we are creating real change in an industry that matters to everyone.We are a workplace that    Values and celebrates diversity of experience, culture, and opinion    Is committed to creating an inclusive environment to enhance our collective experience    Promotes a supportive community through staff-led affinity groups, events, and educationCulture & Values: We think Forbes said it best: Making the world a better place is what The Advisory Board Company is all about. We have a unique culture where employees are told to avoid after work emails, encouraged to take 10 hours per month of paid leave for community service, and are asked to add surplus value in every interaction with a member or colleague. Over the past thirty years, we have developed a distinctive corporate culture based our values and principles. 88.desc: The Brookings Institution--ranked #1 among think tanks in Washington, DC--is currently seeking applications from Penn students for a number of summer internship positions. All positions are posted on the Penn Wharton Public Policy Initiative job board:http://publicpolicy.wharton.upenn.edu/for-students/job-board/Students should visit the job board and drop application materials for the specific internships that interest them.

89.desc: The Philadelphia Film Society is seeking a development intern to assist in all aspects of individual giving, including membership, donor research, and the annual fund. The position is ongoing, and the term will be set by mutual agreement. The intern will also perform a variety of development-related administrative duties as assigned.Responsibilities:  Some of the tasks include, but are not limited to:•	Supporting staff efforts to grow PFS’s membership and donor base, including direct contact with current and prospective members•	 Providing basic donor profiles through prospect research•	Assisting with cultivation and stewardship events and activitiesBenefits: This is an unpaid internship, ideal for an individual looking for hands-on experience in fundraising, such as a recent graduate or someone looking to change careers.The Philadelphia Film Society utilizes the power of film and provides facility resources for other creative arts to engage, educate, entertain, and promote cultural understanding within diverse communities.  PFS produces the annual Philadelphia Film Festival, an international festival that welcomes films and guests from around the world to venues throughout the city for screenings and special events.To Apply:Visit filmadelphia.org/jobs-internships. Send completed application and resume to internships@filmadelphia.org.

90.desc: BTIG is a global financial services firm specializing in institutional trading, investment banking, research and related brokerage services. With an extensive global footprint and more than 500 employees, BTIG, LLC and its affiliates operate out of 14 cities throughout North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. BTIG offers execution, expertise and insights for equities, equity derivatives, ETFs and fixed income (futures, commodities, foreign exchange, interest rates, credit as well as convertible and preferred securities). The firm’s core capabilities include global sales, portfolio, electronic and outsource trading, transition management, investment banking, prime brokerage, capital introduction, corporate access, research and strategy, and commission management. Additional information about the firm can be found at www.btig.com. We are looking for an Institutional Equity Sales Assistant in New York with excellent analytical, organizational and communication skills who will be able to work with a very driven senior sales team.  The ideal candidate will be trustworthy, conscientious and hardworking, independently seeing situations through to completion while maintaining a team-first attitude. This is an entry level support position providing trade monitoring, clearing and settlement proficiency, willingness to gain macro market knowledge, awareness of current market events and news and ability to establish and foster relationships. There is an opportunity for advancement to become an institutional salestrader as capabilities and character are demonstrated over time.  We are willing to train the right candidate. The candidate must have, or obtain the Series 7, 55, and 63. The successful candidate will be eager to learn and capable of working in a fast-paced, team oriented environment.  The ability to remain focused during highly stressful market conditions is essential. Specific responsibilities may include, but are not limited to the following:•  Work closely with the CEO and Founder, along with rest of the management team, sharing responsibilities for the firm’s largest institutional clients, managing special projects, and trading on a daily basis.•  Learn how to use Bloomberg, Fidessa as well as other trading systems and relevant sources of market data•  Watch trading screen for price changes, alerts, news and general market activity •  Alert traders to incoming orders, ensure client instructions are being followed•  Assist traders with order follow up, updates and recaps•  Answering phones, drafting emails, managing schedules and dealing with guests. •  Responsible for morning briefs, including highlight flows for senior management and morning situations for the firm’s salesforce.•  Aggregate market information to inform team members of overnight and upcoming news and events•  Communicate with colleagues in operations and compliance, and learn to handle any problems that may arise•  Willingness and availability to assist senior members of the salesforce in entertaining clients and managing client relationships.

91.desc: INVESTMENT ASSOCIATEBRANDYWINE GROUP ADVISORSNEW YORK, NYhttp://www.brandywinetrust.com/Firm BackgroundThe Brandywine Trust Group  was founded in 1989 to provide fiduciary and investment services to a limited number of families, including the founders, the objective being to achieve scale and professionalism in the management of the families affairs while preserving their independence from large financial institutions.  Brandywines only clients are a small group of multi-generational families with substantial assets and long term, equity-oriented investment goals.  Brandywines families derive their wealth from various sources, including brokerage, investment banking, venture capital, real estate and part ownership of a Fortune 500 company.  Assets under administration exceed $8 billion.The Trust Group is structured as follows: Brandywine Trust Company (BTC) is a privately-held Delaware trust company that serves as trustee, adviser, and account administrator to the client families.  Various Brandywine Trust partnerships are maintained to serve as pooled investment vehicles for the family accounts.  Brandywine Group Advisors (BGA), located in New York City, provides investment expertise, advice, and management to BTC and the partnerships.  The Investment Associate will be employed at Brandywine Group Advisors, located in New York City.  BGA engages in asset allocation and manager selection similar to an endowment or foundation, with a focus on total return and a very long-term investment horizon.  In terms of investment performance, it allocates capital to and maintains strong relationships with world-class managers and, as a result, its investment returns have exceeded relevant benchmarks by a significant margin.  BGA also gains insight and strategic guidance from a small, highly experienced Investment Committee.  Responsibilities	BGA seeks a highly motivated professional to provide analytical, research, and investment process support to a small team of generalist investment professionals which is currently comprised of a Chief Investment Officer (CIO), Chief Operating Officer (COO) and three Investment Directors.  He/ she will be a key part of the team, working with them to monitor and shape BGAs investment portfolio across multiple asset classes: global equities, hedge funds, private equity, venture capital, natural resources and real estate, and fixed income.  The Investment Associate will have primary responsibility for the portfolio analytics used to monitor existing investments and evaluate future opportunities.  To that end, the Investment Associate will perform rigorous qualitative and quantitative analysis of existing managers and pools/ asset classes.  In this effort, the Investment Associate will also drive quality and process improvement to refine appropriate reporting and monitoring tools.  Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:	Helping perform rigorous due diligence on new and existing managers  	Analyzing portfolio performance, exposures, and liquidity; clearly and concisely communicating key conclusions of analysis to the team	Helping build/ refine and maintain the analytical infrastructure needed to efficiently track key information on the portfolio and underlying managers	Using appropriate research tools to enhance analysis on new investment strategies and opportunities	Attending meetings and conference calls with current and prospective investment managers	Assisting in the preparation of reports that are required by the Investment Committee or for client families  	Contributing to special projects as they ariseThis position offers the successful candidate an extraordinary opportunity to apprentice at a highly successful investment platform.  He or she will have the opportunity to learn and deepen various skills including gaining an understanding of multiple asset classes, fund manager and opportunity monitoring and assessment, and portfolio management more broadly.  The candidate may potentially, in time, be promoted to an Associate Investment Director role, depending entirely on his/her investment acumen, business judgment, and ability to gain the respect and confidence of the CIO and team.    QualificationsIt is critical that the Investment Associate enjoys working closely with a small team with one common goal, where all members pitch in without hesitation on any and all tasks that arise.  The successful candidate will have superb analytical ability, outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, and a strong desire to learn about institutional investing.  He/she must be a self-starter with the willingness to bring high energy, creativity, and resourcefulness to this position which demands the highest quality work product.  As a member of a small team, the successful candidate must have the ability to handle multiple projects and priorities with attention to detail.   Finally, the candidate must have a sense of humor and the highest level of integrity.The successful candidate will have a minimum of one full year of post-undergraduate work experience.  Please note:  This is a pre-MBA/Master's position.CompensationBrandywine offers a competitive compensation package commensurate with experience and excellent benefits. To Apply: please send your resume to Scott Newman at snewman@bganyc.com for consideration

92.desc: General Overview:JSSA’s clinical teams in Maryland and NoVA have multiple immediate openings for Licensed Clinical Social Workers / Licensed Clinical Professional Counselors to join our growing teams.
