96.company: Public International Law and Policy Group
96.desc: PILPG Summer InternshipAbout The Public International Law & Policy GroupThe Public International Law & Policy Group (PILPG) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that operates as a global pro bono law firm providing free assistance to developing states and governments involved in violent conflicts.  To facilitate the utilization of this legal assistance, PILPG also provides policy formulation advice and training on matters related to conflict resolution.  To date, PILPG has advised over 20 states and governments on the legal aspects of peace negotiations and post-conflict constitution drafting, and over two dozen states and war crimes tribunals in Europe, Asia, and Africa concerning the protection of human rights, self-determination, and transitional justice.Position SummaryInterns will be asked to spend 10 to 12 weeks working either part- or full-time in PILPG’s Washington, DC office.  Interns will work closely with PILPG’s Washington, DC and field office staff throughout the program.  PILPG currently has projects in Burma, Iraq, Kenya, Kosovo, South Sudan, Turkey, Yemen, and the Netherlands.  The internship program is designed to expose students and recent graduates to the field of peace negotiations and post-conflict constitutions, as well as to assist students in honing their research, writing, and networking skills.  The program also has a strong emphasis on professional development and exposure to the field of public international law.

97.desc: Political Communications Manager - [PAAU-02] ACLUF, Communications Department, New York and Washington, D.C.For nearly 100 years, the ACLU has been our nation’s guardian of liberty, working in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the United States.  Whether it’s ending mass incarceration, achieving full equality for the LGBT community, establishing new privacy protections for our digital age, or preserving the right to vote or the right to have an abortion, the ACLU takes up the toughest civil liberties cases and issues to defend all people from government abuse and overreach. With more than a million members, activists, and supporters, the ACLU is a nationwide organization that fights tirelessly in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Washington, D.C., for the principle that every individual’s rights must be protected equally under the law, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or national origin. OVERVIEWThe Communications Department of the ACLU’s national offices in New York City is seeking applicants for the full-time position of Political Communications Manager.Reporting to the Deputy Director of Communications and working directly with the national Communications team and with the National Political Director, the Political Communications Manager will work in developing and executing communications strategies that advance the ACLU’s work on civil liberties, by increasing its effectiveness on legislative and policy change at the national and state level. The Politcal Communications Manager will be a member of the Communications Department and will serve as a communications liaison between the national Communications Department and the National Political Advocacy team, working in both the ACLU’s New York and Washington, D.C. offices.ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIESServe as a lead member of the unit that is developing and executing a creative, multi-faceted communications strategy to advance the ACLU’s efforts to grow a nationwide non-partisan political program to increase our effectiveness at the state and federal levels.Guide the ACLU’s rapid response to daily events on issues related to national policy strategy.Work on a wide array of civil rights and civil liberties issues, including criminal and racial justice, immigrants’ rights, voting rights, LGBT rights, reproductive freedom rights, and national security, technology and privacy.Develop and implement general and targeted communications strategies to further the ACLU’s issue work and brand as needed.Develop communications plans, which include traditional communications, message development, web presence, advocacy and social media, to educate, motivate, and influence target audiences.        Work closely with the National Political Advocacy Department to develop communications strategies and tactics for state legislative and advocacy initiatives.       Increase coverage of ACLU issues and ACLU messages by cultivating and maintaining relationships with key reporters, editors, producers and bookers.Develop and update issue talking points for sensitive and/or controversial issues.Create communications content, including talking points, news releases, op-eds, letters to the editor, blog posts, backgrounders and website and social media content.  Draft or coordinate the drafting of documents with communications colleagues.Conceptualize, as well as draft and edit, opinion pieces such as blog posts and op-eds.Strategize to determine the most effective spokespeople for disseminating the ACLU messages and brand.      Prepare lobbyists, advocates, litigators and/or clients and other spokespeople for media appearances.        Provide assistance to affiliates in the development of communications materials and strategies to further the ACLU’s nationwide, non-partisan political agenda and legislative actions.    COMPENSATIONThe ACLU offers compensation commensurate with experience and within the parameters of the ACLU compensation scale.HOW TO APPLYPlease send a cover letter including your minimum salary requirement, your resume and a relevant writing sample or no more than 5 pages to: HRJOBSCOMM@aclu.org - reference [PAAU-02/W] in the subject line.Please indicate in your cover letter where you learned of this career opportunity.Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.This job description provides a general but not comprehensive list of the essential responsibilities and qualifications required. It does not represent a contract of employment. The ACLU reserves the right to change the description and/or posting at any time without advance notice.The ACLU is an equal opportunity employer. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. The ACLU encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, and veteran status.   The ACLU undertakes affirmative action strategies in its recruitment and employment efforts to assure that persons with disabilities have full opportunities for employment in all positions.We encourage applicants with disabilities who may need accommodations in the application process to contact: hrjobsincl@aclu.org. Correspondence sent to this email address that is not related to requests for accommodations will not be reviewed. Applicants should follow the instructions above regarding how to apply.The ACLU comprises two separate corporate entities, the American Civil Liberties Union and the ACLU Foundation. Both the American Civil Liberties Union and the ACLU Foundation are national organizations with the same overall mission, and share office space and employees. The ACLU has two separate corporate entities in order to do a broad range of work to protect civil liberties. This job posting refers collectively to the two organizations under the name “ACLU.”

98.company: National Museum of American Jewish History
98.position: Public Relations and Digital Marketing Manager
98.desc: Department: Marketing and CommunicationsReports to: Director of Marketing and CommunicationsLocation: Philadelphia, PAOrganization DescriptionThe National Museum of American Jewish History (NMAJH), on historic Independence Mall in Philadelphia, presents educational programs and experiences that preserve, explore, and celebrate the history of Jews in America. Its purpose is to connect Jews more closely to their heritage and to inspire in people of all backgrounds a greater appreciation for the diversity of the American Jewish experience and the freedoms to which Americans aspire.NMAJH’s vision is to be the preeminent national museum creatively teaching, interpreting, and inspiring dialogue about the American‐Jewish experience in the context of American history. The Museum will be a force fueling the American spirit of courage and imagination, aspiration and hard work, leadership and service, through active engagement with the stories of American‐Jewish life and tradition.Position SummaryThe National Museum of American Jewish History is seeking a full-time Public Relations and Digital Marketing Manager to manage strategic planning and execution of media relations and key digital marketing initiatives (website and social media, with the possible eventual addition of e-mail communications). The position reports to the Director of Marketing and Communications.Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesPublic Relations: Create strategic public relations plans for all major museum initiatives, including the permanent collection, exhibitions, public programs, education, visitor services, event rentals, the store, and the café. Strategically and proactively pitch stories and follow up with writers and editors to obtain the best coverage possible. Write, gain necessary approvals on, and judiciously distribute press releases. Maintain website press room and image library. Draft talking points and FAQs for internal and external use. Function as Museum spokesperson as assigned. Schedule interviews, tours by press, photo ops, and press events. Responds to all media requests and escorts photographers, reporters, and cameramen through the Museum/at Museum events. Obtains photo permissions when necessary.  Liaise with Convention and Visitor’s Bureau and Visit Philly media relations in coordination of media visits – coordinate ticket requests and tours. Collect press reviews and quotes that can be leveraged via other marketing and communications vehicles. Create media coverage reports for staff on a monthly basis, and board on a quarterly basis. Other tasks as required.Digital Marketing: Immerse oneself in all aspects of social media for the Museum – strategy, execution, and measurement. Maintain social media and website portion of Museum’s editorial calendar Maintain blog Perform routine updates to the website. Day to day manager of more substantial website changes that may result from upcoming website audit. May eventually take over strategy and execution of monthly e-newsletters, online advertising strategy, and Google Adwords Other tasks as required

101.position: UBS Hedge Fund Solutions, Investment Team Intern Analyst – New York, NY
101.desc: Overview of UBS Asset ManagementAsset Management is a large scale asset manager with well diversified businesses across regions, capabilities and distribution channels. We offer investment capabilities and investment styles across all major traditional and alternative asset classes. In addition, Asset Management is a leading fund house in Europe, the largest mutual fund manager in Switzerland and one of the largest fund of hedge funds and real estate investment managers in the world.As an intern in Asset Management, you will work alongside our talented asset managers and specialists while you learn about our organization, our clients and our wide range of investment products and services.UBS Hedge Fund Solutions DescriptionUBS Hedge Fund Solutions LLC was founded in 1994  and is a wholly owned subsidiary of UBS Americas Holding LLC. It offers a wide range of hedge fund solutions including commingled products, customized discretionary products, as well as portfolio advisory and strategic advisory services. UBS Hedge Fund Solutions has approximately 114 employees, including 57 investment professionals. The firm is headquartered in Stamford, CT with additional offices in New York, London, Geneva, Zurich, Hong Kong, Singapore and Tokyo. As one of the world's largest hedge fund intermediaries, UBS Hedge Fund Solutions has developed the experience and infrastructure to support a global investment platform. As of January 2016, UBS Hedge Fund Solutions currently manages approximately USD 33.9 billion and has allocated over USD 198.6 billion since inception.  Position Description:The investment team within UBS Hedge Fund Solutions is primarily responsible for sourcing and monitoring hedge fund investments. The intern will work closely with the Director of Research on special projects to helpenhance the scalability of the investment team.  The summer interns will gain exposure to the hedge fund industry and a range of investment professionals throughout the program.Interns will be based in our New York, NY office.Duties and Responsibilities:• Liaise between sources of hedge fund investment ideas and the investment team• Conduct interviews and meetings to gather facts on hedge fund investment processes• Assist in producing investment opinions in preparation for Investment Committee meetings• Support local client and prospect relationships and interact with business development as needed • Attend related conferences and maintain industry networks• Liaise with Investment Operations team as needed• Summarize monthly sub fund performance drivers• Take notes for internal and external investment meetings.• Prepare monthly strategy team packets for investment meetings, discussing market trends, manager performance and workflow• Use Bloomberg to compile relevant market data and conduct various statistical analysis • Write reports that summarize market observations and strategy drivers across asset classes• Monitor activities with current investment hedge funds for assigned hedge fund strategies with eventual goal of managing fund relationships• Support Business Development as needed, by preparing for client and prospect presentations and updates • Conduct independent analysis of hedge fund managers utilizing both quantitative and qualitative factors• Understand and communication broader market dynamics with investment team• Develop an understanding of HFS products and team structure. • Support relationships with AM and WMSB distribution arms as well as external institutions• Build relationships with HFS investment officers, product controllers, Portfolio Specialist Group (PSG), and legal and compliance officers• Edit hedge fund manager write-ups submitted monthly to assist in the communication of hedge fund performance to end-clients.  • Collaborate with fellow interns and HFS analysts to deliver a Summer Capstone presentation based on a topic that is of strategic interest to the business. Interns will be expected to employ analytical skills and knowledge of the hedge fund investment business acquired during the internship program.

102.position: Venture for America 2016 Summer Internship Program
102.desc: Venture for America 2016 Summer Internship ProgramWe’re seeking highly motivated college students to join our team and help make sure Training Camp 2016 goes off without a hitch. Training Camp is a rigorous 5-week program, held on campus at Brown University, that will prepare the 2016 class of Venture for America Fellows to hit the ground running as early-stage startup employees and entrepreneurs. We’re looking for energetic, reliable team players who are excited to work closely with one department at VFA, while still pitching in each day to ensure that Training Camp's (many!) moving parts run smoothly.This 10-week internship runs from May 31-August 5, with some flexibility around start and end dates. Before and after Training Camp, you’ll work from VFA headquarters in NYC.What you’ll do:•	Work full-time in Providence, RI from June 20-July 22, and from VFA’s headquarters in New York City before and after Training Camp.•	Be part of the core team managing daily operations at Training Camp, including the schedule and other logistics.•	Work closely with one team (marketing, events, operations, recruitment, guest experience, or Fellow experience), where you’ll manage at least one major project that will serve as the capstone of your internship.•	Serve as a capable utility player. You’ll do everything from preparing materials for training sessions to working with outside vendors to setting up spaces for events.•	Be a resource for Fellows and plan activities to enhance their experience.The good stuff:•	The VFAmily: we have a fun, tightly-knit team culture (a must to live together in Providence for five weeks!), and you’ll have an opportunity to make a real impact over the course of the summer.•	The substantive, marketable experience: we treat our interns like VFA team members. We’ll give you tons of responsibility from day one, and the more you rise to the occasion the more we’ll have you take on.•	The inside scoop: you’ll have a front-row seat to a premier entrepreneurship training program, and will have the opportunity to regularly sit in on trainings.•	The network: our past interns tell us that the best part of this internship is getting to know VFA Fellows, alumni, and supporters.•	The perks: we offer all interns a stipend, and will cover your room, board, and travel expenses while in Providence (you’ll secure your own housing while in NYC).How to apply:To apply, please fill out our internship application. If we think you might be a good fit, we will contact you with next steps.https://jobs.lever.co/ventureforamerica/507bc1b7-eb58-428d-96c5-c530e00cbbd8

105.desc: SummaryThe commercial real estate loan underwriter is responsible for underwriting new commercial real estate loans, as well as acting as portfolio manager for closed loans at Liberty SBF. The underwriter’s goal is to ensure the quality, completeness, and accuracy of analysis that precedes credit and business decisions.Responsibilities •Analyze and evaluate various types of commercial real estate loan opportunities including but not limited to: Commercial Mortgage Backed Securities (CMBS,) Small Business Administration (SBA,) and bridge/transitional property loans in a manner consistent with Liberty SBF credit parameters•Prepare written credit memoranda and ancillary forms for internal and external use•Coordinate with closing department and outside counsel in the preparation, review and approval of loan documentation •Partner with Wholesale Originator/s to cultivate strong client relationships. Exhibit a sense of urgency towards meeting client requests while also meeting acceptable risk parameters•Understand and promote Liberty SBF products to assist the Wholesale Originator in meeting profitability target•Perform routine Portfolio Management activities to proactively manage the loan portfolio and identify and address problems to produce timely loan modifications and risk rating changes, as appropriateWho is Liberty SBF?Liberty SBF is a commercial real estate finance company lending directly from its balance sheet to small businesses owners and property investors across the United States. In the past year, Liberty SBF has enjoyed tremendous growth, quadrupling our volume of business and opening new offices in Los Angeles, New York, and Chicago in addition to our current headquarters in Philadelphia. We have put together a select team of professionals who work together efficiently, utilizing best practices and the latest technology to deliver the highest quality products and services in the industry.

106.company: Hillel: The Foundation for Jewish Campus Life
106.desc: Hillel International is seeking a data quality professional to maintain its various Enterprise Data systems. The Database Associate will work closely with members of the IT team to ensure data quality across all systems.What you do well:Manage multiple projects simultaneously with high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.Provide excellent customer service to both internal and external customers.Learn new software and have an adventuresome orientation toward refreshing/enhancing one's computer software skills.What you bring to the job:High level of proficiency with PCs and Microsoft OS.Advanced skills in Excel, Word, Outlook.Excellent verbal & written communication skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Minimum 3 years' experience in specialized software applications, data entry and verification and report generation.Experience and customer relationship management databases.Knowledge and experience in SQL and Salesforce is a plus.What you'll own:Process all data updates, staffing changes and new user account creations in our database systems.As first line of support, responsible for responding to and following up on internal/external customer inquiries which include but not limited to user account issues, resetting passwords, researching and resolving anomalies.Responsible for data hygiene and data integrity which includes merging duplicates, and cleaning/standardizing data.Assist with CRM projects which include compiling data, data analysis, and importing/exporting across database systems.Build queries and present reports in a format that is easy to understand.Ensure Sugar CRM systems and Listserv database capture accurate contact and staff information to effectively generate reports and email lists.Support and train organization-wide staff as necessary on CRM functions.Review and update, as necessary, documentation of all data entry procedures and processes.New Systems Development: Assist with data migration, functional and integration application testing, executing various test scenarios, ongoing regression testing, and troubleshooting.Assist with other IT projects as needed.What you'll get out of it:Hillel offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, Group Supplemental Retirement Annuity (GSRA), pension plan, life insurance, Long Term Disability (LTD), Flexible Spending Plan, generous vacation/sick time, and parental leaveCompetitive salary in the non-profit marketplace.  Great professional development, mentoring, and skill building opportunities.Independent and hands on work in an exciting environment.Passionate colleagues and practically unlimited t-shirts, Nalgene bottles and university swag.What we’re about:Hillel International is the largest Jewish campus and community-based organization in the world serving the college-age population. Working with hundreds of thousands of students globally to help Jewish students make an enduring commitment to Jewish life, learning and Israel, Hillel serves students at more than 500 colleges, universities and communities. In addition to its presence on more than 450 North American campuses, Hillel works in more than 55 cities in Israel, the Former Soviet Union, Latin America, Australia, and the United Kingdom. Hillel meets all of these students during this most formative time of their lives and engages, educates and inspires these future leaders to make an enduring commitment to Jewish life, learning and Israel.About Hillel’s Schusterman International Center:Hillel's Charles and Lynn Schusterman International Center (SIC) is located in the heart of Washington, D.C. and helps local Hillels in the areas of institutional advancement, strategic planning, leadership development, fundraising, human resources, fiscal administration, student engagement and communications. Hillel's mission is to enrich the lives of Jewish students so that they may enrich the Jewish people and the world. Hillel student leaders, professionals and lay leaders are dedicated to creating a pluralistic, welcoming and inclusive environment for Jewish college students, where they are encouraged to grow intellectually, spiritually and socially. Hillel helps students find a balance in being distinctively Jewish and universally human by encouraging them to pursue Tzedek (social justice), Tikkun Olam (repairing the world) and Jewish learning, and to support Israel and global Jewish peoplehood. Hillel is committed to excellence, innovation, accountability and results.To Apply:Please apply at www.jobs.hillel.org by clicking on “Current Openings.”  PLEASE NOTE: Applicants should include a copy of their cover letter and resume in one document when applying for this position. Please upload this document as a word or PDF file. When you upload the document, the system will create an unformatted version of your resume as a snapshot in your application. The formatted version of your resume will also be attached to your application, and will be used during the hiring process.

110.position: Goldman Sachs Strats / Quant 2016 Full-Time Opportunities
110.desc: Securities StratsSecurities Strats play important roles across the trading floors. Some Strats create cutting-edge derivative pricing models and develop empirical models to provide insight into market behavior. Others develop automated trading algorithms for the firm and its clients, taking an active part in the increasing shift from voice to electronic trading. A third group works on analyzing exposures, structuring transactions, and applying quantitative concepts to meet client needs. Between these teams, Algo Strats design and develop complex parallel computing architectures, electronic trading tools and advanced algorithms.Investment Banking StratsIBD Strats are active in marketing, structuring, pricing and executing transactions for large corporations and institutions in the capital markets and in M&A. We develop state of the art quantitative and analytical methods for advising clients and building financing and risk management solutions across products and industries. IBD Strats are both investment bankers and innovators, creating analytics and scalable technology platforms that will shape the future of investment banking and how we connect with clients. Our team members are financial engineers, software engineers and data scientists who share a passion for investment banking and the financial markets.Finance StratsFinance Strats serve as quantitative experts that play an important role in the risk management of the firm, working closely with the CFO and other members of senior management. Strats in Market Risk and Capital Quantification are responsible for the design, development and maintenance of market risk models. Strats in Risk Architecture are responsible for governing the design and implementation of market risk and market risk capital measures, including model performance, backtesting and industry advocacy. Strats in Operational Risk are responsible for developing and implementing operational risk and capital models and associated analytic tools. Strats in Model Risk Management are responsible for model validation all of the firm’s models.Technology StratsCorporate Treasury Strats provide unique insight into the firm’s business activities, by working closely with the CFO, the treasurer and other members of senior management. They create quantitative tools and analyses measuring the firm’s funding, liquidity and capital. Key team responsibilities include the creation of asset liability and liquidity risk models and analysis of counterparty credit risk, as well as assessing the impact of regulation and responding to supervisory requests.Compliance StratsSurveillance Analytics Strats are data scientists, software engineers and quantitative analysts who design and implement complex surveillances over massive amounts of data. Types of surveillances include trade/transaction surveillances, market manipulation, insider trading, anti-money laundering surveillances and e-communications surveillances.Investment Management StratsInvestment Management Strats collaborate with portfolio managers, traders and sales professionals to analyze portfolios, create investment algorithms, and build pricing models and risk management tools for a broad set of instruments across global financial markets. They also work with private and institutional clients to understand and analyze client investment needs, portfolios (including those employing external managers) and investment strategies. The work involves developing a thorough understanding of the full range of investment products and strategies, an ability to capture the characteristics of those investments in mathematical models and the creation of infrastructure to make those analyses reusable and scalable across our businesses.How to ApplyApply online at goldmansachs.com/careers, following the instructions below:1.	Under the Students and Graduates heading, select “Apply now”2.	Select New Analyst/Associate or Summer Internship3.	Location: New York City Area4.	Division: Strats / Quant5.	Subdivision: Compliance, Finance, Investment Banking, Investment Management, Securities or TechnologyGoldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet. © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2014. All rights reserved.

With technology at the forefront of innovation, there is no better time to join our firm of tech savvy business strategists. Our consultants have worked in a wide variety of industries in the United States and abroad, helping business and IT executives with strategic planning and execution as well as with aligning corporate strategy, divisional strategy, and divisional investments.Interested in studying, learning, and advising companies on how to compete in the modern digital era? 113.position: Research Assistant for CHOP Pediatric Heart Valve Modeling Group
113.desc: Job Description: Research AssistantThe Pediatric Valve Modeling Group at the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia is a collaboration between clinicians, engineers, and computer scientists to better understand, and ultimately intervene upon, dysfunctional pediatric heart valves.A research assistant in the Pediatric Valve Modeling Group will be a essential part of this effort. This position offers the opportunity to build competencies in clinical and translational research, conduct mentored independent research, and gain exposure to the practice of medicine, specifically pediatric cardiology, pediatric cardiac surgery, and pediatric cardiac anesthesia.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:•	Utilize custom, easy to use software developed in house for making computer models of pediatric heart valves from 3D ultrasound (no programming experience required)•	Associate clinical database information with heart valve models using Excel and RedCap to allow translational insight into the mechanism of dysfunction of abnormal valves•	Participate in the scientific process of research study design, IRB approval, data analysis, and preparation of written reports, oral presentations, or manuscripts. Dates: June 2016 (flexible start date) – June 2017, option for continuation Location: Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia, 3401 Civic Center Blvd, Philadelphia, PAHours: Full time (40 hours per week)Preferred Skills and Experiences:•	Bachelor’s degree expected, but year out of college possible for right applicant•	High level of initiative and ability to work independently •	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills •	Proficiency in basic computer programs (e.g. Microsoft Word, Excel) and willingness to learn to use new programs (RedCap database, custom valve modeling tools)•	Background in biology, engineering, math, or physics appreciatedApplication: Please submit the following materials (in PDF format) to Matthew Jolley at JOLLEYM@email.chop.edu•	Resume•	1-2 page cover letter. Please detail your interest and include any other points of interest you may feel are relevant to this position.Deadline: Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Applicants are encouraged to send all materials by March 14, 2016. Questions: Please direct any questions to Matthew Jolley at JOLLEYM@email.chop.edu

Many of the technical challenges Amazon encounters have never been dealt with before on this scale, if at all. Come help lead the way in e-commerce innovation.

116.desc: Company Description:Geneva Energy Markets (GEM) is a proprietary trading company and the leading market-maker in the over-the-counter (OTC) oil market. Since the firm's founding by Mark Vonderheide in 2008, GEM has experienced astounding growth and now has offices in New York, Chicago, and Dublin. This growth was made possible by two industry innovations:  exchange-cleared OTC products and electronic trading. GEM provides liquidity to a wide range of counterparties—including oil companies, banks, utilities, airlines, and hedge funds—without exposing itself to credit risk. Electronic trading, which has replaced open outcry, enables GEM to use its proprietary algorithmic trading programs for efficient execution of oil futures. By combining a deep understanding of the oil markets with state-of-the-art technology and an efficient cost structure, GEM has become one of the largest and most active oil traders in the world.Job Description: GEM is seeking a motivated, passionate, and team-oriented candidate to join the firm as a software developer summer intern. The role requires strong programming and problem-solving skills. The summer intern will work on real projects that will have an immediate impact on the firm. Some projects include developing trading algorithms or GUIs that will assist the traders in day to day activities. Additionally, the intern will learn from and work directly with the head software developer and partners of the firm, who are leaders in the industry.

We are searching for bright and passionate people who are excited to make an impact from day one and grow with the company to take on greater responsibility over time.  We are collaborative, hard-working team players that welcome challenges and rise to any occasion.  Our open workspace in the heart of San Francisco encourages conversation and collaboration.  From cross-departmental meetings to frequent happy hours, Brilliant Earth team members bring a top notch attitude and a willingness to help each other grow. Everyone at Brilliant Earth has a voice  we want to hear yours! If you are interested in growing with Brilliant Earth, send us a resume and cover letter letting us know why you are interested in joining our mission and our team. Please include a sentence about your favorite shape of diamond.Position Overview:The Website Merchandising Coordinator supports the management of our online product catalog and product website assets.  As a team member, you will collaborate with multiple departments to produce, maintain and organize our growing online product listings and ensure high quality standards are maintained on our website. 124.position: Economic Senior Consultant - New York Transfer Pricing Group
124.desc: Transfer Pricing:Transfer pricing is a multidisciplinary field that integrates economics, business, legal and tax principles in the evaluation of intercompany transactions. Transfer pricing refers to pricing arrangements for the sale of goods, provision of services, loans or transfer of intellectual property between affiliates of a multinational enterprise with operations in more than one tax jurisdiction.  These intercompany transactions are becoming increasingly frequent as multinational enterprises continue to globalize their operations.  As a result, transfer pricing represents a significant and growing tax administration challenge to our clients as well as the U.S. Internal Revenue Service and foreign tax authorities.  Deloitte’s Transfer Pricing Group, part of the firm’s Tax function, combines the global expertise of tax professionals, Ph.D. economists, attorneys and economic consultants to help multinational enterprises address their transfer pricing issues in the various jurisdictions in which they operate.Economic Senior Consultant:Professional Responsibilities:We are currently seeking a Senior Consultant for our New York Transfer Pricing Group to work in a team/project-based environment.  Our Senior Consultants work with Ph.D. economists, attorneys and tax specialists to analyze and resolve international transfer pricing issues faced by multinational enterprises in a wide variety of industries.  Responsibilities include devising and performing industry research and financial analysis of companies, performing economic modeling, communicating with clients to obtain factual and financial data, as well as drafting reports in support of our findings.  Additional responsibilities include assisting with client marketing efforts, maintaining project files, and mentoring and training new Consultants.Euromoney Magazine and the International Tax Review have consistently rated Deloitte’s transfer pricing practice as a top Americas and global transfer pricing team.  Deloitte provides a rewarding professional experience with competitive compensation and benefits and with opportunities for professional growth.  Fortune, Business Week, and Working Mother magazine’s consistently rank Deloitte among the best places to work. About Deloitte:Deloitte refers to one or more of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee, and its network of member firms, each of which is a legally separate and independent entity. Please see www.deloitte.com/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited and its member firms. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting. Deloitte provides audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries. With a globally connected network of member firms in more than 140 countries, Deloitte brings world-class capabilities and deep local expertise to help clients succeed wherever they operate. Deloitte's approximately 169,000 professionals are committed to becoming the standard of excellence.Deloitte and its subsidiaries is an equal opportunity organization. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal state or local law.How to ApplyAll applicants should apply through your University’s career services website, as well as through Deloitte’s website. To submit a job-specific profile for this job or to view all of our career opportunities on our careers site, please visit http://usjobs.deloitte.com. The requisition number for this opportunity is: E16NYCTSRCJM017-TP.

125.desc: New York Life is currently seeking self-motivated, driven individuals with a passion for making a positive impact on peoples’ lives. As a young professional, chances are you’re looking for many things in your career such as challenging work that enables you to learn and grow, the ability to advance and be rewarded, and an environment that provides structure and a robust training and development program to help you succeed. And mostly importantly, you can do work that matters and makes a real difference in your community. Here is what distinguishes this opportunity with New York Life: •           Career Advancement - Continue to build your own business or, if qualified, move into management – the choice is up to you. Criteria for management are clearly defined and are quantifiable - there are no “favorites

126.desc: The Leadership Development Internship Program at the Middle East Institute is designed to provide students or recent graduates considering a career in a Middle East related field with hands-on experience at a Washington, DC-based, nonprofit organization that focuses exclusively on the Middle East. Interns obtain guidance, experience, and exposure to the Washington policy and scholarly community while developing professional skills with interns from all over the world.MEI offers an array of internship opportunities that engage a wide range of professional interests and talents. On a given day, the RA for Dr. Paul Salem might conduct open-source news analysis of extremist and moderate Syrian groups on Twitter and YouTube, while our Programs and Communications interns might organize and help host a panel to discuss cultural racketeering and antiquities theft in Egypt. With over 20 intern positions across 7 different departments, we have a variety of positions that attract a very diverse pool of interns.Although our internships are unpaid, MEI works to ensure that its interns are compensated for their contributions. We offer a free language class, daily travel reimbursement, a year-long online subscription to the Middle East Journal, and a series of talks, the Intern Development Series, exclusively dedicated to advancing our interns' professional lives and their knowledge of the region.

129.position: Learn. Live. Lead. Join AVODAH: The Jewish Service Corps
129.desc: AVODAH: The Jewish Service Corps seeks corps members of all backgrounds for a year of service at antipoverty organizations in Chicago, New Orleans, New York, and Washington, DC.AVODAH matches corps members with local, community-based organizations where they gain considerable expertise spending a year focused on issues including immigration, domestic violence, hunger, homelessness and housing, environmental justice, education, and public health.Corps members are expected to work at a high level at their placements and are able to do so through the expertise of placement staff, the support of AVODAH program staff and through AVODAH's program which works to provide corps members with skills, mentoring, connection to leaders in the field, and an expanded tool kit of methods of social change.During the year, corps members live together as a community and participate in weekly educational programs to deepen their understanding of domestic poverty and explore their work through the lens of Jewish tradition, regularly facilitated by local experts, educators, and community leaders.Several of our positions require fluency or comfort in a second language, especially Spanish.Participants receive a modest living allowance in addition to receiving health insurance, a travel subsidy, and subsidized housing.At the end of the program year, corps members join the AVODAH Alumni Network, comprised of more than 800 social justice leaders nationwide. Members of the AVODAH Alumni Network have lifetime access to opportunities for activism, professional development, and Jewish engagement.Applicants must be between the ages of 21-26 at the start of the program year in August 2016. Applicants must be citizens of the United States or permanent residents of the United States, or have dual United States citizenship with another country. Applicants must be able to participate in the program for a full year.

130.desc: Luxe Valet is looking for a Valet Operations Manager in San Francisco. As the lead for the Valet Operations team, you will own the most important part of the business (valets) in our largest market. This position is ideally suited for a business-savvy individual looking to leverage their considerable quantitative, operations and strategic thinking skills to tackle valet operations. You will fully immerse yourself analyzing problems using data and real-life insight, define solutions, and implement them in the real world. You are a respected leader and live by a “get it done!” mantra.Your day to day responsibilities will include strategic and operations initiatives, process design and implementation, execution, and performance measurement.YOU WILL:+ Understand operational pain points, formulate solutions and execute+ Develop programs to scale the operations and support the business+ Focus on training, onboarding, metrics and performance data to support San Francisco+ Manage escalations and make command decisions+ Drive quality metrics and initiatives to improve the customer and valet experience+ Develop compelling, insightful, and actionable programs and measurements using data and real-world insights+ Lead execution against recommendations quickly and with flawless accuracy; Own process for measuring the impact and return of recommended initiatives+ Ability to be highly productive with limited oversight on a day-to-day basis. This role is intended for somebody who will take meaningful responsibility and initiative for shaping operationsYOU HAVE:+ A Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related technical field+ At least 2-3 years of relevant experience at a top-tier management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity firm and/or technology company+ Highly analytic mindset with strong financial modeling and complex problem solving skills+ Precedent examples of having developed and implemented business strategies, driving impactful results according to plan+ Effective oral and written communication skills, while dealing with stress well+ A high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand+ Ability to succeed in a collaborative get-it-done environment

131.desc: A 9-12 month paid internship program in clinical research related to child development and neurodevelopmental disorders is offered by Cohen Children’s Medical Center of New York – part of Northwell Health (formerly North Shore-Long Island Jewish Health System).        This Clinical Research Internship offers 1-2 accomplished students the opportunity to work closely with faculty mentors on research projects related to normal or abnormal child development. Research Assistants (RA’s) will assist clinical faculty with ongoing research projects and/or work collaboratively with one or more mentors in designing new projects of mutual interest. The Division has internal funding for clinical research. RA’s are not expected to write grants, and their research endeavors and activities are not dependent on extramural grants. Although the internship is primarily focused on clinical research, there may also be an opportunity to co-author a review article for publication in a peer-reviewed pediatric journal.   Program Dates: Start and completion dates for the Gap Year internship are somewhat flexible. Priority will be given to applicants prepared to make at least a full-time 9 month commitment or longer, though alternate schedule arrangements will be considered.  With advance notice, research interns may take as many days off (without pay) as needed during their internship to visit medical schools for interviews.Additional information is detailed in the attached Summary.  For Further Information:     The research internship is coordinated by Dr. Andrew Adesman, Professor of Pediatrics. Questions regarding the Gap Year internship or the application process should be directed either to him (AAdesman@northwell.edu) or to his assistant, Christine Peck, at 516 802-6101 (CPeck@northwell.edu).

132.position: 2016 Global Equity Linked Products (GELP) Rotational Program
132.desc: RBC Capital Markets:RBC Capital Markets is a premier investment bank that provides a focused set of products and services to corporations, institutional investors and governments around the world. With more than 7,100 professionals, we operate out of 70 offices in 15 countries across North America, the U.K., Europe, and the Asia-Pacific region.We work with clients in over 100 countries around the globe to deliver the expertise and execution required to raise capital, access markets, mitigate risk and acquire or dispose of assets. According to Bloomberg and Dealogic, we are consistently ranked among the largest global investment banks.RBC Capital Markets is part of a leading provider of financial services, Royal Bank of Canada (RBC). Operating since 1869, RBC is one of the top 15 largest banks in the world and the fifth largest in North America, as measured by market capitalisation. With a strong capital base and consistent financial performance, RBC is among a small group of highly rated global banks.Global Equity Linked Products (GELP)GELP is a client facing derivatives business servicing Private Banks, Retail, Corporate and Institutional Clients and is present throughout Canada, New York, London, Hong Kong and Tokyo. GELP can be categorized into three functional areas: Trading, Sales, and Platform (Structuring, Quants, Business Technology and Management.)U.S. Analyst ProgramThe program provides interns direct exposure and hands-on experience through this 12 month program.  Interns will have the opportunity to gain experience within different areas of GELP working alongside some of the best in the business. Some of the businesses that participate in the GELP program include:Business TechnologyOverview / Responsibilities:•	Global Equity Linked Products Business Technology is looking for sharp, inquisitive and energetic problem-solver for an outstanding opportunity to apply and expand its knowledge of financial instruments, front-office processes and technologies. •	This position will be responsible for implementing and supporting various tools (pricing, risk analysis, workflow and reporting) and infrastructure for GELP business technology.  The chosen candidate will interact with front-office - trading, sales, quants and technology - to implement rapid technology solutions. •	This position requires good Excel/VBA and Scripting programming skills; exposure/aptitude for rapid applications development; good understanding of financial mathematics; and strong client service orientation.Ideal Candidate Profile:•	A recent bachelors/masters graduate in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering      or Sciences•	Proficiency in MS Excel, VBA, SQL and Windows/UNIX scripting•	Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions•	Basic concept of financial mathematics and equity derivatives in particular•	Excellent written and spoken communication skills•	Knowledge of C++ or Java is a plus•	Knowledge of market data access using Bloomberg or Reuters Excel API is a plusStructured/Quantitative ModelingOverview / Responsibilities:•	Support local quant and structuring teams in day to day tasks such as model and product testing and analysis, data collection, analysis and presentation.•	Implementation tools using VBA or other programming tools.•	Running of periodic reports.Ideal Candidate Profile:•	Recent graduates with a Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college in a quantitative areas such as Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics, Physics or Engineering•	Master’s Degree or a Ph.D. or ongoing graduate studies in quantitative field is very desirable•	Strong C++ or C# skills are a significant asset•	Experience in Technology , financial modeling and Excel / VBA skills are an asset•	Experience in Python is a significant asset•	SQL knowledge is a significant asset•	Knowledge of market data access using Bloomberg or Reuters Excel API is a plusSales and TradingOverview / Responsibilities:•	Support traders in day to day tasks such as trade pricing, risk management, trade booking, P & L decomposition and reconciliation•	Special projects as requiredIdeal Candidate Profile:•	Degree in Mathematical Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Sciences•	Strong quantitative skills•	Basic knowledge of mathematical finance and derivatives in particular•	Preferred VBA and / or C++ Programming•	Willingness and persistence to tackle complex problems and to see them through with appropriate solutions.Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment:RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors.

133.desc: Position Overview:GRA is looking to hire full-time Associate for its Washington, DC office, located near Dupont Circle. The Associate’s role will deal primarily with research on matters pertaining to information security, assisting in the development of marketing and research/analytical products, and contributing to article submissions to outside publications. The position will begin with a probationary three-month trial (40-hour work week) that, if successful, will convert into a full-time position upon completion. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:o	Assist with research, writing, and editing of internal and client-facing productso	Use detailed knowledge of the technical aspects of information security issues to guide research, assist with business development, and produce written productso	Review and write regularly published articles primarily on current/technical issues in the realm of information security o	Ensure all research products adhere strictly with the guidelines of the Chicago Manual of Styleo	Other projects as assigned

134.desc: LiveIntent is hiring a Business Operations Intern to help manage and improve upon systems and processes that keep our business moving! The first priority for this intern will be maintaining the data integrity of Salesforce to maximize the efforts of our sales team. The second priority will be auditing and consolidating knowledge resources used across the company so that relevant information is accessible and easy to find for all employees. A little about LiveIntent:LiveIntent is a company built on people. Our culture centers on the people that work here, and our platform centers on the people we help marketers reach. We're unique. We're fun to work with. And we're looking for unique, fun people to join our team and help our mission.Recently named #2 on Crain’s Fastest Growing New York Companies list and #45 on the Forbes America’s Most Promising Companies List, we connect over 450 brands with 750 of the top US publishers through a platform powered by people, not pixels.If you are smart, technically adept, collaborative, and have a strong desire to learn, we want to hear from you!A little about the Business Operations Intern job: -Review and clean Advertiser and Publisher account data in Salesforce -Review and clean Contract data in Salesforce-Build new Salesforce reports and review existing reports to monitor data integrity and fix issues that arise-Audit current knowledge resources, create clear descriptions for what each system is used for, and outline a plan with recommendations for changes that would create efficiencies   -Begin knowledge resource consolidation projects that come from your recommendations A little about you: -You’re a self-starter and willing to run with a project without perfectly detailed directions-You enjoy problem solving and try to approach life with a problem solving attitude-Communication is a strength, you strive to be clear in both written and spoken communication-Excel doesn’t intimidate you and you possess at least basic Excel skills -You might have knowledge of Salesforce (SFDC), that would be a huge plus!A little about your summer with us: 10 Fun, Fast Weeks: Our 2016 Summer Internship Program will run from Monday June 6th through Friday August 12th. This is a paid position and you’ll work 40 hours per week.Location, location, location: You’ll spend 10 weeks at our headquarters in NYC, conveniently located in Tribeca. Since we have offices located in Austin, London, Berlin, and Copenhagen you’ll walk away with the experience of working for a global tech company!Thoughtful Onboarding: During your first 2 weeks you’ll ramp up with the same LiveIntent Onboarding that our full-time employee experience. We’ll also create opportunities for you to meet the full-time team (read – free food!) so you feel fully connected. Ownership: Your time at LiveIntent will be meaningful, not filled with coffee runs. Teams across the company have identified ongoing projects to address real business challenges – and we trust you to take ownership of these projects. Our hope is that you will identify areas for opportunity and go for it, without waiting for instruction!Mentorship & Growth: On your first day you will meet your Trip Sitter, a veteran LiveIntenter who will help you navigate through your time here. Your manager and fellow team members will teach you and provide feedback along the way. We’ve created trainings to help you get the most out of this experience and feel prepared for your next step. Find Fun: We work hard at LiveIntent but we take every opportunity to Find Fun along the way. You’re encouraged to participate in activities like: afternoon snack time, office ping pong tournaments, trivia nights, in-office group exercise classes, coloring sessions, organized sports teams, and so much more!

135.desc: Fit4D is hiring a Chief Operating Officer for our New York City office. 136.desc: Who we are We are a group of well-funded technology and real estate entrepreneurs.  Our mission is simple.  We want to modernize the multi-billion dollar title and settlement industry to deliver a seamless, transparent, and delightful experience to sellers, buyers and borrowers. We are currently seeking to add a Funding Specialist to our Escrow department. We are looking for a responsible, motivated professional to make sure our real estate escrow accounts  are meticulously maintained and all disbursements go without a hitch.  Individuals with settlement, finance and/or accounting experience with good understanding of the real estate industry are excellent candidates.  We do look for some relevant experience and proven track record in positions related to handling money, financial transactions analyses and of course customer service. We do operate under some high stress and we are in a tight deadline environment.  Prior title experience is not required.  What you should bring to the table:Fire:  You are determined to see tasks through to the end; you're not happy with 99% done. You hit the ground sprinting and use your killer creativity, sense of urgency and common sense to guide you.Grace under pressure:  You have the ability to solve many problems at a moment’s notice; you have a positive, “can-do” attitude where the customer is always right and no task is too big or too small to conquer.Team player: You’ll be working closely with all departments; you're resourceful, decisive and hold yourself accountable for the customer experience.Detail oriented: Working in the Escrow Department means attention to every little piece – from a penny that cannot reconcile to a lender wire that does not balance. You love spreadsheets and can’t help but triple check everything you do.Technology and Finance: You have a solid understanding of general accounting and finance and you truly believe technology and software is the best way to keep them in check. A fun, caring, and humble attitude: We all work hard, but it’s important to have a good time, look out for each other, and pitch in wherever needed.What you'll do:Enter, post and issue and maintain accounting entries for seamless reconciliationRefund and oversee file disbursementPrepare daily and weekly and assist with monthly reconciliation reportsReview escrow accounts and report on status, changes and outstanding balancesProduce funding reports and analyses, identify and propose solutions to potential issuesWork with and provide guidance to Escrow Coordinators when neededReview, analyze and approve vendor bills and other account payablesWork closely with other departments to facilitate escrow  requests while exercising sound judgment, prioritizing and maintaining sense of urgencyMaintain thorough communication with clients and vendorsIdentify and escalate potential problems to Escrow managerOther related projects that and special tasks as they arise Requirements:Experience: we don’t require specific title or settlement experience, however good command of accounting and finance are strongly preferred. Results driven, money related, under stress proven performance and history are the perfect combination.Smarts: you’ve got a college degree in business, finance or accounting, some good, recent experience and can communicate and write well. Tech-savvy: proficient with Microsoft Office Suite especially Outlook & Excel and have the natural ability to pick up on new programs and tools. This is a full time position with exceptional benefits and perks. Our office is in a beautiful high rise suite in Center City Philadelphia with great access to public transportation so you can be at your best every day.Title Forward is an Equal Opportunity Employer

137.desc: The Church Pension Fund is the Midtown Manhattan based benefits provider to the Episcopal Church. With offices in New York and Hong Kong, our investment team of 23 professionals oversees assets totaling $12 billion.The Church Pension Fund, established in 1917, has built a globally diversified portfolio of public and private equities, real estate and fixed income securities invested across investment strategies.  The investments are managed by over 200 external managers and general partners. Our portfolio includes economically targeted investments, investments with women- and minority owned firms, and environmentally responsible investments that offer competitive returns.CPF invites qualified candidates to apply for an exciting new opportunity to join our Investment Management team.  The individual selected for this position will work with our very experienced team as an Investment Analyst. The Investment Analyst oversees and updates SunGard Investran database of CPG’s portfolio company and property characteristics, transactions and exposures. Database plays vital role enabling investment diligence, analysis, reconciliations, monitoring and reporting related to venture, buyout, real estate, real asset and hedge fund portfolios totaling $3.6 billion. Analyst prepares analyses and reports with guidance from Managing Directors and Associates. Other investment, data and presentation-related tasks across asset classes may be assigned. This position is part of CPG’s Analyst Program, the duration of which is expected to last three years.

138.desc: DEPARTMENTInformation TechnologyCLASSIFICATIONFull time LOCATIONPhiladelphia, PAABOUT FRANKLIN SQUARE CAPITAL PARTNERSFranklin Square is a leading manager of alternative investment funds designed to enhance investors’ portfolios by providing access to asset classes, strategies and asset managers that typically have been available to only the largest institutional investors. The firm’s funds offer “endowment-style” investment strategies that help construct truly diversified portfolios and manage risk. Franklin Square strives not only to maximize investment returns but also to set the industry standard for best practices by focusing on transparency, investor protection and education for investment professionals and their clients.Founded in Philadelphia in 2007, Franklin Square quickly established itself as a leader in the world of alternative investments managing over $15 billion in assets. Franklin Square was named one of Philadelphia’s Best Places to Work and ranked by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Most Promising Companies. Franklin Square distributes its funds through its affiliated broker-dealer, FS2 Capital Partners, LLC.For more information, please visit www.franklinsquare.com. KEY RESPONSIBILITIESFranklin Square is seeking to hire an experienced Help Desk Analyst who is responsible for managing all of the day to day issues that arise from internal employees as they relate to their hardware, software and connectivity.  This role is responsible for hands on execution and servicing and must possess the technical skills and the customer servicing skills to be effective.  The Help Desk Support Specialist will report to the Director of Network Operations and will collaborate with our outsourced help desk partner to ensure all issues are managed and resolved appropriately.•	Responds to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone or through electronic submissions.•	Able to diagnose and remediate technical hardware and software issues.•	Researches questions by leveraging available information resources.•	Supports the new hire onboarding process by issuing all appropriate equipment, software and security credentials.•	Services the employment termination process by terminating all secured access to information and data by complying with Franklin Square employment termination policies.•	Manages the inventory of all user hardware and hardware requests extending from laptops, pc’s, company issued phones and iPads.•	Enforces security policies on all company issued equipment as well as submissions from users requesting access to information and data from non-company issued hardware.•	Owning the relationship and collaborating with the designated providers that augment our help desk function.•	Where appropriate and necessary, redirecting or escalating problems to the appropriate resource.•	Administer all issues and activity reports in an effort to enable reporting for volume, service levels, types of requests and root cause.•	Overseeing and administering all necessary changes to maintain versions of software and anti-virus measures on company issued equipment.QUALIFICATIONS•	Experience servicing and supporting customers who consume a wide variety of hardware and software.•	Outstanding hardware and licensed software knowledge as well as highly evolved problem solving skills.•	4-year degree.•	Excellent oral and written communication skills.•	Ability to work effectively with others.•	Embodying a high service level for internal customers as well as high attention to detail.COMPETENCIESCharacterExhibits integrity, professionalism, practical judgment, positive attitude at all times; exhibits perseverance, mental toughness and initiative in the face of problems and challenges; must be able to take direction and accept constructive criticism.Interpersonal confidenceStrong interpersonal skills; can effectively communicate and relate to all levels within and outside the organization; possesses the ability to influence and creates and builds positive and productive relationships.Results orientedDrives the team and the organization for results in order to improve performance; able to make timely or planned decisions appropriate to the circumstances or situation.TeamworkSelf-starter but also effective as a member of a team; willing to put firm’s objectives ahead of individual goals.CommunicationExcellent communication and listening skills are required.Organizational abilityCan organize people and resources to prioritize and get projects completed; can create a plan for resourceful workflow and has a strong ability to multi-task and keep order in a fast paced, high-energy work environment.Franklin Square Capital Partners offers an exceptional benefits and wellness program and a highly competitive compensation package.Franklin Square Capital Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

139.desc: Intellicomm Inc., an information technology firm located in Wayne (suburban Philadelphia), PA, provides online services to mostly business customers. We are seeking a SQL Database Developer.Responsibilities include:• MS SQL Server setup, administration and management.• Writing queries and stored procedures.• Database backup, recovery and restores.• Database performance tuning.• Creating database schemas.• Ongoing documentation of systems and procedures.• This position requires occasional after-hours support in emergency cases.Intellicomm is focused on developing the leading edge hosted unified communications service. To learn more about Intellicomm, please visit the company website at www.intellicomm.com or the service website at www.innoport.com.Please Note: No agencies, phone inquiries and no walk-ins please.

140.desc: Shift Forex is looking to bring on qualified and motivated Brokerage Operations Support interns. We offer an exciting opportunity for hands-on experience with leading professionals in the Forex field to gain knowledge and experience in offshore corporations as well as back-office brokerage operations.Interns will get the opportunity to:· Communicate daily with clients around the globe· Learn and work extensively with Excel and specialized software such as Salesforce· Receive training on FX and brokerage operations· Learn about AML (anti-money laundering) and KYC procedures· Assist in providing personalized service to clients with a diverse array of product needs· Learn how to complete and process related paperworkThis is an unpaid internship in New York, NY.
