141.position: Entry Level Legal Assistant - Assistant Managing Clerk
141.desc: Prestigious, International Law Firm located Midtown -West in NYC - Seeks Entry Level Legal Assistant/Assistant Managing Clerk.  An excellent opportunity to gain the critical research and reasoning skills that will help you succeed in law school. Must be able to make a 2 Year commitment to a position if planning to attend law school or post graduate studies in the future. Every Assistant in this Department is trained to: Docket and handle  docketing  and litigation deadlines in the New York office, and will provide docketing support to multiple practice areas that do litigation work. This position will provide back-up support  to other offices and will report to the Managing Clerk.Research court procedural rules Docket incoming litigation mail, notices from court and all pleadings in a litigation matter. This includes keep docketing system updated by ensuring that all documents are entered for each case and that the deadlines are calculated correctly 	Keep abreast of developments, procedures and rules in the forums where the firm practices including general state and federal practice. Advise attorneys on court procedure, including electronic case filing procedures.   Understand and use computerized case management systems including those used for docketing court documents, calendaring dates and reviewing and maintaining multiple court docket e-mail boxes.  Gain knowledge of civil procedure by going to court to processing court documents and doing legal research.Conduct research using a variety of tools, including the accessing of private and public databases and work on special projects as assigned by the Managing Clerk.Required:Bachelors degree preferably in legal studies with a strong GPAExceptional verbal and written communications skills Strong attention to detail, follow through and resourcefulnessAbility to prioritize competing demands under tight deadlinesDemonstrated ability to professionally work and collaborate with colleagues at all levels Ability to do overtime including some weekends to meet filing deadlinesAbility to make a 2 year work commitment if planning to attend law school We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and provide exceptional training, excellent benefits, compensation and work environment.

142.desc: Position Description Department:		Development FLSA Status:		Non-Exempt; Full-time	Position Title:	       Administrative AssociateReports To:		Managing Director, DevelopmentLocation:			Philadelphia, PADate:			February 2016Administrative Associate Overview: Under the direction of Managing Director, Development provide professional quality and timely administrative support for all staff. With typically a minimum of five years’ experience, act in a role that is working closely with all staff to support the organization of company and project files and meetings and presentations. Prepare and coordinate accurate billable hours and timely expense reimbursements while serving as the liaison between the parent company resources and staff to resolve IT issues, complete office supply requisitions and coordination of company events and facilities maintenance. Essential Functions:1.	Support organization of company and project files by locating, retrieving, and organizing, scanning and transferring project files to the proper destination upon request. 2.	Prepare and coordinate approval of accurate billable hours and timely expense reimbursements according to policies and procedures.3.	Assist with preparing reporting packages, presentations, special projects and other duties which require proofreading, photocopying, filing and collating. Ensure application of correct use of the English language including grammar, spelling, punctuation and layout. Provide professional quality, timely general administrative support to all staff.4.	Ensure entry, guest waiting area and administrative work areas present a professional and orderly image of National and are absent of excessive items. Greet and direct a diverse group of visitors to the company in a friendly, customer-oriented manner.  5.	Organize and manage day-to-day conference, team and guest office rooms, including food and beverages as needed. Manage the process of setting up conference and team room technology, including audio/video equipment in preparation of company meetings. Coordinate with parent company staff as needed. 6.	Provide entry level IT desktop support and serve as the liaison between the parent company resources and staff. Includes testing, identifying and resolving basic end user problems related to hardware and software, email, internet and the peripheral and audio/video systems. 7.	Support the administration of telecommunications system; route and field calls, set up and train employees, and manage special phone requests.  8.	Manage office supply requisitions, organization and control of supplies and restocking as needed. Daily production room and supply organization.9.	Mail delivery, collection and distribution. Coordinate the pick-up and delivery of express mail services. Maintain publications, periodicals, subscriptions and professional memberships as needed.10.	Ensure National Development’s Corporate Calendar is maintained, as appropriate.  11.	Support internal sustainability initiatives, in addition to demonstrating a commitment to National’s Sustainability Policy and best practices where feasible by incorporating environmental, social and governance dimensions in daily business activities and decision-making.12.	Demonstrate commitment to and abide by National’s Regulatory Compliance Manual and Code of Ethics. Other Duties and Responsibilities:1.	Actively and collaboratively participate in Staff meetings, as needed and required.Qualifications: 1.	Successful completion of an undergraduate degree in business, communications or related field is required. Prior administrative experience in a professional office environment is required. 2.	A demonstrated history of at least five years of administrative and records management experience is required. Direct office administration and/or construction administration, records and database management and/or significant coursework in other related fields is preferred. 3.	Must demonstrate a strong knowledge of customer service principles and practices, applying discretion as needed. Demonstrate cultural awareness and sensitivity, sound work ethics, and effective professional verbal and written communication skills.4.	Must be detail-oriented, resourceful and possess excellent interpersonal and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and successfully handle multiple projects. Possess expert computer indexing abilities as well as satisfactory application of correct use of the English language including grammar, spelling, punctuation and layout.  5.	Capable of working independently or as a team while exercising initiative. Demonstrate proactivity and flexibility relative to managing priorities, providing status reports and meeting deadlines. The position is part of small team of real estate professionals who work in a very collaborative environment. Strong interpersonal skills and experience working in a team-like environment is essential. 6.	An interest in real estate development, architecture, urban planning, is recommended but not required.7.	Possess aptitude for learning new technology applications, and current proficiency in intermediate level MS Office Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point and Adobe. SharePoint and Project is a plus. Work Environment:1.	This job primarily operates in a clerical, office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers and filing cabinets. This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required, which would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary. 2.	Periodic travel to the parent company office in Washington, DC is required in order to attend staff meetings and other events. Travel to other projects and meeting locations will be determined. The work environment and physical demand characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions and nothing in this herein restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  The employee in this position will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at National will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. National does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

143.desc: Associate, Life Sciences Strategy ConsultingBoston, MAClarion Healthcare, LLC, a boutique life sciences consulting firm in downtown Boston, seeks intellectually curious, highly analytical, team-oriented individuals eager to roll up their sleeves to help pharmaceutical / biotech clients address their most important strategic and organizational challenges.    As an Associate at Clarion you will gain deep experience in -- and broad exposure to -- the dynamic life sciences industry.   Working with a team of seasoned professionals you will help shape decisions of senior executives.  Recent projects include:  •	Developing a novel, industry-leading commercialization model for a development stage biotech client preparing to launch its first oncology product;•	Evaluating and recommending opportunities for a major pharmaceutical client to diversify into a non-Rx product area;•	Developing a rare disease profile to evaluate a biopharmaceutical client’s potential acquisition of a development-stage asset for disease treatment;•	Assessing a potential acquisition in the healthcare space for a large-cap private equity firm by providing analysis of the target market, company, and investment potential.Clarion provides an exceptional opportunity for you to develop a broad base of in-depth commercial experience in a dynamic, collaborative, downtown office environment.ABOUT THE ASSOCIATE OPPORTUNITYAll recent graduates – PhDs, MAs and BAs alike – join Clarion as Associates, with differences in compensation, expectations and career trajectory based on highest degree achieved.  Because we care about performance and results more than titles, we strive to keep hierarchy to a minimum – thereby allowing every individual to rise to their highest potential.  Clarion Associates gain exposure to a broad range of issues facing businesses in the rapidly-changing life sciences industry.  As an Associate, you will develop and apply a solid set of skills that will help you contribute to our work in key areas and will serve you well throughout your career:•	Research:  Using primary and secondary sources, you’ll identify information critical to understanding our clients’ business problems.  Whether the information relates to market trends, companies, competitors, or products, you’ll learn to differentiate between essential and extraneous.•	Analysis:  You’ll dig into data, prioritizing key issues, generating hypotheses and testing your theories.  You’ll bounce ideas around with your teammates, and you’ll keep going until you are confident with your results.•	Communication:  You’ll clearly and persuasively articulate your analysis, effectively using slides and verbal communication to present your key findings.Each project is unique, but a case team typically consists of 3-6 Clarion members including a Managing Director and/or Principal, an experienced Consultant and/or Manager, and one or more Associates.  Client interaction occurs at all levels and varies based on the project.  Given the size of the firm, its entrepreneurial culture and relatively horizontal organizational structure, Associates can expect to interact with Managing Directors frequently, benefiting from their seasoned judgment and experience.INTERESTED?To be considered for this exceptional opportunity, please submit a cover letter, resume and transcript (unofficial acceptable) online, via PennLink.  We hope that you will consider joining the growing number of Penn alumni at Clarion!

144.desc: Job Description: SnipSnap built the first app to let anyone scan a paper coupon and turn it into a mobile offer. Since we launched in 2012, we've become the largest consumer app in Philadelphia, with 5 million users, who have saved 250 million coupons and a half a billion dollars. As we continue to grow, we need a rockstar sales and business-development intern to help pitch new retailers and partners on our solutions. This includes, but is certainly not limited to mobile coupon campaigns, geo-targeting, behavior targeting, and enterprise coupon marketing. The ideal candidate is hardworking, focused, a quick learner and willing to take on anything that comes their way. A can-do attitude and flexibility is both key, as we are a lean, fast-paced start-up at the core.Responsibilities-	Size clients and industries to provide recommendations /solutions to business challenges through the use of professional services-	Help sell mobile image recognition and mobile coupon offerings to larger retailers and 3rd party mobile app partners-	Identify key decision makers in existing and potential clients-	Generate 10+ new leads per week-	Grow business within existing accounts by managing the account relationship-	Ongoing follow up with client to detail satisfaction and ongoing businessQualifications-	Experience selling and managing accounts-	Broad knowledge of the mobile app landscape including mobile shopping apps-	Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment-	Excellent written and oral communication skills-	Strong negotiation skills-	Strong interpersonal skills-	Able to work well in a team environment and is able to work independently when necessary-	Must be motivated, goal oriented and persistentOur TeamWe’re obsessive about great design, great user experience, and keeping it simple. We’re passionate about high availability, performance and consistency.We hang out in Slack. We manage our work in Asana. We laugh liberally. We’re a lean team – you’ll have direct access to everyone. We value innovative ideas and work hard to raise the bar in everything we do. And we are quick to embrace new technologies and methodologies that allow us to work better and faster and build better products for our users.

145.desc: Position DescriptionDepartment:		DevelopmentClassification:		Exempt, Full-timeTitle:				Development ManagerReports To:		Managing Director, DevelopmentLocation: 			Philadelphia, PADate:			February 2016Development Manager Overview: Under the direction of the Managing Director, Development and in consultation with the development team, manage and resolve day-to-day issues related to development activities on one large project, several smaller development projects or portions of projects. With typically a minimum of five years’ experience, act in a role that is working closely with senior and junior development professionals to expedite and assure project completion according to specifications. With appropriate supervision participate in the selection of financial sources, deal structuring, legal document review and negotiation as well as architectural and construction planning as appropriate.  Essential Functions: 1.	Under the guidance of the Managing Director, Development, manage the day-to-day development activities related to one or more investments where National Development serves as sole, lead developer or co-developer in collaboration with a joint venture partner. As appropriate, act as the main point of contact with the consultant team for a specific development project(s) or components of projects. With oversight support the communication of priorities and monitoring of the consultant team relative to the planning, organization, execution and management of the development team’s goals, objectives and progress. 2.	With oversight and coordination with the project construction and development team, support finalizing any or all of the following as needed: (i) land use entitlements and permitting; (ii) evaluation, selection and ongoing oversight of third-party design and construction professionals (e.g., general contractors, architects, engineers, etc.); (iii) oversight of development budget and schedule; (iv) creation and management of project pro forma and development models; (v) marketing and branding initiatives; (vi) ensure compliance with the terms of third-party financing; (vii) selection and oversight of third-party leasing and property management professionals; (viii) oversight of the transition from construction to completed operations; and (ix) miscellaneous activities required to successfully plan and manage the development or re-development of an income-producing, commercial real estate project, including responsibilities outlined in a project-specific letter or Development Services Agreement.   3.	Participate in negotiations and support the management of executed retail and office leasing deals, including landlord work, communications with and about managing the tenant and tenant’s consultants, improvements and the tenant’s move-ins.4.	In coordination with the senior construction team review a variety of construction documents including but not limited to plans and specifications, budgets, schedules, contract documents, and third-party consultant reports to identify and report issues of concern.5.	Prepare accurate and timely billable hours following policies and procedures, resolving errors and reconciling against project budgets.6.	Attend and actively contribute to regular meetings between National Development staff, clients, consultants, joint venture partners and third-party professionals related to current and planned future development activities. 7.	As appropriate coordinate with National Development legal counsel in the preparation and execution of requisite legal documents including third-party architect, engineer, consultant and construction contracts and all other legal documents commonly related to real estate development or construction.8.	Assist National Development’s parent company investment staff in feasibility assessments of new investments where National Development would assume a lead development or co-development role. 9.	Manage and ensure compliance with National Development’s risk management practices and policies.10.	Assist in the creation and documentation of National Development project standards and protocols. 11.	In all cases, ensure company investment objectives, policies, and standards are followed in the development and construction process.12.	Oversee and support firm-wide commitment to National’s Sustainability Policy and best practices where feasible by incorporating environmental, social and governance dimensions into daily business activities and decision-making.13.	Demonstrate commitment to and abide by National’s Regulatory Compliance Manual and Code of Ethics.14.	Periodic overnight travel is required on an as needed project-specific basis to attend meetings and special events.Other Duties and Responsibilities:1.	Prepare and deliver periodic (i.e., monthly, quarterly, and/or annual) development and construction reporting packages to clients, consultants, partners, etc. as appropriate. Oversee and, as necessary, create reporting packages required by third-parties (e.g., lender draw packages, etc.). 2.	Represent the company at industry organizations and important external events.  3.	Keep abreast of market news reporting, industry news, and legal issues to determine the impact and management of activities related to the project. Continue professional development as appropriate.Qualifications: 1.	Successful completion of an undergraduate degree in business with an emphasis on a real estate-related discipline such as finance, development, architecture, engineering or other construction-related field is required. A graduate degree is preferred.2.	Demonstrated history of a minimum of five years of real estate development, construction, or architecture/engineering experience in new, ground-up construction, re-development/adaptive re-use is required. Direct commercial construction or development experience and the management of retail or office development, design, and/or construction projects is strongly preferred. 3.	Excellent organization and multitasking abilities, business writing, verbal communication, interpersonal, project management and real estate-related financial analysis skills are required. Ability to communicate understanding of and articulate financial considerations, market demand, project feasibility and financing in a collaborative team environment. 4.	Familiarity with unionized construction and development trade practices and contracts including but not limited to various types of construction, architect, and consultant agreements; development agreements; permits and entitlement-related agreements and other documents commonly related to commercial real estate development and construction is preferred.5.	Experience with construction-related risk management and compliance including insurance and surety products is preferred.6.	Experience with project cost estimation, scheduling, and construction and design delivery methods is required.7.	Must have the ability to read, understand and follow construction-related documents such as work orders, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. 8.	Experience with the constructability and suitability of various types of building systems and construction methods is preferred.9.	Experience with sustainable (i.e., “green”) construction practices (e.g., LEED, GreenPoint, etc.) is required.10.	Proficiency in Adobe and Microsoft Office Suite programs such as Excel, Outlook, Word and Project is required.Work Environment: 1.	This job primarily operates in a clerical, office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones. The employee is required to occasionally walk the project and the surrounding location. The employee is frequently required to regularly sit, talk and/or hear, reach with hands and arms and occasionally balance, stoop and kneel. 2.	The position will be located in the same metropolitan area as a project to which the incumbent will be assigned.  One or more additional projects may also be assigned to the incumbent which may be located in a different, though relatively proximate, metropolitan area. In this case, regular travel, possibly including overnight travel, may be required.  Periodic overnight travel to National Development’s offices in Washington, DC will also be required in order to attend staff meetings and other events. The work environment and physical demand characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions and nothing in this herein restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  The employee in this position will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at National will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. National does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

146.desc: Elementary Special Education TeacherGrade Level:	Elementary (K1 – 6) Start Date: 	August 2016Locations: 	Lawrence, Springfield, and Boston, MAAbout UP Education NetworkUP Education Network manages and operates five schools in Boston and Lawrence, MA. We serve 2,600 elementary and middle school students. UP is invited by local school districts to restart chronically underperforming district schools as UP Academies. Each UP Academy shares the same mission: to ensure that students acquire the knowledge, skills, and strength of character necessary to succeed on the path to college and to achieve their full potential. In fall 2016, UP will launch its sixth turnaround school in Springfield, MA as a part of the Springfield Empowerment Zone Partnership.Teaching at UP Education NetworkTeachers hold primary responsibility for the development of curriculum, the instruction of content, and, most importantly, the success of UP Academy’s students. At UP, your career is shaped by:•	Opportunities for immediate impact: UP offers a chance to bring best practices found in high-performing schools to students previously enrolled in struggling schools, and to rapidly unlock the potential of these students.•	Talented, mission-driven colleagues: Our staff is enthusiastic, dedicated, and willing to do “whatever it takes” to put every student on the path to college.•	Collaboration and teamwork: Staff members collaborate and work closely together on grade-level or content area teams, using data to track student performance as well as guide instructional practice.  •	Consistent professional growth and development: Members of our staff typically have bi-weekly check-in meetings with their managers where they receive targeted coaching and support.  Additionally, the entire staff participates in weekly professional development sessions during the school year, kick-started by extensive training in August.   Desired Skills and Characteristics of an UP Teacher:•	A passionate belief in UP Academy’s mission, values, and educational model; •	A deep desire to work with educationally underserved student populations and their families;•	An unwavering commitment to the academic success and personal development of our students;•	An eagerness to set ambitious, challenging, and tangible goals, and a relentless drive to achieve them; •	An ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a capacity to remain calm and focused when faced with unexpected challenges; •	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including strong public speaking skills; •	A sense of humility; Compensation:We offer a competitive compensation package including comprehensive health benefits.  We encourage applicants of diverse backgrounds to apply for any open position in which they feel qualified. We believe that we have a responsibility to recruit, retain, develop, and reward a diverse and talented staff. Our students must be exposed on a daily basis to a diverse group of powerful role models - in their teachers, their school leaders, and their supporters in the network office. With this in mind, we are committed to recruiting the most talented individuals from the widest possible range of backgrounds to join our creative, mission-driven team.

151.desc: Organization OverviewDoorways to Dreams (D2D) Fund is a nonprofit organization that works to improve the economic well-being of millions of financially vulnerable American consumers through innovation.  D2D generates practical ideas for financial products, services and policies; pilot tests its ideas; and pursues scale strategies to reach millions of households.  Examples of nationally-recognized D2D innovations include: Financial Entertainment including video games and apps, Prize-Linked Savings accounts such as Save to Win, Tax Time Savings initiatives such as Save Your Refund.D2D has offices in Boston and Washington, DC.D2D uses a four-stage innovation process to bring policies and products to market that increase the financial security and opportunity of low- and moderate-income households.1)	Discover Ideas: Seek out and observe new consumer finance trends.2)	Design and Build Solutions: Create new consumer financial products, services, and public policies.3)	Pilot Test and Evaluate Solutions: Pilot test and evaluate the most promising ideas.4)	Drive Innovations to Scale: Provoke private and public financial system participants to scale tested concepts by offering new financial products or changing public policies or administrative rules.D2D is currently pursuing a four year goal to foster systemic change in the financial system and positively impact a half a million people.To learn more about the organization, please visit www.d2dfund.org.  Position OverviewThe Innovation Strategist plays a key role in helping D2D develop innovative financial solutions for financially vulnerable consumers. The individual will be part of an organization and team passionate about making positive, scalable impact on the financial lives of consumers. The Innovation Strategist will support multiple D2D initiatives. Responsibilities•	Coordinate projects through task management, organization and disciplined follow up. •	Employ strong interpersonal skills to support and coordinate strategic relationships with financial institutions, community groups, vendors and other critical partners.•	Contribute to the scaling of financial innovations by following industry developments, and studying relevant consumer, industry and public policy issues.•	Conduct or support original qualitative and quantitative research to inform innovation design and evaluation.  •	Creatively problem-solve and collaborate with a small, results-oriented team to effectively keep projects on track toward both short term milestones and long-term strategic objectives.•	Write both online and print communication that describes D2D’s work, supports D2D policy efforts, and promotes dissemination of D2D innovations.•	Contribute to a positive organizational culture through consistent high energy, appetite for learning, eagerness to support colleagues and engaged participation on project teams.

152.desc: LEGAL ASSISTANTDAVIS POLK & WARDWELL LLPDavis Polk & Wardwell LLP is a global law firm with over 750 lawyers and 110 legal assistants in offices in New York, Menlo Park, Washington DC, So Paulo, London, Paris, Madrid, Hong Kong, Beijing and Tokyo. Since its founding more than 160 years ago, Davis Polk has established itself as the firm of choice for major corporations and financial institutions worldwide on their most complex and often precedent-setting transactions and significant litigation matters of all kinds. Our lawyers are recognized globally among the very top practitioners in their respective fields, and our non-legal professional staff shares the same commitment to excellence and service that has long been the hallmark of our firm.	Davis Polk is currently seeking bright, energetic legal assistants to work in the New York office.  The ideal candidate must have a strong academic record, excellent organization and communication skills, a sharp eye for detail and be highly motivated and conscientious. Successful legal assistants possess a strong interest in learning and participating in ways beyond their immediate job description.Applicants seeking a position as a corporate legal assistant should address resumes, cover letters and college transcripts to Thomas J. Moratti, Manager  Corporate Legal Assistants at Thomas.Moratti@dpw.com.

153.desc: Are you ready to put your financial and public policy analysis skills to work to help the City Council shape and support local policy, pass the New York City Budget, as well as provide ongoing operational oversight over one or more City agencies?  If so, the New York City Council’s Finance Division is the place for you.  Several opportunities with the Finance Division team are available to cover major program areas including Education, Social Services, Infrastructure, and Government Operations.Key responsibilities include:•	Provide expert financial analysis and input to the City Council Committee(s) you are assigned;•	Review and monitor the budgets of city agencies. All analysts handle one or more City agencies and are responsible be tracking actual and projected agency spending and revenues, agency contractual spending and capital project planning, implementation and costs; •	Prepare reports and analyses on budget and fiscal matters for Council budget and oversight hearings; •	Staff City Council Committee task forces which prepare legislative, budget and oversight hearings, monitor agency performance, and follow a broad range of public policy issues;•	Prepare fiscal analyses for proposed legislation;•	Prepare analyses on special research questions as directed by the director and/or deputy director; •	Represent the Finance Division and Council at high level meetings and events with City agency Commissioners, union leaders and issue advocates; •	Make presentations to Council Members and staff on key budget and agency issues; and•	Advise elected officials and senior staff on budget and policy matters.

154.desc: Altshuler Berzon LLP, a San Francisco law firm specializing in public policy and union-side labor litigation, has an opening for a litigation assistant to start in June 2016.  This position must be filled by someone who is fluent in Spanish.	As our web site [www.altshulerberzon.com] details, we litigate cases of national significance in the fields of labor and employment, environmental, civil rights, constitutional, and campaign and election law.	We are looking for an entry level candidate with an outstanding record.  This would be an especially good opportunity for someone considering pursuing a career in law.  We are looking for someone with a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn.  Extraordinary attention to detail is a must.  Prior legal experience is not required.  We require a two year commitment.  A valid driver's license is strongly preferred.	The tasks involved in this position will include assisting with trial preparation, organizing and summarizing documents, research, interacting with clients, translating between English and Spanish, and administrative tasks.  	Please email your resume, cover letter, and college transcript to sbrownell@altber.com.  Please indicate your level of Spanish fluency in your cover letter.

155.desc: Open Systems Technologies is hiring energetic and motivated professionals to join our rapidly growing Philadelphia office. We are looking for fun, smart, hardworking people to help us increase our current market footprint by continuously excelling at what we do best, “Making IT Easy.” If you, or someone you know, is outgoing, driven, and has a desire to be part of successful team, we encourage you to apply!We’re seeking a college graduate with professional experience to join our team as a On boarding Associate in our rapidly growing Philadelphia office to support multiple Fortune 500 companies.Responsibilities:Oversee and Facilitate  the onboarding process which includes:*Tracking of requirements*Client, Internal & Legal requirements*Distribution & collection of New Hire paperwork*Facilitate the I-9 process*Compliance*Organized collection of data to include each hire's status*Escalation and timely follow up on client issues*Distribution & timely follow up of BG and Drug tests

156.desc: Alcoa is currently seeking highly motivated and energetic team members to join our Management Consulting and Strategy (MCS) - Operations Team as an Operations Engagement Manager in Pittsburgh, PA or New York, NY. The Management Consulting and Strategy (MCS) group is Alcoa’s internal strategy consulting group. We are accountable for partnering with business leaders to guide and lead implementation of Alcoa's three strategic priorities, as defined by the CEO and the Executive Council, to drive profitable growth throughout Alcoa. The MCS Operations Team delivers sustainable operational transformations through disciplined execution of lean manufacturing, automation strategies, reliability excellence (REX), and operations management systems.To complete our mission effectively, we:* Create insights into Alcoa’s business operations through fact-based shop floor analysis* Develop and prioritize actionable solutions to improve operational productivity and equipment reliability working closely with Alcoa business units (BUs) locations and corporate resource units (RUs)* Establish sustainable management systems and key metrics that align business objectives with shop-floor executionRoles and Responsibilities:The MCS Operations Engagement Manager is a senior position reporting directly to a member of the MCS Leadership Team. The role has high-visibility involving interactions with leadership. As an Engagement Manager, you will have the opportunity to lead project teams to solve Alcoa’s most significant operational issues. With high-level guidance from a project director, you will plan and lead project implementation working with a team of MCS operations consultants and analysts in partnership with business unit clients. Through your projects, you will manage a team that:* Develops first-hand knowledge of Alcoa’s critical operations and equipment reliability on the shop floor* Performs operational assessments to develop insights and improvement hypotheses* Prioritizes opportunities and develop action plans to achieve best-in-class performance* Creates and delivers engaging and informative presentations to align leadership* Recommends and implements practical solutions working directly with clients to drive productivity improvementsThroughout, you will demonstrate strong problem-solving, communication, project management and people-management skills. As the project team leader, your ability to coach, provide candid and timely feedback, and develop others to work as a high-performing team is essential.Project engagements typically last 3-6 months and you will typically be assigned to one engagement at a time. Travel to operating locations, typically 4 days per week, is expected. While there may be short breaks between projects, you should expect to spend the majority of your time away from your home base.Learning and Development:When you join the MCS Operations Team, you are joining a group that will challenge you and invest heavily in your professional development. MCS leadership adopts interactive development programs with monthly training focused on strategy, leadership, project management and Alcoa-specific organizational topics. MCS also organizes se mi-annual offsite training and development functions that engage the entire team.Career Path:The Engagement Manager position is a launching point for a rewarding and challenging career at Alcoa. The MCS Operations Team is the natural starting point because of its unique vantage point delivering projects that focus on operational excellence throughout all of Alcoa’s businesses.As an, team members will take one of two paths forward:* Assume a key role in an Alcoa business unit that aligns with your career aspirations and skill sets* Directly advance to an Operations Project Director role within MCS

157.company: New York City Economic Development Corporation
157.position: Project Manager - Technology Desk, Industry Transformation Teams
157.desc: Position Overview:The Industry Transformation Teams (ITT) department at NYCEDC seeks to understand the rapidly-changing landscape of NYC's key economic sectors and to develop and implement innovative policy initiatives that address specific challenges and opportunities in these sectors. ITT has eight current focus areas: industrial/advanced manufacturing, international affairs, healthcare/life science, sustainability/urban innovation, income mobility, fashion, social capital, and technology. The Technology Desk works to make NYC the most attractive place for tech companies to start, grow, and thrive. The team serves as an advocate, catalyst, and convener for the NYC tech ecosystem, assisting new ventures and existing companies with their formation and growth in NYC while ensuring that the benefits and opportunities created by the sector are accessible to all New Yorkers. Tech initiatives have focused on key sector priorities such as improving access to fast, reliable, and affordable internet service, increasing the availability of affordable and flexible workspace for early-stage ventures, connecting technical talent with hiring NYC firms, strengthening connections and networks within the NYC tech community, and more. As technology becomes increasingly ubiquitous, the team seeks to apply and leverage it to unlock unique opportunities within NYC's other industries. New initiatives in these hybrid fields may include those focused on fin-tech, edu-tech, real estate tech, civic-tech, and more. A critical member of the team, the Project Manager's responsibilities include understanding emerging trends and strategic priorities in all of these industries, implementing creative initiatives to address these trends and priorities, and maintaining on-going relationships with many key industry stakeholders. Project Managers drive initiative execution and coordinate project teams involving multiple public and private stakeholders. In addition, they conduct analyses, undertake primary and secondary research, develop presentations for internal and external audiences, and occasionally represent the City at events with external stakeholders and clients in the industry.Responsibilities:•	Help identify key issues at the beginning of a project to develop an appropriate work plan, including project scope, timelines, specific tasks to be completed, individual responsibilities, etc.•	Manage the execution of various workstreams (including coordinating cross-departmental or cross-agency teams) for each initiative•	Support desk efforts in client management, ongoing relationship-building and marketing in support of industry growth•	Create and deliver PowerPoint presentations that effectively communicate project recommendations and / or findings to various audiences (e.g., senior EDC staff, City Hall staff, partner agencies, external stakeholders)•	Conduct research, data gathering and analysis, and expert interviews, as and when necessaryQualifications: •	Undergraduate degree required•	2+ years of professional experience preferred (but not required), ideally in a demanding analytical/strategic environment•	Ability to manage projects against tight timelines, to prioritize among competing needs and opportunities, and to manage multiple projects at the same time•	Proactive and collaborative style; works well in teams•	Strong demonstrated written and oral communications and presentation skills•	Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills, comfort building financial models, and skill working with data sets•	Enterprising and resourceful, organized and results-oriented•	Ability to look strategically at the big picture and search for insightful, creative solutions•	Comfort interfacing with senior officials and business leaders•	Knowledge / experience in fashion industry or related fields a plus•	Demonstrated interest or experience in economic development, urban infrastructure, real estate, and/or public policy issues a plus•	New York City residence is required within 180 days of hire About the Industry Transformation Teams (ITT) Department: Industry Transformation Team (ITT) within NYCEDC's Center for Economic Transformation (CET) Division is organized around targeted industries to drive job growth, advance economic diversification, and increase economic opportunities for all New Yorkers. Teams realize these goals by identifying and implementing innovative, transformative approaches to spur economic development. Programs reflect the combined capabilities of strategy, research, and program implementation teams. About NYCEDC:New York City Economic Development Corporation is the City's primary vehicle for promoting economic growth in each of the five boroughs. NYCEDC's mission is to stimulate job growth through expansion and redevelopment programs that encourage investment, generate prosperity and strengthen the City's competitive position. NYCEDC serves as an advocate to the business community by building relationships with companies that allow them to take advantage of New York City's many opportunities. Additional information on NYCEDC can be found by visiting http://www.nycedc.com/. Our Diversity & Inclusion Mission is to attract, retain, and engage a diverse workforce comprised of talented people. Like the city of New York, NYCEDC knows our strength comes from each of our connected parts, making the fabric of our organization better and stronger because of our unique employees' talents. NYCEDC employees can expect to work as part of a highly engaged, passionate and inclusive workforce where everyone's contributions are valued, respected and make an impact on one of the best and most diverse cities in the world! The New York City Economic Development Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. NYCEDC offers excellent benefits, including company-paid 401 (a) pension plan, 457(b) tax-advantaged retirement savings plans, medical, dental and vision benefits, and discounted gym memberships and movie tickets.

158.desc: NERA Economic Consulting (www.nera.com) is a global firm of experts dedicated to applying economic, finance, and quantitative principles to complex business and legal challenges. For over half a century, NERA's economists have been creating strategies, studies, reports, expert testimony, and policy recommendations for government authorities and the world’s leading law firms and corporations. We bring academic rigor, objectivity, and real world industry experience to bear on issues arising from competition, regulation, public policy, strategy, finance, and litigation.NERA’s clients value our ability to apply and communicate state-of-the-art approaches clearly and convincingly, our commitment to deliver unbiased findings, and our reputation for quality and independence. Our clients rely on the integrity and skills of our unparalleled team of economists and other experts backed by the resources and reliability of one of the world’s largest economic consultancies. With its main office in New York City, NERA serves clients from more than 25 offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.While economics is at our core, we employ a multidisciplinary approach that includes the use of statistics, econometrics, game theory, mathematics, and computer science to apply economics to challenging issues faced by our clients in a number of areas, including antitrust and competition policy, communications, energy/environment, intellectual property, transfer pricing, and securities/finance and mass torts.  With our broad range of practices and expertise, NERA provides you with the opportunity to focus on the areas that interest you most.  Whether your passion lies in natural resource damage assessment, the protection of intellectual property rights, or navigating the credit crisis landscape, we encourage you to pursue a path that makes the most use of your talent and interests.  Responsibilities include building quantitative models; analyzing industry trends and competition; academic research; creating intuitive presentation materials for complex analysis; drafting expert reports; writing code for complex data analysis; and participating in client meetings.NERA provides a challenging and rewarding professional experience with competitive compensation and benefits.  To help meet the demands of the position, we support both personal and professional growth.  Elements of our program include a comprehensive orientation program, skill enhancement training sessions, and formal performance evaluations twice a year.  NERA’s researchers also gain tremendous learning and development opportunities by working closely with experts, clients, and senior consultants. The analytical depth of our projects, the breadth of industry exposure, and experience working in teams offer excellent preparation for researchers applying to top graduate programs in business, economics, and law, and for ensuing careers in consulting, finance, industry, and academia.

160.desc: Position Description Department:		Development Classification:		Exempt, Full-timeTitle:				Senior Construction ManagerReports To:		Director, Construction Management Location: 			Philadelphia, PADate:			February 2016Construction Manager Overview: Under the direction of the Director, Construction Management and in consultation with the development team oversee construction activities on one large project or several smaller projects.  With typically ten years’ of commercial construction experience, work closely with senior and junior level construction professionals to facilitate day-to-day project progress and to ensure construction meets standards and time frames within cost estimates.  With oversight as appropriate support contract negotiations, change order resolution and responsibility for day-to-day project progress and activities.																Essential Functions: 1.	Under the direction of the Director, Construction Management and in consultation with the project construction and development team, oversee construction activities on one large project or several smaller projects throughout the United States assisting with the implementation and execution of the development plan. Limited to provide oversight and coordination of commercial real estate professionals including contractors and consultants through construction documents and coordination of construction activities. 2.	Oversee and supervise daily construction-related activity for specific development project(s), ensuring that the construction process is adhering to National Development construction management protocol.   3.	With oversight and coordination with the project construction and development team, ensure that construction projects are completed on time and meet National Development project standards. Assist in outlining project plans, setting project goals and objectives and evaluating project performance. 4.	On a daily basis function as a liaison between the construction and development team and third-party consultants. As required, prepare and submit written project status reports. 5.	Assist in establishing preliminary construction budgets and construction schedules for specific development projects. 6.	Oversee construction-related tasks for the development team during the permitting and entitlement process.7.	Assist the Director, Construction Management with finalizing construction contracts, reviewing changes orders and other project related activities. 8.	Assist the Director, Construction Management by interfacing with National Real Estate Advisors and third-party consultants.9.	In all cases, ensure National Real Estate Development objectives, policies, procedures and standards are followed in the development and construction process. 10.	Prepare accurate and timely billable hours following policies and procedures, resolving errors and reconciling against project budgets.11.	Attend and actively contribute to regular meetings between National Development staff, clients, consultants, joint venture partners and third-party professionals related to current and planned future development activities. 12.	Demonstrate commitment to National’s Sustainability Policy and best practices where feasible by incorporating environmental, social and governance dimensions into daily business activities and decision-making.13.	Demonstrate commitment to and abide by National’s Regulatory Compliance Manual and Code of Ethics.14.	Periodic overnight travel is required on an as needed project-specific basis to attend meetings and special events.Other Duties and Responsibilities: 1.	Provide general support on National’s overall development efforts. 2.	Assist in establishing National Development sustainable building and best practices protocol. 3.	Assist with providing staff and parent company staff with training and education on critical concepts and current developments within the construction industry via informal presentations and/or written materials.4.	Keep abreast of market conditions, industry news, and industry related legal issues to determine the impact on activities related to the projects. Continue professional development as appropriate.5.	Represent the company at industry organizations and external events.  Qualifications: 1.	Successful completion of an undergraduate degree in architecture, engineering or other construction management is required. Graduate-level coursework in real estate, development, construction, or other related field is preferred. 2.	Required to have a demonstrated history of ten years of work history including field experience with increasing project responsibility with a major construction firm on varied commercial building types. Candidate must have experience with new, ground-up commercial construction.  3.	Active professional licensure in a construction-related discipline (e.g., architect, civil engineer, structural engineer, etc.) is preferred, but not required. 4.	Familiarity with unionized construction trades, concepts, policies, and procedures including experience with Project Labor Agreements, Collective Bargaining Agreements, trade jurisdictional and work rules, labor rates, etc. 5.	Experience negotiating construction and related contracts, including various types of construction agreements (GMP, Cost Plus, Stipulated Sum, AIA Forms, AGC Forms, etc.); architects agreements, and consultant agreements in related fields (structural engineering, civil engineering, geotechnical, environmental, etc.).6.	Experience with construction-related risk management and compliance including insurance and surety products.7.	Experience with project cost estimation, scheduling, and construction and design delivery methods.8.	Must have the ability to read, understand and follow construction-related documents such as work orders, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. 9.	Experience reviewing architectural plans and specifications for completeness and constructability.10.	Experience with the constructability and suitability of various types of building systems and construction methods.11.	Experience with sustainable (i.e., “green”) construction practices (e.g., LEED, GreenPoint, etc.).12.	Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Adobe and Project Management software (e.g., Microsoft Project) is required.Work Environment: 1.	This job primarily operates in a clerical, office setting. This role uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones. The employee is required to frequently walk the project and the surrounding location and may be exposed to ongoing construction and various weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment may range from moderate to loud. The employee is frequently required to regularly sit, talk and/or hear, reach with hands and arms and occasionally balance, stoop and kneel. 2.	The position will be located in the same metropolitan area as a project to which the candidate will be assigned.  One or more additional projects may also be assigned to the candidate which may be located in a different, though relatively proximate, metropolitan area. In this case, regular travel, possibly including overnight travel, may be required.  Periodic overnight travel to National Development’s offices in Washington, DC will also be required in order to attend staff meetings and other events. The work environment and physical demand characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions and nothing in this herein restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  The employee in this position will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at National will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. National does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

161.desc: Special Education TeacherGrade Level:	Middle School (6-8) Start Date: 	August 2016Locations: 	Lawrence, Springfield, and Boston, MAAbout UP Education NetworkUP Education Network manages and operates five schools in Boston and Lawrence, MA. We serve 2,600 elementary and middle school students. UP is invited by local school districts to restart chronically underperforming district schools as UP Academies. Each UP Academy shares the same mission: to ensure that students acquire the knowledge, skills, and strength of character necessary to succeed on the path to college and to achieve their full potential. In fall 2016, UP will launch its sixth turnaround school in Springfield, MA as a part of the Springfield Empowerment Zone Partnership.Teaching at UP Education NetworkTeachers hold primary responsibility for the development of curriculum, the instruction of content, and, most importantly, the success of UP Academy’s students. At UP, your career is shaped by:•	Opportunities for immediate impact: UP offers a chance to bring best practices found in high-performing schools to students previously enrolled in struggling schools, and to rapidly unlock the potential of these students.•	Talented, mission-driven colleagues: Our staff is enthusiastic, dedicated, and willing to do “whatever it takes” to put every student on the path to college.•	Collaboration and teamwork: Staff members collaborate and work closely together on grade-level or content area teams, using data to track student performance as well as guide instructional practice.  •	Consistent professional growth and development: Members of our staff typically have bi-weekly check-in meetings with their managers where they receive targeted coaching and support.  Additionally, the entire staff participates in weekly professional development sessions during the school year, kick-started by extensive training in August.   Desired Skills and Characteristics of an UP Teacher:•	A passionate belief in UP Academy’s mission, values, and educational model; •	A deep desire to work with educationally underserved student populations and their families;•	An unwavering commitment to the academic success and personal development of our students;•	An eagerness to set ambitious, challenging, and tangible goals, and a relentless drive to achieve them; •	An ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a capacity to remain calm and focused when faced with unexpected challenges; •	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including strong public speaking skills; •	A sense of humility; Compensation:We offer a competitive compensation package including comprehensive health benefits.  We encourage applicants of diverse backgrounds to apply for any open position in which they feel qualified. We believe that we have a responsibility to recruit, retain, develop, and reward a diverse and talented staff. Our students must be exposed on a daily basis to a diverse group of powerful role models - in their teachers, their school leaders, and their supporters in the network office. With this in mind, we are committed to recruiting the most talented individuals from the widest possible range of backgrounds to join our creative, mission-driven team.

162.desc: Program OverviewHigh Lantern Group (HLG) is a strategic positioning and reputation management consultancy focused on developing early-stage strategy and communications for some of the most notable brands and public and private organizations in business today.Our Summer Associates Program is a structured, competitive ten-week program. Associates will be exposed to a wide range of consulting work in the fields of strategic communications, public affairs, public policy, and business strategy. Summer Associates (SAs) will have many responsibilities, including conducting market and public policy-related research, developing client proposals and engagement strategies, constructing reports for internal and client-facing presentations, drafting client deliverables and other collateral, and assisting with administrative duties. In addition, SAs will have access to a wide-range of HLG resources to make their experience both intellectually stimulating and supportive of their career aspirations.Candidates may apply to become summer associates in any of High Lantern Groups five offices: Asheville, NC; Los Angeles, CA; New York, NY; Philadelphia, PA; or Washington, D.C. Candidates will be expected to commit to a full-time position for ten weeks, from June 13 to August 19.Desired QualificationsWe seek motivated self-starters who have experience with or an interest in strategic communications, business, politics, and public policy. College graduates (one or two years out of school) and graduate students (MBA, MPA, MPP or a related degree) studying in these fields are preferred. Undergraduates that expect to graduate after June 2017 will not be considered for this program at this time. Ideal candidates should have excellent writing, research, and communication skills, strong attention to detail, the capacity to balance multiple responsibilities, and the ability to work independently.CompensationSAs will be compensated $20/hour with the expectation of a 40-hour workweek.How to ApplyPlease apply using the button below. You are required to submit a cover letter, resume with three references, and unofficial transcript. In your cover letter, please indicate which of High Lantern Groups offices you would like to apply to and order of preference for location; applying to multiple offices is welcome. Your unofficial transcripts can be sent to summerassociate@highlanterngroup.com.Applications are due on March 18 at 5 p.m. Candidates will be notified if selected for an interview. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed. No phone calls, please. Key Dates and DeadlinesJanuary 29: Summer Associate application process opensMarch 18: Summer Associate application deadlineMay 6: Candidate selection deadlineJune 13  August 19: 10-week Summer Associate ProgramAbout High Lantern GroupHigh Lantern Group helps clients build their reputations through early-stage strategic planning, outreach to influencers and opinion leaders, compelling narratives and messages, and high-impact communications tactics. We are a new kind of consulting firm that brings decades of experience at the highest levels of business, media, government, management consulting, and CEO advisory work to the challenges facing our client companies. Organizations that want to create a compelling case for strategy, expand their influence, and shape public opinion and debate turn to us for our expertise in reputation management, thought leadership, and strategic alignment.We believe that a successful positioning strategy must be linked to the organizations purpose and objectives, and it must be done at the highest levels of the organization. Most communications and advocacy firms specialize in late-stage activities that are the most visible to the outside world. But without a proper foundation, these activities provide little leverage to build reputations, enhance relationships, or drive desired outcomes. They must be anchored to something deeper. Those who successfully position themselves do more than garner positive attention; they define public opinion and get others to follow it. This is the work of High Lantern Group.Through its affiliations with SSA & Company and the G100 group of companies, High Lantern Group operates in an ecosystem of seasoned strategic advisors spanning global industries and disciplines. Please visit our website at www.highlanterngroup.com for more information. The Asheville OfficeHigh Lantern Groups Asheville office is located in Pack Square in the heart of downtown. Our normal operating hours are 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.The Los Angeles OfficeHigh Lantern Groups Los Angeles office is located in Old Town Pasadena. Parking is provided one block from the office, which is also located two blocks from the Metro Gold Line  Memorial Park station. High Lantern Group Los Angeles normal operating hours are 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.The New York OfficeHigh Lantern Groups New York office is located in Midtown Manhattan, one block east of the Chrysler Building.  Our normal operating hours are 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.The Philadelphia OfficeHigh Lantern Groups Philadelphia office is located in Wayne, just west of Philadelphia, on the Main Line. The office is a short walk from the Wayne Regional Rail Station, which is served by the SEPTA. Our normal operating hours are 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.The Washington, D.C. OfficeHigh Lantern Groups Washington, D.C. office is located just two blocks south of Dupont Circle in the heart of the downtown area.  Our office is conveniently serviced by two Red Line Metro stops at Dupont Circle and Farragut North, each just a five-minute walk away. Our normal operating hours are 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

163.desc: This is a unique opportunity to gain experience with a fast-growing firm that is working with a range of leading impact investing institutions. The Summer Associate(s) will support client-related work, which may involve a range of issues and diverse types of institutions related to impact investing. Tideline’s team is collaborative and open, and there will be many opportunities to learn and contribute. Candidates must be based in the New York City or San Francisco areas, and will be expected to begin working in June. The primary responsibilities include:- Conducting desk research and producing related analysis- Supporting preparation of research, client, and marketing materials- Participating in brainstorming and team discussions as appropriate- Other responsibilities will be based on the candidates’ interests and experience, and may include:     - Supporting financial analysis and modeling     - Supporting communications / marketing / social media efforts     - Supporting business development efforts

164.desc: The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. We offer a collegial work environment and high-caliber colleagues from diverse backgrounds—everything from mathematicians and computer scientists to philosophers, musicians, and journalists. Our culture combines some of the best aspects of academia, finance, and technology. We pride ourselves on adhering to the highest standards of ethics and performance, but in our offices you’ll see more flip-flops than suits—we have no dress code, and our meritocratic culture gives employees the opportunity to make significant contributions early on in their careers. If you’re intellectually curious, energized by ambitious goals, and willing to take on a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you.Are you the person people turn to when they have a computer problem? Do you have a passion for tinkering with technology of all shapes and sizes?  We are looking for an exceptionally talented and conscientious technologist to join our IT/Enterprise team as a Systems Administrator, and are prepared to offer a highly attractive compensation package. The D. E. Shaw group is a global investment and technology development firm with an international reputation for financial innovation and technological leadership.  The technologist we hire will be responsible for a varied array of support and project work across a wide range of technology, including but not limited to Windows PCs and servers, UNIX servers, mobile devices, and an advanced communications infrastructure.  Responsibilities include troubleshooting a variety of complex problem reports, management of software and hardware deployments, administration of various infrastructure-level systems, and automation and efficiency improvements.   The ideal candidate will have: strong knowledge of the Microsoft Windows enterprise environment and standard applications, such as MS Office; superb organizational and time management skills, with a focus on working efficiently; and demonstrated interest in improving process and technology.  Successful team members are resourceful, with a strong ability to combine independent research, prior experience, and critical analysis to resolve unfamiliar problems and advance challenging work.  They also have great social skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills, critical to working with global colleagues across a diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. Other desirable qualifications include: familiarity with general systems administration and an understanding of what makes for good IT policy; experience with phone, deskside, and remote user support; experience with hardware and software administration; experience supporting mobile devices; familiarity with a Linux or Solaris environment; experience with Python, PowerShell, and/or other scripting languages; trade floor and/or data center support experience; familiarity with Cisco and/or Polycom communications technology; familiarity with Active Directory. In keeping with our firm's culture and the ever-changing nature of our work, we are more interested in talent, curiosity, and motivation as demonstrated by a strong history of achievement than we are in any particular skill or experience.	Interested students should apply directly through our website at: https://www.deshaw.com/recruit/jobs/Ad/UPenn/SysAdminMembers of the D. E. Shaw group do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.
