166.desc: Opt-Intelligence is a technology company based in New York City. We are the largest advertising network dedicated to opt-in advertising. Marketers use our unique technology to create multi-channel audiences through targeted online ad campaigns; website users interact with Opt-Intelligence's

167.desc: The Associate Consultant position works closely with the consulting team to provide research, portfolio analysis, and investment advice to our clients.  This position requires a unique combination of good business sense, proven qualitative and quantitative abilities, successful time management, and the ability to communicate effectively, identify tasks and priorities, and complete deliverables to company standards and deadlines.  The position reports directly to the Head of the New York Office and is located in RVK’s New York office.Job DescriptionDuties for this position will include, but are not limited to:•	Complete a variety of special projects at the request of the senior consulting team. Typical projects include: asset allocation studies, domestic/international equity and fixed income investment manager structure analyses, investment policy revisions, portfolio rebalancing, letters of instruction, etc.•	Provide day-to-day client service in support of the lead Consultant•	Execute client deliverables to high standards of quality and accuracy•	Write, edit, and proofread client communications and training materials for clients with regard to various investment topics•	Assist senior consulting team with defining key messages and use creativity in presenting ideas, recommendations and information to clients•	Possess advanced knowledge of recommended investment management firms, products, and strategies•	Review client monthly and quarterly performance deliverables•	Periodically attend meetings and present special projects and/or performance reports to clients at the request and approval of the Head of the NYO.•	Participate in internal research projects and special client assignments as needed•	Prepare ad-hoc market environment and investment research•	Play an active role in business development efforts including drafting and editing RFP responses and potentially participate in finals at the request and approval of the Head of the NYO

168.desc: Congressman Pete Olson is currently seeking ambitious students who are interested in interning in his Washington DC office during the summer of 2016. A Capitol Hill internship gives a unique opportunity to learn about the political process by working side by side with policy makers, government officials and future world leaders. Interns will assist staff with drafting constituent correspondence, attending Congressional briefings, assisting communication team efforts, analyzing Committee testimony and more. This is a full-time, unpaid internship. No matter which career field students plan to follow after graduation, this internship presents infinite opportunities for your future and career aspirations. We're looking for students with superb academic achievement and an interest in the political sphere. Students must be able to perform under pressure, carry themselves well and possess a strong writing ability. Texas ties are preferred, but not necessary. Those interested should send a resume, cover letter and a short writing sample (1-2 pages to showcase writing prowess) to Intern Coordinator Ron Hammond at Ron.Hammond@mail.house.gov.

169.position: Citi Residential Finance Group Full Time Analyst
169.desc: Company Description:As the pre-eminent global financial services company, Citi boasts over 200 million diverse clients – including some of the most influential names in the business world. The benefits of our size add up to a lot more than a collection of statistics. The proportions of our business place us in a unique and eminent position. Because – over 200 years – we’ve brought together some of the world’s most successful and diverse financial companies to form one Citi with unparalleled strength across over 100 countries in four regions: North America, EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa), Asia-Pacific and Latin America.Business Area Description: Citi's Capital Markets Origination division is comprised of over 20 different groups, many of which are hybrids between Investment Banking and Sales & Trading. This unique mix of groups drives the fixed income and equities markets by providing products and liquidity for our clients. Typical responsibilities of Capital Markets Origination includes managing overall fixed income and equity relationships as well as dialogue with corporate clients; originating, marketing, structuring and executing fixed income and equity transactions; and demonstrating ways to limit interest rate and credit risk through the use of derivatives.Program Description: The Residential Finance Group currently employs 20 mortgage finance professionals and is seeking to hire a First-Year Analyst who will have general support responsibilities for all business activities. The group focuses on all aspects of the US non-agency residential mortgage business and actively manages a portfolio of residential mortgages via execution of purchases, sales, securitizations (including re-securitizations). Additionally, the group advises clients, such as mortgage originators, banks, hedge funds, private equity firms and REITs, on optimizing their portfolios by structuring and executing securitizations, buying, selling and brokering whole loans and providing structured lines of credit. The group works closely with mortgage trading, sales, risk and the investment bank and is also a key player in the small-balance commercial and single-family rental spaces. Analyst responsibilities include:•	Residential whole loan transaction management for both the buy-side and sell-side of the business •	Preparing pitches and coordinating business development activities for current and prospective clients•	Supporting warehouse financing team to assess risk and facilitate funding transactions•	Coordinating securitization and re-securitization transactions, preparing marketing materials, working with Rating Agencies, attorneys and accounting firms, coordinating the marketing of the transaction with the trading desk and sales force and reviewing all relevant disclosure documentation•	Engaging in third-party underwritings for various issuers looking to access capital markets•	Executing daily fundings for Citi’s jumbo conduit business•	Brokering whole loan transactions between Citi affiliates and investors•	Actively participating in the evaluation of strategic initiatives and capital raises for mortgage banking clients•	Analyzing performance trends and reviewing historical executions to aid in the valuation of the existing mortgage portfolio and future purchasesQualifications: Undergraduate Degree •	Detail-oriented, self-motivated, strong work ethic, resourceful and organized•	Ability to manage multiple ongoing transactions/projects on different timetables, work under pressure and meet deadlines •	Superior Microsoft Office skills •	Strong communication and interpersonal skills requiredApplication Instructions: Candidates must apply through Citi's online application system at www.oncampus.citi.com in addition to the application process specific by your school. Please apply on Citi's website using the following parameters: •	Region: US •	Business Division: Institutional Clients Group•	Program: Full Time Analyst •	Business Area: Capital Markets Origination•	Location: New York

170.desc: About WSKG Public MediaLocated in the Southern Tier of New York State, WSKG neighbors the New York Finger Lakes’ wine region and is a short drive from New York City.  WSKG’s educational services, community engagement initiatives, television stations, radio stations, and website combined reach over 600,000 people living in a 21-county area.  With a focus on local and national news, arts, history, STEM, and youth content, WSKG is dedicated to the community it serves, and to the pursuit of innovation and excellence.  Find out more about WSKG by visiting http://www.wskg.org and searching “local content report.”  WSKG is an equal opportunity provider and employer.  Job DescriptionAs WSKG’s major gifts officer, your work will ensure that the organization’s systems and procedures support major gift cultivation and retention.  It will be the efforts you undertake planning, coordinating, and implementing major donor activities that develop donors and contributions in support of WSKG.  Under your care, accountability and compliance standards for donors and funding will be maintained.  You will report to the director of development and marketing, and work closely with development and marketing staff to enhance all aspects of fundraising.In support of the above accomplishments, you will:•	work with development staff to develop a balanced major donor strategy tailored to the needs of the organization that will enable it to attract, retain and motivate major donors;•	cultivate relationships necessary to attract and maintain major donors;•	ensure attainment of the organization’s major donor activities and goals;•	work with appropriate WSKG departments to secure information that supports fundraising efforts; •	work with the Development Committee of the Board of Trustees to facilitate the optimum interaction between trustees and major donors; and•	perform other duties and completes special projects as assigned.

171.desc: We are looking for an undergraduate/graduate student who is passionate about helping to build a non-profit organization from the ground up. If you're interested in marketing/communications/management/healthcare and are looking for a meaningful way to make a difference in people's lives while developing core professional skills 5-10 hours per week, this may be the internship for you.We are flexible on the timing and length of the internship. You will be working with the group's three board members who make up the entire staff (one of which is a Consultant with BCG and the other an investment manager at Merrill Lynch). You will have weekly/bi-weekly check-ins via Skype with at least one of us to provide a progress report. While the three of us are hands on, we have day jobs that keep us from doing as much as we'd like to. This is where you come in! This position provides a unique opportunity to drive and help determine the direction of how we build up our non-profit. Think of yourself as a co-CEO along with the Board. Aside from the flexibility this internship provides (you will largely be the one defining your role), you will get professional development feedback from the Board members and an opportunity to interact with healthcare/other professionals in the Philadelphia region.

173.position: Public Policy Summer Intern- Graduate Level
173.desc: Public Policy Summer Intern- Graduate LevelJob ID: HC20161901-98095Description: The College Board, the national educational organization, is conducting a search for Public Policy Interns at the Graduate Level. The College Board's Global Policy & Advocacy division has 2 openings in our Washington, DC office. This is a paid internship for graduate-level students.This position is based out of our Washington, DC office.Internship title: Public Policy Internship Internship timing: Early June 2016 - Early August 2016Hours per week: At least 30 hours per weekLocation: Washington, D.C. officeThis is a hourly paid internshipDescription: Are you concerned about the lack of opportunities available for many of today's low-income students and students of color? Do you want to work with a team of top national experts dedicated to tackling America's growing educational opportunity gap? If so, the College Board's Public Policy Spring Internship will offer you the chance to learn from and contribute to the College Board's ongoing efforts to deliver educational opportunities and challenge all students to own their future. . Driven by a single goal, the College Board seeks to ensure that every student has the opportunity to prepare for, enroll in, and graduate from college--particularly, low-income and underrepresented students, as well as students who are the first in their families with a chance to earn a postsecondary degree.About the Position: The Policy interns will have a unique opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment while gaining real-world experience with postsecondary policy development, policy research, and government relations. The public policy interns will play a critical role in assisting the policy teams to research, generate, and advance policy ideas that deliver opportunity for all students. The interns will focus on K-12 and/or postsecondary issues, (e.g. college readiness, college affordability, state financial aid policy).Responsibilities: The primary responsibility of the interns will be to support the education policy development team, by: •	Developing an independent culminating project focused on advancing opportunity for underrepresented students-including low-income students, students of color, and students who are the first in their families with a chance to graduate from college•	Collaborating with top national experts in postsecondary policy to develop research ideas and/or policy recommendations•	Conducting literature reviews and policy scans on issues related to college readiness, access, and success•	Attending and summarizing education-related meetings and Congressional hearings on behalf of the College Board•	Monitoring federal legislative hearings•	Analyzing quantitative and qualitative data to inform policy analysis, development, and advocacy•	Developing compelling evidence-based advocacy materials to support the College Board's advocacy efforts•	Very minimal administrative workQualifications: •	General knowledge of K-12 and/or higher education issues from a state or national level•	Demonstrated experience in examining educational challenges faced by underrepresented students.•	Applicant should fit into one of the following categories: o	Currently enrolled (or accepted) in a master's or doctoral-level program in public policy, education policy, or related discipline.o	A 2016 graduate of an undergraduate program exploring public policy or education policy graduate programs.•	Strong analytical and/or research skills•	Excellent written and oral communication skillsTo Apply: Candidates must apply online through our careers site at www.collegeboard.org/careers. Interested applicants should submit a resume, and writing statement no later than February 26, 2016. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. NO phone calls will be acceptedTo be considered candidates must submit the following documents before February 26 th •	A resume that includes your G.P.A, major and expected graduation date (you must submit your resume through our career site at https://www.collegeboard.org/about/careers/job-listings•	A writing sample (1-2 pages) submitted to publicpolicyinternship@collegeboard.org responding to the following question: If you had an opportunity to advise a presidential candidate on an important policy issue that would improve college readiness, college access and/or postsecondary success, what would it be and why? How has policy failed to address this issue in the past? The College Board is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The College Board participates in E-Verify, a service of DHS and SSA, where required. This position is subject to a background check.

174.company: City and County of San Francisco
174.desc: Applications are accepted until 3/18/16 at midnight.The mission of the program is to foster community stewardship by preparing recent college graduates for leadership roles in public service. The City and County of San Francisco is pleased to offer Fellowship positions to up to 16 individuals in this highly selective program. Fellows are full time City employees who earn an annual salary of approximately $50,000, plus comprehensive health and dental benefits.   The experience includes a weekly learning component built into the Fellows' work schedule that is designed to provide a well-rounded, thorough introduction to San Francisco government operations, in addition to supporting the development of vital workplace skills such as leadership and communication. Fellows work on projects during the program that have a direct impact on City operations that span a broad range of City functions, involving analytical, planning, and operational work.

175.desc: TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank®, offers a Summer Internship Program with an unparalleled experience – where you’ll gain valuable insight into our vision to Build The Better Bank, while also strengthening the core skills and knowledge you’ll need to launch a successful career. TD Summer Internship ExperienceOur 10 week non-rotational program consists of:•	A fun-filled, high-energy introduction to TD Bank•	A variety of professional experiences•	Professional development training•	Extensive networking opportunities•	Interaction with senior leaders•	A dedicated support network, including a formal peer-mentoring program•	An active role in community service projects  CSB Intern OpportunitiesAll opportunities will be focused on our Corporate and Specialty Banking division within TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank. The primary locations for this program are New York, Philadelphia and Boston areas.Corporate & Specialty Banking (“CSB”) is the line of Business within TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, that focuses on managing larger, more complex and diverse clients across TD’s geographical footprint and in approved out-of-footprint areas. While much commonality exists between each of these businesses, each has operating and credit risk unique to their specific products and services.Business Units Include:	-Corporate Banking	-Commercial Real Estate	-Healthcare	-Asset Based Lending	-TD Equipment FinanceAbout TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient BankTD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, is one of the 10 largest banks in the U.S., providing more than 8 million customers with a full range of retail, small business and commercial banking products and services at approximately 1,300 convenient locations throughout the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, Metro D.C., the Carolinas and Florida. In addition, TD Bank and its subsidiaries offer customized private banking and wealth management services through TD Wealth®, and vehicle financing and dealer commercial services through TD Auto Finance. TD Bank is headquartered in Cherry Hill, N.J. To learn more, visit www.tdbank.com. Find TD Bank on Facebook at www.facebook.com/TDBank and on Twitter at www.twitter.com/TDBank US.TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, is a member of TD Bank Group and a subsidiary of The Toronto-Dominion Bank of Toronto, Canada, a top 10 financial services company in North America. 176.desc: Calling All Instructors!Have you been looking to experience a new culture and take a break from the daily routine of your current position? Are you currently a graduate student who is interested in spending summer break abroad? Would you like to build off your current experience in a vibrant environment where students are eager to learn what you have to teach them? The Princeton Review Korea is looking for someone like you!Our global network and years of experience provide assurance that no other institute in Korea can offer. With our headquarters in Boston, The Princeton Review is a global organization with over 700 locations around the world. As the largest international TPR office in the world, The Princeton Review Korea (TPRK) has distinguished itself as a reliable leader in the Korean education industry.TPRK operates out of two state-of-the-art facilities in the heart of downtown Seoul. TPRK’s prime locations allow for our employees to fully experience all that Seoul has to offer.The Princeton Review Korea conducts intensive courses during June, July, and August for our Summer Intensive session. TPRK staff members are actively seeking reliable and motivated people to join our team of talented instructors. The details are provided below:Teaching the SATStarting in 2016, students will be taking the newly revised SAT, and we at TPRK will be preparing them for it. Working in our summer intensive program as an instructor will present an interesting challenge and will provide you with valuable experience. The Princeton Review is well-known for its strategic approach to “cracking” the test—and the new SAT is no exception. We have both the materials and the experience to equip you to be an effective and confident test-prep instructor. If you come willing to learn the in-and-outs of the SAT, to master the test, to become a leader in the classroom, then we will be there to help you along the way in our mission to raise students’ scores.Training Schedule:May Training: May 30 ~ June 9June Training: June 27 ~ July 7*Dates are subject to change according to summer schedule. *All candidates must receive mandatory training. Session Schedule:Option 1: June 10 ~ August 3 (June and July – 2 months)Option 2: June 10 ~ August 24 (June to August – 3 months)Option 3: July 8 ~ August 24 (July and August – 2 months)*Dates are subject to change*Option 2 and 3 only opened to candidates that are able to teach SAT and other Subjects.Required Documents: Must have the following documents prior to May 2016 - Original Diploma *Notarized with an apostille - Nationwide Criminal Background Check *Notarized with an apostilleCompensation:Instructor will be paid 25,000KRW an hour. Instructors can work up to 40 hours a week and make up to 4,000,000KRW per month and 12,000,000KRW for three months of work.Employee Benefits-	TPRK’s professional teacher training-	Continental breakfast on teaching days -	Weekly reward for best teachers -	Monthly teachers’ appreciation trip -	Airfare & housing support -	Welcome bag and TPRK Uniform-	New teachers’ settlement support programAirfare Reimbursement:The Princeton Review Korea will provide overseas instructors with economy class airfare into Seoul, Korea, from an agreed upon international airport and from Seoul to an agreed upon international airport upon completion of the contract based on the following criteria:1.	Roundtrip airfare reimbursement for instructors working all 3 months of the Summer Intensive Program.2.	One-way airfare reimbursement for instructors working 2 months of the Summer Intensive Program.*All airfare reimbursements will be received after successful completion of instructor’s contracted term.Housing Support:The Princeton Review Korea will provide and assist in finding housing for instructors for the duration of employment. The provided housing will be dormitory style studio apartments in the vicinity of the campus that instructors are assigned to instruct at.Over the past 18 years, TPRK has built a fun and energetic environment conducive to learning and working. The work experience gained at TPRK will provide you with benefits today and in the future as you pursue your future career goals. We truly believe that you will experience life in one of the most interesting cities in the world and we’ll even pay for you to get here!If you feel like you are reliable, responsible, self-motivated and interested in working with us, please submit an application through our website: http://recruit.tpr.co.krSincerely,The Princeton Review Korea

180.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
180.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multifamily housing finance, home improvement, rent regulation, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders. Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family-friendly policies. The Office of Professional Services (OPS) is responsible for all administrative and support services, including Human Resources, Communications and Public Information, Legal Affairs, Fair Housing, Policy Development, Competitive Procurement and Contract Management, Fiscal Planning, Accounting and Treasury Services, Facilities and Building Management Services, Internal Audit, Project Management and Information Technology Services. OPS values professionals that enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and who have the skills required to effectively plan, direct, and coordinate HCR’s wide array of support services.JOB SUMMARYUnder supervision, audits   and evaluates the safeguarding of assets, accuracy and reliability of accounting data, compliance with agency policies, procedures and regulatory requirements to protect the agency from loss through error, fraud or gross inefficiencies.Recommends improvements in internal accounting control and operating procedures. Performs special examinations at the request of management or the Audit Committee and prepares reports of such audits and reviews.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:•	Conducts or assists in reviews of internal controls to evaluate the safeguard of assets, test accuracy   and reliability of accounting data, check adherence   to agency policies, procedures and government regulations.•	Prepares or assists in the development of audit programs.   This would involve the flowcharting of the audit function, identifying strengths and weaknesses, bridging the work paper and lastly development of the audit program.•	Prepare audit work papers documenting evaluation of controls, audit tests, results and conclusions.•	Performs or assists in applying computer auditing procedures and conducting reviews of data centers.•	Consults   with   management   to   facilitate   the   implementation   of   approved   audit recommendation.•	Assist the agency's independent auditors and advises authorities in the conducting of their examinations.This job description is not intended to be all inclusive, and employee will also perform other reasonably related business duties as assigned.What we offer: •	Exciting opportunity to be part of New York’s resurgence to greatness; •	Extensive benefits package including paid leave, excellent health, dental, vision and retirement benefits; •	Promotional opportunity for dedicated professionals. TO APPLY, please send resume and cover letter to: jobopportunities@nyshcr.orgNew York State is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

181.desc: NAVIGANT (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global expert services firm dedicated to assisting clients in creating and protecting value in the face of critical business risks and opportunities.   Navigant professionals combine technical with business pragmatism in the highly regulated industries to support clients in addressing their most critical business needs.  The Company has more than 5,000 employees and a geographic presence in over 50 cities globally.  Navigant Consulting has been recognized as one of the Top 50 Management and Strategy Consulting Firms by Vault.com; as a Best Place to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); and a Top 100 Employer by Diversity Employer.  Navigant is also ranked in the Modern Healthcare list of Top 20 Healthcare Management Consulting Firms.  Visit www.navigant.com/careers.Position:	Consultant, Life Sciences AdvisoryLocations:	Boston, MA; Chicago, IL; Lawrenceville, NJ; New York, NY; San Francisco, CANavigant Life Sciences is the Life Science strategic consulting arm of the Navigant Consulting Health Care Practice. Our clients include companies in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, drug delivery and diagnostic industries. Examples of Navigant Life Science’s diverse consulting assignments include therapeutic area strategy development, product opportunity assessments, commercial strategy, business development search and evaluations, due diligence, market access strategy, new product launch planning and positioning, and payer landscape assessments.  Our clients are worldwide and range in size from start-ups to multi-nationals.    Navigant Life Science’s culture is distinguished by its collegial, team approach.  We value hard work of the highest quality and also encourage creativity, entrepreneurship, and having fun.  Responsibilities:This is a highly challenging position that draws heavily upon all of the analytical, creative, and interpersonal skills essential to effective general strategy consulting.  Consultants work with Navigant Life Science teams providing support through all aspects of project work.  Specific tasks include the following:   scheduling and conducting interviews with physicians, payers, and other thought leaders in healthcare; gathering and analyzing medical literature, healthcare market reports and databases; and participating in document writing, production, and client presentations.  Navigant encourages career development and hiring for the long term.  Consultants follow a clearly defined career path and continue to deepen their knowledge in the field of healthcare and the practice of consulting.   Travel is project dependent but averages 15 to 20 percent.  Qualifications:•	Graduating with BA/BS or MS degree between December 2015 and June 2016 and majoring in business, science, biomedical engineering, or healthcare policy and planning is preferred.•	Demonstrated interest in Life Sciences consulting•	Exhibit critical thinking, creativity, and strong oral and written communication skills•	Demonstrate superior data collection, organizational and analytical skills and a high level of motivation and initiative•	Must exhibit ability to grasp clinical and business implications of technically complex products and services.•	Must demonstrate willingness to travel and work overtime when requiredBenefitsWe offer a competitive compensation package that includes an annual incentive compensation plan, a comprehensive health insurance program, a matching 401(k) program, and employee stock purchase plan.  The Navigant is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulations.

182.desc: Your future. Made with IBM. IBM is now hiring Business Consultant – Interns.We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. The convergence of data and technology is transforming industries, society and professions. Some of these professions did not even exist before data, cloud, social and mobile. IBM Global Business Services is part of this transformation and just the place to define your career within business consulting. Join us as we make the most of these exciting times and discover what you can make of this moment. What will you make with IBM? ibm.com/careersAt IBM Global Business Services, in Commercial Sector we partner with Fortune 1000 clients to deliver real business value by:	Bringing together the world’s largest consulting practice with industry-leading research capability. 	Enriching business consulting with advanced research, analytics and technology. 	Teaming on all phases of engagement to plan, build, and implement advanced business solutions. 	Establishing new, flexible and iterative approaches that only IBM can offer through our unique combination of skills, experience and capabilities.	Leveraging the proven roadmaps and frameworks we have developed across our 17 industries. 	Applying IBM's global expertise and local capabilities through our unique global delivery network combined with our teams in over 170 countries.	Providing our clients with an integrated approach to business design and execution, turning strategies into actions.These strengths applied to business issues and opportunities give our clients not only the ability to anticipate change, but also take advantage of new possibilities.What will an IBM Consultant – Internship offer to you?	Client interaction with challenging responsibilities.	Collaboration with smart people in a dynamic team environment.	Mentorship and exceptional on the job training.	Ongoing learning and development opportunities.	Potential full-time entry-level consultant opportunities.You will also have an opportunity to learn more about Consulting by Degrees - our world-class leadership and development program!  Consulting by Degrees is designed to provide our entry-level consultants the full-spectrum of structured training, development and practical experience necessary to successfully launch and accelerate their career.Our Consultant–Interns at IBM contribute right away to top-tier clients and have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences.  Consultant-Interns work on projects that help clients integrate strategy, process, technology and information to increase effectiveness, reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value.  They can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills, work across different disciplines and move into new challenges.What do we look for in a successful IBM GBS Consultant-Intern?•	Minimum 3.2 GPA, above 3.2 strongly preferred•	Demonstrated leadership and adaptability, with willingness to readily and voluntarily take ownership of highly challenging tasks and problems, even beyond initial scope of responsibility•	Thorough and analytical, with capability to apply logic to solve problems•	Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, while maintaining focus despite conflicting demands•	Drive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve results•	Initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills•	Effective interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively with individuals, strengthening relationships to achieve win-win solutions•	Ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive manner•	A passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of viewRequired Qualifications•	Willingness and ability to travel 4 days a week (home on weekends – based on project requirements) but up to 100% travel if business and client needs require •	Reside within a reasonable commuting distance (generally 20 miles or less) of one of the following cities: Atlanta (GA), Boston (MA), Chicago (IL), Dallas (TX), Houston (TX), New York City (NY), and Philadelphia (PA)Application Procedure:In addition to submitting your resume through your Career Services Office, you must complete an online profile at http://www.ibm.com/start to Job Requisition # 21472BR. Resumes remain active in our system for six months.Want to connect with IBM Global Business Services? Please “LIKE” or Follow GBS Careers now!     Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/IBM.GBSCareers 	Twitter:  @IBM_GBSCareers Additional Information:Learn about GBS Consulting by Degrees – our world-class leadership and development for entry-level consultants:  ibm.com/start/consulting/CbDLearn about IBM GBS Strategy & Analytics consulting services at: http://www-935.ibm.com/services/us/gbs/strategy/Learn about IBM Cloud Solutions at http://www.ibm.com/cloud-computing/us/en/Learn about IBM Mobile Solutions at http://www.ibm.com/mobilefirst/us/en/IBM’s Employment Policy:IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. However, applicant eligibility for employment-authorized immigration status, temporary or permanent, will be considered. Any subsequent sponsorship for permanent residence is at the sole discretion of IBM management, and is based on job performance, contribution, and business requirements.

183.desc: Investment Banking firm seeks dynamic Analyst Intern(s) for a summer internship program running from June 2016 to August 2016. Clearsight Advisors, the only Washington, DC area based Investment Bank focused on high growth Business Services and Technology companies is looking to add at least one Analyst intern position at its Tysons Corner headquarters. The Analysts will participate as active members of the investment banking team on live client engagements, both M&A and capital raising, marketing and pitch activities, and general research projects.Clearsight will provide the interns with significant real world experience and access to a team of accomplished senior investment bankers. The Intern Program is designed to provide a mutually beneficial experience for both Clearsight and the Interns. We expect the successful individuals to actively participate in client meetings where practical. As such, they will have access to CEO’s, CFO’s, Entrepreneurs and Private Equity board members of leading high growth technology and business service companies. The interns will learn how to develop and analyze comparable companies and precedent transactions. In addition, they will actively participate in drafting Confidential Information Memorandums, conducting due diligence and helping develop active calling campaigns on behalf of both clients and Clearsight. Equally as important, the interns will lead research projects on specific market segments including Management Consulting, IT Services, Offshore BPO, Financial Technology and SaaS Solutions.We will work with the successful intern candidates to craft a mutually agreeable schedule.

184.desc: Weitz & Luxenberg, headquartered in New York City, is currently seeking entry-level Legal Assistants with demonstrated research experience and a strong academic background. This opportunity is excellent for motivated, recent or upcoming college graduates seeking to pursue a career in law. At W&L, we consider ourselves to be among the best law firms in the world at taking a client’s case and achieving the result they want. 185.desc: Do you live and breathe design, typography, color theory and composition? Do you have unique creative talents with an eye towards fresh and original marketing and design concepts? Are you a confident writer? Come work with our creative team to translate marketing and brand strategies into awesome marketing collateral. We’re looking for a Marketing & Design Intern to assist our Senior Graphic Designer, Design Associate and PR & Marketing Strategist in producing marketing materials such as brochures, maps, presentations, email campaigns, newsletters, blog posts, and much more.Candidates must have an excellent understanding of print design and a strong grasp of Adobe InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop. Successful candidates will be willing to learn quickly and will possess an upbeat, energetic, and “no task too big or too small” attitude. If you meet all of the criteria, submit your killer application to us!Company Details:MSC Retail is the curated aggregation of planners, artists, thinkers, deal-makers, restaurateurs, retail minds, analysts, and a whole lot of other trendsetters who are really good at what they love doing. While traditional brokerage is deeply embedded in our DNA, MSC Retail prides itself on creating needle-moving value that goes well beyond the real estate transaction. Founded in 1989 and headquartered in Center City, Philadelphia, with an office in New York City, MSC Retail has worked tirelessly to earn its reputation as one of the most unique, creative and innovative retail brokerage & advisory services firms in the country. We create and implement real estate concepts, strategies and solutions for the world’s leading retailers, restaurants, hotels, landlords, universities, cities, and developers.Please note: We are not a creative agency. While no knowledge of real estate is required for the internship, we are looking for someone who is not expecting an agency experience and who is interested in being immersed in our world. To get a better understanding of what we’re all about, please visit www.MSCretail.com. Internship Details:• Intern will report directly to the Senior Graphic Designer• Intern can expect to work on a variety of projects that will allow him/her to hone his/her design skills, learn about the world of commercial real estate, and gain real-world experience with an in-house creative team • Duration: 10 weeks during Summer 2016, 10-15 hrs/week; schedule is flexible• Intern must be available to work at our Center City, Philadelphia office and provide his/her own laptop with Creative Suite/Cloud

186.desc: Interested in working for a young, innovative and ambitious company in Downtown D.C.?Passionate about digital media and what it can do for businesses today?Curious about a career with international opportunities?Then keep reading!About MeltwaterFounded in Oslo in 2001 before moving our headquarters to San Francisco in 2006, Meltwater is the global leader in media intelligence, with over 1100 employees globally and 24,000 clients. Our innovative products help businesses extract insights from billions of online conversations and articles  we call it Outside Insight.Unique CultureFor over a decade, Meltwater has maintained a very unique culture, based on a foundation and belief in people and the potential they possess, regardless of experience.  Like many entrepreneurially focused companies, Meltwater employees embody the work-hard, play-hard spirit.  Whether you meet an employee from Washington, D.C., or Hong Kong, you will likely discover many similarities in terms of their achievements, focus and superior communication skills. Our office spaces are collaborative, open working environments in which team work, learning and fun are the day-to-day norms.  Each office consists of a number of small teams, ensuring that all of our employees have easy and frequent exposure to their managers and can quickly learn from those around them.Personal and Professional Growth OpportunitiesHaving a career in sales and management will build valuable business acumen, allowing you to develop very quickly in ways that few other careers offer.  Additionally, Meltwater takes a vertical approach to our management trainee program, and only promotes from within. As opposed to being jack-of-all trades and master-of-none, you will develop into a highly competent salesperson and a confident manager, who will have an inspiring group of employees that you will hire, train and develop yourself.The RoleThe International Management Program is both intense and rewarding.  It not only focuses on teamwork and culture, but also, and most importantly, has a strong emphasis on business-to-business sales in the news and social media industries.As part of the role, you will be speaking to a wide range of companies and organizations  from universities and local government departments to Fortune 500 companies. You will be responsible for the entire sales process, from prospecting to produce demonstrations to bringing clients onboard yourself  getting all of the credit for your hard work!All Meltwater managers have been developed through this program as have the majority of its executives. The program is designed to prepare each consultant for a career in management, and successful completion is required before the individual can be considered for a management position. ****Due date for applications:  11 March 2016Interview date: 15 March 2016 in Washington, D.C.First day at work: April or June 2016Contact: careers.dc@meltwater.com****Learn more about Meltwater on our website at www.meltwater.comFollow us on Twitter @meltwater or like the MeltwaterGroup page on Facebook Learn more about the Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST), our non-profit school in Accra, Ghana by visiting www.meltwater.org

187.company: City of Philadelphia, Chief Administrative Officer
187.desc: Position: Performance Management Analyst/Assistant Chief Administrative Officer, City of PhiladelphiaGeneral Position Description: The Office of the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) was created to focus on improving the way the City allocates resources, acquires goods and services, and the way it hires, trains and compensates employees. The CAO has an emphasis on improving efficiency and effectiveness across government. The Chief Administrative Officer reports directly to the Mayor. The Senior Analyst/Associate CAO will report to the Deputy CAO/Director of Performance Management who reports directly to the CAO.Performance management helps government entities use technology and data to set goals, connect stakeholders, track progress, and achieve results. By collecting and analyzing data and evidence, determining the desired outputs and outcomes, and linking data to overarching priorities, city leaders can use performance management to best administer policies and programs to the benefit of their community and residents. The performance management analyst plays a crucial role in the success of the program.The performance management analyst will carry out a variety of analytical, assessment, writing and reporting, stakeholder engagement and customer service, and administrative duties. Responsibilities:1.	Provide support in the development of a city-wide performance management system.2.	Research commonly-used performance measures and standards.3.	Develop and track performance metrics in line with the City, Mayor’s goals, and individual departmental goals and priorities, identifying trends for review.4.	Analyze department and cluster-level performance data sets. Clean data and verify data integrity and quality as needed.5.	Assist with development of departments’ strategic plans, including clear goals, aligned measures, and data collection, analysis, and reporting processes. Support departments in developing capacity to monitor the progress of goals and action items detailed in the strategic plan.6.	Manage ongoing requests for assistance from departments and coordinate performance management problem-solving. 7.	Collaborate with department-level staff to document data sets, performance management processes, data collection, and reporting requirements.8.	Develop internal and external customer surveys and performance measures as needed.9.	Write clear, concise performance reports and other print and web-based products for internal and external audiences.10.	Support the preparation and coordination of performance management meetings.11.	Track and update performance management strategies, tools, and deliverables.12.	Work closely and collaboratively within the CAO office and across all City departments and offices.13.	Support the Director of Performance Management in administration of a variety of projects.14.	Perform other related duties as assigned. QualificationsGeneral skills•	Investigative ability and intellectual curiosity•	Strong interpersonal skills with the capacity to collaborate across diverse city departments with many different groups•	Ability to explain technical subject matter to a non-technical audience•	A self-starter with flexibility to both work independently and as part of a team•	Strong communication and writing skillsTechnical/Knowledge Skills•	Proficient in data analysis techniques with an understanding of basic statistical concepts•	Fluency in Microsoft Office Suite (particularly Excel) required•	Familiarity with statistical software packages (e.g., STATA, SPSS) is a plusEducation•	Bachelor’s degree in public policy, public administration, social sciences, business, economics, finance, government or related field.To apply:Please send resume, cover letter, and a brief writing sample (3-5 pages) to:Liza M. Rodriguez, PhDDeputy CAO/Director of Performance ManagementLiza.M.Rodriguez@phila.gov.

188.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
188.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing for New Yorkers, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Working under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing and housing finance resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multi-family housing finance, home improvement, rent control, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders. Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family-friendly policies.The Office of Finance & Development manages HCR's multifamily and single family housing programs and bond offerings. HCR has been the most active housing bond issuer in the country over the past four years, issuing over $5.6 billion in tax exempt and taxable housing bonds to funds initiatives ranging in scope from mixed income rental developments to single family mortgages. Finance & Development actively engages with a range of partners including for-profit, and not for profit borrowers, municipalities, lenders, investors and other funding entities to leverage the State's Low Income Housing Tax Credits, tax exempt bonds, single family lending programs, and State funded programs. Our resources have helped finance over 22,000 affordable apartments and over 6,250 affordable homes in the past four years. Finance & Development is also responsible for implementing many of the initiatives under the Governor’s new House NY Program, an unprecedented $1 billion investment over the next five years. The Multifamily Finance unit offers financing to encourage a wide range of affordable housing, including preservation and rehabilitation of existing affordable multifamily rental housing, new construction of affordable multifamily rental housing for households of all ages, and mixed income developments, such as 80/20 projects for the creation of affordable multifamily rental housing in high-cost rental markets such as New York City. In the past two years, the Multifamily Finance unit has funded more than 50 projects that will create over 7,500 affordable housing units. Job Opportunities at New York State Homes and Community Renewal Job Summary:The Senior Underwriter will perform underwriting of construction and permanent financing for multifamily housing that utilize tax exempt and taxable bonds, tax credits, as well as a variety of housing subsidy loan sources deployed by the agency. Primary responsibility is to determine project eligibility, loan amount and appropriate structures of multifamily transactions, in accordance with the Agency's statute, regulations, and underwriting guidelines. Other duties include: structuring and underwriting the more complex transactions reviewed by the Multifamily unit, assisting the Senior Vice President and the Vice President in projects related to developing new financing structures, and attending meetings with prospective borrowers to develop new business.The position reports to the Vice President of Multifamily Finance and would assist the Vice President in daily management of the unit’s work flow and in identifying underwriting and real estate issues to be addressed as part of an on-going training program for the unit.

189.desc: NAVIGANT (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global expert services firm dedicated to assisting clients in creating and protecting value in the face of critical business risks and opportunities.   The Company has more than 5,000 employees and a geographic presence in over 50 cities globally.  Navigant Consulting has been recognized as one of the Top 50 Management and Strategy Consulting Firms by Vault.com; as a Best Place to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); and a Top 100 Employer by Diversity Employer.  Navigant is also ranked in the Modern Healthcare list of Top 20 Healthcare Management Consulting Firms.  Visit www.navigant.com/careers.Position:	Summer Associate, Life Sciences AdvisoryLocations:	Boston, MA; Chicago, IL; Lawrenceville, NJ; New York, NY; San Francisco, CANavigant Life Sciences is the Life Science strategic consulting arm of the Navigant Consulting Health Care Practice. Our clients include companies in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, drug delivery and diagnostic industries. Examples of Navigant Life Science’s diverse consulting assignments include therapeutic area strategy development, product opportunity assessments, commercial strategy, business development search and evaluations, due diligence, market access strategy, new product launch planning and positioning, and payer landscape assessments.  Our clients are worldwide and range in size from start-ups to multi-nationals.    Navigant Life Science’s culture is distinguished by its collegial, team approach.  We value hard work of the highest quality and also encourage creativity, entrepreneurship, and having fun.  Responsibilities:This position will allow the intern to develop the analytical, creative, and interpersonal skills essential to effective general strategy consulting.  Summer associates work with Navigant Life Science teams providing support through all aspects of project work.  Specific tasks include the following:   scheduling and conducting interviews with physicians, payers, and other thought leaders in healthcare; gathering and analyzing medical literature, healthcare market reports and databases; and participating in document writing, production, and client presentations.  Basic Qualifications:•	Currently completing either an undergraduate or MBA with an interest in the Life Sciences industry•	For the MBA internships, Life Science industry or strategy consulting experience is preferred•	Understanding of financials, budgets, and ability to develop quantitative models for forecasting populations/sales •	Must be able to demonstrate written and oral communication and presentation skills •	Strong project management skills are imperative for leading small teams•	Powerpoint and Excel skills are required – must be able to think graphicallyNavigant is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulations.

191.position: Teaching Artist for Asian Arts Initiative’s 2016 Summer Youth Arts Workshop
191.desc: Call for ArtistsAsian Arts Initiative’s 2016 Summer Youth Arts WorkshopPriority Deadline: February 26, 2016 Overview:Asian Arts Initiative is seeking experienced visual and/or performing artists to join our Youth Arts Workshop (YAW) Summer Program staff team. Teaching artists will work with approximately 30 youth in grades 6, 7, and 8 at our home location in Chinatown North – 1219 Vine Street, Philadelphia, PA 19107. The program will operate Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. from July 5th to August 12th. We are looking to hire lead teaching artists to work full-time (approx. 30-35 hours/week) with additional training and planning meetings prior to program start date. About this summer:Students will be exploring multi-disciplinary art techniques to define what health for their mind, body, and soul looks like visually and/or physically. Teaching artists will work collaboratively in constructing a curriculum that will allow our students of various skill levels to create/perform the theme of health to present at the end of the summer.

192.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
192.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing and housing finance resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multifamily housing finance, home improvement, rent control, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders.Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family friendly policies.The Office of Finance & Development manages HCR's multifamily and single family housing programs and bond offerings. HCR has been the most active housing bond issuer in the country over the past four years, issuing over $5.6 billion in tax exempt and taxable housing bonds to funds initiatives ranging in scope from mixed income rental developments to single family mortgages. Finance & Development actively engages with a range of partners including for-profit, and not for profit borrowers, municipalities, lenders, investors and other funding entities to leverage the State's Low Income Housing Tax Credits, tax exempt bonds, single family lending programs, and State funded programs. Our resources have helped finance over 22,000 affordable apartments and over 6,250 affordable homes in the past four years. Finance & Development is also responsible for implementing many of the initiatives under the Governor’s new House NY Program, an unprecedented $1 billion investment over the next five years.The Multifamily Finance unit offers financing to encourage a wide range of affordable housing, including preservation and rehabilitation of existing affordable multifamily rental housing, new construction of affordable multifamily rental housing for households of all ages, and mixed income developments, such as 80/20 projects for the creation of affordable multifamily rental housing in high-cost rental markets such as New York City. In the past two years, the Multifamily Finance unit has funded more than 50 projects that will create over 7,500 affordable housing units.DUTIES:The primary duty of the Underwriter is to underwrite and originate mortgages for affordable multifamily housing. This position will evaluate project feasibility and eligibility and determine loan amounts. In addition to financial and quantitative analysis, the Underwriter will assess qualitative factors such as the experience of developers, contractors and property managers. The Underwriter serves as the primary contact between HFA and its borrowers, secures necessary internal approvals and advances projects to the Credit and Policy Committee.

193.desc: Headquartered in Trevose, PA, The Alpha Companies are leading providers of payment solutions for small and medium-sized businesses across the country. Since inception in 2000, we have grown to over 4,000 clients with a presence in 49 states and have been honored as one of Inc. Magazines 500 I 5000 fastest growing companies in the country for 7 consecutive years as well as being honored in Philadelphia Business Journals Top 100 multiple times since 2007.Alpha Card Services and its affiliates are equal opportunity employers who believe in strength through diversity.We are seeking an entry to mid-level software developer with .NET web development experience to assist with the creation and maintenance of various internal and external facing business and data management applications. This position will work on-site, in Trevose, PA, on the development team, under the CTO, performing assigned tasks using contemporary Microsoft technologies including C#, MVC, and Entity Framework.Desirable & Helpful Skills: JavaScript, AJAX (jQuery, jQuery UI) Front-end web experience (Html, CSS, Responsive, Etc.) Entity Framework Domain Driven Design Dependency Injection Mobile Development Custom authentication and authorization providers Windows Communication Foundation (WCF)

194.position: 2016 BEYA STEM conference, Booth #101: Discover All You Can Achieve with a Career
194.desc: Booth #101: Discover All You Can Achieve with a Career at Northrop GrummanNorthrop Grumman is excited to participate in the BEYA STEM conference in Philadelphia! For early consideration, please apply to job requisition #16001668. A career at Northrop Grumman touches virtually everything we do. From equipment that protects our men and women in uniform, to satellites that predict climate change, our employees are huge contributors to our mission. Northrop Grumman offers a variety of challenging internship, co-op and new graduate positions in multiple disciplines. We are actively recruiting students of all grade levels and entry-level graduates for current and future business needs across our organization. We have urgent requirements for students with active Secret or Top Secret security clearances.Internship and Co-op Opportunities:-Full-time or part-time-Students must be currently enrolled in a relevant accredited college/university degree program pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or PhDNew Graduate Opportunities:-Full-time, with both direct position or rotational program options-Students must be within 12 months of their graduation date from a relevant accredited college/university degree program pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or PhDWe understand you want a career that rises above the rest: you want one that takes you places. Come discover where you can go with us at BEYA Booth #101. Well have representatives ready to answer your questions, provide advice and help get you ready for the next step: applying for a career at Northrop Grumman.Want to get a head start before BEYA? Register and submit your rsum at http://tinyurl.com/h9x55cl to let us know that youre interested in what we have to offer. Northrop Grumman has been a partner of the BEYA STEM Conference for 30 years. We look forward to this years event and continuing to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace.BEYA Career Fair DetailsFriday, February 19, 20169:00 a.m.  4:00 p.m.Saturday, February 20, 201610:00 a.m.  4:00 p.m.Pennsylvania Convention Center1101 Arch StreetPhiladelphia, PA 19107Hall: B PCC  Level 200Northrop Grumman Booth #101Please submit a resume that details the following:  -Relevant coursework pertaining to your degree-Current overall GPA -Anticipated graduation date-Security clearance status, if any-Prior relevant internship or research experienceJoin our Talent Community:LIKE NorthropGrummanCareers on FacebookFOLLOW Northrop Grumman Corporation on LinkedInFOLLOW @NG_Careers on TwitterSUBSCRIBE to our YouTube Channel: NorthropGrummanMediaDiscover more about our careers athttp://www.northropgrumman.com/Careers/Pages/default.aspxNorthrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. @2016 Northrop Grumman Corporation.
