195.desc: Description- Next Level Video is looking for a hardworking, organized individual that is not afraid of long hours and detailed work. You will gain hands on experience in Sports Production while learning and implementing skills related but not limited to; marketing, live event video production, sales and customer relations, print editing techniques and software, networking, and web development. You will work hand in hand with our staff to create and implement meaningful daily and weekly tasks as well as be given managerial responsibilities to oversee crews during events.  All training will be monitored and administered by our full time staff.  At the conclusion of this internship you will also have a live working portfolio of print, email, and video marketing.Program Features and Tasks:•	Marketing and Social Mediao	Record game footage and capture photos at each evento	Create and execute social media marketing plan for NLV including post event surveyso	Design and develop marketing graphics for weekly email campaigns and website updateso	Design on-site advertisement for products such as banners, flags, and signageo	All facets of Customer Relations including sales calls and on-site informational presence at all events•	Office and Equipment Managemento	Daily operations and metricso	Organize customer data, orders, and deliveryo	Manage all equipment including collection, storage, and rentalo	Video editing for both internal marketing projects and customer highlight reelso	Compress video footage and upload files for configuration and delivery•	Event Operationso	Coordinate and train all staff for events as a Site Supervisoro	Event set up and breakdown of equipment including cameras, scaffolds, and marketing materialo	Travel domestically for multiple eventso	On-site compression of footage o	On-site customer relations and related sales during events•	Software Execution o	Apple Compressor and Final Cut Pro Xo	Express Engineo	Adobe Suite: After Effects, Illustrator, Mocha, and Photoshopo	Microsoft Office: Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Publisher, and Word•	NXTsports Integrationo	Work collaboratively with sports company NXTsportso	Shoot, edit, and distribute in studio weekly and monthly marketing videos to support NXTsports staff with internal operations and external marketing needso	Agree to non-disclosure with all NXTsports related meetings, implementation, and marketingRequirements:•	Expectationso	Highly organized individual that can work in a team-based environment with NLV and NXTsportso	Communicate clearly and efficiently in all internal business meetings, external events, and customer related inquireso	Be accountable for personal tasks and time managemento	Report to the Philadelphia office for a minimum of 4 days Monday-Friday as well as a specified event each weekend•	2016 Summer Eventso	In addition to reporting to the office, an intern is required to work an event every weekend of the internship period o	Some events require domestic travel and hotel accommodations which will be compensated o	A list of the dates and events can be found on our website or by clicking here•	Compensation and Expected Hourso	Intern shall receive $250.00 per week paid out bi-weekly ($2,000.00 for the two-month internship period)o	Domestic travel expenses for events shall be reimbursedo	Hotel accommodations will be taken care of by NLV prior to each evento	Intern will be expected to work a minimum of 9:00am-5:00pm 4 days weekly, and both weekend dayso	Weekend work and event preparation is mandatory and will require extremely long hours o	Intern will receive a minimum of one weekday off per business weekNext Level Video works on all facets of video production.  We are committed to maintaining the quality of our footage through polished editing, sound distribution, and customer service. We are a company comprised of young, talented, and hardworking media professionals.  You are not limited by your experience- be as creative as possible.

196.desc: SnipSnap built the first app to let anyone scan a paper coupon and turn it into a mobile offer. Since we launched in 2012, we’ve become the largest consumer app in Philadelphia, with 5 million users, who have saved 250 million coupons and a half a billion. As we continue to grow, we need experienced sales and business-development professionals who can pitch new retailers and partners on our solutions. This includes, but is certainly not limited to mobile coupon campaigns, geo-targeting, behavior targeting, and enterprise coupon marketing.The ideal candidate is hardworking, focused, a quick learner and willing to take on anything that comes their way. They will immerse themselves in image recognition and visual search technology, learning the ins and outs in order to help it continue to grow. A can-do attitude and flexibility is both key, as we are a lean, fast-paced start-up at the core.Responsibilities- Size clients and industry’s to provide recommendations /solutions to business challenges through the use of professional services- Sell mobile image recognition and mobile coupon offering to larger retailers and 3rd party mobile app partners- Deliver sales presentations to prospective accounts and closing new business- Identify key decision makers in existing and potential clients- Generate 10+ new leads per week- Grow business within existing accounts by directly managing the account relationship- Ongoing follow up with client to detail satisfaction and ongoing business- Attend network events to meet with future customersQualifications- Experience selling and managing accounts- Broad knowledge of the mobile app landscape including mobile shopping apps- Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment- Excellent written and oral communication skills- Strong negotiation skills- Strong interpersonal skills- Able to work well in a team environment and is able to work independently when necessary- Must be motivated, goal oriented and persistent

197.desc: Mitra Capital LLC is a Boston-based hedge fund seeking individuals with exceptional analytical ability and drive as candidates for our Analyst position.  We are a long-short equity hedge fund with an investment strategy of analyzing management’s use of language to predict how stocks will perform on earnings.  We are looking to build on our success, including being ranked the top-performing equity market neutral fund of 2015, by expanding our team of talented individuals.  Our Analyst role provides the opportunity to join a growing firm where individual excellence makes an impact.  Our approach is based on deeply analyzing management’s choice of words and the construction of their statements to predict future company performance.  The concepts underlying our approach to finding hidden or concealed information that most investors miss in management’s speech have their roots in the Central Intelligence Agency and over a decade of proprietary investment research.  However, the process each quarter of identifying and analyzing hundreds of complex situations, where only probabilistic conclusions are possible, provides a never-ending challenge and learning process for our Analysts.

198.desc: Position:   Analyst:  Asset Management; Asset and Fund Performance Modeling and ReportingLocation:  New York CityPosition will involve assisting MD of Asset Management and MD of Investor Reporting with modeling asset and fund performance; asset and collateral reviews; cash management; quarterly and annual accounting review and  ongoing interface with accounting group.   Opportunities also to assist with underwriting new transactions.  Required skills:Superior Excel-based modeling skills (macros a plus)Some accounting background or knowledge a plusPreferred experience:1-2 years related experience or demonstrable equivalent skillsSpecific responsibilities include:-	Create and maintain fund cash flow and returns models and projections-	Initiate and track fund and corporate budgets-	Assist in preparation of investor reports, to include fund performance statistics, monthly and quarterly financial results-	Prepare investor presentations and assist with fund marketing process

199.desc: Analyst - San FranciscoApply here: http://bit.ly/206UHLoAlphaSights is seeking ambitious 2015/2016 graduates to join our client service team. If you are competitive, commercially motivated and excited about early responsibility and a steep learning curve, we’d love to hear from you.A HIGH-GROWTH COMPANYRegularly ranked as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world (The Sunday Times Fast Track 100, Crain’s List, Inc 5000), AlphaSights was founded in 2008 and now has a worldwide team of over 300 professionals based across our offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Dubai and Hong Kong.Our client service team works alongside strategy consultants, private equity, hedge funds, investors and corporate decision-makers, connecting them with handpicked industry experts who bring highly relevant knowledge to address our clients’ challenges. Through our service, we help our clients access the insights and expertise they need to decide and execute more quickly and effectively.A FRONTLINE ROLEAs a new joiner, your role is to act as the intermediary between our clients and specific industry experts. You will focus on understanding our clients' knowledge gaps and defining the relevant expertise required to fill them. You then identify, engage and qualify experts who possess that knowledge. This involves researching companies and sectors, contacting seasoned professionals and evaluating their relevance. You then connect these professionals with our clients through direct conversations and face-to-face meetings. You will be in a fast-paced, communication-intense frontline role, driven by client demand and stretch targets - you should expect to run several projects concurrently, mastering competing deadlines and fast turnaround times.A CLEAR CAREER PATHAlphaSights provides a clear path for our people to develop into confident, autonomously operating business leaders who can win new business, grow client relationships, and recruit, train and inspire colleagues. Once you excel at the core requirements of the entry-level role, you will take on additional responsibilities, including project management, relationship management, and coaching of new team members. You will receive intensive training along the core dimensions it takes to become a commercial leader, including account management, business development, negotiation, leadership, recruitment, and talent development.Read more about our career path at http://www.alphasights.com/careers/your-pathWHAT WE LOOK FOR:We look for the following features when assessing and selecting new team members:You can articulate a clear direction for your early-stage career and how AlphaSights fits with your journeyYou have the confidence to lead conversations with senior executives in diverse markets and functionsYou excel in a high-growth, high-performance environment that can be uncertain and complexYou have an infectious, positive ‘can-do’ attitude and desire to make an impactYou empathise, connect with others and build meaningful relationshipsYou get a buzz from driving results and generating revenue

200.position: Assistant Director, New York Regional Office
200.desc: Founded in 1906, AJC seeks to enhance the well-being of the Jewish people and Israel, and to advance human rights and democratic values in the United States and around the world. Among Jewish advocacy organizations, AJC is the leader in the global arena. We are known for our unparalleled access to diplomats, government officials, and faith leaders in more than 100 countries. In addition to our New York headquarters and Office of Government and International Affairs in Washington, D.C., AJC has offices across the United States and around the globe, and maintains partnerships with Jewish communities worldwide. The regional offices maintain the agency’s nationwide presence, attract leaders and donors to AJC, enhance the agency’s influence with key local, national and international decision makers and stakeholders, implement advocacy initiatives at the state/local level, establish and nurture community relationships, and serve as AJC’s eyes and ears on the ground.Major Functions:1. Assist the Director in the implementation of strategic goals and objectives in coordination with the regional board2. Provide conceptual, logistical, and organizational support for all office programs and activities3. Assist with the implementation of fundraising activities4. Assist with NYRO communication and the recruitment and development of local AJC leadershipFundraising• Assist Director, other regional staff and lay leadership with fundraising events, and soliciting lay leaders and members• Plan with Director and lay leadership major annual fundraising event, including working with honoree(s), internal and external vendors, securing venue, coordinating and mailing invitations, manage invitation list(s) and RSVPs, follow up for donations received and pledged.• Work with the Director to foster a culture of development, within the regional office lay leadership• Assist with donor cultivation• Work with vendors to create and produce invitations, programs, and other materials for fundraising• Conduct research on potential honorees and donors• Provide support to ensure that fundraising events run smoothlyProgram Development and Implementation for AJC priorities including Israel programming, Interreligious/Intergroup• Develop programs in collaboration with Director and lay leadership, implement independently and collaboratively• Manage all program logistics including securing speakers, venue and working with vendors• Manage coordination of travel arrangements for visiting speakers• Develop program budgets• Ensure programs run smoothly by overseeing all onsite functions• Create and distribute all necessary marketing materials including invitations, flyers, emails, and event programAdvocacy• Assist with advocacy efforts including monitoring legislation, outreach to community leaders, and local, state and federal officials• Represent AJC on coalitions with other groups on issues of mutual concern• Assist Director and other regional staff with AJC Global Forum outreach, recruitment, and planning of regional specific activities and advocacyCommunity Relations• Work with Director and lay leadership to establish and maintain relationships with important AJC constituencies including political, government, media, ethnic and religious groups• Represent AJC as needed at external meetings with partner agencies, the community and on boards• Establish and maintain relationships with important AJC constituencies in consultation with the Director• Stay abreast, and keep others informed, of news and analysis on issues of importance to AJC• Maintain online presence for regional office through regional website, social media and emailCommunications• Update regional office website• Create and publish newsletter• Write monthly program report highlighting regional activities• Liaise with local media sources for publication of letters to the editor/op-eds• Create action alerts and other email correspondence to engage membership and community• Develop and improve relationships with media• Manage regional photo database• Take notes at Board meetings and other meetings as assigned by Director

201.desc: Kepler Cannon is a boutique strategy consulting firm with offices in New York City, San Francisco and New Delhi. We foster a dynamic and collaborative environment, where the work is both challenging and stimulating. Our uniquely diverse team members bring multi-faceted perspectives to the table to create a highly energizing culture. At Kepler Cannon, we combine traditional proven methods of problem solving with advanced analytics to solve clients’ previously intractable problems. The challenges our clients face are limitless so our remit is wide and varied—comprising of anything from corporate strategy to process re-engineering to technology optimization.We are growing rapidly so we are always on a look out for superstars. Be part of a tight knit team with direct exposure to senior partners and clients, where you will be able to develop strong problem solving skills, travel the world to advise global 1000 clients, and build the next great consulting power house.An Associate’s primary role is to own and run with workstreams on client projects and to facilitate research, in-depth analysis, and insightful problem solving. As a core member of the project team, you will interact regularly with clients on a day-to-day basis and help them transform their business. Below are some examples of day-to-day functions an Associate should expect to perform:• Independently conduct market research including new industry trends, changes in industry structure, competitive landscape, and other topical research• In-depth industry or company level financial analysis• Leverage new problem solving techniques to build insightful new strategies• Gather, validate, and analyze critical data• Construct insightful and detailed quantitative models and uncover insights• Interview clients and industry experts (in person and over the phone) in collaboration with other team members• Create concise, easy to understand, and impactful written end products• Work collaboratively with other consultants and client team members to deliver outstanding work products

202.desc: Internship Opportunity (Availability:  Summer 2016)Organization:		American Water Works AssociationLocation:		Washington, DCDescription:  The American Water Works Association (AWWA) is Dedicated to the World’s Most Important Resource™. It provides knowledge, information and advocacy to improve the quality and supply of water in North America and beyond.  AWWA advances public health, safety and welfare by uniting efforts of the full spectrum of the water community.  AWWA’s Government Affairs Office, where this internship is located, is in Washington, DC and is minutes away from Capitol Hill, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the White House.  Those three entities (Congress, the EPA, and other executive branch agencies) are the focus of most of AWWA’s governmental affairs efforts. Staff closely coordinate their many activities through the Water Utility Council (WUC) to develop action programs to initiate, evaluate, respond and comment within the framework of Association policy, on legislative, regulatory, and other matters which directly affect water utilities.  You can read more about AWWA’s Government Affairs Office on our website. The selected candidate will have the primary responsibility of developing and executing work on one major project for the duration of the internship. The main objective of the internship is completing a project and associated paper to be submitted to Journal – AWWA for peer review and publication.  Examples of published papers from previous intern projects are listed at the end of this announcement and can be accessed in full on Journal-AWWA’s website.  The selected candidate will also attend meetings and briefings in the area to gain an understanding of the breadth of water policy issues covered by the DC Office.  The student will work with AWWA staff on a project that would best fit his or her qualifications and our priority regulatory issues such as cyanotoxins, lead and copper, disinfection by-products (DBPs), and the energy-water nexus. Potential projects ideas include the following:•	Analysis of Monitoring and Reporting Violations versus Violations of Standards – This analysis would compare the two types of violations to determine if monitoring and reporting violations are a precursor of violations of the standards.  •	Analysis of Capacity vs. Demand in the Very Large Systems – This analysis will develop case studies of the approximately 30 very large systems that serve more than one million people looking at the current system capacity vs. demand, and also the project capacity vs. demand for the system.•	A Political Map of Drinking Water in America – This analysis would identify the issues associated with drinking water regulation and legislation on a state-by-state basis with an emphasis on the top media markets of the US (potentially at a city/county level as well).  The analysis would be sufficiently detailed to help focus grassroots outreach and media actions by AWWA.  The three projects listed above are examples. Other water policy projects addressing important water sector issues such as climate change, sustainability, effectiveness of regulations, water infrastructure financing, affordability of water, water security and preparedness, the water-energy nexus, and others could be considered for the internship depending on qualifications and current drinking water policy needs.  Qualifications:•	Graduate student pursuing a Master of Science in Environmental Science, Master of Science in Environmental Engineering, and/or Master of Environmental/Public Policy preferred.  Undergraduate students that have completed at least their sophomore year will also be considered.  •	Excellent communication skills•	Experience with environmental issues preferred•	Must be able to work independently with minimal supervisionWage/Salary Information:  	Depending on qualificationsDeadline to Apply:  		5 PM ET, March 4, 2016How to Apply:  Please visit http://www.awwa.org/resources-tools/career-center/jobseeker.aspx?activeview=jobdetails&joblistingid=14003 to submit a resume and cover letter explaining why you wish to take part in this internship. Resumes submitted without the other requested information will not be considered. AWWA staff will review candidate materials and select a student for this internship. Past Drinking Water Policy Interns’ PapersMcGavisk, E., Roberson, J.A., and Seidel, C.  Using Community Economics to Compare Arsenic Compliance and Noncompliance.  Journal AWWA.  105:3:47 (March 2013).  Aubuchon, C.P., and Roberson, J.A.  Price Perception and Nonprice Controls under Conservation Rate Structures.  Journal AWWA.  104:8:33 (August 2012).  Weir, L., and Roberson, J.A.  National Compliance Costs from a Potential Revision to the Nitrate Regulation.  Journal AWWA, 103:3:44 (March 2011).Reiling, S.J., Roberson, J.A., and Cromwell. J.E.  Drinking Water Regulations: Estimated Cumulative Energy Use and Costs.  Journal AWWA, 101:3:42 (March 2009).

204.company: Conference on Asian Pacific American Leadership
204.desc: The Conference on Asian Pacific American Leadership (CAPAL) has two summer programs: (1) Internships  and (2) Scholarships. FEDERAL INTERNSHIP PROGRAM ($3500):CAPALs Federal Internship Program places undergraduate and graduate students within the federal government primarily in the Washington, DC metro area. Opportunities in regional offices throughout the U.S. are possible. Intern duties vary and may include policy or scientific research, project coordination and management, business, law, communication and more. Applicants are asked to specify their preferences on the application and those selected will be placed based on their interests and skills. These internships are suitable for students interested in government and public policy, but are open to ALL MAJORSEach CAPAL intern will be awarded a $3,000 stipend to support the successful completion of their internship plus $500 for travel reimbursement. Depending on your interests and placement, your duties could vary from policy or scientific research, project coordination and management, business, law, communication, and more. Applicants are asked to specify their preferences on the application, and those selected will be placed based on their interests and skills. Agricultural knowledge is not required. These internships are suitable for all students interested in government and public policy.-----------SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM ($3500): CAPALs Public Service Scholarship Program awards scholarships to undergraduate and graduate students who will be serving in unpaid public service internships (nonprofit or government) in the Washington, DC metro area. These scholarships are intended to enable outstanding students with leadership potential to work full-time and learn ways to influence their local communities and the AAPI community. Recipients of the scholarships are responsible for securing their own internship opportunity.The CAPAL-MAASU Public Service Scholarship will be awarded to an undergraduate student enrolled at a school that is a member of the Midwest Asian American Students Union (MAASU) or a school located in the following Midwestern states: Colorado, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, South Dakota, and Wisconsin. All eligible scholarship applicants will be considered for the CAPAL-MAASU scholarship. Email questions to: applications@capal.org For more information visit www. Capal.orgDesired Majors: All majors

205.desc: Duties and responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, the following: 	Market Research•	Gather news articles relating to commercial real estate, technology, universities, and hospitals in the following markets: Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington DC, Pittsburgh, and Southern New Jersey.  Acquisition/Management▪	Review all closed deals and OMs – enter parameters into Excel spreadsheet for Lease Comps and Sale Comps.▪	Identify potential acquisition opportunities in target markets using local real estate website, economic development websites, and CoStar:▪	Determine ownership/company.▪	Obtain contact information.▪	Scroll through public records to gather historical sale price. Leasing▪	Determine ownership/company for office buildings.▪	Create updated stacking plan using Winstack for all Philadelphia Metro office buildings.▪	Obtain contact information for decision maker (including who’s on site) – enter in database.▪	Scan all leases, LOIs, proposals, etc. into files▪	Set up tracking system to alert agents of Options, Triggers/Expiration Dates, etc. ▪	Observe agents making cold calls, canvassing, attend meetings. 206.position: Communications Consulting / Investor Relations Analyst Position
206.desc: Company Description: Stern Investor Relations, Inc. is a leading provider of investor relations services to entrepreneurial healthcare and biotechnology companies – essentially, we consult at the intersection of several exciting areas: communications, finance, healthcare and biotechnology. Our culture is similar to that of a start-up, but in an established, corporate setting – everyone has a very active, hands-on role in multiple facets of the business. We pride ourselves on being thought leaders in our field, and we are based in New York City, the center of the investment universe!We work closely with C-level executives at public and private biotech and healthcare companies in the US and internationally (Takeda, Alkermes and Alnylam are among our largest public clients; private clients include NGM, Scholar Rock and Mersana) and engage with the investment community - healthcare investors, equity research analysts and investment bankers - on behalf of our clients. In collaborating with our clients on their larger corporate strategy, we provide a range of services to achieve key investor relations goals, including effective messaging and positioning, enhancing visibility, improving institutional ownership and sell-side coverage, preparing for financings and IPOs, developing good guidance practices and managing communications around M&A, binary events and other strategic issues. Further information on our clients and capabilities may be found on our website at www.sternir.com.Job Description: Entry-level analyst at a boutique investor relations firm in NYC. •	Entry to mid-level responsibilities on dedicated client account teams•	Provide daily logistical and strategic IR support to clients•	Draft and review technical corporate communications materials•	Conduct research projects and targeting analyses•	Manage the planning and execution of roadshows, conferences, Analyst/Investor Days and other events•	Day-to-day communications with clients and the investment community •	Develop and manage company marketing materials and assist with office responsibilities and new business initiatives •	Excellent opportunity for long-term growth within the company

207.desc: Intern - Core Trading Technology Team The Core Trading Technology team provides the engineering underpinnings of the firm through a variety of services, APIs, rich clients, and web clients.  Our paid summer internships cover 10 weeks over which you will work on real production projects under the guidance of our engineers.  Interns take part in every step of the projects from client interactions, design, and prototyping through delivering a finished product.  You will be closely integrated with the team and regarded as a peer to our full time engineers.  Were a low-ego, high-performance team that thrives on building great software!About the FirmHBK Capital Management is an alternative investment firm currently managing approximately $9.5 billion in assets. The firm was founded in 1991 and employs approximately 200 individuals in Dallas, New York, London, and Charlottesville. Among the top-rated and longest-tenured hedge funds in the world, we have a refreshingly transparent and team-focused culture, low turnover, and a fun work environment.

208.desc: The D. E. Shaw group seeks talented research analysts to join its credit opportunities group during the summer of 2016. This strategy invests in high yield and distressed debt, credit driven special situations, and capital structure opportunities in the U.S. and Latin America. Responsibilities will include researching, analyzing, and performing due diligence on potential investments. A strong passion for investing, as well as a demonstrated aptitude for financial analysis and excellent communication skills are essential. The ideal candidate will have a strong record of academic achievement, be it at the undergraduate or graduate/post-graduate level. We do not expect nor require candidates to have any direct experience in this field.The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. We offer a collegial work environment and high-caliber colleagues from diverse backgrounds—everything from mathematicians and computer scientists to philosophers, musicians, and journalists. Our culture combines some of the best aspects of academia, finance, and technology. We pride ourselves on adhering to the highest standards of ethics and performance, but in our offices you’ll see more flip-flops than suits—we have no dress code, and our meritocratic culture gives employees the opportunity to make significant contributions early on in their careers. If you’re intellectually curious, energized by ambitious goals, and willing to take on a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you.	Interested students should apply directly through our website at: https://www.deshaw.com/recruit/jobs/OC/UPenn/CropInternMembers of the D. E. Shaw group do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

209.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the Role:Minted is seeking a Director, Brand Communications for our Stationery vertical to join our Brand Team. In this role, you will be a key partner in communicating the brand positioning for our stationery business working collaboratively as part of a core brand team that supports stewarding a great brand. The Director, Brand Communications will thoroughly understand the consumer in the category, help facilitate consumer research, and derive consumer insights. The role will ensure the core value proposition and positioning for a category is presented consistently across all creative content and customer touch points and ensures that business goals are met through creative strategy.  This individual will partner with the Category teams and Channel Marketers to define content strategies and then will own writing creative briefs for all marketing materials and campaigns in the category. In addition, this person will ensure consistency in messaging for that category, reviewing every customer touchpoint material for the category. The person in this role will be the filter for 100% that comes in and 100% that goes out from the creative team from a creative perspective for their category.We’re seeking a person whose experience could win them a senior brand management role in a larger company, but who appreciates working in a small team and entrepreneurial environment, in a role spanning high-level strategy to hands-on execution.As part of your cover letter, please answer the following questions:Who do you think the Minted consumer is? What do you think is important to the Minted consumer?What do you think the Minted brand stands for?Specific Responsibilities:Partner with multiple teams across the organization, including business GM, Marketing, and Merchandising, to develop a content strategy aligned with business objectives both with an annual view and a quarterly view. To do so, gain an understanding of the business to inform creative asset development including, but not limited to, seasonality, promotion timing, and key products.Develop content development requirements that will be utilized across multiple channels. Partner with CEO and Studio Director to input into asset creation planning process. Partner with the Producer and Studio Director to plan for annual, quarterly, monthly, and weekly content deliverables.Have knowledge of all creative assets being created to facilitate efficiency of asset creation and utilization.Maintain consumer and product strategy guidelines for the category in-line with guidance from the CEO and share new information with design partners.Develop a deep understanding of the consumer target, perform ongoing research, and draw out consumer insights that can inform content strategy.Facilitate qualitative and quantitative research with consumers, spanning from high level strategy (what is being asked and how) to basic execution (organizing and scheduling focus groups, and writing and building surveys directly in SurveyMonkey).Understand and use analytics to inform optimization of content, pulling learning into the briefing process and being the one to communicate this important information to design partners.Write creative briefs for all assets, building from cross-functional input, and brief the Brand Team on asset creation. Include any learning based on results or past feedback.Review assets, working closely with the design team, to ensure they are on-strategy with regard to business, consumer, and creative objectives, align with brand usage guidelines, and deliver required community requirements.

210.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the Role:Reporting to the VP Marketing, the Director of SEO is responsible for driving the company’s search engine optimization strategy and practice. You will develop creative strategies that increase Minted’s traffic and revenue from organic search. We’re seeking a creative, dynamic, and detail-obsessed SEO expert. You will lead a team of scrappy SEOs, formulate and drive our on-site and off-site SEO strategy, and act as the chief SEO advocate and explainer inside the company, educating engineers, PMs, designers, and marketers, alike in order to make Minted a world-class SEO company. You will build Minted’s SEO strategy across our burgeoning set of new ecommerce verticals, product categories, proprietary content, and user community.Specific Responsibilities:Formulate creative on-site and off-site strategies that build sustainable, scalable, white hat competitive advantages for Minted in SEOBring industry best practices into the organization by keeping abreast of the latest ideas in SEO and translating them into internal processes and strategiesAct as the chief SEO evangelist inside the company, creating internal training programs and processes that ensure that good SEO decisions are made throughout the organizationLead an SEO team that serves Minted’s multi-vertical businesses, helping each of your team members adapt your strategy to the needs of their particular categoryDesign processes and train your team to take on SEO modeling, forecasting, analytics, research, site optimization, and reporting practicesOwn and manage traffic and revenue goals from organic search for the company as a whole and for each of our major businessesDefine SEO technical roadmap for long term growthPartner with product management and engineering teams to define and write requirements

213.desc: We buy and sell estate jewelry and engagement rings in Philadelphia.  We're looking for an intern to help with the day to day operations of growing a small business.  This is an opportunity to learn the nitty gritty, unglamorous side of growing a small business.  A hands-on job in the luxury industry, our internship can prepare you for an entry level position in marketing, merchandising, luxury, or retail.Tasks include:- managing social media- reaching out to local media- researching blog posts- cataloging and photographing jewelry- listing jewelry online- ensuring compliance with local laws- creating marketing materials- researching new opportunitiesHours are flexible, but we are looking for a 1 day a week commitment at our office downtown. 214.desc: Vendor Relations Specialist - Brilliant Earth, San FranciscoBrilliant Earth is one of the fastest growing ecommerce jewelers in the world, and the leader in ethical origin fine jewelry. Founded in 2005, we have been featured in Newsweek, Glamour, the Today Show, and Martha Stewart among many other media outlets. We are a team of dedicated individuals with a common goal of creating a more sustainable, transparent, and compassionate jewelry industry.We are searching for bright and passionate people who are excited to make an impact from day one and grow with the company to take on greater responsibility over time.  We are collaborative, hard-working team players that welcome challenges and rise to any occasion.  Our open workspace in the heart of San Francisco encourages conversation and collaboration.  From cross-departmental meetings to frequent happy hours, Brilliant Earth team members bring a top notch attitude and a willingness to help each other grow.Everyone at Brilliant Earth has a voice  we want to hear yours! If you are interested in growing with Brilliant Earth, send us a resume and cover letter letting us know why you are interested in joining our mission and our team. Please include a sentence about your favorite shape of diamond.Position Overview:We are seeking a results-driven, innovative and passionate leader to serve in the role of Vendor Relations Specialist within our Operations Group for Brilliant Earth.  The primary objectives of this position are to maximize efficiency, quality, and customer experience critical to Brilliant Earths success, while developing strong vendor relationships. You will be responsible for vendor management functions within the gemstone department; managing day to day vendor relations, while maintaining strong relationships with our partners. You will be an instrumental member of our operations team, which is dedicated to delivering excellence from the time a customer places an order to the moment a customer opens their package. Join our team of committed problem solvers who are passionate about ensuring that every Brilliant Earth purchase meets the highest standards of quality and craftsmanship. The ideal person for this role thrives in fast-paced startup environments and has demonstrated an ability to be effective with finite resources.  We have a social and environmental mission at the core of our company and are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about helping us achieve our social goals, as well as our business goals.Key responsibilities include: 	Manage relationships with partners and vendors, including developing new relationships, managing day to day vendor interactions, and handling or directing escalations.	Contribute cross functionally on supply planning, purchasing, and inventory control. Continually improve purchasing with respect to the companys quality, delivery and cost objectives.	Ensure product supply chain is well developed and maintained to ensure a superior customer experience, timeliness, and a high level of efficiency.	Formulate and implement systems, policies and procedures to ensure smooth operation of business.	Coordinate and allocate tasks and resources to ensure general operations run smoothly with vendors.Specific qualifications include:	BA degree or equivalent 	Experience with vendor management required	Experience with inventory/ supply chain/ production in a product, retail, or ecommerce company preferred	Ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of personalities, from executive personnel, to our vendors and partners	Detail oriented with strong follow through and have the ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects	Highly organized with focus on execution, problem solving, and improving processes	Exhibit a sense of urgency in managing time and accomplishing tasks	Ability to think critically and adapt quickly in a flexible environment	Team player with an ability to work collaboratively	Entrepreneurial spirit  / self-starter	Strong computer skills, including knowledge of ERP/inventory systems	Interest in socially and environmentally responsible organizations and products

215.company: Kimmel Center for the Performing Arts
215.desc: Department:		Ticket PhiladelphiaReports To:		Director of Client RelationsStatus:		Exempt	Summary:The Program and Web Manager’s primary role is to manage Ticket Philadelphia’s relationships with secondary and third-party ticketing distribution partners and to maintain Ticket Philadelphia’s standard and mobile website, related mobile apps, and e-commerce website.  This position will help ensure a high level of customer service, coordinate the flow of accurate and timely information and data, and maximize marketing campaigns, and increase sales and fees. This position will also help to develop new business opportunities for Ticket Philadelphia. Essential Functions:•	Represent Ticket Philadelphia with secondary and third-party ticketing partners •	Work with Director of Client Relations and client marketing staff in the effective management of ticket inventory distributed through secondary and third-party ticketing partners •	Work with Box Office staff regarding the fulfillment of ticket orders taken through secondary and third-party ticketing partners  •	Perform all routine maintenance and site updates to www.ticketphiladelphia.org using the EpiServer content management system including modification of client graphics as needed  •	Perform all routine maintenance and site updates to Ticket Philadelphia’s mobile website and mobile apps•	Perform routine maintenance and content updates to all Ticket Philadelphia online purchase paths•	Work with IT Services staff and third-party support team to troubleshoot and resolve any failures or errors on Ticket Philadelphia’s main or mobile website or its mobile apps •	Provide relevant reports and data to clients using existing tools and reports•	Serve on the Ticket Philadelphia management team•	Learn the duties of a Patron Services Associate to fill in at that position as needed•	Work with the Director of Client Relations and Vice-President, Ticket Philadelphia in developing new business opportunities •	Serve as internal Project Manager for implementing new technologies for Ticket Philadelphia and its clients  including coordinating vendor and client calls, developing agendas, follow up on to-dos and working with a web based project management system to keep track of these duties•	Other duties as assignedEducation and Experience:•	A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree required•	Minimum of 3-5 years of arts ticketing, arts marketing, website content management and/or equivalent experience•	Prior business to business sales or customer service experience•	Experience required with Web Content Management Systems - Epi Server experience a plus•	Experience required with project management platforms.  Basecamp experience a plus.•	Experience required with bug tracking software – Jira a plus.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:•	Strong computer skills with experience in Excel, Word and database applications•	Highly detailed oriented with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment  •	Basic HTML•	Familiarity with web based ticketing systems – Tessitura a plus•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.•	Excellent team building and interpersonal skills.Environment, Physical Demands and Other Conditions:  •	Office environment•	Nights and weekends required

216.desc: Position Overview:The Project Manager will work to develop the New York City economy and make the City more business friendly by overseeing and managing real estate and financing transactions. The Project Manager may work on projects in tax incentives, bond financing, NMTC/HTC financing, or other relevant development finance tools, and will perform financial analysis and assist in developing deal structures.Responsibilities:• Administer financing transactions, including scheduling and coordinating resources of staff from other departments• Build and maintain detailed financial models of development projects• Analyze and present findings and recommendations to project teams and senior staff in written and verbal form and brief senior officials of EDC and other City agencies on the project status• Perform due diligence to get necessary information about proposals for business incentives• Advise members of the real estate and business communities about incentives and programs available in New York City and evaluate requested and offered business & development incentives• Design, research, and assist in the administration of new NYCEDC micro and small business lending programs; Using discretionary tax benefits, SIG negotiates deal structures and provides financing opportunities to foster business growth in NYC. NYCEDC's mission is to stimulate job growth through expansion and redevelopment programs that encourage investment, generate prosperity and strengthen the City's competitive position. NYCEDC serves as an advocate to the business community by building relationships with companies that allow them to take advantage of New York City's many opportunities. Additional information on NYCEDC can be found by visiting http://www.nycedc.com/.Our Diversity & Inclusion Mission is to attract, retain, and engage a diverse workforce comprised of talented people. NYCEDC employees can expect to work as part of a highly engaged, passionate and inclusive workforce where everyone's contributions are valued, respected and make an impact on one of the best and most diverse cities in the world!The New York City Economic Development Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 217.desc: The D. E. Shaw group is looking to train motivated individuals to trade and conduct research in one of a variety of systematic and fundamental investment strategies during the summer. Strong quantitative and analytical aptitude; communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills; and sensitivity to detail are essential. The ideal candidates take initiative to solve problems, possess a high level of computer literacy, and will be approaching their final year of full-time study with an impressive academic record. Direct prior experience is not required, but some exposure to financial markets is a plus.The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. We offer a collegial work environment and high-caliber colleagues from diverse backgrounds—everything from mathematicians and computer scientists to philosophers, musicians, and journalists. Our culture combines some of the best aspects of academia, finance, and technology. We pride ourselves on adhering to the highest standards of ethics and performance, but in our offices you’ll see more flip-flops than suits—we have no dress code, and our meritocratic culture gives employees the opportunity to make significant contributions early on in their careers. If you’re intellectually curious, energized by ambitious goals, and willing to take on a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you.Interested students should apply directly through our website at: https://www.deshaw.com/recruit/jobs/OC/UPennMembers of the D. E. Shaw group do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

221.position: Senior Project Manager, Bush Terminal Industrial Campus - Sunset Park
221.desc: Position Overview:Direct and work with interdisciplinary teams to develop and implement plans for the City-owned Bush Terminal Industrial Campus, located on the waterfront in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn, to further support business and quality job growth; a diverse, skilled workforce; and public access to the waterfront. The Industrial Campus is comprised of nine buildings totaling almost 1 million square feet of leasable space and the 51st Street Rail Yard, adjacent to a waterfront open space, Bush Terminal Piers Park.Responsibilities:•	Provide strategic direction and project management to facilitate comprehensive planning and development of the City-owned Bush Terminal Industrial Park. This will require both independent work and consultant management.•	Support a cross-cutting, interdisciplinary team to align leasing, planning, infrastructure investment, and real estate development.•	Define and evaluate development scenarios, based on sound planning principles and market realities.•	Develop financing and implementation strategies for interim and long-term uses.•	Build and maintain relationships with governmental and quasi-governmental entities including; real estate and business groups, civic and community organizations, and advocacy groups.•	Craft and facilitate public outreach processes.•	Represent the organization in public and professional forums. 222.desc: Harlem RBI, an award winning sports-based youth development program, is seeking dynamic, motivated individuals to serve as Summer Day Camp Group Leaders in an innovative sports and literacy-based summer program for youth in grades K-5 in East Harlem and the South Bronx, New York.  Harlem RBIs program provides youth with a full day of educational, enrichment and baseball activities designed to foster a positive learning environment, build character and reverse summer learning loss. Role & Responsibilities Collaborating with co-leaders to facilitate lesson plans that focus on helping youth build social-emotional skills in areas such as teamwork, conflict resolution and self-esteem; Serving as an assistant teacher, helping to implement daily reading activities in an innovative literacy program intended to improve reading skills and enthusiasm for reading; Coaching and organizing baseball/softball teams for teams of elementary school-aged participants; Leading recreational activities and chaperoning off-site enrichment field trips; Supervising and managing team and individual behavior at all times using positive discipline techniques and pro-active interventions to ensure the physical and emotional safety of all youth;  Participating in training, professional development and tactical meetings.The summer season commitment is from mid-June to mid-August. Service hours are generally Monday  Friday from 8:00am-5:15pm. Qualifications Must be at least 18 years of age; College-involvement: current student or graduate of a 2 or 4 year institution/vocational program; Knowledge of baseball/softball is helpful but not required; Experience working with groups of children; Passion to work in a team environment and meet high expectations for youth and staff; Ability to take initiative while maintaining confidence, flexibility and enthusiasm; Deep embodiment of Harlem RBIs organizational values of teamwork, diversity, integrity and fun.

223.desc: brEDcrumb is a Penn-founded startup.  We're a social impact mentorship platform based on shared backgrounds that provides free college admissions consulting to help underserved students attend and graduate from the best college for them.We're looking for rising Sophomores and rising  Juniors who will be in Philadelphia for the summer who are interested in helping us create economic opportunity for 1M+ underserved high school students.Our ideal candidates are interested in working for an education technology company.  We expect that students will be able to demonstrate entrepreneurial propensity, an interest in social impact, and a desire to scale a business.

224.position: Teach and Lead in San Francisco in 2016-2017
224.desc: Who We AreThe San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the seventh largest school district in California, every year serving more than 55,000 students who speak more than 44 documented languages in our 131 schools across the city of San Francisco.  We aim to provide each student with an equal opportunity to succeed by promoting intellectual growth, creativity, self-discipline, cultural and linguistic sensitivity, democratic responsibility, economic competence, and physical and mental health so that each student can achieve his or her maximum potential.  Every day in our quest to achieve this mission we place access and equity, student achievement, and accountability at the forefront of every childs education.What It Means to Work HereThe San Francisco Unified School Districts strategic plan, Impact Learning.  Impact Lives. places access and equity, student achievement, and accountability at the forefront of every childs education. The ideas and actions in the plan focus on one central idea: every child has the right to be well-educated.  SFUSD hires teachers and other credentialed professionals who are committed to delivering rigorous instruction to all students, continuous learning and improvement, creating a culturally responsive classroom environment, and building meaningful connections with families and the community.As a San Francisco public school educator, you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse group of students alongside supportive and talented colleagues.  You will be an integral part of the districts effort to ensure that every student who enrolls in our schools will graduate ready for college, career, and life. Who We WantWe want talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences, who are inspired by our mission steeped in equity, and who are motivated to unleash our childrens potential.  We want people who are strong collaborators, skilled communicators, problem solvers and who are comfortable in a community of continuous learning.SFUSD is now accepting applications for 2016-2017 and will begin hiring as early as February 2016!

225.desc: The New York City Comptroller is an independently elected official who serves as the Chief Financial Officer of the City of New York. The mission of the Office is to ensure the financial health of New York City by advising the Mayor, the City Council, and the public of the City's financial condition. The Comptroller also makes recommendations regarding City programs and operations, fiscal policies, and financial transactions. In addition, the Comptroller manages assets of the five New York City Pension Funds, performs budgetary analyses, audits City agencies, registers proposed contracts, determines credit needs, issues and sells City obligations. The Office employs a workforce of 760 professional staff which includes: accountants, auditors, attorneys, information technology specialists, economists, engineers, budget, financial and investment analysts, claim specialists and researchers in addition to administrative and support staff.Summer Internship ProgramThe Summer Internship program reflects the Comptroller’s Office commitment to provide a wide range of learning and work opportunities to students with strong interests in public service. The Comptroller’s Office welcomes the opportunity to attract a diverse group of college students to help enable a mutual exchange of knowledge, experience and service to benefit the Office as well as our interns. Assignments: Interns may be needed by a number of Bureaus throughout the Office; possible areas include: Asset Management, Accountancy, Administration, Budget, Audit, Press Office, Economic Development, Contract Administration, Public Affairs, Policy, Information Systems, Engineering, and the Office of the General Counsel. Those interested in applying for this very competitive program are encouraged to go to www.comptroller.nyc.gov to learn more about our bureaus and our missions.Qualifications: Applicants must be currently enrolled in a BA/BS, J.D. or a graduate degree program. Those who also display a deep interest and commitment to public service will be considered among the strongest candidates. Compensation: Interns will receive $12-14 (Undergraduate) and $15-$19 (Graduate) an hour for a maximum work week of 28 hours.Program Term The program period is from June 6th – August 4th. To Apply Go to Summer Internships at http://comptroller.nyc.gov/employment-opportunities-and-summer-internships/. Applications will be accepted February 1 through March 11.Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/H/V 1/15/2016

226.desc: Analyst - New YorkApply here: http://bit.ly/23vRmtJAlphaSights is seeking ambitious 2015/2016 graduates to join our client service team. If you are competitive, commercially motivated and excited about early responsibility and a steep learning curve, we’d love to hear from you.A HIGH-GROWTH COMPANYRegularly ranked as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world (The Sunday Times Fast Track 100, Crain’s List, Inc 5000), AlphaSights was founded in 2008 and now has a worldwide team of over 300 professionals based across our offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Dubai and Hong Kong.Our client service team works alongside strategy consultants, private equity, hedge funds, investors and corporate decision-makers, connecting them with handpicked industry experts who bring highly relevant knowledge to address our clients’ challenges. Through our service, we help our clients access the insights and expertise they need to decide and execute more quickly and effectively.A FRONTLINE ROLEAs a new joiner, your role is to act as the intermediary between our clients and specific industry experts. You will focus on understanding our clients' knowledge gaps and defining the relevant expertise required to fill them. You then identify, engage and qualify experts who possess that knowledge. This involves researching companies and sectors, contacting seasoned professionals and evaluating their relevance. You then connect these professionals with our clients through direct conversations and face-to-face meetings. You will be in a fast-paced, communication-intense frontline role, driven by client demand and stretch targets - you should expect to run several projects concurrently, mastering competing deadlines and fast turnaround times.A CLEAR CAREER PATHAlphaSights provides a clear path for our people to develop into confident, autonomously operating business leaders who can win new business, grow client relationships, and recruit, train and inspire colleagues. Once you excel at the core requirements of the entry-level role, you will take on additional responsibilities, including project management, relationship management, and coaching of new team members. You will receive intensive training along the core dimensions it takes to become a commercial leader, including account management, business development, negotiation, leadership, recruitment, and talent development.Read more about our career path at http://www.alphasights.com/careers/your-pathWHAT WE LOOK FOR:We look for the following features when assessing and selecting new team members:You can articulate a clear direction for your early-stage career and how AlphaSights fits with your journeyYou have the confidence to lead conversations with senior executives in diverse markets and functionsYou excel in a high-growth, high-performance environment that can be uncertain and complexYou have an infectious, positive ‘can-do’ attitude and desire to make an impactYou empathise, connect with others and build meaningful relationshipsYou get a buzz from driving results and generating revenue

227.desc: The CLMs Internship Program has more than 30 internship positions available for the summer of 2016. The program is designed for students who are interested in pursuing a career in the dynamic field of claims management. In addition to the eight-week internship with their host company, all interns will be provided an opportunity to earn their claim adjuster license through an online training program. Internships are available across the country, including New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Charlotte (NC), Chicago, Hartford, Miami, Boston and Denver.The claims management profession is a tremendous combination of legal issues, technology, analysis and management. Past interns all gave their internship high marks and said it opened them up to the multitude of career options in claims management. Many of the companies participating in this internship program intend to offer full-time employment to successful interns after their graduation.

228.desc: Bounce Exchange is a fast growing enterprise software start-up that is recognized as one of Internet Week’s Best Places to Work in NYC Tech. We created the “Behavioral Automation” market, and are known for developing our patented Exit Intent Technology that helps top internet retailers and publishers better monetize their web traffic.  We have an opening for a Digital Marketing Associate in our New York office.  If you have any interest in start-ups, e-commerce or digital marketing, this is an incredibly unique opportunity to join an accomplished team on the ground floor and help blaze the trail for future growth.You will learn more in two weeks here than you would elsewhere in two years about all facets of effective e-commerce and online marketing. 230.position: Director of Athletics, Physical Education and Leisure Studies
230.desc: Hagerstown Community College, located in Western Maryland, is accepting applications for a full-time Director of Athletics, Physical Education and Leisure Studies position.The Director is responsible for HCC's intercollegiate athletic programs.  The Director is also responsible for physical education and leisure studies programs, spanning both credit and non-credit offerings. 231.desc: Who is Talener?Talener is one of the top technology staffing firms with offices in the countrys top cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, Boston & Washington DC.  We work with startups to Fortune 500s, major media agencies and top tech organizations. Our goal is to be the best in the business, and that starts with you. We are looking for highly motivated, energetic people with the drive to learn and make money.   But, what is staffing? Staffing at Talener is an exciting opportunity to learn sales, business development, and build relationships.  You work, what we call in the staffing world, a full desk.  This means that you play matchmaker to businesses and job seekers.  You search for companies with job openings and match them with quality candidates.  You build relationships with your clients and candidates.  The more companies at which you place candidates, the more money you make!  This is an exciting sales role to build your career. Who Are We Looking For? -Recent Graduates or 1-2 years experience.-Motivated individuals who arent afraid to get out of their comfort zone.-People looking to grow within a company If you come from a competitive sports background, have studied abroad, taken a leadership role in a Greek life, or any other organization, we want to talk to you! You know what it is like to manage people, projects and events. The Position:Everyone at Talener starts as a Relationship Manager. Everyone has been in the same position, so you are never alone.  Unlike many other staffing agencies, you work on a team to fill positions so you will always have a support system.   Responsibilities include:-Contacting clients about open positions so they can use our --search services-Building a database of candidates for the open positions-Developing your business contacts and creating relationships-Making Deals! The ultimate goal is to place candidates with companies and to make money! The Offer:$40k Base + Uncapped earning potential (The more candidates you place, the more money you make!)Health & Dental Benefits- majority paid by TalenerComprehensive Training Program:  This is a sales role, and we will train you to be the best in the tech market.  Dont know anything about technology? No problem.401k Retirement PlanSubsidized Gym Membership2 Hour Lunches, four times per weekHealthy Office SnacksPre-Tax Transit BenefitsPaid Time Off/Unlimited VacationMerit Based PromotionsTeam EnvironmentSales Incentives: Paid trips, happy hours, team bonding activities, dinners, etc.  If you are driven to build relationships, arent afraid of the phone or email, and ultimately want to take control over your earning potential, then we want to hear from you! Contact Marina Star at mstar@talener.com or call  646-774-0904 to apply directly and visit our website to learn more about us: www.talener.com

232.desc: Experienced Analyst - New YorkApply here: http://bit.ly/1JIjtQbAlphaSights’ Experienced Associate Program is aimed at graduates with 1-3 years' experience gained in a different field who are now seeking to enter the business world. Whether you spent some years with Teach For America, went down the non-profit route, or spent time in the military - as long as you can clearly articulate your decision to switch into a fast-paced commercial environment, we’d love to hear from you.Individuals who join us on this scheme must possess maturity, leadership potential, and a clear sense of where their business career should take them. Upon joining, you will be thrown in the deep end and pushed to get up the commercial learning curve extremely rapidly. Associates on the scheme will be eligible for fast-track to Manager level if they demonstrate the required leadership traits and deliver outstanding commercial results.A HIGH-GROWTH COMPANYRegularly ranked as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world (The Sunday Times Fast Track 100, Crain’s List, Inc 5000), AlphaSights was founded in 2008 and now has a worldwide team of over 300 professionals based across our offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Dubai and Hong Kong.Our client service team works alongside strategy consultants, private equity, hedge funds, investors and corporate decision-makers, connecting them with handpicked industry experts who bring highly relevant knowledge to address our clients’ challenges. Through our service, we help our clients access the insights and expertise they need to decide and execute more quickly and effectively.A FRONTLINE ROLEAs a new joiner, your role is to act as the intermediary between our clients and specific industry experts. You will focus on understanding our clients' knowledge gaps and defining the relevant expertise required to fill them. You then identify, engage and qualify experts who possess that knowledge. This involves researching companies and sectors, contacting seasoned professionals and evaluating their relevance. You then connect these professionals with our clients through direct conversations and face-to-face meetings. You will be in a fast-paced, communication-intense frontline role, driven by client demand and stretch targets - you should expect to run several projects concurrently, mastering competing deadlines and fast turnaround times.A CLEAR CAREER PATHAlphaSights provides a clear path for our people to develop into confident, autonomously operating business leaders who can win new business, grow client relationships, and recruit, train and inspire colleagues. Once you excel at the core requirements of the entry-level role, you will take on additional responsibilities, including project management, relationship management, and coaching of new team members. You will receive intensive training along the core dimensions it takes to become a commercial leader, including account management, business development, negotiation, leadership, recruitment, and talent development.Read more about our career path at http://www.alphasights.com/careers/your-pathWHAT WE LOOK FOR:We look for the following features when assessing and selecting new team members:You can articulate a clear direction for your early-stage career and how AlphaSights fits with your journeyYou have the confidence to lead conversations with senior executives in diverse markets and functionsYou excel in a high-growth, high-performance environment that can be uncertain and complexYou have an infectious, positive ‘can-do’ attitude and desire to make an impactYou empathise, connect with others and build meaningful relationshipsYou get a buzz from driving results and generating revenue

233.desc: The New York City Council’s Information Technology division is looking for a talented individual who is ready to join our incredible team. Duties of the position include analyzing end-user hardware and software issues, implementing complete solutions to restore system functionality, providing timely and effective technical support to both internal and external staff, adhering to problem management and documentation practices as per Information Technology policies and procedures, supporting remote users and office locations, showing methodical and disciplined approach to problem solving. Travel to offices in the five boroughs of New York City approximately 25%.

234.desc: INVESTMENT BANKERS – Capital Markets/M&A AdvisoryBrooks, Houghton & Company, Inc., a private investment bank (FINRA member firm) established in 1989 with offices in midtown Manhattan and Connecticut.  Brooks, Houghton provides a full range of corporate finance related investment banking services to public and private middle market companies including mergers and acquisitions and capital market transactions, as well as direct investments undertaken by the firm through funds under its management.  The firm has one or more openings for senior-level corporate finance professionals able to generate new business and execute transactions with other Brooks, Houghton investment bankers.  The ideal candidates should have at least 10 years of investment banking experience including origination, structuring, raising capital, M&A advisory and analyzing financial transactions.  The firm is seeking experienced and motivated team players interested in working in a service oriented corporate finance practice, serving private middle-market companies and small cap public companies.  The location could be New York or in select circumstances other locales.Qualified candidates: please e-mail: vpatel@brookshoughton.com.          Please do not call. Websites: www.brookshoughton.com.                         www.bhcinterimfunding.com

235.desc: We are seeking qualified candidates to join our Launch Research Associate (RA) Program. The goal of the Program is to provide flexible, value-added analytical resources to support the firm’s mission of superior investment performance.  Additionally, we endeavor to develop and identify exceptional Launch RAs to build our pipeline of talented investors.  Through a series of multiple rotations, program participants will play a critical role in assisting experienced analysts and portfolio managers in conducting research and implementing their investment process.  Launch Research Associates are hired globally, domiciled out of our Boston, London, Singapore and Tokyo offices. Rotational opportunities (both short and longer term in nature) may be available between our global office locations listed above, along with our Radnor, PA location. Interested candidates should have geographic flexibility.In the first two years in the role, Launch Research Associates should expect to complete a rotation in each of the following groups:  Global Equity Portfolio Management (GEPM), Fixed Income, and Global Industry Research (GIR). Although less frequent in nature, there may also be opportunities within our Macroanalysis and Asset Allocation (AA) groups. Typically rotations are 3-12 months in length.  The duration and nature of each rotation will vary considerably based on investor needs, fit, and the participants’ skills and interests.  Examples of the nature of the work include:• Analyzing potential investment opportunities• Building and maintaining company financial spreadsheets• Modeling sophisticated financial instruments• Completing complex analytical projects• Researching macroeconomic themes• Interpreting company announcements• Attending company meetings & conferences• Developing & communicating investment ideas in spoken & written formAfter two years of rotating, participants may be placed in a longer-term (>1 year) assignment with an investment team (GEPM, Fixed Income or GIR; some opportunities may exist in AA or Macro). The total Launch Program is maximum 5 years in length.  A Launch RA’s career path during and after the five year period is based upon personal interests, individual skill and future potential to become a highly successful investor.  Many RAs may pursue graduate studies upon completion of Launch.The Program affords a unique entry-level opportunity for those individuals who are passionate about and are seeking to embark on a career in investment research and investing.  We expect new entrants to join the Program in July 2016.  At that time, there will be a Boston-based, initial in-house training curriculum focused on developing accounting, financial statement analysis, and financial modeling skills, as well as providing broad exposure to the investors and investment landscape at WMC.  Supplemental training and career coaching will be provided on a continuous basis throughout each participant’s tenure with the Program along with mentorship from experienced investors and peers.  In addition, participants will be required to pursue the CFA exam to further their financial acumen.

236.desc: Innovative young company in Center City, Philadelphia, developing Human Resources (HR) services for organizations. Help manage basic administration of innovative start-up company's office. Responsibilities include gathering business intelligence, designing new Human Resources (HR) services to help small to mid-sized companies, seeking business alliances, filing information, word processing, assisting with clerical tasks, miscellaneous office responsibilities, maintaining and reconciling contacts/records; creating news releases; other duties as assigned. Send email to padulo@verizon.net stating your career interests and capabilities; attach a CV or Resume; come for interview as scheduled.

237.desc: Marketing Internship – New York CityMyGradPad is a hybrid Real Estate Technology Company headquartered in New York City with an office in Boston as well. Our mission is to simplify every step of finding an apartment by combining innovative technology with experienced real estate agents. We specialize in marketing to college students, recent grads and young professionals. Our company is comprised of three divisions: real estate brokerage, marketing, and technology.

238.position: OLD FASHIONED ICE CREAM PARLOR HIRING (Old City
238.desc: The Franklin Fountain, Philadelphia's premiere ice cream parlor and soda fountain is now reviewing applicants for the upcoming Spring & Summer seasons!PART TIME DISHWASHERThe ideal candidate would be a self motivated multi-tasker who likes to keep active. This position demands good time management, attention to detail, high energy, and a positive attitude. Able to lift up to 50 lbs, work while standing for up to 8 hours, and navigate stairs. Weeknights and weekend availability is required (night shifts run until between 1am and 2am). Starting wage is $8.50/hr, based on experience, plus tips. PART TIME SODA JERKJob duties include:- Greeting customers, providing detailed historical and product information- Recording and preparing orders- Handling cash transactions- Inventory and restocking- General cleaning tasks- Table-clearing & DishwashingIndividuals with relevant experience and an aptitude for leadership will be considered for advancement within the company.The Franklin Fountain is open seven days a week until midnight or 1am. Please visit our website to learn more about us: www.franklinfountain.comAll qualified individuals may download an application at this link:http://shanecandies.com/apps/FranklinFountainApplicationFeb15.pdfEmail the completed application and resume to jobs @ franklinfountain.com (Please type Soda Jerk or Dishwasher in the Subject line) or hand it in person to our shop at 116 Market Street.
