239.desc: The acquisitions sales coordinator is responsible for the negotiation and final purchase of all real estate development opportunities within the Philadelphia region for Streamline Solutions.  Expected productivity is approximately four transactions monthly amounting in $1.5M in sales.  Coordinator will convey initial offers to sellers, build trust and rapport with these individuals, work with in-house developers to generate counter offers/strategies, coordinate meetings with sellers for in-person negotiations, and ultimately execute agreements of sale for the purchase of real estate.  Coordinator will also manage the transaction through to closing and will be point of contact for seller and settlement coordinator from title company.

240.company: Alliance for Ethical International Recruitment Practices
240.desc: The Alliance for Ethical International Recruitment Practices (Alliance) is a non-profit organization that aims to protect the vulnerable population of migrant professionals from exploitation.  It seeks to improve the experiences of immigrant nurses and teachers in the U.S. through its voluntary Codes of Ethical Conduct that provide best practices in recruitment.The Alliance is excited to offer an internship in the research of migration, labor and ethical practice.  This is an exciting opportunity for individuals to explore the non-profit sector.  The Alliance is a small organization, so the interns are critical pieces; yet as a division of CGFNS International Inc., the intern will get exposure to a larger non-profit organization.  Projects are designed to develop innovative methods to advance migrants’ rights in international recruitment policies.  Work streams will be determined by the Director based on the Alliance’s timeline and direction, reflecting professional development goals of the intern. Primary Duties & Responsibilities:•	Conducts research and analyzes key issues involving the intersection of immigration, health care, education and labor recruitment.•	Develops outreach strategies to educate foreign-educated professionals on their rights.•	Reviews and updates Alliance Web site and related Social Media platforms.•	Manages day-to-day operational aspects of Alliance programs.•	Drafts and reviews communication pieces for the Director.•	Actively participates in and provides support and assistance for strategic business planning and organizational development efforts.•	Prepares project reports and presentations for program and project status meetings.The duration of the summer internship is 8-12 weeks between May and August 2016.  Standard hours are 9-5.  Internship start dates and times are flexible.  (Please email to request Spring or Fall availability). This position is located at the CGFNS International, Inc. offices in the University City neighborhood in Philadelphia, PA.  Please indicate on the application whether you are interested in a full-time or part-time internship position.

241.desc: L&M Policy Research, LLC is seeking candidates for research assistant positions in Washington, D.C. L&M is a highly collaborative and collegial health services research firm with expertise in public and private health care issues. Our dedicated staff has extensive experience in qualitative and quantitative methods and provides the highest quality research to assist government and private organizations in improving health care policy and delivery, with particular focus on Medicare, Medicaid and private insurance marketplace reforms under the Affordable Care Act. Responsibilities: •	Participate in qualitative and quantitative research activities in support of health policy-related projects•	Work with project managers to ensure that work is high quality and client-ready •	Lead and support key stakeholder interviews •	Collaborate with project teams to analyze claims and survey data sets  •	Support the acquisition and handling of administrative data files including cleaning data Applicants should have an interest in domestic health policy issues and possess the following qualities and skills. Qualifications:•	Bachelor’s degree •	Capacity to work autonomously on tasks within a larger team •	Strong verbal communication and technical writing skills (e.g., reports, memos, literature reviews)•	Excellent organizational and time management skills•	Relevant experience or education and strong interest in health policy research•	Proficiency with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint •	Familiarity with data analysis software packages (such as SAS or STATA) a plusPlease send a resume, cover letter, and succinct writing sample (no phone calls please) to:Abby HoffmanResearch AssociateAHoffman@LMPolicyResearch.comwww.LMPolicyresearch.com

242.position: Senior Project Manager, Brooklyn Wholesale Meat Market - Sunset Park
242.desc: Position Overview:Direct and work with interdisciplinary teams to develop and implement plans for the City-owned Brooklyn Wholesale Meat Market (BWMM), located on the waterfront in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn, to further support business and quality job growth; and a diverse, skilled workforce. The Brooklyn Wholesale Meat Market is a 10-acre property with three buildings totaling approximately 215,000 square feet that supports a mix of meat, seafood, and food wholesalers-distributors and a food service provider.Responsibilities:* Provide strategic direction and project management to facilitate comprehensive planning and development of the Brooklyn Wholesale Meat Market (BWMM). This will require both independent work and consultant management.* Support an interdisciplinary team to align leasing, planning, infrastructure investment, and real estate development of BWMM in coordination with other City-owned industrial assets on the Sunset Park waterfront.* Define and evaluate development scenarios, based on sound planning principles and market realities.* Develop financing and implementation strategies for interim and long-term uses.* Build and maintain relationships with governmental and quasi-governmental entities including; real estate and business groups, civic and community organizations, and advocacy groups.* Craft and facilitate public outreach processes.* Represent the organization in public and professional forums. Other Responsibilities:* Other projects and tasks as assigned, including planning and development support on other City-owned industrial assets on the Sunset Park waterfront; other duties as assignedMinimum Qualifications: * Bachelor's Degree* 3 years of experience in economic or community development, planning, or equivalent.* Strong interpersonal, written, verbal and analytical skills.* Demonstrated expertise in project management.* Ability to craft and facilitate community outreach and planning processes.* New York City residence is required within 180 days of hire.Preferred Qualifications:* Master's Degree in urban planning, public policy, real estate or related field* Spanish language fluency* Strong understanding of and experience with the technical aspects of the public planning and development process, preferably specific to NYC* Demonstrated entrepreneurial and problem-solving abilities* Experience in use of spreadsheets and presentation applications, including Excel and PowerPoint.* In addition to the above, the ideal candidate would have experience with one or both of the following: capital projects, including experience in the design and construction process, or real estate development, including finance and negotiation experience.About NYCEDC:New York City Economic Development Corporation is the City's primary vehicle for promoting economic growth in each of the five boroughs. NYCEDC's mission is to stimulate job growth through expansion and redevelopment programs that encourage investment, generate prosperity and strengthen the City's competitive position. NYCEDC serves as an advocate to the business community by building relationships with companies that allow them to take advantage of New York City's many opportunities. Additional information on NYCEDC can be found by visiting http://www.nycedc.com/. Our Diversity & Inclusion Mission is to attract, retain, and engage a diverse workforce comprised of talented people. Like the city of New York, NYCEDC knows our strength comes from each of our connected parts, making the fabric of our organization better and stronger because of our unique employees' talents. NYCEDC employees can expect to work as part of a highly engaged, passionate and inclusive workforce where everyone's contributions are valued, respected and make an impact on one of the best and most diverse cities in the world!The New York City Economic Development Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. NYCEDC offers excellent benefits, including company-paid 401 (a) pension plan, 457(b) tax-advantaged retirement savings plans, medical, dental and vision benefits, and discounted gym memberships and movie tickets.

243.desc: Summer Analyst (2016 Internship), New YorkTHE COMPANYApply here: http://bit.ly/1PVbHySDigital connectivity is disrupting businesses across industries and geographies, and turning the established order upside down. As consumers, we now enjoy on-demand access to anything from taxis to cleaners and everything in between. At AlphaSights, we’re bringing the on-demand revolution to professional knowledge.We’ve established ourselves as the go-to knowledge partner for some of the largest consultancies, private equity funds, investment banks and corporations in the world, helping them access the knowledge they need to make better, more informed, investment decisions. We’re growing fast, our clients love us, and we’re a fantastic place to develop some of the most sought-after skills for the 21st century workplace.THE INTERNSHIPThis is a challenging 10-week program designed to help you develop the skills you need to succeed in business. You will gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced, commercial environment and will work on live projects from day one. Your mentor will provide you with the training and feedback you need to make an impact.KEY FEATURESInitial Training: our two-week intensive ramp-up is designed to introduce you to what we do and how we work. A combination of seminar-style sessions delivered by members of our Client Service Team and on-the-desk learning will equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to make an early impact.Project Work: throughout your time here, you will work on real client requests. Projects typically include qualitative research and communication with key industry players.Side Project: growth means constant business challenges, and this is your chance to pitch your business solution to senior management at AlphaSights. You will be encouraged to nominate your own project manager and, with guidance from AlphaSights mentors, come up with a sustainable, workable solution to a real business challenge.WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FORWe’re looking for humble and emotionally intelligent individuals with the drive and results-orientation to make things happen. In addition to these core attributes, we’re looking for passionate individuals with a “can-do” attitude, who flourish in a fast paced environment and thrive on constant challenge. You must be a team player and connect effortlessly with colleagues and industry experts alike. A business background is not essential, but successful candidates will demonstrate a clear interest in the business world and strong desire to develop their skills in this area.

244.desc: Fehr & Peers is a leading transportation planning and engineering firm interested in motivated individuals who consider themselves “transportation enthusiasts.”  We are considering engineer/planner candidates for full-time employment or internships at our offices in California (Roseville, Walnut Creek, San Francisco, San Jose, Los Angeles, Orange County, San Diego), Colorado (Denver), Utah (Salt Lake City), Washington (Seattle), and Washington D.C.Entry-level Transportation Engineer/Planners are given the opportunity to work with Senior Transportation Engineer/Planners and Associates on projects such as: transportation impact studies, bicycle/pedestrian plans, parking studies, smart growth evaluations, transit forecasting and operations studies, streetscape evaluations and design, traffic safety studies, highway interchange/corridors studies, and more.  We provide opportunities to learn cutting edge software including: VISSIM, VISUM, TransCAD, CUBE, and TP+.

245.desc: Fehr & Peers is a leading transportation planning and engineering firm interested in motivated individuals who consider themselves “transportation enthusiasts.”  We are considering engineer/planner candidates for full-time employment or internships at our offices in California (Roseville, Walnut Creek, San Francisco, San Jose, Los Angeles, Orange County, San Diego), Colorado (Denver), Utah (Salt Lake City), Washington (Seattle), and Washington D.C.Entry-level Transportation Engineer/Planners are given the opportunity to work with Senior Transportation Engineer/Planners and Associates on projects such as: transportation impact studies, bicycle/pedestrian plans, parking studies, smart growth evaluations, transit forecasting and operations studies, streetscape evaluations and design, traffic safety studies, highway interchange/corridors studies, and more.  We provide opportunities to learn cutting edge software including: VISSIM, VISUM, TransCAD, CUBE, and TP+.Our interns take on similar tasks and responsibilities as a full-time entry-level staff. Internships are available for the semester, summer, or year.

246.desc: Tutor Corps - Urban Education FellowshipAs a member of the Great Oaks Tutor Corps, you will mentor and tutor middle and high school students at a Great Oaks Charter School for the duration of one school year (August 2016-June 2017).  This is service role with regular full-time hours Monday-Friday with some tutors participating in Saturday Academy as well. At Great Oaks, around half of our tutors are members of the AmeriCorps National Service Network which provides additional benefits.The ideal candidate is a bright, talented college graduate interested in committing a year of service. Great Oaks has schools in Newark, NJ, New York, NY, Bridgeport, CT and Wilmington, DE, and is seeking tutors for all sites. The Tutor Corps plays an integral role in helping our schools achieve their mission: to prepare students to succeed in college. Great Oaks is seeking individuals who are motivated, enthusiastic and up for one of the most rewarding challenges of their lives.Responsibilities You will invest your time and energy in the success of a small group of middle or high school students to help pave the way to college success. The majority of students enter Great Oaks several years below grade level, so this role requires hard work, creativity and a dedication to helping students beat the odds. Most of your day will be spent tutoring students one-on-one or in small groups. You will also take on secondary projects, based on a passion or skill you have, such as coaching teams, leading clubs, assisting with operations or supporting teachers in the classroom. Specific responsibilities include:Bolstering student achievement:*Provide daily tutoring to several small groups of Great Oaks students*Work closely with teachers to develop individualized tutorial content*Assess student progress on a regular basisBuilding relationships with families:*Develop authentic relationships with families through weekly phone calls and updates*Attend all family and parent events*Create opportunities to connect with families on an ongoing basisSupporting the successful operation of your school:*Perform secondary duties such as assisting teachers and administrators, supporting staff and student recruitment, and leading clubs*Assist with school operations throughout the day including monitoring hallways and stairwells, supervising student lunch and assisting with other activitiesQualifications and CompetenciesAs a prerequisite, the successful candidate must believe in the mission of Great Oaks. The candidate should demonstrate a passion for breaking new ground to lead social change. A successful candidate will also bring the following qualifications and competencies: *A strong academic record with a Bachelors degree from a competitive college or university*Experience working with students; tutoring experience preferable*Exceptional ability to respond well to feedback and implement it immediately*Tenacity, adaptability, passion and excellent communication skills

247.position: U.S. Associate - Internal Audit Loan Review
247.desc: Job Description:   Credit Agricole Corporate & Investment Bank's Internal Audit department is seeking a recent graduate that has experience in the Financial Industry.  The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong initiative, able to work under pressure and have an understanding of banking and capital markets.The U.S. Associate program offers an opportunity for recent college graduates interested in finance and investment banking to actively participate in this fast-paced and challenging industry.  We provide our U.S. Associates with the tools necessary for professional growth and career advancement. The U.S. Associate experience fosters the opportunity to connect with people who can help guide you career.The U.S. Associate position will be available for a maximum of 2 years.  The goal of the U.S. Associate program is to develop the ideal candidate into a potential full-time position at the end of the two years.Department Mission:Within CA-CIB Americas Internal audit, the Loan Review Unit is responsible for ensuring an independent review of the credit portfolio (Structured Finance, Corporate Loans, Trade Finance etc.) booked in the US Branches of CACIB on a timely basis. This review covers the quality and completeness of the credit analysis done in the underwriting of the loan, the risk rating assigned to the loan and the adequacy and consistency of the supporting legal documentation in accordance with the credit approvals and the Risk Policies and Procedures of CACIB.  The department generates reports to CA-CIB USA Management and RPC (Risk & Permanent Control)as well as Internal Audit Management in New York and Paris.Reporting:Member of Loan Review Internal Audit team, reporting locally to the Head of Loan Review – USA -Internal Audit department in NY which is overseen by the Head of Internal Audit Americas.Position Description:The individual will assist in implementation of the annually defined loan review program by collecting, organizing and filing the data necessary for the Loan Review Analysts to review the portfolio.  This includes searching data from external sources on markets, industries and the companies to be analysed, downloading internal information from the various CA-CIB systems including the loan accounting system, the legal document system(LEGOS) the covenant monitoring system(COSMOS), the loan closing system (Galaxy), the risk rating system (the models) and the credit review system).  The associate will also prepare charts, graphs and summaries of information to be included in the reports.  The individual will work closely with the Loan Review Analysts and under the direction of the Head of Loan Review. The individual is expected to work in close collaboration with all Internal Audit teams in accordance with matrix responsibility in order to leverage functional expertise from other areas in the audit department to assist in timely delivery of the Internal Audit plan and Regulatory Requirements.- Obtain information from both the front office and external sources- Participate in the Internal Audit credit risk review portion of the loan review process following the steps to conduct a loan review and obtain information for the process- Participate in audit review of the internal risk assignment in accordance with the rating matrix guidelines (Anadefi data entry verification), confirmation that covenants have been entered into the system accurately, confirm that covenant calculations are accurate, verify that the systems reflect the approved amounts to the correct legal entities.- Assist in documenting the Loan Review Program and Analysis, in a traceable way.- Assist the Head of Credit Audit with collecting information to respond to both internal and external auditors (Regulatory & Bank auditors) during exams.

248.desc: IntroductionThe Greysteel Company is a leading commercial real estate and capital markets services firm with offices nationwide.  Greysteel serves as trusted advisor to middle-market multifamily and retail developers, owners, and investors in investment sale, debt placement, and structured finance transactions.  We are seeking candidates with integrity and passion to join a growing platform of the best commercial real estate advisors in the industry.   Everything Greysteel does is guided by a set of principles that define our character and culture as we deliver the right team, the right solution, the right way.Job OpportunitiesResponsibilities for candidates include every element of client/deal development and execution.  Applicants should have well-developed analytical /problem solving capabilities, written and oral communication skills, consistent attention-to-detail, and advanced knowledge of real estate investment transactions.  Candidates must be capable of high activity project management.Philadelphia, PA OfficeCapital Markets Associate: product/area of focusMultifamily: debt placement and structured finance Retail: debt placement and structured financeResponsibilities -	Originate and manage marketing, negotiation, and closing of real estate debt placement or structured finance assignments on behalf of middle-market multifamily or retail property owners.-	Develop and nurture relationships with private and institutional developers, owners, investors, lenders, and service providers to promote the Greysteel platform.-	Contribute to Greysteel’s proprietary database by submitting notes regarding investor or lender investment objectives or programs.-	Monitor market activity on a daily basis and maintain a database of sales comparable(s) by utilizing platform tools and subscriptions.-	Conduct competitive rental surveys by calling and visiting properties when underwriting investment sales in order to determine market value and debt placement, or to determine investment returns for structured finance transactions.-	Prepare proposals and memoranda featuring customized economic, market, and area overviews, as well as site level specifics.-	Use Greysteel’s financial modeling tools, including but not limited to Argus and MS Excel based discounted cash flow models to analyze and project debt/equity sensitivity.-	Read, review, and summarize real estate documents (i.e. leases, operating statements, tax returns, environmental and engineering reports, appraisals).-	Facilitate and manage due diligence processes.-	Lead and participate in proposals and presentations.This is a commissioned position.Greysteel Company is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet. © The Greysteel Company LLC, 2015.  All rights reserved.

Greysteel serves as trusted advisor to middle-market multifamily and retail developers, owners, and investors in investment sale, debt placement, and structured finance transactions.  We are seeking candidates with integrity and passion to join a growing platform of the best commercial real estate advisors in the industry. Candidates must be capable of high activity project management.Philadelphia, PA OfficeInvestment Sales Associate: product/area of focusMultifamily: urban infill, suburban and tertiary market multifamily properties Retail: urban infill, shopping center (anchored, unanchored) and net lease propertiesResponsibilities -	Originate and manage marketing, negotiation, and closing of real estate investment sale on behalf of middle-market multifamily or retail property owners.-	Develop and nurture relationships with private and institutional developers, owners, and service providers to promote the Greysteel platform.-	Contribute to Greysteel’s proprietary database by submitting notes regarding investor or lender investment objectives or programs.-	Monitor market activity on a daily basis and maintain a database of sales comparable(s) by utilizing platform tools and subscriptions.-	Conduct competitive rental surveys by calling and visiting properties when underwriting investment sales in order to determine market value.-	Prepare proposals and memoranda featuring customized economic, market, and area overviews, as well as site level specifics.-	Use Greysteel’s financial modeling tools, including but not limited to Argus and MS Excel based discounted cash flow models to analyze and project sale price.-	Read, review, and summarize real estate documents (i.e. leases, operating statements, tax returns, environmental and engineering reports, appraisals).-	Facilitate and manage due diligence processes.-	Lead and participate in proposals and presentations.This is a commissioned position.Greysteel Company is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet. © The Greysteel Company LLC, 2015. 250.position: Senior Associate, Technical Assistance, Pew-MacArthur Results First Initiative
250.desc: The Pew Charitable Trusts is driven by the power of knowledge to solve today's most challenging problems. Pew applies a rigorous, analytical approach to improve public policy, inform the public and invigorate civic life.We are an independent nonprofit organization – the sole beneficiary of seven individual trusts established between 1948 and 1979 by two sons and two daughters of Sun Oil Company founder Joseph N. Pew and his wife, Mary Anderson Pew.Our work lays the foundation for effective policy solutions by informing and engaging citizens, linking diverse interests to pursue common cause and insisting on tangible results. Our projects encourage efficient, responsive governments – at the local, state, national and international levels – serving the best interests of the people. We partner with a diverse range of donors, public and private organizations and concerned citizens who share our interest in fact-based solutions and goal-driven investments to improve society.With offices in Philadelphia, Washington, DC, Brussels and London and staff in other regions of the United States as well as Australia, Pew provides an exciting learning environment and the opportunity to work with highly talented individuals. We are a dynamic, rapidly evolving organization that values creativity and innovative thinking and fosters strong teamwork with mutual respect.Government PerformanceGovernment Performance (GP), an internal operating division of The Pew Charitable Trusts, identifies and advances effective policy approaches to critical issues. It researches emerging topics, develops data-driven reports, and highlights innovative approaches to complex problems. When the facts are clear, GP advocates for nonpartisan, pragmatic solutions.GP initiatives focuses on six areas: (1) strengthening the economic well-being of America's families; (2) promoting fiscal health at the state, federal and local levels; (3) advancing innovative, data-driven state policy in targeted areas, such as corrections, elections, and children's dental health; (4) ensuring a safe food supply; (5) encouraging safety and innovation in drugs and medical devices; and (6) fostering cutting-edge biomedical research. GP makes use of the basic tools required to help explore and advance effective policies, regardless of the issue: credible, timely, and user-friendly research; assessments of public support for change; strategic outreach and dissemination to ensure that good information is widely communicated to decision-makers, media, influential stakeholders, and the public; the capacity to bring together diverse perspectives and find common ground; and the ability to identify and apply approaches that have proven successful elsewhere.Position OverviewThe Senior Associate, Technical Assistance, Pew-MacArthur Results First Initiative (Results First), will provide intensive technical assistance to selected states and local governments that are implementing and using the Results First approach and tools, including the Results First cost-benefit model. The Senior Associate will also support the ongoing development and refinement of the Results First cost-benefit model, contribute to the design and execution of related evidence-based tools, and collaborate closely with internal colleagues and external partners to advance project goals. This position, based in Pew's Washington, DC office, will report to the Manager, Tool Development, Results First, and will be hired for an initial period through December 31, 2018 with the possibility of renewal pending the success of the program, funding sources and board decisions on continued support.•	Build the capacity of selected states and local governments to implement the Results First approach and tools in a variety of policy areas, including adult criminal and juvenile justice, child welfare, health care, education, mental health, public health, and substance abuse. This work will be done through a combination of onsite visits, phone calls, emails and webinars. Specific tasks include:o	Give presentations and webinars to prospective and current participating state and local governments explaining the three main components of the Results First technical approach: compiling a program inventory, matching programs to the evidence base, and populating and using the benefit-cost model.o	Assist jurisdictions in creating a list of the programs they currently fund in a specific policy area and collecting the following information on each: brief description, length, frequency, budget, setting, and capacity.o	Help jurisdictions use tools developed by Results First to determine whether there is any evidence on the effectiveness of these programs.o	Assess the availability and quality of jurisdictions' data for the benefit-cost model.o	Help participating governments populate the benefit-cost model with jurisdictions-specific data on marginal costs, populations served, resource usage, and deaths attributed to substance abuse and mental health disorders.o	Work closely with participating governmental staff to tailor the benefit-cost model to meet their data and policy needs.o	Review and vet jurisdictions' benefit-cost models and results for accuracy.o	Review and provide feedback to jurisdiction staff on their presentation of results to policy makers.o	Create additional training materials, worksheets and other resources as necessary.o	Communicate regularly with participating governmental staff, monitor their progress, and, in consultation with Results First staff, field questions and resolve issues as they arise.•	Assist with developing and deploying other evidence-based tools and resources.•	Participate in conferences, seminars and other professional development activities as needed.•	Collaborate closely with all Results First staff and other Pew colleagues as needed.•	Bachelor's degree required, advanced degree in economics, public administration, or a related discipline strongly preferred.•	At least five years of relevant professional experience.•	Solid knowledge of economic analysis, including cost-benefit analysis.•	Knowledge of policymaking, ideally at the state or local government levels; knowledge of social policy (e.g., child welfare, mental health and substance abuse) preferred.•	Experience training or teaching individuals.•	Strong applied research and analytical skills, including an ability to synthesize large amounts of information quickly and summarize findings effectively.•	Demonstrated project management and organizational skills; able to meet multiple deadlines by setting priorities and identifying resources.•	Excellent written and oral communications skills, including an ability to communicate results effectively to policymakers.•	Strong interpersonal skills; able to develop and manage productive and collaborative relationships both internally and externally.•	Ability to think strategically and creatively, juggle multiple priorities, adjust to changing circumstances, organize time efficiently and remain attentive to details.TravelIt is anticipated that this position will undertake frequent travel, including providing on-site technical assistance (two trips per month, on average), participating in multi-state convenings, and attending professional conferences.CompensationWe offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits package.Pew is an equal opportunity employer.PI92788011

251.desc: Our Associate Teacher position is a full-time teaching opportunity for individuals passionate about making an impact on public education – providing them world-class training to become Lead Teachers at Success Academy Charter Schools.  Associate Teachers who are not certified to teach will enroll in a 21-month Master’s and certification program through Touro College, earning a Master’s in General and Special Education, Grades 1-6. This degree program is fully funded by Success Academy. About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Our schools rank in the top 1% in math and top 3% in English among all New York State schools, while serving children with an overall poverty rate of 77%. We also act as a catalyst and model for education reform nationwide so that all kids can have access to high-quality schools. Success Academy Charter Schools are dedicated to academic excellence, character development, and extracurricular achievement with college graduation as an end goal. In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning. We also pride ourselves on developing a truly cohesive school community of parents, teachers, leaders, staff, and scholars. We require parents to be active participants in their child’s education and school-wide events, and hold the entire school community accountable to the same high level of expectations. We believe all children can achieve at extremely high levels, and we believe this starts with the dedication of exceptional and diligent adults. We are building a movement to transform public education. It’s no easy feat, but we can promise it will be one of the most rewarding. Are you ready to join?Responsibilities We are seeking dynamic, full-time Associate Teachers who are passionate about public education and are drawn to the intensity of our high-performing environment. This is a paid, full-time teaching position, with benefits. Starting their first day, Associate Teachers receive extensive training and professional development. This training continues and is applied as each Associate Teacher begins teaching in a Success Academy school where they work in a classroom alongside a dedicated Lead Teacher to build their skills and expertise. Along with the guidance of school leadership, the Associate Teacher experience is the training ground for becoming an exceptional Lead Teacher, and promotion occurs based on individual performance. Our Associate Teachers will:•	Join a groundbreaking faculty of teachers that are committed to closing the achievement gap and raising the bar for all children.•	Be a part of a highly motivated team committed to education reform, parent choice, and the building of exemplary schools.•	Engage students through a cutting-edge curriculum that reinforces the fun of learning and enables all students to thrive.•	Work collaboratively with a Lead Teacher, receiving on-going coaching and development while contributing significantly to the day-to-day instruction.•	Collaborate regularly with school leaders – receiving ongoing coaching and mentorship.•	Provide additional academic and tutoring support to scholars.•	Teach in classrooms filled with resources and technology.•	Go above and beyond to consistently innovate and improve one’s practice.

252.desc: Archetype Solutions Group (ASG) is recruiting for a Business Associate to join our dynamic, growing business that is driving 3x YoY growth. The position will be located at the ASG office in Trevose, PA (office is easily accessible from center city Philadelphia via Septa Regional Rail). The Associate will work closely with one or more ASG managers across a variety of projects.ASG teams not only develop the strategy for partner initiatives but are also involved in the execution of those projects. Associates are expected to leverage their strategic thinking and problem solving skills to derive insights and design solutions. Following the initial project there may be opportunities to join other ongoing ventures within ASG.Company:Archetype Solutions Group is a Data Analytics Incubator currently stewarding five companies across various stages of growth, and have 40 employees across ventures in the Greater Philadelphia area. Our primary industry is Healthcare, with an acute focus on insurance and wellness. We take a unique approach of partnering with strong regional players to co-develop SaaS products to fit market needs.Working at Archetype means doing what you love. Not only do we partner with enterprises to co-create solutions, but we also incubate our own ideas and bring them to life. Our team is comprised of highly successful former Data Scientists, Management Consultants, Financial Analysts, and Developers who wanted leverage their analytics expertise to progress a portfolio of companies.In our open culture everyone is a hands-on contributor. Being part of our incubator, you get to solve many exciting problems and see your work in action across multiple companies. Our team breaks the normal grind, passionately pursues entrepreneurship, and rapidly develops innovative solutions.Responsibilities: •	Scope out opportunities to incubate high impact business opportunities with existing partners•	Work with our partners to refine existing client-facing service offerings, and look for new features and add-on services•	Design efficient processes to help clients utilize solutions in a changing business environment•	Contribute to a dynamic and engaging work environment•	Keep multiple projects on-track, while both structuring and executing taskso	Manage change in organizations through clear, concise communicationso	Design custom analysis applications in MS Excelo	Research and select service providers to support and help execute initiativeso	Support the development and testing of new technology tools and/or offeringso	Create client deliverables and sales materials (presentations, brochures, etc.)

253.position: Business Consultant - Enterprise Content Intelligence (ECI) Group
253.desc: Business Consultant - Enterprise Content Intelligence (ECI) Group Join Perficient, and you will play an integral role in impacting some of the country's most dynamic companies. With broad industry resources and deep technical expertise, we collaborate with clients to cultivate ideas and deliver results. Choose a career with Perficient, and work in a challenging and dynamic environment where innovate and engaging work are a part of everyday life.  Build your Career at Perficient:   WATCH THE VIDEOPerficient is always looking for the best and brightest technology talent to support our growing partner and client portfolio. We have scaled from a startup organization to an industry leader by delivering business-driven technology solutions to solve real business problems for mid-sized and large corporations throughout the U.S. and abroad.Career PathWe are proud to offer the opportunity for Business Consultants to build long and successful careers at Perficient. We offer multiple career paths to allow individuals to continue to progress whether their interests and talents are in solution architecture, project management, consulting leadership or business management. We encourage our consultants to explore the different options and work closely with their career counselor and mentors to build a career that is satisfying and rewarding. Perficient is currently looking for Business Consultants for our offices in Washington, DC, New York, NY or Boston, MA. Job Description and RequirementsParticipate in many of the client interfacing aspects of the system lifecycle, including requirements analysis, functional design, software installation and configuration, testing, documentation, training, and project management.•	Redesign complex business processes to make use of the newest technologies and processing concepts. A Business Consultant is expected to quickly understand a customer’s current business processes and objectives and help devise new processes that are more efficient and effective.•	Learn and understand the technologies we work with and envision how they can be applied to solve business problems. These technologies include enterprise software packages from vendors such as IBM, EMC, and PegaSystems as well as custom components.•	Candidates should have experience in requirements analysis and system design along with an understanding of and interest in technology and how it can be applied. Candidates must also have excellent oral and written communication skills.•	The Business Systems Analysts work in small teams, often with significant client interaction, and are expected to contribute their ideas and skills from day one.    About PerficientPerficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000® and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient delivers vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions. Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient’s professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index. Perficient is an award-winning Premier Level IBM business partner, a Microsoft National Service Provider and Gold Certified Partner, an Oracle Platinum Partner, and a Platinum Salesforce Cloud Alliance Partner.Our project teams deliver high-value, measurable results by working collaboratively with clients through a user-centered, technology and business-based methodology. We believe this approach enhances return-on-investment for our clients by significantly reducing the time and risk associated with designing and implementing business and technology solutions.Our work is routinely recognized by our partners, trade and industry authorities, and most importantly, our clients. We place strong emphasis on building lasting relationships with clients and being 100% referenceable. In each of the past four years, more than 80% of our revenue was derived from repeat business. We believe this reflects our commitment to quality consulting and the long-term partnerships we build with our clients.To learn more about Perficient's services, solutions, products, and locations, visit http://www.Perficient.com/Linkedin.com/company/Perficient            Facebook.com/Perficient               Twitter.com/Perficient_jobs            RSS: Perficient.com/Thought-LeadershipAt Perficient, we offer a competitive base salary, bonuses twice a year, a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental and vision, 401(k) with matching contributions, 3 weeks paid time off and 10 paid holidays per year.

256.desc: Amerimar is currently seeking a highly energetic and motivated Summer Analyst based out of the corporate office in Philadelphia, PA.  The Analyst will have primary responsibilities related to acquisitions and asset management.  The individual will have the opportunity to join a successful and rapidly growing organization and gain exposure to a wide variety of real estate transactions nationwide.  Analysts will evaluate and prepare comprehensive analysis for potential investments, create financial valuations and perform financial, legal, operational and managerial due diligence.  Analysts will also assist in asset management activities, including partnership and property level finance and leasing.

257.desc: Analyst Company:New York based investment firm with $500mm under management focused on private equity, real estate and special situations investments (both directly and via funds) on behalf of a network of ultra high net worth individuals and select institutional investors.  Specific Responsibilities:•	Assisting with transaction due diligence and underwriting•	Preparing complex financial models and valuation analysis•	Performing company and industry research•	Compiling and writing investment memos and presentations•	Participating in management calls, company meetings and industry conferences •	Monitoring portfolio company performance•	Managing existing fund investments and manager relationships•	Preparing quarterly and annual internal and external reporting documents•	Assisting with company marketing presentation materials and client relationship managementQualifications:•	0-2 years investment banking or private equity experience•	Undergraduates with an outstanding academic and internship track record will be considered as well•	Strong work ethic, interpersonal skills and exceptional communication capabilities•	Excellent attention to detail•	Ability to work as a member of a small team handling a wide range of responsibilitiesTiming:Flexible between immediate and Summer 2016

258.desc: Axel Johnson, Inc., a New York-based direct investment firm, is seeking an analyst for its corporate development group.  This individual would be responsible for research efforts aimed at developing current and ongoing investment theses, building out the industry and competitive context around specific investment prospects, and maintaining research concerning the company’s current portfolio.With 2 to 3 others, the individual’s efforts would support a team of three investment / portfolio managers.The position is based in Axel Johnson’s New York City office and will involve limited travel to conferences, internal meetings, management presentations, and the like.

259.desc: Company OverviewSpencer Stuart is a leading global executive search and leadership advisory firm. Founded in 1956 and privately owned, Spencer Stuart is the partner of choice among organizations seeking guidance and counsel on senior leadership needs. We work with clients across a range of industries, from the worlds largest companies to medium-sized businesses, entrepreneurial startups and nonprofit organizations. The firm has 56 offices in 30 countries around the world.Our Consultants bring years of leadership experience in the very sectors and functions for which we provide a range of talent advisory services. Our engagement teams are organized to maximize industry and content specialization, along with knowledge sharing across the firm. These client service teams are supported by first-rate Associates, Analysts and Executive Assistants, and backed by state-of-the-art technology. We regularly work with colleagues across geographies, reflecting the international reach of our clients and the realities of the global business environment.Our ValuesAs executive search and leadership advisory professionals, we help organizations identify and develop individual leaders and leadership teams who will fit, perform and endure. The insights we bring and the advice we impart have a significant impact on the businesses we serve and on individual lives and careers. We recognize these responsibilities and take them seriously. We adhere to a code of professional ethics, handling our relationships with clients, executives and colleagues with great care. We offer balanced advice with courage and honesty and treat sensitive information with the utmost respect and discretion.Above all, we value quality  the quality of the services we provide our clients and the manner in which we navigate our interactions with individual executives and executive teams, whether we have been retained to recruit a senior executive, provide post-merger advisory recommendations or conduct a leadership assessment and development  exercise.Our distinctive culture continues to attract, develop and retain exceptional people to the firm and we are resolved to continue reaching for the highest standards of professionalism in our work.Leadership Advisory Services PracticeThe Leadership Advisory Services (LAS) Practice is a uniquely dynamic practice environment within Spencer Stuart. Emerging in recent years as a key area of strategic focus for the Firm, LAS has experienced an accelerated growth trajectory in both product diversification (acquisition of Reya Group, release of LP and ExI 2.0) and scale.Operating synergistically alongside the Firms market-leading Executive Search business, LAS professionals provide advice and partnership to clients navigating a range of key leadership and talent issues, including:	Aligning culture and talent strategy with business strategy	Maximizing team effectiveness	Merger integration support	Executive assessment and CEO succession	Talent development and transition supportPosition SummaryThe LAS Culture Analyst will be the point person in supporting U.S.-based culture engagements and, over time, is expected to develop in-depth knowledge of Spencer Stuarts culture offerings. The LAS practice serves as an innovation hub for the broader firm and the Culture Analyst plays a critical role in the education and training of internal colleagues (both LAS and Search) regarding culture product offerings and participates actively in internal initiatives for LAS product development and the build-out of practice infrastructure. The LAS Culture Analyst will be responsible for developing significant content and producing industry and/or functional analysis reports to support client engagements, special projects and new business initiatives. To accomplish this, the analyst will gather, synthesize, make recommendations and present information for prospective and ongoing client engagements utilizing internal, external, and contracted resources.  The Culture Analyst will play a major role in knowledge creation within the firm. In addition, the Culture Analyst may have opportunities to engage and contribute to intellectual capital pieces on behalf of the LAS practice.  The Culture Analyst will ideally be based in Spencer Stuarts Boston office.

260.company: Hillel: The Foundation for Jewish Campus Life
260.position: Associate for Strategy and Measurement - Hillel International (1612
260.desc: Hillel International is seeking an Associate to join the Strategy and Measurement Department at the Schusterman International Center in Washington, DC.  The Associate for Strategy and Measurement will be responsible for coordinating and supporting multiple measurement and evaluation projects including Measuring Excellence, Hillel International's signature project as part of our Drive to Excellence.What you do well:Data tracking, collection, entry and analysis with the goal of informing business decisions.Organize and synthesize large amounts of information for different audiences.Communicate technical information in a way that can be easily understood.Support the necessary steps to move projects forward effectively and efficiently.Maximize productivity with creative strategies and initiatives.Collaborate with team members to continuously refine and improve processes.General administrative, logistics and operational support.What you bring to the job:Excellent analytical skills and experience with data management.Self-confidence and ability to work both independently and collaboratively.Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build productive working relationships.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Reliability and discretion when needed.An ability to multi-task and manage a variety of different projects.A passion for Hillel's mission.A bachelor's degree and some experience with statistics, data management, accounting, or other relevant field.  High proficiency with Excel; SPSS and/or Qualtrics a plus.What you'll own:Helping to build a culture of data collection, measurement and continuous improvement throughout the Hillel network.Creating reports and presentation materials to help make meaning of data to inform strategic decision-making and story-telling activities.Supporting the development of a CRM system to track our work with local Hillels and ease reporting.Supporting local Hillels with better data tracking and reporting via standardized collection tools.Conducting regular evaluations of data collection tools and processes to proactively escalate issues, propose solutions and modify strategies.What you'll get out of it:Hillel offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, Group Supplemental Retirement Annuity, pension plan, life insurance, Long Term Disability (LTD), Flexible Spending Plan, generous vacation/sick time, and parental leave.Competitive salary in the non-profit marketplace.  Great professional development, mentoring and skill building opportunities.Independent and hands on work in an exciting environment.Flexible work hours.Passionate colleagues.What we’re about:Founded in 1923, Hillel has been enriching the lives of Jewish students for more than 90 years. Today, Hillel International is a global organization that welcomes students of all backgrounds and fosters an enduring commitment to Jewish life, learning and Israel. Hillel is dedicated to enriching the lives of Jewish students so that they may enrich the Jewish people and the world. As the largest Jewish student organization in the world, Hillel builds connections with emerging adults at more than 550 colleges and universities, and inspires them to direct their own path. During their formative college years, students are challenged to explore, experience, and create vibrant Jewish lives.To apply:Please apply at www.hilleljobs.com by clicking on “Current Openings.” Contact jobs@hillel.org with any questions.PLEASE NOTE: Applicants should include a copy of their cover letter and resume in one document when applying for this position. Please upload this document as a word or PDF file. When you upload the document, the system will create an unformatted version of your resume as a snapshot in your application. The formatted version of your resume will also be attached to your application, and will be used during the hiring process.

261.desc: You’re an ideal candidate for the Counselor position if:*You think that working with students, counselors, and schools on getting into and getting the most out of college sounds like your dream job.*You can write a fantastic personal essay on cue, and teach others how to do the same.*You think high school students are just about the best group of people to work with in the world (after the people here, of course!)*You want your students to succeed and be the best students they can be, and want to do whatever it takes to help them get there. *You’re ready to learn our tried and true methods and eventually teach them to others.We’d like to hear from you if:*You think it would be exhilarating to tell someone famous (or their children) what the right next step in their education is.*You worked hard in college, were and are genuinely passionate about what you studied, and think “nerd” is a compliment.*You love, love, love to read and write.*You’re organized, responsive, and can’t remember the last time you left an email unanswered.*You are a spelling and grammar ninja and can use the Microsoft Word Review toolbar in your sleep. *You’ve had some experience working with students in a classroom, tutoring, mentoring, or coaching setting (not your own children).*You are flexible, you can and do set goals independently and structure solutions to issues that may arise and solve them quickly – remember, we work with teenagers!It doesn’t matter if:*You have a comprehensive, or even partial, knowledge of colleges and their campuses. This type of experience is not required. If you already have some background here, great; if not, do not worry about it, this will not hurt your application.This is a full time position in New York City.

262.desc: DESCRIPTION: Get a behind the scenes look into a grassroots environmental campaign as one of our paid community organizing interns. Learn how policies are affected from the ground up, through constituent based activism. Organize communities and activate citizen participation through fundraising, membership recruitment, public education, and constituent letter-writing campaigns. Participate in protests, press conferences, legislative hearings and our annual lobby day in Harrisburg. Help us take on big polluters, win elections, and make democracy work.LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES:•	Get an in-depth crash course in community organizing, public policy at the local, state, and federal levels, and the pressing environmental issues that impact our communities.•	Annual lobby day spent lobbying local legislators in Harrisburg on environmental issues that affect Pennsylvania.•	Attend occasional protest, press conference, and legislative hearings.•	Work with and help develop our team of committed activists to help save the world.DEVELOP GRASSROOTS SUPPORT ON THE FOLLOWING CAMPAIGNS:•	Regulations and transparency in the fracking (hydraulic fracturing) industry•	Protection of rivers, lakes, and streams•	Philadelphia campaigns•	Election WorkQUALIFICATIONS:•	Commitment to environmental and social justice.•	Strong communication skills, especially one-on-one interactions•	Team-oriented attitude.•	Able to work at least 3 days a week M-F from 1:45-10pm or at least two days a week 4:30 to 9:30 (spring and fall semesters only).  •	Knowledge-base on environmental issues preferred.ADVANCEMENT:•	Leadership and salaried management positions available within 2-3 months, based on performance and commitment, excellent management training program; opportunities for travel and relocation throughout the U.S.!COMPENSATION: •	$10-$14/hr; Paid training; Potential college credit for summer and school-year interns; Benefits package available to permanent employees.

263.desc: DESCRIPTION: Work for a meaningful cause, getting on the ground experience in the environmental and political field. Seeking full-time and part-time organizers to activate communities participation through fundraising, membership recruitment, public education, and constituent letter-writing campaigns. We need sustainable, accountable-to-the-public agencies, policies and laws! Help us win for transparency, public health, and making democracy work.DEVELOP GRASSROOTS SUPPORT ON THE FOLLOWING CAMPAIGNS:•	Regulations and transparency in the fracking (hydraulic fracturing) industry•	Protection of rivers, lakes, and streams•	Philadelphia campaigns•	Election WorkQUALIFICATIONS:•	Commitment to environmental and social justice.•	Strong communication skills, especially one-on-one interactions•	Team-oriented attitude.•	Able to work at least 3 days a week M-F from 1:45-10pm or at least two days a week 4:30 to 9:30.  •	Knowledge-base on environmental issues preferred.ADVANCEMENT:•	Leadership and salaried management positions available within 2-3 months, based on performance and commitment, excellent management training program; opportunities for travel and relocation throughout the U.S.!COMPENSATION: •	$10-$14/hr; Paid training; Outstanding benefit package available to permanent employees (includes paid health and dental insurance, life insurance, 2-3 weeks paid annual vacation and holiday sick leave.)•	Potential college credit for summer and school-year interns

264.desc: DESCRIPTION: Begin your non-profit career and develop your professional skills on environmental activist campaigns. We are seeking professional community organizers to activate citizen participation through fundraising, membership recruitment, public education, and constituent letter-writing campaigns. We need sustainable, accountable-to-the-public agencies, policies and laws! Help us win for transparency, public health, and making democracy work.DEVELOP GRASSROOTS SUPPORT ON THE FOLLOWING CAMPAIGNS:•	Regulations and transparency in the fracking (hydraulic fracturing) industry•	Protection of rivers, lakes, and streams•	Philadelphia campaigns•	Election WorkQUALIFICATIONS:•	Entry Level•	Commitment to environmental and social justice.•	Strong communication skills, especially one-on-one interactions•	Team-oriented attitude.•	Able to work at least 3 days a week M-F from 1:45-10pm or at least two days a week 4:30 to 9:30.  •	Knowledge-base on environmental issues preferred.ADVANCEMENT:•	Salaried outreach management positions available within 2-3 months, based on performance and commitment •	Excellent management training program •	Opportunities for travel and relocation throughout the U.S.!COMPENSATION: •	$400-500 PER WEEK.•	Paid training •	Outstanding benefit package available to permanent employees (includes paid health and dental insurance, life insurance, 401k plan, 2-3 weeks paid annual vacation and holiday sick leave.)

265.company: Hillel: The Foundation for Jewish Campus Life
265.desc: Hillel at Buffalo is seeking a creative, vibrant and multi-talented leader to serve as the Director at the University of Buffalo and at other campuses in the community. The successful candidate will have a strong Jewish and Israel background, will be a self-starter and capable multi-tasker who will use his/her skills to engage students and advance the mission of Hillel in inspiring every Jewish student to make an enduring commitment to Jewish life, learning and Israel.  We will consider a wide range of exceptional candidates. The Jewish Federation, which funds and provides oversight to the Hillel, is committed to supporting the Executive Director to grow and develop professionally and find the resources he/she needs to enhance Jewish student life throughout Western New York.Qualifications:A bachelor’s degree.Minimally two years of leadership experience with college-aged students and the ability to connect with and engage students.A strong knowledge of Judaism and Jewish life.A deep commitment to Israel and a nuanced understanding of effective engagement, education, and advocacy strategies; preferably a Hebrew-speaker.Previous successful experience in organizational management and a desire to learn and lead fundraising strategies.Clear and effective verbal and written communication skills.Demonstrated leadership capabilities.Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks with competing deadlines.Knowledge about network management and social networking processes.Energy, a sense of humor, flexibility and maturity.The top candidate will receive:Competitive compensation package in the non-profit marketplace.Outstanding professional development, supervision, mentoring, and skill building opportunities.Flexible work hours.Travel opportunities with students.The ability to impact the lives of emerging Jewish adults.Job ResponsibilitiesStrategic Planning and Community RelationsDevelop, articulate, and promote a dynamic and innovative vision for the Hillel in Buffalo in partnership with the Task Force on Jewish campus life and other key stakeholders, including students, alumni, parents, the local Jewish community, Hillel International, and campus faculty and staff at University at Buffalo and other area colleges.Work with the Federation to make decisions about resource allocations, priorities and setting realistic goals.Set priorities and articulate measures of success in line with Hillel International’s “Measuring Excellence” framework so that results are accomplished.Work with the Task Force to create a strategic plan to propel Buffalo Hillel into the future.Financial Development and OversightDevelop and nurture productive relationships with individuals and organizations that can financially support the mission of Hillel.Initiate fundraising activities and organizes student, alumni and future members’ participation in development.Built a partnership with The University at Buffalo’s development office to identify and solicit potential donors.Work in partnership with the Federation’s CEO in overseeing all financial and programmatic activity.Jewish GrowthCreate an educational vision and strategy for the Hillel that will allow the diverse student community to reach a greater understanding and fuller expression of their own Jewish identity.Educate campus groups and partners formally and informally about Jewish religious observance, culture, history, Israel, and communities and serves as a role model for full, rich Jewish identification.Counsel students individually within a Jewish context.Leadership DevelopmentListen actively to students and other campus community members in order to identify strengths, weaknesses, and leadership potential in others, to connect them with the right opportunities to develop.Delegate leadership and responsibilities for activities to others, empowering students to develop and carry out Jewish educational, cultural, and religious events and activities, including leading holiday and Shabbat services.Take on a leadership role in challenging situations and inspires others as a role model.AdvocacyProvide immediate on-site assistance in managing any Israel advocacy crisis or Anti-Semitic incident.Develop pro-active Israel Advocacy strategies specific to Buffalo Hillel, maximizing the full array of national and local advocacy services.Collect intelligence and monitor anti-Israel activities on campus.Ensure the creation of necessary relationships on campus for furthering advocacy effortsCampus and Community RelationsBring together external groups/individuals with similar goals or missions to form lasting alliances and develops mutually beneficial joint activities and partnerships with them.Develop a rapport with a wide variety of individuals.Communicate effectively with all stakeholders.Strategically initiate, develop, and maintain networks of people on campus and among Jewish students and Hillel stakeholders who can help to advance Hillel’s goals.About Hillel at Buffalo and Buffalo, NY:A flagship institution in the State University of New York system, University at Buffalo is the largest and most comprehensive campus in the 64-campus SUNY system. UB is a premier, research-intensive public university dedicated to academic excellence. Our research, creative activity and people positively impact the world. Like the city we call home, UB is distinguished by a culture of resilient optimism, resourceful thinking and pragmatic dreaming that enable us to reach others every day.Hillel at Buffalo’s program is full of activities to engage students’ minds, spirits, well-being, and creative interests. The Hillel lounge is on campus, centrally located in the Buffalo Commons, right near Starbucks for easy coffee dates with students. The staff offices are furnished to accommodate students who stop by to meet with friends, chat, have a snack, attend a program and much more. The total enrollment of 30,000, there are approximately 2,500 Jewish students on the beautiful campus in Amherst, NY.Hillel at Buffalo is affiliated with Hillel International.  Hillel International enriches the lives of Jewish students so they may enrich the Jewish people and the world, and envisions a world where every student is inspired to make an enduring commitment to Jewish life, learning and Israel.Buffalo’s Jewish Community consists of 12,000 people, nearly 10 synagogues, a robust Jewish Federation, two large Jewish Community Center campuses and two Jewish day schools.  Most of the Jewish population now resides in the Buffalo suburb of Amherst, an affluent community of about 100,000, which is home to the main campus of the University.  There are many reasons to move to the Buffalo metropolitan area, including a world-renowned symphony orchestra, a top-rated art museum, several drama companies, and two major league sports teams. Plus, it’s where Buffalo wings were invented!To Apply:   Please apply at www.hilleljobs.com by clicking on “Current Openings.”PLEASE NOTE: Applicants should include a copy of their cover letter and resume in one document when applying for this position. Please upload this document as a word or PDF file. When you upload the document, the system will create an unformatted version of your resume as a snapshot in your application. The formatted version of your resume will also be attached to your application, and will be used during the hiring process.

266.desc: MOD Worldwide – Philadelphia, PAMaking people happy makes you happy.Can you make it sing?You need to translate the clients’ ideas into the creatives’ skills. You’re the go-between, the translator and the ringleader for big ideas and tight deadlines. Your iCal is full, your inbox is humming and your face is smiling—you’re our next Junior Account Manager. RESPONSIBILITIES:Work with Account Executives & Account Managers to track deliverables & manage workflow Communicate effectively with clients on key accountsMaintain client expectations by promptly relaying project statusesAbility to recognize, develop and enhance concepts conceived by staff and direct translation across all channels.Experience managing the creative process and brand standards.

267.desc: Merus Global Investments, LLC has an Exciting Full-Time Employment Opportunity for a Junior Trader Trainee.Merus is looking for a highly competitive, quick thinking individual with a background/major in finance, economic and/or mathematics who has a passion for trading equities, options and futures. Compensation: $50,000 annual salary, plus discretionary bonus and full benefits are offered. Interviews begin in February 2016.Desired Qualifications: -Four year college degree, with a major in finance, economic and/or mathematics-Strong interest in global equity markets -Core GPA above 3.5 -Ability to communicate under pressure-Highly motivated and detail orientated-Entrepreneurial spirit The Training Program (2 Years):Learn all aspects of trading, from execution, to clearing, to risk management, to international risk arbitrage, and special situations events. Daily requirements include, tracking P/L of traders, reconciling positions, executing orders, modeling upcoming trading events, communication with brokers and back office employees.   Organization Description:Merus Global Investments, LLC is a multi-strategy investment partnership that allocates stable capital to its community of traders with headquarters located in the heart of New York City’s Financial District and a branch office in Austin, Texas.Merus Global Investments was founded in December 2015 by a senior team of highly skilled trading professionals with the focus and vision to create a firm unparalleled in the industry. How to Apply:Submit Resume and Transcript to careers@merusglobal.com. Merus Global Investments, LLC is an equal opportunity employer.

268.desc: Be part of something innovative and cutting edge. Join our team of more than a hundred software engineers, designers, project managers and software specialists that are smart, creative and excited by what they do.Some of our ground-breaking work includes:• advanced computer-adaptive algorithms (only one that’s peer-approved in the country)• mobile support for the user interfaces• learning management systems with social media features• user interfaces that are universally accessible to people with or without disabilities • innovative, machine-scorable items The American Institutes for Research (AIR) is a leading professional services firm with a growing software engineering and product development team. We design and build things that are inspiring and make a real impact in the online testing industry. We are currently seeking Software Engineers to join our team in Washington, DC (Georgetown).Responsibilities The Software Engineer will be an integral part of the software engineering and product development team within AIR. This group of professionals provide custom software solutions for our clients as well as internal support systems. Much of the work we perform is new development, so the right candidate will have the skills needed to perform full life-cycle software development. This includes participation in requirements gathering, application and database design, system documentation, writing and unit-testing efficient code, and deployment.

269.desc: The Boxed Summer Undergrad  Internship Program is an opportunity to work in one of New York City’s fastest growing startup companies. We’re looking for a few undergraduate student interns who are passionate about technology, innovation and entrepreneurship to assist in various tasks and projects assigned to different departments. You’ll work side-by-side with our entrepreneurially-minded employees in various departments (including, depending on areas of intern interest, operations, marketing, finance, human resources, procurement, supply chain, logistics and product management) – gaining hands-on experience working on real-world projects. We focus on investing in high potential undergrad students to bring their talent back to Boxed after graduation. This program is intended for students that will be graduating in May 2016-2017. We offer countless ways to make an impact in our organization as long as you’re up for the challenge! If you’re ready to take on additional responsibilities and to build on your skills and experiences all within a vibrant and rewarding working environment, we want to hear from you!

270.desc: Manhattan-based firm needs smart, organized, motivated SAT/ACT, academic subject, and AP tutors for high-paying, high-volume tutoring work.If you're thinking about tutoring as a career, this is the place for you. We're committed to growing our people and rewarding them for great work. This is also an excellent position for graduate students, artists, freelancers, writers, and others who are looking for steady work to support their passions. Tutors will work directly with high school students one-on-one, and must be able to work remotely via Skype and/OR travel to various New York City locations. While the majority of our clients are based in New York, we work with families from all around the world.Tutors will report to Tutoring Manager and work mainly evening and weekend hours in order to be available to high school students.

271.desc: Established in 1997, Endeavor is leading a global movement to catalyze long-term economic growth by selecting, mentoring, and accelerating high-impact entrepreneurs worldwide. 18 years later, Endeavor has screened 30,000+ candidates and selected over 1,000 entrepreneurs. Supported and mentored by our growing network of 1,000+ local and global business leaders, these entrepreneurs have created over 400,000 high-value jobs and generate more than $7 billion in annual revenues. Endeavor entrepreneurs include MercadoLibre, a NASDAQ-listed e-commerce technology company with annual revenues of $373MM, and Globant, which recently went public on the NYSE. For more information on our model, please visit: http://endeavor.org/model/ourmodel.Endeavor Insight is currently seeking a Technical Associate to join its growing team. The Technical Associate will manage and improve the technical structures necessary to the success of Insight’s work. These components include a SQL database, a Linux-based remote server, interactive surveys constructed using Javascript and JQuery, interactive visualizations using D3Js, and various ancillary processes written in PHP, JavaScript, JQuery and Python.The Technical Associate will lead and own all technical aspects of the team’s analysis and work, and will also have the opportunity to involve himself/herself in the substance of Insight’s work and expand his/her area of expertise by learning about research, project management and entrepreneurship. The Technical Associate will also have the opportunity to travel abroad to assist with Insight projects. Representative examples of past projects conducted by Endeavor Insight include the New York tech map and report, which inspected the way that entrepreneurs in New York City influence one another (http://www.nyctechmap.com/vcs/). The team has also published analysis results in Harvard Business Review, TechCrunch, and other online platforms

272.desc: Upper Manhattan Empowerment Zone (UMEZ) is a private, not-for-profit corporation with approximately $80 million available for investment.  Our mission is to revitalize Upper Manhattan's economy through business, cultural and workforce development investments.  The communities we target for investment activity include East Harlem, Harlem, Washington Heights and Inwood.  We are the first economic development effort of this magnitude to impact Upper Manhattan.  UMEZ's Board of Directors includes local and city wide leaders.The responsibilities of the Assistant Controller will be the following: •	Perform general accounting functions for UMEZ and its subsidiary BRISC•	Collect bank statements and make journal entries for miscellaneous cash deposits, monthly interest income, bank charges and other cash transactions•	Record incoming wires from government agency to update grant receivables•	Reconcile bank accounts, run bank reconciliation reports in separate accounting systems and generate detailed reconciliation reports in excel spreadsheets for major bank accounts to itemize and categorize monthly transactions.  •	Prepare monthly State Cash Report for government agency ESDC to disclose Operating Accounts, Initiative Funds and Loan Repayment accounts•	Record principal and interest payments collected directly from borrowers and indirectly through third party to update loan and interest receivables•	Maintain loan amortization schedules and accrue monthly interest receivables•	Set up allowance for doubtful loan accounts and make quarterly adjustments•	Journalize bi-weekly payroll transactions based on ADP reports •	Update and maintain excel files for 401(K) contributions, employer matching and loan repayments.•	Allocate and journalize Payroll and all other admin expenses covered by UMEZ for its subsidiary BRISC in separate systems. •	Reconcile inter-company accounts on monthly basis for both UMEZ and BRISC•	Prepare outgoing wire request forms to various receivers and prepare bank transfer request forms within UMEZ and BRISC bank accounts as needed•	Record monthly amortizations for fixed assets and prepaid expenditures•	Make periodic accrual entries for deferred compensation payable, vacation accruals, audit fees, etc.•	Prepare quarterly statement of functional expenses to compare with quarterly budgets and analyze variances•	Perform monthly balance sheet account analysis•	Update and Maintain various procedure manuals in the accounting department•	Act as a back-up to accounts payable for payment processing•	Perform other duties which may be assigned from time to time

273.desc: TDC is a Boston-based nonprofit management consulting and research firm that works across the nonprofit sector.  It is one of the countrys oldest providers of management consulting to nonprofits.  We offer strategic business planning services for nonprofits at organizational inflection points.
