Guided by our clients missions, informed by market realities, and grounded in financial best practices, we work with clients to help them lay out integrated programmatic, organizational, and financial strategies.  In addition, TDC works with funders and donors to create philanthropic strategies that support their visions for meaningful impact.  On occasion, TDC publishes in-depth research on critical topics facing the nonprofit sector.   TDC is a small firm comprised of approximately 20 consultants.  Our senior consultants hold degrees from top MBA and graduate programs and bring a wealth of experience from the nonprofit and social sectors. In their time at TDC, past Associate Consultants have found the following opportunities especially meaningful components of their experience:	Exposure to a variety of nonprofit clients and their diverse challenges.	Experience with a variety of skills, including financial modeling, dataset management and analysis, and market research.	Experience with a variety of analytical tools, including survey and statistical analysis software.	Exposure to thought leaders throughout the nonprofit sector. 	Consistent and thoughtful guidance from senior consultants and firm leaders.	Encouragement and expectation of professional growth and development. 	Increased responsibility with time and experience. Position overviewAssociate Consultants staff multiple client engagements simultaneously, and have the opportunity to work with a variety of TDCs senior consultants.  They support project teams of two to three in research, analysis, and client-facing capacities.  Associate Consultants engagements span TDCs portfolio of work with individual organizations, funders, and sector-wide research projects. In their first year at TDC, Associate Consultants will:	Take notes and prepare memorandums for client meetings.	Review organizations financial documents, strategic plans, marketing materials, audience research, etc.	Design and conduct surveys, interviews, and focus groups.	Conduct market research using census data, client datasets, and other primary sources.	Write and prepare client deliverables, including presentations and reports.	Use analysis to shape scenarios and financial models that inform client decisions. 	Communicate with clients to collect materials, organize meetings, and distribute deliverables.As Associate Consultants gain experience they often take on additional responsibility, including:	Ownership of research protocols and results; communication of high-level findings to the project team.	Increased client management.	Increased project management.	Heightened complexity of data analysis and financial modeling.

274.desc: If you believe education is the soul of all other industries, you belong here at Apex Ivy Consulting. AIC is a growing education company changing mindsets across China. We operate out of nine cities, mentoring students one-on-one and equipping them to thrive at US universities and liberal arts colleges by helping them develop character strengths, self-understanding, improve their writing abilities, and understand the many cultures of the United States. We pride ourselves in our alumni achievement that includes 14 founders of companies an author of 3 books. We also pursue philanthropy, giving over 3 million RMB in scholarships to rural scholars and will open our first Hope school in Yunnan in 2016. We're looking for passionate educators who are also excited about working cross-culturally in business development or research into the Chinese education system. With a diverse portfolio of projects and connections with the China LAC-Tour, Caijing Sanya Forum, and numerous local and international NGOs, AIC is an exciting opportunity for education enthusiasts with interests and aspirations in and outside the classroom. Past consultants have leveraged their AIC experience to later gain opportunities working at private equity firms, Google, Macys, Boston University, and graduate schools such as Harvard Law School, Teachers College of Columbia University, and the Yale School of Management.College ConsultingThis is a new Education Consultant's primary responsibility. Between August and January each year, you will mentor students one- on-one to assess their strengths and weaknesses, plan their application strategy, advise them in the school research process, brainstorm admissions essay topics, and provide critical feedback on their drafts. Between February and July of each year, you will mentor students as they work to better themselves before the admissions cycle, helping them understand their area of academic interest better, seek engaging internship opportunities, or apply for summer school admissions.TeachingYou will occasionally teach small, discussion-based seminars to help students develop skills that will serve them in the application process, in the US education system, and for the rest of their lives. You have the option of designing your own courses as well as implementing our current materials.MarketingYou will market AICs consulting services to potential students and parents in large seminars, small groups and one-on-one meetings. This is an exciting challenge for candidates with strong Mandarin skills. You may contribute to our ongoing marketing publications and research projects, or even submit a proposal for your own marketing project.Business DevelopmentWorking in a highly entrepreneurial environment, you will have the opportunity to gain experience wherever your interests lie. AIC consultants past and present have sought investment deals, improved operation efficiency, developed new services, contributed to our social media presence, improved our corporate social responsibility, and much more.Education Consultants for the 2016-2017 application cycle should be available to start between January and June 1st 2016 and will join our offices in Beijing, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Nanjing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Wuhan, Xian, or Zhengzhou.All candidates must have or display:-A bachelors degree from a top 30 ranked US college or university-Passion for education-Fluency in English, demonstrated by superior writing, critical analysis, and communication skillsCompetitive candidates will have or display: -Fluency in Mandarin-Teaching experience-Previous mentorship or counseling of students applying to college is a plusSubmit your resume, a cover letter describing your interest in the education industry and working in China, and a recent writing sample (creative or academic pieces are both acceptable) to Mr. Andy Blake (andy.blake@aic-edu.com) and Ms. Hallie Treadway (hallie.treadway@aic-edu.com) in an email titled [Your Name], AIC 2016 Full Time Application.

275.desc: Seeking Late Winter / Spring interns. Must be located in Philadelphia.SAVERY Gallery seeks Gallery Assistant Intern to present the space to the public, anticipate and accommodate the needs of Gallery Principals, Artists, and Clients, administer to daily tasks, and collaborate on the continued promotion of the Gallery exhibition program. Ideal candidate has an enthusiasm for contemporary art, is an engaging and creative communicator, and opens the space to new ideas and aesthetics through active participation.DIRECTION:- Intern will work and learn under direction of Gallery Manager and Gallery DirectorRESPONSIBILITIES:- General administrative and maintenance tasks- Maintain Gallery mailing lists and draft Gallery correspondence- Greeting / Front Desk; welcoming guests, providing artwork and pricing information.- Follow up on inquiries, collect potential client information- Assist with Opening Receptions and First Friday events, gallery functions, and public programming such as Artist Talks and Workshops- Assist with cataloging Art works and general research	QUALIFICATIONS:- Excellent research, writing, and communication skills- Excellent record-keeping and organizational skills- Able to collaborate and also work independently under direction on defined projects- Knowledge of art and gallery practices ideal- Mac and tech savvyInterns must commit to a minimum of at least three months (or the term of their university’s internship program), and be able to work at least 8 hours per week over a period of one or two days. Negotiated shifts are offered between the hours of 11AM-6PM Wednesday through Saturday. Participants may arrange for college credit in conjunction with undergraduate or graduate coursework in fine arts, art history, arts administration, or marketing but it is not a requirement - please provide institutional guidelines for receiving credit. Interns will receive an evaluation form and letter of recommendation at the end of the internship term.To apply, please send a resume and cover letter to intern@saverygallery.com. You may include an optional attachment of writing samples or other relevant information.

276.desc: Private Equity and Strategy ConsultantRetail and Consumer Group, United States*Please include GPA in your application.Private Equity and Strategy Practice IntroductionThe Kurt Salmon Private Equity and Strategy Practice is a San Francisco-based team that provides strategic, analytical consulting services to leading private equity funds and corporate clients operating in retail and consumer products.  Our group provides a unique opportunity for high-caliber individuals to gain significant strategy experience. Our fast-paced, strategic projects offer a dynamic and highly challenging environment for new team members to develop quickly and gain immediate exposure to senior firm leadership and industry executives. Consultants are expected to own and drive their individual work streams to completion, as well as to help communicate our findings on pressing strategic issues to CEOs and investors. Our supportive, non-hierarchical, merit-based structure gives new consultants the chance to consistently work with practice leaders who have decades of strategy consulting experience. We have worked for eight of the top ten private equity funds in the country, and we participate in the majority of large M&A deals in the retail, consumer products, and restaurant industries. On the corporate side, our clients span a broad range of leading retail and consumer goods companies—many companies you interact with on a regular basis. Key clients range from manufacturers to distributors to retailers, in e-commerce and traditional brick and mortar. We cover the entirety of the retail and consumer products value chain, which we’ve found to be dynamic, fun and relatable to our everyday lives. Our practice is part of Kurt Salmon, the leading global management consulting firm specializing in a full range of solutions for the retail, consumer products, health care and financial services industries. We have over 75 years of history achieving lasting improvements and delivering results for our clients as thought leaders and trusted advisors. The Private Equity and Strategy Practice is a focused entity within the broader firm—our team comes from the most prestigious undergrad and MBA programs in the country.  As a dedicated group within a global company, we maintain the flexibility and camaraderie of a small office while leveraging the network and resources of a larger firm. Our consultants commonly go on to become MBAs in top programs, associates at private equity firms or leaders in our own practice. Position DetailsSuccessful consultants demonstrate exceptional analytical, interpersonal and creative-thinking skills. They receive both formal and on-the-job training and ramp up quickly as integral members of the Private Equity and Strategy Practice.Consultants analyze quantitative market, financial, and consumer research data and uncover insights through primary and secondary research. Consultants also develop analytical frameworks, financial models, and conceptual tools to define and test hypotheses, outline strategic scenarios and synthesize information into meaningful conclusions. A consultant’s primary activities typically include: •	Building market and financial models for evaluation of M&A targets, divestitures, and investments•	Disaggregating and analyzing drivers of company performance•	Assessing key market and competitive dynamics through consumer research and interviews with industry experts•	Translating complex analysis and modeling into concise, insightful presentationsKey capabilities of the position include:•	Quickly and creatively identifying key insights from diverse sources•	Thriving under pressure and meeting tight deadlines•	Gathering, organizing and analyzing large datasets•	Constantly maintaining intellectual curiosity and initiative•	Interacting with the senior levels of firm and client leadership on a day-to-day basisLocation and TravelThis position is open in our San Francisco office. Work is typically completed in the San Francisco office and travel is limited (10-20% annually). Occasionally, projects will require more extensive travel depending on specific client needs.Kurt Salmon seeks diversity among our consulting staff and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

277.desc: Exceptional Deployment Engineers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded high-performance computing and research group based in New York City.  These hires are expected to contribute to the development of scientific workflow systems, deployment of software and infrastructure, standardization of tools, regression testing, configuration management, and/or third-party support for our simulation tools packages.   Ideal candidates will have strong Python programming and scripting experience, exceptional communication skills, and a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open source accomplishments.  Other relevant areas of expertise might include high-throughput workflows, structured and unstructured data management and analysis, distributed systems software, software release management, automation testing, and quality assurance, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than a track record of achievement and innovation. Our group is developing multiple generations of the Anton supercomputer, a massively parallel special-purpose machine that speeds up molecular dynamics simulations by orders of magnitude and is designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery. If you are interested in working closely with a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application materials.  We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation.   To submit an application, please use the link provided below: http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/SciDevD. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

278.desc: The School District of Philadelphia is the cornerstone provider of public education in Philadelphia. The 130,000 students entrusted to the District arrive at school every day with an extraordinary range of needs and aspirations. We are committed to delivering on their right to an excellent public school education, and we are particularly focused on ensuring every student has access to exceptional educational opportunities close to where they live. Equity is our mandate. Will you join us? Job SummarySupports efforts to ensure effective hiring and placement of substitutes for The School District of Philadelphia to meet the demand at the school level. Coordinates day-to-day operations for long-term substitute assignments. Provides critical capacity for filling assignments and partners with the Recruitment Team to conduct prospect research, marketing & outreach to candidates, application review, and phone interviews. The Specialist will report to the Director, Substitute Services. Essential Functions    Identifies long term teacher substitute needs in partnership with the Staffing Team.    Conducts research on potential candidates to fill long term assignments in partnership with the Recruitment Team.    Coordinates with Employee Health Services to have up to date information on possible end dates for long term assignments.    Prepares offer letters for long term hires.    Oversees the process for employee entering related to paperwork & clearances, inclusive of certification application if needed.    Corresponds with the Staffing Team on status of filling long term assignments within their networks.    Works with Substitute Services vendor (Source4Teachers) on management of long term and other substitute information in database/software systems.    Ensures all long term information is kept up to date.    Ensures an efficient “time to fill” for each role with a clear focus on increasing and improving the fill rate.    Provides customer service to School District staff regarding general substitute needs/inquiries.    Provides general administrative and project support to the Substitute Services team.

279.desc: Temple Teacher Residency is a federally funded, rigorous teacher education program centered upon a year-long clinical training within high-need Philadelphia middle schools integrated with graduate coursework. Students receive a living stipend ($18,000) to support them during residency. TTR Residents finish the year with:•   Masters of Education from Temple University’s College of Education•   Pennsylvania middle grades science/math teaching certification (with an option to add special education certification)•   Ongoing mentoring for their first two years teaching in Philadelphia's middle schools

280.desc: TECHNOLOGY GRADUATE SCHEME 2016  ELSEVIER Career Opportunities - SUMMER 2016 START We take graduate recruitment very seriously at Elsevier. Part of the 4th largest information provider in the world, we are looking for talented, insightful and innovative graduates to join our 2016 Technology graduate program.  Graduate entrants to the Elsevier Technology Group join a team that strives to innovate and constantly improve our range of technologically advanced products. In doing so you will be provided with exciting, challenging assignments; where innovation is the order of the day and where technology drives the global business forward; where you will be using the latest tools and encouraged to explore the opportunities opened up by using new ones. We are committed to offering pathways to professional growth, development and promotion and all within a culture which encourages collaboration and team work. Oh, and of course you will be well rewarded with a competitive financial package.  So, who is Elsevier? (click https://youtu.be/-Bz55QL0iyQ to find out more)  Elsevier is a thriving $4bn revenue global business within the RELX Group (previously known as Reed Elsevier).  RELX Group is a world-leading provider of information solutions for professional customers across a range of industries. With a history spanning 130 years, Elsevier is the fourth largest digital paid content provider in the world (behind Google, Bloomberg and China Telecom) and our Technology team uses cutting-edge technology to create a range of innovative, multi-platform digital products using a world-class content set for end users in the scientific, academic and medical worlds. Our leading edge products are used globally to advance science, aid discovery, improve patient outcomes and impact peoples lives in a positive manner on a daily basis.Our customers span virtually every Science, Technology and Medical field in the world and our products include such distinguished brands as Science Direct, The Lancet and Cell. What are we offering?We are offering 10 Technology graduate opportunities for 2016; roles will be based in our offices in New York and Philadelphia. You will be trained over the course of 2 years in disciplines such as Project Management, Software Engineering, Business Analysis and Information Security and you will gain exposure to technologies and processes such as CRM, BI & Analytics, Cloud Computing, Java, HTML, PHP, Agile and Big Data concepts such as AI and Machine Learning. What makes us better than the rest?There are all sorts of graduate roles out there but we are confident that few (if any) can match the combination of benefits that we offer. In addition to great technical and soft-skills training, we offer: an excellent work-life balance, a great social life, structured career planning and a 2 year fast-track development program. Last but not least we offer a generous compensation package that increases incrementally throughout the two years together with a competitive benefits package.  What are we looking for?	First and foremost you should be a 2015/2016 graduate 	Ideally you will be a Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business & Computing, Mathematics, Physics major or similar.	You should have a natural passion for technology and a desire to learn and progress quickly.	You must be a strong communicator with well-formed interpersonal skills.Take the next step	If this sounds like the ideal opportunity to kick start your career then please submit your resume and cover letter to https://reedelsevier.taleo.net/careersection/jobdetail.ftl?job=ELS001U6&lang=en  for consideration 	First round telephone screenings will take place in January/February with assessment days in March/April.	The start date for these roles will be Summer 2016.

281.desc: ABOUT BREAKTHROUGH NEW YORKSince 1999 Breakthrough New York has been transforming the lives of motivated, low-income students by preparing them for and helping them enroll and persist in rigorous high schools and colleges. It is our mission to help them break through the obstacles that stand in the way so that they can succeed in the world. Over the past five years our finance and development teams have been the backbone of BTNY as the organization’s budget has grown 30% each year over the last three years. As a part of this strategic growth, we are seeking to build our infrastructure by adding new team members who are innovative and are excited about the possibility of working with a growing organization!ABOUT THE POSITIONThe Finance & Operations Coordinator you will ensure the successful completion of some of our most essential business processes. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE…     FINANCE and PAYROLL•	Processing all transactions in accordance with General Acceptable Accounting Practices (GAAP)•	Managing the accounts payable process by, receiving, verifying, obtaining approval, processing and filing all vendor invoices on a weekly basis.•	Ensuring that employees are paid accurately and according to annual calendar by:o	Overseeing the accurate completion and submission of all new hire paperworko	Processing and submitting payroll for approval by scheduled deadlines•	Processing of incoming contributions on a daily basis, including bank deposits, receipts, and recording.•	Reporting contributions on a monthly basis and reconciling with the Development team.•	Managing the monthly credit card reconciliation process.•	Assisting the Chief Financial Officer in the Audit and 990 filing processes, which includes but is not limited to the gathering of documents, preparation of audit schedules and working with external Auditors.TALENT MANAGEMENT•	Finding and hiring the qualified talent to join our growing team by:o	Leading the recruitment strategy for our growing team o	Overseeing the interview, hiring and onboarding processes and calendar across all departments.•	Coordinating organizational talent calendar by:o	Creating and disseminating the calendaring of the annual performance evaluation process. o	Evaluating, recommending and securing organizational professional development training needs.•	Overseeing employee benefits, facilitating enrollment for employees via process and employee education.GENERAL OFFICE•	Maintaining the organization and safekeeping of hard-copy files and digital records as they relate to the above processes.•	Ensure BTNY remains compliant in all related local, state and federal regulations.•	Support the operations team with office coverage and other projects as needed•	Other duties as assigned

282.desc: Heritage Consulting Inc., is a twelve year old Philadelphia-based preservation planning consulting firm with clients nationwide. We are collecting resumes for one or more internship assignments right now and through the summer.  The intern(s) will work directly with firm principal Donna Ann Harris. The paid internship is part time starting now and possibly through September to assist on several projects.  Projects may include but are not limited to the following issues:•	Undertake library, journal and internet research on a variety of downtown revitalization, fufund raisingr historic preservation topics•	Proofread documents, proposals, and reports•	Write drafts sections of reports, proposals or case studies•	Assist in development  of online and paper surveys, tabulate, analyze and produce draft reports on data for review using Survey Monkey•	Assist with focus groups, contact participants, take notes during focus groups and meetings, prepare draft reports for review•	Attend client meetings to take notes sometimes in a verbatim matter for reports•	Research topics and issues related to historic house museums, commercial district revitalization or nonprofit organizational development.•	Create graphics, report covers, survey forms, spread sheets, size photographs, simple maps, PowerPoint graphics or picture research.Internship LocationThe intern will work off site on his or her own PC and Microsoft operating system.  If you use a MAC, please discuss this during the interview, as you must have Microsoft Office Suite.  Progress meetings will occur weekly during the internship period at Heritage Consulting Inc.’s co-working facility in Philadelphia Center City or on the phone.Stipend and TimetableThe internship period is flexible, part time and project based.  Depending on projects in the office, there may be more than one internship opportunity.  We anticipate paying $15 an hour.  Depending on the need, some projects may have very limited turnaround time, weekend work is expected. All internships are project based. Interns will be 1099 employees, no benefits offered.  There may be opportunities to attend client meetings, but these will be determined on a case by case basis.ExperienceIntern must have excellent skills using the Microsoft Office Suite, library and Internet searching skills. High quality writing skills are essential as is copy editing.  Excellent attention to detail is expected.  Skills in graphic design programs are useful.  An intern with course work in urban planning, public policy, nonprofit management and/or historic preservation is preferred, and those enrolled in Master’s Degree programs are encouraged to apply.In the past ten years, our summer interns have continued to work for us after their internship and into the school year and after. We promoted two interns to associates in our firm and we actively assist all of our interns to find full time positions as they began their careers.  Heritage Consulting Inc. is an excellent place to start a career in preservation planning and economic development.To ApplyStudents wishing to apply for Heritage Consulting Inc.’s Internship should e-mail ALL of the following items as soon as possible, as we have immediate need for assistance.Please note in your cover letter any graphics programs in which you are skilled, whether you a valid drivers license (what state), your availability and career goals.  Please include ALL of the following items as PDF attachments in your email: A cover letter; current resume; a short (no more than three pages) writing sample; and names, email and phone numbers of three references.  Please supply ALL materials requested, as we will not contact applicants who fail to provide all of these documents.Please send all materials to donna@heritageconsultinginc.com.  Please no phone calls. Applicants we wish to interview will be contacted directly. Thank you.

283.desc: Job Description Oppenheimer provides Analysts with a high level of responsibility and extensive access to senior management and clients. Analyst will be part of the Technology M&A Team in San Francisco specialized in M&A transactions across various technology sectors. Transaction teams at Oppenheimer are typically small in size, providing Analysts with significant responsibilities early in their career.   Analysts’ responsibilities include:(i) 	prepare complex financial analyses and models(ii) 	conduct due diligence investigations of client companies(iii) 	support the preparation of detailed presentations and pitch materials  (iv) 	research potential buyers/investors and(viii) 	participate in various marketing and recruiting activities of the firm. Please submit a cover letter and resume to Jesus Espinoza at jesus.espinoza@opco.com include in the subject line SF Tech M&A.

284.desc: We have a great opportunity for growth and potential at our office in Philadelphia, PA. The IT Recruiting Coordinator will utilize an e-procurement system to access, review, interview and place technical candidates. We will provide all the necessary training and tools in order for you to become a successful IT Recruiting Coordinator. The IT Recruiting Coordinator also will oversee day-to-day tasks of full-cycle recruiting for our client in our Managed Services Program (MSP). Day-to-day tasks involve reviewing job descriptions, researching market salary ranges for job opportunities, creating and placing job postings, reviewing applicant resumes and recommending candidates for interview, scheduling interviews, submitting background checks and drug tests, coordinating candidate start details, and following up with the hiring manager after a worker starts.The typical schedule for this position will be Monday through Friday 8am -5pm. You must be willing to work outside of these hours when necessary.What you'll do:• Working with hiring managers to determine client labor needs and to set client expectations regarding turnaround time for temporary hires.• Process and fill assigned worker requisitions for senior level IT positions (Hyperion, Oracle, OLAP, Firmware, Web methods, Middleware, and Siebel).• High volume staffing in the entertainment and sports industry• Communicating with staffing suppliers regarding client labor needs to create a pool of candidates for each open job; scheduling interviews and/or communicating feedback about job applicants to suppliers when appropriate.• Managing the invoicing process and tracking invoice approvals/reconciliations.• Monitoring payroll activity for temporary workers.• Managing day-to-day customer service interaction with client, including daily information flow, problem solving, and training for online system use, with focus on continuous process improvements.• Creating and maintaining employee files to ensure compliance with contract-related services and requirements.• Tracking re-hire eligibility.• Managing on-boarding and orientation process.

285.desc: VaynerMedia is a social-first digital shop that focuses on storytelling across platforms. We keep creative, strategy and media buying all under one roof, which enables us to build and execute sophisticated digital campaigns that drive tangible business results for some of the biggest brands in the world.We believe in marketing to consumers based on the year we live in, which means that in 2016, we are executing campaigns predominantly on such digital platforms as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Snapchat and Pinterest. VaynerMedia is based in New York with offices in San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chattanooga.We are seeking driven individuals with analytical backgrounds to join our Ads Team. The Media Analyst role is an entry level position with a strong career path. General Qualifications:You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, high-energy environmentYou are both a creative and analytical personYou are detail-oriented and organizedYou want to have an impact and feel passionate about the work that you doYou are driven and hungry for success, and always want to learn moreYou are a team player and enjoy collaborationResponsibilities:Setup and daily management of advertising campaigns across various digital platformsOngoing, real-time optimization of live media to ensure client goals are met and/or exceededProvide media planning assistance for upcoming campaigns, helping determine platforms to run on, audiences to target, creative strategies to implement, and moreIncluding the setup, implementation and measurement of various controlled A/B testsAssist with client-facing campaign reporting and write-ups to ensure relevant metrics and insights are shownConstantly work to improve campaign performance, insights collection and takeaways, and generally strive to “over-deliver” to clientsRequired Skills/Experience:BA or BS degree (Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Finance a plus) or Entrepreneurial street credsAdvanced skills in Excel including pivot tables and macrosAbility to problem solve and think criticallyProven record of managing multiple projects at onceAbility to stay highly organized and efficient in a fast-paced, rigorous work environment

286.desc: ABOUT BREAKTHROUGH NEW YORKSince 1999 Breakthrough New York has been transforming the lives of motivated, low-income students by preparing them for and helping them enroll and persist in rigorous high schools and colleges. It is our mission to help them break through the obstacles that stand in the way so that they can succeed in the world. On a daily basis our students are breaking through and here at BTNY we’re proud to be a part of that road to success. ABOUT THE POSITIONAs Middle School Manager your leadership will launch the paths of BTNY students in their first two years of the program by managing the success of site coordinators at two middle school programming sites.  YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE… •	Oversee two middle school sites to ensure site coordinators are achieving the following organizational goals: •	100% of BTNY middle school students meet accountability expectations •	100% of BTNY rising 9th grade students matriculate to college-prep high schools•	Management of site coordinators ensuring development and growth•	Lead, plan and delegate middle school-wide projects, including Seasonal Staff recruitment and hiring, curriculum development, student data analysis, student admissions, and high school placement•	Serve as contact for a caseload of BTNY partner high school’s admissions contacts, deepening relationships with each•	Evaluate site performance regularly, identifying the need for improvements and rapidly implementing changes•	Act as a BTNY ambassador in developing and managing strategic relationships between BTNY and other organizations within the education and college success communities•	Use data to propose and implement strategic adjustments to middle school programming•	Manage program-wide data collection and evaluation systems •	Other duties as assigned

287.desc: The Foundation seeks a Program Manager who will manage our expanding program to protect wildlife and wildlands in Africa, with a current focus on east Africa.The Program Manager works closely with the Foundation’s President and Vice President on all aspects of grantmaking for the African wildlife program, including both day-to-day operations and broader program strategy development. The Program Manager reports to the Foundation’s Vice President.The Program Manager will contribute to programmatic ideas and participate actively in grantmaking by soliciting, developing, and recommending grants and administering projects in the program area. In addition, the Program Manager will have expertise and knowledge in one or more of the elements of the grantmaking program and will help build networks among funders and develop partnerships to leverage the impact of the Foundation's grant-making investments.  She/he will also work closely with contractors or grantees, some of whom will be located in Africa. The position is based in Washington, DC but will require periodic domestic and international travel. Essential Responsibilities and Tasks •	Implement the Foundation’s strategies on African wildlife protection. Actively partner with grantees and other stakeholders to develop effective campaign strategies; assemble and manage the required expertise and financial resources. Principal campaign tools include influencing government policy, service delivery, communications/media, educating and organizing, grassroots development, and coalition building, among others; •	Identify gaps or weaknesses in the overall campaign strategy (such as specific capacity, skill sets, or interest groups) and identify ways to fill the gaps; •	Maintain a breadth of knowledge, including research, about current trends, emerging issues, policy interventions, and innovations in African conservation issues to enhance the effectiveness of program strategy and understanding of Foundation staff and board;•	Recommend grants for funding by providing critical analysis of project strengths, weaknesses and risks;•	Perform due diligence and monitoring of grantees.  Work with grantees to develop timely and complete proposals.  Review proposals for project design, strategy, resource needs, and adequacy of program evaluation. Communicate regularly with the Vice President about existing grants, proposals and letters of inquiry;•	Design and execute program monitoring methods for Foundation grants and special projects, including negotiation of specific measureable objectives for grant contracts with each grantee;•	Manage the entire grantmaking process within the Foundation’s grants management software to ensure timely and accurate data, status, and reports;•	Prepare materials such as memoranda and reports for the Board of Trustees and present information at Board meetings and professional gatherings;•	Work closely with other Foundation staff and consultants to facilitate cross-program collaboration.This position will also perform other duties for the Foundation as required.  It is anticipated that over time the general and specific responsibilities of this position are likely to change as the Foundation’s activities and resources expand or change. Flexibility and a willingness to work in a team approach are essential.

288.desc: ABOUT BREAKTHROUGH NEW YORKSince 1999 Breakthrough New York has been transforming the lives of motivated, low-income students by preparing them for and helping them enroll and persist in rigorous high schools and colleges. It is our mission to help them break through the obstacles that stand in the way so that they can succeed in the world. On a daily basis our students are breaking through and here at BTNY we’re proud to be a part of that road to success. ABOUT THE POSITIONAs Site Coordinator you will change the lives of NYC middle schoolers by leading the first two years of their path as BTNY students and ensuring their placement into top high schools.  YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE… •	Work onsite at one BTNY middle school site along with another Site Coordinator, and your Manager •	Co-lead School Year and Summer programming at your site.  Ensure that your site achieves organizational goals: •	100% of middle school students meet accountability expectations •	100% of rising 9th grade students matriculate to college-prep high schools•	Oversee intern recruitment, selection, and training of your site’s seasonal staff (examples: School Year Tutors, Summer Teaching Fellows, Summer Instructional Coaches, etc.) •	Lead relationship with host site, and site vendors/service providers, and families •	Coach a cohort of 8th grade students through their high school application process •	Recruit and select annual incoming class of students •	Manage site-wide data collection and evaluation systems •	Other duties as assigned

289.desc: System Engineers at Architecture Technology Corporation (ATCorp) work closely with the Federal Aviation Administrations (FAA). ATCorp has now worked on more than 50 projects for the FAA, ranging from terminal and tower automation to runway safety. Our team in Washington DC is currently looking for the best Systems Engineers to help with FAAs NexGen  projects. ATCorp (http://atcorp.com)  was established in 1981 and is a privately owned firm with locations in Minneapolis, MN, Washington DC, Ithaca NY and San Jose, CA. ATCorp provides engineering services, technology research and development and software products for projects requiring state-of-the-art products and technology.  System Engineers work in our Engineering Services Division, which specializes in the design and development of large-scale, real-time, state-of-the-art systems. These engineers work in the fields of system engineering and real-time systems (e.g., air traffic control, runway safety). This team creates, implements and deploys  real-time systems that are part of the FAA initiatives to improve and re-shape how America Flies. Qualified individuals will have a minimum of a BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or and a technical background in: - Enterprise Architecture - Software Metrics Qualifications - System Engineering, system design and requirements specification - Air traffic control systems and applications / FAA experience - System Performance Engineering, Modeling and Measurement - Risk Assessment - Reliability, Maintainability and Availability  ATCorp offers a comprehensive benefits package with a pay range of $55K - $115K, including: Flexible Work Schedule, Paid Time Off (PTO), Life Insurance, Floating Holidays, Paid Holidays, 401(k), Long Term Disability (LTD), Short Term Disability (STD), Extended Leave Bank (ELB), Health and Dental Insurance, Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Fitness Discounts, Employee Assistance Program and Relocation.Work Authorization/Security Clearance:Candidates will be required to pass a background check. Per government contract requirements, candidates for these positions must be a citizen of the United States or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence. Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/ArchitectureTechnologyCorporationFollow us on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/architecture-technology-corporationTwitter: @jobsATCEngineerReports to	VP of Engineering Services Job summary	Design and or innovate new idea and technologies	Programming and research	Confirms product performance by designing and conducting tests	Extensive regular contact with assigned project clients	Participating in client/contractor meetings and resolving client/engineering and management project issues	Creating system and software architectures 	Developing, testing, and deploying software	Large-scale Software Systems Integration and test	Building commercial products 	Conduction research and development 	Providing customized consulting services	Application of systems analysis techniques and procedures	Determine hardware, software or system functional specifications	Assist in achieving project goals	Work with multiple projects 	Interface with various departments	Other jobs as assigned by supervisor Abilities Required	Self-starter, able to drive projects to completion in circumstances where little guidance and support is available	Knowledge of Microsoft Office	Must play well with othersStatus 	Full-time	Exempt DisclaimerThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.https://www.atcorp.com/about/careers/systems-engineer

290.desc: Underwriting Analyst Training ProgramPrivilege Underwriters, Inc. is the insurance holding company dedicated to creating an exceptional experience for responsible high net worth individuals and families that are members of Privilege Underwriters Reciprocal Exchange (PURE). We are currently seeking entrepreneurial, ambitious, and creative college graduates interested in learning, researching, and developing innovative approaches to the high net worth Insurance market. This is a dynamic role heavily focused in broker interactions, designed to provide outstanding analyst support while being challenged to meet our high standards of responsiveness, accuracy, efficiency, exceptional service and regulatory compliance.Visit our LinkedIn page to learn more about our organization: https://www.linkedin.com/company/pure-group-of-insurance-companies/careers?trk=top_nav_careersTraining ProgramAnalysts take part in a 3 month paid, comprehensive, team-oriented & fun-filled training program beginning in summer 2016 at our White Plains, NY headquarters to gain a strong foundation in high net worth property and casualty insurance—this includes learning about PURE products, solutions, and the successful practices that shape our organization and differentiate us from our competitors. The training program provides exposure to our Underwriting function among other facets of our business and will lead to full-time positions in Underwriting. Upon completion, analysts will be based out of our Scottsdale, AZ; Charleston, SC; Basking Ridge, NJ; Chicago, IL; New York, NY; or White Plains, NY offices. As an underwriting professional, a typical day might include:•	Developing, maintaining and managing broker partnerships in specific states and/or territories•	Developing strategies, goals, and tracking progress of state/territories by delivering exceptional, timely, complete and accurate service to brokers•	Learning how to manage a field of brokers to attain company growth, new business, and profitability goals•	Operating within authority and documentation guidelines and following up on accounts •	Analyzing, assessing, and selecting risks with an empathetic and profitable mindset in line with PURE’s strategy and underwriting guidelines•	Being challenged on assignments that may require a quick turnaround•	Attending trainings and workshops to further develop both personally and professionally during your career in Insurance•	Being recognized for exceptional performance •	Playing a game of ping pong in our café •	Knowing your efforts are truly valued and appreciatedCompany OverviewPURE is a policyholder-owned insurer providing best-in-class, customizable coverage throughout the U.S for high-value homes, automobiles, jewelry, art, personal liability and watercraft.  Inspired by some of the finest mutual and reciprocal insurers in the world, PURE emphasizes alignment of interests and transparency for its members. PURE’s low cost of capital, careful member selection, and proactive risk management all contribute to highly competitive rates.  As a member of The PURE Group, PURE is rated A- “Excellent” for Financial Strength by A.M. Best. We offer a full range of comprehensive benefits, including base salary, paid time off, medical, dental, commuter benefits, life insurance and a matching 401k program.If you are naturally curious, self-motivated and an eager learner with the passion to be a part of an exciting growth company, we encourage you to apply. PURE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

291.desc: Ivy Global is hiring essay editors, math test question writers, English content developers, administrators, and junior sales associates. Positions are available in New York City, Silicon Valley and throughout the US. Math test question writers and English content developers will create educational materials and practice test materials in the Mathematics or English Language domain for our publications. Administrators will be responsible for general office administrative duties, scheduling tutors/instructors and develop marketing materials. Junior sales associates will be responsible for networking with high schools, organizations, consultant and companies. Ivy Global is also hiring SAT/ACT instructors. SAT/ACT instructors will teach and prepare students taking the SAT. Both part-time and full-time positions are available.

292.desc: The New York Times is seeking an Analyst to join the Revenue Optimization group within the Advertising and Marketing departments. The Revenue Optimization group is a small, high-impact team that partners with Advertising and Marketing leadership to make more data-informed decisions about how the business is performing and where the most attractive opportunities for growth lie within our existing product / offer suite.The Analyst will report into the Director of Revenue Optimization and will work with Advertising and Marketing Finance, Marketing managers and Advertising product, and the Strategy & Development team embedded within the Revenue organization.On a day-to-day basis, the Analyst will help the Revenue Optimization group:In partnership with Finance, define, track, report on, analyze and otherwise master underlying revenue drivers so that Marketing and Advertising leaders can manage the day-to-day business, better plan and forecast revenue, identify longer-term challenges and opportunities and make decisions based on those insightsIn partnership with Marketing leaders, develop monetization strategies and investment plans to increase subscribers, revenue per subscriber and lifetime value by adjusting:Print and digital pricing and bundling strategyAnnual promotional calendar and differentiated offer testingRetention plans, loyalty and referral programs, cross-sell and up-sell strategies, etc., differentiated for key customer segmentsIn partnership with Advertising Finance (Pricing) and Advertising Product / Innovation, conduct analysis and make recommendations to support overall ad revenue by adjusting pricing and onsite inventory allocationThe New York Times is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics.

293.position: Experienced Teachers and Leaders Wanted for 2016-2017 School Year
293.desc: CalWest Educators Placement connects educators seeking their next opportunity with private, independent, and charter schools in the western United States. We recruit nationally to find exceptional leaders and teachers who meet the hiring needs of our partner schools. Benefits to partnering with us for your search:•           Personalized resume advice and suggestions•           Connections to schools with small classrooms and great resources •           Interview and school visit preparation•           Advocacy on your behalf to our partner schools•           A network of independent schools devoted to cultivating a more inclusive learning environment•           Career fairs with interviewing opportunities for educators seeking to broaden their network and develop professionally To apply to be a candidate in our 2016-2017 pool, please submit a current resume and brief letter of introduction to resume@calwesteducators.com. For more information, visit www.CalWestEducators.com We're also inviting our candidates who are new to independent schools to an Educator Workshop presented by CalWest with guest speaker Brad Rathgeber Executive Director of Online School for Girls.TopicTransitioning to Independent Schools -- A Guide to Mission, Culture, & EnvironmentThis workshop will be held in San Francisco on February 24th.We encourage applicants of diverse backgrounds to apply for any open position in which they feel qualified. We are committed to embracing diversity and consider all applicants for all positions without regard to color, ethnic background, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected class. CalWest is committed to providing inclusive opportunities for all prospective candidates.

294.desc: DEPARTMENT OVERVIEWThe Model Risk Management (MRM) group is a multidisciplinary group of quantitative experts at Goldman Sachs with presence in New York, London, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Bangalore.The group’s primary mandate is to manage risk that arises from quantitative models used in the firm through its range of businesses – from models used for derivatives valuation to models used for risk management, liquidity and capital computations. In addition to independently reviewing these classes of models for their validity, theoretical consistency and implementation accuracy, the group is also responsible to assess the risk associated with model choice, e.g., exposure to choice of model in various contexts such as pricing exotic options or in calculating capital.Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet. © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2015. All rights reserved.

295.desc: About AxiomAxiom Learning strives to be a catalyst for educational change globally.  We are a new kind of learning laboratory focusing on achieving children’s full potential. Axiom is an innovative start up, a hub for smart, idealistic people aspiring to unleash the greatness in every child. Our customized, 1-on-1 instruction is designed to empower students of all ages to find happiness and success in all aspects of their lives. We are growing rapidly and looking for the most passionate educators to join us.Axiom needs instructors to serve as both faculty members and innovators in our expansion. Instructors will design and apply creative lesson plans in traditional subjects, non-traditional subjects, and in supporting unique learners. They will also work on projects from developing educational standards in other nations to supporting charter school reform. Through these projects that support our mission statement, instructors will have many opportunities for growth and promotion. As we open more centers, we are looking to hire business managers and educational managers from within.Job DescriptionWe are looking for smart, energetic people who are enthusiastic about changing the world one student at a time. Instructors need to posses the ability to actively adapt teaching approaches based on each student's learning styles and learning objectives. Faculty members will also need to take initiative and be proactive to help Axiom reach its greatest potential as a learning laboratory and catalyst for change.Our centers generally serve students 5 to 18 years of age. We are currently looking for full-time/part-time faculty as well as summer interns with experience in any level and subject to join our expanding team. During the academic year, each learning center's busiest hours are after school (typically 3:00-8:00 PM) and weekends (8:00-8:00 PM). Therefore, instructors must be available to work afternoons and evenings. A typical work week is Sunday-Thursday OR Tuesday-Saturday. NOTE: When applying, please clarify which Axiom region(s) and positions (full-time/part-time/summer internship) you are interested in applying to. In addition, candidates moving on to the first round will be asked to prepare a 5-10 minute lesson on the subject of their choosing.Responsibilities1) Teaching a range of student sessions based on qualifications and experience. a) Standardized Test Prep  b) Traditional Academic Subjects c) Learning Efficiency and Cognitive Processing   d) Executive Functioning 2) Prepare weekly, customized lesson plans, and long-term 5 week plans for every student3) Provide weekly reports on students’ progress4) Create detailed progress reports for every student each academic semester5) Attend weekly team meetings, prepare to give updates on students, discuss questions or concerns, and make short presentations to share teaching resources and strategies6) Research, design, and apply innovative curricula for long-term educational projects7) Take the lead on initiatives that support Axiom’s mission statement8) Contribute to marketing, human resources, and other aspects of company operations, based on interests and experienceRequirements Some work experience in teaching or relevant fieldB.A./B.S. requiredLocationsBoston (Harvard Square, Wellesley, Concord, Chestnut Hill, Newton)California (Los Altos, Menlo Park, San Francisco)New York (Manhattan)Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

296.company: GOALOOP - Connecting the world through goals
296.desc: Join us as we near Goaloop's public launch! We are seeking two Marketing + Business Development Interns to become important members of our small, innovative team.You will gain experience in all aspects critical to the growth of a startup, from social media campaigns to forging strategic partnerships. You will be encouraged to participate in brainstorming sessions and to contribute your ideas.Got a goal? Goaloop it! State your goal on Goaloop, and people and resources come to you to help you achieve it. Goaloop connects the world through goals. If your goal is to learn the piano, you'll see goals to teach the piano. Connecting goals expands social circles and increases commercial opportunities. Connecting goals, we can achieve anything together!Most social networks connect the world based on 'who', Goaloop connects the world based on 'what' -- what your goals are. Our model expands social circles, increases commercial opportunities, and skyrockets collaboration and innovation.Read about our technical leaders and other members of the Goaloop team at:https://goaloop.com/about (click through)      andhttp://entrepreneurship.columbia.edu/founders/goaloop/We are a small, growing team, located close to Columbia University's main campus in New York City. We welcome great candidates near and far; working remotely is an option -- we come together for team meetings, in person and online, depending on your location.Milestones to date:-- Our software has been developed to function globally-- Goaloop is patent pending-- Raised $1.2 million to date-- We are an Astia company (http://astia.org)-- Our launch partners include the YWCA of NYC, The Rao Institute, and Ellevate (formerly 85 Broads)-- Our IP Portfolio includes several registered trademarks, including:- Connecting the world through goals - The Goal Market - The Goal Engine - The Goal Network - Get found and find others based on goals- Where goals and money meet - We're banking on your goals - Reach and market your full potential - The Goal Index - Got a goal? - Swing - Logos (3 design marks)-- We have a Co-Existence Agreement with Google-- We are launching with two revenue streams-- Cultivated an exceptional team and Advisory BoardMost openings require a major commitment, but we are open to flex schedules and part-time involvement as well. Join us and become an important member of the innovative team that launches Goaloop! To apply, use this system, or please email your cover letter and resum to goalooping@goaloop.com or fill out the form at: http://marketpowerforall.com/machform/view.php?id=8We look forward to hearing from you.Got a goal? Goaloop it!Connecting goals, we can achieve anything together.https://goaloop.comYou'll find more information on our social media accounts, and we were just featured within IBM's Center for Applied Insights: Discover and apply new ideas.

297.desc: Group Gordon’s Marketing and Business Development intern will work closely with the marketing team to support activities aimed at growing the firm’s business. In addition to contributing to a variety of marketing tactics to maximize the firm’s exposure, interns will help identify, research, and pitch potential clients. The ideal candidate is highly organized, has strong research and writing skills, and demonstrates an interest in marketing and business development.About Group GordonGroup Gordon is a high-end corporate PR firm that develops and executes smart communications strategy to elevate its clients. With offices in New York, Chicago, and Philadelphia, Group Gordon works in multiple industries, including finance, law, real estate, public affairs, and nonprofit. We assist clients with strategic planning, media relations, branding, crisis management, media training, and digital. The firm's diversity of experience and understanding of its clients' goals produce inspired solutions to the toughest challenges.

298.desc: Assist in the management of a private equity portfolio comprised of primary fund commitments, direct co-investments and secondary purchases.  Work closely day-to-day as part of a small team in a New York-based office (and with regular contact with Munich and Singapore based colleagues). The primary responsibilities will include the following:- Provide analytical support for the due diligence of primary, co-investment and secondary investment opportunities. The focus will be on both quantitative elements and qualitative considerations- Assist deal lead in the preparation of investment proposals- Assist senior staff in evaluating the terms and conditions of private equity funds and their impact on economics and alignment of interest- Actively participate in meetings with intermediaries and General Partners- Assist in maintaining deal flow database and perform related analyses - Participate in internal Investment Committee discussions and assist deal teams in responding to questions from Committee members- Conduct market mapping and related sourcing activities in North and South America- Work alongside senior investment professionals to actively monitor existing investments- Represent team at industry and investor conferences

299.desc: The Group Gordon Internship Program provides firsthand experiences in research, writing, and pitching skills to students interested in public relations. Interns are fully integrated into the firm and work closely with employees on a number of short-term and long-term client projects. Group Gordon is a high-end corporate PR firm that develops and executes smart communications strategy to elevate its clients. With offices in New York, Chicago, and Philadelphia, Group Gordon works in multiple industries, including finance, law, real estate, public affairs, and nonprofit. We assist clients with strategic planning, media relations, branding, crisis management, media training, and digital. The firm's diversity of experience and understanding of its clients' goals produce inspired solutions to the toughest challenges.

300.desc: Redfin is a well-funded technology startup that’s revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry. We use data, innovative design, and beautiful software to put consumers first throughout the process of buying and selling homes.  Get ready to dive headfirst into our award-winning website and mobile apps and solve challenging business problems in a customer friendly way.  Unleash your brilliance and do work that matters .If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you.At Redfin, you’ll be part of something much bigger than just a job. You will help us empower customers and real estate agents with state-of-the-art, end-to-end technology. You’ll work on tough technical problems in big data, automation, search, platforms, engaging and intuitive user interfaces, and much more to transform buying and selling a home into a web and mobile experience.We have a variety of opportunities and will consider you for all available roles:WHO YOU ARE[Software Developer I]●	You have or are working towards completing a computer science or technical engineering degree●	You have a knack for building rock-solid and well tested code●	You have a strong knowledge of CS fundamentals, algorithms & data structure●	You love beautiful, simple user interfaces●	You are an advocate for customer experience[Software Engineer in Test I]●	You have or are working towards completing a computer science or technical engineering degree●	You are obsessed with bringing out the best in a product, able to create automated tests and tools that uncover every strange corner case you can think of before a feature makes it to our customers. ●	You have obsessive attention to detail. You’ve found several things wrong with this job posting already and can’t wait to tell us about them. You’re going to be really opinionated about it too.●	You are familiar with HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Java and have a passion for automation[Product Manager 1]●	You have or are working towards completing a computer science or technical engineering degree●	You are creative and customer-service focused with zeal for building an addictive, delightful user experience, and the instinct to identify with the customer●	You have an interest and knowledge in human-computer interaction and basic CS fundamentals●	You hit the ground sprinting and use your killer creativity, sense of urgency and common sense to guide you●	You have strong leadership skills that allow you to partner with our engineers and business execsTECHNOLOGIES WE USE & TEACH●	Swift & React.js●	Redshift, DynamoDB & EMR●	Google Maps, native iOS & Android SDKs, Objective-C●	Postgres, Hadoop●	JS, AJAX, JSP, HTML, CSS, Java, Spring, Hibernate, and various other tools/librariesWE OFFER●	Awesome start-up culture (snacks, lunches, office events, casual dress code)●	Small teams with great exposure to all levels of the company●	Great locations (downtown Seattle and downtown San Francisco)●	Competitive compensation and 3-weeks paid vacation annually●	Generous benefits; 100% of medical, dental & vision premiums paid by Redfin●	Support and resources to continue learning●	Amazingly smart and fun teammates, and a management team invested in your growth and success●	Seattle's #1 best place to work in 2014 by Seattle Business MagazineRedfin is an equal opportunity employer

We use data, innovative design, and beautiful software to put the consumers first throughout the process of buying and selling homes.  Get ready to dive headfirst into our award-winning website and mobile apps and solve challenging business problems in a customer friendly way.  Unleash your brilliance and do work that matters.  If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you.At Redfin, you’ll be part of something much bigger than just a job. You will help us empower customers and real estate agents with state-of-the-art, end-to-end technology. You’ll work on tough technical problems in big data, automation, search, platforms, engaging and intuitive user interfaces, and much more to transform buying and selling a home into a web and mobile experience.We have a variety of opportunities and will consider you for all available roles:WHO YOU ARE[Software Developer Intern]:●	You are working towards a degree in computer science or code that will withstand millions of users hammering on it.  ●	You have a strong knowledge of CS fundamentals, algorithms, and data structures, and a passion for writing code. ●	You love beautiful, simple user interfaces, and you constantly wonder what you could have done to make your last project simpler.[Software Engineer in Test Intern]: ●	You are working towards a degree in computer science or engineering. ●	You are obsessed with bringing out the best in a product, able to create automated tests and tools that uncover every strange corner case you can think of before a feature makes it to our customers. ●	You thrive to increase developer productivity by solving hard problems and researching new tools/libraries. ●	You are familiar with HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Java and have a passion for automation. ●	You’re excited to spend 12 weeks working alongside our brilliant and passionate team to ensure our products are ready to launch.[Product Manager Intern]: ●	You are working towards a degree in computer science or engineering. ●	You are creative and customer-service focused with zeal for building an addictive, delightful user experience, and the instinct to identify with the customer. ●	You hit the ground sprinting and use your killer creativity, sense of urgency and common sense to guide you.●	 You have an interest and knowledge in human-computer interaction, basic CS fundamentals, and strong leadership skills that allow you to partner with our engineers and business execs.●	 You are excited to spend 12 weeks utilizing both your technical skills and business acumen to be successful.TECHNOLOGIES WE USE & TEACH●	Swift & React.js●	Redshift, DynamoDB & EMR●	Google Maps, native iOS & Android SDKs, Objective-C ●	Postgres, Hadoop●	JS, AJAX, JSP, HTML, CSS, Java, Spring, Hibernate, and various other tools/librariesWE OFFER●	Awesome start-up culture (snacks, lunches, office events, casual dress code)●	Competitive compensation●	Projects that allow you to interact and work with different teams, including tech, design and marketing●	Most interns’ projects go into production within the 12 week internship, so you can experience the full lifecycle, teams with great exposure to all levels of the company●	Relocation stipend provided for eligible candidates●	Opportunity to demonstrate your skills and receive a full time offer or return
