At Dow Jones you're not going to get lost among countless aisles of drones.•	We have fun !•	We encourage and support each other in creating new ideas by paying attention to the world out there, using our imagination, experimenting, and learning from success and failure.•	We want you to be yourself, speak your mind, and know that nothing here is above question.*LI-JA1Requisition ID2015-27636

330.desc: Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.Tenable now has over 400 employees globally and 20,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by the Washington Post, Baltimore Sun, Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.Do you have a desire to work in Finance at a high-growth Software company in the Baltimore area?Tenable Network Security has a Financial Analyst Internship opportunity for college students in their junior year. If you're looking for a chance to apply what you're learning in your degree program, as well as work for an industry-leading employer then we invite you to apply to be a Finance intern at Tenable. Tenable is a fast growing, private-equity backed information security Software company that is seeking a college junior to serve as a Summer Financial Analyst.  Working within the Finance Department, the Analyst will help create financial projection models using Excel and other software programs including NetSuite and Salesforce.com.  Additional responsibilities include creating financial dashboards and reports for use by the Board of Directors and senior leadership of the company.  Presentations will generally be prepared in PowerPoint.  The summer experience will be fast paced and hands on.

331.company: BSD Code and Design Academy USA
331.desc: Do you want to be part of building the tech talent of the future for America?Join the BSD Code and Design Academy team in Philadelphia to give kids the tools they need to succeed.BSD is an internationally-present Technology Education Academy in the USA, Hong Kong and Thailand. We are on a mission to educate the next generation through relevant courses that deep-dive kids into the world of code.Instructors at BSD don’t just teach - they are at the core of our academy communities as learning innovators constantly developing new ideas and learning themselves. Our instructors represent the face of everything that we do.BSD teaches kids in the same way they naturally learn in the real world: with practical experience. Breaking tech isn’t a mistake, it’s an opportunity to learn, correct, and take another step forward. BSD Instructors are developers, designers, marketers, and much more with a range of professional and teaching experience, united by their passion for the opportunities that technology affords us all and a burning desire to share that knowledge with the next generation.You will:Teach coursesCreate coursesCurate a BSD spirit of learning in our communityBe a teacher, innovator and creator of new product ideasBe a marketer and part of the face of our companyThis role is part of the startup of BSD in America. This means that you will participate in building the future of the business and that we will create schemes and options programs that will recognize this. You will have the opportunity to see the marks of what you build today in the future of the company (and the success of the students that work with us in their futures too!)As with any startup, in return you will need to work in an environment that can undergo huge change overnight. You must be adaptive and resilient to survive this. You must genuinely feel passion for what BSD aims to achieve and see what you are undertaking in working with BSD as a lifestyle, not simply as your work.

332.desc: About LiverampLiveRamp is the leader in data connectivity, helping the worlds largest brands use their data to improve customer interactions on any channel and device. We thrive on mind-bending technical challenges and value entrepreneurship, humility, and constant personal growth.About This JobCant be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. Its hard to say what tomorrows challenge will be, but youll be happy to hack away at it, whether its a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.ResponsibilitiesDesign and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.Contribute towards building a great company.QualificationsExcited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.Perfect for talented new grads or those with under 2 years of related experience.Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.Employee BenefitsOwn equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.Work in the heart of San Francisco  the best city in the world.

333.company: U.S. Department of Justice, Antitrust Division (SF
333.desc: The San Francisco office of the Antitrust Division of the U.S. Department of Justice is seeking highly motivated college graduates to assist attorneys with all aspects of its civil and criminal investigations and litigation.  Paralegal positions with the Division present real opportunities for significant responsibility, hands-on experience and rewarding public service.  Now is the time to take advantage of the substantive training, exciting legal work, and excellent reputation the Department has to offer.  We have 5 positions available beginning summer 2016 for a two-year term appointment at the GS-07 level ($47,525 per year).  As with most government jobs, all applicants will be required to apply for these jobs through the government hiring website www.usajobs.gov.  However, exceptional candidates with GPA of 3.45 are encouraged to email the requested documents directly to steven.taylor@usoj.gov to learn more about the positions.

334.position: Real Estate Broker Summer Internship – New York City
334.desc: MyGradPad is a hybrid Real Estate Technology Company headquartered in New York City with an office in Boston as well. Our mission is to simplify every step of finding an apartment by combining innovative technology with experienced real estate agents. We specialize in marketing to college students, recent grads and young professionals. Our company is comprised of three divisions: real estate brokerage, marketing, and technology.

335.desc: AroundCampus Group is the leading collegiate media and marketing company in the U.S. As an AroundCampus summer sales intern, you will help connect UPenn with the local Philadelphia community by selling advertising that will appear in the UPenn and Drexel student planners, on our mobile app, website, and digital signage (on select campuses).As a Sales Representative you will:•	Attend our week-long, nationally recognized Sales Foundations Academy Training Program at the University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill campus; all expenses paid.•	Learn and execute the AroundCampus steps of the sales process.•	Develop prospecting and lead generation skills.•	Consult and build relationships with local and corporate businesses in Philadelphia, PA.•	Retain current advertising packages through excellent customer service and account management techniques.•	Develop interpersonal and professional skills as an individual and in a team setting.•	Strive to achieve a team sales goal•	Gain a skill set that will set you apart from your peers in today’s job marketWe want people who are:•	Confident, driven, competitive and obsessed about their future•	Great listeners who love to work with people •	Goal-oriented people who like working alone as much as they like working with a team•	Willing to constantly learn, improve, and adapt quickly•	Excited about discovering and exploring Philadelphia, PA•	Versatile; building relationships across many verticals Job Requirements:•	Full-time availability Monday through Friday, 8:30am – 5:30pm•	Vehicle or Train and Bus passes for the entire summer•	Housing in or near Philadelphia, PAWonder what happens after the internship? We also have an awesome line up of Career Partners waiting to talk to you about their full time, highly coveted positions once you have completed the AC program. Check them out:MemoryBlue • Bloomberg BNA • Echo Global Logistics • TEKSystems • TelePacific CommunicationsADP • Ferguson • Enterprise • Edward Jones • Netsuite • Federated Insurance • CEDReynolds and Reynolds • CEB • Stephen Gould • Tom James • VerizonApplication Instructions: Apply online at www.aroundcampusgroup.com/os-apply. You may email Mike at mstobbe@aroundcampus.com expressing interest, or if you have any questions.Positions available in Delaware: NewarkPositions available in Washington, DC and Maryland: College Park, Washington, DCPositions available in Pennsylvania: Altoona, Bethlehem, Clarion, Easton, Erie, Elizabethtown, Indiana, Lancaster, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Shippensburg, Slippery Rock, State College, West Chester, West Philadelphia *You must have Housing and a Vehicle or Train and Bus passes(preferred) in or near the Philadelphia area (or another AC market), in order to apply for this internship.

336.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the Role:Minted is seeking a talented and passionate Senior Director, New Business Operations to join our Supply Chain team. This individual will be responsible for developing and executing supply chain strategies for new businesses, including Home Decor. The Senior Director, New Business Operations will be accountable for scaling and managing our supply chain for new businesses, including managing supplier relationships and in-house facilities. He/She will ensure we deliver high quality products that meet our customers’ expectations by leveraging customer data to develop action plans at Minted and with our partners. This role is also responsible for managing to key margin and cost targets to ensure the company meets overall profitability goals. He/She will enjoy “rolling up his/her sleeves” to make an impact and deliver results resourcefully. This position reports to the SVP, Operations.Specific Responsibilities:Supply Chain Strategy: Develop and execute supply chain strategies for new businesses that ensure we can deliver on our quality, profitability and sales goalsGrowth Infrastructure: Build the supply chain infrastructure to ensure Minted can scale new verticals, including home decor. Evaluate when it makes sense to leverage 3rd parties vs. vertically integrate from a cost, time, and quality perspectiveProduct Quality: Deliver best in class product quality by setting aggressive, but achievable goals, and drive quality improvement action plans throughout the organization and with supplier organizationsMargin and Cost Management: Manage to key margin and cost goals for new businesses to ensure the company meets its overall profitability goalsTechnology Roadmap: Partner with product and engineering teams to ensure roadmap priorities support new business scaling efforts. Operationalize functionality to ensure full return on investment and operational efficienciesQ4 Preparation and Execution: Develop and execute Q4 scaling, capacity, labor and execution plans with cross functional partners and suppliers to meet Q4 customer satisfaction, sales and profit goals

337.desc: BackgroundThe Frick Collection is an art museum with a collection of more than 1,100 works of art—dating from the thirteenth to the nineteenth century—displayed in the intimate surroundings of the former home of Henry Clay Frick. The residence, with its furnishings and works of art, has been open to the public since 1935. It is considered one of the world's most perfect museums; its sister research institution, the Frick Art Reference Library founded in 1920, is of equal distinction. The library is an internationally recognized research library that serves as one of the world's most complete resources for the study of Western art.Internship Projects will include research for and the writing of webpages, blog posts, Wikipedia and Tumblr entries that relate to the Library and its collections, as well as involvement with our digital art history initiative and survey work on the collections. Individual and collaborative projects will be decided in consultation with the interns to reflect their skills and interests.EligibilityThe Administration Internship is open to qualified undergraduates or graduate students in art history, library and information science, or other relevant fields. Foreign nationals must have eligibility to participate in unpaid internship placements in the U.S.  Applicants are responsible for their own housing and travel arrangements.Time CommitmentIntern activities are generally carried out four days a week between the hours of 10 a.m. and 4 p.m.; however, an alternative schedule may be discussed.Benefits of an Internship with The Frick Collection The library administration interns' time at The Frick allows them to experience how a house museum, The Frick Collection, and a very specialized art history library, the Frick Art Reference Library, operate. There are opportunities to publish social media postings, e.g. Wikipedia articles, Tumblr and other blog posts, etc. Interns gain professional skills and learn about museum and library practice in a supportive environment. The Frick Collection offers a beautiful and pleasant work setting and an excellent opportunity to appreciate some of the world’s finest works of art.  There is no stipend associated with this internship. However, all interns of The Frick Collection may access free or discounted admission to most of New York’s finest museums. Summer interns will attend a wide range of staff-led enrichment sessions, such as gallery talks by curators and conservators, visits to conservation studios, introductions to the resources of the Frick Art Reference Library, and behind-the-scenes tours of museums and galleries around New York City. The Frick provides employees, trainees, interns, and volunteers with a discount on Museum Shop purchases and a subsidized on-site staff dining service. Application Process and Timeline: All FARL Administrative Department Internship applications for summer 2016 must be submitted no later than February 29, 2016.   Selected candidates will be contacted for interviews, and applicants will be notified by the end of April 2016.  All internship applications must be submitted via e-mail to Library Administrator at internships@frick.org, as follows:   Subject Line:  “FARL Administration Intern – Summer 2016” 	Submit PDF cover letter and resume.Include the following in your cover letter-Your reasons for applying to the Frick Art Reference Library-Your preferred dates and hours of availability (to be discussed if selected for an interview)No phone calls please.  FARL Administration Department Internshipsinternships@frick.org					The Frick Collection 1 East 70th StreetNew York, NY  10021	Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principal at The Collection, where selectin for employment/intern/ volunteer opportunities is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, alienage or citizenship status, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, military status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other protected characteristic as established by law.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment//internship/volunteerism, including, but not limited to, hiring/selection, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. This description shall not be construed as a contract of any sort for a specific period of employment/internship/volunteer placement.

338.desc: Your teamRisk management and control are integral parts of UBS’s commitment to providing consistent, high quality returns to our shareholders. The delivery of superior returns depends on achieving the appropriate balance between risk and return. The Risk function seeks to actively promote good business conduct and support the business in building and maintaining the bank's reputation as the basis for sustainable financial success. It also designs and defines the firm's risk management framework and assesses its effectiveness. We also identify, assess, advise, decide, monitor and report on credit, market and operational risks and recommend and/or initiate appropriate mitigating actions. Your roleAs a member of our risk team you’ll help us protect UBS’s reputation, financial health and long-term interests by helping us identify measure and control any and all risks to our business.Credit Risk Control•	Analyze time sensitive credit requests across banking, and trading products (eg, OTC derivatives, futures and repo).•	Analysis of complex transactions including the establishment of internal risk ratings and exposure tolerances  •	Counterparty rating assessment and financial analysis for institutional clients•	Conduct research to improve lending value levels for certain products•	Perform ad hoc stress testing relating to particular issues, industry segments, countries in collaboration with other key partners across credit risk control, market risk and other logistics functions. •	Interact with lending product specialists, traders, salespeople, Market Risk and Credit Risk Officers, UBS branch offices, international UBS offices•	Explain risk methodology to various internal partnersMarket Risk Control•	Assist MRC staff in the development and production of market risk reporting of key risk sensitivities for trading and banking books throughout the business•	Assist MRC quantitative staff in development and representation of risk modeling•	Interact with teams throughout the business units and assess data related to UBS positions with market risk•	Review of new products and stress analyses•	Develop and utilize awareness of market events to highlight impacts to UBS business unitsPositions are located in Stamford, CT; New York, NY; and Weehawken, NJ.InternshipThe Summer Intern Program is a structured, 10 week program.  Interns will be placed into one of the functions and locations above as determined at the time of the commencement of the program. The program is targeted to students graduating in December 2016 or June 2017.  In addition to the experience and education acquired on the job while working on real projects with business impact, interns engage with senior leaders in a conversational setting via a weekly speaker series, and develop cross-business networks via social and educational events. As the primary pipeline into UBS's analyst program for college undergraduates, Summer Interns are considered for the Risk Control Graduate Training Program at the end of the summer. About UBSUBS is committed to providing private, institutional and corporate clients worldwide, as well as retail clients in Switzerland, with superior financial advice and solutions while generating attractive and sustainable returns for shareholders. Its strategy centers on its Wealth Management and Wealth Management Americas businesses and its leading universal bank in Switzerland, complemented by its Global Asset Management business and its Investment Bank. These businesses share three key characteristics: they benefit from a strong competitive position in theirtargeted markets, are capital-efficient, and offer a superior structural growth and profitability outlook. UBS's strategy builds on the strengths of all of its businesses and focuses its efforts on areas in which it excels, while seeking to capitalize on the compelling growth prospects in the businesses and regions in which it operates. Capital strength is the foundation of its success.Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, UBS has offices in more than 50 countries, including all major financial centers, and approximately 60,000 employees. UBS Group AG is the holding company of the UBS Group. Under Swiss company law, UBS Group AG is organized as an Aktiengesellschaft, a corporation that has issued shares of common stock to investors. The operational structure of the Group comprises the Corporate Center and five business divisions: Wealth Management, Wealth Management Americas, Retail & Corporate, Global Asset Management and the Investment Bank.Your experience and skillsCandidates must graduate from a 4 year Bachelor’s degree program or equivalent between December 2016 and June 2017, and have a cumulative GPA of 3.4 or above. Official transcripts will be required to verify GPA.We look for individuals who seek challenge in an intellectually stimulating environment.  Relevant experience includes Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Research, Engineering, Accounting, or Finance.  However, we have found that candidates come from a variety of academic backgrounds, and we find individual qualities more important than a specific major or concentration. We seek candidates with the following qualities:•	Skills: Strong writing and communication skills•	Intellectual caliber: Analytical, creative, intelligent•	Values: Ethical, hardworking, trustworthy, dedicated, team oriented•	Temperament: Assertive, confident, mature, competitive, committedTake the next stepAll candidates must apply online at www.ubs.com/graduates. Please enter job reference (#112278BR) in the keyword field of the search page.  If we recruit on your campus and you are required to apply through your Career Services Office, you must also submit an application to our website.UBS is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

339.position: Algorithm and Software Development for Computational Biochemistry
339.desc: Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.   Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishment.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation.   Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine. To submit an application, please use the link provided below:  http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/CSD. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

340.desc: Founded by diabetes experts, patients, and market research professionals, dQ&A Market Research Inc. is a San Francisco-based, patient-centric market research company that focuses exclusively on diabetes and obesity. Our proprietary panels of patients, diabetes educators, and primary care physicians have allowed us to accurately reflect the patient voice and offer our clients expert, rapid, and trustworthy insights to various diabetes business questions. dQ&A clients include Fortune 500 pharmaceutical and medical device companies, as well as many leaders and innovators in the field, who seek to better understand what and how patients think, and the market as a whole.dQ&A Analysts: dQ&A analysts demonstrate genuine interest in diabetes and healthcare, and keep up-to-date on developments in the diabetes market. They assist in the writing and fielding of surveys, the analysis of the resulting qualitative and quantitative data, and the translation of this analysis into reports and visual representations of data to provide genuine market insights and solutions. Analysts are also presented with opportunities to interact with leaders and influencers in the diabetes field, as well as senior managers at client companies. The position may involve travel to conferences held in the USA.dQ&A is an equal opportunity employer. It offers competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, complete medical and dental insurance programs, and retirement benefits.

341.position: Analyst - Market Research, Consumer Goods Division
341.desc: Analyst - (entry level to 2 years' experience)Location: Hoboken, NJ (10 minutes from NYC by public transportation)Additional opportunities available: San Francisco and Atlanta Do you want to influence the decisions of the world’s leading companies? Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding role in the technology, healthcare and/or consumer goods industries, working with a variety of methodologies and marketing issues? Do you have a passionate curiosity about what and why people do what they do? Are you really good at what you do? Join us!Your roleAs an Analyst, you will manage all phases of market research projects and provide our clients with the insights that drive their businesses forward, in the process:•	Perform and manage market research projects from start to finish: survey setup and design, managing data collection, analyzing the data and creating a presentation to make recommendations for your clients’ strategic business issues.•	Discuss strategic business problems with the client, along with other members of the SKIM team•	Independent management of client contact during day-to-day project management.•	Pro-active contribution towards the improvement of our services and products.•	Ensuring that the assigned projects are optimally carried out and deadlines are met.Your profileWe are looking for dedicated, smart and enthusiastic team players with:•	Robust academic track record from a top tier program (Bachelor’s degree required).  Studies in the areas of: Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Business Administration, Market Research, Marketing, Medical or Behavioral Science, Life Sciences, or Psychology. •	Strong interest in healthcare, consumer goods or technology/telecom services.•	Entry–level (recent grad) to 2 years work experience preferably from market research, marketing or management consulting companies highly desirable. •	Excellent analytical, oral, and written skills required. •	Interest in an organization that is globally diverse with a complex and dynamic environment. •	Entrepreneurial and pro-active attitude towards your career with a strong interest in quantitative and/or qualitative market research methodologies. •	**Must be authorized to work in the United States presently and/or in the future. **Our offerSKIM is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) who offers a flexible working environment. We provide a competitive salary and benefits package including: employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage, 4% match on 401(k), paid vacation, sick and personal time, casual dress code, flex hours and a Summer Hours program. We are located two blocks from the Hoboken train station and PATH train lines. Trip from NYC is approx. 10 minutes. We are committed to employee development.  Working with us allows you to use your own initiative to help make a success of SKIM’s business and of your career. If interested, please submit resume and cover letter STATING AREA OF INTEREST (Healthcare, Consumer Product, or Telecom/Services). All qualified candidates should apply to the SKIM website under the careers section at skimgroup.com.** Paid relocation not available for positions outside of NY/NJ area.

342.desc: Business Development Executive, Pareto Law, New YorkCompetitive NY salary + Benefits/OTEREF: PLINTBDENYCome and join our expanding family...Enjoy a competitive salary, annual incentive trips to the likes of Europe, the UK or Dubai, rapid and realistic progression alongside a company culture that is next to none. Are YOU made for Pareto?So whats involved? Well, our Business Development Executives are an extremely valuable and highly prized asset: the driving force for sourcing, generating and building new business for the future of Pareto. You will need to be creative and able to think outside the box; proactive in pursing new opportunities and strategic in your thinking and approach. You will build on excellent communication skills and product knowledge to pitch to new and prospective clients. Commercial awareness and good business sense are essential as you identify, qualify and speak with business opportunities, as well as tracking your leads daily. Building business relationships with clients will also be essential. What You Get  We believe our people deserve the very best. So when it comes to rewarding our team, we go one step further. Our advanced products and services cover the whole trading lifecycle, from low latency trading tools to settlement, compliance and risk management.Each year we offer a number of students the opportunity to develop their careers in our rapidly expanding business and we're looking for driven, passionate, and diverse students like you to help us make an impact and create cutting edge applications used across the world. Role DescriptionAs a Fidessa Client Delivery Management intern, you will spend 10 weeks in our  New York City office embedded within our America’s Client Delivery Management group.  Client Delivery Management is responsible for  maintaining client relationships, driving implementation of projects and other initiatives post contract.  Our Delivery Management Team is formed of an enthusiastic mix of people with strong technical, functional and customer service skills. This department touches many aspects of business including project management, business management and relationship management.  If you are interested in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you work as part of a team, make an impact and get recognized for it, then Fidessa's Client Delivery Management Internship experience is *the* opportunity for you! Why should you join us?Our 10 week internship program will provide you with meaningful work that will further your education and give you hands-on experience in your field. •	Paid Internship for our New York or Chicago office•	Participate in New Hire Onboarding program that introduces you to         Fidessa and the financial trading industry•	Work on projects that enable you to add value to our business•	Partner with mentors who will work closely with you every step of the         way to answer questions, provide insight, and give feedback•	Secure an opportunity to be considered for a full-time offer to join                Fidessa upon graduationWhat are some of the perks of Interning at Fidessa?•	Gaming area to enjoy with your new friends and colleagues.•	Lunch & Learn and Speaker Series with free lunch.•	Various activities and outings. 344.desc: Who we are: Title Forward, a wholly owned subsidiary of Redfin Corporation, is a group of well-funded technology and real estate entrepreneurs. Our mission is simple. We want to modernize the multi-billion dollar title and settlement industry to deliver a seamless, transparent, and delightful experience to buyers and borrowers and make our real estate and lending partners look like geniuses and rockstars in the process. We want to revolutionize the title and settlement industry and create an experience for our customers, agents, and lenders that is unparalleled in the title industry. We are putting together a team of innovative, hungry, and highly motivated professionals to blend technology and customer service with a dash of automation and good old know-how to build a new kind of national title agency.What you’ll do:As a Closing Specialist at Title Forward you will be the face of the transaction. You will be responsible for guiding buyers and sellers from contract acceptance to funding and everything in between. It will be on you to answer questions, provide guidance, and keep everyone on course. Our Closing Specialists are responsible for pulling together all aspects of the transaction in a timely manner, and keeping all parties on the same page by communicating constantly. They are tasked with  ensuring that not only are the customers delighted but that all details of the transaction are perfect and all parties stay on track during the process. They interact with agents, buyers, sellers, lenders and all stakeholders to ensure all parties are ready for signing.  They prepare and proof HUDs, prepare closing packages, update our systems, and jump in to problem solve whenever something is off plan.  In addition, you will get to know your agent teams and markets inside and out and become intimately familiar with all the local details and nuances of the area and the agents.  Further, as a Closing Specialist, you will build relationships with our top shelf signing agents and work closely with a coordinator to form a closing team that is the best in the business.What we are looking for:We are looking for professionals interested in the title and settlement industry that bring a mix of customer service, extreme attention to detail, and have proven themselves through their work or academic records.  Experience in related fields such as title, mortgage underwriting, law / legal, or real estate are ideal for this position.Customer service is key so you'll need strong written and verbal communication skills, an ability to prioritize and multi-task, and a positive 'can-do' attitude where the customer is always right. Beyond that, we're looking for the ability to meet tight timelines all while making each customer feel like they are the ONLY customer.To succeed in this role you'll need the following:•	Fire: We're in growth mode, and we need folks who are high energy. You'll need to prepare HUDs, hold lenders accountable for on-time document delivery, and ensure our customers feel like closing their home purchase is a celebration.•	Leadership: You see opportunities, not problems and keep your cool under tight timelines.•	Desire to innovate: Think about Apple, Virgin America, and American Express. These companies ensure the entire customer experience is perfect and are constantly improving.•	Tech-savvy: You're comfortable with technology and learn new programs quickly.•	A fun, caring, and humble attitude: We all work hard, but it's important to have a good time, look out for each other, and pitch in wherever needed.What we are offering:•	Above average salary & amazing benefits: We offer a competitive base salary and a generous benefits package; plus, profit-sharing bonuses because we're all in it together.•	An open, entrepreneurial environment: New ideas are always welcome. We want to foster an environment of continuous improvement where everyone on the team contributes.•	A great work space and an even better one to come: Our brand new office is in downtown Philadelphia at 17th and JFK.  We're right in the middle of the action and close to transit and freeway access so you can be at your best every day.•	A chance to build something great: We're in start-up mode and this is a ground floor opportunity to design and build a title agency the way you've always known it should be. We believe the industry has been wrapped in title jargon and secrecy for too long and have made it our mission to change the game when it comes to title and closing.Title Forward is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

345.company: D. E. Shaw Research (revised as of 2013) (Chem – 2015 New)
345.desc: D. E. Shaw Research is seeking exceptional computational chemists and biologists, as well as other computational scientists with a track record of extraordinary achievement, to join our New York–based team.  This is a unique opportunity to develop and work with transformative technology in a dynamic, interdisciplinary environment.   Relevant areas of experience might include the study of allosteric interactions or other functionally important conformational changes in biological molecules, structure prediction or design for proteins or RNA, the study of protein–protein or protein–nucleic acid interactions, force field improvement through detailed comparisons of simulation data with NMR measurements or other experimental data, or development and implementation of new methodology (e.g., integrators, methods for enhanced sampling or free-energy calculations, or tools to efficiently analyze large simulation datasets).  Specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical, however, than outstanding intellectual ability, unusually strong research skills, and a history of innovation and accomplishment.  We are committed to fostering a stimulating, rewarding, and flexible work environment, and we are prepared to offer above-market compensation to candidates of truly exceptional ability. To submit an application, please use the link provided below: http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/ChemD. E. Shaw Research is an independent research group that is pursuing an ambitious, long-term strategy aimed at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  We have developed a special-purpose supercomputer capable of executing molecular dynamics (MD) simulations orders of magnitude faster than was previously possible.  Our current projects include investigations of proteins and other biomedically relevant macromolecules as well as the development of computational chemistry methods to enable more accurate and effective MD simulations.

346.desc: Apply Your Talent. Shape the Future.Computer Scientists/Software EngineeringThe Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC is seeking Computer Scientists/Software Engineers focusing on the following areas:Information Systems/ Cyber Security: Design systems to integrate imagery and information; data base management, network systems integration/administration. Modeling and simulation Model, analyze, and interpret test results for navigation, and guidance systems; design high-fidelity, object-oriented system simulations and prototype decision support systems; analyze requirements and effectiveness of military systems in postulated environments.Network/Communications Engineering: Provide engineering, evaluation, design, and implementation of communications systems to improve capabilities. Develop and test advanced communications equipment. Investigate and apply advanced computing technologies to client systems. Conduct R&D in information control environments, network management and control, and computational uncertainty. Perform system analysis, modeling and simulation for signal processing and control systems and real-time hardware/software subsystems for GPS-based positioning, navigation, & remote sensing systems. Conduct communication and networking systems engineering activities in support of Cyber Operations, Special Operations, and Homeland Protection Business Areas. Communication systems include wireless line-of-sight and satellite communications systems and networks.Software Engineering: Develop complex scientific software systems from design through test and validation; real-time system design; advanced, high-definition graphics display systems; interactive computer network design.For recent graduates, APL offers The Discovery Program, an exciting 2-year rotational program spanning multiple technical departments ranging from aerospace engineering to intelligent systems to networked sensor system analysis and modeling. Discover your interests and strengths and take on challenging projects that will stimulate your professional growth while accelerating your career.To learn more about the discovery program and to apply, visit: http://www.jhuapl.edu/employment/collegeAPL offers an impressive and comprehensive benefits package, including a liberal vacation plan, a matching retirement program, significant educational assistance, a scholarship tuition program for staff with dependents, and competitive salaries matching with skills and experience. 347.desc: Exceptional design verification engineers sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group that is developing multiple generations of the Anton special-purpose supercomputer with the aim of fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  Our project combines innovative, massively parallel architectures with algorithmic advances in computational biochemistry.   Successful candidates will possess a graduate degree, an outstanding academic record, exceptional analytical and communication skills, extensive knowledge of hardware architecture, and hands-on experience with chip design and verification.  Particularly relevant areas of expertise might include System Verilog constrained random verification driven by functional/code coverage metrics and UVM, OVM, and/or VMM verification of high-speed ASIC designs.  Knowledge of emulation, formal verification, or DFT is a plus. Our aim is to add outstanding contributors and innovators to our small team of talented hardware engineers, who are working on large, high-performance designs (~400 mm^2, >50M gates) in cutting-edge process technologies.  We are committed to fostering a stimulating, positive, and flexible work environment, and we are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation. To submit an application, please use the link provided below: http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/DV D. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

Our group has shed new light on biomolecular phenomena such as protein folding, protein dynamics, and protein-drug interactions by directing unprecedented computational power toward the solution of key problems in the fields of biomolecular simulation and design.  Successful candidates will have zero to five years of experience and extraordinary records of achievement in the natural sciences and/or scientific software development. Electrical/Computer Engineers The Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC is seeking Electrical/Computer Engineers focusing on the following areas:Communications Engineering: Design and develop new systems and evaluate current systems and networks; develop integrate, and evaluate satellite communications and control systems, including ground station and signal processing equipment -- design, develop, and test microwave radio systems, circuits, and hardware components.Controls Engineering: Apply modern control techniques in diverse technical areas. Examples include implementing Kalman filters in radar tracking algorithms, determining missile accuracy via estimation theory, and analyzing guidance and navigation systems. Defense systems test and evaluation. Determine operating characteristics, accuracy, and reliability of ballistic weapon systems; analyze total systems as well as missile, fire control, navigation, and launcher subsystems; and design and monitor test programs.Hardware Design: Develop working models of electronic systems for applications in nearly every frequency region. Included are projects in guidance, control systems, communications, signal processing, microprocessor and computer systems, antennas, circuits, advanced radars, and flight-model satellites.Information Systems/Cyber Security: Design systems to integrate imagery and information; data base management, network systems integration/administration. Modeling and simulation Model, analyze, and interpret test results for navigation, and guidance systems; design high-fidelity, object-oriented system simulations and prototype decision support systems; analyze requirements and effectiveness of military systems in postulated environments. Perform system analysis, modeling and simulation for signal processing and control systems and real-time hardware/software subsystems for GPS-based positioning, navigation, & remote sensing systems.Signal Processing: Provide signal processing and image analysis expertise, based on understanding of physical theory and its application to new technology development efforts. Analyze sensor design and requirements, conduct experiments to automate processing of signals and data. Process recorded sensor signals from various systems and develop new processing techniques.Software Engineering: Develop complex scientific software systems from design through test and validation; real-time system design; advanced, high-definition graphics display systems; interactive computer network design. Software for spacecraft ground systems. System Engineering/Analysis: Determine the system needed to solve a given problem in an effective and economical way; represent systems by mathematical models for evaluation and parametric definition; integrate system parameters; perform dynamic analysis of closed-loop control systems; develop and conduct experiments with prototype components, subsystems, and total systems.Defense Systems Testing and Analysis: Technical research and systems analysis related to various seekers and sensors used by military tactical and irregular warfare systems, including Strike Aircraft, Maritime Patrol Aircraft, Precision Guided Munitions, land-based sensor systems and Autonomous Unmanned Systems.For recent graduates, APL offers The Discovery Program, an exciting 2-year rotational program spanning multiple technical departments ranging from aerospace engineering to intelligent systems to networked sensor system analysis and modeling. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.For more information about a career at APL, please visit our website at:https://jhuapl.taleo.net/careersection/4/jobdetail.ftl?job=09815&lang=en&sns_id=mailtoJohns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that complies with Title IX of the Education Amendments Act of 1972, as well as other applicable laws, and values diversity in its workforce.

351.desc: We’re hiring Fellows to work on big problems: whether it’s protecting public health by stopping the overuse of antibiotics on factory farms, checking the influence of billionaires and Super PACs over our elections, protecting consumers, passing new recycling laws, or promoting smart transportation options for a 21st century economy.At U.S. PIRG, we know that social change doesn't just happen. We need to organize, advocate, and fight for change. By becoming a Fellow with U.S. PIRG, you will learn how to become an experienced organizer and advocate for the public interest.What Fellows DoOur Fellows don’t just sit behind a desk. We need people who are willing to work hard to advocate for the public interest -- whether it’s by developing campaigns, building coalitions, mobilizing and organizing the public, showcasing our work online and in the media, or making our case directly to decision-makers. This is a two-year program, expressly designed to prepare future leaders within PIRG. The powerful industries have their lobbyists. That’s why we need people like you to ensure the public’s voice is heard, that decision-makers do the right thing, and to keep fighting to solve more of America’s problems.Locations and start datesWe’re hiring for positions in D.C., Boston, and Chicago. If you’re flexible, you can apply for multiple locations. We accept applications on a rolling basis. State date: August 1, 2016.Salary & BenefitsThe target annual compensation for this position is $25,500 in the first year. Staff in their second year receive a raise which averages $1,500. U.S. PIRG offers a competitive benefits package. We also offer an excellent training program and opportunities for advancement.To learn more and applyVisit jobs.uspirg.orgU.S. PIRG is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, age, sex, handicap, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

352.position: Foster Care/Resource Home Care Case Manager
352.desc: Progressive Life Center, Inc. (PLC), a private, non-profit human services agency,  provides an array of community based  services to adjudicated youth and their families within the Washington, D.C.; Baltimore, MD; Prince George’s County, MD; Philadelphia, PA; and Newark, DE areas. PLC’s core service areas are child welfare, juvenile justice, and behavioral health. A sample of programs and services include: foster care and adoptions, kinship care, family preservation, independent living, case management, juvenile diversion, parenting training, individual and family counseling, and substance abuse prevention.Program Summary:The Philadelphia NIA Foster Care program provides general and treatment foster care services for children and youth from infancy to 21 years of age. In-line with our goal to reunify children and youth with their biological parents or identify loving and safe permanent homes, Philadelphia NIA recruit, train and license new resource foster families/homes and provide case management support to resource foster parents, children and youth, and the biological parents. As a result of our efforts, we are proud to report that the Philadelphia NIA Foster Care Program ranked in the top five, treatment foster care, programs in Philadelphia City with the highest permanency rates for fiscal year 2014. Position Description:The Foster Care/Resource Home Care Case Manager position requires the incumbent to provide case management and referral services.The Foster Care/Resource Home Care Case Manager will be responsible for providing and linking clients and biological families to follow-up services; developing service plans, progress reports, termination summaries and follow-up documentation; providing relevant crisis intervention support, advocacy service and community resources and program referrals; and other duties as assigned.Benefits:We offer exceptional benefits package with an opportunity for personal and professional growth. EOE. Benefits Package:1. Clinical Training2. Continuing Education Units3. Fringe Benefits4. Investment package5. Flexible work schedule Physical Demands:Physical Demands (Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).• Ability to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.• Ability to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.;• Ability to operate a computer and other office productivity machinery;• Ability to position self to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl;• Ability to frequently communicate with employees/customers/clients; and must be able to exchange accurate information by perceiving the nature of sound, near and far vision, depth perception, providing oral and written information;• Ability to frequently move files weighing up to 20 pounds throughout the office space;• Ability to be on call and often respond to situations during off hours which can disrupt normal sleep patterns and cause fatigue;• Ability to physically restrain children when required and protect him/her in physically confrontational situations;• Ability to face a significant amount of emotional stress which can cause related physical stress;• In cases of child relocation, the incumbent may be required to assist the child by carrying belongings and must often lift, carry and/or comfort small children.Work Environment:• Normal office environment or residential facility, but also may travel locally to visit clients within their homes, meet with service providers, and/or attend meetings: • Schools, hospitals, mental health clinics, private practices, prisons, corporations, and numerous public and private agencies.• Specialize in one or more of over 40 practice areas – including Disaster Relief, Child Welfare Services, and Homeless Family Assistance, among many others.

355.desc: D. E. Shaw Research (DESRES) seeks gifted hardware engineers to join our New York–based team as paid summer interns.  Opportunities are available for graduate-level Electrical Engineering or Computer Science candidates with backgrounds in systems architecture, ASIC design and verification, VLSI physical design, or parallel computing. As a member of our highly interdisciplinary team, you will contribute to an ambitious, long-term research project in computational biochemistry aimed at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  Our group is developing multiple generations of the Anton supercomputer, a fully custom, massively parallel machine which executes molecular dynamics simulations orders of magnitude faster than was previously possible.  We design and verify our own ASICs to run on Anton, and we’re developing large, high-performance designs in advanced process technologies.  At DESRES we’ve cultivated a collegial and intellectually stimulating environment in which people with different backgrounds (including electrical engineering, computer science, chemistry, biology, physics, and math) regularly interact to advance our research.  Our aim is to recruit extraordinary contributors with outstanding academic records to work with our small team of talented hardware engineers.  We value creativity and innovation, and we are looking for intellectually curious and versatile individuals who have the potential to make significant long-term contributions to our efforts. If you are interested in exploring groundbreaking research topics with the mentorship of our world-class team of biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application materials.  We are prepared to offer above-market compensation to candidates of truly exceptional ability.   http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/SAInternD. E. 357.desc: D. E. Shaw Research is seeking postdoctoral fellows of exceptional ability to join our New York–based team.  This is a unique opportunity to develop and work with transformative technology in a dynamic, interdisciplinary environment.  Candidates should have expertise in computational chemistry, biology, or physics, or in a relevant area of computer science or applied mathematics.   Relevant areas of experience might include the study of allosteric interactions or other functionally important conformational changes in biological molecules, structure prediction or design for proteins or RNA, the study of protein–protein or protein–nucleic acid interactions, force field improvement through detailed comparisons of simulation data with NMR measurements or other experimental data, or development and implementation of new methodology (e.g., integrators, methods for enhanced sampling or free-energy calculations, or tools to efficiently analyze large simulation datasets).  Specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical, however, than outstanding intellectual ability, unusually strong research skills, and a history of innovation and accomplishment.  We are committed to fostering a stimulating, rewarding, and flexible work environment, and we are prepared to offer above-market compensation to candidates of truly exceptional ability. To submit an application, please use the link provided below:  http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Oncampus/UPenn/PFD. E. Shaw Research is an independent research group that is pursuing an ambitious, long-term strategy aimed at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  We have developed a special-purpose supercomputer capable of executing molecular dynamics (MD) simulations orders of magnitude faster than was previously possible.  Our current projects include investigations of proteins and other biomedically relevant macromolecules as well as the development of computational chemistry methods to enable more accurate and effective MD simulations.

359.desc: Progressive Life Center, Inc. (PLC), a private, non-profit human services agency,  provides an array of community based  services to adjudicated youth and their families within the Washington, D.C.; Baltimore, MD; Prince George’s County, MD; Philadelphia, PA; and Newark, DE areas. PLC’s core service areas are child welfare, juvenile justice, and behavioral health. A sample of programs and services include: foster care and adoptions, kinship care, family preservation, independent living, case management, juvenile diversion, parenting training, individual and family counseling, and substance abuse prevention.Program Summary:The Philadelphia NIA Foster Care program provides general and treatment foster care services for children and youth from infancy to 21 years of age. In-line with our goal to reunify children and youth with their biological parents or identify loving and safe permanent homes, Philadelphia NIA recruit, train and license new resource foster families/homes and provide case management support to resource foster parents, children and youth, and the biological parents. As a result of our efforts, we are proud to report that the Philadelphia Nia Foster Care Program ranked in the top five, treatment foster care, programs in Philadelphia City with the highest permanency rates for fiscal year 2014. Position Description:The Recruitment, Training & Licensing Assistant position requires the incumbent to assist in establishing and implementing procedures for licensing and re-certifying foster parents.The Recruiting, Training & Licensing Assistant will be responsible for assisting the RTL or RHC staff with the retrieval, compilation, and confirmation of full compliance of all foster home re-certifications ; assisting licensing staff with ensuring that training and certification processes meet the requirements of the child placement license; assisting RTL Specialists with home inspections, licensing document collection, new foster parent file development and interviewing; supporting RTL Specialists with setting up in-service, pre-service, or other foster parent events (e.g. training areas and equipment, copying training documentation, ordering and monitoring refreshments, co-facilitating training and monitoring children/teens that accompany parents during training; and other duties as assigned.Benefits:We offer exceptional benefits package with an opportunity for personal and professional growth. EOE. Benefits Package:1. Clinical Training2. Continuing Education Units3. Fringe Benefits4. Investment package5. Flexible work schedule Physical Demands:Physical Demands (Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).• Ability to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.• Ability to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.;• Ability to operate a computer and other office productivity machinery;• Ability to position self to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl;• Ability to frequently communicate with employees/customers/clients; and must be able to exchange accurate information by perceiving the nature of sound, near and far vision, depth perception, providing oral and written information;• Ability to frequently move files weighing up to 20 pounds throughout the office space;Work Environment:• Normal office environment or residential facility, but also may travel locally to visit clients within their homes, meet with service providers, and/or attend meetings: • Schools, hospitals, mental health clinics, private practices, prisons, corporations, and numerous public and private agencies.• Specialize in one or more of over 40 practice areas – including Disaster Relief, Child Welfare Services, and Homeless Family Assistance, among many others.

Particularly relevant areas of expertise might include computational biology, Python and C/C++ programming, molecular dynamics, scientific visualization, computer graphics, full-stack web development, scientific workflow management, high performance data-parallel computing on multicore and GPU architectures, and the development of large-scale data management, cheminformatics, and/or analysis frameworks, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement. 368.desc: At 12+, we believe in every student’s potential for success. We believe in the power of people to inspire and motivate each other. This is why we take pride in our team, which is available to all students in our partner schools throughout each and every school day. They greet each student on the first day of school and cheer them on through graduation. They are mentors, tutors, advocates, and trusted friends. These are the 12+ Fellows. The Fellows Initiative is a one-year engagement that opens a channel for impassioned, energetic, and team-oriented individuals to transform the culture of underserved high schools. You will serve on the frontline of our mission to empower our students to dream bigger than they ever have before. We challenge you to expect more from Philadelphia’s schools, our students, and yourself. We challenge you to be the change. Join us in showing others that a small group of dedicated individuals can truly change the world. Responsibilities:Under the leadership of the Site Director, Fellows implement school-wide 12+ programming, which includes RAISE (freshman transition / college readiness), Flight (college access), and PLUS Leaders (student leadership) programs. Fellows also plan and execute school-wide, culture-building events such as College Week and Career Day. Most importantly, Fellows are commissioned to build personal relationships with individual students, transforming student mindsets and empowering them to succeed in education beyond the 12th grade.About 12+:12+ is an education nonprofit that aims to increase educational equity by building college-going cultures in high schools throughout Philadelphia. 12+ partners with high schools to redefine what is possible for their students. By aiming to create welcoming learning environments, provide individualized support, and implement practical college-access resources, 12+ seeks to transform school cultures and inspire students to unlock their full potential.In 2010, 12+ began as a mentoring program for nine high school students at Kensington Health Sciences Academy, which belonged to the lowest tier of schools in the School District of Philadelphia. All nine students successfully enrolled in college the following year. In 2012, 12+ transitioned to serving the entire student body in order to change the trajectory of the whole school, rather than a select few students. KHSA’s overall college-going rate increased from 10% in 2010 to over 80% in 2015. Now, 12+ serves over 1200 students in three partner schools throughout Philadelphia.Applications open January 15, 2016, and will be accepted on a rolling basis until positions are filled. For more information, visit www.12plus.org/fellowsinitiative.

369.desc: 2016 Software EngineerBloomberg's software engineers are responsible for creating the world's premiere source for real-time and historical market data and analytics.  Engineers are given the responsibility to define, architect, build, and deploy complete systems that anticipate and fulfill our clients' needs.  Our agile development cycle allows us to roll out new software seven days a week.  Small teams and access to managers creates a collaborative and innovative work environment. Engineers are given the opportunity to be creative and the impact of their contribution is highly visible throughout the company and to clients.We are looking for software engineers who are interested in designing high-impact solutions to help our customers optimize complex workflows, efficiently manipulate large datasets, and make quick, intuitive decisions.  The Software Engineer Training Program: our training program will prepare you to develop software in our large-scale and fast-paced environment. Topics will include real-time data processing, databases, networking and graphics technologies. During training, you'll participate in lectures and labs as well as collaborate with colleagues through group projects. Mentors are available throughout training to ensure you're fully prepared to hit the ground running once you join the group of your choice. After training, you will have the opportunity to continue learning through Bloomberg University, expand your network of technology and business experts, and attend presentations with world renowned guest speakers.The CompanyBloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world.

371.desc: Sony/ATV Music Publishing in New York is seeking to fill the position of Research Analyst, A&R/Artist Development.  The preferred candidate will collect, organize, manage & analyze music data to evaluate unsigned & signed artists.Responsibilities:Perform statistical analysis of upcoming artists to evaluate their potential earning powerBuild prediction models & other analytical data tools to regularly evaluate unsigned & signed talent across digital, radio & sales avenuesModel will predict artists/songwriter sales performanceIdentify and prioritize input variables, e.g. radio play, sales, streaming, listens, etc.Help build and maintain a growing central music database in MSQL containing major music chart dataReview new data in database for upcoming music talentHelp develop new ways to evaluate unsigned talent via data collection (radio, sales, YouTube, Sound cloud, Spotify, etc.)Monitor unsigned artists in the radio, streaming & sales spaces to communicate any relevant milestones to the A&R teamPerform weekly forecasts on particular records as new data becomes availableRegularly update sales & radio tracking sheets weekly for monitored songs and albumsPrepare presentations & communicate major research updates & artist performance to senior managementPerform other related analytic and general tasks as needed
