373.company: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation
373.desc: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation, based in Menlo Park, California, is seeking an Associate Director of Public Investments to work in its Investment Department.About the FoundationThe William and Flora Hewlett Foundation has been making grants since 1967 to help people build measurably better lives. The Foundation concentrates its resources on activities in education, the environment, global development and population, performing arts, and philanthropy, and makes grants to support disadvantaged communities in the San Francisco Bay Area. The Foundations assets are approximately $9.1 billion, with annual grant awards totaling more than $400 million. A 13-member Board of Directors provides overall direction for the Foundation. For more information about the Hewlett Foundation, please visit its website at www.hewlett.org.About the Investment DepartmentThe Investment Departments mission is to pursue an investment strategy that generates optimal risk-adjusted returns that are sufficient, over time, to sustain the real value of the Foundations endowment net of payout.  Currently, all investments are made through a premier group of external managers. The investment portfolio is widely diversified by geography and across a range of asset classes.About the PositionThe Associate Director of Public Investments reports to the Director of Public Investments. The Associate Directors primary responsibility will be to participate in manager selection and oversight across the Foundations distress/credit, absolute return, fixed income and real estate-oriented strategies, which collectively represent roughly 43% of the endowment portfolio. The Associate Director will work closely with other senior members of the investment team and provide support on asset allocation and other key investment policies, including monitoring of portfolio risk. The individual filling this position will be a critical part of our 11-person investment team.Related responsibilities include:Work closely with the Director in monitoring and analyzing existing public investments including maintaining active communication with external managers, attending annual meetings and reviewing quarterly correspondence. Perform due diligence for prospective investments and assist in manager selection by evaluating  strategy and analyzing historical performance. Prepare strategic analyses of the asset class and review allocations of capital.Support the Chief Investment Officer and Directors with modeling and analysis of benchmarks, portfolio performance, risk and liquidity.Manage the development of computer models and databases for investment analysis and evaluation of external managers.Research broad investment and industry trends, and support the Directors and the Foundations investment team in various projects as required.

374.desc: deVere Group  Leading Global Award Winning Investment AdvisoryGlobal 2 year Fast-Track Degree-holder Program in Investment Advisory. Full time trained salaried positions with bonuses(open to all Senior undergraduates/recent Alumni with the right qualities, irrespective of grade, or degree subject).35 positions available throughout 2016, in New York, Bahamas and Miami.We currently have mentored positions available for our 2 year Trainee/Associate Investment Advisory Program initially based at our deVere Academy office in Manhattan, New York for several months training before either staying on in New York or relocating to Miami or Bahamas.Future opportunities also exist for those interested in international travel exist in our Academy offices: Paris, Geneva, Dubai, Shanghai, Moscow, Kuala Lumpur,  and Sydney and also some of our other city-centre offices globally.For those candidates who apply and look suitable we have a short online webinar where we present our program to you, and you type in any of your questions and have them answered by our existing New York trainee graduates.The Program begins with five weeks of intense training in our New York, Manhattan Office, equipping you with the foundations to become a successful Trainee/Associate Investment Advisor. This intensive, fast-track structured training will turn you from a newly graduated student into a highly paid, fully qualified Investment-Advisory professional within just 24 months, or even earlier for high fliers.Rewards in years 1-4.During the training period you will be paid 36k USD p.a gross plus quarterly bonuses on top based on performance and KPI's.Based on a strong salary package and monthly bonus program some of our top graduates are currently exceeding the higher levels belowTrainee/Associate incomeYear one:   US$ 80-95k+ Year two:   US$ 90-140k+Investment Advisor incomeYear three: US$ 150-250k+Year four:   US$ 300-500k+For more information and to apply go to the Apply tab at:http://www.deveredestinations-usa.comTrainee/Associate Wealth Advisor Role:Our focus will be on giving you structured training and one to one mentoring throughout the fast track 24 months. You will also get hands-on experience of dealing with high-net-worth clients worldwide. This will involve you working with a successful Senior Investment Advisors, assisting them build their client base and address their clients financial issues, which could be anything from retirement planning to portfolio investment advice.You'll be surrounded by some of the industry's top Investment Advisors, trainers and managers. So when it comes to building up your business-development and client-management skills, you'll have the opportunity to learn from the best.QualificationsAt the same time, you will study towards a professional international qualification  CISI (Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment) and the US Series 65 qualification.All of the locations we've chosen offer an excellent social life. So there will always be lots of things to do, places to go and people to meet, whether you're at work or enjoying a day off.By the end of the 24 months, you should be ready to take on the role of a fully-fledged Investment Advisor. If you're really good, you could get there even quicker.Who can apply?We welcome applications from all recent alumni from the last few years with bachelors degree and all Seniors/undergraduates in their last year of university. Any degree or level as long as you also have the key qualities below.Key qualities we look for:Ambition, Enthusiasm, Sports-minded, Competitiveness, Belief, Persistence, Independence, Tenacity, Grit. The ability to get on with all types of people at all levels.For more information and to apply go to http://www.deveredestinations-usa.com

375.desc: Company OverviewSpencer Stuart is a leading global executive search and leadership advisory firm. Founded in 1956 and privately owned, Spencer Stuart is the partner of choice among organizations seeking guidance and counsel on senior leadership needs. We work with clients across a range of industries, from the worlds largest companies to medium-sized businesses, entrepreneurial startups and nonprofit organizations. The firm has 56 offices in 30 countries around the world.Our Consultants bring years of leadership experience in the very sectors and functions for which we provide a range of talent advisory services. Our engagement teams are organized to maximize industry and content specialization, along with knowledge sharing across the firm. These client service teams are supported by first-rate Engagement Managers, Associates, Analysts and Executive Assistants, and backed by state-of-the-art technology. We regularly work with colleagues across geographies, reflecting the international reach of our clients and the realities of the global business environment.Our ValuesAs executive search and leadership advisory professionals, we help organizations identify and develop individual leaders and leadership teams who will fit, perform and endure. The insights we bring and the advice we impart have a significant impact on the businesses we serve and on individual lives and careers. We recognize these responsibilities and take them seriously. We adhere to a code of professional ethics, handling our relationships with clients, executives and colleagues with great care. We offer balanced advice with courage and honesty and treat sensitive information with the utmost respect and discretion.Above all, we value quality  the quality of the services we provide our clients and the manner in which we navigate our interactions with individual executives and executive teams, whether we have been retained to recruit a senior executive, provide post-merger advisory recommendations or conduct a leadership assessment and development  exercise.Our distinctive culture continues to attract, develop and retain exceptional people to the firm and we are resolved to continue reaching for the highest standards of professionalism in our work.Leadership Advisory Services PracticeIn 2014, Spencer Stuart acquired Shanghai headquartered Reya Group, a market-leading provider of products, technology and services related to organizational culture and change management. With the seamless integration of Reya Group into its existing portfolio of Executive Search and Leadership Advisory offerings, Spencer Stuart is able to provide its clients with a unique dimension of insight regarding the style, capabilities and potential of individuals and teams.Operating synergistically alongside the Firms market-leading Executive Search business, LAS professionals provide advice and partnership to clients navigating a range of key leadership and talent issues, including:	Aligning culture and talent strategy with business strategy	Maximizing team effectiveness	Merger integration support	Executive assessment and CEO succession	Talent development and transition supportAs the LAS practice continues to grow 30% per year in both scale (revenue) and breadth (diversity and depth of advisory services), the LAS Associate participates actively in internal initiatives relative to LAS product development, build-out of practice infrastructure and engagement execution. Position SummaryThe LAS Associate plays a critical client-facing role and supports Consultants in the full execution of client engagements, including the deep dive, multi-method assessment of executives and the formulation of written materials relative to assessment and development findings. The LAS practice serves as an innovation hub for the broader firm. In addition to executing client engagements, the Associate serves as a subject matter expert relative to Spencer Stuarts proprietary culture products and solutions. He/She plays a critical role in the education and training of internal colleagues (both LAS and Search) regarding product offerings and participates actively in internal initiatives for LAS product development and the build-out of practice infrastructure. The objective of the LAS Associate role is to provide world-class leadership advisory services to the firms clients while also serving as a key colleague and teammate in advancing the growth agenda of the practice within the context of the firms overall strategic objectives. A typical LAS client engagement team may include: 1 or 2 LAS Consultants, 1 or 2 LAS Engagement Managers or Associates, 1 or 2 Search Consultants, and 1 or 2 Executive Assistants. We view the leadership advisory skillset to be portable across industries; the LAS Engagement Manager serves clients across a diverse range of industry sectors, including but not limited to consumer goods, industrial, financial services, energy, and professional services. The LAS Associate role requires approximately 30% travel, primarily within the geographic/continental region of the persons home office (i.e. North America, EMEA, APAC). Occasional global travel may be required. The LAS Associate will be based in Spencer Stuarts San Francisco office. Key RelationshipsReports to: 			Regional Research Director (solid line)LAS Consultant (dotted line on a project basis)Associate Practice Leader, LAS (dotted line)Other relationships: 		LAS Practice LeadershipOffice Manager at home officeLAS Consultants Search ConsultantsLAS Executive Assistants	LAS Associates, Senior Associates, Engagement Managers  	and AnalystsLAS Product ManagementLAS Knowledge ManagerLibrary ServicesHome office colleagues, both LAS and Search Corporate training and information servicesMajor ResponsibilitiesClient-facing: The Associate plays an active role in all aspects of the engagement lifecycle, from planning and execution through close. The successful Associate will handle multiple engagements across varied time zones with competing deadlines and will work effectively with individuals who have differing styles in order to consistently produce world-class deliverables for the Firms clients. Responsibilities include: 	At the outset of the client engagement, participates in stakeholder calls with client company executives, board members and/or other key stakeholders 	Assists in the development of client communications and engagement plan	Manages interactions with both external client contacts and internal colleagues to ensure transparency and alignment throughout the engagement lifecycle; communicates engagement progress to the client and/or engagement team at agreed intervals	Administers proprietary LAS products and services	Creates engagement updates and reports, leveraging strong copywriting skills 	Contributes to summary client presentations and other documents identifying key organizational, cultural and strategic findings across the engagement	Participates in client meetings to relay culture findings	In collaboration with Consultant, prepares and co-facilitates client workshops 	Participates in executive feedback sessions Engagement management: In collaboration with relevant team members (including but not limited to Executive Assistants, LAS Consultants, and Search Consultants/Associates), participates in the planning and management of the engagement lifecycle. Working with limited technology resources and a diverse group of internal and external stakeholders often spanning time-zones and geographies, the LAS Associate assists in driving high touch, high value engagement management and seamless execution: 	Demonstrates initiative and commitment by doing what is needed at all phases of the process	Over time, develops an understanding of the resources required to execute all aspects of the engagement life-cycle; leverages this insight to consistently and proactively think ahead, develop engagement plans and timelines, and anticipate next steps 	Communicates engagement progress to the client and/or engagement team at agreed upon intervals	Fosters close communication and builds strong working relationships with peer colleagues, including Executive Assistants, Associates and Analysts	Manages a large volume of information with rigorous attention to detail; develops personal systems and tactics for maximizing personal organization and productivity  Practice building: Currently experiencing an accelerated growth trajectory and serving as a strategic incubator for the broader firm as it evolves its approach to assessment in search, the LAS Practice encourages an all hands on deck attitude from each of its members. The successful Associate is a self-starter who will operate comfortably in this environment characterized by rapid change and ambiguity. He/She will assist in driving structural and product-driven enhancements within LAS by: 	Participating actively in internal initiatives relative to LAS product development and the build-out of practice infrastructure, including integration of culture tools within new and existing products and services	Practice-building activities may include but are not limited to: providing ongoing targeted feedback on current/existing LAS tools, assisting in the development of additional proprietary assessment tools and technologies, analyzing current business process methodologies and contributing to business process improvement initiatives, assisting in the due diligence of potential partner organizations or business development targets  	Building relationships with and proactively engaging with search colleagues; developing an understanding of the firms core search business and facilitating wider understanding of LAS products, services and strategyCANDIDATE SPECIFICATION:  KEY SELECTION CRITERIAIdeal Skills and Experience	Three or more years experience in relevant leadership advisory or strategy consulting environment 	Demonstrated interest in organizational change/design, human capital, leadership assessment, human resources or psychology through direct work experience or educational degrees	Superior business writing skills, as evidenced through project work or writing samples to be provided upon request	Direct interaction/experience with executive-level clients is advantageous but not required 	Undergraduate degree from highly competitive university required. Advanced degree is preferable	Excellent command of written and spoken English is required. Command of additional languages helpfulCritical Capabilities for SuccessDriving results: Works to meet/beat explicit goals	Works to achieve goals while overcoming obstacles and/or planning for contingencies	Shows strong self-motivation such as drive and urgency about reaching targets and can inspire others to achieve such targets	Checks work of self and others against required quality standards	Reviews performance and progress on a regular basis to ensure team is achieving results, seeking corrective action to address gaps or under performanceCollaborating and influencing: Engages individually to build collaboration	Invites and uses the opinions and perspectives of others	Engages people in a dialogue to gain commitment and bring them

376.company: the Franklin Fountain & Spruce Harbor Park
376.desc: ASSISTANT MANAGEMENT POSITIONSFRANKLIN FOUNTAIN & SPRUCE STREET HARBOR PARKThe Franklin Fountain, Philadelphia’s Premier Ice Cream Parlor and Soda Fountain is looking to fill several Front-of-House Assistant Manager positions within our growing company. Positions are full time. Hourly pay commensurate with experience. Health and dental benefits after 90 days of full-time employment.Hours:  ~40 hours per week including some evening, weekend and holiday work.Assistant Managers are responsible for:Overseeing daily operations at on-site and/or off-site locationsScheduling, training & supervising Front-of-House staff; enforcing all relevant business policies and procedures, delegating tasks as neededCommunicating with Kitchen Staff and other Managers regarding inventory & product needsTaking and processing customer orders, handling cash and credit transactions, performing all other regular front-of-house tasksInterested qualified candidates should send a RESUME & COVER LETTER to jobs@franklinfountain.com.NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE

377.desc: Would you like to help us create the technology of tomorrow?   At Cobham, we’ve got what it takes to turn our graduates into the next generation of innovators, pioneers and entrepreneurs. That’s why we’ve developed a graduate program with two distinct streams that provide opportunities for the next generation of business leaders and engineers alike. Our Future Business Leaders stream is a structured, closely monitored, two to three year rotational program. The program will be a series of six to nine month rotations across the US in various disciplines, including Program Management, Strategic Sourcing, Operations, Business Development, Procurement, Commercial, Sales and Marketing, Finance, and Human Resources. The program will allow you to explore some of Cobham’s offices located in California, Arizona, Iowa, New York, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, and Pennsylvania.   The duration of the program is customized to fit your and the businesses needs and will commence at the beginning of September. The recruitment and selection process comprises online application, telephone interview, online test and assessment centre, and we would advise you to apply for this opportunity at the beginning of your senior year of college. How quickly you are taken through the process will be dependent on assessment centre dates, although the sooner you apply the more likely it is you’ll be considered for the assessment centre and therefore selected to join the program. No matter what area you choose to go into, you can count on maximum exposure to our technology and global culture, so you’ll be required to complete placements across at least three of our divisions. Where you are placed in the US depends on your career aspirations and what stream you decide to follow, but wherever you go with us you’ll find support and development opportunities, regular reviews and frequent training sessions. The program is big in its scope and goals, but not overly so - everyone knows each other, and you’ll have plenty of time to build your social and professional networks.Throughout the program, you'll have regular performance and development reviews with your assignment manager. You'll also be given a mentor who will provide personal and professional support, and a development log that will help you keep track of your progress. And if you want to gain a relevant professional qualification, such as chartered status or a professional certification, we'll support you all the way. At the end of the program, you'll have the opportunity to apply for a permanent position anywhere within the business. Where you end up is up to you, but in a company as diverse as ours, you'll always have interesting opportunities. What’s more, every placement you take part in will be vastly different from the others, and there’ll never be any doubt that the work you’re doing is adding significant value to the company.If you will have the right to work in the US at the time of starting your employment, and a 3.5 GPA in a business or engineering discipline, we want to hear from you - even if you have a few years of work experience. We’re interested in graduates from any degree discipline that requires the analysis and manipulation of large amounts of quantitative data, but a degree in a subject like Geography or English could also prove useful. Regardless of your degree focus, we're looking for enthusiasm, an innovative spirit and the kind of big ideas that will help shape the future of Cobham and make a difference in the communities we work in. In return, you’ll have the chance to show us what you can do right from day one, as well as receive plenty of executive exposure in order to give you the skills you need to become a future leader.Please be advised, Cobham do not offer sponsorship. If you want to find out more about the role or have any questions related to it, please contact us on CRT.Graduate@cobham.com.Cobham | Innovators with Insight

378.desc: Company Information: Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP is a leading international law firm engaged in the practice of law in major cities throughout the world.  The principal areas of the firms practice include all aspects of corporate and transactional matters, tax and regulatory matters, and litigation.  The firms clients include a diverse group of leading corporations and financial institutions based in the United States and abroad, as well as sovereign governments, government agencies and individuals.  Cleary Gottlieb has 16 offices in New York, Washington, D.C., Beijing, Brussels, Buenos Aires, Cologne, Frankfurt, Hong Kong, London, Milan, Moscow, Paris, Rome, So Paulo, Abu Dhabi and Seoul and has more than 1,200 lawyers worldwide.  The firms culture is one of tolerance, diversity and respect for all employees.Job Description:Because of the firms cutting-edge corporate practice, the corporate paralegals at Cleary Gottlieb are exposed to a wide variety of complex corporate transactions and work with some of the most knowledgeable attorneys in the country.  As a result of the firms leading international practice  especially in Latin America  corporate paralegals will be exposed to the latest cross-border transactions.  In addition to challenging work, the corporate paralegal experience at Cleary Gottlieb offers an excellent educational experience for those interested in pursuing law school.The corporate paralegals are expected to be able to work independently and equally well as part of a team with a strong sense of loyalty towards co-workers, superiors, and staff.  The corporate paralegals work under the direct supervision of the attorneys and are expected to provide assistance on a vast array of projects and tasks, which include, but are not limited to:	Participation in due diligence investigations	Preparation of basic filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission and other governmental agencies	Preparation for and attendance at closings of various transactions, including assisting the client and attorneys during the closing; and preparation of closing binders to be sent to the client and other involved parties	Liaison between attorneys and various state agencies and services	Preparation and filing of certificates of incorporation, by-laws, resolutions, and foreign qualifications of companies	Translation of foreign language correspondence and documents (subject to the paralegals ability) and occasional interpretation for foreign clients attending closings	Performing cross-reference checks

379.desc: CrossLead is an enterprise leadership solution that combines our proven process, cloud-based software, and talented consultants to empower organizations to adapt and win in today’s dynamic environment. Drawing from shared experiences transforming the US counter-terrorism effort from a siloed, hierarchical apparatus into a high-performing team, we developed CrossLead to scale the adaptability of small teams to the enterprise level. It removes silos, eliminates dysfunctional practices, and dramatically increases the pace at which organizations can operate and succeed in complex environments. Founded in 2011 as McChrystal Group, LLC, CrossLead spun off in 2016 to scale our software-enabled leadership solution to empower organizations to minimize uncertainty and thrive. Based in the Washington, D.C metro area and San Francisco, we work with corporations and non-profits globally.Responsibilities•	Manage and update company website and social media platforms•	Create and execute CrossLead digital media and marketing strategy, including brand strategic plan and social media editorial calendar •	Manage digital media and marketing budget•	Implement and monitor social media guidelines•	Curate and promote media content, including blog posts, articles, and press releases•	Refine social and site analytics and leverage learnings to enhance social media and content strategies •	Lead bi-weekly digital media and marketing meetings

380.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the role:Develop the holistic brand awareness strategy, including media mix and spend distribution across product verticals, to meet our awareness goals and broader company goals. Build offline media strategies against key awareness building channels, including TV, print advertising, outdoor advertising and strategic partnerships. Manage relationships with external partners, including agency/partner selection, contract and pricing negotiation and performance management. Support CEO directly on strategic brand awareness project launches, including idea generation, financial modeling, program management and execution. Drive financial modeling and marketing analytics related to brand awareness building including media mix modeling, awareness measurement and segmentation strategies based on user/customer segments. Longer term, build and manage a world-class team by defining organizational needs, recruiting talent and developing that team to deliver against goals. Work with the Brand team to develop beautiful, engaging campaigns that are optimized for customer engagement.Perform competitive and market research to stay abreast of the external industry.

381.position: Elementary School Apprentice Teacher (2016-2017 School Year
381.desc: An Invitation to Apply for the Position ofElementary School Apprentice TeacherConey Island Preparatory Public Charter SchoolBrooklyn, New YorkAbout Coney Island PrepConey Island Prep is a college preparatory public charter school in Brooklyn, New York. Merging growth, performance and commitment, the Coney Island Prep community takes its responsibility to prepare students for the college and career of their choice very seriously. Professionals balance their sense of ownership and responsibility with humility and levity and are supported every step of the way.We were thrilled to launch Coney Island Prep’s elementary school in August 2014.  Over the next two years Coney Island Prep will continue its growth to serve approximately 1,000 scholars in grades K–12.  The mission of Coney Island Prep is to prepare every student to succeed in the college and career of their choice.  We achieve success through a rigorous academic program in a supportive and structured school community.CommitmentThere is no more urgent task than to educate students from low-income backgrounds.  So we hire professionals who are committed to the core.  It’s high-energy, fast-paced, tiring and sometimes all-consuming.  But we wouldn’t have it any other way.  And neither would you.What We Have to OfferThere are plenty of ways you can make an impact.  And our team is all in.  You have the opportunity to work with students, and there’s always someone who’s got your back from coaching you through a bad day to helping you grow professionally. And while the environment can be hectic and ever-changing, you’ll have all of the technology and caffeine you need to get the job done.What We Ask In ReturnYou have to be all in too.  You own your work and when you reach your goals, you reach higher.  Our professionals work incredibly hard, and are inspired by the urgency of what we do.  We need professionals who aren’t afraid to ask for help, feedback, and support.  They’re driven by personal responsibility, data, and results, and they’re not above doing whatever’s asked.  They make friends at work, smile through hectic days, and add a little levity in along the way.The OpportunityThe Apprentice Teacher position is a great opportunity for recent college graduates who are interested in pursuing a career in education, but do not have prior teaching experience.  This one-year apprenticeship allows you to gain valuable experience by taking on responsibilities both inside and outside of the classroom, while receiving exceptional professional development throughout the year.  At the end of the apprenticeship year, Apprentice Teachers are well positioned for a full-time teaching role. Mindsets and Experience•	Passion for education and a dedication to Coney Island Prep’s mission•	Steadfast belief that all students can achieve at the highest academic levels and deserve an opportunity to succeed in the college of their choice•	Bachelors degree required; Masters degree and NY state certification preferred•	Professional demeanor and excellent organizational skills•	Self-reflective and open to regular feedback•	An entrepreneurial spirit, embracing the opportunity for creativity and hard work inherent in a start-up•	A positive, solution-oriented attitude and drive for excellence•	Willingness to be a team player.Responsibilities•	Support the Operations Team and Dean of Students in planning field trips, grade-wide incentive programs, and hallway and classroom decoration.•	Support teachers with general administrative responsibilities, including entering grades, making copies, and maintaining classroom libraries.•	Plan and teach one subject to a core group of scholars. •	Provide coverage and support for all grade levels and subjects as needed.•	Support students’ academic achievement through individual or small-group tutoring.•	Assume a high level of personal responsibility for the progress of all students.•	Take on a proactive part in creating a positive, structured, results-oriented and fun school culture.•	Commit to a school culture of consistency by implementing school-wide systems, structures and procedures. Benefits and Compensation•	Apprentice Teachers receive an annualized salary of $40,000.•	As a regular full time employee of Coney Island Prep School, you will be eligible for benefits that include medical, dental and vision, as well as a generous retirement benefit package.•	Apprentice Teachers are provided with laptops and access to all the necessary technology and resources needed to succeed in the classroom.Start DateAugust 2016Contact Information Interested applicants should go to https://coneyisland.schoolrecruiter.net/Index.aspx to apply for available jobs.  Coney Island Preparatory Public Charter School is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, national origin, citizenship or disability.

386.desc: Would you like to create the technology of tomorrow?   At Cobham, we’ve got what it takes to turn our graduates into the next generation of innovators, pioneers and entrepreneurs. That’s why we’ve developed a graduate program with two distinct streams that provide opportunities for the next generation of business leaders and engineers alike. Our Functional Excellence stream for engineers is a structured, closely monitored, two to three year rotational program. The program will be a series of six to nine month rotations in various disciplines, and will allow you to explore some of Cobham’s offices located in California, Arizona, Iowa, New York, New Hampshire, Massachusetts and Pennsylvania.  The duration of the program is customized to fit your and the businesses needs and will commence at the beginning of September. The recruitment and selection process comprises online application, telephone interview, online test and assessment centre, and we would advise you to apply for this opportunity at the beginning of your senior year of college. How quickly you are taken through the process will be dependent on assessment centre dates, although the sooner you apply the more likely it is you’ll be considered for the assessment centre and therefore selected to join the program. No matter what area you choose to go into, you can count on maximum exposure to our technology and global culture, so you’ll be required to complete placements across at least three of our divisions. Where you are placed in the US depends on your career aspirations and what stream you decide to follow, but wherever you go with us you’ll find support and development opportunities, regular reviews and frequent training sessions. The program is big in its scope and goals, but not overly so - everyone knows each other, and you’ll have plenty of time to build your social and professional networks.Throughout the program, you'll have regular performance and development reviews with your assignment manager. You'll also be given a mentor who will provide personal and professional support, and a development log that will help you keep track of your progress. And if you want to gain a relevant professional qualification, such as chartered status or a professional certification, we'll support you all the way. At the end of the program, you'll have the opportunity to apply for a permanent position anywhere within the business. Where you end up is up to you, but in a company as diverse as ours, you'll always have interesting opportunities. What’s more, every placement you take part in will be vastly different from the others, and there’ll never be any doubt that the work you’re doing is adding significant value to the company.If you will have the right to work in the US at the time of starting your employment, and a 3.5 GPA in an engineering discipline, we want to hear from you – even if you have a few years of work experience. We're looking for enthusiasm, an innovative spirit and the kind of big ideas that will help shape the future of Cobham and make a difference in the communities we work in. In return, you’ll have the chance to show us what you can do right from day one, as well as receive plenty of executive exposure in order to give you the skills you need to become a future leader. Please be advised, Cobham do not offer sponsorship. If you want to find out more about the role or have any questions related to it, please contact us on CRT.Graduate@cobham.com.Cobham | Innovators with Insight

387.desc: If you are interested in applying to this job, please submit your information here: http://www.jsco.re/7dq8The Company: Our mission is to be the worlds leading marketplace to help homeowners find & hire the best service professionals for their home repair, maintenance and improvement needs. We have helped over 30 million people find a trusted home services professional and have been featured in publications such as Fast Company, Wired, The Today Show, the Wall Street Journal and the Huffington Post. We are a subsidiary of IAC (NASDAQ:IACI). The HomeAdvisor NY sales team is unrivaled; combining a fast paced high energy culture with committed professional training and development programs. We are ramping up our sales team today to meet the growing demands of our business. HomeAdvisor NY is based in the heart of New York City, in Times Square. Please check out www.homeadvisor.com for more information about our product, and come visit us at www.getfelix.com for a glimpse into our office and our culture.SALES ASSOCIATES: Our Sales Associate role provides a unique opportunity for anyone interested in gaining experience in the world of sales and internet media. Working alongside some of the smartest and most passionate innovators, you will join our powerhouse sales team. You will be fully immersed in growing our company, and will gain invaluable, life-long communication skills. Our sales team is vital to the companys success, and we need A+ talent to come in and help take our company to the next level. YOU: Are driven to succeed in everything you do, and you NEVER give up  Are outgoing, with a great personality and good people skills Are interested in the start-up world, interactive media space, and cutting-edge technology Want to contribute immediately to a team-oriented environment Have a strong and focused work ethic; Are able to handle a daily grind Want to learn and get better everyday Take the initiative to go above and beyond Are a self-starter  Are career oriented, and looking for growth Have a sharp, professional demeanor  Are excited by high-energy, fast paced settings  Are competitive  Are looking to get into sales THE JOB:  Call on and speak with small business owners across the country, consulting on HomeAdvisors services and products - We will provide all leads, and you will be cold-calling before you have follow-ups/warm calls or a pipeline in place  Drive new business acquisition  Learn sales techniques and help to develop new, creative sales strategies  Share feedback and ideas with upper management  Develop excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills REQUIREMENTS:  Must have PASSION  Must have FUN  Take challenges head-on, and face rejection with a consistently positive attitude!  Desire to put in 115%  Ability to work independently, while also actively contributing within a team  Excellent time management and organization skills required  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Advanced MS Office skills, including Outlook, Word and Excel, and strong familiarity with e-mail and Internet  Bachelors degree as of 1/2016 Sales experience a plus, but not necessary We offer a competitive base plus commission compensation package, as well as a comprehensive benefits program, including: o Health insurance, with options for dental and vision coverage o A relaxed work atmosphere o Paid vacation, personal, and sick time o 401k o Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner ** All benefits listed are subject to change.Equal opportunity employer

We need professionals who aren’t afraid to ask for help, feedback, and support.  They’re driven by personal responsibility, data, and results, and they’re not above doing whatever’s asked.  They make friends at work, smile through hectic days, and add a little levity in along the way.The OpportunityThe Apprentice Teacher position is a great opportunity for recent college graduates who are interested in pursuing a career in education, but do not have prior teaching experience.  This one-year apprenticeship allows you to gain valuable experience by taking on responsibilities both inside and outside of the classroom, while receiving exceptional professional development throughout the year.  At the end of the apprenticeship year, Apprentice Teachers are well positioned for a full-time teaching role. Mindsets and Experience•	Passion for education and a dedication to Coney Island Prep’s mission•	Steadfast belief that all students can achieve at the highest academic levels and deserve an opportunity to succeed in the college of their choice•	Bachelors degree required; Masters degree and NY state certification preferred•	Professional demeanor and excellent organizational skills•	Self-reflective and open to regular feedback•	An entrepreneurial spirit, embracing the opportunity for creativity and hard work inherent in a start-up•	A positive, solution-oriented attitude and drive for excellence•	Willingness to be a team player. Responsibilities•	Support the Operations Team and Dean of Students in planning field trips, grade-wide incentive programs, and hallway and classroom decoration.•	Support teachers with general administrative responsibilities, including entering grades, making copies, and maintaining classroom libraries.•	Plan and teach one subject to a core group of scholars. •	Provide coverage and support for all grade levels and subjects as needed.•	Support students’ academic achievement through individual or small-group tutoring.•	Assume a high level of personal responsibility for the progress of all students.•	Take on a proactive part in creating a positive, structured, results-oriented and fun school culture.•	Commit to a school culture of consistency by implementing school-wide systems, structures and procedures. Benefits and Compensation•	Apprentice Teachers receive an annualized salary of $40,000.•	As a regular full time employee of Coney Island Prep School, you will be eligible for benefits that include medical, dental and vision, as well as a generous retirement benefit package.•	Apprentice Teachers are provided with laptops and access to all the necessary technology and resources needed to succeed in the classroom.Start DateAugust 2016Contact Information Interested applicants should go to https://coneyisland.schoolrecruiter.net/Index.aspx to apply for available jobs. 397.desc: Since 1966, Mecalux has been known for its high quality specialization in the design, manufacturing, sale, and services of metal racking, automated warehouses, and other storage solutions. Mecalux is a global leader in the storage systems market, selling to more than 70 countries. Interlake Mecalux, the US subsidiary of Mecalux, is hiring Industrial Sales Representatives to join our sales team. We are a growing company that is looking for an energetic and qualified Industrial Sales Representative to lead us to further growth in the following regions: - New Jersey - New York - Boston - Philadelphia - Atlanta - Chicago - Dallas - Houston- San Antonio - Austin - Phoenix - San Diego - Los Angeles - San Francisco - Sacramento  - Denver - Indianapolis- St Louis- Des Moines - Cleveland- Detroit - Minneapolis - Milwaukee - Columbus - Seattle - Portland - Nashville - Memphis - Oklahoma City - Tulsa - Raleigh - Charlotte - MiamiThe Industrial Sales Representative is responsible for targeting, acquiring, enlarging, and maintaining sales of InterlakeMecaluxproducts within his or her assigned territory.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:    Manage relationships by updating customers' knowledge of products/applications, securing engineering/design support, and providing appropriate training.    Demonstrate leadership with customers by conducting sales presentations, directing sales calls, managing contract negotiations, and overseeing the execution of sales contracts.    Utilize market research to develop sales opportunities which will assure market performance and penetration in support of business initiatives.    Partner with customers to develop long term relationships, generate additional sales, and guide problem resolution discussions.    Develop monthly and weekly sales plans that include prospecting activities and forecasts.    Ensure completion of customer projects through the coordination of engineering, manufacturing, installation, and customer service activities.We offer: 	Interlake Mecalux offers excellent benefits including:- Salary commensurate with experience.- Excellent insurance including medical, dental, vision, life/disability.- Robust 401(k) plan with a generous company match.- Paid time off and paid holidays.- The invaluable opportunity to work for a growing, global company that values continuous process improvements and promotes from within.

398.desc: Job Description:Kidron Corporate Advisors is a New York based boutique investment bank. Kidron is seeking to add an Analyst to its team. Analysts support the origination and execution of M&A transactions, capital raises, and other strategic advisory assignments. Analysts play a meaningful role in our small deal teams and must be capable to meet tight deadlines under low supervision and enjoy working in fast-paced demanding environments. Duties Include:•     Provide analytical, research, and marketing support to senior bankers•     Build detailed financial models and perform valuation analyses•     Prepare marketing materials, executive summaries, information memorandums, and management presentations•     Perform industry and company research

399.desc: Company Information: Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP is a leading international law firm engaged in the practice of law in major cities throughout the world.  The principal areas of the firms practice include all aspects of corporate and transactional matters, tax and regulatory matters, and litigation.  The firms clients include a diverse group of leading corporations and financial institutions based in the United States and abroad, as well as sovereign governments, government agencies and individuals.  Cleary Gottlieb has 16 offices in New York, Washington, D.C., Beijing, Brussels, Buenos Aires, Cologne, Frankfurt, Hong Kong, London, Milan, Moscow, Paris, Rome, So Paulo, Abu Dhabi and Seoul and has more than 1,200 lawyers worldwide.  The firms culture is one of tolerance, diversity and respect for all employees.Job Description:Maintain case documents; assist attorneys with preparation of pleadings, filings and document productions; proof-read and cite check legal documents; prepare for and attend depositions, hearings and trials; perform LEXIS, Westlaw, internet and field research; translate foreign language documents; and interact with clients, local counsel and our Washington, D.C. and international offices.  Clients range from large international corporations to indigent pro bono individuals.

Professionals balance their sense of ownership and responsibility with humility and levity and are supported every step of the way.We were thrilled to launch Coney Island Prep’s elementary school in August 2014.  Over the next four years Coney Island Prep will grow to serve approximately 1,000 scholars in grades K–12.  The mission of Coney Island Prep is to prepare every student to succeed in the college and career of their choice.  We achieve success through a rigorous academic program in a supportive and structured school community.CommitmentThere is no more urgent task than to educate students from low-income backgrounds.  So we hire professionals who are committed to the core.  It’s high-energy, fast-paced, tiring and sometimes all-consuming.  But we wouldn’t have it any other way.  And neither would you.What We Have to OfferThere are plenty of ways you can make an impact.  And our team is all in.  You have the opportunity to work with students, and there’s always someone who’s got your back from coaching you through a bad day to helping you grow professionally. And while the environment can be hectic and ever-changing, you’ll have all of the technology and caffeine you need to get the job done.What We Ask In ReturnYou have to be all in too.  You own your work and when you reach your goals, you reach higher.  Our professionals work incredibly hard, and are inspired by the urgency of what we do.  We need professionals who aren’t afraid to ask for help, feedback, and support.  They’re driven by personal responsibility, data, and results, and they’re not above doing whatever’s asked.  They make friends at work, smile through hectic days, and add a little levity in along the way. Mindsets and Experience•	Passion for education and a dedication to Coney Island Prep’s mission•	Steadfast belief that all students can achieve at the highest academic levels and deserve an opportunity to succeed in the college of their choice•	Bachelors degree required; Masters degree and NY state certification preferred•	Professional demeanor and excellent organizational skills•	Self-reflective and open to regular feedback•	An entrepreneurial spirit, embracing the opportunity for creativity and hard work inherent in a start-up•	A positive, solution-oriented attitude and drive for excellence•	Willingness to be a team player.Responsibilities•	Assume a high level of personal responsibility for the progress of all students•	Create academically rigorous lesson plans, materials, and assessments, and differentiate as needed•	Teach engaging, rigorous, and relevant lessons daily•	Communicate effectively with all stakeholders, including scholars, families, and staff•	Commit to a school culture of consistency by implementing school-wide systems, structures, and procedures•	Reflect on various data sources to improve your practice•	Take on a proactive role in creating a positive, structured, results-oriented and fun school cultureBenefits and Compensation•	Teachers at Coney Island Prep are provided with an extremely generous salary and are eligible for a school-wide performance-based bonus.•	As a regular full time employee of Coney Island Prep School, you will be eligible for benefits that include medical, dental and vision, as well as a generous retirement benefit package. •	Teachers are provided with laptops and access to all the necessary technology and resources needed to succeed in the classroom.Start DateAugust 2016Contact Information Interested applicants should go to https://coneyisland.schoolrecruiter.net/Index.aspx to apply for available jobs.  Coney Island Preparatory Public Charter School is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, national origin, citizenship or disability.

406.desc: First Quality Enterprises, Inc. (FQE), founded in 1988, is a global multi-billion dollar privately held company with over 4,200 employees.  Its corporate offices are located in Great Neck, New York, with manufacturing facilities and offices in Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Georgia, Canada, and China.  FQE is a diversified family of companies manufacturing consumer products ranging from Absorbent Hygiene (adult incontinence, feminine care, and baby care), Tissue (bath and towel), and Industrial (non-woven fabrics, print and packaging materials, thermoformed plastics), serving institutional and retail markets throughout the world.  FQE focuses on private label and branded product lines.Our core business philosophy is built on a proud culture driven by safety and quality, respect, humility, integrity, customer focus, and teamwork.  With leading edge manufacturing technologies and processes and visionary leadership, FQE is positioned to continue significant growth in the coming years.  We are seeking an experienced Process Engineer for our First Quality Retail Services Group, manufacturing facility located in King of Prussia, PA.         This position will be responsible for providing technical leadership on assigned lines with similar technology, manufacturing cost and quality improvements, manufacturing equipment utilization, reliability, speeds, scrap rates, and efficiency goals.

407.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the Role:Minted is seeking an experienced retail leader to manage online merchandising and onsite marketing for the Minted brand.The Senior Director, Onsite Marketing is responsible for all aspects of presenting Minted’s products for sale on the Minted site, including the seasonal calendar, on-site messaging and selling strategies, and promotional strategy.  In collaboration with the CEO and the business General Managers, he or she will build an online merchandising strategy that drives revenue, engages customers, and continues the diversification of the Minted brand across all of its categories of business.  This individual will be a key manager of the Minted brand, working closely with the CEO and others to shape the brand and its expression.A successful candidate will be highly experienced in managing e-commerce onsite marketing and merchandising. (S)he will be passionate about Minted’s products and have strong commercial and shopping instincts, understanding how and when to sell our products.  This individual will also be deeply analytical and use data to drive decision-making.At the intersection of marketing and merchandising, this role reports to the CEO initially, then to the VP Brand Communications.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and drive the on-site merchandising calendar for the year: thoughtful, customer focused, merchandising concepts that will drive customer engagement, maintain the premium nature of Minted’s brand, and balance real estate allocation according to the company’s strategic goals, with a focus on seasonal relevance, fresh messaging, and creative storytelling.Develop the annual promotional calendar and manage promotional activities across Minted, including promotional offers, messaging and events.Allocate real estate on homepage and other shared real estate to accomplished desired brand understanding.Drive analytics and A/B testing. Develop a deep understanding of user behavior and customer segments on Minted.com through web analytics.Manage promotional strategy and execution with the goal of maximizing promotional efficacy, taking into account seasonality and customer segments. Forecast and actualize impact of proposed promotional offers through comprehensive lift analysis.Work with the Brand team to develop beautiful, engaging campaigns that are optimized for customer engagement. Ensure that messaging and creative assets are consistent throughout channels, including on-site, email, and direct mail.Partner with Product Management (PM), to own the conversion rates of the site, along with discoverability of product via homepage banners, navigation, on-site search, landing pages, and more.Perform competitive and market research to stay abreast of the external industry.

408.desc: DRW is a principal trading organization, meaning all of our trading is for our own account, and all of our methods, systems and applications are solely for our own use. Unlike hedge funds, brokerage firms and banks, DRW has no investors, clients or customers. DRW trades actively in a wide range of asset classes both domestically and internationally.DRW is headquartered in Chicago and has offices in London, Montreal, New York, San Francisco and Singapore.  We currently employ over 600 people worldwide from many different disciplines and backgrounds.DRW is looking for a Chicago-based Trade Support Engineer to support a rapidly growing environment.  Please note that you must apply for positions with DRW through your University’s career services website and also directly on our company website at www.drw.com. Responsibilities:•Provides application support for front office, middle office and back office applications and users•Supports proprietary and third party systems•Works closely with software developers and traders to improve, monitor and maintain internal systems•Contributes to the engineering efforts to automate processes, monitor systems and improve software management on both Microsoft and Unix platforms•Communicates directly with exchanges, clearing members and ISV’s to resolve trading issues•Releases and verifies new software packages to production•Maintain enterprise scheduling, release and monitoring systems

409.desc: SUMMER TRAC PROGRAMThe Summer TRAC Program provides exceptional college juniors with an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in our risk management and insurance brokerage practices. The Summer TRAC Program is designed to give students an insight into Marsh’s business and culture, and to allow us to assess students’ potential to make a long term contribution to the firm. As a Summer TRAC Associate, students will be placed in one of our hub cities for a minimum of ten consecutive weeks time enough for challenging assignments that contribute directly to our business.Key components of the Summer TRAC Program include:- Weekly Speaker Series- Formal Goal Setting- Business Case Team Project- Buddy Program- Performance Management- Community Service Project- Networking OpportunitiesUpon completion of the summer internship, exceptional juniors may be extended an offer to join our full-time TRAC Program. LOCATIONSOpportunities for the Summer TRAC Program are available in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, Philadelphia, New York and San Francisco.

410.desc: If you are looking to expand your career horizons in the areas of industry, technology, and client-facing work, look no further than the Customer Support Engineering Role at OSIsoft.  In this role you have the opportunity to make a significant impact for our enterprise customers each and every day, while simultaneously building upon your existing skillsets.  Want to pursue a management role?  Just ask and you’ll have the opportunity to mentor and drive resolutions for our enterprise customers like Shell and Bayer.  Perhaps you were looking to explore the world of development, but need to get your feet wet with some basic programming courses; take some courses on the side all while troubleshooting complex software issues that will allow you to prove your problem solving ability, and we’ll take it from there.  The Customer Support Engineering role will allow you to develop a variety of skills that will contribute to your entire career, and fortunately, you get to work with a team of really smart people to in turn help our really smart customers. We are currently looking to hire Customer Support Engineers in San Leandro, CA, Philadelphia, PA and Johnson City, TN. As a Customer Support Engineer, you will:•	Complete a 6 month orientation and training period where you will learn about our products, customers, and company culture. This will happen through classroom training, customer interactions, visiting operating facilities, shadowing and hands on experience helping customers get value from their PI systems.•	Rotate between the Technical Support & Field Service roles. You will cycle through both activities for varying amount of times.o	Technical Support involves handling phone and email requests from our customers that have questions about our software, and usually involves in-depth troubleshooting.  We are looking for the best and brightest problem solvers to be the face of the company while getting our customers’ software solutions to a working and thriving state. o	Field Service involves installation and configuration of our software at a customer site, either in-person or remote. This requires properly installing and configuring the software for the customers’ environment and troubleshooting any issues that come up. It will require some travel to customer sites.o	Work on internal projects that develop relevant skills such as programming, industry experience and customer interaction skills.You may enjoy this if:•	You love problem solving•	You have a passion for technology and computers•	You are customer focused•	You appreciate team work and like to share ideasWe’re looking for:•	Top graduates from the best Engineering & Computer Engineering Universities•	Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree or PhD•	Chemical, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering background or related field with a minimum GPA of 3.5•	Strong computer knowledge, troubleshooting ability and communication skillsWhat you will learn, how to:•	Systemically troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues •	Provide world class customer service, face to face and over the phone while making an impact for industry leaders•	Collaborate with all parts of organization, including engineering, and salesBenefits :•	Mentorship: You will be assigned a mentor to guide you in your new job•	Office Exchange: Travel to one of our foreign offices to grow professionally and culturally•	Healthy Snacks: Take a break from work to enjoy a healthy, homemade snacks•	Casual Work Attire•	Work/Life BalanceAbout OSIsoft: At OSIsoft, we provide the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™. Our customers rely upon the PI System™ to safeguard data and deliver enterprise-wide visibility into operational, manufacturing and business information. The PI System™ enables users to manage assets, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, improve processes, drive innovation, make business decisions in real time, and to identify competitive business and market opportunities. We are time series data; if the data has a value at a given time, we collect it, store it, and show it to our customers whenever they need it! We let engineers and managers see exactly what’s going on in their processes in real time– useful right?EEO/AA/Veterans/Disabled

411.desc: New Street is looking for bright, creative thinkers to join our rapidly growing intellectual capital business. You would be a great fit if you are intellectually curious, creative, love problem solving, and work well in a fast paced, unstructured environment with lots of autonomy.Who we are: New Street Research is the preeminent global research and analysis firm focused on the Communications Services sector.  We have offices in New York, London and Singapore.  The team is comprised of top-ranked analysts that led teams at JPMorgan, UBS, Credit Suisse, and Merrill Lynch in the US, Europe, Asia and emerging markets. We left investment banks to found New Street because we knew that we could do research better if we were independent; we knew we could innovate; we knew we could create a product that was substantially more valuable than anything coming out of investment banks; we wanted to be and work with entrepreneurs.  We also knew we would have more fun if we used our knowledge, skills and relationships to do more than just research.What we do: Our primary business is advising institutional investors where to invest in the Communications Services sector; however, when we are at our best we are combining intellect and industry knowledge to help shape the industry we cover.  We solve problems for investors, telecom & cable companies, regulatory agencies and other industry participants ranging from investment decisions, capital raising, capital deployment, strategy and policy.What you will learn: First and foremost you will hone your problem solving and analytical capabilities.  You will learn to build frameworks to dissect, explain and solve complex problems.  These skills will be invaluable wherever you go next, whether it is in research, public market investing, private equity, consulting, banking, or industry.  You will work directly with senior analysts (no layers).  You will debate strategy with the CEOs and CFOs of some of the largest companies in the world.  You will debate investment ideas with the largest and most successful investors in the world.  You will be expected to learn fast and put yourself in a position to manage projects independently from the start.

412.desc: WalletHub.com – one of the nation’s leading personal finance destinations – is rapidly growing and is seeking a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Finance Reporter. The position includes conducting industry research studies, writing blog posts and educational guides, moderating Q&A forums, developing in-house video content, and much more!WalletHub contributes to most of the country’s largest national news outlets, including The Washington Post, Fox Business, The McClatchy Company, US News, The Huffington Post, American City Business Journals, Forbes, CNBC, Businessweek, and The Boston Globe.  Our team is hardworking, energetic, and focused on helping consumers save money. This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to truly make a difference and enjoys a challenge.Why WalletHub?  WalletHub’s initial focus was in the credit card space, and we quickly became the go-to credit card resource for consumers and industry professionals alike.  Not only did the nonprofit group Consumer Action rate WalletHub as the best credit card website, but our industry research and expert opinions are featured in the national media far more often than any other company in the space.WalletHub is now aggressively expanding into the rest of the personal finance market – from everyday banking and insurance to mortgages and investing.  We already boast the largest directory of financial companies and professionals on the Web, and our goal is to ultimately change the way people think about money.  How do we plan to do that?  As the first ever social network built from the ground up around personal finance, WalletHub is disrupting the notion that money is a taboo subject, and we’re connecting consumers with each other and subject matter experts.  WalletHub enables consumers to compare financial products, read and write reviews about financial companies and professionals, ask and answer questions, group around shared interests, customize their financial news, and much more.In short, WalletHub is well on the way to being the Yelp of personal finance (but on steroids), and this is your opportunity to get in on the ground floor.  Yes, it is true that you will most likely get paid a bit more and work a bit less if you decide to play it safe and work for a large corporation.  But will you make a difference?  Probably not, but you will if you decide to join WalletHub team and take this journey with us!Regardless of whether the next step in your career is starting your own business or working for a Fortune 500 company, the type of intensive hands-on experience that you will gain while at WalletHub will leave you in a better position to succeed.Ideal WalletHub Team Member•	Willing to work hard (50-55hrs per week)•	Attention to detail•	Love of learning•	Limitless creativity•	Effective communicator & collaborator•	Top 10% of graduating class•	Hungry to make a difference•	Unfaltering work ethic•	Big dreams & a desire to make a differenceCompensation•	Very competitive salary based on prior experience•	Potential for stock options after the first year•	Health benefits•	Visa sponsorship

413.desc: OSIsoft is a growing company that is dedicated to keeping a small business feel while maintaining global outreach. We hire smart people, and trust them to make the right decisions for the organization, and the customer. OSIsoft provides the best aspects of a startup, such as direct access to customers, learning and training opportunities, new technology, and challenging engineering problems, as well as the stability of a company devoted to being around for the next 30 years. The Inside Sales Representative position gives you the foundation and expertise to launch a successful sales career within OSIsoft. It involves actively contacting current customers and an unwavering ability to get on the phone to develop strong and successful relationships with prospects. The ideal candidate should have a global business vision and be able to work in a team environment to meet the sales goals. We are looking for enthusiastic, passionate and inquisitive people for this role in San Leandro, CA and Philadelphia, PA.As an Inside Sales Representative:•	You will be a key player by engaging current customers in their annual renewal of support and maintenance of their PI infrastructure•	You will discover, contact and introduce our product to potential customers in a specific region.•	You will be responsible for managing the entire sales cycle of specific opportunities in a defined territory including requirements gathering, product recommendations, proposal generation, pipeline management and deal closure•	Use of CRM will be part of your daily routine to help you keep track of your opportunities and review your performance over time•	Stay up to date on our technology to be able to sell the newest products to our customersYou may enjoy this if:•	You are a highly motivated competitive person.•	You have a passion for technology and want learn to more about this industry.•	You are driven by building relationships.  We’re looking for:•	Top graduates who have a Bachelors or Master’s degree in engineering or a related field with a minimum GPA of 3.0•	Skills to effectively communicate technology value on the phone to new contacts and capacity to handle rejection without impeding motivation•	Industrial process and automation knowledge is a plus•	Experience with Microsoft CRM and SAP is desirableThe Good Stuff:•	Competitive Pay•	Healthy snacks: Take a break from work to enjoy a healthy, homemade snacks•	Casual environment and work attire•	Work/Life BalanceOSIsoft provides the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™. Our customers rely upon the PI System™ to safeguard data and deliver enterprise-wide visibility into operational, manufacturing and business information. The PI System™ enables users to manage assets, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, improve processes, drive innovation, make business decisions in real time, and to identify competitive business and market opportunities. We are time series data; if the data has a value at a given time, we collect it, store it, and show it to our customers whenever they need it! We let engineers and managers see exactly what’s going on in their processes in real time– useful right?EEO/AA/Veterans/Disabled

414.desc: Build your career. It’s all right here.We are a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Employees can be a force for good only when they are working at the top of their ability, learning new skills and challenging themselves with new responsibilities. Allstate’s Enterprise Talent Market was developed with that in mind, to help you reach your full potential.Job DescriptionAllstate is a company that's transforming - and we need charismatic and innovative professionals for our Investments Development Program - leaders who can help drive decisions as we evolve into the future.  Are you up to the challenge? The Allstate Investments Development Program is designed to build versatile leaders by providing cross-functional experience through three rotations within Investments at Allstate. Each rotation lasts one full year and aligns to the Investments organization.  This approach builds business acumen and deep expertise that is imperative for successful at Allstate. Participants will have the opportunity to jump-start their career within an area in which they want to focus through the following opportunities:Three 1-year structured rotations in different areas within InvestmentsRotations within each area could consist of the following:Trading, Risk, Research, Investments Finance, Real Estate and/or Private EquityAssignments that involve people, project, and change management along with client-facing work, operations, and strategyTwo formal learning conferences each year with experiential learning opportunities and exposure to key leadersFormal mentoring relationships with experienced Allstate Leaders as well as a peer mentor during the programOpportunities to get to know our nonprofit partners and to volunteer within and outside of Allstate The Details:The program begins Summer 2016Rotation locations will be within our Home Office in Northbrook, IllinoisJob QualificationsQualifications:Bachelor's Degree completed in 2016Cumulative GPA of 3.5+Diverse backgrounds and experiencesBA/BS in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Business or related area of studySignificant relevant business experience via internships or campus preferredExtensive Leadership experience through extra-curricular activities, community involvement, or in the workplaceStrong interpersonal, organizational, and multi-tasking skillsGood Work. Good Life. Good Hands®. As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component. For jobs in San Francisco, please see the notice regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.

415.desc: OSIsoft is a growing company that is dedicated to keeping a small business feel while maintaining global outreach. We hire smart people, and trust them to make the right decisions for the organization, and the customer. OSIsoft provides the best aspects of a startup, such as direct access to customers, learning and training opportunities, new technology, and challenging engineering problems, as well as the stability of a company devoted to being around for the next 30 years. The IT Support Engineer role is an integral part of the IT function. This role is designed to give you experience in all parts of IT, and allows you to explore the areas that interest you most. You will spend half of your time providing desktop support for all of our employees. The other part of your time will be working on internal projects that develop IT skills such as networking, development or project manager. We are currently looking to IT Support Engineers into our offices in San Leandro, CA and Philadelphia, PA. As an IT Support Engineer, you will learn:•	All things related to office 365, Cisco Call Manager, and handling issues via the online ticketing system•	The IT Infrastructure including network engineering, Physical and Virtual Machine infrastructure, storage arrays, DevOPS, Vendor Management, SQL Administration, and much more•	How to support the internal PI system You may enjoy this if:•	You love problem solving•	You have a passion for technology and computers•	You are customer focused and like team environments with lots of multi-tasking.We’re looking for:•	Basic computer troubleshooting experience, ability to communicate with a multiple types of people, excellent problem solving skills, and experience in working with different customer service•	Bachelor's, or Master's Degree in Computer, Chemical, Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering or related field with a minimum GPA of a 3.0The Good Stuff:•	Competitive Pay•	Office Exchange: Travel to one of our foreign offices to grow professionally and culturally•	Healthy snacks: Take a break from work to enjoy a healthy, homemade snacks•	Casual environment and work attire•	Work/Life BalanceOSIsoft provides the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™.
