416.desc: About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning. To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, the brightest, and the most highly motivated adults we can find. We value excellence, celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.We are seeking an ambitious Policies and Procedures Associate to join our Network Operations team at Success Academies (SA). Reporting to a Director of Operations, the Network Operations Associate will be responsible for providing support to the schools and Network for the Scholar Management System (SMS), operational policy and procedures, documentation, launching and maintaining procedures with schools across the network, and other project management support. ResponsibilitiesOur Policies and Procedures Associate has the exciting opportunity to...•	Serve as a pivotal member of a cross-functional Network team to support a cohort of schools to achieve operational excellence in all areas•	Support the operational policies & procedures for your cohort of schools in the following areas: scholar information, scholar medical needs, scholar food service, scholar uniforms, and school quality assessment standardso	Provide schools with the tools and information they need to do their jobs effectivelyo	Answer questions and concerns from your cohort of schools dailyo	Notice trends in questions and concerns, and work with the policies & procedures group to address globally to create long-term solutions•	Provide project support to a cross-departmental team of policies & procedures professionals, including but not limited to:o	Edit and update documents, forms, and training materials according to SA branding and style requirementso	Develop efficient and effective project management systems for tracking and executing projects and tasks as they ariseo	Contribute ideas to continuously improve existing systems and processes•	Work collaboratively and efficiently with various Network teams to advance initiatives of the policies & procedures group•	Provide general project management for your cohort of schools as necessary•	Provide general School support as necessary throughout the year, including rallies and specials events

417.desc: About Our Company:ESM Productions is a premier, full-service event production company that specializes in the creative design, planning and execution of high-profile events and productions that are delivered on stage, on screen and online. We supply the innovative expertise, resources and state-of-the-art technology to meet a wide variety of production needs and challenges. Our skilled, in-house production staff creates digital media, social platforms and video packages to help clients share messages with their audience.ESM Productions has produced some of the most high-profile large-scale events across the nation. Some of the largest events we have produced include the Wawa Welcome America! Festival, the Budweiser Made In America Festival, the 2008 World Series Championship Parade & Celebration for the Philadelphia Phillies, and the 2013 March on Washington to commemorate the 50 year anniversary of the first March on Washington. In September, ESM will produce events for the World Meeting of Families- Pope Francis visit, which is expected to draw over 1 million attendees.We are looking for a well-rounded, diverse individual seeking experience in the field of live event production. This opportunity is well suited for students with an interest in Tourism-Hospitality and Communications majors. Previous experience with events will be helpful for this experience, but not required. Internships at ESM are taken very seriously. Exceptional interns, who prove themselves to be great problem solvers, are often asked to stay and extend their internship.Intern Responsibilities:• Greet visitors and callers, handle their inquiries and direct them to the appropriate persons according to their needs• Complete forms according to company procedures• Prepare and manage correspondence, reports and documents• Handle incoming mail and other materials• Operate office equipment which includes printer, plotter, fax machine and mailing/shipping devices• Attend events and assist production team with the set-up and break-down• Be a contributing team member to ESM

418.desc: Position Summary: The Community College Research Center (CCRC) at the Institute on Education and the Economy at Teachers College, Columbia University is accepting applications for a post-doctoral research associate who will co-lead quantitative research projects focused on advising and student support services, developmental education, progression to a degree, and other student success initiatives. The post-doctoral research associate will design appropriate analyses to address research questions, analyze data independently, co-author related reports and publications, and present study results independently at local and national conferences. For more information on CCRC’s current research activities, see: CCRC Current Projects. This is a full-time, two-year, grant-funded position based in New York City, with the option for an extension of the appointment if funds and performance allow. The position includes a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as support for research-related travel and expenses. Responsibilities:- Perform sophisticated quantitative analysis using advanced statistical and econometric methods and oversee day-to-day data analysis activities including leading or co-leading teams in analyzing quantitative data - Serve as primary author or co-author on CCRC publications (reports, briefs, working papers) and journal articles, as well as review working papers from within and outside of CCRC - Present analyses in project team meetings, as well as represent CCRC and present research at conferences, speaking engagements, and events  - Advise junior researchers and graduate students on research methodology, and manage junior researchers in terms of project-related quantitative data management and analysis  - Collaborate in proposal development and grant writing activities to secure funding for future research - Participate in meetings with funders and other external stakeholders, and respond to external inquiries from press, researchers, and general public

419.desc: For nearly 100 years, the ACLU has been our nation’s guardian of liberty, working in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the United States.  Whether it’s ending mass incarceration, achieving full equality for the LGBT community, establishing new privacy protections for our digital age, or preserving the right to vote or the right to have an abortion, the ACLU takes up the toughest civil liberties cases and issues to defend all people from government abuse and overreach. With more than a million members, activists, and supporters, the ACLU is a nationwide organization that fights tirelessly in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Washington, D.C., for the principle that every individual’s rights must be protected equally under the law, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or national origin. The Information Technology (IT) department of the National office in New York City is seeking applicants for a full-time Senior Database Support Specialist.OVERVIEWReporting to the Associate Director of Enterprise Database Systems, the Database Support Specialist is responsible for providing and improving business support to national and affiliate users of the fundraising donor database and related business processes. The Specialist works closely with affiliate and national staff and supports day-to-day fundraising operations, manages business processes related to user support and data hygiene, and is responsible for advancing the Information Technology department’s ability to serve its customers. The ACLU is implementing new enterprise-wide constituent relationship management (CRM) software and seeks a candidate who is able to manage ongoing business support responsibilities and also participate in creating the architecture of the CRM. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIESManage the day to day effectiveness of support delivery for the Nationwide Shared Database.Provide 2nd tier business support for users in 53 remote Affiliate Offices and the NY National Office for the ACLU’s Nationwide Fundraising Database.Participate in discovery and implementation of new CRM systems, including project management and business analysis responsibilities, as assigned.Serve as a subject matter expert on fundraising database business processes.Resolve requests for business support from users or from 1st tier support staff.Work in collaboration with the database vendor to address and resolve user problems.Log, track, update, and resolve all cases using support tracking software.Manage support tracking software; maintain the end user knowledge base. Analyze and monitor help desk performance and user support trends.Define, document, and maintain internal support procedures.Work with the Development Department to identify and define new fundraising business processes.Collaborate with IT Training Specialist to identify high priority training opportunities for system users and to prepare user communications and presentations.Lead special data and database projects and Development initiatives (e.g., annual nationwide revenue reconciliation, donor listing, donor calls, etc.) as required.Collaborate with project working groups including coordinating meetings, producing agendas and minutes, distributing materials and tracking action items. Provide backup to other support staff.Manage software release and testing plans with database vendor.Test enhancements and bugs in database application(s) and related tools as assigned.Write specifications for database enhancements and new functionality as necessary.Undertake special projects as assigned.

420.desc: Software Implementation Junior Project Manager – New YorkAxiom is a recognized leader in the business of law and growing faster than anyone in the industry. We're a new category of professional services firm that applies best practices from other industries and a better business model to help General Counsel do legal work intelligently. We are seeking a junior Project Manager to lead the enterprise account management team for our Managed Services Product Development group.The Role:The Software Implementation Project Manager will assist Senior Project Managers for critical Axiom technology enabled accounts and be dedicated to assisting delivery of our core product.  This person will be engaged in top-level involvement with Axiom’s enterprise client base that includes the largest IT brands in the nation.

421.desc: If you believe education is the soul of all other industries, you belong here at Apex Ivy Consulting. AIC is a growing education company changing mindsets across China. We operate out of nine cities, mentoring students one-on-one and equipping them to thrive at US universities and liberal arts colleges by helping them develop character strengths, self-understanding, improve their writing abilities, and understand the many cultures of the United States. We pride ourselves in our alumni achievement that includes 14 founders of companies an author of 3 books. We also pursue philanthropy, giving over 3 million RMB in scholarships to rural scholars and will open our first Hope school in Yunnan in 2016. We're looking for passionate educators who are also excited about working cross-culturally in business development or research into the Chinese education system. With a diverse portfolio of projects and connections with the China LAC-Tour, Caijing Sanya Forum, and numerous local and international NGOs, AIC is an exciting opportunity for education enthusiasts with interests and aspirations in and outside the classroom. Past consultants have leveraged their AIC experience to later gain opportunities working at private equity firms, Google, Macys, Boston University, and graduate schools such as Harvard Law School, Teachers College of Columbia University, and the Yale School of Management.College ConsultingThis is a new Education Consultant's primary responsibility. Between August and January each year, you will mentor students one- on-one to assess their strengths and weaknesses, plan their application strategy, advise them in the school research process, brainstorm admissions essay topics, and provide critical feedback on their drafts. Between February and July of each year, you will mentor students as they work to better themselves before the admissions cycle, helping them understand their area of academic interest better, seek engaging internship opportunities, or apply for summer school admissions.TeachingYou will occasionally teach small, discussion-based seminars to help students develop skills that will serve them in the application process, in the US education system, and for the rest of their lives. You have the option of designing your own courses as well as implementing our current materials.MarketingYou will market AICs consulting services to potential students and parents in large seminars, small groups and one-on-one meetings. This is an exciting challenge for candidates with strong Mandarin skills. You may contribute to our ongoing marketing publications and research projects, or even submit a proposal for your own marketing project.Business DevelopmentWorking in a highly entrepreneurial environment, you will have the opportunity to gain experience wherever your interests lie. AIC consultants past and present have sought investment deals, improved operation efficiency, developed new services, contributed to our social media presence, improved our corporate social responsibility, and much more.Education Consultants for the 2016-2017 application cycle should be available to start between January and June 1st 2016 and will join our offices in Beijing, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Nanjing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Wuhan, Xian, or Zhengzhou.All candidates must have or display:-A bachelors degree from a top 30 ranked US college or university-Passion for education-Fluency in English, demonstrated by superior writing, critical analysis, and communication skillsCompetitive candidates will have or display: -Fluency in Mandarin-Teaching experience-Previous mentorship or counseling of students applying to college is a plusSubmit your resume, a cover letter describing your interest in the education industry and working in China, and a recent writing sample (creative or academic pieces are both acceptable) to Mr. Andy Blake (andy.blake@aic-edu.com) and Ms. Hallie Treadway (hallie.treadway@aic-edu.com) in an email titled [Your Name], AIC 2016 Full Time Application.

422.company: Law Offices of Dominick W. Lavelle
422.desc: Seeking individual(s) to work with Managing Attorney on various tasks from legal work to marketing techniques to administrative duties. We are a busy personal injury law firm and are seeking candidate(s) for this entry level immediate full time position. Job duties will include drafting Summons and Complaints, Bills of Particulars, legal research, contact with clients to schedule and confirm appointments, drafting of correspondence to clients, medical providers and insurance companies, drafting of legal documents, obtaining documents needed for the litigation of cases, working with managing attorney to prepare cases for trial, writing newsletter/social media entries to clients, networking with other firms who act as trial counsel, administrative work regarding the business end of the firm along with other duties. No prior experience needed. Excellent opportunity for individual considering law school who wants experience in New York law firm prior to applying to law school. Job will include trips to Court with attorney to observe appearances. Also a good opportunity for an individual interested in the business end of a law practice.

423.desc: Our firm will provide you with the opportunity to actively participate in the real world of management consulting. At MFR we offer two types of Internships: The Undergraduate Associate Consultant Internship (UACI) program (full time summer and part-time school year) for college/university studentsThe Graduate Student Consultant program for graduate school students (full and part time)Both positions provide the student with a structured introduction to MFR�s analytical tools and applications. There is a strong mentoring and professional development component as well as ongoing coaching by colleagues and MFR team members. The student chosen for our firms Undergraduate Associate Consultant Intern (UACI) are typically students between their third and fourth year of college/university.  They have strong academic backgrounds, analytical skills, highly motivated level, and outstanding interpersonal skills and are considering a career in management consulting.  We accept all majors in our Internship program.  You will be staffed on actual cases beginning in the first of the Internship. You will work as members of project teams in roles that vary by the team's and projects objective.  UACI�s are typically responsible for data gathering and analysis, interviewing the client's customers, competitors, and suppliers, writing reports and presenting the findings to team members.  The Graduate Student Consultant (GSC) is a graduate student between their first and second year of business school. The position simulates the experience of an MFR Consultant.  You'll perform a full range of functions-field interviews, data analysis, solution brainstorming, presentation crafting and delivery-on case assignments that range from business unit strategy to marketing, and IT.  You will work directly with the MFR teams and clients to solve business problems and create change. As a Consultant with our firm, you'll have the opportunity to work on projects that will involve:  �Growth Strategies:  market opportunity analysis, new market entry strategies, M&A evaluation, business case development, competitive analysis. �Strategic Alignment:  customer segmentation, go-to-market strategies (e.g., pricing strategies, channel alignment), post-merger integration, organizational alignment.�Corporate Initiatives:  corporate sponsored business plan support, strategic best practices. The consulting work requires strong problem solving and customer, competitor, market and channel analytical skills.  This includes strong project management and relationship building skills and the ability to interact effectively with our clients is critical.  Primary responsibilities include:� Analyzing, designing and implementing business process improvement strategies for our clients and developing an array of solutions to improve business performance issues.� Assisting in the research, development and implementation of strategic marketing concepts for our clients.� Assisting in the research, writing, and editing of reports and other materials. � Helping with obtaining background information for projects through research, focus groups and interviews. Also defining user requirements � Student will also work as part of the MFR �in-house� consulting team to analyze and advise MFR on market positioning and on increasing our competitiveness in the Philadelphia / Northeast Corridor market.

424.desc: FIRM OVERVIEW | HR&A Advisors, Inc. (HR&A) is an industry-leading real estate, economic development and program design and implementation consulting firm, with offices in New York City, Washington, D.C., Dallas and Los Angeles. We provide strategic advisory services for some of the most complex mixed-use, neighborhood, downtown, campus, and regional development projects across North America and abroad for clients in the public, private, and non-profit sectors. Whether we are exploring the hidden potential of an abandoned industrial waterfront, developing a financing strategy for energy efficient retrofits for a commercial building owner, or illustrating the economic benefits of parks and open space redevelopment, HR&A creates value by providing innovative and creative solutions to the complex challenges of economic development and real estate in urban environments.POSITION DESCRIPTION | HR&A seeks part or full-time Summer Fellows for 10 to 12 weeks in our downtown Los Angeles office, starting in June. Fellows are asked to take on responsibilities in line with those of the core analytical staff at HR&A.  Tasks may include market research, case study research, economic and financial analyses, and public policy analysis, as well as preparation of marketing materials, proposals and client deliverables in the form of written reports and memos, PowerPoint presentations and Excel models.  EXPERIENCE REQUIRED | Successful Summer Fellows will be bright, independently-motivated critical thinkers and have a passion for urban development and policy.  HR&A is seeking candidates who have completed their bachelors degree and are working towards completion of an advanced degree, preferably with a concentration in economic development, real estate finance, urban planning, public policy, and/or housing finance.  Additional relevant work experience is preferred.  The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills; proficiency with PowerPoint, Excel, and other Microsoft Office programs; and the ability to manage multiple assignments at once. Furthermore, the candidate should be a highly motivated independent thinker who is extremely detail-oriented and sufficiently poised for client interaction.  SALARY | Fellows will be paid a monthly stipend based on experience and qualifications.SUBMISSION | Please send cover letter and resume as a single PDF document (maximum of 2 pages) to HR&As website at http://www.hraadvisors.com/contact/career-opportunities/.  Your file must be named in the following format LAST NAME.FIRST NAME.DATE. First round interviews are anticipated to be conducted in February on a rolling basis. HR&A may contact candidates for brief phone conversations prior to these interviews. For more information, please visit www.hraadvisors.com or contact us at jobs@hraadvisors.com.Please do not call regarding this position.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status or medical condition.

425.desc: Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. is a highly regarded executive compensation consulting firm.  The Firm’s primary mission is to assist its clients in developing compensation programs for top management that ensure alignment between pay and performance, focus the management team on achieving the company’s short- and long-term financial and strategic goals, and create commonality of interest between management and shareholders.  We serve as the retained advisor to over 650 publicly-traded companies, including 27% of the S&P 500 index and approximately half of the component companies in the Dow Jones Industrial Average.  We also advise emerging growth companies as well as private-equity-financed companies.  Our New York City office offers a high-integrity, intense work environment in which high performers are provided superior rewards and rapid growth potential.  We seek bright, ambitious, quality-oriented professionals with strong educational achievements, excellent analytical skills, superb written and oral communication skills, and a strong attention to detail.  Preference will be given to those who demonstrate strong presentation skills, robust financial acumen, intellectual curiosity, and the ability to comprehend economic, accounting, tax and legal issues.  The position offers opportunity to launch a long-term executive compensation consulting career with unlimited potential.  Our top consultants serve as the retained advisors to the board of directors and senior management teams of the world’s most complicated and successful organizations.As an analyst, successful candidates will provide support to senior consultants on client engagements. Initial responsibilities include compiling and analyzing competitive data from SEC filings, financial databases, and third-party surveys. For high performers, the position will lead to broader contributions on engagements including project management and responsibility for client deliverables. Consultants will also develop knowledge in the areas of tax, accounting, securities rules, and corporate governance as they relate to the field of executive compensation.

426.desc: Hedge Fund Analyst InternshipApplication Deadline: March 15thWeiss Asset Management is a Boston-based hedge fund seeking candidates to work with a team which invests in equities, derivatives, and fixed income across the world through fundamental and quantitative strategies. No finance experience is required - all interns receive comprehensive training and are equipped to make meaningful contributions to the firm. By working alongside our research and trading team, interns gain investment experience on par with that of first-year buy-side analysts and quantitative traders. High-performing interns are typically offered full time positions upon graduation.Responsibilities and Opportunities•	Learn through our rigorous training program which covers pure arbitrage, value investing, and statistical arbitrage across multiple asset classes•	Make significant contributions at all stages in the investment process, including sourcing, researching and modeling sophisticated investments.•	Build and apply expertise in both fundamental and quantitative analysis.•	Conduct original research to find new investment strategiesWhy Weiss?•	Hedge fund run by ex-Bell Labs mathematical economist Andrew Weiss (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Weiss_(economist)•	History of 23 consecutive successful years since inception, yet a small, 40-person, startup culture.•	Opportunity to collaborate on interesting problems with a quantitatively-oriented team, including PhD-level researchers hired from top universities•	Work hard, play hard culture with an open office, relaxed dress code, gym/trainer, massages, and 3 meals/day onsite.•	Competitive compensationQualifications•	Extremely strong quantitative abilities•	Interest in both mathematical as well as qualitative analysis•	Resourceful, entrepreneurial, and willing to challenge oneself to find answers to unsolved problems.•	Strong aptitude for idea-generationTo apply, please send an e-mail to careers@weissasset.com with the subject, “[Your Name], Analyst Internship” in the subject line. Attach your updated transcript and resume including GPA’s and standardized test scores (SAT, ACT, GRE, etc.). Applicants will be considered for all open terms. Please see below for deadlines.About the company: Weiss Asset Management develops proprietary value-based and quantitative strategies to manage approximately $1.2 billion globally. Members of our team have advanced training in economics, computer science, physics, law, and mathematics, but we welcome truly exceptional candidates from all backgrounds. Our approach to problems is cerebral and analytically rigorous as we continually review our results in light of new data and insights. Collegial in nature, the culture at Weiss fosters cutting-edge academic and industry research. Finance experience is not a prerequisite, but candidates should have the drive and ability to acquire the skills necessary to perform at the highest level. All employees must adhere to the highest ethical standards. WAM does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or other characteristic protected by law.

427.desc: Child Health Consultants (CHC) is a nurse managed company that contracts with the Philadelphia Department of Human Services to provide nursing consultation to child welfare social workers and the families they serve. CHC is seeking a part time pediatric nurse to work weekday evenings from 4PM-9PM at the Department of Human Services child care room. This nurse will perform nursing assessments and make decisions about the immediate medical needs of children who are awaiting emergency foster care at the department. Duties will include administering medications, coordinating care, and providing support to children experiencing the trauma of being separated from their parents.This position requires one year of pediatric nursing experience.Resumes should be sent to Kathleen Torrisi RN MSN- ktorrisi@chconsults.com

428.desc: Arzoo’s Private Equity Summer Internship ProgramWe are looking for interns to work with us through the Summer to help us with proprietary deal sourcing (read below for a full description of what that involves). The way in which we source investments is very similar to a traditional private equity firm, and this internship will therefore give you a useful set of skills if exploring a career path in private equity, investment banking or consulting.In return for unpaid work, and because we are a small firm, we will give you additional responsibility you wouldn't get at a large firm (if we can delegate to you, we will), opportunities to learn new skills, and letters of recommendation as well as introductions to our vast network of contacts in banks, consulting firms, other private equity firms, industry, etc.We are a start-up private equity firm founded in and based in Philadelphia. The founder is a graduate of Yale University and Harvard Business School and has extensive experience in the investment banking and private equity field. Our strategy is to acquire an established small business and manage it directly. Our target industries are varying and you will research a multitude of interesting, different industries. Our target deal size is $2-20m.ResponsibilitiesThis is a demanding role, and as such we ask you to carefully read through the daily responsibilities -- we have tried to be as honest as possible so there is no confusion as to what this job entails.[% of intern time][5%] Industry research - finding and reading industry reports, news articles, etc. to understand how firms make money in an industry and what the most important trends are. The skill we want you to develop is to quickly synthesize a large amount of information and be able to identify the 3-4 most important factors that make a business successful in a given industry.[80%] Creating databases (of company contact information). - There are thousands upon thousands of small businesses in the US. Before we can start asking whether to invest in them we need a systematic way of contacting them and keeping track of communication. An unglamorous, but essential task. Computer and programming skills are helpful, but there is no substitute for hard work and grit.[5%] Company research -- many small business have a limited online presence. We want you to be able to dig deep and find out what makes a small business successful -- what is their product? Who are their competitors? What differentiates them? Form a judgment and be able to tell us in 2-3 sentences why we would/would not want to invest in them.[10%] Drafting letters to business owners -- use industry and company research to draft letters of approach to business owners.[2.5%] Financial modeling and benchmarking -- a skill sought by many leading finance companies but one we can teach you in an hour. Interns will be expected to learn how to build basic spreadsheets to help analyze potential investments.[2.5%] Drafting offer letters -- writing non-binding and binding letters of interest, gaining familiarity with legal terminology and deal structuring.We know that the above % don't add up to 100% -- each individual’s experience will be slightly different -- we wanted to give you a directional sense. Interns will also take on at least one presentation project during their time here. This involves researching a specific (usually untapped) industry and specific company within it. They will formulate an opinion on both the industry and the company along with a price valuation, culminating in a short, 8-10 minute presentation.We work out of two shared office spaces in in the Drexel/UPenn area. Being a startup company, we are relatively relaxed in terms of our culture. We do not wear suits everyday, we wear whatever we feel is comfortable. If you are seeking a fun environment and want to work alongside young talented entrepreneurs with whom you can build long standing relationships, we encourage you to apply.

429.desc: EMI Worldwide, located in Philadelphia, is looking for a qualified sales intern to join our sales/marketing team.Our company designs and implements sales incentive programs and provides meeting planning support services for medium to large companies nationwide.Our intern program provides a hands-on opportunity to learn how to motivate salespeople to increase their sales using travel awards, design sales incentivecampaigns for various sales channels, and provide meeting planning support services to mid to large size companies. We seek an intern who can participatein our sales intern program 2 to 3 days a week.This intern should be prepared to work in a fast-paced team environment, and will finish the internship having gained broad experience in various aspectsof marketing sales motivation programs to increase sales through various sales channels. This position could lead to a fulltime sales position for the right person.ResponsibilitiesAssist with the qualification of sales leadsAssist in providing marketing materials to our salesforceAssist with creation of sales proposalsAssist with the preparation and delivery of prospect email campaignPerform analysis of marketing and sales dataSeek and analyze competitor marketing and sales materials both on and offlinePrepare presentationsEnter contact information into contact management systemsProvide support to social media effortsRequirementsWe are looking for a senior undergraduate student in the Philadelphia area who is majoring in Sales or Marketing. This person should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with extensive knowledge of Web and social media. PowerPoint, Word and Excel experience is a bonus, and will be considered when choosing the best applicant for this internship position.

430.desc: The Kevin Boyle for State Senate Campaign is seeking smart, enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join our team’s campaign in Pennsylvania’s 5th Senatorial District in Philadelphia. Interns will have the opportunity to work in a variety of capacities within the campaign while interacting with the candidate and senior staff on a daily basis.This internship will provide students with the opportunity to gain valuable skills that are applicable to a variety of jobs in campaign management, politics and legislative affairs.With the presidential and various state and local elections set to take place this fall, this opportunity is an excellent way to learn more about the day to day operations of a campaign, the political process and the political environment of Philadelphia.Interns will assist the candidate and senior staff with a variety of tasks, including community outreach and canvassing, phone banking, research, data management and entry, assisting in the coordination of community events, managing interactions and contact with supporters and other community organizations.Interested parties are encouraged to submit resumes by email to Victoria Cram at vcram@voteboyle.com . The email should include your desired start date and your anticipated weekly availability.

431.desc: Job Title: Communications ManagerStart Date: ImmediatelyLocation: Washington, DC, USAReporting to: CEOBackgroundThe Verified Carbon Standard (VCS) is looking for a Communications Manager to lead its organizational communications efforts, including helping to develop a communications strategy and executing it. The need to communicate with an increasingly wide array of stakeholders comes as VCS has grown from an organization with a single focus to one with a variety of programs and initiatives.Launched in November 2007, VCS began by creating and managing the VCS Program, which has become the leading global greenhouse gas (GHG) reduction program in the voluntary carbon market. Since its inception, more than 1,300 projects around the world have relied on the VCS Program to issue more than 180 million Verified Carbon Units (VCUs). An important element of the VCS Program is the Jurisdictional and Nested REDD+ framework, which is designed to enable governments to leverage carbon finance to protect their forests. In addition, VCS manages the Climate, Community & Biodiversity (CCB) Standards, the most widely applied and respected tool for demonstrating positive community and biodiversity impacts of land-based climate projects. VCS is also a California-approved Offset Project Registry (OPR), helping to implement that states landmark cap and trade program. Finally, VCS is engaged in the development of new standards frameworks designed to drive investment in actions that generate significant and measurable environmental and sustainable development benefits.As we emerge from a promising agreement at COP21 in Paris with a worldwide focus on reducing carbon, there is an opportunity to explain how VCS programs play a critical role in addressing environmental issues and promoting sustainable development. The VCS team is excited to bring on a Communications Manager who can help tell that story at global, domestic, and local levels.Job DescriptionThe Communications Manager will be responsible for ensuring effective communications with VCS stakeholders worldwide and the smooth operation of VCSs communications efforts. Principal tasks and responsibilities will include the following:   Ensure the ongoing development of VCS communications and effective positioning of the organization. This work will entail  three distinct elements which need to be integrated. First, the Communications Manager will work with each of the various programs and initiatives to identify communications priorities, including addressing challenges and taking advantage of opportunities, and implement a plan to drive communications forward.Second, the Communications Manager will weave together the individual narratives of each of the programs and initiatives VCS manages into a cohesive set of organizational communications. Finally, the Communications Manager will develop and implement a monitoring system to track real progress in effective messaging against tangible, measurable goals and targets.   Ensure the ongoing development and clarity of the VCS website. This will include guiding the development of anew VCS website in early 2016, individual sites for each of VCS programs and initiatives, and providing ongoing content and editing support. This task will involve managing and working closely with a communications consultant.   Manage communications with stakeholders, including producing all outreach and marketing materials (eg, public statements, website content, print materials, presentations, newsletters, annual report) based on content provided by program staff, responding to media inquiries and supporting outreach efforts by colleagues.   Refine and manage the organizational communications strategy, including a potential VCS re-branding effort which would rely on a communications and branding expert.   Oversee the use of the VCS trademarks and brand, and ensure compliance with all licensing requirements.   Assist with other parts of the organization as needed.Required Skills, Knowledge and Experience   A minimum of five years of professional communications experience in the non-profit or private sectors with a strong working knowledge of environmental and/or sustainable development issues. Marketing experience in these fields is desirable.   Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical issues to different non-technical audiences, and experience editing and drafting documents for clients and public presentation.   Good understanding of climate policy, carbon markets or landscape sustainability is highly desirable.   Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and work quickly, accurately and on deadline.   Motivated, proactive, and resourceful with strong attention to detail.   Excellent interpersonal skills, capable of relating to our many and diverse stakeholders, and maintaining a professional approach and demeanor in high pressure situations.   Masters degree in communications, branding, marketing or a related field is desirable.   Fluency in English is essential; fluency in Spanish is desirable.   Experience in graphic and website design, HTML, email campaign software, and social media is desirable.Terms and ConditionsWe offer a competitive salary and an attractive benefits package. To apply please submit the following documents:   Cover letter (max one page) explaining why you are interested in the position and the value you would bring to VCS and our mission to protect the environment.   Examples of previous communications work, including representative print and web content.   Resume/CV (not to exceed two pages).Please note that this position is only open to applicants who have the legal right to work in the United States. All documents must be submitted to employment@v-c-s.org by 3 February 2016.

432.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the role:Minted is looking for talented operations engineers to build great things and to have fun doing so.  This is a great role for someone who believes in creating automation, driving simplification and creating a rock solid, four nines culture.Specific Responsibilities:Develop automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure, scale and monitor their applications in data centers and in cloudActively participate in high level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluationsTroubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains - will be expected to participate in on-call escalations to troubleshoot customer facing issuesDeliver quality features on-time and on-budget and execution against project plans and delivery commitments.Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology, always on a look out for new technologies and work with management and the development team in bringing in new technologies.

433.desc: The American Enterprise Institute, a preeminent think-tank in Washington, DC, is a community of scholars and supporters committed to expanding liberty, increasing individual opportunity, and strengthening free enterprise. AEI pursues these unchanging ideals through independent thinking, open debate, reasoned argument, facts, and the highest standards of research and exposition. Our purpose is to serve leaders and the public through research and education on the most important issues of the day in the areas of economics, culture, politics, foreign affairs, and national defense. AEI's work is addressed to government officials and legislators, teachers and students, business executives, professionals, journalists, and all citizens interested in a serious understanding of government policy, the economy, and important social and political developments. Job DescriptionThe American Enterprise Institute is seeking an external affairs associate to help promote our research and programs to key audiences in DC and around the country.  In particular, you will help manage and develop the Leadership Network, a groundbreaking initiative in its third year that is designed to attract, educate, and inspire leaders from the worlds of business, community, nonprofit organizations.  You will be responsible for researching applicants, managing our database, keeping websites and social networks current, and developing and organizing programming (including conference calls, bimonthly newsletters, and events).  The incumbent will also be responsible for promoting the work of some of our key scholars and staff, will provide internal and logistical support for all outreach-related communications and activities, and will be responsible for the maintenance and development of various constituent lists.

434.desc: Classroom Responsibilities (working closely with the lead teacher) Do whatever it takes to ensure all students are meeting their potential Teach and facilitate small group and whole class instruction Collaborate with colleagues in infusing school culture Create rigorous and engaging long-term plans, unit plans, and daily lesson plans Infuse core values into daily lessons and every school practice Maintain a productive, organized, safe, neat and focused learning environment Administer meaningful and frequent assessments in a timely manner Provide necessary accommodations and modifications for growth and success of all students Effectively teach KIPP Philadelphia’s adopted or developed curriculum  Keep parents well-informed about students’ progress through daily behavior reports and academic progress reports Uphold all school policies within the classroom School Responsibilities Arrive at school by 7:15 a.m. and stay until 5:00 p.m. Mon-Thurs, 4:00 p.m. on Friday. Attend designated school functions outside of school hours Attend and participate in all school/parent meetings Contribute to the planning and execution of all school-wide events Develop strong relationships with the families of the students through home visits, participation in school events and over the phone Perform necessary duties including but not limited to bus, lunch, and dismissal duties Chaperone field lessons Uphold all school policies Professional Development: Receive and implement feedback from the school leader and other staff Participate with enthusiasm in all school wide professional development Participate in a teacher certification program (if applicable) Meet weekly with instructional coach, principal, or lead teacher for feedback on instruction/planning Complete all required assignments for Liberty Fellows training in a timely manner Achieve the role of lead teacher Additional responsibilities may arise during the school year. They will be communicated to all employees with as much notice and flexibility as possible.

435.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA. About the Role:Minted is looking for an up and coming Engineering Manager who can leverage their technical experience to take a lead role in designing and building software which will enable Minted to deliver world-class service and product quality and drive the company's growth for years to come.  We are seeking a leader who can be responsible for strategy, managing engineers toward deliverables, as well as perform hands-on coding.  You will manage one or more small, agile teams rapidly designing, developing, testing and deploying revenue generating products in an entrepreneurial environment.Take a lead role in building complex software systems including architectural proposals, code reviews and, if necessary, hands on coding.Ensure that technical designs support our goals of quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, maintainability, and security.Create an engineering culture of ownership, testing and measurement.Collaborate with product management to define requirements for the commerce web site.Act as the interface between engineering and marketing, product management, merchandising, community relations, and third party vendors.Manage projects to ensure on-time delivery.Work with product management team to set priorities and create a long term, product roadmap.Improve engineering retention through morale events, career development, training, and mentorship.Recruit a high caliber engineering team.

436.desc: The Operations Manager will work directly with the staff, students, and families of KIPP West Philadelphia Elementary Academy and is responsible for ensuring smooth daily operation of the school.  The hours of this position are 7:00 am-5:00 pm, Mondays through Fridays.Lead and Manage the front office, including: Creating a warm, welcoming environment for all students, family, staff, and visitors Serving as primary phone and reception contact for all families and all visitors Manage transportation services, food services, day-to-day office operations and coordinate snack distribution Maintain personnel, student and compliance files Maintain and utilize Power School, including attendance, demographics, and grade entry Prepare and distribute student report cards Performing administrative duties including filing, faxing, copying, and documenting office procedures Manage KWPEA communication, including weekly family bulletins and monthly calendars Assisting families to complete the Federal Lunch Program applications, checking the applications for mistakes, and submitting applications to the School District Food Services Department Working directly with the School Leader to provide administrative assistance and additional professional support as needed Manage phone calls to families of absent or tardy students Maintain and Build Operational Systems, including: Serve as the point of contact for all building maintenance issues and 3rd party vendors  Plan and manage logistics for special events (Back to School night, Thanksgiving Potluck, etc) Document Act 48 Credits for teachers Beautify and maintain shared-school space (bulletin boards, signage, photos, quotes, CTE forms, etc) Coordinate logistics for all in-house professional development sessions and external PD logistics for staff Coordinator and/or serve as the point of contact for picture day Monitor supply levels for school, manage classroom inventories, and replenish as needed Oversee and place all purchase orders Manage and oversee student enrollment, home visit, and registration process throughout the yearAs a team member on the KIPP West Philadelphia Elementary Academy staff, the Operations Manager must take on additional responsibilities, including: Exhibit positive rapport with students, families, and staff and act as a role model for students Being present at school every day Monday through Friday from 7:00am – 5:00pm. Being present at school four Saturdays throughout the year from 9am-12pm. Working during our two week summer school session Participating in three weeks of school planning and professional development in July and August Supervising students as needed during meals, dismissal, and school-wide meetings Participating in staff meetings and professional development o Ensure that Power School demographic information is up to dateo Follow up with families regarding attendance inconsistencies, documentation, and updates Covering extra responsibilities when other staff members are absent Maintaining regular communication with KWPEA families and guardians Chaperoning student trips throughout the school year Implementing school-wide policies and procedures Being available for report card nights and other events involving families Serving on school committees as needed Other duties as assigned by the school leader

437.desc: Seeking a recent COLLEGE GRAD for EQUITY RESEARCH.   Renaissance Capital LLC, located in Greenwich, CT (25 miles north of New York City) is the global leader in providing independent research on Initial Public Offerings (IPOs) for major financial institutions and individual investors, and advisor to the Global IPO Plus Fund, the only mutual fund to focus solely on the initial public offering market. Renaissance Capital also maintains the FTSE Renaissance IPO Index Series to provide investors with a comprehensive and structured vehicle to invest in the IPO market around the world.  FTSE is the global index company that is owned by the London Stock Exchange.  Our analyst position has been called a boot camp for financial analysis involving financial modeling, valuation, discounted cash flow and fundamental business analysis.  The Junior Analyst will be taught our proprietary research process for analyzing newly public companies and be responsible for preparing research reports on a broad range of industries with an emphasis on technology, communications, health care and retail companies. A willingness to use new technology is essential and an entrepreneurial spirit with a
