440.desc: ABOUT THE SCHOOLExcel Academy Public Charter School is Washington, DC’s first public school for girls. We will serve over 800 Preschool through 7th grade girls in school year 2015-2016. Our mission is to provide our students with a solid academic foundation and enrichment opportunities to prepare them to succeed in high school and college and to develop the skills and confidence they need to make healthy, positive lifestyle choices. For additional information about Excel Academy, visit www.excelpubliccharterschool.org. RESPONSIBILITIES Excel is seeking a LICSW-certified Social Worker to fill an immediate opening. The Social Worker supports the social-emotional needs of our scholars in PreK-7th grade. We are looking for a highly dedicated professional to help bridge school, home and community to help students be as successful as possible.The Social Worker will be responsible for duties in the following areas: Counseling•	Provide counseling to students in 1:1 and small group settings for the purposes of:•	meeting IEP-mandates•	meeting goals of students referred through the Child Study Team•	supporting students with short term crisis intervention•	increasing social skills, anger management, self-esteem, and conflict resolution, and•	ultimately, improving classroom performance•	Update goals, attend annual meetings, and make revisions as necessary for students with IEP-mandated counselingLeadership and Engagement•	Supervise two Licensed Graduate Social Workers•	Help support behavior plans and interventions •	Attend Student Support Team and Child Study Team meetings accordingly•	Serve as advocate for parents and families in need•	Conduct home visits when necessary•	Co-facilitate parent and family workshops •	Co-facilitate teacher professional development workshops Collaboration and Coordination•	Work alongside teachers and students to develop the social skills and work habits to achieve academically•	Attend Student Support Team and Child Study Team meetings accordingly•	Meet with teachers regularly to discuss counseling case reviews, behavior plan progress, social emotional curriculum planning as well as other concerns•	Collaborate with outside agencies to share information and ensure creation of seamless service delivery plans for students•	Ensure completion of paperwork required for the delivery of services, such as creation of IEP goals and objectives, progress notes, Medicaid reimbursement forms, social histories, and psychological evaluations.•	Complete functional behavioral assessments (FBAs) and behavior intervention plans (BIPs) in collaboration with students and instructional staff

441.desc: FOX Architects (www.fox-architects.com) is an award winning firm changing the DC skyline with large scale corporate commercial buildings. We have immediate openings for talented Staff Architects to join our architecture/base building studio. Our team is located in the heart of downtown Washington DC, just three blocks north from McPherson Square Metro (blue/orange/silver). The selected individual will assist in developing design concepts, participate in all aspect of the project and be part of the best architecture team. We offer excellent salary and benefits in a dynamic, fun and forward thinking environment. Everyones ideas are valuable and teamwork is encouraged and celebrated. We are proud of our excellent client base, positive working environment and vision for our future. If this sounds like the sort of organization you would like to work with, wed like to hear from you! Roles and Responsibilities:	Assist Senior and Project Architects, Project Managers, Senior Designers and Principals in the execution of project specific tasks, including financial accountability.	Capture design concepts through renderings.	Evaluate, select and apply basic design skills and techniques to project related assignments.	Execute administrative tasks assigned by Studio Leaders, and Project Managers.	Manage technical projects small to medium size in nature with supervision.

442.desc: INTRODUCING INCREDIBLE NEW PERKS:Signing bonuses: a signing bonus for Summer Interns, Team Leaders, Assistant Instructors, Lead Instructors, and Operations Coordinators, ranging from $250 to $1000 (depending on experience) for select sites throughout the Peninsula region.The Best Summer of Your Life . . .In a summer at Galileo you will: experience profound, customized professional development; contribute your background and unique perspective to support the growth of a team of dynamic leaders, artists, mad scientists, movers, shakers and acrobats; build ridiculously strong friendships, and most importantly, transform the lives of hundreds of children.Grow With Us . . .Galileo, voted a top 10 company to work for in the Bay Area, is expanding yet again is a growing community with an increasing number of year-round and seasonal positions. Interested in working for an innovation-education company at the forefront of design thinking and 21st century education? Successful camp staff are often likely candidates for amazing opportunities at Galileo HQ.Live in one of Three Destination Metro Areas!Galileo now has camps in the Bay Area, SoCal, and Chicago. Have an incredible time exploring these regions. National parks, exceptional cuisine, cutting-edge art & tech industries, and multiple professional sports teams, what else could you need? Not surprisingly, these metro areas are consistently listed as top ranked places to live in the country by Businessweek, Forbes, Huffington Post, and the New York Times! Come experience it for yourself! Below is a sample job description for our Team Leader or Assistant Instructor roles. To learn more about our mission and employment opportunities, visit our website at www.galileo-camps.com/jobs/summer-jobs. Our summer job hiring season has begun! Apply now! SHARED VALUES AND EXPECTATIONS         Serve as an ambassador of Galileo, demonstrating our mission and values in a positive and professional manner and acting as a role model of the Galileo Innovators mindset         Commit to building a safe, child-focused community         Demonstrate professionalism and accountability         Take initiative to analyze and solve problems         Treat others with courtesy and respect         Respond to camper, family members and colleague needs         Maintain a high standard of ethics, integrity and confidentiality ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES         Lead your team of up to 18 campers throughout the week to art, science and outdoor rotations         Provide leadership, energy and camp spirit for campers, constantly assessing group dynamics and the needs of individual campers         Assist Lead Instructors in the classroom as they deliver curriculum to your team of campers         Set, work towards, and achieve measurable professional development goals         Support camper check-in and check-out processes         Provide excellent customer service to families by communicating with them on a daily basis about their campers experience         Write daily updates to families and weekly camper certificates         Assist with daily setup and cleanup of camp and assist Instructors with lesson preparation         Contribute to and participate in daily opening and closing ceremonies, all-camp activities, and snack & lunch supervision and programming WORK HOURS AND DATESThe camp environment is demanding, requiring intense dedication and work ethic from each staff member. Depending on the time of summer or the specific week or day, the needs of camp and resulting staff hours may vary. We seek and make offers to staff who we believe are capable of thriving in this environment and contributing to camps success. The camp day runs, on average, 8.5 hours for Team Leaders. Each camp varies based on specific needs of the site, with staff generally arriving at 7:45am and leaving at 4:45pm. In addition to these hours, Team Leaders will work Extended Care as part of, or in addition to, their normal schedule. Though each camps schedule is unique, a sample work week can be found on our website. Camp Hours:         Monday-Friday, 7:45am-4:15pm (hours may vary week to week, and typically staff work more hours in the first and last weeks of camp)         Staff Meetings: Either Wednesday or Thursday of each week from 4-5:30pm         Before Setup Days begin, complete between 5-12 hours of online training         Training and Setup Days: Participate in two mandatory training and setup days in the days before camp starts         Camp Cleanup: Participate in cleaning and packing up camp for an additional 5-10 hours, typically an extra 1-2 hours at the end of the day during the final week of camp. On the last day of camp all staff stay on site until cleanup is complete, which will be 6pm at the earliest. COMPENSATIONSummer staff positions are temporary, seasonal positions and do not include benefits. Expectations for work hours at Galileo programs are outlined above; we are committed to competitively compensating staff.         Paid per hour, depending on experience, location, and level of education; 6-10 weeks, depending on location. Overtime rates (1.5 x hourly rate) apply to all hours over 8/day and/or 40/week.          Staff Training: You will be compensated per hour for between 5-12 hours of online training         Training and Setup Days: You will be compensated per day for two days of training and camp setup on site         Payroll is processed every two weeks; payments will be issued and paystubs made available every other Friday SUPERVISION GIVEN/RECEIVED         General supervision, ongoing observation and evaluation provided by Camp Director and/or Assistant Camp Director

443.desc: We are looking for dedicated, hard working, open-minded people who have an abundance of energy and a desire to supervise/mentor teenagers during the summer. Must be available at the end of June for 3 to 6 weeks, plus orientation/training. The hours are long, you won't get rich, but the experience is priceless. Salary, plus room and board, plus r/t airfare or AMTRAK ticket from your home city (if needed) are all included.  Staff must be 21 years of age before June 14, 2016Summer Discovery operates pre-college enrichment programs for teenagers 13-18 years of age in the USA at: UCLA, UC Santa Barbara, University of Michigan, Georgetown University, Pace University NYC, Emerson College (Boston), University of Texas at Austin, Johns Hopkins University, CU Boulder  and U of Pennsylvania, Hood College and Dean College.Jr. Discovery operates three summer enrichment programs for students completing grades 6-8 at UCLA, University of Texas at Austin and Georgetown University.Discovery Internships operates internship programs for teenagers 15+ years of age in the USA at: NYC, Los Angeles and Boston.Resident Counselors live in a university Residence Hall and are responsible for the student's health, safety and well being.  Resident Counselors supervise residence hall living, field trips, afternoon, evening and weekend activities, sports, provide academic support, and more.  Previous residence life experience preferred. Staff are provided room, board, transportation to and from the program, and a stipend which varies by program duration.More info about the program is available at the Summer Discovery website www.summerdiscovery.com/summer-jobs , click on Summer Discovery.

444.position: Associate Consultant Intern, Life Sciences Strategy Consulting
444.desc: Clarion Healthcare, LLC, a boutique life sciences consulting firm in downtown Boston, seeks intellectually curious, highly analytical individuals eager to roll up their sleeves to tackle substantive problems impacting pharmaceutical and biotech companies.  INTERNSHIP DESCRIPTIONThis internship program will provide students with the opportunity to gain valuable consulting experience and develop in-depth knowledge while working in a dynamic, collaborative, downtown office environment. Associate Consultant Interns will contribute to client case work as well as internal research initiatives evaluating the strategic implications of specific market/industry trends for our pharmaceutical / biotech clients.As part of the program, Associate Consultant Interns will:	•	Work as an integral part of one or more case teams•	Design and conduct qualitative and/or quantitative research and analysis•	Create and deliver presentation materials•	Collaborate directly with experienced consultants and members of the Clarion management team•	Participate in firm meetings and eventsOver the course of the program, Associate Consultant Interns will gain exposure to a wide range of case work and develop their skills through formal and informal training and mentorship.The 2016 summer internship program will run approximately 10 weeks, starting in early June through the beginning of August (specific dates TBD).

445.desc: Our Education Managers serve as innovative school leaders who oversee all special education services school-wide and work extensively with data to drive overall student achievement.About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what's possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning. To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, the brightest, and the most highly motivated adults we can find. We value excellence, celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.We are seeking an ambitious Education Manager to join our Success Academy Charter Schools.Responsibilities:Reporting directly to the school leader, the school-based Education Manager is responsible for overseeing special education services school-wide. Education Managers collaborate closely with the Advisory and Data Reporting departments at Success Academy Charter Schools to drive student achievement.Special Education and Scholar Support•	Support struggling scholars by identifying gaps in assessment data, collecting teacher referrals, tracking academic and behavior interventions, tracking scholar progress against clearly defined benchmarks, and initiating the process for an Individualized Education Plan (IEP) when necessary.•	Track special education services, manage the processes for alteration and renewal of IEPs, and continually assure that services match the academic needs of scholars.•	Lead weekly meetings with school leaders, teachers, and special education providers to review interventions in place with at-risk scholars, assess effectiveness, and determine adjustments.•	Provide regular, robust communication to parents, teachers, school leaders, and special education providers on scholar progress.•	Manage grade promotion, including training teachers on identifying and supporting scholars at risk of being retained.•	Ensure all data on scholar achievement, interventions, and Special Education services are tracked in the Student Information System.•	Manage Education Coordinator(s) (when applicable).Data and Assessment (carried out by Education Coordinator at small schools)•	Establish systems that keep teachers organized, aware, and prepared for assessments, including necessary training on proctoring, scoring, and data collection. Ensure all assessment data reported on time through the Student Information System.•	Support communication to families on scholar progress, including Progress Reports each Trimester.•	Ensure school adherence to all New York State testing protocols, including test security, proctoring guidelines, and submission of testing materials to state and city testing authorities.•	Complete projects that require specialized knowledge of scholar data or systems. Examples include: preparing the DOE Invoice, creating class lists, and managing the ELL identification process.

446.desc: You have a passion for business, sales, and collaborative technology. You would love to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment that maximizes what you have achieved in college and provides a launching pad for an equally strong career. If youre serious about both working hard and having fun, you should talk with us. We improve the way global organizations activate strategy, tackle business challenges, innovate and grow. We are venture backed and positioned for rapid growth in 2016 and beyond.We are CorpU. Our solutions offer Fortune 500 executives the best content from leading academics at the topmost universities, on our proprietary platform, so that companies may meet their strategic goals through state of the art online collaborative experience.As an Inside Sales Associate you will use your passion to sell CorpU solutions via telephone, email, and web. Working in a motivated, high-energy team setting, you will bring to bear your business knowledge and highly developed communication skills to help senior leaders in targeted organizations recognize the value of CorpU products and services. You will partner with Sales Representatives to build a pipeline of prospects and escalate opportunities for our outside sales pros.Local candidates only:  Philadelphia, PA 19103Required education:  Bachelor's

447.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA. About the Role:Minted is looking for brilliant and passionate analysts.  The Analytics team uses rigorous analytics to generate insights from granular data that inform overall strategy as well as product, merchandising, marketing and business decisions across the company, and across the idea lifecycle -- from ideation to launch and iteration. This work ultimately strengthens Minted’s marketplace, leading us to stronger growth and profitability and helping us continuously improve the experience for consumers and artists on our platform.Our Product Analyst quantifies user activity on the site in order to identify, measure, and prioritize improvement efforts.  This is someone who loves getting into the details in search of meaningful insights.  We need someone who prides themselves in the accuracy and impactfulness of their work.  Our Product Analyst needs to think critically and creatively about what our data can tell us about the real world experience of our users.  You will partner closely with the VP of Product to generate hypothesis and share insights.Specific Responsibilities:Partner with Product Managers to determine key success metrics for Product success.  Identify improvement opportunities through data analysis and play key role in the ideation, launch, and optimization product lifecycle.  Define data to be collected for measuring success of new product features, and work with engineering on proper tracking and instrumentation of dataDesign and build self-service dashboards using a mixture of analytical and visualization techniques to derive actionable insight from dataWork closely with product teams to properly design and conduct A/B tests for product feature experiments and improvementsEnsure not just the accuracy of analysis, but the accurate interpretation by team membersContribute to documentation and organization of our data setsQuantify summary product performance for the rest of the company and board

448.desc: BEST SCHOOLS, BEST LEADERSRePublic Schools is a network of public charter schools whose mission is to reimagine public education in the South. RePublic was founded by the leaders of Nashville Prep and Liberty Collegiate Academy, the first and only two public charter schools to perform in the top 5% of all public schools in Tennessee for both growth and absolute performance. RePublic now operates one high school and four middle schools — including the first charter school in Mississippi’s history.  REIMAGINING SCHOOLS IN THE SOUTHRePublic Schools recently received a $9.6 million grant from the U.S. Department of Education to undertake unprecedented growth. Over the next five years, RePublic will grow to support at least 10 schools across Tennessee, Mississippi and at least one other state in the Deep South. We will also dramatically expand our game-changing work in computer science.  WANTED: TRAILBLAZING LEADERSIn recognition of this growth, RePublic needs trailblazing leaders at every level of the organization. With the help of a sizable commitment from the U.S. Department of Education and other supporters, we will offer a series of differentiated fellowships for the 2016-17 school year.LEADER RESIDENCY PROGRAM  RePublic provides opportunities for professionals (inside and outside of education) who are ready to transition — or who have just transitioned — from leading in a classroom or another field to leading in a school. RePublic Leader Residents participate in a year-long training program, with access to personalized mentorship, professional development, and leadership coaching.  The RePublic Leader Residency program — modeled off of medical residency models — combines: Expert Mentors: Each Resident will be assigned a leadership position at a RePublic school or the network under the tutelage and supervision of an experienced RePublic Principal or network leader. These principals and network leaders include experts in the field, such as three leaders who have each had the distinction of the running the highest performing charter schools in Tennessee.World Class Training: Residents will receive extensive internal and external training which, in past years, has included a partnership with the Relay Graduate School of Education and Building Excellent Schools. Training spans vision-setting, operations, instruction, curriculum, management, and communications and storytelling. Our faculty is comprised of leaders with experience across industries, including politics, government, education, and business.  Visit the Best Schools in the Country: Leaders will visit and learn from the highest performing schools in the country, including the highest performing schools in New York, Boston, Denver, Washington, DC, and New Orleans.Leadership Retreat:  Twice annually, Leader Residents will attend two-day retreats that include leaders and expert teachers from across the network. These retreats typically take place outside of our home territories. Each Resident will emerge from their residency year ready to assume the role as Principal, Dean of Students, Director of Operations, Dean of Student Supports, or Grade Level Team Leader.

449.desc: Department Name:  GfK Boutique Research	   SBU #: 249     Company: GfK Boutique Research     Locations: Boston, San Francisco, or Hong Kong                 Position Description:Note:  Applicants must have 1-2+ years of experience in the semiconductor or related industries.  Applicants that do not meet this requirement will not be considered as industry background and knowledge is essential.  We are unable to offer relocation assistance or visa sponsorship for this position.This position is for a Research Analyst on GfK Boutique Researchs Semiconductor research team. S/he will work on a small international team conducting research on global semiconductor manufacturers with a focus on the wireless segment, spanning smartphones, tablets, wearables, and IoT devices.  We are looking for someone with a passion for technology and an eagerness to become an expert on whats inside todays leading mobile electronics products.  This research is sold to financial clients around the world and what the analyst can expect to get out the experience is: 1) Rewarding experience.  GfK Boutique is a fast growing, entrepreneurial company with a flat organizational structure. Analysts are not only focused on research but are also considered key contributors to the growth of the business and product development. You will be positively surprised by how significant a contribution you can make towards both the direction and success of the company 2) You will be exposed to the top investment managers globally and gain a clearer understanding of the investment research process3) You will help build a build a unique product and service that gives our clients actionable insight into the markets and companies we cover4) A truly global experience and perspective.  Your team is global, the companies you cover are global, and we service clients globallyEssential Duties and Responsibilities:	Analyzing competitive dynamics within the wireless semiconductor industry by combining our proprietary point-of-sale data with web-based research and external data points	Following company earnings, investor events, and news/press releases, constantly comparing company messaging to our proprietary data	Comparing the signals coming from our data with other external data points, such as company reports, news stories, etc.	Creating bi-weekly research reports and supporting analysis on the Wireless component industry	Effectively communicating our messages to our clients, top tier hedge funds and mutual funds	Being a part of a highly collaborative international team (members in Boston, London, & Hong Kong)

450.company: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco
450.desc: The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco is looking for recent and future graduates to assist with the vital work of the Economic Research Department. Positions are ideal for students considering graduate study in Economics. Research Associates provide economic/analytical support to economists in academic research, monetary policy, and economic briefings to senior management. Tasks include conducting econometric analysis of economic and financial data, computer programming, preparing charts and tables, maintaining databases, and reviewing background materials.To apply, please submit an application on-line at: http://www.frbsf.org/our-district/careers/. Include resume, cover letter, and undergraduate transcript (unofficial is acceptable).

451.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA.  About the role:The Analytics Team uses an agile approach as we work with data to make sure our customers get the best experience. The ideal candidate will own features from design to implementation, to deployment and you will be a go-to person in your domain.Specific ResponsibilitiesWe're looking for someone who loves working data and enjoys building ETL frameworks. You have experience in Data Warehousing and are able to think outside the box when necessary.Work with analysts and business stakeholders to gather technical requirementsDesign and implement scalable Data Pipelines using ETL frameworkIntegrate new data into Dashboards, Reports and BI ToolsHelp expand Data Science at Minted

452.desc: We hire software development engineer interns into our technical teams based in Seattle, Washington. Our interns and co-ops write real software and partner with a select group of experienced software development engineers, who both help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our customers.Impact: As a member of the Amazon development team, you’ll be given the opportunity to have direct impact on the evolution of the Amazon e-commerce platform and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, optimization, scalability, security and tweaking algorithms, just to name a few.Innovation: Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Are you interested in finding the best intersection of features vs. performance? Are you up to the task of delivering innovative technology that offers millions of unique products to thousands of suppliers, to tens of millions of customers around the world? Many of the technical challenges Amazon encounters have never been dealt with before on this scale, if at all. Come help lead the way in e-commerce innovation.

453.desc: RCLCO, a national leader in providing strategic economic guidance to the real estate industry, seeks qualified Associates in our Washington, DC, Los Angeles, Orlando, and Austin offices. RCLCO is recognized as the leading independent knowledge solutions provider to the real estate industry.  Founded in 1967, RCLCO is a pioneer in bridging market and financial feasibility, consumer research, and industry intelligence.  Our professionals are widely respected for their ability to assess economic and market directions, and to translate these trends into project concepts and financial guidance. Associates join our team as junior consultants to gain unmatched experience in real estate analytics and exposure to the industry.  Associate team members may stay at RCLCO to advance their careers in real estate consulting, or may eventually pursue other career or educational opportunities; our Associates have gone on to successful careers in real estate development, private equity, banking, investment, and public policy. Associates work directly with project managers and senior firm leadership to provide foundational support for RCLCO’s market research, financial and statistical analyses, and professional reports and client presentations. Key responsibilities include:•	Organize data, analyze trends, and construct financial and statistical models by  employing existing RCLCO methodologies and/or developing new approaches;•	Conduct primary and secondary economic, demographic, and real estate research;•	Prepare reports and presentations to communicate key findings and recommendations to clients;•	Provide analytical support in client meetings and presentations;•	Support business development and intellectual property initiatives.

454.desc: About Minted:Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA. About the Role:Minted has a unique approach to home decor merchandising given that all of our textile designs are crowdsourced from a community of independent designers and voted on by consumers. The Associate Merchandise Manager (AMM), Home Decor is a highly entrepreneurial position and a blend of a creative role and an analytical role.  The AMM will be the sole merchant in the Home Decor group for the first year of the business, owning responsibility for the overall assortment of textile designs offered on our products.  This includes project managing the end-to-end merchandising process for fabric and home decor, assisting the GM of Home Decor and the CEO with making “editor’s picks”, writing design challenge descriptions, and owning merchandise analysis and sales reporting.  He or she will report to the GM of Home Decor and will work closely with the CEO of Minted and other key functions at Minted.  The AMM will be trained personally by the CEO and Creative Director of Minted.At Minted, we're passionate about design. A successful candidate must have a deep love for home decor and textiles and an eye for great design. In addition to having a creative side, he or she will have strong analytical and quantitative driven decision-making skills, excellent project management and communication skills, and the ability to both think strategically as well as roll up their sleeves to get things done quickly and with limited resources.Responsibilities:Project manage the home décor/fabric competition, selection, and launch process at Minted. This includes a wide range of responsibilities including writing challenge descriptions, ordering test prints, and working with supply chain and production to ensure that products launch on time and on budget.Choose products to be featured online and in emails.Contribute to strategy including shaping annual merchandise roadmap for home decor categories.Contribute to assortment planning, including quantity and mix.Work closely with Artist Relations to develop the textile designer community at Minted, including recruiting, developing & retaining designers.Manage the online merchandising of art categories including filters, SKU organization, and 'shoppability' of the assortment.Contribute to analysis to identify growth opportunities including competitive and customer analysis.Own all merchandising reports and analytics for the home decor categories.Ensure all functional areas within company, from marketing to customer service, stay educated about the consumer and the products in the categories.Work directly with the CEO and Founder on special projects and initiatives.

455.desc: Blue Engine Teaching Assistants (BETAs) work with students in high school math and English classrooms in New York City for a single year of paid AmeriCorps service. BETAs complete four weeks of training in August and receive weekly support during the school year from both their lead teacher and site director. Upon completing the year of service, BETAs have the option to stay for a second year and enroll in Blue Engine’s teacher residency program to become a certified, full-time lead teacher. Interest in being a teacher and prior education experience is NOT required.

456.desc: Did you plan your school’s biggest concert of the year? Did you market it like a champ? Could you do it again without skipping a beat?Great  – this may be the internship for you. As the Marketing and Events Intern at Updater, you’ll work with our marketing and sales departments to assist in the planning and execution of trade shows and sales events, including pre-show planning and post-event wrap up. Additionally, you’ll contribute to marketing projects, including creating content for our blog and social media, performing business outreach and development, and assisting in the design and creation of marketing collateral and email campaigns.Updater is one of the fastest growing tech startups in Silicon Alley, and we’re looking for an amazing intern who’s looking to gain real life exposure to the inner workings of a thriving New York City startup. This internship is an excellent opportunity to work on projects that will meaningfully support our business goals and scalability.Plus, you’ll work alongside an extremely dedicated and motivated team that’s not afraid to pull long hours, but that truly loves working together (team outings, Friday lunches, and team dancing/karaoke are all part of the job). And the best part? You’ll walk away with a concrete set of professional, transferrable skills.For more information and to apply, please visit: http://grnh.se/vk3ib4Responsibilities: Coordinate trade show logistics, including working with event partnersProduce and manage content for our various blogs and social mediaCommunicate and track critical deadlinesContribute effective ideas to improve existing processes and actively seek solutionsAnd much more!About You:You have experience event planningYou have experience writing blog posts and social media postsYou excel at managing competing priorities and deadlinesYou’re extremely detail oriented and have excellent written and communication skillsYou can commit to working in our NYC office one or more full days per weekYou're a Junior or Senior in college (preferred) A month at Updater might include:Rotating office DJCross-functional collaborationGroup outings to NYC Meetup eventsBad jokes & misguided humorLate nights (with free dinner!)Team lunches & happy hoursCompensation:This is a paid internship.About Updater:Updater makes moving easier for the 45 million Americans on the move every year. With Updater, users seamlessly transfer utilities, update accounts and records, forward mail, and much more. Thousands of relocation professionals (from real estate brokers to property managers) rely on Updater’s business solutions to save clients hours with a branded and personalized Updater experience.The Updater team shares a common passion for addressing the unmet needs of today's busy mover. From jugglers to fashionistas to geeks, we're a pretty diverse bunch!Headquartered in New York City, Updater has raised $10 million from SoftBank Capital, IA Ventures, Commerce Ventures, Second Century Ventures (the strategic investment arm of the National Association of REALTORS®), and leading angel investors.

457.desc: MCO China Internships is a comprehensive internship program provider. It is our purpose to ensure all program participants receive a well-rounded experience that encompasses China’s culture, language, and international work environment. Various resources such as housing, language training, cultural/social activities are provided. Program participants are required to pay a program fee to2 month - $4,0903 month - $5,290Placement (2-3 month) - $1,250HOST COMPANY INTRODUCTION:This company is a leading brand in the high-end periodical market and the top publication with both English and Chinese language distributed in the Mainland market. Beyond the flagship magazine, this magazine also produces bespoke magazines and provides creative solutions for clients seeking to achieve their business objectives through the use of media.Our readership is as well-curated as the content in the magazine. They may sit in China’s key metropolises, but they display a global state of mind, being influenced by currents from London, New York, Tokyo and Paris. The pages of this magazine make them feel connected to the design, hospitality, culture, and most interesting personalities of China and the world. In fields ranging from public service, to finance, to media, our readers are less defined by their jet-setting luxury lifestyle and wealth than by their taste for quality and their hunger for smart media offering fresh, stimulating content. Foreign and Chinese, they are mostly between 25 and 50, often live in a different city from where they were born, and travel for business or leisure at least twice a month.INTERNSHIP DESCRIPTION:Want to learn more about media and fashion in China? Are you a college student or recent graduate interested in becoming an editor? This magazine is the leading bilingual publication in China focused on architecture, inner space, decor, luxury goods, travel, etc. Distributed in all of the five-star hotels in China as well as golf courses, membership clubs, restaurants, etc., this is the most recognized publication in its class.JOB DUTIES: Manage Social Media  Helping to plan content and themes; Formulating, researching, and writing original articles on architecture, art, hotel openings, etc. Editing English and, potentially, Chinese proofs if you’re multilingual. Translating articles from Chinese into English or vice-versa.

458.desc: Interested in working in a dynamic, challenging environment, for a company that recognizes and rewards your creativity, initiative and contributions? Excellent! You're in the right place to explore a career with Zurich. We are a global insurance group that truly loves what it does and we want people who truly love what they do. We provide our employees with challenging, real life opportunities to develop and grow with us and contribute to the world around us – both professionally and personally. We deliver a wide range of general insurance and life insurance products and services for individuals, small businesses, and mid-sized and large companies, including multinational corporations.,. Our size and scope mean we have experiences to suit almost any skillset at Zurich so there is limitless opportunity to find a uniquely rewarding career with us. We are Zurich, one global company, with one mission, one ambition, one set of shared values and a clear commitment to ourstakeholders: our customers, our people, our shareholders, and the communities in which we live and work. To find out more visit our Global Careers Website: www.zurichna.com/careers for a career you truly love.Zurich is currently looking for a Financial Analyst to work out of our offices in New York City, New York. This position will be responsible for the analysis of moderately complex insurance products, financial data, and the processing of financial transactions.  This role will also provide support in building and monitoring our high net worth and institutional private placement life insurance businesses.  This will include:     * Preparing Investment Committee presentations for proposed funds     * Tracking compliance,  monthly performance and fund newsletters     * Reporting monthly fund balances, policy NAVs to agents and commissions to broker-dealers     * Communicating with market facing unit and funds     * Monitoring industry news     * Generating policy offering documents for appropriate jurisdiction with appropriate fund schedules     * Tracking deliverables     * Creating and Tracking subscriptions     * Reviewing trades, fees and confirmations

459.company: Lambda Legal (New York, NY) (New York, Dallas, Los Angeles, Chicago, Atlanta
459.desc: Lambda Legal seeks a Legal Help Desk Specialist for its Legal Department, in the Headquarters Office in New York City. The Specialist will staff the Legal Help Desk by responding to the publics requests for help and/or information and will further develop Lambda Legal's Legal Help Desk capabilities and resources.Lambda Legal is a national organization committed to achieving full recognition of the civil rights of lesbians, gay men, bisexuals, transgender people, and people with HIV, through impact litigation, education, and public policy work.  Founded in 1973 and headquartered in New York City, Lambda Legal has regional offices in Los Angeles, Chicago, Atlanta and Dallas.Lambda Legals law reform, policy, and educational work encompasses a wide range of areas critically important to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) people and individuals living with HIV, including federal and state constitutional law issues; fighting discrimination in employment, public accommodations, and housing based on gender identity, sexual orientation and HIV; advocacy on behalf of youth in schools or in foster care or juvenile justice systems; ensuring access to health care; challenging bias in the criminal justice system; obtaining legal respect for same-sex couples relationships; securing parent-child relationships; advocating on behalf of LGBT immigrants and those living with HIV; working to end LGBT-targeted harassment and violence, and related public policy advocacy. Lambda Legal has been involved in numerous landmark cases including Obergefell v. Hodges, Lawrence v. Texas, Romer v. Evans, Boy Scouts of America v. Dale, Bragdon v. Abbott, Glenn v. Brumby, In re Marriage Cases, Varnum v. Brien, Benitez v.  North Coast Womens Care Medical Group, Fields v. Smith and Brandon v. County of Richardson. For more information about Lambda Legal, visit www.lambdalegal.orgResponsibilities: The Legal Help Desk Specialist responds to requests for information and legal assistance through Lambda Legals Legal Help Desk and intake process. The Legal Help Desk Specialist answers a high volume of telephone calls, faxes, emails and letters, logging requests in a database.  The Legal Help Desk Specialist meets with attorneys regularly to screen intakes for possible Lambda Legal involvement; each intake is prepared for attorney review and follow-up, if appropriate.  The Specialist works with attorneys to respond to each call, providing general legal information, publications, and contacts to LGBT-friendly resources and  organizations.  The Specialist sends and keeps current Legal Help Desk resources, including referral lists and charts of legal information. Responsibilities: The Legal Help Desk Specialist responds to requests for information and legal assistance through Lambda Legals Legal Help Desk and intake process. The Legal Help Desk Specialist answers a high volume of telephone calls, faxes, emails and letters, logging requests in a database.  The Legal Help Desk Specialist meets with attorneys regularly to screen intakes for possible Lambda Legal involvement; each intake is prepared for attorney review and follow-up, if appropriate.  The Specialist works with attorneys to respond to each call, providing general legal information, publications, and contacts to LGBT-friendly resources and  organizations.  The Specialist sends and keeps current Legal Help Desk resources, including referral lists and charts of legal information.
