461.desc: We are a successful law firm with approximately 60 attorneys and a similar number of support staff.  Based in New York City, our firm has an outstanding reputation in the transactional, regulatory, tax, trusts and estates, real estate, litigation and securities arenas, representing clients in a wide range of local, state, national and international matters.We have an immediate opening for a paralegal in a full-time, regularly scheduled position within our Corporate Department to begin as soon as possible.  Responsibilities include working on corporate organization & administrative actions, federal & state regulatory filings, general corporate transactions & closings, and closing binders.

462.desc: Company Description: Established in 1975 out of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Public Financial Management (PFM) is a financial advisor that provides financial consulting, bond pricing, and debt management services to state and local governments and healthcare and educational organizations across the United States. For over thirty-five years, PFM has advised many of the country’s largest municipal and institutional financing programs totaling in excess of five hundred billion dollars. Many of these engagements involve evaluating capital strategy, developing financial and capital plans, debt structuring, complex tax analysis, resource allocation, and capital markets advice. Currently the firm has over 500 employees serving a broad base of public and nonprofit clients from offices located in every region of the country. PFM combines national experience with specialized functional expertise, regional knowledge, and local perspective through the development of individual practices dedicated to serving every client type; including states, municipalities, health systems, universities, and pension funds.  As a financial advisory leader to these organizations, PFM has built a world class reputation for providing clients with independent advisory services, and is consistently among the top rated independent financial advisory firms in the country in almost every major industry in which the firm is active.        Position Summary: PFM is currently seeking an upcoming or recent graduate to serve as an Analyst in our PFM Solutions practice.  PFM Solutions is the premier strategic/financial planning platform for colleges and universities, and other public entities, and unites our clients’ major areas of operation into a single institutional point of view, allowing business officers to quickly analyze the strategic ramifications of operating and capital initiatives.  PFM Solutions supports the institutional strategic planning process by establishing and analyzing relationships among hundreds of interdependent operating variables, which users can manipulate to get a clear view of prospective strategic outcomes. The successful Analyst candidate for the PFM Solutions team will be expected to have an active interest in financial modeling, using both Excel-based and proprietary software solutions. Candidates should be nimble in a fast-paced environment, in which even entry-level Analysts are given significant responsibility.  To be successful, one must have the ability to manage multiple and differing priorities and deadlines, and have excellent verbal communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills for interaction with a diverse group of internal colleagues, senior leaders, clients, and prospects.Core Responsibilities:  The Analyst will work closely with peers and senior managers to service existing PFM Solutions client relationships and assist in business development. Specific responsibilities may include: •	Developing customized spreadsheets and other software solutions to produce time-series financial projections, capital budget analysis, and ratio analysis;•	Managing a portfolio of clients;•	Assisting in the marketing of the PFM Solutions modeling platforms;•	Assisting in management of the business franchise; and otherwise•	Working as an entrepreneurial team mate in building a relatively new businessThe opportunity for client interaction is a key element of the Analyst experience. Additionally, PFM Analysts gain broad exposure to a wide range of financial instruments.

463.desc: Gloss PR is based in Narberth, Pennsylvania, with most of our work occurring in downtown Philadelphia. Gloss is a boutique PR, events and marketing firm specializing in luxury lifestyle, hospitality, real estate, healthcare and non-profit clients. Our Spring Semester interns will have exciting hands on experience with numerous projects including:•	The Rittenhouse Row Spring Festival•	Rebuilding the Rittenhouse Row website•	The DNC •	PR for all of Iron Chef Jose Garces’ Philadelphia restaurants•	Einstein Healthcare Network’s 150th Anniversary•	Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia’s Cheers for CHOP with DJ Jazzy Jeff•	Garces Events Bridal Showcase•	Real Estate projects including groundbreakings, resident events and launches for new apartment buildings, shopping centers and office buildings•	The launch of Snap Custom Pizza•	The launch of the Sporting Club Main Line•	Living Beyond Breast Cancer’s Reach and Rise Yoga Fundraiser•	PR for specials at Zama and Panorama•	And much more…. Gloss is easily accessible by Septa (there is a bus stop a block from our office) and has free parking next to the office. Our attire is casual and our vibe is focused and fun. We take great pride in working on some of Philadelphia’s most exciting projects.We are looking for several college students to join us this semester (January-May 21) to help us execute our projects. In turn, we will help our interns grow professionally, and nurture their promising careers. We will work with our college partners to provide any reporting necessary to help the students gain the credits necessary for the practical experience they are obtaining at Gloss. Ideal hours are 9:30-4—but we can be very flexible with this and would love for interns to be with us at least two days a week (if partial hours are required that is fine too). A few weekend and evening nights will be required—and will provide great experience.  A typical day would include building a media list, sending eblasts for clients, writing web copy, calling people to confirm attendance at events, soliciting auction items for our non profit events, researching client categories for social media and more.

464.company: Institute for Innovation Law, UC Hastings College of the Law
464.position: Program Associate, Institute for Innovation Law
464.desc: THE ROLEThe Institute for Innovation Law (Institute) is seeking a Program Associate. The Institute oversees the Startup Legal Garage and the Privacy & Technology Project at UC Hastings College of the Law in San Francisco. The Program Associate will have a multifunction role to support the Institute's activities. The Program Associate’s responsibilities will consist of providing administrative support to the Institute’s Director; serving as the Institute's office manager; supporting the classroom, research, and government interaction work of the Institute; leading various program initiatives; and supporting events and activities hosted by the Institute. The ideal applicant will be a recent college graduate hoping to gain 1-2 years of work experience before graduate school. Under the supervision of the Director of the Institute for Innovation Law, the Program Associate is responsible for a variety of tasks.RESPONSIBILITIESTypical duties and responsibilities consist of, but are not limited to, the following:- Help foster media relations for the Institute. This includes organizing media contacts, sending out press releases, and coordinating interviews with the press;- Manage the Institute’s programming and events calendar, and manage the calendar and scheduling for the Director;- Assist with government interactions and creation of materials for testimony and commentary requested by Congress, state legislators, state and federal agencies, and their staff members;- Provide administrative support to the Director of the Institute, including preparation of manuscripts, articles, research projects, examinations, presentations, reports, mailings, charts, statistical reports, evaluations and transcripts, and taking notes;- Produce merge documents, headers/footers, endnotes and footnotes, print class rosters, make photocopies, make travel arrangements;- Support Institute programming;- Manage the Institute’s faculty and staff fiscal-related matters: faculty and staff professional development accounts, travel expense reimbursement forms, check requests, travel arrangements, etc.;- Coordinate special events with faculty.

465.position: Public Relations Account Associate (Start Date: Summer 2016
465.desc: Account Associate at LaunchSquad: Entry-level opportunity for aspiring integrated communications practitioners.LaunchSquad is an eclectic community of people committed to producing the best possible results for the companies we love. We build creative PR, social media and original content programs for the most innovative start-up and mid-stage technology, consumer lifestyle and media companies around.We’re looking for our next generation of superstars and we’re interested in talking with you about full-time opportunities to join our team starting summer 2016 in San Francisco, New York or Boston. New grads interested in communications will be considered. About the Account Associate opportunity:At LaunchSquad, we’d like to think everyone is looking for an opportunity where they can feel empowered, contribute real results and grow their skills and smarts every day. In this role, we try to provide just that.No day is ever the same. Account Associates work on three to four client accounts and learn directly from LaunchSquad’s senior staff. From the start, Associates work closely with their clients on a daily basis and contribute to integrated communications programs in meaningful ways, including client relations, media and analyst relations, industry research, writing, branded content creation and tracking and measuring account activities and results. Whether our team is launching an unknown start-up or helping an established company reimagine their story, our work is handcrafted, always expanding. Over the course of year one at LaunchSquad, an Account Associate can expect the following from the experience: - Position with constantly expanding learning opportunities; - Growth within each team, including transitions and shifts in responsibilities; - Regular performance acknowledgement, feedback and merit increases for outstanding work; - Ability to develop skills and knowledge that will accelerate career advancement and future professional opportunities.If you believe in LaunchSquad’s vision and want to contribute to the team and grow your talents with the Squad, we’d like to hear from you. LaunchSquad has full-time PR Account Associate Summer 2016 opportunities in our San Francisco, New York and Boston offices. Please do not submit multiple applications for each position, instead, apply to your preferred location and then highlight alternative location preferences in your cover letter. Account Associate Summer 2016 opportunities start as early as July 1st 2016 in some locations. Our hiring team will be interviewing qualified candidates on an ongoing basis through the spring of 2016 until all positions are filled. Please visit our website (http://launchsquad.com/) for more information about our team, clients and culture.

466.desc: Community, Social Justice, Transformational SpiritualityQuaker Voluntary Service is a year-long service program in which young adults, between the ages 21-30, live communally, work full time at social service and social change agencies, and explore themes of spiritual and personal growth with local Quakers. Fellowships are available in Atlanta, GA, Boston, MA, Philadelphia, PA, and Portland, OR. QVS provides housing and utilities, a public transit pass, grocery allowance, health and wellness support (including access to insurance if needed), financial support for student loan debt, a simple living stipend, support to attend conferences and trainings, dedicated time for reflection and community building, as well as robust support from staff and volunteers. All Fellows who successfully complete the year will receive a $500 exit stipend. The program year is from August 27, 2016 - July 31, 2017.For more information, including a list of our partnering agencies, please visit our website at www.quakervoluntaryservice.orgApply by March 15, 2016: https://www.quakervoluntaryservice.org/apply

467.position: Research & Program Associate, Liberty & National Security Program - D.C
467.desc: Research & Program Associate, Liberty and National Security Program, Washington, DCThe Brennan Center for Justice at New York University School of Law is a non-partisan public policy and law institute that focuses on improving the systems of democracy and justice. A singular institution  part think-tank, part public interest law firm, part advocacy group  the Brennan Center combines research, scholarship, legislative and legal advocacy, and communications to win meaningful, measurable change in the public sector.The Liberty and National Security program works to advance effective national security policies that respect constitutional values and the rule of law. Areas of focus include restoring the proper flow of information between the government and the people by securing increased public access to government information and strengthening privacy protections; ensuring government policies targeting terrorists do so effectively and without religious or ethnic profiling; and securing appropriate mechanisms and institutions for effective government oversight.Position: The Brennan Center seeks a full-time Research & Program Associate (RPA) to work in the Brennan Centers Liberty and National Security Program. This a two-year position allows RPAs to gain experience in various aspects of the Liberty and National Security Program. For the first year, the RPAs substantive areas of focus will be research and advocacy surrounding the reform of secret laws, electronic surveillance reform, and policing & technology issues. The second year may be a continuation of this advocacy or an expansion into other issues, as dictated by evolving program priorities and current events. The RPA will also perform a range of administrative tasks.This position is offered in our Washington, D.C. office. The RPA will report directly to Elizabeth Goitein, Co-Director of the Liberty and National Security Program.Responsibilities include:Conducting legal and factual research and data analysis, and drafting memos and other materials reflecting the research and analysis.Performing a wide range of administrative, database, paralegal support, and program management tasks, including (but not limited to) making travel arrangements, copy-editing, maintaining contact lists, completing expense reports, and checking legal citations.Organizing and staffing program and Brennan Center events.Organizing and/or participating in coalitions of allies.Working with attorneys, Fellows, Communication and Development professionals, editors, other Research and Program Associates, and organization leadership.Drafting and editing publications, reports, newsletters, blogs, and other public communications as needed.Overtime (compensated at 1  times the regular hourly rate) may be required before deadlines. Some travel (usually to New York City) is required as well.A significant portion of the Research & Program Associates time may be spent on administrative tasks depending on program priorities.Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have:A bachelors degree (this is an entry level position; lawyers and individuals with advanced degrees will not be considered) Previous research experienceExcellent writing skillsAs an equal opportunity affirmative action employer, the Brennan Center is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applicants of all races, ethnicities, genders, gender identity and expression, and sexual orientations, and applicants who have been previously incarcerated.Salary: $36,000-43,000 commensurate with experience. Excellent benefits package. For more information about the Brennan Center, visit our website: www.brennancenter.org.Applications: The application deadline is April 15, 2016, but applicants will be interviewed on a rolling basis and decisions will be made as soon as appropriate candidates are identified. We encourage applicants to submit their applications early. The anticipated starting date for this position is August 1, 2016 (with some flexibility as to an earlier or later start date), and a firm two-year commitment is required. To apply, please go to www.brennancenter.org\employment and upload (where it says attach resume) as one document the following application materials: cover letter, resume, writing sample (up to 10 pages), and contact information for three references. Please include Internet hyperlinks to writing samples where available. If you have difficulty with the online system, you may send your application by e-mail to: brennancenterjobs@nyu.edu with Liberty and National Security Research and Program Associate, DC in the subject line, after registering in the online system.

468.desc: RCLCO, a national leader in providing strategic economic guidance to the real estate industry, seeks qualified Senior Associates in our Washington, DC, Los Angeles, Orlando, and Austin offices. RCLCO is recognized as the leading independent knowledge solutions provider to the real estate industry. Founded in 1967, RCLCO is a pioneer in bridging market and financial feasibility, consumer research, and industry intelligence. Our professionals are widely respected for their ability to assess economic and market directions, and to translate these trends into project concepts and financial guidance. Senior Associates are emerging managers of RCLCO’s consulting engagements, including market research, financial modeling and optimization analyses, and investment opportunity analyses. They manage the efforts of junior consultants and collaborate with a dynamic team of peers and senior firm leadership, to deliver market-based, forward-looking advice to our clients.Key responsibilities include:•	Manage consulting projects from kick-off through presentation of final conclusions and results;•	Conduct primary and secondary economic, demographic, and real estate research;•	Organize data, analyze trends, and construct financial and statistical models by  employing existing RCLCO methodologies and/or developing new approaches;•	Prepare reports and presentations to communicate key findings and recommendations to clients;•	Participate in client meetings and presentations;•	Manage existing and potential client relationships;•	Participate in and support business development; •	Develop intellectual property and prepare industry publications and presentations; •	Mentor and train junior team members.

469.desc: We are seeking tutors for academic subjects and for standardized tests including the SAT, ACT, LSAT and GMAT for our location in Westchester, New York. We are an academic and test prep tutoring group and have been widely regarded as Americas preeminent private tutorial and test preparation service. We specialize in academic tutoring ranging from grade school through graduate school and in preparing students for standardized tests and are dedicated to helping our students from all backgrounds achieve their academic goals.Our group comprises of talented, motivated and highly accomplished individuals with stellar educational and professional backgrounds. All our tutors undergo intensive training before they start tutoring our students. Tutoring Details:  Intensive training (based in NYC/Westchester)  Must work at least 25 hours per week  Most of the tutoring takes place at our premises  Tutoring is one-on-one   Ongoing support and training

470.desc: Our Education Coordinators play a vital role supporting our school leadership teams and Education Managers with academic data, organizing all testing and assessments and special education services to drive student achievement.About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what's possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning. To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, the brightest, and the most highly motivated adults we can find. We value excellence, celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.We are seeking an ambitious Education Coordinator to join our Success Academy Charter Schools.Responsibilities:Reporting directly to the Education Manager, the school-based Education Coordinator is responsible for student information related to assessments school-wide. Education coordinators collaborate closely with the Advisory and Data Reporting departments at Success Academy Charter Schools.Responsibilities include:•	Coordinate all student achievement testing and data collection for the school.•	Prepare and present data results to school leaders.•	Manage the entire test administration process for all grades and all students within the school. This includes high-stakes exams for scholars in grade 3 and up.•	Train teachers on administration and scoring of assessments.•	Manage scholar promotion and academic data using our Student Management System.•	Coordinate scholar report cards.•	Coordinate the Response to Intervention (RTI) process at the school, including data meetings, tutoring sessions, and meetings with the School Based Support Team (SBST).•	Provide necessary data and information to network Special Education Managers.•	Coordinate student Individualized Education Program (IEP) creation, and interact with teachers, parents, and special education providers to determine current and future educational services for all students.•	Communicate student performance results to parents, including the need for additional support services if necessary.

471.desc: The Forest Foundation 2016 Summer Internship program provides the opportunity for undergraduate college students in the United States, including graduating seniors, to gain experience in the non-profit world through 50 paid, 10-week summer internships and accompanying leadership development program.  Through placements at non-profit organizations in the Greater Boston area, interns engage in the general operations of an agency and help advance the agencys mission and work in the community.  Included in the program are a series of 4 leadership and professional development workshop days facilitated by Forest Foundation and drawing upon experts in the community.PROGRAM DETAILS:	50, 10-week paid internships at exceptional non-profit agencies in Greater Boston	Prospective interns apply directly to Forest Foundation through a competitive application process.  If accepted, a pairing process for an internship with a community partner host agency begins	Interns engage in the general operations of the host agency while completing an independent project designed around both their personal interests and the agencys needs	Leadership and Professional Development Workshop days introduce interns to issues of public policy, social entrepreneurship, foundations, grant-writing and non-profit management.  Interns write real grant proposals and present to Forest Foundations Board of Trustees.	Compensation is $4,500 for 40 hours per week over 10 weeks from early June through early August.To learn more and download an application visit: www.forestfoundation.net

472.desc: About AlphadyneAlphadyne Asset Management is an alternative investment management firm founded in 2005 by Bart Broadman and Philippe Khuong-Huu.  The firm manages assets across macro and relative value investment strategies in global interest rate, foreign exchange and volatility markets.   Alphadyne has offices in New York, Singapore and London.  Role DescriptionAlphadyne is seeking an investment professional to join its New York office as a Quantitative Strategist.  This position will directly support and contribute to the Portfolio Strategy Group, focusing on building quantitative trading models for the quantitative investment strategies. The successful candidate will be a high performer, who is resourceful, able to work individually as well as within a team, and possesses strong quantitative skills.Job responsibilities include:•	Design, implement and test quantitative trading models and signals.•	Build analytics for portfolio construction and back testing.•	Tactically perform portfolio and trades modeling, analyze and interpret the results. Discuss and review with the investment team and quant portfolio managers.•	Participate in weekly investment team meetings.

473.desc: At Towers Watson Investment, we advise large institutional investors, including corporate pension plans, insurers, endowments and others on their long-term investment strategies.  As a leading investment consultant, we help organizations improve their ability to achieve their investment mission by managing investment complexity, establishing risk tolerance and improving governance. The Investment business employs over 800 associates worldwide, has more than 1,000 pension funds and institutional investors as clients, and has over $2.2 trillion of assets under advisory. The Global Manager Research Team is a critical element of our Investment line of business and is the team responsible for investment idea generation.  We have one of the largest global manager research teams in the industry with more than 150 researchers spread across most major investment regions of the world and following one global, integrated research process. Our goal is to identify the best investment solutions for our clients, be they investments with manager’s funds or directly into individual assets.  Delegated Investment Services (DIS) is an exciting part of our business which is growing in response to increasing demand from clients.  Infrastructure in particular represents a growth opportunity within our clients’ portfolios, as American investors’ infrastructure activity has traditionally lagged behind those of investors in other parts of the world. This will mean working proactively with colleagues in other disciplines and regions to help create high quality, diversified portfolios for clients, potentially on a fiduciary basis.We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Infrastructure Research Consultant.  In time, we would expect this individual to lead the global infrastructure team.  Experience in other real assets such as real estate, agriculture, timber, energy, etc. would be beneficial.  In this role you will evaluate some of the most highly respected private markets investment managers in the world, helping to form robust opinions on such areas as investment skill and the ability to meet our clients’ objectives. You will also be required to source and assess individual assets and deals which fund managers invest in and could potentially be offered as co-investments to our clients.  These views are documented and communicated to clients through face-to-face meetings and via access to our comprehensive database.  The ultimate objective is to identify the best investment opportunities which fit the requirements of various client and delegated portfolios.  As a member of the Global Research team, you will liaise with other consultants around the globe while also partnering with other internal businesses to service clients’ complex needs. You will also work closely with managers to help develop new products and services which more closely meet our clients’ requirements and expectations. Further, as a member of the North American Investment manager research team, part of the role would comprise working closely with  clients which would include (but not be limited to): advice on portfolio construction, investment research and selection, discussion of market views and investment opportunities.This hire could be located in New York, Chicago, Toronto, Sydney or Melbourne.Performance Objectives:Excellence-  Interview and evaluate real asset investment strategies and managers-  Lead both internal and external research meetings, driving discussions and formulating views on specific managers and products-  Assist in the development and presentation of research findings to the global Investment practice-  Work closely with colleagues across the global manager research team to ensure identification of best in breed managers-  Actively contribute to efforts to focus resources on the highest priority areas of investment at any given point in time given market conditions and opportunities-  Thoroughly investigate and document potential investment offerings pursuing all relevant perspectives to make as informed of a decision as possibleClients-  Advise clients to help them determine their overall infrastructure strategy-  Contribute to developing Towers Watson’s global business development strategy in the area of real assets, with a particular focus on infrastructure -  Develop relationships with existing and potential clients investing in infrastructure and other real assets-  Develop trusted advisor relationship through effective communication and efficient, quality execution of projects-  Interface with colleagues from other practices and regions on assignments that reflect the clients’ broader business issuesPeople-  Build relationships with investment managers and act as a point of contact to provide information about the managers to members of the global investment practice -  Demonstrate natural ease and effectiveness when dealing with clients/colleagues at all levels-  Motivate and develop team members across the global organizationFinancial -  Guide new business initiatives for the provision of TW infrastructure services in North America-  Support client consultants in servicing key clients and participating in new business presentationsJob Details Link:  https://careers.peopleclick.com/careerscp/client_watsonwyatt/external/en-us/gateway.do?functionName=viewFromLink&jobPostId=77098&localeCode=en-us

474.desc: Tandem Music Group LLC is seeking an Intern to join our team. This internship is located in Philadelphia, PA within our newly renovated recording studio. Applicants should have excellent communication skills; maintain a high level of professionalism, possess adequate customer service skills, as well as minimal knowledge about the entertainment business.Job Requirements: Must be enrolled in an accredited institution, preferably in their senior year of undergraduate studies or recent graduate, valid driver’s license, and reliable transportation.Overall Duties: Assisting Tandem staff with miscellaneous office duties (and other needs), running errands, booking and managing talent, as well as business management.  Direct Responsibilities: Assisting Tandem’s staff with day-to-day operations; managing their event schedule and travel arrangements, answering the telephone, managing the email system and receiving/delivering mail. Participation in staff meetings is mandatory unless specified otherwise.

475.desc: Suburban Philadelphia architectural firm, seeks a highly motivated Intern Architect with 1-3 years of experience to work on high-end residential projects in various capacities. The Intern Architect will support Project Managers and firm Principal by developing Construction Documents, conducting architectural surveys and providing administrative support as needed. An Architecture Degree is required as well as a knowledge of construction materials, components and assemblies. Required skills: Strong technical and graphic skills, AutoCAD and REVIT proficiency preferred. Competitive salary and benefits package, pleasant working environment, IDP support and opportunity for growth. Office is located close to public transportation. Please submit resume, cover letter and work sample

476.desc: Serious about a career in retail? Get real world experience through Burlington Stores’ nationally recognized intern program. With 550 plus stores, an E-commerce site and 30,000 associates, and growing, we're always looking for great talent. Corporate Internship positions are located in our Corporate Offices in Florence, New Jersey, located between Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Princeton, New Jersey and our Los Angeles Buying Office.Through Burlington Stores’ summer intern experience, you will not only gain knowledge and skills through your departmental assignment, you will gain a full understanding of working in the fun and fast-paced world of off-price retail. Our comprehensive program provides you the opportunity to work side by side with leaders in the industry. Our interns proclaim our program to be “top-notch” because we execute on our promise to “wow” you every day. Highlights of the program include:Comprehensive OrientationRegular interaction with the leadership teamBuddy for support and guidanceInvolvement in Community Service ProjectsLeadership Development SeminarsShadowing days to explore alternative careersClassroom training, e.g. Retail Math, ExcelPresentations by key lines of businessStore toursInteraction with other interns and departmentsGroup social activitiesBusiness casual environment & associate discountSuccess of our program is measured by the number of interns who receive offers and join us as full-time associates. 479.desc: Computer Packages Inc, a 47 year old Intellectual Property software company based near Washington DC, is seeking a Client Representative to interface with existing and potential clients. Recent graduates with some work experience preferred. Excellent benefits including health insurance, tuition reimbursement, pension, gym membership and opportunity for growth.

480.company: Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Foundation
480.desc: Schusterman seeks an outstanding recent college graduate for a one-year fellowship in its Washington, D.C. office. The Fellow will assist the Leadership Initiatives team in its mission: to build the capacity of Jewish organizations by increasing the quantity of exceptionally qualified volunteer and professional leaders for the Jewish community. We do this by implementing various strategic initiatives that focus on recruiting, developing and retaining exceptional professional and volunteer talent with Schusterman’s grantees and the Jewish sector more broadly. Specific responsibilities of the Fellow include:Assist the Leadership Initiatives team on key initiativesa. Provide support to Schusterman staff in the design and implementation of strategic initiatives and special projects such as the Schusterman Fellowship, CareerHub and Talent Alliance;b. Arrange convenings and off-site gatherings for individuals, partner and grantee organizations;Research and Supporta. Seek out, review and synthesize articles, blogs, studies and presentations related to the team’s strategic priorities and topics such as leadership philosophy, delegation, facilitation techniques, giving feedback, working in teams, mindfulness, coaching and presence;b. Help to develop and expand new and existing program areas such as peer-to-peer recruitment; professional development and career coaching offerings;c. Draft blog posts, talking points, reports/presentations, emails and other materials on behalf of Schusterman and the Leadership Initiatives team;Data, Asset and Information Managementa. Build intake mechanisms and reports for key initiatives;b. Support program evaluation (e.g. surveys) and other data needs using Salesforce and Schusterman-wide technology; andc. Provide administrative support for the team.

481.desc: Front End Web DeveloperMOD Worldwide – Philadelphia, PAKeep it creative.Are you developed enough?We need the dreamers who cannot stop dreaming, the rebels who consider rule books To-Do-Lists. Not salmon swimming upstream but piranhas climbing Angel Falls.  Someone who’s seen pigs fly, who is strikingly original and just happens to be a front end web developer.RESPONSIBILITIES:• Work with designers to give form and functionality to our vision.• Staying up-to-date on the latest industry technology.• Experimenting with side projects for the agency brand and fill them with your personal creativity.• Start to finish involvement with our projects—anything from branding a pharmaceutical company, creating a website for a luxury condominium or building an interactive experience for an international fashion house.

482.desc: Success Academy is the fastest growing and highest performing network of charter schools in the nation. Our mission is to provide children with opportunity, empower parents with choice, and prove once and for all that zip codes do not determine destiny.					Since opening our first Harlem school in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country.					To support this growth and to continue providing all of our scholars with an unparalleled educational experience, Success Academy seeks to hire a Gift Officer—a results-focused individual who has the demonstrated philanthropic success and tenacity to advance our goals and the success of our scholars through the identification, solicitation, and stewardship of individual donors to Success Academy.

483.desc: Suburban Philadelphia firm seeks Junior Architectural Designer to work as part of project team on high-end residential projects. Duties include preparing construction documents under the direction of the Project Manager and firm Principal. Competitive salary and benefits; excellent work environment and potential for growth.

484.desc: MOD Worldwide – Philadelphia, PAYou live by software and dream in animation.Is your brain compatible with our agency? Our work moves at the speed of our collective skill.  You’ll be an essential circuit for our visual processing power. We need a devoted animator who doesn’t mind being a creative visionary, expert storyteller, and move people. You won’t be required to physically lift anyone—just their minds, hearts and souls.

485.desc: Intern will assist Organizers in one or all of the following duties:-Assist Organizers in planning marches, rallies and social events.-Meet with local, state and national legislators and government officials-Team strategy and planning-Occasional trips to Washington DC or Harrisburg-Social Networking-Assist Organizer in plannings local or regional outings

486.desc: Summer Study is looking for enthusiastic, energetic, outgoing role models who desire to teach and mentor high school students at one of program locations (Penn State University, Colorado State University, The Sorbonne in Paris, and Fordham University New York City, American University DC, and Spain).  Summer Study offers a unique experience to high school students from around the world by combining academics with the excitement and activity of a college environment. Teachers create, design, and implement their own “high interest low pressure” curriculum. Curriculum will include lecture, group discussion, in-class activity, guest speakers, and local field trips. The goal of the subject matter and curriculum is to make the course exciting, engaging, and meaningful to all students. 	Staff Advisers supervise sports and afternoon recreational activities, chaperon nightly events (movies, plays, concerts, dance clubs, etc.), reside in our dedicated residence halls and teach 1 or 2 enrichment classes per day. Additional opportunities include non-teaching positions such as Sports Clinic Instructors, General Office Support Staff, Medical Coordinator, Special Events Planner, Tour Guide, Sports Director and others. The programs also include off-campus weekend excursions to other colleges and cultural sites. Compensation includes all lodging, meals, planned entertainment and activity fees, weekend travel expenses and salary.We can help instructors to design and structure an internship to meet your specific department requirements, or simply offer the opportunity for further experience working with adolescents.

487.desc: Our students need your expertise, passion and leadership.We are looking for highly motivated and skilled talent to join our team at the District of Columbia Public Schools (DCPS). We seek individuals who are passionate about transforming and improving educational outcomes for our students.In DCPS, 4,500 teachers serve the needs of 49,000 students across 113 schools.  As part of a comprehensive reform effort to become the best urban school system in America, DCPS intends to have the highest-performing, best paid, most satisfied, and most honored educator force in the nation whose work drives significant achievement gains for DCPS students. Responsibilities•	Develop and implement curricula to meet academic standards•	Thoughtfully plan daily lessons and implement specific strategies to meet the needs of all students, providing extra support, enrichment, or variation of work when necessary•	Be accountable for students’ academic growth and increase each individual student’s achievement•	Design and implement assessments that measure progress towards academic standards and diagnose areas of student misunderstanding•	Use assessment data to refine curriculum and inform instructional practices•	Create a positive, achievement-oriented learning environment•	Reflect on successes and areas of growth as a teacher, seek to improve performance, and respond to feedback•	Participate in collaborative curriculum development, grade-level activities, and school-wide functions•	Invest parents and families in their children’s academic success through regular communication •	Perform other related duties as assigned.How to applyTo apply, visit our website at www.joindcpublicschools.com/teachers, and complete our online application. QuestionsIf you have any questions, please email us at teach.dcps@dc.gov.Stay Informed!Follow us on Twitter at @dcpsjobs, or become a fan of DCPS Jobs on Facebook.Criminal Background CheckIn accordance with the Criminal Background Checks for the Protection of Children Act of 2004, this position has been designated and identified as one which requires a criminal background check and/or traffic record check.  If you are tentatively selected for the position, a criminal background check will be conducted. A final offer of employment is contingent upon the receipt of a satisfactory criminal background check.Notice of Non-DiscriminationIn accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 and the D.C. Human Rights Act of 1977, as amended, District of Columbia Official Code Section 2-1401.01 et seq. (Act), the District of Columbia Public Schools (DCPS) does not discriminate (including employment therein and admission thereto) on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family status, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, genetic information, disability, source of income, status as a victim of an interfamily offense, or place of residence or business.  Sexual harassment is a form of sex discrimination, which is prohibited by the Act.  In addition, harassment based on any of the above-protected categories is prohibited.  Discrimination in violation of the aforementioned laws will not be tolerated.  Violators will be subject to disciplinary action. Inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies of DCPS will be handled as follows:Employees with inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies related to employment and employees should contact: Equal Employment Opportunity SpecialistOffice of Labor Management & Employee RelationsDistrict of Columbia Public Schools1200 First St, NE, 10th Floor, Washington, DC  20002(202) 442-5424

488.desc: About Us:SocialCode is a technology and insights company that manages digital advertising for the world's leading consumer brands across the world’s largest social platforms: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, & Pinterest. We are a subsidiary of Graham Holdings Company (formerly The Washington Post Company), but operate independently. We have an open office environment that fosters a free exchange of ideas and we’re looking to add more bright, enthusiastic talent eager to make a big impact on our business.  Do you have the quantitative skills it takes to run sophisticated social campaigns for the world’s most valuable brands?How you can make an impact:Creation and daily monitoring of Facebook and Twitter advertising campaignsTesting and analysis of key metrics to optimize performance and meet business objectivesCommunication with internal teams regarding campaign delivery data pertinent to client and business goalsMonitoring of daily reporting statistics for accuracyRecommending changes to existing products, policies, and processes that improve overall performanceBrainstorming new ways to improve advertising and engagement on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and PinterestWhat we offer:Competitive salary Quarterly bonus eligibilityFull benefits401(k) & pensionCompany equityCasual dressRapid learning and growth opportunitiesIn-office snack surplus

489.desc: As an Assistant Trader, you will learn the quantitative and game theoretical approach that SIG uses to make decisions in the financial markets.  You will work closely with experienced traders both on the desk and in the classroom who share a passion for mathematics, problem-solving, and technology.  The objective of the Assistant Trader program is to develop you into an autonomous decision-maker, capable of creating profitable trading strategies, assessing risk, and appropriately allocating firm capital.The objective of the Assistant Trader program is to develop you into an autonomous decision-maker, capable of identifying profitable trading opportunities, assessing risk, and appropriately allocating firm capital. You will be assigned to a trading desk where you will be responsible for daily activities that support our ongoing trading activity. Day to day work includes sourcing information that may affect trading strategies and conducting quantitative analysis of potential trading opportunities. You will work directly with a trader who is available to answer questions and provide you with feedback.Two senior traders teach the theoretical classroom education, which is the core of the program. Your professional development is their full-time responsibility. Class topics include option theory, decision science, corporate finance, game theory, and market structure. Lessons in decision making are reinforced through mock trading, game playing sessions, and a quantitative research project, which allow you to apply your theoretical knowledge in an immediate and practical way.SIG Perks•Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm, shorts all summer long•Food, beverages, and snacks available all day•On-site Wellness Center staffed with full-time Nurse Practitioner•Discounts for dining, entertainment, shopping, travel, and attractions•Social events including a poker tournament, dinners, and sporting events in Philadelphia•A 3,500 square-foot gym, yoga and indoor cycling classes•On-site services such as barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and ATMSIG Perks•	Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm, shorts all summer long•	Food, beverages, and snacks available all day•	Game room with golf simulators, game tables (poker, pool, ping pong, etc.), multicade classics video games, and Play Station/X-Box video area •	A 9,000 square-foot gym with cardio, cross fit and strength machines, plus yoga and indoor cycling classes•	Discounts for dining, entertainment, shopping, travel, and attractions•	Social events including a poker tournament, dinners, and sporting events in Philadelphia•	On-site Wellness Center staffed with full-time Nurse Practitioner•	On-site services such as barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and ATMIn order to apply and learn more about our opportunities, go to www.sig.com/campus.  About SIGSIG is a place where smart, analytical people work together to trade profitably in today’s markets. Our traders, quants, developers, and systems engineers work closely together for the continuous development and improvement of our trading strategies.

490.desc: The trading internship is a unique opportunity to learn about quantitative trading.  Our interns work on the desk in the morning and afternoon, but they step off daily to receive classroom education in trading and decision science.  The combination of desk and classroom training provides interns with the best preparation possible for quant trading.  Students with a STEM background will learn how SIG uses decision-science, game theory and technology to make trading decisions.  The goal of the program is to provide interns with a deep exposure to trading, so they can decide if it is what they want to pursue full-time.  SIG Perks•	Free housing is provided and conveniently located near SIG at the University of Pennsylvania•	Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm, shorts all summer long•	Food, beverages, and snacks available all day•	Game room with golf simulators, game tables (poker, pool, ping pong, etc.), multicade classics video games, and Play Station/X-Box video area •	A 9,000 square-foot gym with cardio, cross fit and strength machines, plus yoga and indoor cycling classes•	Discounts for dining, entertainment, shopping, travel, and attractions•	Social events including a poker tournament, dinners, and sporting events in Philadelphia•	On-site Wellness Center staffed with full-time Nurse Practitioner•	On-site services such as barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and ATMIn order to apply and learn more about our opportunities, go to www.sig.com/campus.  About SIGSIG is a place where smart, analytical people work together to trade profitably in today’s markets. Our traders, quants, developers, and systems engineers work closely together for the continuous development and improvement of our trading strategies.

491.position: Associate/Assistant Marketing Manager, Retention - Sports Illustrated, GOLF Magazine, and SI for Kids
491.desc: Position: Associate/Assistant Marketing Manager, Retention - Sports Illustrated, GOLF Magazine, and SI for KidsStart Date : ImmediateLocation: New York, NYTime Inc. is one of the largest branded media companies in the world. The company reaches more than 130 million people globally each month across multiple platforms, with influential brands like Sports Illustrated, Time, People, InStyle, Real Simple, Travel + Leisure, Food & Wine and Wallpaper. Time Inc. is home to celebrated events and franchises including the Sports Illustrated's Sportsman of the Year, Fortune 500, Time 100, People's Most Beautiful, Essence Festival in New Orleans and the Food & Wine Classic in Aspen.Time Inc. Consumer Marketing+Revenue, the industry leader, develops, retains, and grows our audience across all of our world-class brands and platforms. Specifically, the Consumer Marketing group is responsible for consumer revenues and profits of all magazines, web sites, and digital products at Time Inc., as well as driving audiences, which directly impacts our relationship with advertisers. The group creates compelling marketing campaigns that keep our readers engaged with our brands and develops exciting partnership opportunities with external companies and agencies to help drive traffic.The job:This position will provide an outstanding opportunity for an Associate or Assistant Marketing Manager to learn about and contribute to strategic initiatives and day-to-day activities for retaining Sports Illustrated, GOLF Magazine, and SI for Kids subscribers and for growing brand loyalty and engagement through enhanced print and digital product offerings.  This position is part of a 3-person Sports Retention team and will be exposed to marketing efforts across all three brands.You will:Support day-to-day activities under the direction of the Marketing Manager for all retention/loyalty programs across online and offline channels, including creative development, consumer segmentation, and fulfillment operationsEvaluate direct to consumer marketing efforts in order to optimize performance in alignment with brand goals including the optimization of response rates, profitability, brand loyalty and brand engagementFocus on improvement of subscriber communications by driving transactions online and optimizing marketing channels to increase early renewals, payments, and cross-sellsOptimize and expand strategy to collect consumer data and serve targeted marketing efforts  based on relevant data pointsContribute to targeted and personalized fan passion point marketing efforts on each brand through various marketing channels including email, mail, and onlinePartner with cross-functional teams (Production, Promotion, Operations/Fulfillment, Finance, and E-mail) to ensure integration of objectives, strategy and executionContribute to ad hoc projects for the brand and/or the division including pricing/offer strategy, premium/renewal incentive development, loyalty programs, etc.Assist with the management of retention budget and financial reporting including monthly expense reconciliations and re-forecastingParticipate in monthly brand updates to various levels of managementYou are:Driven:  You have an insatiable hunger to learn, and challenge yourself during each and every task that you touch.  Passion for media and supporting the marketing efforts for Sports Illustrated, GOLF Magazine, and SI for Kids are a must.  Bachelor’s degree required.Analytical:  You understand how to efficiently use the tools at your disposal to parse data, as you make sense of the key points in the most complex of spreadsheets in order to guide impactful decision-making.  Proficiency in Excel required.Right and left-brained:  You are detail-oriented and results-focused.  Your strong suit is in strategic thinking, with a sharp analytical mind complemented by a creative touch.  You make sense of a fast-paced, changing environment with a strong sense of prioritization and organization, allowing you to multi-task quickly and effectively.A natural leader:  You take initiative on projects, but work extremely well in a team setting.  You can build relationships across multiple groups and communicate effectively with peers and upper management, both written and verbally.Integrative:  You approach problems from multiple directions, using unique perspective to find the most optimal solution.  You challenge assumptions constructively, with an eye towards innovation, evolution, and progress.

492.desc: Elementary Teacher (2nd Grade)William E. Doar Jr. Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ)ABOUT THE SCHOOLThe William E. Doar Jr Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ) blends rigorous academics with world-class arts instruction provided by artists from renowned dance, musical, theatrical, and visual arts institutions. WEDJ is the only public charter school in Washington, DC to provide professional-caliber arts training for students in PreK through eighth grade at no cost to families. WEDJ serves more than 430 elementary and middle school students, a majority of whom are African American, and 85% of whom qualify for free/reduced priced lunch.In pursuit of an academic program that matches the success of its arts program, WEDJ partnered with TenSquare, a proven school turnaround partner, to launch a comprehensive school improvement effort in January 2014. Within five months of starting the interventions, student proficiency on the 2014 state exam increased by almost 12% in math and in four out of six grades in ELA. WEDJ’s Performance Management Framework (PMF) score also increased over 11 points, from a borderline Tier 3 score of 36.5 in 2013 to a solid Tier 2 score of 47.6 in 2014. The TenSquare supports teachers at WEDJ through intensive instructional coaching and professional development, curriculum and planning support, and school and classroom culture development. For additional information about WEDJ, visit www.wedjschool.us. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWEDJ is looking for an elementary teacher to fill an immediate vacancy. We are particularly interested in candidates with lower elementary school experience (grades K-2). The position is a full-time, 10-month position. A teacher at WEDJ is responsible for the following:Curriculum and Planning•	Creating curriculum including unit and lesson plans aligned to Common Core standards•	Structuring compelling, standards-based lessons that challenge students’ critical thinking and align with lesson, unit, and grade-level objectivesInstruction•	Utilizing strong content knowledge to effectively present material to students•	Incorporating joy and rigor in lessons and so that students are excited about and invested in their academic excellence  •	Employing multiple methods to accommodate different learning styles and abilities, including special education students and English language learners•	Participating in all professional development opportunitiesAssessment•	Assessing students academic and developmental growth through observation and a variety of assessment methods•	Tracking and monitor assessment results in order to regularly refine teaching practices and design differentiated lesson plansSchool Culture•	Create a positive learning environment that promotes high expectations and provides opportunities for all students to experience success •	Maintaining positive, professional relationships with students, families, and colleagues •	Communicating with students, parents, school staff to ensure that students are on-track in their learning and making progress towards goals

493.desc: Position: Executive Assistant, President of DigitalLocation: New York, NYTime Inc. is one of the largest branded media companies in the world. The company reaches more than 130 million people globally each month across multiple platforms, with influential brands like Time, People, Sports Illustrated, InStyle, Real Simple, Travel + Leisure, Food & Wine, and Wallpaper. Time Inc. is home to celebrated events and franchises including the Fortune 500, Time 100, People's Most Beautiful, Sports Illustrated's Sportsman of the Year, Essence Festival in New Orleans and the Food & Wine Classic in Aspen.The job:This role will report directly to the President, Digital at Time Inc.  The digital team is charged with building digital revenue and audience growth for the full portfolio of Time Inc. brands. This includes accelerating growth in the existing core businesses and brands through a high scale tech infrastructure, innovative digital ad products, partnerships, audience growth, and content innovation across all formats and platforms.  In addition, this includes identifying and pursuing new businesses to bold onto the core to add additional revenue.The Executive Assistant for the President of Digital will work closely with the President in two major functions: a) administrative duties including light scheduling, travel, and organizational duties for the digital options, and b) entry-level digital business operations which could include (depending on skills, interest, and business needs) competitive analysis, strategic presentations with guidance from the President, testing of new technologies, and/or basic business reporting and tracking.  This role is an entry level role that provides an opportunity for someone to learn the media business.You have:A passion and interest in the digital media business1-6 years of experience – both experienced and new hires are welcome to applyVery strong organizational skillsA proactive “can do” attitude and personalityExcellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to work with a wide ecosystem of people, with strong cultural sensitivity and awarenessProficiency with programs such as Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Outlook, and Microsoft Word are requiredAn understanding of social media, publishing, finance/accounting are a plus

494.desc: Home Energy AdvisorSealed® Inc.Location: New York Metro Area (Long Island, Westchester, Orange County, Northern New Jersey) Who we are:Sealed is a fast-growing and award-winning startup that is disrupting the home energy space. We are the first and only company that contractually guarantees savings from energy-saving improvements to the home, such as insulation, air sealing, and appliance upgrades. Sealed is your opportunity to have an outsized impact on the planet, our customers, and the bottom line (including your own!). Join us and be responsible for a multi-million dollar book of business that yields real results for everyone involved. Acquire valuable sales, technical, and account management training that will jump-start your career. Why us:- Fun company culture- Potential for company equity- Unlimited paid vacation- Opportunity for rapid promotion and professional growth- Not a desk job Who you are:- Excited about a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to build a business from the ground up- Ready to take on substantial responsibility immediately- A people person- Comfortable working independently- Strong communicator- Confident, organized, and humble- Passionate and persistent- Interested in learning new skills- Responsible, licensed driver What you will do at Sealed:- Provide home energy assessments for clients in the greater NYC area- Design and sell custom home efficiency projects to homeowners- Work with senior management to set company sales strategy and tactics CompensationFirst year: $35k Base + commissions (Potential total compensation is $70k+)Second year: Potential for high performers to make $100k+ How to ApplyGo to https://sealed.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0h5wt to submit your application Check us out sealed.comblog.sealed.comRecent Press

495.desc: AcisTek Corporation is currently seeking a Junior IT Business Analyst to join our team in supporting a Government client in the Washington, DC area.The Position:- Learn and work within the Agile SCRUM software development methodology including writing and maintaining business requirements and participating in all SCRUM meetings- Work with a SCRUM team to understand, create, and maintain software product(s) for the client- Create business process workflows and diagrams- Utilize JIRA and Confluence to create and track tickets and related documentation- Respond to and complete client requests in accordance with team support structure- Create and maintain system documentation, such as testing documentation, user guides,requirements documentation, and more- Test system functionality and UI’s in multiple browsers by following use cases and testing documents- Must be a team player with multi-tasking, problem solving, and customer service skills- Ability to communicate with technical team members to ensure that all requirements are understood- Other duties as assigned                                                                                                                                                                                                          The Opportunity:This is an outstanding opportunity to work in a small, focused team environment with unlimited challenges, providing development support for our customer. You will also be working directly with the management as well as a team of analysts and with various projects interacting with the customers.Position Type:FULL-TIME JOB (permanent, no end date)Position Location:Arlington, VAApplicants must apply on our corporate website at www.AcisTek.com. Applications not submitted on the corporate website will not be considered. AcisTek Corporation (AcisTek) is a growing, certified 8(a), minority owned business that provides rapid, responsive, and scalable technology solutions to the federal government. By utilizing the Agile methodology, AcisTek employees work closely and interactively with our clients to ensure our products meet their ever-changing needs. Our teams of developers and analysts leverage Adobe, Oracle, and Microsoft software to build rapid applications.

496.desc: ABOUT THE SCHOOLExcel Academy Public Charter School is Washington’s first public school for girls serving 800 Preschool through 7th grade girls. Our mission is to provide our students with a solid academic foundation and enrichment opportunities to prepare them to succeed in high school and college and to develop the skills and confidence they need to make healthy, positive lifestyle choices.For additional information about Excel Academy, visit www.excelpubliccharterschool.org. POSITION DESCRIPTIONWe are seeking a Kindergarten teacher to begin immediately. The position is a full-time, 10-month position.A teacher at Excel is directly accountable to their grade-level Assistant Principal for student academic success, maintenance of rigorous school culture, and mission advancement. Teachers are responsible for the following:Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesTeaching and Learning•	Creating curriculum including unit and lesson plans aligned to Common Core standards•	Structuring compelling, standards-based lessons that challenge students’ critical thinking and align with lesson, unit, and grade-level objectives•	Providing rigorous instruction in core subjects daily and use a variety of strategies to engage students in the classroom;•	Teaching students with disabilities in an inclusion setting and implement IEPs as necessary;•	Participating in all professional development opportunities;Assessment•	Assessing students academic and developmental growth through observation and a variety of assessment methods•	Use assessment data to refine curriculum and instructional practice;School Culture•	Create a positive learning environment that promotes high expectations and provides opportunities for all students to experience success •	Maintaining positive, professional relationships with students, families, and colleagues •	Communicating with students, parents, school staff to ensure that students are on-track in their learning and making progress towards goals•	Oversee student lunch periods, arrivals and dismissals, recess and playground duties;•	Keep comprehensive attendance and tardy records on all students;

497.desc: WantedUnique professional with 8-15+ years of work experience. Job LocationMajor US city, New York preferred. DurationMinimum 2.5 years commitment, full-time job. Job DescriptionWe are seeking a unique professional for a role that is positioned to grow into one of the top leaders at One Acre Fund as we enter an exciting period of expansion. This role has high potential to join our U.S. Leadership Council, which helps to set long-term organizational strategy along with our field leaders. With the support of our Board, existing funders, Executive Director, U.S. Director, and Global Business Development Director, this role will be responsible for:New lead development and relationship-building. Interact with some of the most thoughtful and forward-looking funders in the international development arena to grow One Acre Fund’s funding.Strategy and partnerships. Increasingly, our funding arrangements are strategic partnerships with the world’s major institutional funders, crafted around objectives that align with One Acre Fund’s long-term strategy. The Senior Director will help craft the strategy around these funding agreements. For example, our grant from the Gates Foundation aims to create a long-term platform for agricultural research and innovations that can scale to impact hundreds of thousands of smallholder farmers.Operationalizing new funding agreements. As our important deals move into implementation, the Senior Director will be instrumental in forming the initial strategy around forming joint objectives, hiring new staff, and identifying the work streams to support funding arrangements. Team development. The Senior Director will be responsible for selecting, mentoring, and developing a global team of 10-15 professionals over the next 3-5 years. We are looking for a humble leader who can help grow our business development, grant writing, and grant stewardship functions. Key spokesperson for our farmers. One Acre Fund is increasingly contributing to global discussions around agricultural development, and the Senior Director will serve as a key spokesperson for the organization, attending and presenting at events like the Skoll World Forum and the Clinton Global Initiative.This is a fund development role. However, because the Senior Director will play a role in strategy, partnerships, and operating a growing team, we do not necessarily need someone with prior fundraising experience. Instead, we are looking for someone with a sharp business mind primarily (e.g., former management consultant), together with strong interpersonal skills and an abiding commitment to our values of humbly serving farmers. Career Growth and DevelopmentOne Acre Fund invests in building management and leadership skills. Your manager will invest significant time in your career development. We provide constant, actionable feedback delivered through mentorship and through regular management consulting-style career reviews. We also have regular one-on-one meetings, where we listen to and discuss career goals, and work collaboratively to craft roles that each person can be passionate about. Because of our rapid growth, we constantly have new high-level roles opening up and opportunities in many functions. This results in fast career growth for our staff.

498.position: Sustrana Summer Marketing and Blogging Internship
498.desc: Sustrana LLC is a strategic sustainability management firm located just outside Philadelphia. We work with companies to help them integrate sustainability management practices into business systems, processes, and culture. We do this in a way that furthers progress towards company goals, drives innovation, enhances brand, and increases profitability.  Our process takes companies from education and commitment building within the organization, all the way through the implementation and continuous quality improvement for sustainability initiatives. Sustrana is looking for a Marketing and Blogging intern for our 2016 Summer Internship Program. Our program is primarily focused on supporting the development of our online sustainability management and planning platform for small and medium sized businesses. The focus of the Marketing and Blogging internship is two-fold:  marketing strategy and implementation; researching and drafting digital marketing communications for multiple uses. Communications channels for written pieces will vary from blogs to Facebook posts, from website content to email campaigns and newsletters. Other tasks may include marketing metrics and data entry. Specific projects and responsibilities will be dictated by the skills and interests of the candidate accepted into the program. Majors/minors that support creative marketing, clear writing, logic, and critical thinking will be given priority. Strong and diverse writing skills and an ability to collaborate and give and receive constructive criticism are essential.Our interns receive education on entrepreneurship, marketing, and business sustainability planning and management concepts. There will be ample opportunity to collaborate and share information, tactics, etc. with other members of the Sustrana team throughout the internship. At the end of the internship you will have gained an understanding of:•	in-bound marketing strategies, concepts, and best practices•	sustainability management concepts and practices•	practical hands-on experience in various aspects of developing and marketing a new technology product in a startup environmentOther reasons why should you work with us?•	As a Certified B Corporation we’re dedicated to meeting the highest standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability•	We’re a Certified Women’s Business Enterprise that prides ourselves on creating a diverse, inclusive, and comfortable work environment for everyone•	Our office is conveniently located outside of Philadelphia in Devon, PA just a few minutes walk from the Devon regional rail station.The internship requires a commitment of 2 days per week for 10 weeks starting the week of June 6th and ending on August 12th.   You will need to bring your own laptop.  Applicants will be expected to be able to work independently based on direction and weekly feedback sessions.  Strong communication and Microsoft Office skills, and attention to detail, are required.  Knowledge of sustainability concepts is preferred, but not required.  Priority will be given to rising juniors and above, including graduate students. Curiosity, imagination, and a respectful sense of humor and fun are required. We are a values-driven workplace and will look for interns who are able to work harmoniously in our company culture. This internship is unpaid, but a local transportation stipend will be provided.Applicants should submit a cover letter, resume, writing sample, and references to Lisa Nevins at lnevins@sustrana.com by 5 p.m. on February 26, 2016.
