501.desc: PrivCo (www.privco.com) is a rapidly growing, funded, and profitable growth-stage financial technology company founded by an internet industry pioneer (co-founder of Vault.com).Do you enjoy developing relationships and the thrill of closing new business? Are you looking for something that’s not just “another sales job” but an opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial environment to build a company that could disrupt the entire information industry?  If yes, this is the role for you. Our financial data company is seeking a high-energy, highly-driven, and highly-resourceful Account Executive to develop relationships with key decision-makers in the Financial Research market and sell data licenses to our proprietary and innovative research database. The market for our product is proven and vast. As a team member, you will have the opportunity to: • Establish and develop relationships with potential and current clients • Close deals and earn lucrative commissions in a wide-open, proven market• Assist with business development and market research practices working closely with the company’s talented product and tech teamsIdeal Candidate will:- Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills with high energy level and assertiveness, as well as strong relationship-building skills- Have sales experience (especially to business clients) required or other business client experience is a plus- Have a sincere and demonstrated interest in business, start-up, and financial news - Ability to learn quickly and speak with confidence about financial services- Have an innate ability to learn a client’s needs and develop a clear value propositionMust have 1 - 4 years of professional experiencePerks Include:• Compensation - Competitive and based on experience. Includes salary, generous commission schedule, and equity grant within our fast growing company via stock options • Free bagel and fruit Mondays• Flexible hours• Frequent company outings and events • Fun start-up atmosphere (Mini Basketball!)About our CompanyAt PrivCo, we are in the process of building the best, most comprehensive private company financial database in the world.  Our mission is to unveil the complex, secretive world of private company and deal information and equip clients with the most accurate and in-depth information possible allowing them to meet their business, research, and financial goals.   We foster an open environment that invites innovation, great ideas, and teamwork.  We have tremendous relationships with our top press partners like The Wall Street Journal, Forbes, CNBC, and The New York Times.  Our funded company is also proud to list the largest and most respected companies and firms in the world as our clients.

502.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
502.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing and housing finance resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multifamily housing finance, home improvement, rent control, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders. Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family friendly policies.The State of New York Mortgage Agency (SONYMA) is one of several HCR agencies. SONYMA’s programs provide mortgage financing to assist low- to moderate-income, first-time homebuyers in the purchase of a one-to-four unit residences that are required to meet eligibility criteria established by the Agency and by applicable Federal law. This position will report to the Single Family Programs unit of SONYMA. The Single Family unit reports to HCR’s Office of Finance & Development described below. The Office of Finance & Development manages HCR's multifamily and single family housing programs and bond offerings. HCR has been the most active housing bond issuer in the country over the past four years, issuing over $5.6 billion in tax exempt and taxable housing bonds to fund initiatives ranging in scope from mixed income rental developments to single family mortgages. Finance & Development actively engages with a range of partners including for-profit and not for profit borrowers, municipalities, lenders, investors and other funding entities to leverage the State's Low Income Housing Tax Credits, tax exempt bonds, single family lending programs, and State funded programs. Our resources have helped finance over 22,000 affordable apartments and over 6,250 affordable homes in the past four years. Finance & Development is also responsible for implementing many of the initiatives under the Governor’s new House NY Program, an unprecedented $1 billion investment over the next five years. Essential Duties / Responsibilities:•The billing, receipt and processing of lock-in fees from participating lenders for handling by the Accounting department. Interface with Treasury Department to ensure the collection (netting) of fees due the agency as it relates to program guidelines. •The processing, reconciliation of and remittance of fees to pool insurer(s) relative to monthly and annual pool premium billings. Interface with pool insurance companies on discrepancies or inquiries relative to insurance coverage of loan(s).•The billing, receipt and processing of quarterly servicing fees due to the agency and the reconciliation thereof with the master servicer and the accounting department.•Reconciliation of all functions and record and file maintenance to ensure accuracy. Filing and Maintenance of all Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Billings and Reports.•Retrieval and distribution of paid in full loans on a monthly basis for processing by the Servicing Department. Receipt and handling Down Payment Assistance Loan (DPAL) and Closing Costs Assistance Loan (CCAL) Recapture Funds for submission to Accounting Department for processing.•Perform special projects as requested by immediate supervisor relative to program modification as it regards to but not limited to system record update of Purchase Price and/or Income Limits and proofing thereof to ensure accuracy of data entered.•Communicate with immediate supervisor relative to problems and/or issues encountered daily.

503.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
503.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multifamily housing finance, home improvement, rent regulation, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders. Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family-friendly policies. The Office of Housing Preservation manages HCR programs that maintain and enhance the state’s portfolio of existing affordable housing. We enforce the Rent Laws in New York City for over 900,000 housing units, while providing federal and state rental assistance to assist more than 45,000 families across the state. We also monitor 130,000 low income housing units financed with federal and state resources, and provide grant funding to help homeowners and tenants save energy.The Housing Portfolio Management Unit is responsible for the asset management and compliance monitoring of the Agency’s existing housing loan portfolio. This portfolio has been financed under various loan and subsidy programs including the Secured Loan Rental Program, the Section 8 Mod Program (Allenhurst Apts.) and the Mobile Home Cooperative Program.Duties & Responsibilities:•	Perform financial monitoring of loans including the analysis of annual financial statements and property income and expense reports in order to identify potential risks that could affect the income stream and the viability of the project to meet required debt service obligations.•	Develop and implement recommendations or action plans to reduce risk and enhance physical and financial performance of portfolio projects.•	Implement and enforce the Agency’s regulatory requirements regarding financial reporting, property use restrictions, lease analysis and the low income unit set aside requirements.•	Interact on a daily basis with borrowers and property managers regarding the operation and management of the property; perform periodic side inspections and management evaluations as required by the loan documents and Agency policy.•	Coordinate property data and perform research regarding historical and current financial trends, operating expenses, market data, income and expense comparable’, and related information. •	Interact with outside professionals, other HFAs, experts in the field, etc. in obtaining information and materials to enhance Agency-financed loans, to determine industry standards, and to help broaden Agency knowledge of portfolio-related matters.•	Review, analyze and integrate housing bond and mortgage documents.•	Produce relevant data and reports necessary to assist in determining intervention plans for under-performing loans.•	Develop recommendations to enhance the long term financial and physical health of projects assigned to the Asset Manager.•	Working independently or with a team, prepare materials recommending solutions, action plans or strategies that will ensure compliance and improve project performance.•	Conduct meetings with borrowers, managing agents, other agencies, institutions or professionals on Agency business relating to portfolio projects.•	Represent the Agency at conferences, seminars, meetings, etc. on portfolio-related matters.•	Resolve difficult issues on portfolio projects through due diligence, enhanced business relationships, closer oversight, technical skills and experience in the recognition and resolution of problems, particularly on priority portfolio projects.•	Develop and implement turn-around strategies for seriously troubled loans.What we offer: •	Exciting opportunity to be part of New York’s resurgence to greatness; •	Extensive benefits package including paid leave, excellent health, dental, vision and retirement benefits; •	Promotional opportunity for dedicated professionals. TO APPLY, please send resume and cover letter to: jobopportunities@nyshcr.orgNew York State is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

perform periodic side inspections and management evaluations as required by the loan documents and Agency policy.•	Coordinate property data and perform research regarding historical and current financial trends, operating expenses, market data, income and expense comparable’, and related information. •	Interact with outside professionals, other HFAs, experts in the field, etc. in obtaining information and materials to enhance Agency-financed loans, to determine industry standards, and to help broaden Agency knowledge of portfolio-related matters.•	Review, analyze and integrate housing bond and mortgage documents.•	Produce relevant data and reports necessary to assist in determining intervention plans for under-performing loans.•	Develop recommendations to enhance the long term financial and physical health of projects assigned to the Asset Manager.•	Working independently or with a team, prepare materials recommending solutions, action plans or strategies that will ensure compliance and improve project performance.•	Conduct meetings with borrowers, managing agents, other agencies, institutions or professionals on Agency business relating to portfolio projects.•	Represent the Agency at conferences, seminars, meetings, etc. on portfolio-related matters.•	Resolve difficult issues on portfolio projects through due diligence, enhanced business relationships, closer oversight, technical skills and experience in the recognition and resolution of problems, particularly on priority portfolio projects.•	Develop and implement turn-around strategies for seriously troubled loans.What we offer: •	Exciting opportunity to be part of New York’s resurgence to greatness; •	Extensive benefits package including paid leave, excellent health, dental, vision and retirement benefits; •	Promotional opportunity for dedicated professionals. 508.desc: We are a small but perfectly formed startup based in Philadelphia. We will give you a chance to work on some great projects and develop your skills in exchange for dedication in doing what you love. You will join a culture that doesn't obsess about how many holiday days you have left and rewards people for their efforts.We enjoy using Macs, 12-foot whiteboard walls, and iPhones at our mobile office. We utilize the ecosystem that technology has created over the past few years, which truly allows us to stay connected, and always in touch. You are free to use whatever you want to get the job done, just always keep in mind: be good or be gone.Role:We are looking for an outgoing Fashion Buyer at Colabination - a marketplace built to support independent fashion designers. This role has a main focus on designer acquisition and designer relationship management. 509.desc: CPEX Real Estate is a commercial real estate firm located in Downtown Brooklyn that provides a full range of services for both real estate and business owners. These services include sales, leasing, acquisitions, and advisory. CPEX utilizes a team-based approach in which each of our teams specializes in a particular property type within the greater New York metropolitan area. We are seeking participants for our Graphic Design Summer Mentorship Program to assist in a wide variety of hands-on design assignments. CPEX aims to provide students with valuable experience in their career field of choice, regardless of whether or not their plans include real estate specifically. CPEX offers an ideal environment for students to explore an interest in business, sales, finance, design or marketing under the guidance of an experienced mentor.While not comprehensive, participants’ responsibilities include:•	Creating original and engaging visual elements for marketing materials•	Designing clean, streamlined layouts for documents and other materials•	Editing and enhancing photographs for use in marketing books and brochures•	Communicating and collaborating with other members of the Operations, Sales, and Leasing teams  CPEX provides a full range of services for both real estate and business owners in multiple markets by utilizing a team-based investment banking model. Each team focuses on a definitive specialization, allowing us to identify our clients’ objectives and implement strategic programs. Accordingly, the CPEX Mentorship Program encourages students to take part in any aspect of office enterprises to provide a well-rounded understanding of how the company functions as well as the roles and responsibilities of each employee. Additionally, each student is assigned to a team within our firm and closely supervised by CPEX senior management. Our Mentees actively participate in the direction of the company and assist in its growth. To learn more, please visit www.cpexre.com.Compensation:Students will receive stipends and are eligible to receive academic credit from their college or university.

511.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
511.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing for New Yorkers, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Working under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing and housing finance resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multi-family housing finance, home improvement, rent control, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders. Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family-friendly policies.The Office of Finance & Development manages HCR's multifamily and single family housing programs and bond offerings. HCR has been the most active housing bond issuer in the country over the past four years, issuing over $5.6 billion in tax exempt and taxable housing bonds to funds initiatives ranging in scope from mixed income rental developments to single family mortgages. Finance & Development actively engages with a range of partners including for-profit, and not for profit borrowers, municipalities, lenders, investors and other funding entities to leverage the State's Low Income Housing Tax Credits, tax exempt bonds, single family lending programs, and State funded programs. Our resources have helped finance over 22,000 affordable apartments and over 6,250 affordable homes in the past four years. Finance & Development is also responsible for implementing many of the initiatives under the Governor’s new House NY Program, an unprecedented $1 billion investment over the next five years. The Multifamily Finance unit offers financing to encourage a wide range of affordable housing, including preservation and rehabilitation of existing affordable multifamily rental housing, new construction of affordable multifamily rental housing for households of all ages, and mixed income developments, such as 80/20 projects for the creation of affordable multifamily rental housing in high-cost rental markets such as New York City. In the past two years, the Multifamily Finance unit has funded more than 50 projects that will create over 7,500 affordable housing units. DUTIES:The primary duty of the Junior Underwriter is to assist in the underwriting and origination of mortgages for affordable multifamily housing. Working under the guidance of an experienced underwriting team, this position will help evaluate project feasibility and eligibility, and determine loan amounts. In addition to financial and quantitative analysis, the Junior Underwriter will assist in assessing qualitative factors such as the experience of developers, contractors and property managers. The Junior Underwriter will facilitate communication between HFA and its borrowers, help secure necessary internal approvals, and assist senior staff in advancing projects to the Credit and Policy Committee.

An ideal candidate would also be familiar with the startup industry, culture and mindset that comes with it. This is your opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a growing startup and contribute your passion, drive and ambition to see a tangible impact on the company. Responsibilities: -Create and execute marketing campaigns with growth hacking and virality tactics in mind-Report on marketing campaign activity and growth metrics-Devise strategies to drive online traffic to the company website-Track, analyze and improve conversion rates throughout the main shopper funnel-Acquire new partnerships with Digital Magazines, Music Discovery sites, and Sneaker News sites-Aid in the development and eventually play a leadership role in our Brand Rep and Blog Ambassador programs-Work directly with our designers to foster and execute collaborative marketing opportunities-Aid in the preparation and execution of weekly email marketing content and A/B Testing-Make suggested improvements to the usability, design and content of the company website based on your primary and secondary research acquired throughout your role-Work in social media to test and develop new strategies for growth and engagement-Attend events individually for professional and company development, as well as with the team for networking and growth opportunities-Review new technologies and keep the company at the forefront of developments in marketing-Take on any future roles and responsibilities with a determined and open mind!

515.desc: Mayer Brown LLP is a leading global law firm with offices in 20 key business centers across the Americas, Asia and Europe. We are a collegial, collaborative, and diverse firm where highly motivated individuals with an unwavering commitment to excellence receive the opportunity, support, and development they need to grow, thrive, and realize their greatest potential.  In particular, Mayer Brown features one of the Nation’s leading Supreme Court practices. Our lawyers have argued more than 220 cases in the U.S. Supreme Court—more than any other law firm. The firm also directs the Yale Law School Supreme Court Clinic.The Supreme Court and Appellate practice group is seeking an assistant to join this specialized practice in the Washington office. The assistant will work under the direction of the partners who lead Mayer Brown’s Supreme Court practice, and the paralegal manager. Responsibilities of this position include:•	Active assistance with Supreme Court & appellate matters (35%) - Assist the leaders of the Supreme Court practice with experience-appropriate aspects of the Firm’s pending Supreme Court and appellate matters. These tasks may include factual and internet research, proofreading and cite-checking drafting documents, preparation of appendices, and assisting with the filing of briefs.•	Supreme Court & appellate practice group management (35%) - Support the leaders of the Supreme Court & appellate practice in marketing and other administrative functions. These tasks will include tracking matters handled by the Firm in the Supreme Court, assisting with maintenance of the practice’s web presence, and assisting with client alerts relating to Supreme Court cases.•	Factual research and writing: assisting the public policy practice (15%) - Support the public policy aspect of the practice. The assistant may be asked to research and draft white papers regarding a diverse array of issues. Topics could include cyber security, privacy, arbitration, and class action litigation.•	Business development: identifying and pitching for new work (15%) - Aid attorneys in identifying potential new appellate and Supreme Court matters. Aid in preparing pitch materials and handle all aspects of new case intake.

516.desc: PrivCo (www.privco.com) is a rapidly growing, funded, and profitable growth-stage financial technology company founded by an internet industry pioneer (co-founder of Vault.com).Do you enjoy following start-ups, VC activity, and have a particular passion for finance and technology?  Are you looking for something that’s not just “another job” but an opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial environment to build a company that could disrupt the entire information industry?  If yes, this is the role for you. Given our start-up nature, the Analyst will have the opportunity to grow and specialize based on skills/interests.  As a team member, you will have the opportunity to: • Perform financial research and written analysis on companies to assist in augmenting our core Platform• Research, analyze, and report on real-time business news (including private market M&A, Private Equity, and Venture Capital deal activity)• Assist in developing our technology-assisted data sourcing process• Manage product growth through your own created initiatives and projectsIdeal Candidate will:• Posses a fundamental understanding of finance and accounting principles (ability to understand financial statements)• Have problem solving, critical thinking, math skills, and ability to multitask• Have a sincere and demonstrated interest in business, start-up, and financial news • Be Experienced with SEC filings (10-Ks, 8-Ks, S-1s, etc.)	Must have 1 - 2 years of professional experiencePerks Include:• Compensation - Competitive and based on experience. Includes salary, revenue share, and generous equity grant within our fast growing company via stock options • Free bagel and fruit Mondays• Flexible hours• Frequent company outings and events • Fun start-up atmosphere (Mini Basketball!)About our CompanyAt PrivCo, we are in the process of building the best, most comprehensive private company financial database in the world.  Our mission is to unveil the complex, secretive world of private company and deal information and equip clients with the most accurate and in-depth information possible allowing them to meet their business, research, and financial goals.   We foster an open environment that invites innovation, great ideas, and teamwork.  We have tremendous relationships with our top press partners like The Wall Street Journal, Forbes, CNBC, and The New York Times.  Our funded company is also proud to list the largest and most respected companies and firms in the world as our clients.

Rubin HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing and housing finance resources. The State of New York Mortgage Agency (SONYMA) is one of several HCR agencies. SONYMA’s programs provide mortgage financing to assist low- to moderate-income, first-time homebuyers in the purchase of a one-to-four unit residences that are required to meet eligibility criteria established by the Agency and by applicable Federal law. This position will report to the Single Family Programs unit of SONYMA. The Single Family unit reports to HCR’s Office of Finance & Development described below.The Office of Finance & Development manages HCR's multifamily and single family housing programs and bond offerings. HCR has been the most active housing bond issuer in the country over the past four years, issuing over $5.6 billion in tax exempt and taxable housing bonds to fund initiatives ranging in scope from mixed income rental developments to single family mortgages. Finance & Development actively engages with a range of partners including for-profit and not for profit borrowers, municipalities, lenders, investors and other funding entities to leverage the State's Low Income Housing Tax Credits, tax exempt bonds, single family lending programs, and State funded programs. Our resources have helped finance over 22,000 affordable apartments and over 6,250 affordable homes in the past four years. Finance & Development is also responsible for implementing many of the initiatives under the Governor’s new House NY Program, an unprecedented $1 billion investment over the next five years.Position Summary: The REO/Foreclosure Specialist will work with the Servicing unit manager and the Agency’s servicers to facilitate more timely processing of loans in foreclosure (once all other options to assist the borrower have been exhausted) as well as the processing of required documentation to sell foreclosed properties. The position is responsible for working with servicers to ensure that foreclosures move through the process as expeditiously as possible. In addition, once properties have been foreclosed and the selling price has been approved by the pool insurer, work with servicers to process the necessary paperwork to sell the properties.Essential Duties / Responsibilities:Work with servicers and their attorneys to expedite loans through the foreclosure process.Responsible for timely processing of activities and responsiveness to ensure foreclosure timeline management is met.Work closely with attorneys on litigation and contested foreclosure matters.Ensure accounts are properly documented within SONYMA’s system of actions taken, correspondence, and explanation of any delays.Maintain SONYMA metrics and protocols on all foreclosure sales. Complete legal follow ups and verify foreclosure sales are complete and process repossessions as necessary.Work in coordination with the AVP/Mortgage Servicing, the Agency’s legal department and the servicer to facilitate the sale and closing of all Real Estate Owned properties (REO) by processing contracts and all other required documentation.Review contracts and legal documents for accuracy and completeness. Manage flow of paperwork to legal department and to the servicerManage the eviction completion process on properties that have completed the foreclosure process and are considered real estate owned (REO) propertiesManage external business relationships in regard to the propertyProcess sales proceeds and insurance claim paymentsProvide status reports of progress.

519.desc: The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission (MedPAC) seeks research assistant candidates who seek an intellectually challenging environment and who possess both an interest in health care policy and a commitment to producing high-quality work. We are seeking candidates who can commit to this position for two-years and who are available to start before mid-July 2016.  MedPAC is a nonpartisan legislative branch agency that advises the U.S. Congress on the Medicare program. The Commission consists of 17 commissioners who are national health policy leaders, and approximately 35 full-time staff. MedPAC staff evaluate Medicare policies, develop new policies for the Commission to consider, and present their work in regular public meetings. MedPAC publishes its recommendations and supporting analyses in two annual reports to the Congress and in other reports periodically mandated by the Congress. In addition, staff prepare analyses of proposed regulations, write issue briefs, and contribute to the preparation of Congressional testimony. They provide technical support as needed to Congressional staff. Research assistants must be able to work as part of a team and take on assigned tasks to help the Commission fulfill its mandate. Depending on need, research assistants perform a variety of tasks including data collection, data analysis, data programming, literature reviews, writing research and policy briefs, presentations, interviews with health care providers, site visits, and coordinating logistics for expert panel meetings. Candidates best suited for this position may possess various research skills, writing and general communication skills, and education and work experience. Research skills:Experience with quantitative and qualitative research Familiarity and comfort with the general principles of statisticsFamiliarity with data analysis, spreadsheet analysis, and data programming (e.g., SAS) Resourcefulness to investigate complex issues and synthesize informationAbility to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a timely and complete mannerWillingness and determination to learn new skillsKnowledge of health policy or public policyWriting and communications skills:Ability to coherently and concisely communicate research findings in writingAbility to present research findings orally Education and experience:An undergraduate degree in a discipline consistent with the stated skill requirements such as economics, political science, public policy, public health, health services research, health administration, or pre-med.Following their two-year commitment, MedPAC’s research assistants have gone on to attend graduate school in a number of different fields (public policy, economics, medicine and nursing, law, and the humanities) or have taken positions in large health care systems, policy organizations, or other government agencies.To apply, send a resume, cover letter, and two writing samples to:  RASearch@medpac.gov  or by mail to Zach Gaumer at the Medicare Payment Advisory Commission, 425 I Street, NW, Suite 701, Washington, DC 20001.MedPAC is an equal opportunity employer. Must be a citizen of the United States.

520.desc: CPEX Real Estate is a commercial real estate firm located in Downtown Brooklyn that provides a full range of services for both real estate and business owners. These services include sales, leasing, acquisitions, and advisory. CPEX utilizes a team-based approach in which each of our teams specializes in a particular property type within the greater New York metropolitan area. We are seeking participants for our Summer Sales and Research Mentorship Program, who will work closely with our brokers and in-house research team.CPEX aims to provide students with valuable experience in their career field of choice, regardless of whether or not their plans include real estate specifically. CPEX offers an ideal environment for students to explore an interest in business, sales, finance, design or marketing under the guidance of an experienced mentor.While not comprehensive, participants’ responsibilities include:•	Making calls and assisting with presentations and walk-throughs •	Working closely with a team to meet time-sensitive goals for clients•	Communicating and collaborating with other members of the Operations, Sales, and Leasing teams as well as with clients and other real estate professionals•	Conduct research by collecting, analyzing and summarizing sales data for company reports•	Performing financial analysis of the most current real estate market data•	Working within a group of Mentees to put together a mock presentation, including a full valuation of the propertyCPEX provides a full range of services for both real estate and business owners in multiple markets by utilizing a team-based investment banking model. Each team focuses on a definitive specialization, allowing us to identify our clients’ objectives and implement strategic programs. Accordingly, the CPEX Mentorship Program encourages students to take part in any aspect of office enterprises to provide a well-rounded understanding of how the company functions as well as the roles and responsibilities of each employee. Additionally, each student is assigned to a team within our firm and closely supervised by CPEX senior management. Our Mentees actively participate in the direction of the company and assist in its growth. To learn more, please visit www.cpexre.com.Compensation:Students will receive stipends and are eligible to receive academic credit from their college or university.

521.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
521.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of highquality affordable housing, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communitiesthroughout the Empire State. Under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and CommissionerJames S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’shousing resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ adiverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderateincome families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multifamily housing finance, homeimprovement, rent regulation, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularlywith a variety of public and private stakeholders.Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration,real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide aworkplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees areempowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and acomprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and familyfriendlypolicies.The Office of Professional Services (OPS) is responsible for all administrative and support services,including Human Resources, Communications and Public Information, Legal Affairs, Fair Housing, PolicyDevelopment, Competitive Procurement and Contract Management, Fiscal Planning, Accounting andTreasury Services, Facilities and Building Management Services, Internal Audit, Project Management andInformation Technology Services. OPS values professionals that enjoy working in a fast-pacedenvironment and who have the skills required to effectively plan, direct, and coordinate HCR’s widearray of support services.Job SummaryNew York State Homes and Community Renewal is seeking a Senior Business Analyst (SBA) who isknowledgeable in the areas of process design and systems analysis. The SBA will work closely withproject managers, IT staff, program staff and other stakeholders to define and develop requirements fornew business processes and existing information technology systems. The SBA will apply a range ofspecialized skills and tools to complete the following specific duties and responsibilities: Conduct research and elicit business requirements from key stakeholders by using interviews,document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business processdescriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis,task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints. Analyze business and user needs, document requirements, and revise existing system logic asnecessary under direction of Project Managers.Job Opportunities at New York State Homes and Community Renewal Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, use case analysis or scenarios, where appropriate. Develop or modify procedures to solve complex problems within information systems. Work with Project Manager to monitor and document post-implementation problems and revision requests to ensure it meets end user needs. Create and revise flow charts, process models, and technical specifications. Assist with the business planning and writing business cases. Research and evaluate packaged software and online services to determine their appropriateness for Agency use.The SBA will use their extensive knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and business analysis best practices to facilitate requirements sessions and communicate clearly and effectively with end-users, applications developers, senior business managers and other team members. The SBA will be accountable for providing coordination to ensure the appropriate collection of data; documentation of information; and presentation of findings. The SBA will provide documentation and flow-charts of the organization’s work flow, as well as ad-hoc query support and report creation.The SBA must have strong technical knowledge and understanding of IT systems and applications as well as the ability to plan and track business analyses activities as part of a project. The SBA also must have good listening skills and interviewing skills to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information. The ideal candidate will also possess good writing skills to ensure effective communicate of information to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staff.

522.company: New York State Homes and Community Renewal
522.desc: New York State Homes and Community Renewal (HCR) fosters the creation and preservation of high quality affordable housing, while working strategically to revitalize neighborhoods and communities throughout the Empire State. Under the leadership of Governor Andrew M. Cuomo and Commissioner James S. Rubin, HCR is a vibrant, innovative agency that integrates and leverages New York State’s housing resources. We have offices in New York City, Albany, Buffalo and Syracuse, and employ a diverse workforce of professionals who are hard-working and committed to serving low and moderate income families. Our mission is far reaching, encompassing single and multifamily housing finance, home improvement, rent regulation, housing subsidies, and community development. We partner regularly with a variety of public and private stakeholders. Achieving this mission requires a wide range of skills and backgrounds in public policy, administration, real estate, architecture, finance, law and many other areas of expertise. We seek to provide a workplace environment that is productive, flexible, accountable, ethical and caring. Our employees are empowered to make a difference where they live and work. We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package, including paid leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and family-friendly policies. The Office of Professional Services (OPS) is responsible for all administrative and support services, including Human Resources, Communications and Public Information, Legal Affairs, Fair Housing, Policy Development, Competitive Procurement and Contract Management, Fiscal Planning, Accounting and Treasury Services, Facilities and Building Management Services, Internal Audit, Project Management and Information Technology Services. OPS values professionals that enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and who have the skills required to effectively plan, direct, and coordinate HCR’s wide array of support services.Job Summary•	Review program financial statements  •	Prepare program related reports and project analysis•	Verify bank transactions to source documents•	Review bank reconciliations and promptly follow-up on outstanding items•	Review transaction postings to the General Ledger from feeder systems 			   (investment, mortgage billing, etc.)•	Review / establish monthly mortgage billing to projects•	Manage internal, external, and state audit process•	Develop Agency-wide financial statement reporting model•	Assist in preparation of comprehensive accounting policy and procedures manual•	Manage other accountants in the group

523.position: James H. Dunn, Jr. Memorial Fellowship
523.desc: Please contact Alex Caton at Alexander.Caton@illinois.gov with any questions.James H. Dunn, Jr. Memorial Fellowship2016-2017Deadline: February 29, 2016 at midnight (12:00am CST)OverviewThe Dunn Fellowship Program provides bright, highly motivated college graduates a unique opportunityto experience firsthand the operations of state government for one year.Dunn Fellows are recruited from public and private colleges and universities throughout the nation.Qualified applicants must hold a bachelor's degree at the program's commencement and must havedemonstrated a commitment to excellence through academic honors, leadership ability, extracurricularactivities and community/public service involvement. The program begins on the first weekday inAugust and ends on July 31st of the following year.Fellows spend one week of August receiving an orientation to state government including tours, policydiscussions, a panel of program alumni and a brown bag lunch with senior staff among other activities.After the orientation period, fellows return to their home office to work under the direction of theirsupervisor.Dunn Fellows are paid $31,332 annually and receive full state benefits.Positions for the 2016-2017 class of Dunn Fellows include: Legislative Affairs Office of Management & Budget Governmental Affairs & Outreach General Counsel (J.D. Required) Communications Federal Affairs Policy Government Transformation & MetricsA majority of Fellows will be based in Springfield with limited placements in Chicago and Washington,D.C.ObjectivesThrough the James H. Dunn, Jr. Memorial Fellowship Program, we hope to accomplish the following: Offer a governmental initiative to meet the public sector’s future need for competentadministrators Provide a public sector management training program that encourages talented college graduatesto consider careers in state government Enable college graduates to supplement their academic backgrounds with practical experience inareas such as policy analysis and program administration Enable the Prescott E. Bloom Internships in Government Program to play an ever-increasing role instate government as new fellows enter public service and former fellows advance intomanagement positionsApply at:http://www.illinois.gov/gov/about/opportunities/Pages/JamesHDunn.aspxDeadline: February 29, 2016 at midnight (12:00am CST)

524.desc: Research Consultant- New York City or Los AngelesInterested in a career in international deal making in the fascinating and lucrative energy & commodity trading markets?This is an opportunity for an entrepreneurial, intelligent, naturally inquisitive and highly motivated graduate/recent graduate to join a high performing, global search firm. We offer a challenging and rewarding career path in a genuinely meritocratic and fun environment. 			Commodity Search PartnersWe are an International Executive Search Firm specialising in the global commodity markets with offices in New York, Los Angeles, Vancouver, São Paulo, Singapore and London. Our unique structure allows our consultants not only to be experts in their chosen sector but also in specific functional disciplines. We demonstrate our commitment through communication, partnership, determination and ultimately results. Our business is built on our tenacity to deliver on our promises. More information on our firm and functions can be found on www.commoditysp.comThe RoleYou will work with a team of top performing consultants in our dynamic New York City or Los Angeles office. You will become a specialist in the high profile commodity trading markets, placing talent across North America. Your role will be focused on the delivery of search mandates along with your senior consultant. You will be taught the core skills and resourcing techniques that set Commodity Search Partners above the competition. Mastering these skills and techniques will allow you to transition into a lucrative consultant position where you will carve out your own niche market.Research Consultant Responsibilities•	Market mapping: Creating your own network of candidates using key search techniques.  We use creative approaches to map markets and provide our clients with complete coverage of the market.•	Headhunting:  working through recommendation and referral through our senior network, you will be building relationships with senior individuals on a daily basis •	Research:  you will become an expert in your field through detailed research in your specialist area, researching your clients and candidates and keeping up to date with market knowledge•	Interviewing: you will be required to interview candidates, both on the phone and face to face prior to their introductions to your clients.  You will also help to guide clients through interviews and prepare both sides accordingly•	Presentation: you will be professionally presenting your candidates to your senior network of clients, exploring opportunities on their behalf and arranging introductions •	Candidate management:  you will manage your candidates from the first research call through to placement and beyond•	Location: Midtown Manhattan or Santa Monica (Los Angeles)•	Start Date: Monday, August 1st, 2016 or earlierNext Steps•	Send your one page resume to USACareers@commoditysp.com o	Subject line: Research Consultant – Your Name•	CLEARLY STATE GPA.•	CLEARLY STATE WORK ELIGIBILITY IN USA•	CLEARLY STATE LOCATION PREFERENCE ( NYC, LA OR EITHER)•	All profiles will be reviewed by 6pm Eastern on March 11th. Due to volume of emails we will not be able to respond to individual questions until after this date.•	Successful applicants will be invited to undertake competency interviews followed by an in person assessment center on Friday, April 1st in Central Manhattan. Los Angeles assessment center will be mid-April.

525.desc: Abernathy MacGregor is a strategic communications firm with more than 30 years of experience advising U.S. and international organizations.  Most of our clients are publicly-owned corporations, although we also advise private businesses, individuals and nonprofits.  We distinguish ourselves from our peers by focusing on partnering closely with our clients to understand their businesses, cultures and goals to achieve results.  We help our clients attract investors, complete transactions, resolve crises, prevail on public issues, retain customers and motivate employees.  We offer our clients diverse and pertinent experience, relationships that matter and ideas that work.We serve our clients in six areas: corporate and financial communications; investor relations and shareholder activism; transaction communications; crisis management; initial public offerings; and corporate restructurings and bankruptcy.  We are consistently ranked as a leader within these disciplines.  Abernathy MacGregor is based in New York, with offices in Los Angeles, San Francisco and Houston.  We were founded in 1984, and are today part of Havas Worldwide, a global advertising and communications services group.  We number approximately 80 professionals.  Interns will play an active role at Abernathy MacGregor over 10 weeks this upcoming summer.  Each selected intern will be assigned to a practice group. Each practice group consists of four to six client-facing professionals at various levels of experience and is led by one or more managing directors.  Over the course of the summer, interns will be exposed to our firm and industry by working with their respective teams and through seminars and group tours of media organizations and financial institutions, along with office-wide social events.

526.desc: The Tower Tomorrow Fellowship offers a select group of university students a challenging summer aimed at educating future journalists, writers and advocacy professionals in research, analysis, writing for publication, strategic communications and media management. Working with world-class writers and media professionals, Fellows will learn about coverage of Israel and the region, meet with journalists, scholars, and diplomats, and undertake an intensive eight-week course. Tower Tomorrow Fellows participate in a rigorous writing seminar, write and revise weekly 2,000-word nonfiction articles on Israel and the Middle East, and receive detailed individual feedback. Fellows also practice short-form writing and gain an understanding of strategic communications and messaging by composing daily blog posts on current events in the Middle East. Fellows work closely with key members of The Israel Project’s staff and gain an understanding of TIP’s cutting-edge work in strategic communications through rotations in the organization’s various departments. Fellows also engage in informal social events where they have the opportunity to get to know other members of The Israel Project staff, including senior leadership. Fellows regularly meet with some of Washington’s most influential journalists, experts, and policymakers for intimate seminars on how ideas flow through contemporary society. Additionally, Fellows also visit distinguished Washington institutions such as The Washington Post, Israel’s Embassy to the United States, NBC News, and the United States Congress in order to get an insider’s view of their work. The Israel Project aims to cultivate and new generation of pro-Israel leaders in policy, thought, media and advocacy. Accordingly, following the conclusion of the Fellowship program, Fellows are eligible to apply for monetary grants to help them establish campus publications, through which they can build on the experience and tools they gained during the summer, while relying on continued TIP resources and training. Through both Fellowship activities and post-Fellowship opportunities, Tower Tomorrow Fellows gain connections and skills that empower them in making a decisive impact on their home campus and the public conversation at large.

527.desc: Analytical Graphics, Inc. (AGI), founder of Cesium, is growing the core Cesium team. Come develop the future of 3D virtual globes!Do you want to use cutting-edge tools, impact a large community, and collaborate on open-source software development using GitHub? Join us in solving hard problems in 3D graphics, massive virtual worlds, large-scale web development, and geospatial analysis.We’re looking for passionate graphics developers to join our team and make a big impact on both the back-end content pipeline and Cesium's runtime engine.You* Are a specialist in graphics for streaming massive models, 3D engine design, or real-time rendering. Topics like spatial data structures, LOD, compression, culling, and shaders excite you. Perhaps you have experience with datasets like massive terrain, imagery, buildings, point clouds, and vector features.* Have strong math skills and enjoy designing data structures and implementing non-trivial algorithms.* Read papers from conferences like SIGGRAPH and Eurographics and books like GPU Pro and Real-Time Rendering for fun. Perhaps you’ve published a few papers.* Navigate recent research and code a production implementation with modern software development practices including git, code reviews, and unit tests.* Understand GPU architecture and have experience with WebGL, OpenGL ES, OpenGL, or Direct3D.* Bonus: love or at least tolerate JavaScript.* Bonus: experience in the games, movie, or geospatial industries.* You have an undergrad or graduate degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Math, Game Design or a related field.The Cesium team enjoys an entrepreneurial environment with the energy and freedom of a startup, and the backing of AGI's established company. You'll join a passionate team that also writes books, creates open industry standards, participates in code sprints and hackathons, and organizes and presents at local and international conferences. We have a culture of writing high-performance, clean, peer-reviewed, tested code.AGI provides experienced mentors who will help you realize your potential, as well as free food, snacks, and beverages, casual dress, flexible hours, onsite gym and laundry, and high-end development hardware.AGI has an energetic office outside of Philadelphia in Exton, PA. We are happy to help you find housing.

528.desc: Company Overview:Restorsea is a new natural prestige skin care company with a powerful and proven line of products anchored by a proprietary enzyme that we have the global exclusive rights to. Within a very short period, we have established ourselves as an award-winning innovator and have received immediate acclaim from Elle Magazine, NY Times, Lucky, Marie Claire, Conde Nast Traveler, Shape, Harper’s Bazaar, InStyle, DuJour, WhoWhatWear, Fashionista.com, Refinery29 and Style.com, most recently winning the Beauty Entrepreneur Award by Fashion Group International. CEO/Founder Patricia Pao, a Harvard Business School graduate, has over 25 years of luxury and beauty industry experience, launching 400+ products for companies including Avon, Guerlain, Elizabeth Arden and Peter Thomas Roth.Restorsea Retail launched in Bergdorf Goodman and restorsea.com in Fall 2012.  Restorsea PRO, a skincare line exclusive to licensed dermatologists and plastic surgeons recently launched in July 2015.Position Description/Responsibilities:Restorsea is a seeking an Account Services Coordinator to support our PRO accounts. PRO accounts are comprised of dermatologist and plastic surgery offices. This position requires strong communication and organizational skills. The Account Services Coordinator serves as a main point of contact for PRO Accounts and PRO Sales Team on all order and logistics matters. Ability to work with a variety of different parties is crucial. Sample responsibilities include:Restorsea PRO•	Set up and file new accounts and maintain ongoing account directory•	Manage all order paperwork to ensure all orders are entered, processed and fulfilled on a timely basis•	Maintain all order templates •	Maintain order summary reports•	Follow up with Warehouse/Distribution Center to confirm on-time delivery•	Prepare and ship PRO orders when warehouse/distribution center is unable to•	Coordinate with Accounts Receivable to ensure on-time billing and invoice communication•	Work with corporate (Operations/Sales/Business Strategy) to support PRO Accounts’ marketing efforts and coordinate materials/inventory•	Provide additional support to PRO accounts as neededQualifications/Desired Skill Set:•	Bachelor’s degree•	Strong verbal/written communication skills•	Attention to detail and excellent organization skills•	Highly responsive•	Proficiency in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel •	Ability to operate independently and as part of a group•	Excellent time management skills; able to juggle multiple projects and switch between them seamlessly•	Self-sufficient, proactive, resourceful and a quick-learner•	Possess a ‘can do’ attitude to do ‘whatever is takes’ to get the job done•	Nimble thinker, able to think “outside the box”Salary Dependent on Experience.Office Location: Restorsea’s office is located at 641 Lexington Ave, 27th Floor, New York, NY 10022

529.desc: If you’re looking to kickstart your career in the clean energy space, we’ve got you covered. Inspire Energy is America’s fastest growing 100% clean energy company. Our goal is simple: make sure everyone has access to clean power. Located in Fishtown, Philadelphia, we pride ourselves on being a hometown hero, helping local residents better their lifestyle by providing solutions to their homes and small businesses. We’re seeking a driven individual who thrives in a social environment. You are forward thinking, a quick learner, and undoubtedly mission driven. You are a go-getter, and will be a key component in growing our tribe of carbon crushers!

530.desc: Now hiring Climate Defender Organizers!Apply at http://jobs.environmentamerica.org/apply.html. Positions will be filled on a rolling basis as applications are received. The application deadline is January 15th and the target start date is February 1st.THE CAMPAIGNFrom droughts and wildfires in the west to heat waves and Superstorms like Sandy in the east, extreme weather fueled by global warming is happening now and it's hitting us at home. 2015 is on track to be the hottest year on record, and in Pennsylvania, nearly 9 out of 10 people live in areas that were listed as federal disaster zones due to extreme weather between 2007 and 2013.We know what we need to do: dramatically reduce the carbon emissions that are created when we burn fossil fuels, both by using less energy and by ensuring that all of the energy we do use comes from clean renewable sources like solar and wind.The good news is that there's enormous momentum for action, and we're on the verge of the biggest step our country has ever taken to tackle climate change. The Environmental Protection Agency has finalized standards dramatically cutting carbon pollution from power plants. This unprecedented step forward is facing enormous opposition from the fossil fuel industry and their allies in D.C. and Harrisburg.Pennsylvania is at the center of this fight.Nationally, Majority Leader McConnell along with major coal companies are leading the charge to rollback these climate pollution limits. And we'll need Senator Casey to stand with us to stop these attacks.Around the nation and in Pennsylvania, everyone is watching to see if Governor Wolf will implement a Clean Power Plan that transforms the 3rd largest emitter of carbon pollution the nation into a clean energy leader. But, coal companies are working with the conservatives in the legislature to interfere with this transformation.The next 8 months will help determine the success of the Clean Power Plan, and whether Pennsylvania and the nation will be on the path to a clean energy future. PennEnvironment is expanding our efforts to mobilize and engage tens of thousands of Pennsylvanians for climate action and build the movement to tackle climate change. The stakes could not be higher, the opportunity has never been more clear, and victory will signal a historic step forward in the fight against climate change.THE JOB DESCRIPTIONPennEnvironment's Climate Defender Organizers are responsible for recruiting, developing and mobilizing powerful teams of climate volunteers in critical communities across the state.As a Climate Defender Organizer, you will work with our existing network of more than 50 team members and dozens of volunteers, and will build volunteer teams in key political areas to ensure support from local decision-makers for climate action. You and your volunteers will organize rallies, run phonebanks to generate thousands of calls, coordinate rapid response media, collect thousands of petitions and personal letters on climate change, attend lobby meetings with volunteers, run skills trainings for citizens and more. Along the way you will train dozens of volunteers to take on more leadership, organize creative events including forums and town halls, present to dozens of community groups and build political power to ensure real progress on climate change.By the end of the campaign, you will will have built volunteer teams in key areas that can continue the fight for Pennsylvania's environment for years to come.Dates:Organizers will start in early February and work through the end of August. Organizers will also have an opportunity to interview for long-term positions at PennEnvironment and our network of organizations.Locations:Pittsburgh, Philadelphia, Philadelphia suburbsTraining:There will be a week-long training near the beginning of the campaign. We will also hold periodic trainings on advanced skills for organizers.Salary:Entry-level organizers will be paid based on an annual salary rate of $25,000. Salary for experienced staff is commensurate with relevant experience, where we value experience with political campaigns, environmental organizations, and managing volunteers or paid staff. All staff will receive paid sick days. We also offer an excellent training program and opportunities for advancement.Qualifications:We're seeking applicants who are ready to commit their time, talent and passion to advocating, organizing and recruiting new leaders to protect the environment. We look for smarts, organizing experience and an eagerness to learn. We value leadership experience of all kinds, especially organizing, grassroots outreach and building campus groups. College graduates, graduating seniors, and rising seniors are invited to apply.Our Climate Defender Organizers will have the opportunity to apply for a career position with PennEnvironment and Environment America--the federation of state groups of which we're a part--at the end of the campaign.How to Apply:Apply online at http://jobs.environmentamerica.org/apply.html. Positions will be filled on a rolling basis.

531.desc: Analytical Graphics, Inc. (AGI), founder of Cesium, is growing the core Cesium team. Come develop the future of 3D virtual globes!Do you want to use cutting-edge tools, impact a large community, and collaborate on open-source software development using GitHub? Join us in solving hard problems in 3D graphics, massive virtual worlds, large-scale web development, and geospatial analysis.As an intern, you'll do the same work as full-time developers. Interns even present at conferences, write articles about their work, and contribute to open industry standards. You'll work with an experienced mentor whose primary interest is to help you realize your potential.You love envisioning new products and features, having ownership, exploring new technologies, and shipping software. You are a creative builder.You are interested in one or more of these areas (we don't expect you to know them all!):* Front-end: JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, UI/UX design* 3D graphics: WebGL, real-time rendering, 3D engine design, spatial data structures, massively parallel algorithms* Back-end: Node.js, PostgreSQL, designing REST APIs, Amazon Web Services* Outreach: Supporting developer communities with demos, tutorials, forums, and conference talksYou are working towards an undergrad or graduate degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Math, Digital Media, Game Design, or a related field.We work with students year round. Many of our interns join us for full-time positions after graduation.The Cesium team enjoys an entrepreneurial environment with the energy and freedom of a startup, and the backing of AGI's established company. You'll join a passionate team that also writes books, creates open industry standards, participates in code sprints and hackathons, and organizes and presents at local and international conferences. We have a culture of writing high-performance, clean, peer-reviewed, tested code.AGI provides experienced mentors who will help you realize your potential, as well as free food, snacks, and beverages, casual dress, flexible hours, onsite gym and laundry, and high-end development hardware.AGI has an energetic office outside of Philadelphia in Exton, PA. We are happy to help you find housing.

532.position: 2016 Chase Modeling and Analytics PhD Program
532.desc: JPMorgan Chase is one of the largest U.S. providers of banking, credit cards, lending, wealth management and investment services, serving more than 50 million customers. We serve individual consumers, small businesses and mid-size companies. All JPMorgan Chase employees are focused on providing the best possible service to our customers every day. We believe that the success of our business is linked directly to the talent and commitment of our people.  The JPMorgan Chase Modeling and Analytics group is a highly select team of Statisticians, Econometricians, Scientists, and Engineers, combining the best academic credentials and technical capabilities with an applied problem solving mindset.  The orientation and type of problems addressed provide an ideal environment for a modeler to grow professionally and make significant contributions at the same time. What It TakesIn addition to top-tier modeling capabilities, the desired candidate is a critical thinker with a highly confident, analytically passionate, and outgoing disposition. He or she thrives in a high pressure and high expectation environment, where each project assigned to him or her would likely have millions of dollars of impact to the business. Our employees understand the cost benefit relationship between solution sophistication and practicality and strive to produce the fastest yet most accurate and rigorous results. He or she is comfortable and capable of working with senior bank executives, effectively communicating analytical, technical concepts. The Program·         Modeling and Analytics Associates work across the various lines of business within the Consumer and Community Bank, including Mortgage Banking, Consumer & Business Banking, Auto Finance, Card Services, and Capital. ·         Job assignments are determined based on a balance of business needs and employee career interests. Our offices are located in Dallas, Wilmington, Columbus, San Francisco and New York. The projects outlined below offer a glimpse into the types of initiatives within JPMorgan Chase that our PhD hires work on: •       Risk Core Modeling – Work on projects that develop sophisticated models to meet internal and regulatory needs, performing data extraction, sampling, and statistical analysis, documenting the modeling process and model results to business leaders.•       Data Intelligence – Develop models, algorithms & platforms for product recommendations, & content personalization that will enhance the customer experience across the entire spectrum of digital commerce, payment and banking. •       JPMIS Analytics – Intelligent Solutions is the big data Center of Excellence for J.P. Morgan Chase. The data science team brings together some of the financial service industry’s brightest minds to pioneer the development of big data analytics across the firm. •       Retail Analytics – Responsible for providing targeting support to Consumer Bank marketing campaigns through development of models for predicting consumer behavior encompassing acquisition/attrition metrics, cross-sell opportunities, forecasting sales and growth behavior. Take the lead in presentation of model results to business leadership and help maintain a comprehensive library of statistical models along with their documentation.

533.desc: Opportunity: Acquisitions and Development AnalystHHM is seeking an analyst for its Private Equity Investment Platform to analyze, underwrite, and acquire hotels domestically.  The position will report to the Vice President of Acquisitions & Development, and be part of a team with seasoned industry veterans whom have acquired and operated hotels for 30+ years.  Over time, team members may invest along-side the company in deals for personal wealth creation.Potential Career Path	Senior Acquisitions Analyst – Acquisitions Associate – Director of AcquisitionsEssential Job Functions•	Support the execution of hotel acquisitions and development deals.•	Lead financial modeling and due diligence support, working closely with other divisions (Operations, Legal, Accounting).•	Conduct detailed market and feasibility analysis.•	Develop and maintain financial models for existing and prospective investments.•	Coordinate real estate deal structures, including multi-tiered promote structures, mezzanine financing, incentive management fees, and joint ventures. •	Gather operating data and research on industry trends, and prepare presentations for monthly acquisitions meetings and quarterly presentations to the Investment Committee and Board of Directors. •	Follow sustainability guidelines and practices related to HHM’s EarthView program.•	Practice safe work habits. •	Perform other duties as requested by management. Position Requirements•	Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Finance, Real Estate, Business or Hospitality; MBA is a plus, but not required. •	1 to 3 years of progressive experience in hotel acquisitions and development with deep market knowledge.  •	Experience with feasibility analysis and financial structures. •	Strong Excel-based financial modeling skills and proficiency in PowerPoint and MS Word.Work Environment and Context •	Work schedule varies and may include occasional work on nights and weekends.•	Requires standing for extended periods, walking, pushing, lifting up to 25 pounds, bending and reaching, stooping, kneeling, or crouching.Hersha Hospitality Management (HHM) is an industry-leading and growing hotel management, investment, and development firm that provides turn-key management solutions to hotels across the United States.  HHM manages world class brands in the select service and full service markets as well as a collection of independent, boutique hotels in key markets.Hersha Hospitality Trust (HT) is a self-advised Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) that owns interests in hotels in major metro and urban centers along the Northeast Corridor of the United States from Boston to New York City to Washington DC to Miami. The company also owns hotels in popular destinations in the Western US, including Northern California, Los Angeles and Arizona. Hersha focuses on high quality, upscale hotels in historically stable and expanding metropolitan markets.Join the Legacy of Strength!Hersha’s legacy is built upon a strong foundation of core values: honesty, communication, community, personal growth and achievement.  Hersha’s rapid growth, focus on associate development and its commitment to serve our guests, our associates and the local communities we work in, combine to make Hersha associates the strongest in our industry. Serve. Stretch. Succeed.Hersha believes if you serve our guests, your fellow associates and our local community, stretch yourself on the job and take advantage of many promotional opportunities, you will ultimately achieve professional success. As we grow, you grow.

534.desc: Firm Overview:We are an investment management (private equity) firm focusing on long-term (primarily control) investments in the private market. Our senior investment team has a long and successful track record as true private equity investors, and our firm has been built upon critical differentiating advantages proven out over an extensive period, across numerous successful investments and through many economic cycles. Our sole objective is to achieve superior risk-adjusted returns for our investors through a disciplined and deliberate investment approach and a focus on building long-term great businesses through engaged partnerships with executives in industry segments where we possess deep knowledge and extensive relationships.  We are not transaction/deal focused and do not separate transaction/deal professionals from operating professionals or those involved with companies post-investment. As a result, we seek only those who have both (i) experience and interest in true fundamental investing and (ii) deep passion and/or experience/exposure in working with management of operating companies.We provide value to our investments by leveraging our combined strengths of deep industry expertise and proprietary network of relationships and resources generally and particularly in the following core areas:- Multi-channel / direct-to-consumer marketing and retailing- Restaurant / foodservice / hospitality- Franchise-modeled businesses- Marketing services- Business services targeted to healthcare and education providersAs a middle-market firm which is young and also has fully committed funds, we offer a unique opportunity. Entrepreneurial individuals meeting the qualifications will have a chance at a ground floor, high impact, heavy responsibility environment. We are located in New York, NY.Position Summary and Responsibilities:The Associate plays an instrumental role in identifying, analyzing and executing investments, as well as assisting in the support and monitoring of partner companies. The Associate is expected to possess strong financial analysis and modeling skills, effective communication skills, and a genuine curiosity or passion for investing and building long-term great businesses.  Typical responsibilities will include:- Assist in the sourcing, initial screening and execution of potential investment opportunities- Build complex financial models to analyze investment returns and conduct various valuation analyses- Perform industry and company-specific research and analysis in support of the investment idea generation process and the evaluation of new investment opportunities- Draft internal memoranda and investment process materials- Lead financial and business due diligence on potential investments and manage external advisors and consultants- Play an active role in supporting partner company management teams, including identifying new product/market opportunities and assisting with financial planning, as well as identifying and working with management to assess strategically attractive acquisition companies

535.position: Associate Analyst- Equity Research, Technology Sector
535.desc: Columbia Threadneedle Investments, the global asset management subsidiary of Ameriprise Financial, is seeking an Associate Analyst – Equity Research to join the firm in Boston, MA. The ideal candidate will have 2+ years technology sector equity valuation experience in a buy-side or sell-side asset management environment.About AmeripriseFocused on people, not just our bottom line.Here, you'll be part of an inclusive, collaborative culture that rewards you for your contributions. You'll work with other talented people who share your passion for doing great work that's in the best interest of our clients. And you'll have plenty of opportunities to make your mark at the office - and a difference in your community. So if you're talented, driven and want to work for a company that cares, put a rewarding career more within reach at Ameriprise Financial.Responsibilities• This position works with the fundamental equity analyst group performing foundational research activities in support of portfolio management teams and senior analysts.• The role supports senior analysts in the technology sector and can include conducting research studies of industry groups or specific securities and developing quantitative decision-making models.• The person in this role may conduct independent research; attend company meetings, trade shows and conferences as needed.• The incumbent will work under the direction and management of senior analysts within the group.• Over time, the person in this role may be asked to cover specific sectors and make investment recommendations under the supervision of senior analysts.• This is an entry position into the investment research field with the expectation of a career track in equity research for successful candidates.

536.company: Episcopal Diocese of Pennsylvania Youth Ministry
536.desc: City Camp is a summer day camp program sponsored and run by the Episcopal Diocese of Pennsylvania. City Camp seeks to help children, youth, and communities encounter God and connect with the Gospel of Jesus Christ. We do this by building strong networks and providing high-quality camp programs for Episcopal parishes, missions, and schools in the greater Philadelphia area. Counselors further the ministry of City Camp through the delivery of activities and programs.Some duties of Counselors include, but are not limited to:-Working with day camp team to implement and evaluate camp programming-Leading small and large group activities with campers-Providing supervision and care for campers-Developing and maintaining healthy relationships with fellow team members, campers, parents, parish contacts, volunteers, and the host communityAll City Camp staff will live in community at St. Luke's Episcopal Church in the Germantown neighborhood of Philadelphia. In addition to a stipend for the summer, staff also receive room, board, and most meals.For a complete job description and application, visit: www.diopayouth.org/work-at-city-camp.

537.desc: Seeking junior equity analyst summer interns for a $1B Boston-based long/short equity fund focused on the technology, media, and telecom sectors.
