Responsibilities include primary and secondary research on select sectors and equities. Research may include customer interviews, market sizing/analysis, and financial statement analysis/modeling. Timing during the summer is negotiable and has the potential to become a full time position post-graduation. Preference for candidates with a demonstrated interest in the stock market and finance. Position open to rising seniors and select rising juniors.

538.desc: We are looking for someone to help us list the Under 600 Calories Menu for every restaurant or deli in Boston, Chicago, D.C., Los Angeles, NYC, Philadelphia, San Francisco and Seattle, and help us spread the word about www.calospot.com. As mentioned in our company profile, we are looking for smart, motivated college students to help with this exciting expansion. We want people who enjoy being active, care about eating healthy, and most importantly want to help others eat healthy.  This is a great chance to get experience working at the ground level of an exciting startup. The actual requirements of the job might change day to day, so you will be given the chance to wear many different hats and do all different types of work. Join us!

539.desc: Are you passionate about sports and specifically, Basketball? If so, we would love to have you join our Market Research team! The Original Profender, a Sports Training and Skills Development Company based in the Philadelphia area, specializes in the manufacturing of

540.company: The Fund for Public Health in New York
540.desc: Role Summary:The Practice Transformation Specialist will project manage healthcare delivery transformation with healthcare providers and staff at clinics in underserved communities of NYC. Through a combination of on-site visits (about 50% fieldwork and travel), remote visits, and e-mail contact, the Specialist will support practices with redesigning clinic-based care delivery workflows that allow the practice to implement care on a population level, improve patient experience, and transition to reimbursement for better health outcomes.  The New York City healthcare market is undergoing extensive and rapid reform with a focus on improved health outcomes, reduced costs to the system, and population health management. The Specialist is a key driver of this reform, providing boots-on-the-ground technical assistance to healthcare providers through training on Health IT, change management, analytics, and evidence-based clinical processes so they can keep up with new standards of care. If you’re looking for exciting work that moves the needle on patient outcomes, addresses health equity, shapes the future of healthcare delivery, and work in one of the most innovative health departments nationally, then bring your critical thinking skills and ability to process information quickly to this highly public facing and impactful role. Key Responsibilities:•Practice Transformation / Practice Facilitation    o	Manage a caseload of physician practices and support practices as they work on quality improvement projects and practice transformation projects.  Practice transformation projects include work towards practice recognition under the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) Patient-Centered Medical Home (PCMH) program, Centers for Medicaid and Medicare (CMS)’s Transforming Clinical Practice Initiative (TCPI), and Meaningful Use.    o	Apply change management concepts and strategies to ensure sustainability of practice transformation    o	Conduct on-site and virtual (online or on telephone) visits with healthcare providers; document visits electronically; and, collect required documentation for grant funding    o	Analyze and interpret reports to communicate practice progress for both internal and external audiences    o	Provide support for office redesign (e.g., workflows, documentation, standard processes) to improve efficiency    o	Customize the EHR to help practices improve performance and clinical measures    o	Provide training on preventive-health features of the EHR and how to utilize for quality improvement activities•Project Management - develop and maintain project plans, proactively manage issues and risks, facilitate team meetings; and, communicate with manager on project progress•Quality Improvement – facilitate PDSA (Plan-Do-Study-Act) rapid change cycles within practices and quality improvement principles to improve outcomes, patient satisfaction and practice operational efficiencies•Training – develop and deliver presentations and trainings in group settings and via webinars to internal and external audiences•Communication - present ideas and concepts verbally and in writing in a way that fosters learning, collaboration and transfer of skills

541.desc: About UsCrossix provides data-driven solutions for leading healthcare and media companies to plan, measure, and optimize client’s marketing initiatives.  Our proprietary software coupled with our extensive data network allows us to pinpoint how client’s marketing campaigns over digital, TV, website, e-mail, and other platforms are reaching and impacting patient Rx behavior. With deep consumer and healthcare professional expertise, Crossix works closely with our clients to inform strategic business decisions and ultimately, drive improved patient outcomes. As a growing company, we are rapidly expanding our capabilities and looking to hire engaged, analytical thinkers. We have a thriving company culture, offering activities like company softball, happy hours, and special NYC outings. We promote a hardworking environment where employees are able enjoy a work-life balance. At Crossix, we promote a workplace culture where each employee is encouraged to have an opinion at all stages. Founded in 2004, Crossix is headquartered in New York City. To learn more, visit www.crossix.comAnalyst RoleAnalysts quickly gain technical expertise to answer client business questions with actionable data-driven insights. MDAs build experience using analytical language and managing project requirements, and have a meaningful impact on client business outcomes. The role necessitates independent thinking and problem-solving, with the ability to communicate effectively while working closely with a team. The entering class of analysts will receive training and mentorship to develop both technical and industry-specific knowledge. Responsibilities•	Leverage cutting-edge analytics capabilities to help measure and optimize client’s healthcare marketing o	Utilize appropriate analytics to link marketing exposures to transactional datao	Execute project requirements, using a logic-based proprietary language alongside SQL and Excel o	Troubleshoot data anomalies and inconsistencies•	Communicate effectively with internal teams o	Assist in development of project reports and presentationso	Identify key insights and implications, highlighting major storylineso	Participate in product development efforts and company-wide initiatives•	Employ and develop marketing and healthcare knowledge to better assist clientso	Work with senior members to apply insights to quantitative findingso	Communicate effectively with clients and intermediaries as projects requireo	Help provide recommendations to various healthcare and media clients using data-proven insights to  optimize client media campaigns

542.desc: AGC Partners is seeking candidates for their two-year investment banking analyst program with opportunities available in the Boston and San Francisco office locations. AGC Partners is a technology focused investment bank with deep industry expertise in Financial Technology, CleanTech, Software, Tech-Enabled Services, Security, IT Services, Healthcare IT and Digital Media and Internet. Analysts will be exposed to a broad range of transaction types which will focus on mergers & acquisitions and private placements. The primary job function of the analyst position will be live deal execution where analysts will work directly with senior AGC team members and frequently interact with clients. AGC offers a unique opportunity for junior bankers to take on large amounts of responsibility and impact all phases of a deal from inception to close, gaining valuable client-facing experience not available on Wall Street. In addition to deal related responsibilities, analysts will deepen their sector knowledge through Partner specific business development related responsibilities. Analysts will be paired with a Partner to assist them with marketing and business development related objectives: market analysis and research; financial analysis; pitch book preparation; and maintenance of industry M&A activity reports. All incoming analysts will undergo extensive and in-depth training with opportunities for career advancement based on merit. This is a full-time, 6 days/week “at-will” position with a 2-year commitment required.

543.position: Summer Intern Associate, Client & Modeling Solutions
543.desc: Argus OverviewArgus Information and Advisory Services is a Verisk Analytics Company (NASDAQ: VRSK) and the leading provider of analytics, information and solutions to consumer banks and their regulators.  Argus helps its clients maximize the value of data and analytics to allocate and align resources to strategic objectives, manage and mitigate risk (default, fraud, funding and compliance), and optimize financial objectives.  Our professionals have substantial industry knowledge, typically greater than fifteen years of experience, in providing solutions to the financial services sector. We are known for our unique ability to blend the highly technical, data-centered aspects of our projects with expert communication and business knowledge.We maintain offices in New York, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Australia, and London and employ approximately 275 professionals.OverviewArgus Information and Advisory Service offers a 10 week summer internship program geared toward highly analytic juniors or first year master students interested in learning more about the Finance Industry and the work we do.The Summer Intern Associates have similar responsibilities as our full-time Associates and are offered challenging work assignments.  These individuals will shadow full-time Associates while working in small teams and gaining exposure to everyday life at Argus.  These students have the opportunity and potential to join our team as a full-time Associate upon graduation.Responsibilities include:•	Leverage extensive datasets and various statistical software applications to develop and execute strategic quantitative analysis•	Investigate and report on complex data interactions to help identify and address our clients’ key strategic business opportunities •	Create statistical data models to be used as tools in the development of client portfolio strategies Qualifications include:•	Current Junior or first year Master student in statistics, industrial engineering, mathematics, economics, computer science, finance, or related field•	A track record of outstanding academic performance•	Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment•	Demonstrated quantitative and qualitative skills•	Strong communication (written and oral) skills•	Familiarity with SQL and/or SAS or other data mining or statistical software is desired Argus Information and Advisory Services is an equal opportunity employer.

544.position: Summer Intern Associate, Data & Application Solutions
544.desc: Argus OverviewArgus Information and Advisory Services is a Verisk Analytics Company (NASDAQ: VRSK) and the leading provider of analytics, information and solutions to consumer banks and their regulators.  Argus helps its clients maximize the value of data and analytics to allocate and align resources to strategic objectives, manage and mitigate risk (default, fraud, funding and compliance), and optimize financial objectives.  Our professionals have substantial industry knowledge, typically greater than fifteen years of experience, in providing solutions to the financial services sector. We are known for our unique ability to blend the highly technical, data-centered aspects of our projects with expert communication and business knowledge.We maintain offices in New York, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Australia, and London and employ approximately 275 professionals.Opportunity OverviewArgus Information and Advisory Service offers a 10 week summer internship program geared toward highly analytic juniors or first year master students interested in learning more about data-driven analytics, programming,  and the work we do.The Summer Intern Associates have similar responsibilities as our full-time Associates and are offered challenging work assignments.  These individuals will shadow full-time Associates while working in small teams and gaining exposure to everyday life at Argus.  These students have the opportunity and potential to join our team as a full-time Associate upon graduation.Responsibilities include:•	Execute and monitor the core monthly processes required to build and maintain a large data warehouse•	Work with technical teams to determine data requirements and best practices for data manipulation, and analysis strategies•	Program software to meet design and business requirements specificationsQualifications include:•	BS or advanced degree in computer sciences, information systems, engineering disciplines, mathematics or related field•	Strong data analysis skills•	Adept in database technologies specifically Microsoft SQL•	Must have a strong analytic background combined with a keen business understanding •	Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts, both verbally and in writingArgus Information and Advisory Services is an equal opportunity employer.

545.position: Training Program in Restaurant Operations and General Management
545.desc: Hillstone Restaurant Group is a privately-held collection of upscale restaurants with 45+ locations in major cities across the country. Some of our more well-known operations are Houston’s, R+D Kitchen, Bandera, East Hampton Grill, South Beverly Grill, White House Tavern, and Hillstone, and we recently opened properties in Bal Harbor and Santa Barbara.  The uncompromising quality of our food, service, art, and architecture has set the standard in our industry for nearly three decades. Our secret? A progressive management culture unlike any in our industry, in which the craft of managing and developing people is as important as culinary arts itself.Recruiting for: Management Training Program OR Culinary Management Training ProgramKnown for attracting exceptional people who are passionate about service and the culinary arts, our performance-driven environment prepares you to build a rewarding career in hospitality. Your first exposure is an intensive 4 + months of rotational assignments in one of our restaurants.  Because our managers come from all backgrounds and industries, you are not expected to be an expert on day one, but will be given many opportunities within a short period of time to show your strengths. From professional development workshops, to informal mentoring and guidance from your colleagues, we are creating well-rounded restaurateurs who are also savvy businesspeople. Outstanding graduates of our training program can earn the General Manager title in just a few years, and many General Managers in our company earn over $200K per year. Training occurs in Los Angeles, Napa, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Dallas, Phoenix, and New York City, with subsequent assignments in markets all across the country, making relocation flexibility a must for consideration.Our management team search is focused on strong leaders who are dedicated to consistently driving high standards and achieving service excellence. Those who enjoy a small-company-feel, are adept at building relationships, and have a single-minded focus on delivering quality should apply.Email your résumé to Keith.Clancy@Hillstone.com.

546.desc: The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, is an independent, non-partisan, nonprofit organization that combines expertise in research, technical assistance, and demonstration projects to assist leaders in government and civil society, examine justice policy and practice, and improve the systems people rely on for justice and safety. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, and New Orleans, and its projects and reform initiatives, typically conducted in partnership with local, state, or national officials, are located across the United States and around the world. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace.Vera ‘s Center on Immigration and Justice (CIJ) works to address the challenges presented by the convergence of the criminal justice and immigration systems. CIJ works with government, nonprofit organizations, and communities to improve government systems that affect immigrants and their families.  CIJ implements programs and provides technical assistance in addition to conducting applied research related to the various program areas.  CIJ focuses primarily on increasing detained immigrants’ access to legal information and counsel and has conducted research and evaluation studies in areas such as legal orientation services for immigrants and access to justice for vulnerable populations. Vera seeks an enthusiastic and self-motivated individual with a background in social science, a passion for justice and excellent quantitative research skills in data management and statistical analysis to work as a Research Associate on a variety of projects in its Center on Immigration and Justice.  ResponsibilitiesReporting to the CIJ Research Director, the Research Associate will work in close collaboration with research and program staff to perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis for contract reporting to federal funders and other research related to the Center’s ongoing projects. The Research Associate will work closely with the Center Research Director and program staff in carrying out the following duties:•	Merge, manage, and analyze large administrative databases using SQL and SPSS programs; •	Draft data collection instruments;  •	Prepare the statistics sections of reports for government partners and funders;•	Conduct interviews and focus groups;•	Write research proposals and policy briefs; •	Present findings of research, evaluation, and policy analysis to diverse audiences; •	Write and present IRB submissions for research involving human subjects; •	Brainstorm project ideas to build upon past and current work; and•	Assist on other projects and tasks as assigned.

547.company: Ameson Education and Cultural Exchange Foundation
547.position: Educational Ambassador- Ameson Year in China
547.desc: Become TEFL certified, gain professional teaching experience, learn one of the world's most in-demand languages, and improve prospects for graduate school and future employment. Ameson Year in China (AYC) is a unique opportunity for recent college graduates to become Educational Ambassadors by spending a year teaching, learning, and making a difference in public schools across China. Participants experience the challenges and distinct rewards of being immersed in one of the world’s fastest-developing economic and cultural landscapes. Each week, twenty hours are spent teaching, ten hours are spent in the office or in support of students’ activities, and ten hours are spent in collaborative or self-directed pursuits, such as language learning, exploration, and community engagement. Application Deadline: May 31, 2016 Program Highlights: •	5000 RMB (~$800) a month•	7500RMB (~$1,200) Travel Allowance•	Full Legal Status (Chinese Work Visa & Residence Permit)•	TEFL training and certification (free 120-hour course)•	Health insurance•	Chinese language lessons•	Cultural activities arranged by host schools•	Housing (conveniently located)•	Airport pickup and ongoing supportFounded in 1994, the Ameson Foundation is a non-profit, non-governmental organization committed to the advancement of cultural and educational exchange. Its honorary Chairman is Dr. Boutros Boutros-Ghali, the former Secretary General of the United Nations. As the 21st century unfolds, U.S.-China relations continue to become more important. At Ameson, we believe that lasting stability can be achieved through dialogue and exchange. We are seeking future leaders to fulfill that mission.In the spirit of equal opportunity, the Ameson Foundation expressly prohibits discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, disability or genetics.Get more information and apply today on our website: www.goayc.org Check AYC out on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVW6crPwpqMkvz3pyHJanPQContact:AYC - Office of RecruitmentSuite 500, Ronald Reagan Building & International Trade CenterWashington, D.C.202-618-6033Email: goayc@ameson.org

548.desc: We are a small but perfectly formed startup based in Philadelphia. We will give you a chance to work on some great projects and develop your skills in exchange for dedication in doing what you love. You will join a culture that doesn't obsess about how many holiday days you have left and rewards people for their efforts.We enjoy using Macs, 12-foot whiteboard walls, and iPhones at our mobile office. We utilize the ecosystem that technology has created over the past few years, which truly allows us to stay connected, and always in touch. You are free to use whatever you want to get the job done, just always keep in mind: be good or be gone.Role:As a merchandising intern, you will have the opportunity to wear many hats and gain real experience on the ground floor of a growing startup. You will work closely with the Designer Relations Manager and the Fashion Buying team to foster and maintain relationships with designers to keep Showrooms up to date. We can’t promise this internship will be a walk in the park, a matter a fact it could be the hardest thing you ever do! We work hard (lookup “startup hours”). But rest assured, it won’t be running coffee and shining shoes. YOU will be a part of a movement, your input and work will add value to the daily operations, and best of all, you’ll learn more in a day then you will working wherever else your application landed. Responsibilities:-Track and maintain designer inventory, including addition of new products or collections and removal of discontinued items-Organize email correspondence with designers including status of upcoming collections, releases and important events to note-Work in backend to upload designer products and build Showrooms taking relevant trends into consideration-Work hand in hand with designers to build their personal brand story within the Showroom-Help guide designers through all steps of onboarding to becoming active members of the Colabination community-Attend events individually for professional and company development, as well as with the team for networking and growth opportunities -Stay ahead of latest fashion trends, brands, topics, and relevant news to present to management -Take on any future roles and responsibilities with a determined and open mind!

549.desc: Old Mission Capital, a proprietary trading firm with offices in Chicago and New York, is currently recruiting summer interns for the summer of 2016.  Students who intend to graduate (from undergraduate, masters or PhD programs) in 2016 or 2017 are encouraged to apply.  No prior experience in finance is necessary. Responsibilities:Responsibilities include quantitative research, exploring new trading strategies, and developing related software. Interns participate in the firm’s education program, getting a chance to learn about all aspects of trading and financial markets both formally (in classes) and on-the-job. Our New York and Chicago offices collaborate through virtual classes, which are taught by the traders and researchers.  Interns are closely mentored by the firm’s senior traders and developers.Benefits Competitive compensation, casual dress environment, social outings, daily breakfast, lunch, snacks and beverages provided. Successful interns are strongly considered for full-time job offers. How to ApplyVisit our website to apply www.oldmissioncapital.com About Old Mission CapitalOld Mission Capital is a proprietary trading firm that was founded in 2008.   In the competitive world of electronic trading, we use quantitative techniques and advanced technology to identify profitable trading opportunities around the globe.  Our firm is made up of individuals seeking to be part of a team that is constantly striving for improvement and never content with the status quo. Management is committed to the development of our team members and making sure they feel challenged and engaged in the company's growth.

550.company: Ameson Education and Cultural Exchange Foundation
550.desc: The Ameson Education & Cultural Exchange Foundation is seeking an entry-level Regional Program Coordinator for its Ameson Year in China Program (AYC). The Regional Program Coordinator is expected to work full-time hours (approximately 40 hours per week) from the Washington, DC office. This is an exempt position.Duties and Responsibilities:•	Provide administrative and logistical support to the Ameson Year in China (AYC) Program and other programs (as needed);•	Organize and implement on-site and virtual events such as webinars and career fair presentations;•	Promote AYC and Ameson events to media contacts, politicians, community and industry leaders, etc.;•	Assist in managing relationships between Ameson and the international educational exchange community;•	Assist in producing program and conference materials, reports, and resources; •	Support program logistics and event-related duties as needed;•	Recruit Educational Ambassadors for the upcoming AYC Program via career fairs, webinars, and in-person presentations;•	Compile and track a wide range of participant information and program data, maintaining accuracy and completeness;•	Perform research when necessary; and•	Other duties as assigned.TO APPLY: Please submit cover letter and resume to goayc@ameson.org, subject line RPC Position. Only applicants that supply a resume and a cover letter will be considered.  Ameson is an equal opportunity employer. People of color, women, immigrants, youth, LGBTQ and differently-abled people are encouraged to apply!**NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE **

551.desc: The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, is an independent, non-partisan, nonprofit organization that combines expertise in research, technical assistance, and demonstration projects to assist leaders in government and civil society examine justice policy and practice, and improve the systems people rely on for justice and safety. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, Los Angeles, and New Orleans, and its projects and reform initiatives, typically conducted in partnership with local, state, or national officials, are located across the United States and around the world. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace.Vera’s Center on Youth Justice (CYJ) seeks an enthusiastic and self-motivated individual to work as a research associate, versed in both quantitative and qualitative research methods, for a new project to study programs for young adults in jails. The three year project combines quantitative, qualitative, and ethnographic approaches and is based in New York City. The Center on Youth JusticeCYJ works with policymakers and practitioners who want juvenile justice to be rooted in the community, more effective, and smaller in scale, touching the lives of fewer children. CYJ combines research, planning, and technical assistance with substantive expertise in juvenile justice to inform and facilitate the work of policymakers and practitioners nationwide. CYJ’s work focuses on communities most impacted by justice system involvement. A cornerstone of CYJ’s work is its commitment to reducing mass incarceration, reducing racial and ethnic disparities in the justice system, and ensuring the human dignity of incarcerated youth and young adults. Current CYJ projects include ensuring family and youth voice in juvenile justice reform efforts, working in Virginia to improve conditions of confinement, and partnering with parole in Illinois. A particular focus in the coming year is enhancing approaches to young adults (ages 16 – 24) and youth who commit violent offenses.ResponsibilitiesWorking closely with CYJ’s research director and staff, the research associate will: •	Qualitative data design, collection and analysis:o	Design of data collection instruments and surveys as well as diagnosing data capacity with partners;o	Recruit research participants o	Conduct qualitative research through surveys and interviews of juvenile justice stakeholders, incarcerated youth, and their families;o	Conduct observations in local jails; ando	Analyze qualitative data collected through interviews, focus groups, and observations.•	Quantitative data cleaning and analysiso	Manage the collection of administrative data—matching, cleaning, and problem-solving;o	Assist conducting data analysis—descriptive data and multivariate analyses of quantitative data and analyze qualitative data from interviews;o	Provide technical assistance to the project partner on data collection management and analysis•	Assist with the development and writing of research reports, memos, and other written products;•	Supervise and/or mentor junior staff and interns;•	Develop new work on young adults and jails and assist with proposal writing;•	Support the on-going development of the Center’s strategic plan;•	Facilitate meetings with stakeholders;•	Manage project deadlines and budgets;•	Conduct literature reviews and other information gathering; and•	Support the development of sound, data-driven policies as a member of a multidisciplinary team.

552.desc: Financial Services RepresentativeJob Type: 	Financial Sales, Account Management, Financial Planning, Business Development, Business Retirement Plan Design, Consulting, Executive InsuranceLocation: 	First Financial Group, a Member of the MassMutual Financial Group		2 Bala Plaza Suite 901		Bala Cynwyd, PA 19004Contact: 	Mary Ann Patton, VP of Agency Recruiting		mpatton@financialguide.com		610-766-3068 (office)		267-253-2962 (cell)Job Level: 	Full-time, Undergraduate and Graduate Degree, Internships, Co-operativesJob Title: 	Agent & Registered RepresentativeWebsites: 	To learn more about the local agency, visit: www.TheFirstFinancialGroup.com		To learn more about the company, please visit: www.massmutualcareers.com A rewarding career for college graduatesAs a recent college graduate, you’ve already proven that you’re self-motivated and goal-oriented. If you’re interested in a career that rewards hard work and provides the satisfaction of helping people and impacting lives for the better, then a career with First Financial Group/MassMutual may be right for you.   As a Financial Services Representative with First Financial Group, a general agency of Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company (MassMutual), you’ll work with clients to help them find solutions to their financial challenges by recommending appropriate products and services. Working side-by-side with experienced professionals, you’ll be part of a team who will guide you as you learn the business. You’ll have access to a host of tools, resources, and training to develop and sharpen your skills.Job Description As an agent and registered representative, you would be one member on a specialty team responsible for retirement plan and corporate investing.  First Financial Group (FFG) is a dynamic and successful General Agency within MassMutual.  The agency has been voted as Best Places to Work- Philadelphia Business Journal for the 9th consecutive year and Top Places to Work-Philly.com.FFG hosts 120+ agents and is expected to grow at an annual rate of 20% on each of the next 5 years.  MassMutual is a leading multi-national financial services organization and a Fortune 100 company offering individual and business retirement investing, financial planning, estate analysis, insurance, securities brokerage, and group benefits to businesses.  The position entails individual and business needs based planning, social media marketing, networking, written and live correspondence, customer relationship management, data mining, Skype for Business, WebEx, in-person presentations, and input to our operational development.Results-driven compensation and access to a competitive benefits package including medical and dental, life and disability insurance, and thrift and pension plans are available for qualified Financial Services Representatives.  Satisfactorily completing the Life and Health licensure and Series 6 (or series 7) is required.Responsibilities	Prospecting for clients through networking, referrals and business development strategies	Developing and maintaining long-term relationships with clients	Providing financial solutions for clients through fact gathering and needs analyses	Expanding personal knowledge and skills through ongoing professional development and joint work with fellow associates	Correspondence with prospective and existing business clientele	Marketing, social media networking, data mining	Cloud data maintenance	Mutual fund & securities portfolios investment analyses	401k plan design & investment education	Corporate investing	Case preparationQualifications	Strong interpersonal skills 	Presentation and organizational skills	Strong work ethic, self-motivated and goal-oriented	BA, BS, and/or graduate degree or equivalent work experience required	Self-management skills	Moderate or higher experience with MS Office 2013/365	Comprehension of basic financial concepts, strategies, and terminology	Strong communication skills in business correspondence	Good health habits and high energyFinancial Services Representatives are independent contractors and are not employees of MassMutual, its subsidiaries, or of General Agents with whom they contract. Local sales agencies are not subsidiaries of MassMutual or its affiliated companies.About MassMutualFounded in 1851, MassMutual is a leading mutual life insurance company that is run for the benefit of its members and participating policyowners. The company has a long history of financial strength and strong performance, and although dividends are not guaranteed, MassMutual has paid dividends to eligible participating policyowners consistently since the 1860s. With whole life insurance as its foundation, MassMutual provides products to help meet the financial needs of clients, such as life insurance, disability income insurance, long term care insurance, retirement/401(k) plan services, and annuities. In addition, the company’s strong and growing network of financial professionals helps clients make good financial decisions for the long-term.MassMutual Financial Group is a marketing name for Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company (MassMutual) and its affiliated companies and sales representatives. MassMutual is headquartered in Springfield, Massachusetts and its major affiliates include: Babson Capital Management LLC; Baring Asset Management Limited; Cornerstone Real Estate Advisers LLC; The First Mercantile Trust Company; MassMutual International LLC; MML Investors Services, LLC, Member FINRA and SIPC; OppenheimerFunds, Inc.; and The MassMutual Trust Company, FSB.For more information, visit www.massmutual.com or find MassMutual on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube and Google+. 553.desc: Company Description: Established in 1975 out of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Public Financial Management (PFM) is a financial advisor that provides financial consulting, bond pricing, and debt management services to state and local governments and healthcare and educational organizations across the United States. For over thirty-five years, PFM has advised many of the country’s largest municipal and institutional financing programs totaling in excess of five hundred billion dollars. Many of these engagements involve evaluating capital strategy, developing financial and capital plans, debt structuring, complex tax analysis, resource allocation, and capital markets advice. Currently the firm has over 500 employees serving a broad base of public and nonprofit clients from offices located in every region of the country. PFM combines national experience with specialized functional expertise, regional knowledge, and local perspective through the development of individual practices dedicated to serving every client type; including states, municipalities, health systems, universities, and pension funds.  As a financial advisory leader to these organizations, PFM has built a world class reputation for providing clients with independent advisory services, and is consistently among the top rated independent financial advisory firms in the country in almost every major industry in which the firm is active.        Position Summary: PFM is currently seeking an upcoming or recent graduate to serve as an Analyst in our PFM Solutions practice.  PFM Solutions is the premier strategic/financial planning platform for colleges and universities, and other public entities, and unites our clients’ major areas of operation into a single institutional point of view, allowing business officers to quickly analyze the strategic ramifications of operating and capital initiatives.  PFM Solutions supports the institutional strategic planning process by establishing and analyzing relationships among hundreds of interdependent operating variables, which users can manipulate to get a clear view of prospective strategic outcomes. The successful Analyst candidate for the PFM Solutions team will be expected to have an active interest in financial modeling, using both Excel-based and proprietary software solutions. Candidates should be nimble in a fast-paced environment, in which even entry-level Analysts are given significant responsibility.  To be successful, one must have the ability to manage multiple and differing priorities and deadlines, and have excellent verbal communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills for interaction with a diverse group of internal colleagues, senior leaders, clients, and prospects.Core Responsibilities:  The Analyst will work closely with peers and senior managers to service existing PFM Solutions client relationships and assist in business development. Specific responsibilities may include: •	Developing customized spreadsheets and other software solutions to produce time-series financial projections, capital budget analysis, and ratio analysis;•	Managing a portfolio of clients;•	Assisting in the marketing of the PFM Solutions modeling platforms;•	Assisting in management of the business franchise; and otherwise•	Working as an entrepreneurial team mate in building a relatively new businessThe opportunity for client interaction is a key element of the Analyst experience. Additionally, PFM Analysts gain broad exposure to a wide range of financial instruments.

554.company: The Public Relations Group of inVentiv Health
554.desc: We welcome graduating seniors to apply for the Graduate Training Program in our New York and Washington, D.C. offices. This program empowers our new joiners and gives them a foundation to build their skill sets further and involve them more in our way of life!Each Graduate Trainee will participate in a hands-on 9 month training program through our Public Relations/Account Management track. Trainings are run by internal and external trainers, exposing Graduate Trainees directly to our business leaders and shapers. Courses include topics such as our working environment, business etiquette, writing skills, the healthcare industry, research, social media, and more. Relevant work experience/internships and coursework—particularly sciences—is preferred. Throughout the program, the Graduate Trainee will be evaluated on their skills and interest in pursuing a career in healthcare public relations.It is a testament to the success of this program that the majority of our graduates go on to become long standing and valued members of our organization.

555.desc: The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, is an independent, non-partisan, nonprofit organization that combines expertise in research, technical assistance, and demonstration projects to assist leaders in government and civil society, examine justice policy and practice, and improve the systems people rely on for justice and safety. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, and New Orleans, and its projects and reform initiatives, typically conducted in partnership with local, state, or national officials, are located across the United States and around the world. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace.Vera seeks an experienced researcher with a passion for justice and excellent skills in research design and quantitative methods to help lead research projects and program development in its Center on Immigration and Justice (CIJ).  Launched in 2006, CIJ works with government, nonprofit organizations, and communities to improve government systems that affect immigrants and their families.  Vera created the Center on Immigration and Justice to address the challenges presented by the convergence of the criminal justice and immigration systems. Over the last decade, CIJ has developed legal information and services programs and conducted applied research across the U.S., including independent research and evaluation studies with funding from government and scientific agencies and private foundations. Research in the Center on Immigration and JusticeVera is seeking an experienced social science researcher with excellent skills in research design, evaluation and quantitative methods.  Working closely with the CIJ Research Director and research and program staff, the Senior Research Associate will help guide, challenge and inspire a unique center to think about how its work on issues at the intersection of immigration and the justice system can achieve the greatest impact.   CIJ currently has several ongoing programs and studies, including projects in New York City and across the United States.  Funding streams are diverse, including federal contracts from the Department of Justice and grants from private foundations.  CIJ implements programs and provides technical assistance in addition to conducting applied research related to the program areas.  It has focused on two program goals: increasing detained immigrants’ access to legal information and counsel, and improving relationships between immigrant communities and law enforcement officials.Responsibilities:Reporting directly to the CIJ Research Director, the incoming Senior Research Associate will help manage ongoing research studies that employ diverse research methods and help lead the development of the CIJ research program.•	 The Senior Research Associate will be responsible for supervising quantitative data collection and analysis and reporting for rigorous evaluations of innovative federal, state and local programs, as well as overseeing CIJ program data management, analysis and reporting.  •	The Senior Research Associate will also be responsible for identifying, developing and implementing ideas for new research and advancing existing projects at the intersection of immigration and justice.  •	With support from CIJ’s Research Director, the successful candidate will work collaboratively with staff to perform analysis of administrative data, mentor other researchers, manage multiple research projects, prepare and deliver presentations and reports to funders, and write competitive grant proposals, research briefs and academic publications.

556.desc: The Education Program Manager (“Manager”) is a professional position involved in managing the daily activities of the global awareness internet-based educational program – “Global Scholars” operated through Global Cities, Inc. – A Program of Bloomberg Philanthropies (“Global Cities”), a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization established under the auspices of Bloomberg Philanthropies, and headquartered in New York City.  The Manager will be part of a professional team overseeing programmatic operations for the educational program.  In addition, the Manager will support evaluation activities regarding global awareness content and measurements of success in promoting global citizenship, curriculum content mastery, literacy, and technology skills. The Manager will work with the Vice President of Global Cities and the other Education Program Managers in connection with the daily operation of the Global Scholars program in accordance with Global Cities’ Mission and Vision.  Global Scholars provides global awareness curricula to middle school students in participating schools/educational sites around the world through an internet-based platform.  The Manager will be based in Global Cities New York City headquarters, report to the Vice President, and work within a professional team of other Education Program Managers.  RESPONSIBILITIES:•	Assist with the development of original curricula, lesson plans, and materials for Global Scholars within the requisite time frames in advance of each semester; work with educational advisors and other experts to fine tune each curriculum in preparation for effective deployment to the sites•	Coordinate the registration of participating schools/educational sites worldwide as well as the necessary processes to ensure their effective ongoing connection to and participation in the Global Scholars Program; assist in recruitment efforts to promote new enrollments through contacts/meetings with educational administrators domestically and internationally as directed by the Vice President•	Work as part of a team with all the Global Cities staff to manage and maintain the required daily operating functions to support the Global Scholars program in an efficient manner •	As directed by the Vice President, establish and maintain good working relationships with the teachers for each of the sites through telephone/email correspondence, as well as in-person meetings as appropriate; support effective participation of the sites through ongoing communications, updates and outreach•	Provide training and technical expertise to participating teachers, including professional development meetings and other guidance •	Work with the Vice President, the other Education Program Managers and IT experts/vendors to assist in fine-tuning of the internet platform that houses the e-classroom and facilitates the Global Scholars curricula and contacts amongst the sites; oversee the maintenance of the platform to ensure it meets the requirements of the Program and that technical adjustments for sites can be accommodated when possible; assist in implementing improvements to the platform as needed as the Program evolves (no computer programming is required)•	Maintain the class lists, assignments, lesson plans, and other necessary data and information on the internet platform; monitor the content posted to the platform by the sites as appropriate•	Assist with efforts to evaluate the effectiveness of the Global Scholars curricula; specifically its effectiveness in supporting student achievement for mastery of global awareness content as well as literacy and technology skill sets•	Work with the Education Program Managers to create correspondence, updates, evaluation/data reports, program/promotional materials, and other necessary presentations/information as required •	Contribute to the effective fiscal, administrative and recordkeeping management of the Global Scholars Program under Global CitiesThis is a full-time position based on-site in the New York City midtown headquarters of Global Cities.  It is anticipated that work hours will extend beyond the New York City time zone day given the organization’s international constituencies, and will need to be commensurate with work demands.  International travel will be required.

557.desc: AB (formerly AllianceBernstein) is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 500 investment professionals with expertise in growth equities, value equities, fixed income securities, blend strategies, and alternative investments, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB’s research disciplines include fundamental research, quantitative research, economic research and currency forecasting capabilities. Through its integrated global platform, AB is well-positioned to tailor investment solutions for its clients. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors.Technology & Operations Associate Program We established the Technology & Operations Program (TOP) in 2000 to develop our next generation of leaders. During this two-year program for recent graduates, Associates experience four challenging six-month rotations in a particular track or career path, in this case, Infrastructure Engineering, before joining a permanent team. Associates will have the unique opportunity to rotate through many areas of the business gaining exposure and visibility across the firm, while benefiting from formalized training and mentorship.Infrastructure Engineering Rotations at ABAs an Infrastructure Engineering intern, you will work alongside experienced professionals to deliver agile and scalable infrastructure products globally. You will work on projects with real business impact, helping to sustain and improve the technology backbone of AB.Rotational teams include, but are not limited to:+ Information Security Technology+ Networking+ Platform Engineering+ Storage Engineering+ Messaging and Collaboration+ Web Services+ Communications+ Enterprise Systems ManagementWho we think will be a great fit...We’re looking for candidates who demonstrate academic excellence, innovation, leadership potential, technical ability and a passion for learning our business. Candidates will possess the following qualifications:+ December 2015 or May 2016 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree candidates in engineering, computer science or related fields+ Cumulative GPA of 3.3 or higher+ Experience and interest in working with sophisticated technology infrastructure engineering including Linux, UNIX, DBMS (Oracle, MS SQL or Sybase), Networking, and Mobile Computing+ Strong quantitative, analytical and creative problem-solving abilities+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills+ Ability to work in a challenging, fast-paced team-oriented environmentWhat sets AB apart?Besides the best corporate culture on Wall Street…o First-hand experience with innovative technologieso Extensive technical and business trainingo Collaboration with senior executiveso Formal mentorshipo Tuition reimbursemento Active TOP Alumni network and involvemento 1 on 1 career planning and development sessionso Active Employee Resource Groups for you to connect with colleagues with common interests across the firm - including free yoga and running classes each week! More detailsThis position is located in our New York City office with the potential for rotations in White Plains, NY (25 minute express train ride from NYC). Candidates must be willing to work in both offices.To apply, please visit: https://abglobal.gr8people.com/index.gp?method=cappportal.showJob&layoutid=2092&inp1541=&inp1375=7464&opportunityid=7464

As the liaison between business users and technical teams, a Business Analyst translates business needs into technical requirements, manages cross-functional projects and stakeholder communication, and provides training to the users as needed.BA interns are assigned to a variety of teams supporting institutional investors, research analysts, portfolio managers, client relationship managers, traders, wholesalers, and more. Working closely with Senior Business Analysts and Project Managers, you will learn the business and technical aspects of our internal systems, key business processes and AB's products and services.  This is a full-time, 10-week paid internship for college juniors and first-year master's students only. Interns with excellent performance can receive a full-time offer for our Rotational Associate program at the end of the internship!Who we think will be a great fit...We're looking for candidates who demonstrate academic excellence, innovation, leadership potential, technical ability and a passion for learning our business.Candidates will possess the following qualifications:+ December 2016 or May 2017 Bachelor's degree candidates in economics, computer science, operations research, mathematics or related fields+ Cumulative GPA of 3.3 or higher+ Must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident+ Keen interest in project management, particularly with the scoping of projects, capturing and documenting requirements, and defining use cases, user interfaces, and testing scenarios+ Experience with SQL and/or other programming languages is a plus+ Excellent communication and presentation skillsWhat sets us apart?Besides the best corporate culture on Wall Street… o First-hand experience with innovative technologieso Extensive technical and business trainingo Collaboration with senior executiveso Formal mentorship programo 1 on 1 career planning and development sessionso Active Employee Resource Groups for you to connect with colleagues with common interests across the firm - including free yoga and running classes each week!More detailsThis position is located in our New York City office. Candidates must be able to work full-time between June 6, 2016 and August 12, 2016. To apply, please visithttps://abglobal.gr8people.com/index.gp?method=cappportal.showJob&layoutid=2092&inp1541=&inp1375=7468&opportunityid=7468

565.desc: Bronner Group LLC is a premier government consulting firm focused on providing strategy, transformation and accountability services to its clientele across the continent. Based out of Chicago, IL, BRONNER’s expert staff has leveraged trusted relationships and its unique status as a woman-owned business enterprise to deliver the highest level of expertise to its public sector clients. Since its founding in 1987, Bronner has advised hundreds of local, state and federal governments and agencies.Recent Representative Clients Include:•	Chicago Department of Aviation•	Chicago Police Department•	City of Los Angeles•	Birmingham-Jefferson County Transportation Administration•	Metropolitan Water Reclamation District•	New Orleans Recovery School District•	New York City Housing Authority•	Philadelphia Housing Authority•	San Antonio Housing Authority•	State of Georgia•	United States Department of the Interior•	United States Department of Housing and Urban Development•	University of IllinoisBRONNER strongly believes that through combining top-notch management consultants with subject matter experts who have decades of experience in the public sector, that it has assembled the most capable team to provide advisory and implementation services across a variety of areas to an even wider variety of public sector clients.Government Services Consultants at Bronner have the distinct ability to gain a genuine management consulting experience while focusing on delivering tangible services to improve public administration. Government Services Consultants take a significant level of ownership in spearheading projects and proposals, and are viewed as full members of the BRONNER team.  Government Services Consultants help solve complex management and programmatic issues for clients through conducting interviews, leading informed data analysis, identifying key factors and approaches, preparing and delivering presentations, surveying industry standards and travelling across the country as valuable members of their respective project teams.

566.desc: About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what's possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning. To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, the brightest, and the most highly motivated adults we can find. We value excellence, celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.We are looking for an ICT Associate to join our Information and Communication Technology team.Information and Communication Technology (ICT) TeamThe Information and Communication Technology (ICT) team provides a number of support services for all of the Success Academies. In addition to servicing each individual school's on-site network, the ICT department manages and continuously develops the technology infrastructure that is shared by all of the schools. This includes internal websites, some systems administration, and our student information system. Furthermore, the ICT department maintains all of the systems that are deployed to end users and provides initial and ongoing technology training for all teachers and back office staff. During the school year, the ICT department works closely with the Instructional Development team to fully integrate technology into each school's curriculum.Responsibilities:•	Oversee and perform technology support for our growing network of schools and network departments•	Handle and manage the help desk system ticket requests; perform help desk ticket analysis to continuously drive long-term solutions and process improvement•	Performing on-site tech support for all educational technology, including but not limited to, interactive white boards, document cameras, printers, computers, iOS devices, and phones•	Track and assess technology equipment inventory network-wide to maintain efficiency and quality of resources•	Manage and facilitate technology equipment, systems, and resource planning for year-long new hire orientation

567.desc: Job posting: https://www2.apply2jobs.com/UAM/ProfExt/index.cfm?fuseaction=mExternal.showJob&RID=5749&CurrentPage=1Job description: Well-capitalized and highly entrepreneurial, Universal American has been on the cutting edge of healthcare for nearly 20 years. Universal American is a publicly-traded healthcare company listed on the New York Stock Exchange with more than 2,000 employees nationwide and annual revenues of approximately $2 billion. Our family of companies provides health benefits to people covered by Medicare and/or Medicaid. Under our Healthy Collaboration® value-based care strategy, we align incentives between physicians and our members’ total quality health outcomes.For 2016, we have expanded our Today’s Options® Medicare Advantage plan into the mid-Hudson Valley region of New York State, including Westchester, Putnam, Dutchess, Ulster, Rockland and Orange counties. This plan is based on the Healthy Collaboration model and includes partnerships with key physician multi-specialty groups in the mid-Hudson Valley region.We are seeking to hire a new Market Manager to oversee existing and new contractual relationships with network providers in the mid-Hudson Valley service area. This new position will play a key role in building and running our Today’s Options® plan in downstate New York. Key activities include conducting outreach and contracting with physicians, inpatient hospitals and ancillary providers; delivering Healthy Collaboration financial reporting to physician partners under value-based arrangements; and managing the health plan network to strategic goals. Responsibilities:• Responsible for coordinating the development of professional, effective relationships with area hospitals, physicians and ancillary providers.• Assist in the development and implementation of network strategies including selection of quality, cost-effective providers.• Maintains the requisite skills to use claims data and an understanding of healthcare delivery processes to identify low value patterns in care and formulate strategies for redesign and improvement. • Plan, develop and manage network physician incentive program budgets under our Healthy Collaboration® model. • Train, support and assist provider network physicians to achieve targets and benchmarks set forth in the Healthy Collaboration® physician incentive programs to drive plan performance. • Develop and maintain a close, effective working relationship with all UAM corporate and shared services departments.• Travel throughout regional area to meet with network providers, problem solve, and sustain key relationships. • Comply with all guidelines established by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) and guidelines set forth by other regulatory agencies, where applicable, and defined in the Universal American Corporate and department policies.• And all other duties assigned by the manager and/or supervisor.Required Skills: • Highly motivated self-starter with a track record of interest and experience in healthcare and managed care services. • Excellent analytic skills and attention to detail including interpretation and analysis of departmental, utilization, financial and operations data.• Excellent interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate thoughts and ideas. • Customer service skills with the ability to interact professionally and effectively with providers, third party payers, physicians, and staff from all departments within and outside the Company. • Organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and/or projects at one time. • Must display a track record of producing work of excellent standards that is highly accurate, demonstrates attention to detail, and reflects well on the organization.Universal American Corp. is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate because of age, color, disability, ethnicity, marital or family status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, military veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to attracting, retaining and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce.

569.desc: Doyle Real Estate Advisors, a full-service research, appraisal, and legal consultancy in Philadelphia, is seeking an intern for the spring semester, with the possibility of employment continuing through the school year and beyond. 570.company: United States Marine Corps Officer Selection Station Philadelphia
570.position: United States Marine Corps Judge Advocate
570.desc: United States Marine Corps Judge AdvocateTo practice law is a privilege.  To practice law as a Marine Officer is a distinction reserved for the few who have what it takes, mentally, morally and physically, to become a leader of Marines.  If you prove yourself worthy, you will not only serve in the field of law, but you will serve your country as an officer in the United States Marine Corps.  Job Description: As a Marine Corps Judge Advocate, you will immediately be given the responsibilities of maintaining your own caseload and advising Marines on legal issues.  Additionally, the training you receive as a Marine Corps Officer will prepare you to be a leader from day one.  While most new civilian attorneys are relegated to research duty on cases tried by others, you will be building your skills and acquiring real legal experience in the courtroom.As a Marine Corps Judge Advocate, there are many areas of specialty in which you may practice law:	- Trial Attorney: While assuming duties as prosecutor, defense counsel or litigator you will try cases before a military judge or a jury of Marines and/or naval personnel.  You may also argue cases before the Navy-Marine Corps Court of Criminal Appeals or the United States Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces.	- Civil Law/Legal Assistance Attorney/In-House Counsel: As you gain experience you may transition into these specialties to write ethics opinions and research issues pertaining to Environmental, Fiscal, Government Contracting, Labor and Employment and other legal matters.	- Operational Law Attorney: You may deploy with Marine operational forces where your responsibilities could include handling Rules of Engagement, Laws of War, Military Justice, Host Nation Justice and a variety of other legal issues.   Requirements:Being a Marine Corps Officer requires the drive to succeed and dedication to your profession.  This is exemplified by our core values of honor, courage and commitment.  Your training will test you physically, mentally and morally to ensure that you have what it takes to lead Marines and serve as a Judge Advocate.  Most of all, it requires leadership abilities and the desire to accept the challenge of becoming a Marine.  Benefits: Salaries for judge advocates are competitive with starting civilian pay.  In addition, you will have the opportunity to travel and the time to enjoy it.  Unlike in most civilian careers, the Marine Corps grants 30 paid vacation days every year in addition to federal holidays.  Furthermore, you will be afforded the opportunity for further education and advanced training through programs while on active duty and the GI bill following your service.  You and your family will also enjoy other benefits, like free medical coverage, housing and subsistence allowances and generous retirement pay while you are still young enough to enjoy it.  Are you ready for the challenge?To find out more information about the Marine Corps Judge Advocate program visit  http://www.marines.com/being-a-marine/roles-in-the-corps/command-element/judge-advocateTo speak to your Officer Selection Officer directly call Officer Selection Office Philadelphia at (215)- 238-0477.

571.company: United States Marine Corps Officer Selection Station Philadelphia
571.desc: Full Time Position:Few can be Marines… Even fewer can lead them.The threats of our time come in many forms; Marines are called upon to confront them.  As a Marine Officer, you will lead the few who are dedicated to facing the world’s monumental challenges head-on, and you will have the opportunity to impact the lives of many.The Marine Corps offers college graduates the opportunity to attend the ten-week Officer Candidates School (OCS) in Quantico, VA.  Here you will be tested, physically, mentally and morally to see if you have what it takes to become an officer of Marines.  If you successfully complete our training, you will be offered a commission as a United States Marine Officer upon graduation.  There is no obligation to accept the commission; the decision is up to you.    As a Marine Officer you will be afforded leadership and management opportunities that are far beyond what most young adults experience.  You will be the face of American foreign policy at the point of impact, leading 40 Marines in disaster relief, humanitarian assistance, and overseas contingency combat operations.  You will give four years to your country in return for a lifetime of experience.Become a Marine Officer and lead an elite force dedicated to bringing hope, justice and freedom to communities around the world.  The leadership qualities instilled in you will guide you as a Marine and throughout your life.  Ready for the challenge? Contact Marine Officer Selection Station Philadelphia at (215)-238-0477, or go to our website at www.marineofficer.comThe Marine Corps is currently accepting applications for both ground and pilot positions. Ground jobs include 25 different specialties such as intelligence, infantry, communications, engineering and logistics.  As a pilot, you'll be assigned to fly an aircraft such as the F-18 Hornet, our current fighter jet; the MV-22 Osprey, which combines fixed-wing and rotary-wing flight; or the high-tech AH-1Z Super Cobra attack helicopter.

572.company: United States Marine Corps Officer Selection Station Philadelphia
572.desc: Full Time Position: Marine Corps Pilot / Naval AviatorThe threats of our time come in many forms; the Marines are called upon to confront them.  Marine Pilots must be ready to fly over hostile territory at Mach 1 speeds hugging the earth at 500 feet.  They must coordinate with ground troops to provide precise support from above.  The must be prepared to airlift Marines in and out of combat zones. But most of all, they must be ready to meet the standards of becoming a United States Marine.The Marine Corps operates one of the largest air forces in the world, yet also its most elite.  If you complete your training here, you will achieve a distinction far greater than that of a pilot.  You will find a sense of purpose that only Marines know, and wear. As a Marine Officer, you will lead the few who are dedicated to facing the world’s monumental challenges head-on, and you will have the opportunity to impact the lives of many.The Marine Corps offers programs both for current students and college graduates.  If selected, you will have the opportunity to attend Officer Candidates School (OCS) in Quantico, VA.  Here you will be tested, physically, mentally and morally to see if you have what it takes to become an officer of Marines.  If you successfully complete our training, you will be offered a commission as a United States Marine Officer.  There is no obligation to accept the commission; the decision is up to you.    The Marine Corps is currently looking for those who have what it takes to become a Marine pilot.  As a pilot, you'll be assigned to fly an aircraft such as the F-18 Hornet, our current fighter jet; the MV-22 Osprey, which combines fixed-wing and rotary-wing flight; or the high-tech AH-1Z Super Cobra attack helicopter.  As a qualified applicant, you will be guaranteed aviation once you have been selected for the program.  More importantly, you will be tested both mentally and physically until you find within yourself the ability to lead, inspire and accomplish any goal you set your mind to, both in the air and in life.Ready for the challenge? Contact Marine Officer Selection Station Philadelphia at (215)-238-0477, or go to our website at www.marineofficer.com

573.desc: This position as a Financial Analyst in Private Equity is based at the New York, NY office of Triago, an international private equity advisory services firm headquartered in Europe.This position is intended as a first permanent job experience upon graduation from UPenn with a bachelor's degree class of 2016 (from Arts & Sciences, Wharton, Huntsman Program or Fisher Program). Secondary Transfers of Private Equity Fund Interests- Analyze portfolios of PE funds including valuations- Assist team members in their monitoring of potential sellers of PE stakes3. Strategic Advisory for Private Equity Firms- Assist strategic advisory practice Partners in their daily tasks- Market research and peer group analysis- Assist in preparation of client deliverablesFluency in French is an advantage but not a requirement.Prior experience in private equity is not required but prior internships in the financial sector in general are an advantage.

574.desc: Susquehanna Growth Equity Private Equity Summer AnalystAs a Private Equity Summer Analyst, you will work closely with our senior deal professionals at every stage of the investment process, from sourcing to execution. This opportunity offers a comprehensive introduction to private equity investing within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. You will quickly gain valuable experience as you develop robust financial models, network with industry entrepreneurs, and evaluate potential investments in new industries. Exceptional summer analysts will be considered for full-time opportunities at SGE, contingent on graduation. Specific Job Duties•	Building detailed financial models to evaluate investment opportunities •	Analyzing financial statements of active and prospective investments•	Performing market research and industry analysis of companies within the technology sector•	Constructing presentation materials for the firm and its portfolio companies•	Supporting new acquisitions post-investmentIntern Perks•	Free housing is provided and conveniently located near SIG at the University of Pennsylvania•	Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm and shorts all summer long•	Game room with golf simulators, game tables (poker, pool, ping pong, etc.), multicade classics video games, and Play Station/X-Box video area •	A 9,000 square-foot gym with cardio, cross fit and strength machines, plus yoga and indoor cycling classes•	Social events such as a poker tournament, dinners in Philadelphia, and sporting events•	Discounts for shopping, travel, dining, entertainment, and attractions•	On-site services such as dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, barber, and ATMTo learn more about our opportunities and apply, visit sig.com/campus and click on Career Opportunities.About Susquehanna Growth EquitySusquehanna Growth Equity (SGE) is a private equity fund focused on growth capital and buyout opportunities in the United States, Europe, and Israel. The firm is focused on software/SaaS, data, internet, healthcare technology, and financial technology and has invested in 30 platform companies since 2006, currently managing over $500 million in assets as it invests out of its fourth fund.SGE approaches the market with a core thesis that the ongoing electronification of transactions and information will transform businesses across industries. As investors, the firm identifies and works with companies offering the innovations and solutions driving this trend. To learn more about SGE’s investment approach, team, and portfolio, visit www.sgep.com.

575.desc: As a software engineering intern, you’ll work alongside our experienced software engineers on the development, delivery, support and enhancements of our trading systems and infrastructure. You will have the chance to work on challenging projects that will be pushed into production. In addition, throughout the summer you’ll meet with senior technologists to learn about SIG technology and how it impacts trading.Our Interns Have:• Created a suite of tools to improve the efficiency of performance data• Improved the visual display of market data in Python/C#/F#• Contributed to the development of high performance low level C++ code for handling the first steps of our market data processes• Conducted technology research projects related to scale and performance with open source tools• Contributed to studies of equity trading and markets by developing and using large sets of trade and price dataSIG Perks• We’ll set you up in campus apartments with other summer interns at the University of Pennsylvania• You’ll join SIG employees in social events such as dinners, sporting events and an intern poker tournament• You can use our recently expanded gym for workouts or fitness classes (even at night and on weekends)• Hang out in our game room that includes golf simulators, pool tables and classic video games• We’re relaxed – you can wear jeans and sneakers every day and shorts in the summer • You can visit our fully stocked kitchens for drinks, snacks, and breakfast. Enjoy our catered lunches every day• Explore Philadelphia using discounts to local restaurants, museums, travel and other attractions• We want to make your life easier so take advantage of our on-site services including the barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and moreTo learn more about Technology at SIG, go to www.sig.com/technology.What We Do:SIG is a trading firm that uses the latest technology to build systems that drive our success in the markets. We rely on ingenuity, collaboration and flexibility in our engineering methods and priorities.  When we design our systems, we focus on every layer of the stack. Experts in networking, platform, security, and software work together to build our high performance software solutions.

We rely on ingenuity, collaboration and flexibility in our engineering methods and priorities.  When we design our systems, we focus on every layer of the stack.
