598.desc: Who are we?MM.LaFleur is a fast-growing fashion tech start-up based in New York City, founded by two former management consultants and the former head designer at Zac Posen. We aim to be the wardrobe solution for all professional women, creating luxury apparel and accessories at affordable price points that are delivered via a seamless, direct-to-consumer stylist experience.No, but really, who are we?We’re a group of individuals passionate about redefining the way women shop and dress for work. We have a validated market and die-hard fans, a quickly growing revenue stream, and a whip-smart and energetic team. We take our work very seriously, but never ourselves. We are as inspired by a beautiful work of art as we are by a compelling data model. We are perfectionists who sometimes spill on our clothes. We pull together profitable pop-up stores in a matter of days. Our customers send us baked goods and baby photos. We love dogs, whiskey, and em dashes. During New York Fashion Week, we drive around a donut truck. We truly believe we can do it better and faster and smarter and have more fun.Who are you?You are a college student who wants to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial fashion environment where you can get a taste of everything. No task is above or below you, and everything from design to logistics is exciting. You’re eager to learn about the inner workings of the Garment District, the fashion industry, and an e-commerce start-up. Above all, you are thoughtful in every sense of the word: you think strategically and critically, and also demonstrate enormous consideration for the needs of our coworkers and customers.What will you do? - Events and Marketing- Planning and assistance for VIP events (e.g. trunk shows, corporate partnerships, pop-up stores)- Social media strategy and content creation (e.g. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.)- Research for events and marketing strategy- Design and Development- Assistance with sampling and production of garments- Quality control- Operations and Customer Experience- Direct interaction with customers, both online and offline- Placing and processing orders, especially as pertaining to Bento Box orders- Inventory tracking	Compensation: Internship is unpaid, but interns will receive a monthly subway pass for transportation. Interns can receive college credit if applicable.A commitment to growth:  We're a start-up, which means we're focused on one thing – growing – and we want you to join us for the ride. Help us become a company that is truly loved by purposeful women across the world, and the opportunities for you are endless. The more you prove, the more you'll get to own.

599.desc: Are you motivated by ideas and learning? Do you consider yourself to be intellectually curious? At CEB, we are seeking undergraduate Research Analyst Interns to join our Washington, D.C. area global headquarters.   As an Intern, you will contribute to the firm’s success through researching and analyzing strategic, business, and operational challenges affecting C-level executives all across the globe.   Join a Company Distinguished by its Insights.During your 10 weeks at CEB, you will work with mentors, and engage in training designed to acquire key analytical and business skills that can contribute to your success in your future career.  As an Intern at CEB, you will quickly build cross-industry business expertise.  Your research will examine common challenges faced by business leaders, uncover effective solutions, and enable those business leaders to take action.  Many interns continue to make an impact as full-time Analysts after graduation due to their hard work and development across the summer. Hear from our former Interns about making a difference. How Do Research Analysts Interns Make an Impact?•	Use analytical tools, such as root cause analysis, to identify the drivers of global business problems, create hypotheses regarding solutions, and develop a testing plan. •	Shadow interviews with senior executives from large organizations, academics from top universities, and industry experts.•	Synthesize information from wide-ranging secondary literature searches and proprietary data sources to produce key business insights.•	Contribute multiple research projects, generating outputs business leaders can use to improve their organization’s performance, such as best-practice studies, benchmarking reports, blog posts, articles, webinars, presentations, training materials, diagnostics, tools, and white papers. •	Support the Research team by scheduling member interviews, participating on calls with prospective and current members, responding to research inquires, coordinating meetings and webinars, and preparing research materials and summaries.

600.desc: Associate Veterinarian needed for a well established four veterinarian small animal/avian/exotic AAHA practice located in Central New York. A progressive practice providing state of the art medicine, in a well equipped hospital, with a friendly, well trained support staff. No after hours or emergency coverage required. Excellent local recreational and cultural opportunities. Located near the Adirondack Mountains and the St. Lawrence Seaway. Competitive compensation package. Excellent opportunity for an experienced veterinarian or new graduate. Send or fax resume to Dr. Karen Leshkivich, Mattydale Animal Hospital, 2703 Brewerton Road, Syracuse, New York 13211, phone (315)455-5915, fax (315)455-9056.

601.desc: Our firm will provide you with the opportunity to actively participate in the real world of management consulting. As a MFR Consultant:  You'll perform a full range of functions-field interviews, data analysis, solution brainstorming, presentation crafting and delivery-on case assignments that range from business unit strategy to marketing, and IT.  You will work directly with the MFR teams and clients to solve business problems and create change. As a Consultant with our firm, you'll have the opportunity to work on projects that will involve:  �Growth Strategies:  market opportunity analysis, new market entry strategies, M&A evaluation, business case development, competitive analysis. �Strategic Alignment:  customer segmentation, go-to-market strategies (e.g., pricing strategies, channel alignment), post-merger integration, organizational alignment.�Corporate Initiatives:  corporate sponsored business plan support, strategic best practices. The consulting work requires strong problem solving and customer, competitor, market and channel analytical skills.  This includes strong project management and relationship building skills and the ability to interact effectively with our clients is critical.  Primary responsibilities include:� Analyzing, designing and implementing business process improvement strategies for our clients and developing an array of solutions to improve business performance issues.� Assisting in the research, development and implementation of strategic marketing concepts for our clients.� Assisting in the research, writing, and editing of reports and other materials. � Assist with obtaining background information for projects through research, focus groups and interviews. Also defining user requirements �  Work as part of the MFR in-house consulting team to analyze and advise MFR on market positioning and on increasing our competitiveness in the Philadelphia / Northeast Corridor market.

602.desc: Machine Learning EngineerFitly Inc. Philadelphia, PAJob Location: Los Angeles, CAStart Date: Immediate hireExpected Salary: $100,000-$150,000 + Benefits, Bonuses, & Equity OwnershipFull-Time PositionFitly, the creator of SmartPlate, is looking for an extraordinary expert in the field of machine learning.About SmartPlate    SmartPlate is the world’s first intelligent plate that instantly analyzes your entire meal.  We deploy deep learning algorithms, image recognition, and load sensors to identify, weigh and analyze food items within seconds. SmartPlate will enable users around the world to make well-informed dietary decisions, and will have a substantial positive impact on their health. Our technology has received overwhelming interests from top healthcare organizations, elite athletes, diabetes institutes, and many communities living with chronic diseases related to poor nutrition.    We are looking for one passionate and creative machine-learning expert with an interest in deep learning and computer vision to accelerate the development of SmartPlate.    At Fitly, you are encouraged to solve problems creatively. You will have a say in what you do and how you do it. You will work with internationally recognized researchers to develop novel algorithms and modeling techniques to advance the state-of-the-art image recognition. You will gain hands-on experience working in a dynamic startup, and your work will have a direct and positive impact on the health of people around the world.    Our mission is to help millions of consumers eat healthy, lose weight and improve physical performance. If you want your life’s work to be used for the good of humanity, join us.  Google can wait. ☺Your Responsibilities:•	You will be diving into complex real-world food image data to produce innovative image analysis models.•	You will utilize your creativity to identify techniques that improve the speed and accuracy of our image recognition technology.•	You will collaborate with experts to solve technical problems using a broad spectrum of data science tools, packages and visualization techniques.•	You will perfect your knowledge and expertise in the big data ecosystem to build efficient and scalable analytical solutions.What we offer:•	Base salary, plus bonus and stock options.•	Comprehensive health coverage.•	Generous Paid Time Off policy.•	Work from home time.

603.position: Paralegal, U.S. Attorney's Office, EDNY, Criminal Division, Business & Securities Fraud Section
603.desc: Paralegal, United States Attorney's OfficeEastern District of New York, Brooklyn, New YorkThe United States Attorney’s Office is accepting applications for paralegal positions in its Business and Securities Fraud Section. The expected start date is between June and August 2016.The Business and Securities Fraud Section investigates and prosecutes criminal cases, with a focus on fraud involving publicly-traded companies, corporate executives, hedge funds, investment advisers, broker-dealers, insider trading, market manipulation, offshore tax havens and violations of the foreign corrupt practices act and the false claims act.Paralegals organize and maintain case files, review documents and assist in the preparation of cases for trial. Paralegals have the opportunity to attend trials and other court proceedings, as well as observe witness interviews and internal strategic planning sessions. The positions are excellent opportunities for recent graduates who are considering a legal career.Applicants must have a B.A., will acquire one by June 2016, or have a similar degree. They should have a strong academic record, excellent organizational skills, an ability to work well with a group and an interest in the law. Please include any prior legal training and/ or work experience in the legal field, if any. Applicants should expect to work more than eight hours a day and outside of traditional office hours, on occasion, in order to prepare for, and assist at, trials. Applicants should be prepared to commit to stay in the position for two years. The anticipated hourly rate is approximately $17 an hour, with potential of earning approximately $22 an hour with time in.All positions are subject to funding availability and security clearance. Applicants must be citizens of the United States. Applicants must pass a background investigation, including a drug test and credit check, before an offer will be extended. Male applicants born after December 31, 1959 must demonstrate either that they have registered with the Selective Service or that they are exempt from doing so.The United States Attorney's Office does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, membership in an employee organization, or other non-merit factor.Applicants should send a resume and cover letter to bsfparalegal@usdoj.gov. No telephone calls, please.

604.desc: The Capital Teaching Residency (CTR) is a nationally recognized, highly selective teacher training program that provides a pathway for new teachers to develop into outstanding educators prepared to serve in high-need schools in Washington, D.C.CTRs make a commitment to teach for a minimum of three years in D.C. Residents spend the first year of this commitment—their residency year—training in a classroom with a highly effective mentor teacher at KIPP DC or E.L Haynes (high-performing D.C. public charter schools). During their residency year, CTRs learn the teaching profession through a gradual release model supported by their mentor teacher and school leaders, as well as certification coursework and other professional development.  CTR trains residents in contents areas with the greatest need for effective teachers in D.C.: Early Childhood Education, Elementary Education, Secondary Math Education, Secondary Science Education, and Secondary English Language Arts. Residents are an integral part of the school community at KIPP DC and E.L. Haynes as they slowly increase their teaching responsibilities.  After completing their residency, CTR alumni remain in the classroom and continue to teach at E.L. Haynes, KIPP DC, or partner public charter schools across the DC Metro area for another two years.  During the two years following the residency year, the CTR program continues to provide graduates with formal and informal support and professional development. Key Responsibilities:•	Participate and contribute as a member of his/her particular school community•	Attend all school level professional development (PD) sessions•	Attend all PD and certification coursework specific to area of training •	Attend CTR specific whole-group PD (scheduled on designated week nights, as well as one Saturday per month) •	Track, analyze, and use data to drive teaching and instruction•	Participate in weekly meetings with mentor/host teacher•	Participate in goal setting, observations, and debrief meetings with school leader•	Participate in mid-year and end-of-the year evaluations by school leaders, based in part on the ability to raise student achievement•	Implement feedback from observations by school leaders and mentor teachers into classroom practice•	Conduct purposeful observations of mentor and other excellent teachers•	Take and pass all required certification exams

605.position: Elementary School SETSS Special Education Teacher
605.desc: OverviewOur Elementary School SETSS Special Education Teacher position is an opportunity for individuals who are results-driven educators, passionate about transforming education in New York City public schools. Our Elementary School SETSS Special Education Teachers help drastically move student achievement through targeted, results-oriented, and high-quality literacy and math instruction.About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Our schools rank in the top 1% in Math and top 3% in English among all New York State schools, while serving children with an overall poverty rate of 77%. We also act as a catalyst and model for education reform nationwide so that all kids can have access to high-quality schools. Success Academy Charter Schools are dedicated to academic excellence, character development, and extracurricular achievement with college graduation as an end goal. In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning.  We also pride ourselves on developing a truly cohesive school community of parents, teachers, leaders, staff, and scholars. We require parents to be active participants in their child’s education and school-wide events, and we hold the entire school community accountable to the same high level of expectations. We believe all children can achieve at extremely high levels, and we believe this starts with the dedication of exceptional and diligent adults. We are building a movement to transform public education. It’s no easy feat, but we can promise it will be one of the most rewarding. ResponsibilitiesOur Elementary School SETSS Special Education Teacher will:•	Join a groundbreaking faculty of teachers who are committed to closing the achievement gap and raising the bar for all children. •	Adapt and differentiate small group instruction for students with special needs, incorporating both push-in and pull-out strategies.•	Assist colleagues in understanding various student disabilities and the appropriate academic and behavioral modifications.•	Prepare student individualized education plans in consultation with staff and families to ensure success for all scholars.•	Engage students through curriculum that reinforces the fun of learning and enables struggling students to thrive.•	Benefit from weekly leadership-led professional development sessions, including grade-team planning meetings, training on classroom management and curriculum, sessions devoted to studying student work and using it to action plan. •	Receive in the moment feedback and support from the school leadership team.

606.desc: Colony Capital, Inc. is a leading global real estate and investment management firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California with 14 offices in 10 countries. Prior to its combination with Colony Financial, Inc. in 2015, Colony Capital, LLC sponsored $24 billion of equity in a variety of distinct funds and investment vehicles that collectively invested over $60 billion of total capital. The Company targets attractive risk-adjusted investment returns across a broad range of predominantly real estate equity and debt oriented investment strategies. Colony is headquartered in Los Angeles, with offices in New York, Boston, Scottsdale, London, Madrid, Paris, Rome, Beirut, Hong Kong, Seoul and Taipei.JOB SUMMARY:This position will provide general support to members of the acquisition and asset management team in connection with new investment opportunities and current assets under management. This internship offers an opportunity for a strong candidate to gain immediate deal experience and exposure to a world-class network of real estate professionals.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:•	Playing a key supporting role in analyzing new investment opportunities•	Conducting a range of quantitative and qualitative analyses (e.g. strategy assessments, market analyses, financial modeling, company valuations, etc.)•	Analyzing and monitoring the performance of existing investments•	Assisting with the preparation of investment proposals and presentationsQualifications:•	Sophomore and Junior Undergraduate Students•	Strong GPA from a top-tier university (preferably business major with an emphasis in finance or real estate)•	Strong work ethic•	Strong interest in the real estate private equity industry•	Outstanding quantitative skills, including strong Excel skills•	Strong financial modeling, finance, and accounting skills, with superior attention to detail•	Results oriented, self-motivated, proactive work habits•	Superior communication and interpersonal skills•	Ability to work effectively and independently in a world-class investment organizationThis job description represents the basic qualifications for the position.  Colony strongly prefers local candidates or those with prior plans to relocate.  Please note that Colony does not pay for relocation expenses.  All qualified candidates will be contacted directly.  No phone calls please. Colony offers excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision, LTD, life, paid parking, and 401(k). Please visit www.colonyinc.com for more information about our company. Please send your resume to humanresources@colonyinc.com Also, please reference in subject line: Summer Internship 2016.

607.desc: COMPANY OVERVIEWPARTNER WITH US AND SEE YOUR CAREER GROW!Are you ready to launch a career and not settle for just another job? Do you see yourself managing your clients and their expectations complete with all of the challenges, financial rewards, and personal satisfaction that such an enterprise can bring? If so, you owe it to yourself to consider a career with New York Life Insurance Company as your partner.BRING YOUR FINANCIAL ADVISOR/ SERVICES PROFESSIONAL CAREER TO LIFE:Manage your own work schedule and establish an attractive work/life balanceLeverage New York Life’s extensive personnel resources and technological toolsWork independently- with the opportunity to be in business for yourself but not by yourselfPartner with a leading company in agent development, as indicated by our 50-plus years of leadership in qualifying members for the prestigious Million Dollar Round Table*Enjoy continuous personal and professional growth with a wide range of paths as an agent and or manager.Qualify for the opportunity to follow a clearly defined path into financial management throughout the companyAchieve your financial goals based upon your abilityRealize benefits of a financial compensation program that helps put you in control and provides for your retirement with a traditional pension planMake a difference in your community by providing financial security and peace of mind to the families and businesses that you will serve through New York Life’s products and services

608.desc: Front End Web DeveloperMOD Worldwide – Philadelphia, PAKeep it creative.Are you developed enough?We need the dreamers who cannot stop dreaming, the rebels who consider rule books To-Do-Lists. Not salmon swimming upstream but piranhas climbing Angel Falls.  Someone who’s seen pigs fly, who is strikingly original and just happens to be a front end web developer.RESPONSIBILITIES:• Work with designers to give form and functionality to our vision.• Staying up-to-date on the latest industry technology.• Experimenting with side projects for the agency brand and fill them with your personal creativity.• Start to finish involvement with our projects—anything from branding a pharmaceutical company, creating a website for a luxury condominium or building an interactive experience for an international fashion house.

609.position: Greener Partners Farm Education Internship- Summer
609.desc: Greener Partners’ Farm Education Internship gives young adults the chance to gain hands-on experience with implementing food education with elementary-age students.  Our Farm Explorer is a mobile farm that travels to schools and community sites, giving children the opportunity to connect with where food comes from, even if they don’t have access to a community garden or can’t visit a farm.  Our Farm Explorer Truck is equipped with pullout garden beds that contain 25-40 different living, edible plants, plus a simple, mobile kitchen. Each lesson includes activities centered on gardening and ecology, as well as harvesting food and cooking, all while incorporating information about healthy eating.  During the summer months, we use our Farm Explorer Truck to teach at a variety of camps and events in the five counties of the Philadelphia region.  The Farm Explorer Intern may participate in the following activities:Farm Explorer Program Support – Farm Explorer programming involves two educators at each visit.  Each educator has – at minimum – a B.A., years of experiential education and classroom teaching, growing experience, and has worked with GP for at least one school year.  The Farm Intern will serve as the third educator; over the course of the internship, the intern will move from observation and assisting with cooking and science activities to leading parts of lessons.  Sample intern responsibilities could include: •	Setting up and breaking down lesson equipment •	Assisting with cooking preparation and demonstration •	Supporting lead educator with plant-based science demonstrations and lessons Growing Support – Over the summer, there is more to do growing and maintaining our vegetable and fruit containers for programming. The Farm Education Intern may help with growing food at our urban farm in North Philadelphia, either for the Farm Explorer Truck or for the other educational garden spaces in the garden. .  Sample Intern responsibilities could include: •	Planting, transplanting, thinning and weeding•	Building and repairing growing technologies like low tunnels or trellises •	Harvesting and preparing garden produce for lessons

610.desc: ActionAIDS is a nonprofit organization that is on the cutting edge of local efforts to defeat HIV/AIDS. To maintain its leadership position as Pennsylvania’s largest HIV/AIDS service organization, ActionAIDS manages a diverse range of fundraising and communication activities. ActionAIDS was founded in Philadelphia in 1986 when a group of 84 committed volunteers came together to form a community of care to provide services to people with AIDS - their partners, family and friends. The group’s mission statement simply read:

611.desc: Calling All Instructors!Have you been looking to experience a new culture and take a break from the daily routine of your current position? Are you currently a graduate student who is interested in spending summer break abroad? Would you like to build off your current experience in a vibrant environment where students are eager to learn what you have to teach them? The Princeton Review Korea is looking for someone like you!Our global network and years of experience provide assurance that no other institute in Korea can offer. With our headquarters in Boston, The Princeton Review is a global organization with over 700 locations around the world. As the largest international TPR office in the world, The Princeton Review Korea (TPRK) has distinguished itself as a reliable leader in the Korean education industry.TPRK operates out of two state-of-the-art facilities in the heart of downtown Seoul. TPRK’s prime locations allow for our employees to fully experience all that Seoul has to offer.The Princeton Review Korea conducts intensive courses during June, July, and August for our Summer Intensive session. TPRK staff members are actively seeking reliable and motivated people to join our team of talented instructors. The details are provided below:Teaching the SATStarting in 2016, students will be taking the newly revised SAT, and we at TPRK will be preparing them for it. Working in our summer intensive program as an instructor will present an interesting challenge and will provide you with valuable experience. The Princeton Review is well-known for its strategic approach to “cracking” the test—and the new SAT is no exception. We have both the materials and the experience to equip you to be an effective and confident test-prep instructor. If you come willing to learn the in-and-outs of the SAT, to master the test, to become a leader in the classroom, then we will be there to help you along the way in our mission to raise students’ scores.Training Schedule:May Training: May 23rd ~ June 3rdJune Training: June 20th ~ June 30th*Dates are subject to change according to summer schedule. *All candidates must receive mandatory training. Session Schedule:Option 1: June 6th ~ July 28th (June to July)Option 2: July 1st ~ August 30th (June to August)Option 3: July 1st ~ August 30th (July and August)*Dates are subject to change*Option 2 and 3 only opened to candidates that are able to teach SAT and other Subjects.Required Documents: Must have the following documents prior to May 2016 - Original Diploma *Notarized with an apostille - Nationwide Criminal Background Check *Notarized with an apostilleCompensation:Instructor will be paid 25,000KRW an hour. Instructors can work up to 40 hours a week and make up to 4,000,000KRW per month and 12,000,000KRW for three months of work.Employee Benefits-	TPRK’s professional teacher training-	Continental breakfast on teaching days -	Weekly reward for best teachers -	Monthly teachers’ appreciation trip -	Airfare & housing support -	Welcome bag and TPRK Uniform-	New teachers’ settlement support programAirfare Reimbursement:The Princeton Review Korea will provide overseas instructors with economy class airfare into Seoul, Korea, from an agreed upon international airport and from Seoul to an agreed upon international airport upon completion of the contract based on the following criteria:1.	Roundtrip airfare reimbursement for instructors working all 3 months of the Summer Intensive Program.2.	One-way airfare reimbursement for instructors working 2 months of the Summer Intensive Program.*All airfare reimbursements will be received after successful completion of instructor’s contracted term.Housing Support:The Princeton Review Korea will provide and assist in finding housing for instructors for the duration of employment. The provided housing will be dormitory style studio apartments in the vicinity of the campus that instructors are assigned to instruct at.Over the past 18 years, TPRK has built a fun and energetic environment conducive to learning and working. The work experience gained at TPRK will provide you with benefits today and in the future as you pursue your future career goals. We truly believe that you will experience life in one of the most interesting cities in the world and we’ll even pay for you to get here!If you feel like you are reliable, responsible, self-motivated and interested in working with us, please submit an application through our website: http://recruit.tpr.co.krSincerely,The Princeton Review Korea

612.desc: Elite Scholars of China (ESC) is looking for an Educational Consultant to join our team. ESC helps China’s brightest and most promising high school students apply to America’s most prestigious colleges. Educational ConsultantAs an Educational Consultant, you will serve as a mentor for top high school students, guiding them through the American college application process. You will work one-on-one with Chinese students to brainstorm essay ideas, develop their writing skills, navigate their educational options, and help them to achieve their educational aspirations.  As a part of a rapidly growing organization, you will also experience the momentum and excitement of a start-up. Educational Consultants play an integral role in building ESC as an organization. Spring and summer months at ESC have an entrepreneurial feel as Educational Consultants each work on projects that utilize their special talents or stretch them in new ways. Projects may involve marketing, curriculum development, IT, recruiting, and other projects that are of critical importance to ESC’s development.   BenefitsESC employees enjoy a range of benefits including subsidized healthcare, a gym membership and other wellness programs, and free daily lunch. For applicants not currently in China, ESC can assist with finding lodging in Beijing. ESC will also arrange and pay for a Chinese visa and travel. Salary is commensurate with experience. About Elite Scholars of ChinaElite Scholars of China (ESC) aims to educate China's top high school students about their undergraduate options in the United States. ESC offers high-quality college-counseling services, SAT, ACT and TOEFL test preparation, US college tours and workshops to China's academically accomplished high school students. ESC students have been admitted to top institutions, including: Brown, Caltech, Carleton, Columbia, Duke, Harvard, Haverford, Middlebury, Northwestern, Princeton, Tufts, Wellesley, Wesleyan and Yale.ESC was co-founded and is managed by Stacy Palestrant (BA, Wellesley & MBA, Chicago Booth) and Tomer Rothschild (BA, Wesleyan & MBA, Wharton). Beyond ESCAt ESC, we have a very low turnover rate for our Educational Consultants. We prioritize the professional growth of our Educational Consultants, giving them opportunities to be challenged and develop expertise.  Most Educational Consultants stay with us for two–four years.  After their time at ESC, Educational Consultants have gone on to do a variety of interesting endeavors – everything from graduate school to management consulting. Below is a partial list of the positions that our counselors have gone on to pursue: * Policy analyst at a think tank in Washington, D.C.* Principal at an international school in Hangzhou* Management consultant at an NYC firm* Graduate programs at Yale Law School, Harvard Business School, UPenn Graduate School of Education, Harvard Law School, and Hopkins-Nanjing Center for Chinese and American Studies

613.desc: Burger King Worldwide, Inc. is the second largest fast food hamburger chain and one of the most recognizable and respected brand names in the world. The Burger King® system operates in over 13,000 locations serving more than 11 million guests every day in 90 countries and territories worldwide.In 2010, 3G Capital, a multi-billion dollar global investment firm focused on long-term value creation, purchased Burger King® and later returned the chain to the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker “BKW”. At Burger King, our vision – to be the most profitable QSR business, through a strong franchise system and great people, serving the best burgers in the world – and our values – Bold, Accountable, Empowered, Meritocratic and Fun – are the foundation of the work we do every day.The Performance Analysis team is a small and fast-paced team that evaluates marketing programs, promotions and new product tests, develops sales and volume forecasts, and conducts breakeven and product performance analyses. The team also conducts ongoing analyses to evaluate business performance across markets. The Sr. Analyst will have direct ownership over important work streams and is expected to contribute to the marketing and overall business strategy of the group.Responsibilities:•	Analyze sales and volume data to evaluate performance of promotions, marketing programs, and new products•	Develop sales and volume forecasts to ensure program success and mitigate inventory risk for franchisees•	Conduct ongoing analyses to evaluate business performance across markets•	Make data-driven recommendations for product, promotional, and marketing strategies•	Provide reporting and business / trend analysis allowing management to make more informed decisions•	Provide appropriate parties (e.g. Marketing, Senior Management) with timely, accurate and insightful analysis of marketing programs and tests

614.company: Kimmel Center for the Performing Arts
614.desc: Department:		Human ResourcesReports to:		Chief Financial OfficerDirect Reports:	HR Coordinator, Office Services Coordinator, Receptionist Status:		ExemptSummary:	This position is responsible for providing HR leadership and supporting management in meeting Kimmel Center Inc.’s strategic plan as it relates to its human resources and the HR function.   Works with all levels of management on the implementation and administration of human resources activities including, but not limited to: recruitment, benefits administration, onboarding, compensation programs, employee relations, and various new programs.Essential Functions:•	Partners with CFO and management team to ensure alignment between strategic plan and human resources initiatives that impact positive business results.•	Assesses and anticipates HR-related needs, by developing, planning and delivering HR programs and services.•	Formulates partnerships across the HR function to deliver continuous support to management and staff.•	Guides leaders in the decisions/processes concerning promotions, compensation adjustments, transfers, terminations, recruitment and staffing.•	Recommends options for key development strategies and leadership training, focusing on performance management and leadership programs to meet current needs and prepare for future changes.•	Creates training and development plans for the organization, including career development and mentoring initiatives.•	Provides employee and management, coaching and counseling with objectivity and professionalism in dealing with sensitive issues.•	Manages employee relations matters for KCI and Ticket Philadelphia staff.•	Develops and administers performance management and appraisal programs. Assists management to ensure objective and meaningful employee performance management and appraisal programs consistent with organizational policy.•	Spearheads recruitment and hiring efforts to secure a diverse, talented and mission-focused workforce. •	Manages and develops compensation and benefit plans and compensation. Works with CFO and outside benefits consultant to negotiate benefit programs.•	Manages the Onboarding and Exiting programs, including conducting exit interviews.•	Maintains the organization’s salary and compensation databases.•	Prepares HR analyses and reports for management.•	Develops, updates, and communicates HR policies and procedures that are consistent with organizational values and legal compliance. •	Remains current on existing and emerging labor, wage, and benefits laws and regulations and serves as advisor for government statutes and programs affecting employment and workers compensation (i.e. FLSA, EEO, ADA, OSHA).•	Oversees daily functions involving office management •	Performs additional human resources duties and responsibilities as directed. Minimum Qualifications:•	Bachelor’s degree preferred in Business, Human Resources or related subject, or equivalent education or experience required. Master’s degree preferred.•	Seven (7) years of experience in Human Resources Management•	Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop good working relationships •	PHR/SHRM-CP certification required, SPHR/SHRM-SCP preferred•	Knowledge of federal, state and local regulations and requirements for compliance and reporting •	Experience in a union environment, preferred•	Strong organizational and customer service skills, detail orientation and proficiency in MS Office•	Ability to deal with HR matters in confidential, objective and professional manner.•	Availability for occasional evening and weekend eventsTo apply for this position, please send your resume to Kimmel Center Human Resources at humanresources@kimmelcenter.org

615.desc: Atlantic Media is a nationally-recognized, award-winning, and digital-first media enterprise whose publications — The Atlantic, National Journal, Government Executive and Quartz — are among the most influential media outlets in America.  Atlantic Media is growing, evolving, and causing major disruption in the world of media. Atlantic Media FellowshipAtlantic Media offers highly ambitious recent college graduates a unique full-time opportunity to participate in the Atlantic Media Fellowship Program. The Atlantic Media Fellowship Program is a structured, year-long, paid fellowship for top-tier talent committed to careers in media. Additionally, the Atlantic Media Fellows participate in the Atlantic Media Academy, a comprehensive curriculum providing a 360-degree view of the modern media industry covering the editorial, operational, and economic sides of both magazine and digital journalism today.The Fellowship will begin in July 2016 and will run through June 2017. Fellowship opportunities will be available in the following areas:•Client Services•Communications & PR•Creative & Design•Events•Finance•Marketing•Product Management•Research•Sales•VideoAll Fellowship opportunities will be located in Washington, D.C. or New York, NY.

Atlantic Media is growing, evolving, and causing major disruption in the world of media. 617.desc: The Philadelphia Orchestra Association is seeking a bright, motivated and outgoing person for an internship opportunity in our Graphic Design area.  The POA values all of our interns and we will go the extra mile to make sure you receive a learning experience that fits your career goals.  Our interns should be ready and eager to learn new skills and bring with them maturity, discretion and flexibility. The Philadelphia Orchestra has distinguished itself as one of the leading orchestras in the world through over a century of acclaimed performances, historic international tours, best-selling recordings, and its unprecedented record of innovation in recording technologies and outreach. Renowned for its distinctive sound, desired for its keen ability to capture the hearts and imaginations of audiences, and admired for an unrivaled legacy of “firsts” in music-making, The Philadelphia Orchestra remains one of the preeminent orchestras in the world.What you will learn:•	How to create compelling marketing communications across both print and web mediums. •	The proper way to release final art files for web and print production. •	Develop a strong understanding of online, email, and print campaigns. What you will do:1.	Assist in the design/layout of print collateral.2.	Prepare files for press.3.	Maintain The Philadelphia Orchestra brand look and feel.4.	Incorporate team changes in a timely manner.5.	Provide administrative support to the Marketing department as needed.

The POA values all of our interns and we will go the extra mile to make sure you receive a learning experience that fits your career goals. Our interns should be ready and eager to learn new skills and bring with them maturity, discretion and flexibility.The Philadelphia Orchestra has distinguished itself as one of the leading orchestras in the world through over a century of acclaimed performances, historic international tours, best-selling recordings, and its unprecedented record of innovation in recording technologies and outreach. Renowned for its distinctive sound, desired for its keen ability to capture the hearts and imaginations of audiences, and admired for an unrivaled legacy of “firsts” in music-making, The Philadelphia Orchestra remains one of the preeminent orchestras in the world.What you will learn:•	Develop a strong understanding of The POA’s group segments, and the approaches to building the group patron base.•	While working with Group Sales with market segment research, will gain an understanding of other ticket programs and initiatives run through the department.•	Gain exposure to the upcoming concert season, potential networking opportunities, ticketing, and general customer service.•	The details of marketing and communication campaigns with new and potential group clients, and gain substantial knowledge of our database systems.•	A general understanding of the entire marketing department.What you will do:1.	Participate in the analysis of group ticket campaigns.2.	Research assigned market segments.3.	Assist group sales team with distribution and development of group sales marketing materials.4.	Develop understanding of student ticket and Young Friends marketing initiatives, with extra emphasis on eZseatU program.

621.desc: Wissahickon Charter School is looking for a School Counselor to serve as a long-term substitute from approximately mid-February, 2016 through May, 2016. The School Counselor serves students across grades K-8.  His/her primary responsibilities include providing crisis intervention, managing the high school admissions process, teaching guidance classes, and providing individual and group counseling to students, The ideal candidate will have a Master’s degree in counseling or social work and will have experience working with students in an urban setting. This position reports to the Middle School Director for teaching duties and to the Chief Operating Officer for all other duties. Key Responsibilities•	Support classroom teachers with behavior and emotional concerns of students•	Work collaboratively with school leaders, teachers, learning specialists, and other staff to support students•	Establish schedules and provide individual counseling, group counseling, and IEP mandated counseling •	Provide crisis intervention, including child abuse and suicide prevention/intervention and bullying prevention/intervention•	Coordinate and manage the high school admissions process, including hosting a High School Admissions event for families and students and handling all administrative duties related to the admissions process•	Teach guidance classes, including a course on the high school application process, a sexual education course, and other courses relevant to students’ needs•	Supervise and oversee the Peace Center, including orientation and monitoring•	Act as the school liaison for outside agencies such as Home School Connection, Wraparound, and the Disabilities Bureau•	Participate in Discipline Review Committee (DRC) meetings and other student-focused meetings as needed •	Consistently implement WCS’ student management practices within the classroom and throughout school•	Establish and maintain relationships with families through regular communication, updates and opportunities for involvement•	Track student data to help inform interventions•	Exemplify WCS’ CARES values (Cooperation, Academic Excellence & Assertion, Responsibility, Empathy and Self-Control) in all interactions with students, families and colleagues•	Seek out and be receptive to feedback from the Middle School Director, COO and peers •	Participate in all professional development and team planning meetings •	Assume other duties as assigned by the administrative team About Wissahickon Charter SchoolWissahickon Charter School's first campus, Fernhill, opened in 2002 and serves 452 K-8 students from across Philadelphia. Our second K-8 campus, Awbury, opened in the fall of 2014.  The mission of Wissahickon Charter School (WCS) is to provide a community of learning that stimulates and builds the child's intellectual, social, and character development. Wissahickon Charter Schools are planned around three essential elements: an environmental focus that allows students to experience the curriculum, recognition of service learning projects as key in students’ success, and an emphasis on parents as partners in the learning experiences of their children.How to ApplyTo be considered, please send the following to applicant@wissahickoncharter.org.  Please write “School Counselor- Long Term Sub” in the subject line.1.	Cover letter indicating why you would be a great fit for the position and Wissahickon Charter School2.	ResumeWissahickon Charter School is committed to hiring a diverse staff and encourages those from traditionally under-represented backgrounds to apply. Wissahickon Charter School does not discriminate in hiring or employment, or in the administration of its educational policies, admissions policies, or other programs.

622.desc: The NS-LIJ Academic Associate Program is a one- or two-year, full-time, paid program in the North Shore-LIJ Health System’s Department of Emergency Medicine. The position is designed for post-undergraduates who are interested in gaining experience in clinical research, biostatistics quality improvement, and/or hospital administration. Academic Associates often apply to medical school but also go on to pursue other careers in fields such as public health, research, and healthcare administration.Associates work for the North Shore-LIJ Health System, the largest integrated health system in New York State and the 14th largest in the country. It is the largest private employer in New York State and serves more than 7 million people on Long Island, Manhattan, Queens, and Staten Island. Within the health system, Associates are employed by the Department of Emergency Medicine and spend most of their time at two locations: North Shore University Hospital and Long Island Jewish Medical Center. Both are located 30 minutes from Manhattan.Associates gain exposure to many aspects of academic medicine. They work primarily with physicians but also collaborate with other healthcare professionals including administrators, statisticians, nurses, and physician assistants (PAs). The program has five key areas of focus: (1) Healthcare Administration, (2) Research, (3) Performance Improvement, (4) Information Technology, and (5) Continuing Medical Education (CME). This breadth of focus provides Associates with a comprehensive perspective on the workings of an academic medical department.For more information regarding the program, please refer to our website at https://www.northshorelij.com/research-and-education/continuing-and-professional-education/graduate-clinical-education/academic-associates or email us at emaap@nshs.edu.

623.desc: Kekst and Company (www.kekst.com) is a leading strategic, corporate, and financial communications firm based in New York. With approximately 70 employees, we are dedicated to providing extraordinary communications counsel and service to publicly-traded companies and private institutions around the world.We are typically engaged to guide a client through its most pressing communications issues – providing value-added strategic communications advice and exceptional execution support at the highest levels of the client organization. We take a holistic approach to strategic communications and understand how to help our clients effectively communicate to their stakeholders, including the investment community, employees, customers, suppliers, and government officials, as well as the media. Kekst was named Corporate and Financial Agency of the Decade by The Holmes Report.  The firm is seeking high achieving analysts with an interest in finance, public affairs, investor relations, and communications. Analysts work with clients in all industries, on both long-term corporate communications and investor relations assignments and on special situations (e.g., M&A, restructurings, issues management, crisis communications, corporate governance, litigation support, etc.).  We are looking for bright, creative individuals who have excelled in their past experiences and will quickly grasp the complex business matters and rapidly changing current affairs in which we are involved.  Position Requirements: One to three years of professional experience. Strong interest in complex business, legal and policy issues.  Basic understanding of capital markets. Excellent written, verbal communication, and analytical skills.  Position requires a genuine team player and self-starter who can perform under pressure, and has a strong work ethic and energy for unpredictable and demanding (but always interesting) work schedules.What we offer: Ability to work on complex, demanding business situations and interesting current events; contribute substantive ideas; be part of a highly merit-based, client-focused culture.  Opportunity to work with committed, experienced, high-caliber colleagues representing an array of professional, academic, and government backgrounds. Salary and Benefits are highly competitive, commensurate with experience.Submit a resume AND LETTER explaining your interest in Kekst and Company to Recruit@kekst.com                                                                Kekst and Company437 Madison AvenueNew York, NY 10022EOE M/F.  NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.

We are looking for a bright, creative individual who has excelled in his or her past experiences and will quickly grasp the complex business matters and rapidly changing current affairs in which we are involved.  Position Requirements: Six to eight years of professional experience, not necessarily public relations.  Strong interest in complex business, legal and policy issues. 625.desc: Notch Partners is a boutique consulting firm.  We connect our private equity clients with industry-leading executives to assess investment opportunities, generate deal ideas, and/or improve the performance of their portfolio companies. We help facilitate long standing relationships between leading executives and our retained clients who range in fund size from $250 million to $15 billion. Our clients view us as essential in their efforts to differentiate themselves in an increasingly competitive private equity world.  Notch maintains high-trust relationships with executives, assisting them with the development of proprietary investment strategies of their own and helping them to navigate the often unfamiliar territory of private equity.Founded in 2002, Notch Partners is based in Millburn, NJ, approximately 20 miles from New York City and easily accessible from NY Penn Station via NJ Transit.  Please refer to www.notchpartners.com for additional firm information.The Associate RoleNotch professionals, at all levels, work collaboratively with highly accomplished private equity investors and world-class C-level executives. The range of day-to-day responsibilities of an Associate typically include (but is not limited to): executive background research and cultivation, collaborative development of deal ideas with executives, competitive industry analysis, and assessment of buyout targets.

626.desc: Investment Analyst Position DescriptionOsage University PartnersOverview:Osage University Partners, a science and technology focused venture capital firm, is looking for an Investment Analyst to support its investment team. Our mission is to invest in cutting-edge, university research based startups. The analyst’s primary role will be at the heart of Osage’s investment team, providing internal analytic support to Osage’s investment and portfolio management activities.  Interested candidates should have demonstrated a track record of academic excellence, strong analytic, writing, and computer skills, and significant interest in start-ups and/or venture capital. Relevant work / internship experience is helpful but not required.Company Description:Osage University Partners (“OUP”) is a unique venture fund that has partnered with leading research universities to invest in their most compelling spin-outs.  Over 900 start-up companies are launched each year in the U.S. based upon university technologies, resulting in the creation of such notable companies as Genentech, Google, and Sun Microsystems. We’ve established partnerships with over 75 top-tier universities, including Caltech, Columbia, Duke, Harvard, Michigan, Penn, UC Berkeley and many others, to invest on behalf of the institutions in their start-ups. We focus on all sectors of university-originated technology, including software, network security, advanced materials, robotics, electronics, energy, therapeutics, and diagnostics. OUP invests in pioneering technologies and visionary entrepreneurs targeting large market opportunities.Since 2010, OUP has raised $315M across two funds. The three Managing Partners collectively have over 50 years of venture capital experience. We’ve invested in over 50 companies, with seven successful IPOs and 2 M&As to date. Osage University Partners is part of the Osage Partners family of funds.  Osage Partners has a twenty-year history of investing in VC and private equity deals, and it has over $600 million of capital under management.  It currently has two distinct venture strategies, each of which has its own staff: Osage University Partners and Osage Venture Partners, which funds early stage enterprise technology companies in the mid-Atlantic region. Investment Analyst Position Description:The Investment Analyst will be at the heart of our investment team, providing support to highly experienced investors. Our investment team currently includes three Managing Partners and six junior investment professionals.  In addition Osage has a dedicated university relations team. Analyst day-to-day responsibilities include providing internal analytic support for all of the fund’s investment and portfolio management activities, maintaining a deal flow database of over 3,000 active private start-ups, helping with presentations and marketing materials, special projects, leading and supporting the firm’s marketing activities, and more. While the Analyst will not work directly on investment opportunities, he/she will be exposed on a regular basis to Osage’s investment activities, its portfolio of companies, and to the worlds of venture capital and entrepreneurship. The Investment Analyst is a two year position, after which time the analyst will be well qualified for a diverse set of opportunities ranging from entering graduate school, to joining a startup, or another entrepreneurial activity.OUP’s environment is vibrant, engaged, and curious. We are a community of learners that has a deep commitment to the growth and education of its members. We value a culture of exploration, fun, humility, and team orientation.  Experience Profile:•Educational experienceo	Undergraduate degree in a range of disciplines o	A scientific graduate degree is a plus but not requiredo	Demonstrated record of strong academic performance•Prior work experience not required. Relevant internship and/or work experience in start-ups or venture capital is a plusSkill Set:•	Strong analytic skills•	Strong computer skills, including high level proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint•	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills•	Self-motivated and capable of working independently.•	Highly detail-oriented and organized•	Ability to multi-task and prioritize a large workload•	Works well in a team•	Strong work ethicThe position is based in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania, just outside Philadelphia.  The role offers a unique opportunity to be exposed to science and technology venture capital amongst highly experienced investors. We strongly believe in deep mentorship and the career development of investment analysts.

628.desc: Creative Academics is a bicoastal tutoring company with offices in Philadelphia and Los Angeles. We have homeschooling, enrichment and traditional (after school) tutoring divisions. We are currently seeking tutors in the Los Angeles area for all academic subjects (grades 6-12), as well as executive functioning skills tutors and standardized tests tutors. Must have reliable form of transportation. This job is for the entire school year - candidate must be able to guarantee availability through the second week of June, 2016. You set your own hours and control the number of clients you take on. You dictate the subjects you teach and the age groups with which you work. We serve children with learning disabilities as well as children without special needs, so please specify if you have the skills to help children with learning and behavioral challenges.

630.position: Engage Your Community through AmeriCorps Service
630.desc: Reading Partners is changing the education landscape. We are a leader in working to solve the literacy crisis in our country by leveraging community volunteers in under-resourced schools. Our diverse and expansive volunteer base provides one-on-one tutoring to students twice weekly, and our program is proven to help children master the reading fundamentals they need to unlock their potential as successful, happy and confident readers in school and in life. Our people are our heartbeat and our greatest resource; we are all passionately rallied around our mission to help children become lifelong learners by empowering communities to provide individualized instruction that works. Join our stellar team leading the charge to deepen our impact and expand our service. Learn more about us at www.readingpartners.org.The AmeriCorps Volunteer Coordinator serves as the face of Reading Partners within the community, leading the charge in recruiting and on-boarding volunteer tutors, while also executing community engagement initiatives. No two days are alike for Volunteer Coordinators - this is an exciting opportunity to develop recruiting skills, build and maintain relationships with local organizations, and make a real impact in the community! Reading Partners AmeriCorps offers an amazing chance to give back and as a member you’ll receive benefits, a great place to serve, and the opportunity to springboard a glowing and growing career. Our top Volunteer Coordinators are ambassadors for service, demonstrate a hunger for community outreach, and strongly believe in our vision and values.What you’ll do and how you’ll do it:Volunteer Recruitment and EngagementLead Reading Partners’ efforts to recruit volunteer tutors in the respective region.•	As a face of Reading Partners in the community, Volunteer Coordinators demonstrate an ability to communicate our mission, vision, and volunteer opportunities throughout the region. Volunteer Coordinators can successfully tailor their recruiting pitches to different audiences and demonstrate a high level of comfort with public speaking. •	Identifying and implementing effective recruitment strategies is a significant component of the Volunteer Coordinator role, as are the creation and execution of retention strategies, planning for and hosting volunteer recognition events, and developing ways to appreciate partnerships.Partnership Cultivation and ManagementCultivate and manage a portfolio of community partners that serve as pipelines for Reading Partners’ tutor recruitment efforts.  •	We believe volunteers get results; our program can’t run without our volunteer reading partners! A self-starting individual will thrive best in this role, as Volunteer Coordinators must balance a variety of responsibilities, including partnership research and cultivation to broaden the volunteer base, maximizing existing partnerships, and providing marketing support to the region. •	Stellar organizational skills are a must for accurate tutor and partnership record tracking, data management through Salesforce, and supporting the high volume of volunteer tutor calls. What we offer:•	AmeriCorps members earn an annual stipend, along with medical, dental, and vision coverage at no cost for our members; childcare assistance is available through AmeriCorps for those who qualify. You may be eligible for student loan forbearance on federal student loans. AmeriCorps members can earn an education award of $5,775 after successfully completing their service term. AmeriCorps members will have an allotment of personal days for sick/vacation.  •	We offer an exciting and dynamic culture, and we commit to investing in and supporting our amazing people to grow their careers with us. As such, we provide ongoing professional development opportunities.The other things you need to know:•	Service Terms: AmeriCorps members serve full-time from August, 2016, through June, 2017, and must commit to a service term of 1700 hours over an 11-month period.•	Travel: Volunteer Coordinators are constantly traveling throughout the community, and need reliable transportation to attend partnership meetings, career fairs, and other events. AmeriCorps members also make occasional trips to regional offices and service day events.•	Program Orientation: At the start of each program year, Reading Partners holds an intensive program orientation training to take a deeper dive into our program, foster relationships with regional teams, and learn the skills necessary to execute the Volunteer Coordinator role.•	Where we serve: Reading Partners AmeriCorps members serve in a variety of regions, including California, Washington, Texas, Oklahoma, South Carolina, Minnesota, Maryland, Washington DC, and New York. This position will serve in New York, NY.

631.desc: Company that provides tutoring and homeschooling services to children in Philadelphia and Los Angeles is currently seeking a Hebrew tutor for the Philadelphia office. Tutor must be fluent in Hebrew and able to tutor courses as advanced as Hebrew Literature for bilingual students.

632.position: Unlock Your Potential with Reading Partners AmeriCorps
632.desc: Reading Partners is changing the education landscape. We are a leader in working to solve the literacy crisis in our country by leveraging community volunteers in under-resourced schools. Our diverse and expansive volunteer base provides one-on-one tutoring to students twice weekly, and our program is proven to help children master the reading fundamentals they need to unlock their potential as successful, happy and confident readers in school and in life. Our people are our heartbeat and our greatest resource; we are all passionately rallied around our mission to help children become lifelong learners by empowering communities to provide individualized instruction that works. Join our stellar team leading the charge to deepen our impact and expand our service. Learn more about us at www.readingpartners.org.The AmeriCorps Site Coordinator is the face of Reading Partners within our reading centers, leading the full-time program coordination, operations, and relationship development at their school. This is an exciting opportunity to work with kids, coach volunteers, build partnerships with faculty and staff, and get a hands-on approach to a literacy program that works! Reading Partners AmeriCorps offers an amazing chance to give back, and as a member you’ll receive benefits, a great place to serve, and the opportunity to springboard a glowing and growing career. Our top Site Coordinators are ambassadors for service, demonstrate a passion for improving education, and strongly believe in our vision and values.       What you’ll do & how you’ll do it:Program Implementation•	Coordinate the day-to-day operations of Reading Partners’ program at a partner school to ensure Reading Partners’ program and curricula meet students’ learning needs.  •	Leading program implementation is a huge responsibility! As the head of a reading center, Site Coordinators demonstrate a strong understanding of our program and can effectively coach volunteer tutors through the curriculum.•	Superb organizational skills are paramount in meeting student enrollment goals (an average of 40-80 students), coordinating schedules, managing accurate data records, and tracking student progress through regular assessments. Site Coordinators also work directly with students to provide ongoing tutoring throughout the year.Relationship Management & Communication•	Forge and maintain positive relationships within the school community to create a welcoming environment for students, volunteer tutors, faculty, and staff.•	Fostering relationships within the school community is a key component of a Site Coordinator’s success. Site Coordinators demonstrate an aptitude for communication, adapting their communication styles to best suit the needs of students, volunteer tutors, Reading Partners colleagues, and school-based faculty/staff. The ability to motivate kids in their learning and manage their behavior is a significant responsibility, as is the ability to train, guide, and give feedback to volunteer tutors. What we offer•	AmeriCorps members earn an annual stipend, along with medical, dental, and vision coverage at no cost for our members; childcare assistance is available through AmeriCorps for those who qualify. You may be eligible for student loan forbearance on federal student loans. •	AmeriCorps members can earn an education award of $5,775 after successfully completing their service term. AmeriCorps members will have an allotment of personal days for sick/vacation.  •	We offer an exciting and dynamic culture, and we commit to investing in and supporting our amazing people to grow their careers with us. As such, we provide ongoing professional development opportunities. The other things you need to know•	Service Terms: AmeriCorps members serve full-time from August, 2016, through June, 2017, and must commit to a service term of 1700 hours over an 11-month period.•	Travel: Site Coordinators need access to reliable transportation to and from their school site, as well as occasional trips to regional offices, other school sites, and service day events.•	Program Orientation: At the start of each program year, Reading Partners holds an intensive program orientation training to take a deeper dive into our program, foster relationships with regional teams, and learn the skills necessary to execute the Site Coordinator role.Where we serve: Reading Partners AmeriCorps members serve in a variety of regions, including California, Washington, Texas, Oklahoma, South Carolina, Minnesota, Maryland, Washington DC, and New York. This position will serve in New York, NY.

633.desc: The Laura and John Arnold Foundation (LJAF) is a private foundation whose core objective is to address our nation’s most pressing and persistent challenges using evidence-based, multi-disciplinary approaches. LJAF strives to create functional solutions that target the root causes, not just the symptoms, of these problems. The solutions must be both scalable nationally and sustainable without permanent philanthropy. Position:	Venture Development Manager – Health CareSalary:	Competitive salary and benefits package based on qualifications  Location:	Washington, D.C. or Houston, TX As a part of LJAF’s Venture Development department, we are building a small team focused on improving the U.S. health care system. We are seeking a Manager of Venture Development – Health Care who will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and pursuing new, high-leverage philanthropic opportunities to positively transform health care. To date, LJAF’s Health Care work has largely focused on supporting cost containment efforts, but our strategy remains in development. The Manager of Venture Development – Health Care will play a key role in defining and implementing LJAF’s strategic plan for philanthropic investment within the sector.Core Responsibilities:•	Collaborate with the Venture Development team to refine and communicate LJAF’s Health Care strategy•	Develop a pipeline of high-leverage philanthropic opportunities: research, vet, and present grant proposals to LJAF’s Board for approval•	Draft grant agreements, including detailed budgets, timelines, and milestones•	Manage charitable investments approved by LJAF’s Board, which will include working with grantees to establish performance metrics, monitoring their performance, and measuring their impact•	Build and manage a network of relationships with new and existing grantees, experts, and key stakeholders •	Provide general operational and administrative support for proposal and grant management•	Collaborate with LJAF staff to explore and develop cross-initiative charitable investment opportunities

634.desc: CopywriterMOD Worldwide – Philadelphia, PARules? Where we’re going, we don’t need rules.You can read but can you write?Are you a writer who can melt keyboards and set notebooks ablaze with your ideas?  You read an ad and make mental markups. F. Scott Fitzgerald tried writing in advertising, it was too difficult.  Can you out advertise the dude who wrote The Great Gatsby? Be a risk-taker, climb our mountain, and dive off its summit.RESPONSIBILITIES:•Understand your audience, capture their voice.•Create comprehensive and creative copy that provokes consumer interests.•Edit and proofread consumer copy •Research and develop content pertaining to various brand standards.•Draft B2B and B2C scripts for video projects.•Adjust tone and consistency across all produced materials in relation to design, graphics, and typography.Come blow our minds.Send your resume & chops today to careers@modworldwide.com.

635.desc: Featured in The New York Times and Sports Illustrated and on Shark Tank and The Today Show, Rugged Events Holding LLC, the company behind the Rugged Maniac 5K Obstacle Race (www.ruggedmaniac.com), The Great Bull Run (www.thegreatbullrun.com) and the Costume Dash 5K (www.costumedash.com), is seeking intelligent, creative and hardworking individuals to join one of the fastest growing event production companies in the US.In this position, you’ll gain experience in all aspects of the company’s operations including, but not limited to: •	Logistics •	Marketing & social media •	Public relations •	Customer relations•	Sponsorship development•	Event design•	New product development You’ll be given significant responsibility and be expected to contribute ideas and energy to fuel the company’s continued growth.This program is designed to identify and train outstanding individuals for full-time employment.   All applicants must successfully complete a four-month internship before being considered for a permanent full-time position. 636.desc: Via is hiring an exceptional General Manager to lead our Chicago team.We've built revolutionary technology that is changing the way people get around cities. Using Via, a shared ride booked on your phone costs little more than the bus. Via is on-demand transit on a mass scale; it’s smart transportation that’s friendly to our planet. Our service currently operates in NYC and is soon launching in Chicago. We’re looking for entrepreneurs who are excited about building Via Chicago’s founding team. Imaginative thinkers who relish wearing multiple hats and never back down from a challenge. Above all, people who get things done.We’re unusually selective in our hiring process. If you have a record of exceptional achievement, take intense pride in your work, and want to join a world-class team, we’d love to talk to you.-----As General Manager of Via’s first market outside of New York, you won’t be working from an expansion playbook – you’ll be writing it. The GM role requires a combination of intelligence, creativity, and leadership that few possess. This is an opportunity for a truly outstanding entrepreneur to shape the operation of our game-changing service. You’ll need to be a consummate marketer, an operations workhorse, and an exceptionally creative problem solver. Responsibilities:•	Oversee Via’s Chicago launch: develop the strategy and logistics behind our go-to-market plan•	Set ambitious growth goals, then tirelessly work to exceed them •	Manage the Chicago team: foster a collaborative, cohesive, and energetic local presence•	Ensure operational excellence, customer satisfaction, and an unbelievable product every day •	Be the face of Via Chicago; develop relationships with policy makers, key players, and local partnersYou: •	An independent self-starter, you thrive in fast-paced environments and feel comfortable with a very high level of responsibility•	A no-nonsense thinker, you have sound business sense and make data-driven decisions •	A detail-oriented executor: you’re obsessively action-oriented•	An exceptional leader: people love working with you and for you•	A savvy and tactful communicator: you intuitively find the right tone in every situation •	A preternatural entrepreneur: you’re excited to build Via Chicago from the ground up and shape the strategic direction of our company•	Have previous leadership and operations experience in a similar role, ideally at a start-up-----Via offers highly competitive compensation packages and benefits, including equity, health insurance, a flexible vacation policy, and relocation assistance. To apply, please go to ridewithvia.com/jobs. Via is an equal opportunity employer.
