639.position: Assistant Vice President - Assistant Director, Private Equity Analyst
639.desc: Nippon Life Global Investors Americas, Inc. (NLGIA) seeks an adaptable team player to join us as a Private Equity Analyst, AVP. We are looking for an investment professional to analyze new investment opportunities, monitor funds and manage disclosure activities to aid in the selection and evaluation of private equity managers for clients.NLGIA is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nippon Life Insurance Company (Nippon Life), the world’s 8th largest life insurer by revenue.  Nippon Life is #1 in Japan (with over 17% market share) and it aims to strengthen its position as a leading life insurer. Nippon Life’s investments in foreign (non-Japanese) securities exceeds US$100 billion.Nippon Life conducts global asset management operations from offices in New York, London and Singapore. Located in New York, NLGIA is the largest overseas asset management subsidiary for Nippon Life and manages Equity, Fixed Income and Alternative investments spanning VC/PE to Real Estate. Nippon Life has expanded into Europe, North America and Asia, where it has established a number of subsidiary companies and representative offices. These subsidiaries and offices are engaged in insurance, asset management and research. Essential Duties/Function:•	Screen and develop new investment opportunities through the manager search and selection process.•	Build strong relationships with existing and prospective general partners.•	Prepare for and conduct due diligence meetings; assist in formulating investment recommendations and presenting reports to the Global Investment Committee. Active participation in the Global Investment Committee, which includes members from Nippon Life Group’s New York, London and Tokyo offices.•	Coordinate with external parties in the negotiation and execution of agreements and documents related to Private Equity investments.•	Contribute industry news, research and data to the team; participate in industry conferences.•	Perform post-investment monitoring of funds, including periodic meetings with general partners, annual meeting attendance and office visits, etc.•	Prepare comments for the quarterly reports; attend quarterly disclosure meetings with Tokyo.•	Research and investigate matters as required by clients or regulators.•	Manage and maintain data related to underlying fund performance and company data.•	Miscellaneous projects or duties as assigned.Experience/Qualifications:•	Strong academic background, undergraduate degree in Finance. Accounting and/or Economics or equivalent work experience; CFA or CAIA qualification preferable. •	At least 3 years of experience in financial services, including private equity fund investing or other direct investment experience. Private Equity fund investment/Alternative investment experience is a plus.•	Strong command of Microsoft Excel, Word and other Office programs.•	Outstanding interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills; ability to excel in a highly collaborative global team.•	Detail oriented, pro-active and able to manage multiple projects to deadlines with minimal supervision.•	Ability to travel internationally and domestically, as required.•	A flexible team player able to adapt to change.Qualified candidates are to submit their resume, compensation history and current salary requirements to:Sharon Scrima, HR Specialists-scrima@nipponlifeglobal.comDisclaimer:NLGIA is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee because of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability or handicap, sex, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal state or local laws.

640.desc: PIRG stands for the Public Interest Research Group. We take on issues where the public needs a champion — someone to stand up to powerful interests when they push the other way.Here’s just one example: The overuse of antibiotics is creating “superbugs” that kill at least 23,000 Americans each year, and is getting so bad that doctors are worried antibiotics could stop working. Yet most antibiotics aren’t used to treat sick people — they're sold for use on livestock, and big factory farms routinely give them to animals that aren’t even sick. That makes no sense whatsoever.So we organized consumers and ten thousand doctors nationwide to convince McDonald’s to go antibiotic-free. With PIRGs in 25 states, we reached more than 125,000 people in the field and millions more online, and McDonald’s agreed to stop selling chicken raised on human antibiotics. We still have more to do, but we’re now seeing big changes in the food industry.We take the same non-partisan, fact-driven, result-oriented approach to problems ranging from money in politics to Wall Street reform. And these strategies have been effective for more than 40 years.  We’re hiring Fellows to work on these problems: whether it’s stopping the overuse of antibiotics on factory farms, or one of our other top priority campaigns like checking the influence of billionaires and Super PACs over our elections, giving consumers the right to know if GMOs are in their food, passing new recycling laws, or promoting smart transportation options for a 21st century economy.What Fellows DoOur Fellows don’t just sit behind a desk. You’ll be out in the real world — recruiting new groups to join a coalition, speaking in a church basement or town hall to win a new endorsement, organizing a news event or rally, meeting with an editorial board, or doing whatever else it takes to urge our public officials to do the right thing. This is a two-year program, expressly designed to prepare future leaders within PIRG. We do have more problems than we should tolerate in America, and we have plenty of solutions that we could be putting to use. And while powerful industries and other special interests will continue hiring lobbyists, we need you to help us balance the scales, stand up for the public, and help solve more of America’s problems.Locations and start datesWe’re hiring for positions in D.C., Boston, and Chicago. If you’re flexible, you can apply for multiple locations. We accept applications on a rolling basis. State date: August 1, 2016.Salary & BenefitsSalary for this position is $25,500 in the first year and $27,000 in the second year. U.S. PIRG offers a competitive benefits package. Eligible staff receive health insurance, paid holidays, sick days, and vacation days; and the opportunity to enroll in our college loan assistance and 401(k) programs. We also offer an excellent training program and opportunities for advancement.U.S. PIRG is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, age, sex, handicap, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

641.desc: Some of our ArsenalScalaPythonGoSparkCoffeeScriptPostgreSQL / PostGISEC2, SQS, DynamoDBReact and FluxFlaskOn the Vistar Media engineering team, we never stop looking for our next addition. We’re kinda hoping that addition is you. We are located in Center City, Philadelphia.We're a startup with an established, well-tested codebase, but we aren't afraid to shake things up. We want to solve our problems with the right tools, whether they’re cutting-edge, or tried-and-true. We're happy to explore new territory (who isn't?), but we won't jump on something shiny for the sake of it. Our engineers work with many different languages and platforms every day. If this gets you excited, we'd love to hear from you.

642.desc: ABOUT COFACTOR GROUPCofactor Group is a management consulting firm based outside Philadelphia that serves clients in the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. We help our clients explore opportunities, manage and sustain growth and plan for the future.  We provide exceptional value by leveraging our deep industry and functional expertise and using superior research, analysis and insight to drive our recommendations.  As a member of Cofactor Group, you will work on challenging business problems, expand your knowledge and skill base, work side-by-side with experienced senior colleagues, and become an integral member of a dynamic and growing company.JOB OPENINGSCofactor Group is currently hiring for the position of Consultant-PMO (Medical Affairs)POSITIONSRole:   Consultant-PMO (Medical Affairs)Salary:  We offer industry competitive salary and benefits.Job DescriptionThe Consultant-PMO will work with Global Medical Affairs clients to develop and execute a broad range of Medical Excellence initiatives.  Engagements may include the creation of Brand Medical Plans and Medical Evidence Plans and implementation support of Medical communication and scientific engagement activities.  Projects vary by size, length and therapy area.The Consultant-PMO manages projects with broad organizational participation and is the key point of contact for day-to-day client relations.  He / She facilitates communication and directs project delivery across Medical Affairs, Clinical Research, Marketing and other functions.  Operational activities include, but are not limited to, defining project parameters, executing work plans, communicating information to stakeholders, facilitating client discussions and preparing written deliverables   The Consultant-PMO may also research, collect and synthesize Medical / scientific content toward completion of business projects.  Management and support of multiple projects during an engagement is expected.  In addition to client engagements, the Consultant-PMO will also have opportunities to participate in firm building activities.  ResponsibilitiesThe successful applicant will:•	Direct and support execution of Medical Excellence initiatives while working closely with Medical Affairs leaders and other cross-functional stakeholders including:o	Define project objectives and determine work, resource and timing requirements o	Prepare working documents for the project team, including Medical / scientific content, project status updates, dashboards, internal discussion and leadership presentation documentso	Prepare for and facilitate project core team and leadership team meetings to review, refine and complete deliverables per set timelines•	Lead department budget reviews•	Manage 3rd party vendors •	Utilize project management tools to track activity status

645.desc: Eze Software Group (Eze Software) is seeking an entry level Execution Management System (EMS) Business Development Associate to join the Sales team in its New York office due to our continued growth and significantly increased demand for our products.  This expansion in our sales force is an exciting entrepreneurial role for an experienced professional looking to further their sales career in our highly rewarding, financial technology industry.As demand for our services continues to rise, you will be expected to increase revenue through upselling our other product lines to existing client accounts on our Execution Management System (EMS) solution.  You will also be expected to track new opportunities upsell new connections across existing users and upsell to new users within a subset of our existing EMS client base. The role requires accurate opportunity pipeline management for each client and some Account Management as needed. You will also be a lead generator to route qualified upsell opportunities for our other product lines to the Core Business Development team. and upsell new connections or users to our add new connections for our EMS solution. To succeed in our role, you and must have an understanding of how hedge asset management funds operate, from front, to middle, to back office. to sell software products into hedge funds and Institutional money managers.  You will be expected to source new opportunities and build a strong pipeline within the EMS client base through researching accounts, identifying and building relationships with key players, and proactive follow ups. You will be expected to draw on your keen sales abilities to tailor a pitch to each specific prospect you uncover, providing a consultative sales approach. You must be capable of working within a highly motivated team to drive the business forward as you will also work closely with the Core Business Development team and the combined groups of Marketing, Consulting, and Product Management to ensure consistency of execution.Benefits:Compensation includes a competitive base salary & excellent benefits.About the Eze Software Group:Eze Software Group is a premier provider of global investment technology to support the front, middle and back office. The Eze Software Investment Suite addresses the core business needs of the asset management community, including Order Management, Trade Execution & Analytics, Portfolio Analytics & Modeling, Compliance & Regulatory Reporting, Commission Management, Data Management and Portfolio Accounting. Eze Software partners with more than 2,000 buy-and sell-side institutions in 30 countries across North and South America, EMEA, and Asia Pacific. Clients include hedge funds, institutional asset managers, mutual funds, pension funds, endowments, family offices, wealth managers, and broker-dealers across a range of strategies, investment products, and asset classes. Based in Boston, Eze Software employs more than 1,000 associates in 12 offices worldwide. ​​Eze Software Group is an equal opportunity employer.

646.desc: Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm that uses innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to guide our business. We are a global liquidity provider and market maker, operating around the clock and around the globe, out of offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.The markets change rapidly, and we need to change faster still. Every day, we come to work with new problems to solve, new systems to build and new theories to test.  We’re always looking for people to join us and help come up with that next great idea.Culture The environment is intellectual and collaborative, relaxed and playful, with a strong focus on education. You’ll learn about trading and our technology stack through in-house classes, guest lectures, and on-the-job experiences. You’ll have the freedom to get involved in many different areas of the business and we’re small enough that you can quickly and clearly see the impact of your work.At Jane Street, we consider trading and programming to be two ends of a continuum.  As both a trading firm and a tech firm, we have room for people who love to trade, people who love to program, and people everywhere in between. Nearly all of our traders write code, and many of our developers trade.  The role you carve out for yourself will be largely dependent on your strengths and the types of problems you enjoy thinking about.

647.desc: Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm with a unique focus on technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to guide our business. Our entrepreneurial culture is driven by our talented team of traders and programmers. We are a global liquidity provider and market maker, operating around the clock and around the globe, employing over 400 people in our offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.  The markets change rapidly, and we need to change faster still. Every day, we come to work with new problems to solve, new systems to build and new theories to test.  We’re always looking for people to join us and help come up with that next great idea. Our trading is based on our own proprietary models and on busy days we engage in over a million trades. Technology is at the core of how we approach trading, and we consider ourselves as much a technology company as a trading firm. We use OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language, and have the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting.Traders work in teams to seek out and trade on pricing inefficiencies, develop models, manage risk, investigate new products, and push into new business areas.  Experienced traders teach and oversee the less-experienced.  New traders serve as assistants while they learn the ropes, getting increasing responsibility as they demonstrate their ability to handle it.

648.desc: Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm with a focus on technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of the markets. We are a global liquidity provider and market maker, operating around the clock and around the globe, employing over 400 people in our offices in New York, London and Hong Kong. The markets change rapidly, and we need to change faster still. Every day, we come to work with new problems to solve, new systems to build, and new theories to test. Technology is at the core of how we approach that work and developers are intimately tied in to every area of the business. We are big believers in functional programming, using OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language.  We also believe  in the value of open source software, using it in our daily work and releasing hundreds of thousands of lines of our own code as open source.

650.position: Senior Director of Mental Health Counseling
650.desc: General Overview:JSSA’s Mental Health Counseling Practice has an immediate opening for a Senior Director to lead and oversee the entire enterprise.  Our mental health practice is comprised of a dedicated interdisciplinary team of over 100 clinicians.   JSSA is committed to providing cutting edge services, programs and support for children, adults, seniors, individuals with disabilities and families.  Our wide-ranging services include assessment, counseling, medication management, coordination of care with JSSA and other community services, customized treatment, and support and education and more.  Under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer, the Senior Director is responsible for the strategic development and implementation of JSSA’s mental health counseling services, using evidence-based practices, across multiple locations and two states (MD and VA).  S/he is accountable for achieving clinical, financial, and operational results to meet or exceed Agency expectations.   S/he is responsible for ensuring JSSA’s visibility and relationships in the health and mental health sectors, payers and the community at large and spearheading the expansion of future plans for new services and revenue-streams.    The Senior Director will have an internal leadership role in ensuring diversity and inclusion, primary and behavioral healthcare integration, and continuous quality improvement.  S/he will oversee the models of care within the program and establish programmatic policies and procedures, while ensuring quality service, clinical excellence and operational effectiveness.  This position is responsible for overall clinical performance and quality outcomes management and will work closely with the QI Director to generate usable information for program improvement.  Location:Ina Kay Building200 Wood Hill RoadRockville, MD  20850			Apply Now:Please submit the following application materials to careers@jssa.org:•	Cover letter with salary requirements•	Resume•	Contact information for 3 supervisory referencesAbout JSSA: The Jewish Social Service Agency (JSSA) has been helping people across the Washington metropolitan area meet emotional, social, and physical challenges for more than 120 years. A nonsectarian provider, we serve people of all religious backgrounds, races and ethnicities, helping the youngest child to the most fragile senior, from individuals to entire families. JSSA provides services and support to nearly 30,000 individuals a year through our wide range of counseling, educational, specialized employment, in-home support, hospice and nursing care, and social services. We are a growing Agency and strive to be an Employer of Choice. As such we offer a competitive salary and benefits package, a healthy work-life balance, collaborative team environment and many opportunities for personal growth and professional development. We pride ourselves on our mission to be the first place for the Jewish community, as well as the community at large, to turn for clinical and social services of the highest quality that sustain and nurture all who seek assistance. Learn more about us at www.jssa.org. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.   AA/M/F/D

We intend to become THE place where America's entire green community gets together - an e-commons that will synergize the force, and the potential, of these scattered actors.See all about it at www.stevesweave.net.We now need to reach a critical mass of users. To receive feedback about how to make the site better.2. To receive 'likes' on Facebook.3. To inspire people to use the site as a living resource.This volunteer position would require as little as 4-5 hours per week and run for no longer than six months.  But all terms are flexible, and nothing obligatory - except enthusiasm.An ideal candidate would be self-motivated, expressive and passionately concerned about green issues.We believe the site can make a significant contribution to the effectiveness of America's green movement, and participating in its development would seem likely to embellish any marketing student's CV - while adding something genuinely good to the world.Now in beta in Boston/Cambridge, we hope to go nationwide within six months.  Think

654.desc: SCIENCE TEACHER (Grades 3-8)William E. Doar Jr. Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ)ABOUT THE SCHOOLThe William E. Doar Jr Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ) blends rigorous academics with world-class arts instruction provided by artists from renowned dance, musical, theatrical, and visual arts institutions. WEDJ is the only public charter school in Washington, DC to provide professional-caliber arts training for students in PreK through eighth grade at no cost to families. WEDJ serves more than 430 elementary and middle school students, a majority of whom are African American, and 85% of whom qualify for free/reduced priced lunch.In pursuit of an academic program that matches the success of its arts program, WEDJ partnered with TenSquare, a proven school turnaround partner, to launch a comprehensive school improvement effort in January 2014. Within five months of starting the interventions, student proficiency on the 2014 state exam increased by almost 12% in math and in four out of six grades in ELA. WEDJ’s Performance Management Framework (PMF) score also increased over 11 points, from a borderline Tier 3 score of 36.5 in 2013 to a solid Tier 2 score of 47.6 in 2014. The TenSquare team will continue to partner with WEDJ leadership throughout SY 15-16 and beyond. TenSquare will support teachers at WEDJ through intensive instructional coaching and professional development, curriculum and planning support, and school and classroom culture development. For additional information about WEDJ, visit www.wedjschool.us. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWEDJ is looking for a Science Teacher to fill an immediate vacancy. A Science Teacher at WEDJ is responsible for the following:CURRICULUM AND PLANNING•	Creating curriculum including unit and lesson plans aligned to Common Core standards•	Structuring compelling, standards-based lessons that challenge students’ critical thinking and align with lesson, unit, and grade-level objectivesINSTRUCTION•	Utilizing strong content knowledge to effectively present material to students•	Incorporating joy and rigor in lessons and so that students are excited about and invested in their academic excellence  •	Employing multiple methods to accommodate different learning styles and abilities, including special education students and English language learners•	Participating in all professional development opportunitiesASSESSMENT•	Assessing students academic and developmental growth through observation and a variety of assessment methods•	Tracking and monitor assessment results in order to regularly refine teaching practices and design differentiated lesson plansSCHOOL CULTURE•	Create a positive learning environment that promotes high expectations and provides opportunities for all students to experience success •	Maintaining positive, professional relationships with students, families, and colleagues •	Communicating with students, parents, school staff to ensure that students are on-track in their learning and making progress towards goals

655.desc: SOCIAL STUDIES TEACHER (Grades 3-8)William E. Doar Jr. Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ)ABOUT THE SCHOOLThe William E. Doar Jr Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ) blends rigorous academics with world-class arts instruction provided by artists from renowned dance, musical, theatrical, and visual arts institutions. WEDJ is the only public charter school in Washington, DC to provide professional-caliber arts training for students in PreK through eighth grade at no cost to families. WEDJ serves more than 430 elementary and middle school students, a majority of whom are African American, and 85% of whom qualify for free/reduced priced lunch.In pursuit of an academic program that matches the success of its arts program, WEDJ partnered with TenSquare, a proven school turnaround partner, to launch a comprehensive school improvement effort in January 2014. Within five months of starting the interventions, student proficiency on the 2014 state exam increased by almost 12% in math and in four out of six grades in ELA. WEDJ’s Performance Management Framework (PMF) score also increased over 11 points, from a borderline Tier 3 score of 36.5 in 2013 to a solid Tier 2 score of 47.6 in 2014. The TenSquare team will continue to partner with WEDJ leadership throughout SY 15-16 and beyond. TenSquare will support teachers at WEDJ through intensive instructional coaching and professional development, curriculum and planning support, and school and classroom culture development. For additional information about WEDJ, visit www.wedjschool.us. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWEDJ is looking for a Social Studies Teacher to fill an immediate vacancy. 656.desc: SPECIAL COORDINATORWilliam E. Doar Jr. Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ)ABOUT THE SCHOOLThe William E. Doar Jr Public Charter School for the Performing Arts (WEDJ) blends rigorous academics with world-class arts instruction provided by artists from renowned dance, musical, theatrical, and visual arts institutions. WEDJ is the only public charter school in Washington, DC to provide professional-caliber arts training for students in PreK through eighth grade at no cost to families. WEDJ serves more than 475 elementary and middle school students, a majority of whom are African American, and 85% of whom qualify for free/reduced priced lunch.In pursuit of an academic program that matches the success of its arts program, WEDJ partnered with TenSquare, a proven school turnaround partner, to launch a comprehensive school improvement effort in January 2014. Within five months of starting the interventions, student proficiency on the 2014 state exam increased by almost 12% in math and in four out of six grades in ELA. WEDJ’s Performance Management Framework (PMF) score also increased over 11 points, from a borderline Tier 3 score of 36.5 in 2013 to a solid Tier 2 score of 47.6 in 2014. The TenSquare team will continue to partner with WEDJ leadership throughout SY 15-16 and beyond. TenSquare will support teachers and leaders at WEDJ through intensive instructional coaching and professional development, curriculum and planning support, and school and classroom culture development. For additional information about WEDJ, visit www.wedjschool.us. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWEDJ seeks a Special Coordinator to begin immediately. The Special Coordinator at WEDJ works to improve traditional and technological literacy of students with a focus on college and career readiness. S/he is responsible for the following:•	Collaborating with classroom teachers to identify students in need of literacy intervention, collecting necessary student data to evaluate reading problems, and providing assistance with Tier I and Tier II interventions; •	Facilitating and performing literacy screenings;•	Providing individual or small group instruction to students as needed in ELA;•	Serving as a literacy resource to regular classroom teachers by assisting them in organizing their reading program, selecting materials, and relating their instructional program to the differentiated needs of students;•	Modeling effective strategies for teaching struggling readers in the classroom;•	Facilitating professional development in the areas of school wide literacy strategies, small group and whole group literacy instruction, and integrating technology into core subject instruction;•	Collaborating with the Academic Director, Head of Academics, and TenSquare team to make data driven literacy intervention decisions;•	Collaborating with leadership to ensure that the ELA curriculum is Common Core-aligned and up-to-date;•	Building digital literacy and access to digital content;•	Oversees the inventory, distribution, collection, and return of technology and supplemental materials;•	Seeking out and participating in appropriate professional development opportunities; •	Developing and maintaining positive and productive relationships with students families; •	Contributing to the school community through participation, professionalism, collegiality, and passion;•	Performing any other duties as assigned by the Academic Director and Head of Academics.

657.desc: OverviewOur Elementary School Science Teacher role is an opportunity for individuals who are passionate about science and transforming education in New York City Public Schools. As a Science Teacher you will lead hands-on, inquiry-based exploration, instilling a love of science and discovery in your students. About Success AcademyAt Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Our schools rank in the top 1% in Math and top 3% in English among all New York State schools, while serving children with an overall poverty rate of 77%. We also act as a catalyst and model for education reform nationwide so that all kids can have access to high-quality schools. Success Academy Charter Schools are dedicated to academic excellence, character development, and extracurricular achievement with college graduation as an end goal. In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning.  Success Academy’s world-class science program begins in kindergarten, with hands-on, inquiry-based science instruction five days a week with a dedicated science teacher. Success Academy scientists conduct experiments and discuss observations, data, and results in the same way professional scientists do. Our science instruction not only ignites a passion for science early in life, but it also provides scholars with critical thinking skills. We believe all children can achieve at extremely high levels, and we believe this starts with the dedication of exceptional and diligent adults. We are building a movement to transform public education. It’s no easy feat, but we can promise it will be one of the most rewarding. Responsibilities At Success Academy we incorporate the three main disciplines of science - Life, Physical and Earth - into each year's curriculum. On any given day, a scholar might dissect a flower, program a robot, or conduct scratch tests to identify minerals! Our teachers become expert facilitators able to deliver instruction based on the needs of their students and promote a culture of learning. Our curriculum is aligned to the NYS Elementary and Intermediate Science Core Curriculum and is designed to meet and exceed state standards with an emphasis on critical thinking and discussion. Our curriculum also allows teachers to utilize lessons based on the Next Generation Science Standards.  Our Elementary School Science Teacher will:•	Join a groundbreaking faculty of teachers who are committed to closing the achievement gap and raising the bar for all children.•	Be part of a highly motivated team committed to education reform, parent choice, and the building of exemplary schools.•	Collaborate regularly with school leaders—receiving ongoing coaching and mentorship.•	Teach in a fully equipped science lab with abundant materials.•	Engage scholars with an inquiry-based curriculum.

658.desc: Organizational Background:Dress for Success Philadelphia is a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit organization affiliated with Dress for Success, an international not-for-profit organization that promotes the economic independence of unemployed and underemployed women by providing professional attire, a network of support and the career development tools to help women thrive in work and in life.  We serve 2,500 job-ready women each year who are referred to us by nonprofit and governmental agencies, including domestic violence agencies, homeless shelters and job training programs. Dress for Success Philadelphia is located at Rodin Place, 2000 Hamilton Street, Suite C-100, just north of the Barnes Foundation and Free Library of Philadelphia.About the Internship:Dress for Success Philadelphia is seeking non-paid Administrative Support Interns to assist with client services, marketing, social media, and fundraising. Administrative Support Interns will have direct contact with clients and will be involved in developing and tracking client statistics.To Apply:•	Submit a cover letter and resume to lauren@dfsphilly.org using the subject line ADMINISTRATIVE INTERN APPLICANT; •	Include your desired weekly hours/schedule, and your target start and end dates;•	Briefly tell us about your academic and/or personal outcomes/goals for the internship.

660.desc: Dress for Success Philadelphia, Inc. is seeking an energetic, detail-oriented, and enthusiastic Development and Communications Intern for 5-10 hours per week starting January 2016.The mission of Dress for Success is to promote the economic independence of women in financial need by providing professional attire, a network of support and the career development tools to help women thrive in work and in life.This is an excellent opportunity for the intern to gain experience in and familiarity with areas such as fundraising, communications, and the day-to-day operations of a nonprofit organization with a global brand.Responsibilities:The Development and Communications Intern will report to the Executive Director.  Areas of responsibilities may include:•	Conduct preliminary research on prospective corporate and foundation donors•	Assist in implementing leadership giving club(s)•	Assist with developing and implementing special events•	Write, edit and proofread development and communications materials•	Assist with mailings, Board meetings, and varied projects as neededHow to applyPlease send cover letter and CV via email in PDF format to nancy@dfsphilly.org  with

661.desc: The Bartrams Garden Community Boathouse is located at Bartram's Garden, a 45 acre site in Southwest Philadelphia, on the Schuylkill River, that contains a historic house, one a the country's oldest botanical garden, community farm & orchard and open space. It is a 20 minute bike ride from UPenn and easy to get to by Septa. The Boathouse intern will assist the River Programs Manager in running our public programs, which includes free boating opportunities for the public, water quality testing, and environmental education. Th intern will also assist in our special events, including the Tidal Schuylkill Boat Parade, Schuylkill Skiffs and Southwest Fishing Derby. We are looking for a creative thinker who enjoys working with the public and being on the water. This is an unpaid position, however intern will have unlimited access to our fleet of kayaks and rowboats for your own personal use, as well as free admission to all Bartram's Garden events and activities. We can reimburse you for any commuting cots.  A fantastic opportunity for someone who enjoys kayaking, wants to learn about running a public recreation program and has an interest in urban watersheds. Send your resume with a brief email explaining your nterest to  Danielle at danielle@bartramsgarden.orgFor more information: www.facebook.com/tidalschuylkill/www.bartramsgarden.orgwww.tidalschuylkill.org

664.desc: JRI America, Inc., (JRI-A) is seeking sharp, talented, and energetic graduates with a desire to be part of an intensive mentorship program in information security. If you are passionate about an exciting and rewarding career, we want to speak with you! This is an opportunity to become a member of our Information Security team in New York and to learn highly valued technical skills in order to maintain the integrity of our data, counter threats, and protect our information assets.Who we are:JRI-A provides innovative IT solutions for Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC), the core member of Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), a Tokyo-based bank holding company with 68,000 employees in 40+ countries and $1.5 trillion assets under management, placing SMBC among the largest 25 banks globally by assets. JRI-A supports SMBC’s operations in the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Africa. JRI-A is a subsidiary of the Japan Research Institute Ltd., the IT specialist subsidiary of SMFG.We invest in you. JRI-A provides SMBC with the information security required of a rapidly growing multinational bank with an expanding portfolio of financial products and services across the capital markets. As a member of our 2016 Security Practitioner Development Program, you will earn a competitive full-time salary and receive intensive mentorship on the latest enterprise class information security technologies. You will also work on projects to develop the next generation of IT security principles and practices. JRI-A’s mentorship program combines the close and collaborative spirit of a start-up with the backing of one of the largest and most respected institutions in the world.
