666.desc: JOB DESCRIPTIONFitch Ratings is currently inviting applications to our Summer Analyst program, which we are offering in our London, New York and Chicago offices.Candidates who are pursuing a college, university or graduate degree, who are in the penultimate year of study, are encouraged to apply.  Ideal candidates will have a financial flair and a keen interest in credit, fixed income and industry analysis.This is a ten week program designed to introduce you to broad credit training and to also immerse you in our day-to-day work activities and special projects working with up to two of our various product groups.You will learn about the work we do at Fitch, why we’re so important in the global market, and our culture.  You will learn the ethical and procedural responsibilities of being an analytical team member.  You will also receive the exposure, and foundational credit and analytical training that will serve as a strong building block for your future career development.  And the most important component is the on-the-job learning opportunities that a Summer Analyst position provides.

667.desc: Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe LLP is a leading international law firm headquartered in San Francisco, with approximately 1,100 lawyers in 25 offices worldwide working together to pursue the objectives of serving its clients and building an enduring institution. Orrick has been practicing law in Asia since 1972, the earliest of any foreign law firm. Today, the firm has more than 80 lawyers based in Beijing, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Taipei and Tokyo. Our clients in Asia include Fortune 100 companies, major industrial and financial corporations, commercial and investment banks, high-growth companies and start-ups, and governmental entities. For more information, please visit our website www.orrick.com.We are recruiting legal assistants to start in the firm's Hong Kong office. The legal assistants would primarily work in the Corporate – Capital Markets group, which continues to build significant momentum in Asia.These are attractive job opportunities for those who are interested in a career in law (or investment banking) in Asia. The legal assistants will work closely with associates and partners on a variety of assignments for Asia-based clients, including assisting in the drafting of offering documents and conducting due diligence on prospective Asian issuers. Successful candidates will gain strong transactional experience in IPOs and other corporate finance transactions. They will also regularly interact with senior management of the firms' clients and have the opportunity to work on transactions with a high degree of independence. The firm's merit-based culture allows enterprising candidates to take on significant responsibilities. High-performance candidates have a number of options on completing their time in China, including advancement within the firm, moving on to law school or business school, or pursuing corporate finance opportunities in Asia. Suitable candidates shall be highly motivated, interested in law or business in Asia, and willing to commit at least two years to the positions. Following two types of candidates are welcome. i) Without legal education background: Completed degree with major in English is preferred. Having the working experience in accounting or audit would be a plus. ii) With legal education background: Qualified lawyer with at least one year of legal practicing experience in Australia or United Kingdom ideally. Trained and qualified at international law firm would be an advantage.  Candidates should have strong academic qualifications with at least second upper level of honours of degree with reputable universities (law degree for qualified lawyer candidates). Near native written and spoken English and native in Mandarin are essential. Interested candidates should send a cover letter, resume and academic transcripts to asiarecruiting@orrick.com.

668.desc: VOLUNTEER/RESEARCH MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR FAMILIES IN CRISISWe are looking for you if you are:1) Majoring in: Law, Public Affairs, Nursing, Medicine, Public Health, Social Work, Behavioral Health, and other disciplines:     - or are interested in cause related media creation (writing, directing, editing, filming etc)     - or enjoy learning new research methods in public health;     - or love designing marketing strategies and materials;2) Are organized and professional;3) Enjoy flexible hours and working environments;4) Are entrepreneurial minded but like working in teams;5) Have a heart for making a difference; and6) Are dependable and take pride in doing excellent work.We are a collaboration of creative people, organizations and communities who believe violence against women and children is wrong and work effectively to end this 100% preventable tragedy. DID YOU KNOW in Philadelphia alone 400, 9-1-1 calls are made EVERYDAY for help by women and children being violently attacked by a parent or partner?We are an inspired team of volunteers that create educational tools for healthcare professionals, first-responders (such as DHS, police officers, shelter workers etc) and other service providers.  We also design innovative preventative awareness campaigns to empower women and inspire an end violence against women and children.Speranza Human Compassion Project’s main objective is to ensure every intimate relationship is safe and every home is a safe place for women and children to thrive, love and grow.  Join our team.. we would love to have you! THESE ARE ALL VOLUNTEER AND RESEARCH INTERNSHIPS WITH NO FORMAL FINANCIAL COMPENSATION.***Men are strongly encouraged to apply and be a part of this important mission.

669.desc: Over the past five years, Butler Burgher Group (www.bbgres.com) has emerged as a leader the real estate valuation and advisory industry with national coverage, extensive expertise, and a proactive approach to meeting the needs of our clients.  BBG ranks among the four largest commercial real estate valuation and consulting firms in the U.S., with 21 offices nationwide, including New York City where the opportunity is located.  Our client base includes the full range of financial institutions from local thrifts to international investment banks.  We also serve equity investors, as well as accountants and attorneys for estate planning and litigation support.  The training program is defined by an independent, yet supportive environment in which the junior analyst will acquire skills in appraisal theory, real estate finance, market analysis, and demographic study.  The position involves a mixture of desk and field work, with new challenges and opportunities presented as the analyst builds a body of knowledge.  The focus is on-the-job learning, as trainees will be responsible for managing their own caseload, seeing assignments through to completion.  Therefore, this position is best suited to an ambitious individual who enjoys problem solving, and is able to focus on the details while never losing sight of the big picture.  Further, the ideal candidate has strong research and analysis skills, and is an effective communicator.  If you are a self-starter with a passion for real estate and a knack for analytics, please submit your qualifications to join our growing team.

670.desc: Blippar is the world’s leading augmented reality start up and a CNBC Top 50 Disruptor, ranked ahead of Snapchat, Spotify, and Pinterest.Since launching in 2011, Blippar has been building something that’s going to change the world: a brand new behavior we like to call visual browsing.  Our goal is big and unabashedly bold: to seamlessly and completely bridge the physical and digital worlds using our extraordinary image-recognition and augmented reality technologies.  We welcome applications for internships in our Data and Corporate Strategy Department, responsible for helping Blippar conduct key analyses across commercial strategy, data, corporate development, pricing, and other core areas.  Interns should expect to work alongside big data and strategy managers in supporting industry research, data analysis, and other priority projects.  Each intern is paired with a mentor from the department who provides guidance and coaching throughout the internship period as well as formal feedback at the conclusion of the program.  We are currently hiring for our Summer 2016 program in New York

671.desc: Graphic DesignerMOD Worldwide – Philadelphia, PANo boring people allowed.Are you encoded by our design?We want the rebel whose deepest fear is fitting in, the thrill seeker who was born with the need to express digital emotions. The detail driven. Wait, make that obsessed. You see the world as a dream where the possibilities are endless, and just happen to be a graphic designer. RESPONSIBILITIES:• Working with an immense range of clients in all sizes.• Interpreting the client's business needs and developing a concept to suit their purpose.• Presenting finalized ideas and concepts to clients or account managers.• Working on teams as well as self-directed.• Estimating the time required to complete the work and providing quotes for clients.MIGHTS:• Agency experience.• Knowledge of PowerPoint. Prezi, Brainshark.

672.desc: Job Overview:Are you looking to travel and play a critical role in the creation of promotional products for some of the most recognized brands in the world?  Are you adventurous and excited by the opportunity to travel for work?  Pop! Promos, The Philadelphia 100’s #1 fastest growing company for 2015, and a leading supplier in the 25 billion dollar US promotional products industry, is seeking a full-time entrepreneurial-minded Product Manager to play an integral role in driving our product development.As the Product Manager, your mission will involve managing our product launches and the supply chain between the US and China.  Through collaboration with our team, you will work to deliver value to the highest performing distributors in North America by shortening the supply chain and focusing on high-growth, high-margin products where we have a cost advantage over our competitors.  We specialize in producing custom-made, Pantone matched products such as sunglasses, touchscreen gloves, cell phone accessories, and more.We work in a fast-paced and strong team environment, and often celebrate milestones with after hours events such as happy hours, bowling and other activities. Only apply if you are up for long hours, hard work, and great rewards!Essential Duties and Responsibilities:• Set a vision for our products by conducting market research and identifying products that are underserved in the promotional industry• Collaborate with and provide direction to our sales, art, marketing, and production teams in the United States (Philadelphia) to plan and execute the launch of our products• Travel to factories in China to identify the supply chain for our products, and build and maintain relationships with dependable and functioning factories• Optimize product development while ensuring each team is clear on their objectives• Regularly document quantitative data (e.g., currency, duties, weight) into an already established Excel template and process• Learn everything there is to know about the products in development, and be able to answer all sorts of questions, including questions related to quality control and safetyEssential Requirements:• College degree with GPA over 3.5• Experienced with (or strong desire to learn) international product development• Ability to quickly learn and manage our non-traditional supply-chain model• Strong leadership skills including the ability to make and clearly communicate decisions, deal with ambiguity, and lead in a fast-paced, culturally-diverse environment• Ability to travel to factories in China required (40-60 days per year)• Advanced quantitative skills (able to quickly convert between currencies, weights, calculate duties)• Intermediate experience with Microsoft Excel Required• Business sense and ability to think analytically• Cost efficient judgment skills• Proven organizational skills• Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills; ability to read, write, and speak Chinese is a plus, but not requiredApply with a resume and cover letter via the following link: https://go.janehires.com:443/Jobs/VrpS6F7dk0OL4R5yX7BmJQ

673.desc: Spring fellowship at LocalAventura, an exciting tech startup!Company: LocalAventura is the easiest and most authentic way to travel to Latin America. We believe that by connecting people and allowing them to explore the world together, we can improve it. Similar to Airbnb's platform, LocalAventura's website provides tourists with the ability to easily find authentic tour guides for their travels in Latin America. LocalAventura is a Philadelphia area startup which was founded by two Wharton alumnae and is currently participating in the Penn iCorps accelerator and the Wharton Venture Initiation Program.Position: we are looking for a spring intern excited to wear many hats and be involved in various operational aspects of a startup. Our ideal candidate easily moves between an independent work environment and collaborative atmosphere and is comfortable in both scenarios.  This person isn’t shy and will be happy to pick up the phone to talk with, interview, or gather information from anyone. We also have a preference for candidates with programming backgrounds, Latin American work experience, and/or Spanish speaking skills.What we offer you: We want to make sure you receive a learning experience that fits your career goals.  You will learn how to work in a startup environment and, since we are a part of two accelerators, have ample opportunity to network with other professionals in the startup, marketing and tech worlds.  At the end of the internship, you will have gained a broad experience in various aspects of a startup company from marketing to sales to product development and more.Hours/week: 10-40 hours/weekLocation: Our company operates in Latin America, so we are most excited for you to be based with us in Santiago, Chile or in another Latin American city. However, we will discuss the opportunity to be remote if you are interested. Timing: The position begins as soon as the spring semester begins. Pay: Unfortunately, this is currently an unpaid opportunity with the opportunity to be considered for a future paid position.  The pay will be intangibles that are very meaningful…early stage start-up experience, working with experienced professionals, making great contacts, introductions and recommendations, having fun, and more.If interested: Please email andrea@localaventura.com with the subject line “Spring 2016 Internship”. Include your resume and a brief description about yourself that let’s us know why you feel this would be a great opportunity for you.www.LocalAventura.com

674.desc: First Quality Enterprises, Inc. (FQE), founded in 1988, is a global multi-billion dollar privately held company with over 4,200 employees.  Its corporate offices are located in Great Neck, New York, with manufacturing facilities and offices in Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Georgia, Canada, and China.  FQE is a diversified family of companies manufacturing consumer products ranging from Absorbent Hygiene (adult incontinence, feminine care, and baby care), Tissue (bath and towel), and Industrial (non-woven fabrics, print and packaging materials, thermoformed plastics), serving institutional and retail markets throughout the world.  FQE focuses on private label and branded product lines.Our core business philosophy is built on a proud culture driven by safety and quality, respect, humility, integrity, customer focus, and teamwork.  With leading edge manufacturing technologies and processes and visionary leadership, FQE is positioned to continue significant growth in the coming years.  We are seeking an experienced Lab Technician for our manufacturing facility located in King of Prussia, PA.  This position is under the direction of a Scientist or Manager and assists in the development of new and proprietary Personal Care Absorbent Product designs. This position would perform product and material lab testing, assist with consumer use testing and plant trials, and generate product prototypes when necessary.Primary responsibilities include:•Participate as a member of the R&D department; execute projects in timely, diligent, safe, and professional manner, and contribute to the growth of the team and department.•Responsible for understanding and performing lab tests on prototype, competitive, and upstream products and materials.•Document work procedures and test results accurately and completely in a laboratory notebook.•Summarize test results, statistical analysis, conclusions, and recommendations in technical reports.•Manually assemble prototype products.•Assist in trial preparation, provide trial support to manufacturing, and test new or experimental trial products.•Support corporate proprietary technology by documenting novel ideas.•Provide competitive product analysis for product development and marketing.•Develop and document new lab test methods to better predict and understand product performance in use.•Other duties as assigned with or without accommodation.The ideal candidate will possess the following skills:•Bachelors or Associates degree in engineering, textiles or science preferred.•Two to five years in R&D or college lab testing.•Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks, knowledge of retail absorbent products, hands on mechanical aptitude, experience using basic lab equipment, including high school lab science classes.•Flexibility to adapt to rapidly changing priorities and workloads.•Proven team player with strong interpersonal skills.•Able to speak, read and write the English language. •Have strong oral and written communication skills, as well as basic computer skills with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.•Able to travel occasionally in United States.The company’s philosophy and work environment has been created by an ownership that places a premium on integrity, honesty and teamwork. As important as a candidate’s qualifications, is their ability to work closely with their colleagues and strive in a politics and ego free work environment.Excellent compensation and benefit package!E/O/E

675.desc: The Omni Team in the Global Real Assets group within JP Morgan Asset Management currently has one full-time position open for an analyst. JPMAM GRA has 400+ personnel across the world managing over $85 billion in assets across real estate, infrastructure and global maritime and transport. Our Omni group is a small, tight-knit team of finance professionals who work closely with portfolio managers, research professionals, client advisors and product specialists across the platform to provide real assets portfolio solutions to large, global, institutional investors such as pension funds, sovereign wealth funds and insurance firms. We are seeking candidates who possess a mix of strong technical and finance skills, especially computer programming, and the ability thrive in a challenging and hard-working but collegial environment. The analyst would be responsible for assisting in the execution of all aspects of the Omni platform, although prior asset management experience is not required – just a willingness to learn and to work collaboratively! We are based in JP Morgan’s global headquarters at 270 Park Avenue in New York. If you have any interest in this position or would like to explore the opportunity further, then please call Nancy Lu at (212) 648-0638 or send her an email at nancy.lu@jpmorgan.com. She’s the analyst on the team who would be happy to answer any and all questions.

676.desc: Please apply online through our careers page found here: https://app.jobvite.com/j?aj=oeo8Xfwr&s=University_job_boardWe're looking for a sharp and creative developer who loves all things iOS. We're the clear leader in Home Goods e-commerce and hit over $1 Billion in 2014 sales; we're working on becoming a leader in e-commerce mobile as well. There are enormous challenges in creating native applications for highly complex, multi-tier sites with extensive functionality. We sell 7+ million products and are seen by over 4 million people per month!Several projects you'd be part of:Several million users have already downloaded our existing iOS appWe are building several new Android and iOS apps to represent all the Wayfair brands (5 current e-commerce sites)Work closely as an important partner in a talented open, & fun e-commerce engineering teamUse the latest open tools and processes like git and scrumAbout Wayfair Mobile:Our mobile apps are a highly visible part of the Wayfair brand  We are committed to giving users an excellent experience on their mobile devicesOur mobile apps have been downloaded over 1.5 million timesWe send nearly 1 million push messages to users every dayWe have an open and fun culture where we use our brainsWe are committed to using open tools like git, cocoapods, and JenkinsWe have the pace of a start-up combined with the stability of a billion dollar company What you bring to the table: Sense of humor and a love of mobile technologiesGreat communication skills and a genuine team orientationUnderstanding of the mobile market: how apps are designed, built, tested and submitted to the app store and maintained / enhancedStrong desire to learn and grow both with Mobile technologies and traditional client / server technologies  Learn more:Engineering blog: engineering.wayfair.comCheck out our iPhone and iPad apps: https://itunes.apple.com/us/developer/wayfair-llc/id525522335***This is an on-site only position working from our Boston, MA office. This is NOT a freelance, contract, or remote position.***About Wayfair:Wayfair (NYSE: W) offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and décor across all styles and price points. With an unparalleled selection of more than seven million home items from 7,000 suppliers, Wayfair helps people find the perfect product at the right price. Our unparalleled selection and superior customer service coupled with the convenience of online shopping, makes it easier than ever before to find exactly what you want for your home. The Wayfair family of brands includes:Wayfair.com, an online destination for all things homeJoss & Main, an online flash sales site offering inspiring home design dailyAllModern, a go-to online source for modern designDwellStudio, a design house for fashion-forward modern furnishingsBirch Lane, a collection of classic furnishings and timeless home décorWayfair is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, and employs 2,000 people across its eight global locations of Boston, New York, Ogden, Utah, Hebron, Kentucky, Galway, Ireland, London, Berlin and Sydney.  The company has previously been named one of America’s Most Promising Companies by Forbes Magazine and selected by the Boston Business Journal and Glassdoor.com as a Top Company to Work For and Top Company for Well Balanced Life.

677.desc: Senior Analyst  Division: Manatt HealthPosition Title: Senior AnalystOffice Location: New YorkJob Req.#: 102Brief Description: Manatt Health is the interdisciplinary health policy and business strategy advisory division of Manatt, Phelps and Phillips, LLP, one of the nation's preeminent health care law and consulting firms. Manatt Health is comprised of a dedicated team of approximately 65 professionals providing their knowledge and expertise to leading healthcare organizations to strategize and resolve complex issues to help improve quality, efficiency, and safety of care.Manatt Health attracts a wide range of for-profit and non-profit clients in both the public and private sectors including health care providers, coalitions and associations of providers, heath plans and other payors, foundations, health information technology vendors, and federal and state government.Position Overview:Manatt Health is seeking a highly qualified Senior Analysts to join our growing team. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of our nationally recognized healthcare practice, with one of the leading health reform practices in the country.Senior Analysts are an important part of the Manatt Health team and play a key role in client engagements. Responsibilities include policy and quantitative research, project management support, presentation development and design, and assistance with monitoring federal and state health policy developments, health care provider markets, and other emerging healthcare trends. Senior Analysts work on a broad range of substantive issues including: payment and delivery system transformation; Medicaid policy, re-design and innovation; strategic planning services; health reform implementation; health IT strategy; and pharmaceutical market access, coverage and reimbursement strategies.

678.desc: Ramapo for Children offers college students a valuable and highly unique summer job experience through one of our programs: Camp Ramapo.  Ramapo runs one of the few residential summer camps that specifically serves children with social, emotional, and learning challenges.  At our camp, staff members believe that all children want to succeed, and embrace the challenges of working with special needs children.  Many of our staff alumni describe their work at Ramapo as having been a formative experience, and have gone on to be teachers, psychologists, social workers, organization directors, and even founders of national service nonprofits.Camp Ramapo has a one-to-one staff-to-camper ratio that not only helps children who need more supervision and support, but also provides staff members with the intensive, hands-on experience that they need to grow professionally. Staff members receive the same state-of-the-art training that we provide to teachers and other youth-service professionals already working in the field.  This training equips them with practical techniques to build positive relationships, create supportive environments for children with special needs, and grow to become leaders in the field. Summer staff lives on the Rhinebeck campus from June–August working to make lasting contributions to children with social, emotional, or learning challenges. Ramapo has a 1:1 staff-to-camper ratio to benefit children who need more support, supervision, and attention. You will lead activities and serve as a role model to these children.In addition, students can gain up to 9 hours of course credit by taking Ramapo’s on-site college course through the National College Credit Recommendation Service. On their transcript, the course will be listed through Excelsior College of the University of the State of New York and can be credited as: Education, Special Education, Educational Psychology, Therapeutic Recreation, Group Dynamics, Outdoor Recreation, Physical Education, Recreation, Camp Counseling, or Community Service.  Departments may also have a fieldwork or independent study course which can be combined with this work.

679.desc: Accepted students will participate in the spring term of the Penn in Washington Semester, interning in Washington at an international aid organization, a foreign policy think tank, the State Department, or some other internationally oriented organization. Students will take four political science courses, including one course on international development or diplomacy. They will then spend the summer in the country that was the focus of their spring internship at a field office of an international aid organization, an embassy, a think tank or a similar organization. For the spring semester, students who intern for a non-profit or the government will receive a $1,500 stipend. For the summer, a stipend of $2,500 will be provided to cover travel and housing expenses. Students will be chosen based on their foreign language ability, relevant coursework, GPA, and other factors. The application deadline for spring 2017 is March 15, 2016.

680.desc: Calling All Instructors!Have you been looking to experience a new culture and take a break from the daily routine of your current position? Are you currently a graduate student who is interested in spending summer break abroad? Would you like to build off your current experience in a vibrant environment where students are eager to learn what you have to teach them? The Princeton Review Korea is looking for someone like you!Our global network and years of experience provide assurance that no other institute in Korea can offer. With our headquarters in Boston, The Princeton Review is a global organization with over 700 locations around the world. As the largest international TPR office in the world, The Princeton Review Korea (TPRK) has distinguished itself as a reliable leader in the Korean education industry.TPRK operates out of two state-of-the-art facilities in the heart of downtown Seoul. TPRK’s prime locations allow for our employees to fully experience all that Seoul has to offer.The Princeton Review Korea conducts intensive courses during June, July, and August for our Summer Intensive session. TPRK staff members are actively seeking reliable and motivated people to join our team of talented instructors. The details are provided below:Teaching the SATStarting in 2016, students will be taking the newly revised SAT, and we at TPRK will be preparing them for it. Working in our summer intensive program as an instructor will present an interesting challenge and will provide you with valuable experience. The Princeton Review is well-known for its strategic approach to “cracking” the test—and the new SAT is no exception. We have both the materials and the experience to equip you to be an effective and confident test-prep instructor. If you come willing to learn the in-and-outs of the SAT, to master the test, to become a leader in the classroom, then we will be there to help you along the way in our mission to raise students’ scores.Training Schedule:May Training: May 23rd ~ June 3rdJune Training: June 20th ~ June 30th*Dates are subject to change according to summer schedule. *All candidates must receive mandatory training. Session Schedule:Option 1: June 6th ~ July 28th (June to July)Option 2: July 1st ~ August 30th (June to August)Option 3: July 1st ~ August 30th (July and August)*Dates are subject to change*Option 2 and 3 only opened to candidates that are able to teach SAT and other Subjects.Required Documents: Must have the following documents prior to May 2016 - Original Diploma *Notarized with an apostille - Nationwide Criminal Background Check *Notarized with an apostilleCompensation:Instructor will be paid 25,000KRW an hour. Instructors can work up to 40 hours a week and make up to 4,000,000KRW per month and 12,000,000KRW for three months of work.Employee Benefits-	TPRK’s professional teacher training-	Continental breakfast on teaching days -	Weekly reward for best teachers -	Monthly teachers’ appreciation trip -	Airfare & housing support -	Welcome bag and TPRK Uniform-	New teachers’ settlement support programAirfare Reimbursement:The Princeton Review Korea will provide overseas instructors with economy class airfare into Seoul, Korea, from an agreed upon international airport and from Seoul to an agreed upon international airport upon completion of the contract based on the following criteria:1.	Roundtrip airfare reimbursement for instructors working all 3 months of the Summer Intensive Program.2.	One-way airfare reimbursement for instructors working 2 months of the Summer Intensive Program.*All airfare reimbursements will be received after successful completion of instructor’s contracted term.Housing Support:The Princeton Review Korea will provide and assist in finding housing for instructors for the duration of employment. The provided housing will be dormitory style studio apartments in the vicinity of the campus that instructors are assigned to instruct at.Over the past 18 years, TPRK has built a fun and energetic environment conducive to learning and working. The work experience gained at TPRK will provide you with benefits today and in the future as you pursue your future career goals. We truly believe that you will experience life in one of the most interesting cities in the world and we’ll even pay for you to get here!If you feel like you are reliable, responsible, self-motivated and interested in working with us, please submit an application through our website: http://recruit.tpr.co.krSincerely,The Princeton Review Korea

681.company: DBHIDS Philadelphia Infant Toddler Early Intervention
681.desc: Work at the direction of, and in collaboration with, Philadelphia Infant Toddler Early Intervention Leadership team to accomplish the following activities:1.	Development of methods to ask families about their communication preferences, and collect and use this information. We may conduct focus groups, do surveys, or query parents at point of contact.2.	Development of protocols for EI Intake, Service Coordination and Service Delivery to follow families' communication preferences including texting and social media to support their completion of the process or continued participation. 3.	Modification to the procedures based on feedback and the evaluation of data.

682.position: Technical Consultant – Enterprise Content Intelligence (ECI) Group
682.desc: Technical Consultant – Enterprise Content Intelligence (ECI) GroupPerficient is always looking for the best and brightest technology talent to support our growing partner and client portfolio. We have scaled from a startup organization to an industry leader by delivering business-driven technology solutions to solve real business problems for mid-sized and large corporations throughout the U.S. and abroad.Perficient is currently looking for Technical Consultants for our offices in Washington, DC, New York, NY or Boston, MA. Job Description and Requirements•	Design and build business applications with content management and workflow technologies. These technologies include enterprise software packages from vendors such as IBM, EMC, and PegaSystems as well as custom components•	Tasks generally include most phases of the system lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, documentation, training, and production support.  •	Candidates should have a solid background in software design and development with some experience in Java, JavaScript, .Net, and J2EE. At TriTek developers have the opportunity to work with new technologies including Web Services, AJAX, Hibernate, and Spring.At Perficient, we offer a competitive base salary, bonuses twice a year, a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental and vision, 401(k) with matching contributions, 3 weeks paid time off and 10 paid holidays per year.About PerficientPerficient is a leading Information Technology consulting firm serving clients throughout North America. Our IT consultants deliver business-driven technology solutions that enable our clients to gain competitive advantage, make their businesses more responsive to market opportunities and threats, strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners, improve productivity and reduce information technology costs.Since 1998, we have delivered successful project engagements for hundreds of Global 2000 and other large enterprise customers. During that time, we have grown from a startup to a publicly-traded firm with approximately 1,800 full-time professionals serving clients from locations in 24 strategic markets across North America, global delivery centers in Europe and China, and a technology consulting recruiting office in India.We have deep domain expertise in technology solutions that differentiate our firm. We use small, expert project teams that deliver high-value, measurable results by working collaboratively with clients through a user-centered, technology-based and business-driven solutions methodology. We believe this approach enhances return-on-investment for our clients by significantly reducing the time and risk associated with designing and implementing eBusiness integration solutions. To learn more about Perficient's services, solutions, products, and locations go to www.perficient.com.

683.desc: Guided and mentored by our expert staff (including former interns!), Noblis summer interns augment their classroom learning with hands on project work in: •	Modeling and simulation•	Cyber security•	Systems engineering•	Computer science•	Biometric technologies•	Life and chemical/biological sciences•	Telecommunications (including wireless technologies)•	Networks•	Data/Knowledge management•	Corporate business operations, e.g., finance and accounting, human resources/organizational development, information technology, event planning/coordination.Your contributions will make an enduring impact in the areas of National Security & Intelligence; Enterprise Transformation; Environmental Sustainability; Transportation (Air and Ground); Health Care Innovation; Noblis Sponsored Research; and Corporate Business Operations. Noblis is consistently recognized as a “Great Place to Work” and “One of the Best Mid-Sized Companies to Work For” by Washingtonian Magazine, Entrepreneur and The Great Place to Work Institute.  Noblis maintains a drug-free, smoke-free workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

684.position: Industrial Engineer | Supply Chain Consulting and Software Implementation
684.desc: The goal of the Implementation team is to ensure that the Areté application suite provides solutions to customers that drive excellent business processes.  Industrial Engineers will manage customer relationships by supporting application functionality, pursuing new business opportunities, and providing consulting and training. Additionally, Industrial Engineers will manage implementations of our application suite and proactively work with customers to provide them with the services they require.  This position provides direct daily contact with our global client base.CompanyAreté Inc. is a growing software and consulting firm committed to delivering elegant, effective supply chain planning solutions to a worldwide client base.  For over twenty-five years, Areté has been a client-centered, solution-focused firm devoted to innovation and excellence.  Areté has a sterling reputation for delivering state-of-the-art software, effective consulting services and excellent solution support.   Areté has offices in New York City and Pennington (very near Princeton) New Jersey. We provide a dynamic and friendly work environment and offer a competitive salary, health and dental plans, profit sharing, a 401(k) plan and more.  Areté, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

685.desc: Areté developers value clean, thoughtful code when solving problems and are comfortable dealing in abstract concepts and models while doing so.  A team-oriented atmosphere encourages employees to think creatively and cooperatively and promotes problem solving and concept building. Developers need to be able to evaluate efficient solutions appropriately when working in performance, scalability, and maintainability challenges. They have flexibility to work the way they feel is best for a given task:  individually, in pairs, or in larger groups.  This flexibility results in a dynamic work environment that varies day-to-day.  Development members work in a fast-paced, hands-on environment requiring contributions to all areas of the software life cycle, but lean heavily toward core and full-stack development.  Our company offers employees the opportunity to create unique career paths depending on their interests. One can choose to specialize in one or more technical fields such as algorithm design, database systems, and software architecture; or one could expand their role towards product management, implementation, and consulting.Areté, Inc. is a growing software and consulting firm committed to delivering elegant, effective supply chain planning solutions to a world-wide client base. Over the past twenty-five years, we have developed a sterling reputation for delivering state-of-the-art software, effective consulting services and excellent solution support.Areté’s development studio is located in the Flatiron district of New York City, one block from Madison Square Park. Our sales, support, and implementation teams are located near Princeton, New Jersey. We provide a dynamic and friendly work environment and offer competitive salary and an excellent benefits package.Areté, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

686.desc: BoardAssist, New York's leading personalized nonprofit board matching service, is recruiting for over 100 nonprofit boards serving locally, nationally and internationally. Nonprofit clients include charter schools, startups teaching economic independence to residents of Mali, Haiti and Afghanistan, and nonprofits serving the homeless and disenfranchised, among others. See http://boardassist.org/find-a-board/ for more.

687.desc: Philly Dance Fitness, an award-winning, independently owned dance fitness studio, is looking for part-time marketing and graphic design interns to help build and execute awareness, conversion and loyalty & retention marketing strategies.If you’ve got an affinity for strategic thinking, have a strong creative eye and enjoy putting plans into action, this internship may be the perfect opportunity for you. As a small company with lots of room to grow, we offer our interns the unique chance to gain substantial, hands-on, real world experience where their big ideas are heard – and turned into realities! Job duties (can be customized based on intern’s areas of expertise and/or desired growth areas):•	Play a hands-on role in the development of marketing and promotional materials for Philly Dance Fitness. This could include developing new designs for fliers, postcards, merchandise, emails and even our website.•	Assist in the maintenance and growth of our web presence. Brainstorm ideas for enhancing and/or streamlining content and put those ideas into practice.•	Work directly with the company’s marketing director to develop, refine and execute key marketing strategies. Help maintain marketing calendars, and track and analyze metrics from monthly campaigns.•	As assigned, assist in creating written content for press releases, newsletters, our website and our social media channels.•	Help distribute marketing materials around the city and possibly represent the company at health fairs or other events.Hours are part-time and flexible, generally 5-10 hours per week at the outset with the opportunity to add more hours after proving successful in the post. Interns report directly to our marketing director and company president. The internship can set up as part of a school credit program or paid at an hourly rate.Ready to make your mark on the greater Philadelphia dance fitness community? Email your resume and cover letter to gabby@phillydancefitness.com. About Philly Dance Fitness:Philly Dance Fitness is an award-winning, independently owned fitness studio offering the greatest variety of adult dance fitness classes in the metro Philadelphia area. Whether you’re looking for hip hop, ballet, jazz or tap, or want to try something new like Bellydance, African jazz, Bollywood or striptease, we’ve got a class for you. Our classes are fun, affordable and accessible – there’s never a need to make a reservation or worry about cancellation fees. Just show up and dance! Plus, we believe that everybody can and should dance, so all of our classes come with an intimidation-free guarantee, and most are suitable for students with no prior dance experience. We make dancing convenient with more than 40 classes offered at three great locations around the city – Rittenhouse, Midtown Village and South Philly. So no matter where you live or work, we invite you to come on out and work it, shake it, move it, dance!See more at www.phillydancefitness.com.

688.desc: Archetype Solutions Group (ASG) is recruiting for a Business Associate to join our dynamic, growing business that is driving 3x YoY growth. The position will be located at the ASG office, currently in Trevose, PA (easily accessible from center city Philadelphia via Septa Regional Rail), but moving to center city Philadelphia in June/July 2016. The Associate will work closely with one or more ASG managers across a variety of projects.ASG teams not only develop the strategy for partner initiatives but are also involved in the execution of those projects. Associates are expected to leverage their strategic thinking and problem solving skills to derive insights and design solutions. Following the initial project there may be opportunities to join other ongoing ventures within ASG.Company:Archetype Solutions Group is a Data Analytics Incubator currently stewarding five companies across various stages of growth, and have 40 employees across ventures in the Greater Philadelphia area. Our primary industry is Healthcare, with an acute focus on insurance and wellness. We take a unique approach of partnering with strong regional players to co-develop SaaS products to fit market needs.Working at Archetype means doing what you love. Not only do we partner with enterprises to co-create solutions, but we also incubate our own ideas and bring them to life. Our team is comprised of highly successful former Data Scientists, Management Consultants, Financial Analysts, and Developers who wanted leverage their analytics expertise to progress a portfolio of companies.In our open culture everyone is a hands-on contributor. Being part of our incubator, you get to solve many exciting problems and see your work in action across multiple companies. Our team breaks the normal grind, passionately pursues entrepreneurship, and rapidly develops innovative solutions.Responsibilities: •	Scope out opportunities to incubate high impact business opportunities with existing partners•	Work with our partners to refine existing client-facing service offerings, and look for new features and add-on services•	Design efficient processes to help clients utilize solutions in a changing business environment•	Contribute to a dynamic and engaging work environment•	Keep multiple projects on-track, while both structuring and executing taskso	Manage change in organizations through clear, concise communicationso	Design custom analysis applications in MS Excelo	Research and select service providers to support and help execute initiativeso	Support the development and testing of new technology tools and/or offeringso	Create client deliverables and sales materials (presentations, brochures, etc.)

689.position: Fashion Tech Startup - Social Media Intern
689.desc: Hey there! We are an early-stage fashion tech startup based in New York City looking for a creative hardworking Social Media Intern. You could be a core member working directly with our Marketing Manager to formulate a social media strategy and execute the plan. We are looking for candidates that are passionate about the fashion industry and interested in gaining experience from working at a startup.WHO WE AREWe’re Alouit, and we make elegant comfortable Italian leather heels for the modern woman to look beautiful and feel empowered throughout her day. Our factory partners and final samples are ready, patents have been filed, and relationships with long-term retail partners have been formed. We are launching a Kickstarter in a few months and focused on pushing our marketing efforts forward. The Social Media Intern would play a key role.  CULTUREMany of our team work remotely, depending on the needs of our quickly growing startup. Our team is mostly based in NY, SF, and Europe. In the beginning you will work closely with our Marketing Manager, and quickly grow into an autonomous role, checking in once or twice a week. We would be able to trust you to flourish and execute well without much direct supervision. We’re known to be friendly and collaborative, and want to help you develop professionally while you help our business grow! It’s a very fast paced environment full of change. We have diplomatic and straight-forward conversations to move forward quickly. RESPONSIBILITIESManage social media platforms including but not limited to Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram.Schedule content releases across social channels.Develop new strategies to build a social media following, ultimately leading to traffic for the Alouit website and Kickstarter campaign.Assist in creating a marketing campaigns.

690.position: Research Associate for Hedge Fund Manager Aurelius Capital Management, LP
690.desc: Research Associate Job Description•	Superb junior-level opportunity to provide research supporting investment analysts focused on distressed and event-driven investing with an emphasis on legal issues. •	Three-year commitment.  While we hope research associates will decide to stay with us longer, we realize some may plan to continue their education after a few years of work experience.  Three years in this role should be excellent grounding for subsequent graduate study in business, law or economics.•	No prior finance or investment experience required. The right candidate will have the aptitude, motivation and discipline to learn on the job.•	Responsibilities are diverse and would require aptitude in both language and quantitative skills.•	We seek highly intelligent, analytical, meticulous, resourceful, self-motivated individuals with incisive minds, a hunger to learn, and unassailable integrity.•	Qualified candidates will be team players and will be completely reliable.•	Impending graduates will be considered.  No summer interns, please.•	Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume along with a cover letter to recruiting@aurelius-capital.com.  Please note: Resumes or cover letters should include all available standardized test scores for college and beyond, as well as grade point averages obtained during academic study. About AureliusAurelius Capital Management, LP is an investment manager headquartered in New York City with an affiliate in London.  We manage over $4 billion of capital in three hedge funds focused primarily on distressed and event-driven investing.  We have an excellent ten-year track record.  Our research process is deep and meticulous.  We prize our integrity.  Our team has 51 people, 23 of whom are investment professionals.

691.desc: Creative Academics is a bicoastal tutoring company with offices in Philadelphia and Los Angeles. We have homeschooling, enrichment and traditional (after school) tutoring divisions. We are currently seeking tutors in the Philadelphia area for all academic subjects (grades 6-12), as well as executive functioning skills tutors and standardized tests tutors. Must have reliable form of transportation. This job is for the entire school year - candidate must be able to guarantee availability through the second week of June, 2016. You set your own hours and control the number of clients you take on. You dictate the subjects you teach and the age groups with which you work. We serve children with learning disabilities as well as children without special needs, so please specify if you have the skills to help children with learning and behavioral challenges.

692.desc: COMPANY:		Citadel LLCOPPORTUNITY:	        Investment & Trading Associate LOCATIONS:		Chicago, New YorkYour curiosity gets you up in the morning, but your relentless drive to improve keeps you coming back for more.  You’ve got a healthy appetite for taking risks and clearly understand the macroeconomic landscape.  You’re also exceptional at statistics and math.  Highly motivated, you can command a room by communicating advanced concepts in a concise way.Citadel trades across all major asset classes in the world’s largest financial markets.  Technology drives our high-performance trading infrastructure – it’s one of the industry’s most powerful platforms.  Our teams have some of the most talented and focused minds in the industry.  It’s not just about being the best; it’s about extending our lead significantly.  We recruit ambitious people who want to win and give them next-generation tools to focus on what they do best: trade in incredibly competitive, fast-paced environments to seize opportunities that others can’t see.If this is what excites you:•	Constantly learning and staying ahead of global market dynamics•	Working in a team environment that closely integrates trading, quantitative research and technology•	Innovating using one of the industry’s most powerful trading platformsAnd this is what you’ve got:	Advanced training in Applied Math, Engineering, Statistical Modeling, Calculus, Computer Science, Physics or related disciplines	Strong knowledge of probability and statistics	Ability to solve open-ended problems using analytical methods	Solid knowledge/experience with Excel, Python, C, C++ or VBA	Passion for the markets and a desire to seize investment opportunitiesThis is what Citadel can give you:•	Meaningful projects that directly impact global markets•	A culture that values ambition and rewards talent•	World-class training, tools and mentorship •	Collaboration with some of the leading thinkers in the industryThe RoleWe are looking for exceptional students to work within one of our asset management investment strategies or liquidity providing proprietary trading businesses.  You will work in a team environment with close integration of trading, quantitative research, and technology, and learn how to manage risk and identify opportunities to deploy capital.  Responsibilities can include conducting research and analysis in the evaluation of financial instruments utilizing fundamental, technical, statistical and/or quantitative methods to provide support for investment decisions.  Potential businesses for placement include, but are not limited to: Citadel Execution Services, Fixed Income, Options Market-Making and Quantitative Strategies.•	Citadel Execution Services: o	Citadel Execution Services is a trading team focused on leveraging individual trader insights and judgement on top of highly quantitative and systematic core trading models. This team coordinates very closely with the Citadel Quantitative Strategies team and focuses on ETFs and other cash equity strategies.•	Fixed Income:o	Global Fixed Income deploys capital in the developed interest-rate, currency, and mortgage markets, focusing on liquid products including nominal and inflation-protected government bonds, interest-rate swaps, futures, rates options, FX options, and Agency mortgage-backed securities. Strategies are primarily concentrated in the G10 markets. Global Fixed Income employs a combination of macroeconomic analysis, quantitative modeling, and rigorous portfolio construction to identify and capture opportunities. Each portfolio manager in Global Fixed Income has a disciplined approach to their specific domain, and the team jointly identifies potential investments across these products and regions through a collaborative investment process. •	Options Market-Making:o	Options Market-Making is a team comprised of quantitative traders focused on the design, implementation and execution of Citadel Securities’ automated options trading systems. This team works closely with colleagues in Quantitative Research and Information Technology, to blend practical trading insight with leading-edge analytics and technology.  •	Quantitative Strategies:o	Quantitative Strategies applies mathematical and statistical models to the financial markets, combining rigorous research and advanced technology to identify and execute on investment opportunities. The team operates globally, seeking to generate alpha by applying systematic strategies across a diverse set of asset classes including equities, sovereign bonds, fixed income, credit, commodities and currencies.About CitadelCitadel is a worldwide leader in finance that uses next-generation technology and alpha-driven strategies to transform the global economy. We tackle some of the toughest problems in the industry by pushing ourselves to be the best again and again. It’s demanding work for the brightest minds, but we wouldn’t have it any other way. Here, great ideas come from everyone.

696.desc: About Artemis ConnectionArtemis Connection unleashes workplace productivity through innovative talent solutions, using data and design thinking. We’re a virtual consulting firm that helps companies create and innovate by making their teams happier and more productive at work. We specialize in creating holistic, tailored talent strategies, and we assess, ideate, iterate, implement, and monitor progress to improve talent outcomes (e.g., recruiting, retention, development, engagement, and productivity). Our specific offerings include traditional consulting engagements (e.g., diagnostics, benchmarking, and implementation/accountability supports), immersive professional development, and long-term staffing.Our founder is Christy Johnson, an entrepreneur, educator, and former McKinsey engagement manager. Our advisors include HR officers, executive coaches, academics, entrepreneurs, and neuroscientists. Our team is made up of seasoned consultants, trained at organizations such as McKinsey & Company, the Boston Consulting Group, Goldman Sachs, Walt Disney, Stanford Graduate School of Business, Harvard Kennedy School, and many more. From a the perspective of a potential employee, though, what makes Artemis Connection unique is the opportunity to combine this first-rate consulting experience with the flexibility that many other consulting firms don’t offer. In short, we’re a consulting firm for experienced top-tier consultants who still want to deliver exemplary value for clients but who need more flexibility in their professional and personal lives. Specifically, we’re flexible with where you want to work and how many hours you want to work – meaning no rigid expectations of being at the client every day, living in a certain city, or clocking in a full 50 hours (or more) each week. Instead, we work with you to understand what flexibility that you need to make consulting work for you. Currently, our team members are spread across the country, engaging with clients remotely (and occasionally on-site, as client needs dictate) and working varied hours (ranging from 10 hours/week to 50 hours/week). We offer market-rate compensation based on the outcomes that you deliver and the number of hours and weeks that you will be leading project work. Because we’re a recently established, and quickly growing, organization, we also offer employees the opportunity to be involved in some of the operations it takes to form and scale a company – a great experience if you’re considering starting your own company someday.To learn more about Artemis Connection, visit http://artemisconnection.com/.  Position overviewWe’re looking for Associates to contribute as critical members of our case teams. Our Associates own and develop their own “modules” (work streams), participate in client engagements, and support other case team members to help solve broader case questions. Our ideal candidate for the Associate role is a proactive, curious, detailed, analytical thinker who can drive forward a case team module and deliver high-quality work products. She/He also is savvy with Excel and PowerPoint, since those tools are how we develop our insights and communicate them to clients. Finally, since Artemis Connection focuses on innovative talent solutions (using data and design thinking) to make employees happier and more productive, our ideal candidate is passionate about these topics, too. Please note that we’re flexible on whether this role is a full-time, part-time, or temporary/contract position, and we’ll work with candidates to match the job to their needs/preferences.

697.desc: The Internship program at Woodstock Farm Sanctuary provides individuals with unique opportunities to advocate for and connect with farm animals, establish community with like-minded people, and acquire valuable knowledge of the various facets of animal protection. We are currently in need of a Development Intern.  As a nonprofit organization with limited funds, WFS Internships are unpaid but very rewarding and a great way to boost your résumé! The hard work and dedication of WFS interns is a vital part of our work. The commitment of interns helps us rescue, provide care and advocate for suffering victims of food animal production.REQUIREMENTSThis position requires your physical presence in Philadelphia, PA for a minimum commitment of 8 hours per week over two months.  Candidates who can work a longer week or who can help beyond 2 months will be given preference.  You will be reporting to our Development Director who works out of Philadelphia (Germantown, right off the regional rail line).  There is also a travel component to this position, including but not limited to events in Philadelphia, NYC and High Falls, NY.  You will need to use your own laptop and cellphone.All applicants must be 18 years of age or older with a demonstrated commitment to the goals and programs of WFS.DUTIES•	Enter data into and generate reports into the database. •	Conduct research on potential donors and strategic partners. •	Prepare reports and presentations for internal and external use. •	Draft and edit correspondence. •	Grant research and reporting.•	Social media and marketing writing.•	Assist the staff in executing donor events and other activities in Philadelphia, NYC, or High Falls NY.•	Assist with mailings, filing, and special projects as needed.•	Cold calls and mailings with potential partners and supporters.•	Assist with membership/donation acknowledgments.•	Restock brochures at various locations via mail or drop off.•	Run errands and make post office runs as needed.•	Assist with other administrative tasks as needed.BENEFITS•	Opportunity to learn more about non-profit administration and business practices.•	Working with like-minded and committed animal activists.•	Gain experience beneficial for future employment.

704.desc: Blueprint is a national nonprofit organization that partners with states, districts and schools to promote educational equity and improve life outcomes for students. Blueprint is currently working with public school districts in Boston (MA), Salem (MA), Denver (CO), St. Louis (MO) and East St. Louis (IL) to plan, implement and monitor rigorous school improvement initiatives in 67 schools, serving over 14,000 students.A key component of our work is an intensive, daily, in-school math tutoring program Blueprint operates called The Blueprint Fellows Program.  We are currently seeking Fellows for our schools across the country.Interested candidates are encouraged to visit our website, http://blueprintschools.org/fellows/ to learn more about the program.Position SummaryBlueprint Fellows are full-time tutors charged with providing students with highly personalized tutoring in mathematics during the regular school day. Fellows work with 2-4 students at a time, delivering individualized lessons and working closely with teachers to accelerate students’ academic achievement. Fellows also work to build strong relationships with students to help increase their self-confidence and commitment to education. The Blueprint Fellows program is an opportunity to participate in a year of service making a difference in the lives of students. Fellows receive a fellowship stipend as well as benefits.While teachers have classrooms of 25 or 30 students, Fellows manage no more than 4 students at a time.  This allows for the individualization of remedial and supplemental instruction.  Fellows receive curriculum materials, pre-service training, on-going mentoring and professional development as well as written evaluation of feedback from their assigned Fellows Coordinator.  Fellows are charged with focusing on the individual needs of their students, helping to accelerate student achievement and close any skill gaps that may exist.We are now accepting applications for the following opportunities: 2015-2016 School Year Positions: Immediate Start: •	Denver, COWaitlist Positions: •	Denver, CO•	Boston, MA•	Salem, MA•	St. Louis, MA•	Candidates who apply for waitlist positions will be considered if a Fellow position becomes available throughout the current school year.2016-2017 School Year Positions:•	Boston, MA•	Salem, MA•	St. Louis, MA•	If you are interested in math or literacy fellow positions in Denver, CO for the 2016-2017 school year, please apply at http://www.denverfellows.com/ to submit your application directly to the Denver Math Fellows Program.•	Start date for a 2016-2017 Fellow position is late-July or August 2016, depending on site location. ExpectationsFellow responsibilities include: Instruction, Planning, Communication & Feedback, and Compliance.  Examples of duties within these categories include:Instruction: •	Carry out all the responsibilities of an academic tutor and ensure that students are consistently learning and challenged. •	Assist students in setting and reaching academic goals.•	Observe, monitor, and assess students’ performance on a regular basis and record data to track student progress towards academic goals. Modify instruction and lesson plans based on student assessment results.•	Tutor students using a variety of research-based instructional strategies designed to support students’ individual needs.Planning:•	Plan daily and weekly lesson plans using a predetermined curriculum.•	Prepare instructional activities to support students in mastering specific academic skills, subject matter content, and end-of-course assessments.•	Collaborate with classroom teachers and designated Fellow Coordinator to ensure tutorial lessons are aligned with classroom instruction. Communication & Feedback:•	Reach out to students’ families at least once every two weeks to update them on their student’s academic progress in tutorial.•	Actively participate in professional development activities.•	Meet with Fellows Coordinator regularly to receive coaching and both informal and formal evaluation and feedback.Compliance:•	Maintain confidentiality of student information as required by law and district policies.•	Enforce school/district behavior rules and policies.•	Perform other job-related duties as assigned.Fellowship Stipend and BenefitsThe fellowship stipend for a Fellow position is up to $20,000-$21,000 per school year depending on site location.  Salary may be pro-rated based on start date and/or program end date.  The Fellow position includes a benefits package. AmeriCorps:A select number of Blueprint Fellows positions are now designated as AmeriCorps. AmeriCorps members are eligible to receive the Segal AmeriCorps Education Award upon successful completion of the program. To learn more about the special qualifications, responsibilities and benefits associated with serving as an AmeriCorps member with Blueprint Schools Network please take a moment to read through our AmeriCorps overview document at http://blueprintschools.org/images/uploads/AmeriCorps-Overview.pdf and the AmeriCorps Fact Sheet at http://www.nationalservice.gov/sites/default/files/documents/factsheet_americorps.pdf.

705.desc: Fluke Advanced Engineering ProgramFluke Networks is seeking motivated, highly-qualified graduates for the Advanced Engineering Program, a developmental track leading to a research and design position at Fluke.The position includes:-	Full-time research and design work-	Opportunities to develop key Fluke products-	Rotating assignments in many domains, including (but not limited to): systems programming, web development, and hardware design-	An optional, fully-paid master’s degreeCandidates must:-	Be highly motivated, independent, agile, and eager to learn-	Be pursuing an electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or similar degree-	Have strong programming fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, and system design-	Have an interest in both high-level and low level software domainsAbout Fluke and Fluke NetworksFluke is based out of Everett, Washington. We develop test and measurement products for many fields, including biomedical, thermal imaging and electrical testing. Fluke Networks is a division within Fluke dedicated to network testing equipment, such as hand-held fiber and copper testers and cloud-based support services.

706.desc: Vice President, Computation CytoVas, LLC, a Philadelphia-based biotech spinout from the University of Pennsylvania, seeks an experienced Ph.D.-level computational scientist to lead the conception, development and implementation of the company’s core strength in developing precision diagnostics through multi-dimensional computational biology.  The successful candidate will have demonstrated expertise in broad areas of computational analysis of high dimensional systems, machine learning and empirical data analysis.  The candidate will be familiar with building and deploying database-driven computational analysis systems that carry out automated high-dimensional data analysis and data mining solutions. Familiarity with flow cytometry data, and in particular high dimensional flow cytometry data, while not required, will be a significant advantage, as will be a working knowledge of immunophenotyping of circulating cells and extracellular vesicles.  If not previously established, a willingness to acquire this highly specialized knowledge is a key requirement.The position requires demonstrated skills in scientific programming (e.g. preferably R, but also Matlab, C++, Python, Java or other data-centric languages), database design and administration (e.g. MySQL), system configuration and administration (e.g. linux, perl, bash), and web-based application deployment (e.g. apache, tomcat, PHP, Ruby/Rails, Grails, etc.).  Specific knowledge of R/Bioconductor, while not required, is a very strong plus.  The VP, Computation will build and lead a small but growing team of computational scientists, including programmers and data analysts.  This will require you to define, articulate and encourage best practices in areas such as software version control (e.g. git, subversion), test and release discipline (unit and integration), software deployment (in a dev/test/prod environment) and documentation.  Your compute infrastructure is cloud-based, so familiarity with AWS cloud computing will be a definite advantage.  Much of the technology developed by you and your group will eventually be submitted to the FDA for regulatory approval.  Consequently, you will be responsible for software validation and change control and your attention to detail in these areas will be critically important.The laboratory at CytoVas is currently in production mode.  So you and your team will not only be developing the data analysis infrastructure of the company, but also applying that infrastructure as scientific data analysts to consume, process, reduce and ultimately gain new knowledge from the data.You must possess outstanding leadership and communication skills, both oral and written.  You will work in a highly collaborative team environment and will interact daily not only with your computational team but also laboratory staff, marketing and sales, and executive leadership.  You will co-author scientific manuscripts at the cutting edge of the application of computational analysis of high dimensional biology.  You will play an important role in interactions with clients and investors, yet you will also have a hands-on role in your group’s development activities.  You will possess a balanced mix of the visionary with the practical, and enthusiasm and energy to emphasize whichever is called for at the moment.CompanyCytoVas, LLC (www.cytovas.com) is an in-vitro diagnostics company that has developed a blood test using a combinatorial approach and novel biomarkers to improve assessment of a patient’s vascular health.  The company is currently in clinical trials evaluating the Vascular Health Profile’s (VHP’s) ability to deliver precise information on the pathology of atherosclerotic plaque as a predictor of major adverse cardiovascular events like heart attack and stroke (MACE).VHP is the first biomarker application developed using CytoVas’ unique capabilities in High-Dimensional Small Particle DetectionTM and Cytometric FingerprintingTM.  CytoVas leverages cutting-edge advances in flow cytometry instrument engineering and cytomic analysis enabling unprecedented detection of fluid-borne small particles down to 0.12 microns, including extracellular vesicles (aka microparticles) and their cell(s) of origin.ApplyInterested applicants should forward any questions or a letter of interest and a recent CV to Todd Johnson, M.D., M.B.A., President, CytoVas LLC at todd.johnson@cytovas.com.

707.desc: Reading Health System is seeking a full time CRNP to join our Neurology/Stroke Program.  CRNP will assist Vascular Neurologists with in/outpatient consults and will also have own patient panel.  This position will be M-F, no weekends/no call/no night coverage.We are within easy driving distance to major metropolitan areas such as Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington, DC and New York City.  In addition, Berks County offers a wide variety of cultural and community arts, sporting events like minor league hockey, arena football and baseball, local wineries, shopping malls and gourmet restaurants.  Outdoor activities include the National Scenic Appalachian Trail, two state parks and lakes for boating, swimming and even ice fishing and skating in winter. Excellent school and robust activities make this an ideal location to raise a family.
