709.desc: RapidSOS is hiring!  Join a rapidly growing MIT/Harvard Business School emergency tech start-up in solving one of the biggest challenges of our generation.  Called one of the “most award winning start-ups in Harvard’s history” RapidSOS has won nearly every major start-up competition, recently raised a major financing backed by two top global VC funds and four prominent HBS/Harvard billionaires, and been featured in national media (homepage of Newsweek, Fox News, etc.).RapidSOS 3-Min Summary Videohttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aUluO-qtQ4wRecent Media• The New York Times: http://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/01/business/smallbusiness/a-lifesaving-smartphone-app-inspired-by-a-brush-with-tragedy.html• MIT University: http://news.mit.edu/2015/rapidsos-one-touch-911-0918Fox News:  http://video.foxnews.com/v/4151374978001/swipe-to-save-a-life-new-app-aims-to-make-911-calls-quicker/?#sp=show-clips• Washington Post: http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/innovations/wp/2015/04/30/my-injured-father-lay-freezing-for-hours-when-his-911-call-didnt-go-through-heres-how-im-fixing-911/• New Scientist: http://www.newscientist.com/article/mg22630152.000-emergency-app-tells-rescuers-how-to-reach-and-save-you.html• Newsweek: http://www.newsweek.com/clock-begins-ticking-911-system-improvements-319553• Tech Crunch:http://techcrunch.com/2015/06/03/rapidsos/• Smithsonian Magazine: http://www.smithsonianmag.com/innovation/harvard-students-app-could-bring-911-into-the-future-180955339/• Popular Mechanics: http://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/apps/a15631/rapidsos-911-app/• Policy Mic: http://mic.com/articles/114046/you-probably-didn-t-know-calling-911-is-a-problem-but-it-is-these-guys-are-fixing-itRecent Awards• Best New Venture – Harvard Business School New Venture Competition• Grand Prize Winner - Top Start-Up Representing the Spirit of Harvard – Harvard President’s Challenge• Top 3 Innovative World Technologies – SXSW Accelerator• Best Mobile Technology at MIT – MIT $100K• Most Innovative Company in the Public Sector – Harvard Innovation Challenge• Top 10 University Start-Up Globally – Founder.org• Top Technology for US/China – MIT China Innovation ForumWhat this role is aboutAs a Marketing Intern you will support the Marketing Director in executing and optimizing a variety of the marketing campaigns related the the product launch and user base scaling efforts thereafter. This is an amazing opportunity to join a rising and dynamic startup. You will be making a measurable impact by playing a role in a successful product launch, creating awareness/buzz and generating app downloads. This position is focused execution via multiple marketing channels and outreach to organizations to gain adoption by their members.What We Offer• An amazing opportunity to be part of something big and to make an impact on a rising startup• Dynamic, fun work environment with a highly talented team• Competitive salary and benefits• Flexible startup work environment and a fun atmosphere • Rapid growth opportunitiesWhat you’ll do if chosen for this role• Drive email pre-registrations from interested consumers and organizations during pre-launch marketing campaigns• Execute on various facets of the marketing plan to drive consumer downloads of our mobile app after launch• Produce measurable results by researching and reaching out to organizations to commit to promoting our app to their members, providing marketing and follow-up support to them to ensure their members have appropriate and sufficient communications to encourage them to download the app• Copywriting, tracking, and reporting of results on leads and conversions• Support the Marketing Director as necessary in coordinating marketing and outreach user acquisition campaigns, including additional duties and special projects as assigned.

710.position: Philadelphia magazine Marketing and Events Internship
710.desc: Mission Statement:To be an intern with the magazine, you must be a dedicated, hard working individual. Hard work on minor tasks leads to the opportunity to gain more responsibility.  An internship with the marketing department is unpaid and requires the following:•	Must be an undergraduate pursuing a four year degree and seeking to gain additional experience in the industry.•	Must be able to work a minimum of 2 days a week (9:00-5:00pm) or the equivalent hours over a three day period. Interns should also be available to assist with certain Philadelphia magazine events after normal work hours on weeknights or weekends (usually 2-3 per month).•	Permitted one hour for lunch.•	Must work for the duration of the semester (spring, summer, or fall) - 9 weeks minimum.•	Must be punctual in attending your scheduled days at work. Habitual lateness will not be tolerated.•	Must notify your immediate supervisor 2 weeks prior to any scheduled vacation when requesting time off or the request may not be granted. Emergency exceptions will be granted.•	Must notify your immediate supervisor if calling in sick.•	Dress code is business casual and office appropriate. No t-shirts, sneakers, spaghetti strap tanks, flip flops, short skirts or dresses, or other inappropriate clothing will be tolerated. As an intern in the Integrated Marketing & Special Events Department at Philadelphia magazine you will serve as a member of the Marketing team in a dynamic, bottom-line driven environment. Marketing interns assist in all manner of tasks, helping in the overall brand and sales-support marketing processes of the magazine and its ancillary publications. Some of these tasks include:•	Assisting with the planning and execution of Philadelphia magazine events by helping with the creation of promotional materials, signage, maintaining RSVP lists, organizing collateral, etc.•	Assisting with set-up and registration at events (this may, and usually does, require carrying/transporting event collateral and signage up to 30 pounds)•	Assisting all parties at events, where needed (guests, sponsors, vendors, PM staff, etc.)•	Helping to prepare media kits for Philadelphia magazine advertising sales representatives•	Mailings (postcards and sectional mailings)•	Creating counter cards, posters, and banners for promotions•	Proofing/copyediting and fact-checking special sections•	Helping to brainstorm new ideas for special section opportunities•	Helping to brainstorm ideas for in-house ads•	Helping to create post-event recaps, photo albums, etc.•	Updating Philadelphia magazine’s social media fan pages and twitter accounts•	Concepting and copywriting for promotional material•	Updating archives of invitations, postcards, etc.•	Assisting with other administrative tasks (copies, faxes, reception duties, errands).

711.desc: We are looking for outstanding candidates to help support the growth of our firm. We seek professionals who have demonstrated high academic/professional achievement, leadership, communication skills, and have a strong interest in consulting.From a cultural perspective, we look for individuals who possess the following qualities that will contribute to our success and the success of our clients: •	Entrepreneurial spirit:  We seek individuals who enjoy contributing to the growth of an organization and who show commitment to the success of their team. •	Problem solving skills: Individuals at SSA have well honed analytical skills coupled with business acumen to structure problems, deliver solutions and communicate insights.  •	Drive: SSA’s team sets ambitious goals and seeks professionals who are energetic, enjoy a fast pace environment and thrive in taking on responsibility.  If this sounds like you, SSA might be a great fit for your career.Job Responsibilities:We are seeking Business Analysts out of our New York City Headquarters.  This position helps support our Strategic Client Development platform whose goal it is to provide a view of how the SSA value proposition can be applied to current and prospective clients from a business development perspective. The position also involves supporting our client facing teams with an emphasis on analytics and project execution. Responsibilities for the role include:•	Conducting required research, market or data analysis, competitive benchmarking, and some data gathering in support of client engagements and business development•	Helping to prepare client-ready deliverables and/or presentations by contributing to the team’s work during project delivery•	Providing support for the development of intellectual capital during or following project assignments•	Provide input to project teams on how to approach a specific engagement and solve challenges during delivery•	Reviewing and summarizing analyst reports, industry trade press, and client documents for business development and project delivery purposes•	Secondary responsibilities include supporting firm activity in new business, developing Intellectual Property, and other internal initiatives.

713.desc: This posting is for two different positions: national crew leader and community crew leader. http://www.thesca.org/serve/field-leaders/program-typesNational Crew Leaders Lead, motivate, inspire and guide High School Conservation crews in more than 100 spectacular national parks, forests and refuges across the US.  SCA offers qualified applicants the opportunity to guide volunteer crews during the summer in the backcountry or frontcountry while supporting land management agencies such as, the National Park Service and the USDA Forest Service.Your SCA crew may: •Construct and maintain trails through parks and forests •Build bridges and shelters •Repair walls and stone steps •Improve and conserve wildlife habitats To be a Leader, you must have a strong interest and experience teaching and/or working with youth,  be able to maintain a  positive work environment and have relevant outdoor experience (living and/or working). Positions are available throughout the United States. -------------------------- Community Crew Leaders Lead, mentor and coach crews of high school students, ages 15-18, during the Summer. Crew Leaders will train and supervise teams of students through the completion of much needed conservation service projects in cities and community parks. Leaders will plan weekly field trips designed to build community understanding and environmental stewardship with participants.A Community Crew Leader should have experience teaching or working with urban youth, be able to maintain a  positive work environment and have relevant outdoor experience (living and/or working). Community Program positions available in various cities nationwide, including Philadelphia.

714.position: IT College to Corporate Internship (C2C) Program - Application Development
714.desc: Vanguard is seeking career-oriented individuals, with a passion for learning to participate in our IT College to Corporate Internship Program.  The program is a full-time, paid summer internship at our Valley Forge, Pennsylvania or Charlotte, North Carolina locations. We provide extensive training, real-world experience and hands-on opportunities in one or more of the many technical areas within IT at Vanguard. You'll work with professionals committed to broadening your technical expertise in Application Development.  We will provide exposure to a variety of aspects of the software life cycle and allow you to impact our clients through one of these challenging assignments:•User interface (UI) design •UI, Mid-tier or host development •Requirements analysis •Application or automated testing Vanguard is a virtual company and we rely heavily on technology to achieve business results. Technology drives almost every aspect of our business, from integrating investment platforms and crew systems to developing mobile technologies that enable clients to connect with us. Vanguard recently placed 15th in the “InformationWeek 500”, the magazine’s annual list of top IT innovators, and ranked 36th in Computerworld magazine’s “2014 Best Places to Work in IT”.  Interns will have the opportunity to build their skills using some of the latest technology, including: •Databases: DB2, Oracle, SQL Server •Platforms/Servers: zOS, Solaris, Windows, Linux, Web and Application.NET, Spring, Web Services, Web, Mobile apps (iOS, Android)•Languages/Tools: Java, JSF, Ajax, JavaScript, C/C++/C#,  XML, XSLT, HTML, XHTML, CSS, Cobol, Maven, Hudson, Subversion, Nexus, JTest, Sharepoint, AnjularJS, Selenium•Concepts: Distributed systems, Tiered development, Data Driven decision making. Service Oriented Architecture, responsive design, Automated TestingProgram supportTo help ensure your success, you'll participate in a structured development program that will help you and your fellow interns build a range of important skills focused on the following themes:•Vanguard Acumen & Culture: Interns will be exposed to Vanguard’s vision, core values, and corporate culture.  They will be able to understand how technology supports Vanguard’s mission.  Activities include a Tour of the IT Division, Philadelphia Field Trip, Volunteer Events, and Diversity Activity.•Building Relationships: Interns will have an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns. Activities include teambuilding and networking lunches.• Professional Development: Interns will participate in developmental activities that will provide them with tools they can take back to school. Activities include one on one feedback sessions with management, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions. Upon successful completion of your internship, we will consider you for employment in a specialized IT position or our Technology Leadership Program (TLP).   You'll find details about these opportunities at vanguard.com/careers.

716.company: fast-growing, privately held, VC-backed, healthcare technology company
716.desc: Company BackgroundQuality Health Ideas, Inc. (QHI) is a fast-growing, healthcare technology company that provides a cloud-based software platform, CareScreen®, which significantly improves health outcomes and reduces the cost of care.QHI first commercialized CareScreen® in 2011, growing to $53M in annual revenue by 2014.  In May 2015, QHI separated from its sister company to engage a larger user network and accelerate growth nation-wide.QHI currently employs ~50 FTE, including generalists, clinicians, data scientists and DBAs, developers and programmers across two locations: Boston, MA and Suffield, CT, and will be scaling up rapidly.Our PhilosophyProfessional impact: Developing and implementing creative solutions in the face of challenging goals, and leveraging strong intellect and rigor to deliver superior impact under tight deadlines.Entrepreneurial drive: Constantly creating new approaches to improve our product, services and technologies. Striving to deliver superior impact with outstanding energy, determination, and judgment.Leadership ability: Leading ourselves, our teams, our clients and fostering effective teamwork in order to drive results and improvement to our product and our company as a whole.The PositionOur Business Analyst should be a highly-motivated, problem solver who will work closely with our Clinical Innovation, Software Development and Business Teams to ensure efficient deployment of our tools and services.  The role will be similar to the McKinsey Business Analyst role, and will receive similar challenging environments as well as professional development.  Several of our executives are former McKinsey Partners.Key Responsibilities	Execute targeted projects including: market research, external communications, data analysis, etc.	Evaluate customer needs and work with the Software Development Team to implement new solutions	Improve professional toolkit including: problem solving, owning deliverables, managing timelines, etc.	Improve knowledge base including: healthcare economics and regulation, clinical practice workflow, etc.

718.desc: Summer Analyst  Department: Healthcare – Manatt Health Position Title: Summer Analyst Office Location: San Francisco, CA; New York, NY; Washington, D.C.Job Req. #: 97 Brief Description: Manatt Health is the interdisciplinary health policy and business strategy advisory division of Manatt, Phelps and Phillips, LLP, one of the nation's preeminent healthcare law and consulting firms. Manatt Health boasts a dedicated team of over 80 professionals providing their knowledge and expertise to leading healthcare organizations to strategize and resolve complex issues to help improve quality, efficiency, and safety of care. Manatt Health attracts a wide range of for-profit and non-profit clients in both the public and private sectors including healthcare providers, coalitions and associations of providers, heath plans and other payers, foundations, pharmaceutical manufacturers, and federal and state government.Position Overview:Manatt Health is seeking 2-4 highly qualified Summer Analysts to join our growing team. Our goal is to provide Summer Analysts with a comprehensive overview of what it’s like to work at Manatt Health. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of our nationally recognized healthcare strategy consulting team with one of the leading health reform practices in the country.Summer Analysts will work with members of the Manatt Health team to support the development of business strategy recommendations for our clients. Specific responsibilities include policy and quantitative research, presentation development and design, and assistance with monitoring federal and state health policy development and other emerging healthcare trends. Summer Analysts work on a broad range of substantive issues including: payment and delivery system transformation; Medicaid policy, re-design and innovation; strategic planning services; health reform implementation; health IT strategy; and pharmaceutical market access, coverage and reimbursement strategies.Duration and Timing:Manatt Health Summer Analysts will spend 10 weeks working in either our New York, San Francisco, or Washington, DC offices. The program will commence in May/June and run through July/August. The objective of this program is to identify exceptional candidates for full-time Manatt Health positions upon graduation.

719.company: myCIO Wealth Partners LLP (myCIO Wealth Partners LLP
719.desc: Responsible for client servicing support for an independent investment advisor team located in Philadelphia, PA.   Our practice provides investment advisory and financial planning services for high net worth individuals and corporate executives. It is preferred that the applicant have some back office experience supporting financial advisors in a financial planning and/or brokerage environment. Applicant must be self-motivated with strong verbal and written communication skills.  The ability to handle multiple assignments is critical, as is the ability to work both independently and as a team member.Provide general administrative support in the areas of investment advisory and financial planning. Prepare client portfolio performance reports. Assist in meeting preparation materials for advisors. Prepare account opening paperwork and ongoing maintenance documents for clients as necessary (i.e. account applications). myCIO rewards its team members’ hard efforts with attractive salaries and top tier performance bonus and profit sharing plans.

720.desc: Workbridge Associates is a unique technology recruiting firm that’s shaking up the recruitment and placement industry nationwide.  We help the hottest companies in nine high-tech cities stay fully staffed with the best technical talent around. We do it through a modern, high-touch client recruiting approach, and through being diligent about recruiting the right people into our own company as well. Today, right now, we need to bring new sales talent into our Philadelphia operation. The technology market in Philadelphia is booming, and to make the most of it, we need to expand.GET IN ON SOMETHING DIFFERENTWhen you visit Workbridge Associates, you’ll see a lot of energetic, ambitious, social people working together to achieve something extraordinary.  It’s fast-paced, noisy at times, and it seems like a million things are happening at once.  It’s never boring.  Amazing things are happening.Serious OpportunityEveryone at Workbridge (all the way up to the CEO) started their career here by reading an ad just like this one. We all started as Sales & Management Trainees. We train our people very well, encourage them to excel, and reward their success aggressively.  We’re led by the people who show themselves to be the best at their job, regardless of age or seniority.  Not many companies offer the same early opportunity to build a business as we do, but that’s our secret sauce. At Workbridge Associates  we celebrate success, and we work hard to make everybody here as successful as possible.Workbridge Associates is a nationwide contingency recruiting firm employing nearly 300 recruiters and generating over $60 million in annual sales. We specialize in the hiring and placement of open-source and .NET engineers; front-end developers; and network managers and engineers. We generate breakthrough recruitment results through lean management techniques, a focus on client relationships, and a unique team-based recruitment approach. Our offices are in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, Newport Beach, New York, Philadelphia, Boston, Chicago, Washington, DC and Toronto.Workbridge Associates is part of the Motion Recruitment Partners family of innovative recruitment companies.

721.desc: Delivering Planisware PPM Software Solutions:In this high-profile, customer-facing role, you will interface regularly with client-side stakeholders to address complex organization-specific business process needs and provide solutions using the Planisware software. This is a unique opportunity to not only gain an inside and front-row view of the business operations sustaining highly successful organizations, but also to use your own creative insights, problem-solving skills and technical skills to enhance those processes. Add both depth and breadth to your career skills portfolio in a highly autonomous role for a company that recognizes and rewards top performers.Join Planisware's team of Implementation Consultants and you will:- Be a consultant . Lead workshops and provide guidance and advice. Uncover clients’ true needs.- Be a technical guru. Code, debug, enhance, improve performance, design smooth GUI.- Problem-solve. Every. Single. Day.- Face new and exciting challenges. No two projects are alike.- Master SDLC (software development life-cycle).- Be a project manager. Work with a team and control the continual budget-scope-time triangle.- Have fun …with your new happy Planisware family.Your day-one communication skills should enable you to present and explain complex problems in simple terms to both IT and senior management. Always engaged technically, you are configuring, troubleshooting, and writing code as needed. After your first year (or sooner!) your skills will evolve to the next level, allowing you to apply your past experience to design effective, user-friendly solutions for new challenges and new clients. Understanding the client's requirements and applying Planisware capabilities to meet business needs will be fundamental to your success. It is this capability that will distinguish you in your consulting career, as performance metrics in this profession derive from consistently delivering the best technical solutions for a wide variety of business needs, enabling the client to maximize return on their investment in our software.Locations:GREATER PHILADELPHIA AREA: This position is based out of our East Coast office located in Trevose, PA, with direct access to Philadelphia and to the greater Princeton area. Public transportation (SEPTA, River Line or NJ North East Corridor) is available.SAN FRANCISCO: This position is based in our San Francisco office, located in SF's Financial District. It’s easily accessible by BART, SF Muni and other public transportation in the Bay Area.To apply:If you are interested in this position, please email plwhr@planisware.com with your resume and cover letter. Please include your name and 'CON1015' in the subject line.Benefits:-    3 weeks paid vacation-    Paid holidays-    Life and long term disability insurance-    Company annual kick-off trip-    401(k) plan with company variable contribution-    Health and Dental Insurance-    FSA plan, including employer contribution-    Cell phone and internet allowances

722.desc: Source4Teachers – The School District of Philadelphia Be part of the change in Philadelphia. Source4Teachers is now hiring K-12 substitute special education teachers to work in the School District of Philadelphia for the 2015/16 school year. The district serves nearly 200,000 students, 80% of whom are eligible for free or reduced price lunch. On average, 407 Philadelphia classrooms go without substitute coverage each day. Substitute teaching is a critical role in bridging this gap and providing Philadelphia students with the classroom continuity they need to succeed in education and life. Established in 2000, Source4Teachers manages the substitute program of 200+ school districts throughout the East Coast. We currently employ more than 40,000 qualified substitute teachers, paraprofessionals, and school support staff. Excited to bring our program to Philadelphia, we need your help to enhance the educational experience for Philadelphia’s students!Why become a Source4Teachers substitute?•	Choose when, where, and how often you’d like to work with up-to-the minute notifications of job opportunities•	Advance your skills with our interactive training opportunities and comprehensive support•	Get your foot in the door with a school district – our partner districts hire 300+ Source4Teachers substitutes as full-time teachers each year!•	Participate in our health benefits and 401(k) program•	Make a difference in your community and the lives of studentsPrimary Responsibilities:•	Provide meaningful instruction and classroom management to students with special needs•	Work with individual students or small groups in a special education classroom or general education inclusion setting to provide instruction aligned with particular student needs•	Implement the regular teacher's lesson plans, routines, and behavior management plans, as well as students’ IEPs and 504 plans; adhere to all school policies and procedures•	Work cooperatively with general education teachers and classroom aides when applicable•	Assist students with personal care needs as directed•	Establish and maintain a safe and orderly classroom environment•	Communicate clearly and effectively to students, faculty, and staff•	Report all student injuries, accidents, illnesses, and serious discipline problems to school administration as soon as possible•	Demonstrate flexibility in performing other related duties as assigned
