725.position: Associate Consultant in Pharma/Biotech Consulting Company
725.desc: About C1:C1 is a strategic partner to our pharmaceutical and biotech clients. In today’s healthcare environment, data-driven decision making in complex disease areas is a complex science. Often, our clients find that return on investment in secondary data and market research is unrealized due to gaps in data, time, resources, and expertise.  At C1, we help clients actuate unforeseen potential using a robust, analytic driven process.  We start by overcoming data gaps to create a reliable, high-quality dataset.  Next, we connect the dots with a unique insight-generation skillset. Finally, we help clients realize exceptional value through an expert implementation mindset.C1 was established in 2004 and has exhibited steady growth year after year.  We have offices in Atlanta (GA), Boston (MA), Manhattan (NY), San Francisco (CA), Summit (NJ), and Lucerne, Switzerland.Overview:Associate Consultants are important members of C1 project teams and work together with experienced C1 with Consultants and Managers to deliver consulting, strategic marketing, and market research projects to clients. In this role you will own and personally deliver components of the client engagement, contributing to the overall success of each engagement. As you demonstrate strong advisory and project management skills, your responsibilities will grow rapidly.As an Associate Consultant, you will:Manage client relationships and project deliveryWork on multiple projects at the same timeApply strong analytic and project management skillsBe actively involved in company and team developmentUtilize business analytics, statistical models, secondary data and primary market research expertise to help our clients achieve their business objectivesWork on a team in a highly collegial and collaborative environmentWhy should I apply to C1:Learning - At C1, we invest in our employees’ long term professional development. Working here, you will receive both formal and “on-the-job” training to help you build the skills you need to propel your career forwardGreat environment – A collegial team environment, meritocracy and openness are the drivers of our company. We are a rapidly growing consulting company and you will be in the center of it allCompensation – We offer a competitive salary plus an attractive benefits package that meets the needs of our employees and our business modelChallenging and exciting work - We consult and work with a variety of biotech and pharmaceutical clients. You will work on innovative and challenging projects that help our clients make important strategic decisions

726.position: Business Analyst in Pharma/Biotech Consulting Company
726.desc: About C1:C1 is a strategic partner to our pharmaceutical and biotech clients. In today’s healthcare environment, data-driven decision making in complex disease areas is a complex science. Often, our clients find that return on investment in secondary data and market research is unrealized due to gaps in data, time, resources, and expertise.  At C1, we help clients actuate unforeseen potential using a robust, analytic driven process.  We start by overcoming data gaps to create a reliable, high-quality dataset.  Next, we connect the dots with a unique insight-generation skillset. Finally, we help clients realize exceptional value through an expert implementation mindset.C1 was established in 2004 and has exhibited steady growth year after year.  We have offices in Atlanta (GA), Boston (MA), Manhattan (NY), San Francisco (CA), Summit (NJ), and Lucerne, SwitzerlandOverview:The Business Analyst is an important member of C1 project teams who works closely with Consultants and Managers to solve interesting client problems, working with a range of secondary and primary data sources. In this role you will own and personally deliver components of the client engagement, contributing to the overall success of each project. As you demonstrate strong analytic and develop sound project management skills, your responsibilities will grow rapidly.As a Business Analyst, you will:Collect and analyze quantitative data from both primary and secondary data sourcesConduct qualitative analysisApply critical perspective across multiple clients and industry data sourcesCommunicate findings from your analysis to internal team members and, over time, to clientsPrepare PowerPoint presentations across a variety of project types and presentation settingsWork on multiple projects at the same timeWork in a demanding but highly collegial and collaborative environmentQualifications:Graduates from top Master’s or PhD programs with a strong quantitative focus, such as Operations Research, Economics, Statistics, Sociology or Psychology, as well as graduates with a life science or business degree with a strong quantitative focusUndergraduates with at least two years of relevant full-time work experience will also be consideredExperience or keen interest in the life sciences and healthcareExcellent verbal and written communication skillsDetailed oriented and organizedExperience with business analytics or computational data analytics (“big data”) is highly desiredProficiency in the following software programs is desired: R, SAS, SPSS, STATA, Tableau, Python, C, C++, MATLAB, VBAQualified candidates with several years of relevant work experience may be considered directly for the Senior Business Analyst positionWhy should I apply to C1:Learning - At C1, we invest in our employees’ long term professional development. Working here, you will receive both formal and “on-the-job” training to help you build the skills you need to propel your career forwardGreat environment – A collegial team environment, meritocracy and openness are the drivers of our company. We are a rapidly growing consulting company and you will be in the center of it allCompensation – We offer a competitive salary plus an attractive benefits package that meets the needs of our employees and our business modelChallenging and exciting work - We consult and work with a variety of biotech and pharmaceutical clients. You will work on innovative and challenging projects that help our clients make important strategic decisions

727.desc: City Internships, a leading experiential education provider, is looking for campus ambassadors to build an immediate community of top talents at key universities. As a campus ambassador you will be responsible for developing relationships with fellow students and introducing them to the City Internships program. The perks of being a City Internships campus ambassador:•	Earn incentives for every student enrolled onto the City Internships program. Cumulative rewards include an internship placement in London, Los Angeles or New York City, accommodation in your chosen city, return fights, a MacBook Pro and more!•	The opportunity to broaden leadership, marketing, communication, entrepreneurial skills and makes a great addition to your resume. •	The opportunity to network with ambitious individuals looking to gain global professional experience.  •	Receive a recommendation letter at end of program to showcase your success.•	Free City Internships gear.What we expect from you:•	Build brand awareness and encourage fellow students to enroll in City Internships’ summer 2016 program.•	Coordinate with other on-campus groups for promotion (ex: Greek life, athletic teams, student government, cultural clubs and other societies).•	Write social media posts several times a month, and contribute to the City Internships blog.•	Update the campus ambassador manager periodically on what you accomplished.•	Distribute promotional materials.•	Addressing any questions fellow students may have about the program.•	Be creative! Come up with fun ideas to inspire fellow students to enroll in the program.

728.desc: Klara is a fundamentally new way for all medical teams to communicate with patients and colleagues in one place. Klara changes the very organization of care, radically improving efficiency, quality, and convenience of care for both doctors and patients.We are based in Berlin and New York City.healthcare, information technology, telemedicine, communications.

729.desc: The global internship program – spring 2016Launch your career with City Internships in the summer of 2016 in Los Angeles, London or New York City. The global internship program is now open for applications and will run from late February to mid-April.City Internships is a leading experiential education provider, running global internship programs in London, Los Angeles and New York.The programs include an eight-week placement, weekly career seminars, resume workshops, professional networking events and an active social calendar.Industries include:-	Banking and financial sector-	Marketing, advertising and PR-	Consulting and professional services-	Law and politics-	Tech and engineering-	Art, fashion and design-	Media and journalismWhat you will achieve- Real-world experienceLand an internship in your chosen industry that makes your resume glow and will have hiring companies lining up to meet you.- Broadened horizonsMake lasting international friendships, see what it means to travel and make a life in a new city.- Professional networkMeet like-minded go-getters and leading industry experts at exclusive networking events; invaluable connections to kick-start your career.- Improved skillsetConvert your theoretical knowledge into workplace dexterity with a slice of professional life and career-enhancing weekly seminars.- Career readinessRealize your career direction and earn the hard and soft skills that the world’s leading companies notice.What you will doWeeks 1-2: Find your feetOur team takes care of the introductions. You focus on settling into your internship, making new friends and exploring your new city. And then we take you away for the weekend on a team-building trip.Weeks 3-4: Skill upGet stuck in to your placement. Learn company processes and gain insight behind the scenes of a new industry. Join weekly City Internships business psychology and insight panel events.Weeks 5-6: Make an impactNow that you’re a familiar face at your host company, you’ll have the opportunity to dive into a project and find solutions to real problems. We’ll see you regularly at seminars and social events.Weeks 7-8: Secure your futureAs the program nears its end, it’s time to talk legacy. Many receive job offers and with others we teach you how to market your profile and put it in front of any employer out there. And then we’ll celebrate with a party.

730.desc: Technical.lyEvents Intern       ABOUT THE POSITIONThe Technical.ly news brand is the Mid-Atlantic’s premiere locally-focused technology news site network, with a national reputation. Based in Philadelphia, we currently publish Technical.ly Philly, Technical.ly Baltimore, Technical.ly Brooklyn, Technical.ly Delaware and Technical.ly DC and organize the annual Philly Tech Week and Baltimore Innovation Week. We are seeking an Events Intern to assist event staff with its events portfolio and to support our social media coverage.This Events Intern will work with Technical.ly staff to provide logistical support at events as well as provide social outreach and marketing strategy through services like Facebook, Twitter and Meetup. We expect this intern position to be an already engaged social media participant, who is familiar with different outreach strategy and follows the latest trends in reaching and engaging new and existing audiences.EXPECTED RESPONSIBILITIESSupport promotion of  events in Philly, Baltimore, Brooklyn, Delaware and DC, working with Technical.ly’s events teamAssist events team in coordinating event logisticsAssist event staff in execution of events: handling ticketing and registration, setup and breakdownAssist staff in creating and executing event marketing campaignsEngage in social media at events, including live-tweeting and photo sharingWrite event highlights before and after events to be shared on social media, and sometimes published on Technical.ly news sitesUse Twitter, Facebook, Meetup and other social media networks daily to engage new and existing audiences in creative waysWork out of University City­-based office for 10-­20 hours per week, roughly 16 in the office and occasional check-ins from homeQUALIFICATIONSPosition is ideal for someone who has an interest in community outreach, events and business development of technology news and events.Candidates should likely possess the following qualifications:Familiarity with and interest in social networkingGreat collaboration and communication skillsInterest in online journalism or media preferred, but not required.Expertise with online communications tools, social networking tools, and Google DocsKnowledge of and interest in local and national technology industries is preferred but not required.DEADLINES AND DETAILSSpring 2015: Starts Jan. 15, ends May 31Stipend: $1,000 total; $500 paid March 1 and $500 paid May 31Deadline for applications: Nov. 10, 2014Summer 2015: Starts June 15, Ends Aug. 15Stipend: $750, $375 paid July 1 and $375 paid Aug. 15Deadline for applications: March 31, 2015Fall 2015: Starts Sep. 1, Ends Dec. 15Stipend: $1,000 total; $500 paid Nov. 1 and $500 paid Dec. 15Deadline for applications: June 30, 2015ABOUT THE COMPANYTechnical.ly is a network of local technology news and events that cover how technology is making cities better. The publication shines light daily on subject matters that can help encourage job growth and retention, address broadband access and adoption, highlight creative and inspirational digital arts and improve transparency and efficiency in government using technology, while engaging the broad base of people who use technology each day.Founded in Philadelphia in 2009 by three Temple University graduates with backgrounds in journalism, the profitable publication has grown to produce a series of events in the Northeast Corridor, including the widely-publicized Philly Tech Week, which in 2014 welcomed 25,000 people across 100 events, and Baltimore Innovation Week, which in 2014 welcomed 6,000 people across 50 events.Technical.ly is published by Technically Media, a small online publishing startup with 10 full-time employees and a network of contributors.

731.desc: Do you enjoy helping people?  Do you live out of your laptop?  Is one of your many talents the ability to maintain 20 tabs up at once while simultaneously keeping up with the status of your email and texts?  How would you like to apply and develop your skills at an up-and-coming Philadelphia-based startup, with an already established and rapidly growing base of customers?  We understand how frustrating the hiring process can be for both the employer and the job seeker; at Jane we’re making hiring a better experience for everyone.What is Jane?Jane is a new kind of web-based HR service -- we’re both a people and technology company specializing in all that is hiring.  Our mission is to disrupt the hiring and recruiting space while providing some serious relief to HR managers throughout the United States.  Check out our website, https://janehires.com, to learn more about what we do.We are a strong team of innovators who are skilled in recruiting, hiring, and software development; and who love helping people and making their lives better.  Part of what we do everyday is learn about the culture of different companies, and we’re excited to add another vital role to our own culture and team here at Jane.That’s why we need you!We’re looking for a hiring assistant who has the passion for working with and helping people (in this case HR managers), interest in human resources and technology, and a hunger to learn and grow professionally.  We’re creating an extraordinary experience for the clients and candidates we interact with on a daily basis, and therefore are looking to hire an extraordinary hiring assistant.Our entire team plans to pitch in and teach the next hiring assistant, so that this person can eventually advance into the role of hiring specialist and work one-on-one with our clients.  The Jane team currently works an 8-hour day Monday through Friday, starting no earlier than 8:00 am and finishing no later than 6:00 pm (EST).What will you be doing?Directly supporting the hiring specialist in the following ways: taking notes during conference calls, entering and formatting information, scheduling interviews, answering calls and support inquiries, and relaying messages accordingly.Creating interview questions for various jobs to help build our information libraryBeing part of the campaign to drive brand awareness, website traffic, and new customersMonitoring, responding, and creating content for Jane’s communication channels, including social media and email marketing.Continuously honing your skills and knowledge of HR to support Jane’s mission and values.If you’re interested in jumping on the Jane train, apply with your resume and cover letter today -- We can’t wait to meet you!

732.company: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation Summer R
732.desc: BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF CLASSConservation Education Camp Counselors are temporary summer positions found only in the instructional camps operated by the Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC). Incumbents of these positions are responsible for the general welfare of the campers, children ages 11 to 17, and volunteers. Counselors organize and implement avariety of educational and recreational programs and activities designed to increase thecampers' awareness of environmental stewardship and related issues.CLASSIFICATION CRITERIAConservation Education Camp Counselors are employed on a temporary basis during the summer months. They supervise a small group of campers (cabin group) on a 24- hour basis, overseeing their daily activities.Incumbents are responsible for conducting workshops and leading educational activities in areas such as general ecology, aquatic ecology, the forest environment and current environmental issues. They may also lead field activities such as stream sampling for aquatic life and soil quality testing. Counselors coordinate and conduct recreational activities including canoeing, hiking, archery, fishing, swimming and hunter safety.RELATED CLASSESConservation Education Camp Director’s are responsible for developing and supervising a comprehensive training program for staff and volunteers at their camps. They set program and work schedules, make staff assignments and review and approve the Conservation Education Camp Counselors' lesson plans. They evaluate staff's work performance as well as the overall effectiveness of the program.Environmental Educator’s conduct a broad range of environmental education and interpretative programs for school youth, teachers, special groups, and the general public. Environmental Educator positions are typically year-round positions located at an Environmental Education Center or in the central office in Albany.ILLUSTRATIVE ACTIVITIES AND TASKSOrganize education, recreation and work projects.•	Meet with other camp staff to plan activities.•	Draw up daily, weekly and seasonal plans.•	Develop and implement education recreation and work projects.•	Update and evaluate activities.Conduct and supervise activities of campers on a 24-hour basis.•	Register and orient campers.•	Instruct and supervise campers in education and recreation projects such as live firing for the hunter safety education program and soil quality testing.•	Administer first aid to campers if necessary.•	Supervise waterfront activities.•	Supervise and implement overnight camp-outs. •	Provide entertainment, such as skits, singing and stories.•	Shuttle campers to and from trail heads.•	Counsel campers who become homesick or disruptive.•	Conduct safety tours with campers to inform them of potential hazards. Assist in the development and maintenance of camp construction projects.•	Participate in the set-up and breakdown of the camp.•	Assist in the purchasing, inventory and delivery of supplies, materials and equipment.•	Maintain an awareness of safety concerns in all camp activities. Facilitate a positive camp experience.•	Assist in public relations and serve as camp liaison between the program and parents/sponsors.•	Support and assist other counselors in the development and completion of camp activities.•	Maintain a positive attitude towards camp objective and processes.•	May assume authority for the administration of the camp in the absence of the Conservation Education Camp Director.INDEPENDENCE OF OPERATIONConservation Education Camp Counselors are directly supervised by a Conservation Education Camp Director who sets schedules, makes assignments, provides training, and approves and evaluates counselors' lesson plans. In addition, peer support and evaluation are provided in weekly meetings and training sessions. Counselors work essentially independently during field activities.Conservation Education Camp Counselors must possess sound judgment and decision- making abilities since they are responsible for the education, health and safety of theircampers. Errors in judgment could result in serious injury or, from a programmaticviewpoint, negatively influence the success of group lessons and activities. The Camp Program's goals and objectives can only be achieved when counselors work cooperatively to insure that maximum learning potential is nurtured.The Camp Program provides a handbook to all staff that discusses health and safety policies and procedures, environmental education lesson plans and resources, as well as other procedures for problems that commonly arise at camp.COMPLEXITYAt all times, Conservation Education Camp Counselors are responsible for the health and safety of the campers according to standards set forth by DEC and the NYS Department of Health.Conservation Education Camp Counselors perform a wide range of tasks that vary in difficulty level from planning and organizing educational programs to physically setting up and closing camp.They must develop, implement, and evaluate environmental workshops and activities which require that incumbents be knowledgeable in areas such as natural sciences, environmental studies and environmental education. Incumbents of these positions must approach problem-solving creatively while demonstrating leadership capabilities and an acute sensitivity to the ever-changing needs of young people. COMMUNICATIONConservation Education Camp Counselors communicate orally on a continual basis with the Conservation Education Camp Director, other counselors, campers, parents and sponsors. They also communicate in writing in the preparation of lesson plans, registration of campers and preparation of reports.The counselor is a parent-like figure to the campers serving as a role model, a mediator, and an educator at all times. As representatives of the Department, oral communications with campers, parents and sponsors are critical to developing trust and establishing credibility in the camper program.In addition, counselors may occasionally communicate directly with vendors, other agency personnel and Department of Health staff to obtain information pertinent to the success of their programs.SUPERVISION EXERCISEDConservation Education Camp Counselor is a non-supervisory class. However, they may directly supervise volunteers that have been assigned to their group, trip or cabin. In addition, in the absence of the Conservation Education Camp Director, a counselor may be given temporary supervisory duties over the program until such time as the Conservation Education Camp Director returns.KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY•	Working knowledge of natural resources, biological sciences, environmental studies and environmental education.•	Working knowledge of water safety instruction, canoeing, or lifeguard techniques.•	Working knowledge and interest in hunter safety instruction, archery, backpacking or camping.•	Ability to get along well with others and exhibit flexibility.•	Ability to communicate positively and energetically while motivating campers and peers.•	Ability to plan, organize, and implement environmental education programs and recreational activities.•	Ability to convey a sincere appreciation for and interest in the natural world.•	Ability to organize and lead field trips.•	Ability to instruct campers in the proper handling of tools and recreational equipment.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSConservation Education Camp Counselors must have two years of college or work experience in natural resources, biological sciences, geology, environmental studies, environmental sciences, environmental education, outdoor recreation, elementary- middle-secondary-special education, or camp management.  Conservation Education Camp Counselors must be certified in approved first aid courses as required by the NYS Department of Health, such as American Red Cross Responding to Emergencies or equivalent and in American Red Cross CPR/AED for the Professional Rescuer or equivalent.  The CPR/AED certification must be in its first year.  Depending upon individual assignments, certification in areas such as American Red Cross Water Safety Instruction or Life guard with Waterfront Module may be required.	May be required to serve as Conservation Education Camp Health Director alternate if you have a New York State Emergency Medical Technician or higher level of certification, such as licensed practical nurse, registered nurse or physician’s assistant.

733.company: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation Summer R
733.desc: Conservation Education Camp Waterfront DirectorNew York State Department of Environmental ConservationSummer Environmental Education CampsNATURE OF WORK The Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Director is a position required by the New York State Department of Health in order for a camp that has a waterfront/aquatic program to receive its operating permit. The Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Director establishes and oversees all swimming and boating activities at the camp's waterfront, supervises all staff and campers participating in swimming activities and responds to bathing and all facility emergencies.  The Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Director maintains required paperwork and equipment relating to the operation of the waterfront.  The Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Director also has Cabin Counselor responsibilities during the evenings and when not performing waterfront duties will be teaching environmental education classes to the campers. Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Director is a part of the 24 camp hour program each session from check-in to check out.CLASSIFICATION CRITERIA AND DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS  Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Directors are characterized by ensuring the safe operation of camp’s waterfront and water related activities such as swimming and boating.  Incumbents meet with camp lifeguards to test skills and to maintain the waterfront.  Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Directors make sure that all camper and staff swim tests take place and the results are recorded with the Conservation Education Camp Director and available for inspection by the Department of Health.   TYPICAL ACTIVITIES, TASKS AND ASSIGNMENTS •	Implements/oversees buddy system and board system or other approved bather accountability system•	Coordinate Lifeguard schedule with Conservation Education Camp Director for morning Polar Bear Swim•	Coordinate Lifeguard schedule with Conservation Education Camp Director for all out of camp trips•	Coordinate Lifeguard schedule with Conservation Education Camp Director for all in camp waterfront activities•	Train and supervise waterfront staff •	Participate enthusiastically in all camp activities, planning and leading those as assigned •	Participate as a member of the camp management team to plan, direct, and supervise evening programs, special events, overnights, and other all-camp activities and camp functions •	Survey waterfront area daily and keep the area free of hazards and debris•	Conduct initial and end-of-season inventory and store equipment for safety RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHERS Conservation Education Camp Waterfront Directors have frequent oral communications with all levels of the camp staff giving and receiving instructions, information and advice regarding the camp waterfront. They may also have oral and written communications with the Conservation Education Camp Director and camp staff to exchange information about the safety of the waterfront and related equipment and programs. They may also have oral communications with counselor staff, Parents and Campers explaining safe use of the waterfront and related areas. NATURE OF SUPERVISION Ability to communicate and work with groups participating (various age and skill levels) and provide necessary instruction to campers and staff. Ability to observe camper behavior and assess its appropriateness; enforce appropriate safety regulations and emergency procedures; and apply appropriate behavior-management techniques. Ability to observe staff behavior and assess its appropriateness; enforce appropriate safety regulations and emergency procedures; and apply appropriate management techniques. Visual and auditory ability to identify and respond to environmental and other hazards related to the activity. Physical ability to respond appropriately to situations requiring first aid. Must be able to assist campers in an emergency (fire, evacuation, illness, or injury) and possess strength and endurance required to maintain constant supervision of campers.  MACHINES, TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT USED Lifeguard chairRescue TubeBack BoardWhistleRescue boardFace maskFinsBuddy BoardWaterfront rope and floatsEnvironmental Education lesson materials KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESDesire and ability to work with children outdoors. Ability to schedule and supervise staff. Training and experience in a variety of program activities offered at the camp. Ability to work well with camp staff/peers in a camp environmentComfortable performing Cabin counselor duties Comfortable teaching environmental education lessons to 11 – 17 year olds.

734.desc: [the area]At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end ninjas: protecting your privacy and ensuring your security.[the role]We are accepting applications for our August 2014 program. Google's Information Technology Residency Program (ITRP) is a 26-month role designed to jumpstart your career in technology. Residents will learn what it takes to support and scale Google’s technology from our corporate infrastructure to end users. Using face-to-face and remote channels, you will be helping Googlers on all sorts of challenging support cases. You will encounter a sophisticated user base working on all major desktop and mobile operating systems (Windows, OS X, Linux, Chrome OS, Android, etc.). Interacting with people in all parts of the company will give you insight into a unique enterprise and corporate culture. The IT Residency Program offers two tracks for career growth and development. Candidates will be placed in the track and location that best fits their skills and experience. The IT Residency in Ann Arbor focuses on global remote support. At Google, we believe that a successful IT career has its foundation in user support, and this track gives you exposure to a wide range of issues by assisting Googlers around the world. You will help Google's operations evolve at scale by finding innovative ways to make support more efficient through automation and documentation. You’ll have the opportunity to spend several weeks in Google's Sydney, Australia, office, as well as a few weeks doing in-person support in different Googles offices in the US and abroad. This track is referred to as the Techstop Connect Residency (TSC). The IT Residency in New York or Mountain View focuses on in-person support in our largest US offices. You will act as a liaison between technical and non-technical groups to enhance Google's infrastructure and internal services. This residency includes two long-term rotations. You will spend three months in a different Google office—US or abroad—learning and supporting local infrastructure and users. For your second rotation, you will work on an operations team for three months. Potential rotations include networking, development, site reliability engineering and system administration. This track is referred to as the Fieldtech Residency (FTR). Whichever path you join, we will equip you with everything you need to know to support our users, as well as skills you’ll need as a future IT leader. You will receive specialized training in networking, infrastructure and multi-platform system administration, and you will develop further skills through hands-on experience in communication technology (video and voice), hardware, software development, mobile device support and project management. Once you are well-versed in key Google technologies, you will have the opportunity to seek out innovative projects that have a visible impact on the company. IT Residency alumni have advanced on to a variety of positions, both at Google and other technology companies, in roles such as networking, security, site reliability engineering, system administration and support. [Responsibilities]- Provide direct and remote support for Linux, OS X, Windows, Chrome OS and Android platforms in addition to network-based applications. - Troubleshooting of Google’s corporate resources and applications. - Develop and participate in local and world-wide IT projects and initiatives, of small to medium complexity. - Provide support for services such as video conferencing, remote access and new internal products and mobile technology. - Analyze incoming requests and create self-service documentation for Google’s internal users and the global support team.

735.desc: Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm with a focus on technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of the markets. We are a global liquidity provider and market maker, operating around the clock and around the globe, employing over 400 people in our offices in New York, London and Hong Kong. The markets change rapidly, and we need to change faster still. Every day, we come to work with new problems to solve, new systems to build, and new theories to test. Technology is at the core of how we approach that work and developers are intimately tied in to every area of the business. We are big believers in functional programming, using OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language.  We also believe  in the value of open source software, using it in our daily work and releasing hundreds of thousands of lines of our own code as open source.Interns are given the opportunity to engage in software and research projects that have real and lasting impact.  Just this year, interns have:•	Improved the propagation algorithm behind an internal parallel/incremental compute engine•	Written high performance code for decoding market data from US exchanges•	Added optimizations to the OCaml compiler to eliminate unnecessary allocations of short-lived objects, as part of a larger project to improve OCaml’s inliner•	Written a tool to efficiently estimate the risk of a continuously changing portfolio in a market crashInterns work on at least two projects in different areas, collaborating closely with full time developers. They also visit either our Hong Kong or London offices.  Interns also have access to many classes and lectures, including a speaker series that brings in some of the world’s top speakers on a broad array of topics.

736.desc: As a member of our Data Center Operations team, you will work in the Command Center of our two onsite data centers which span over 12,000 feet combined.  In this role you will provide hands-on support across a variety of technologies that include computer, network, security, server and facilities systems.  You will not be taking tickets and escalating them; you will own and troubleshoot issues that arise through to conclusion, even when any level of escalation may be necessary.  With this in mind, your role will include managing third party monitoring tools to ensure that uptime is not impacted and that the data centers are running in accordance with business needs.  You will also have the opportunity to build and deploy servers and work collaboratively with our engineering teams to deploy broad-based technical solutions within this environment.   This role offers tremendous growth both from a technical and a business perspective as our data center operations team is also exposed to supporting additional data centers and collocation sites in the Mid Atlantic region.  This team provides 24 x 7 x 365 coverage across a 4 day/11 hour shift work week with additional shifts and hours required as necessary.  The required hours for this 3rd shift opening are 10:00pm to 9:00am.What We’re Looking For:•	BS in Computer Science or Engineering, Information Technology or a similar technical major•	Minimum of two (2) years of proven experience in working with operating systems (Solaris, Windows, Linux) file systems and system hardware •	Ability to troubleshoot systems and applications in a timely manner required •	Programming experience or scripting experience (PERL, UNIX shell scripts) necessary •	Familiarity with Oracle, SQL or other database technologies a plus •	Understanding of critical IT facilities infrastructure and structured cabling•	Knowledge of financial markets, products and/or market data is a plusSIG Perks•	You can use our recently expanded gym for workouts or fitness classes (even at night and on weekends)•	Hang out in our game room that includes golf simulators, pool tables and classic video games•	We’re relaxed – you can wear jeans and sneakers every day and shorts in the summer •	You can visit our fully stocked kitchens for drinks, snacks, and breakfast. Enjoy our catered lunches every day•	Explore Philadelphia using discounts to local restaurants, museums, travel and other attractions•	We want to make your life easier so take advantage of our on-site services including the Wellness Center, barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and more•	Spend time with other SIG employees at social events including a poker tournament and sporting events in PhiladelphiaTo learn more about Technology at SIG, go to www.sig.com/technology.What We Do:SIG is a trading firm that uses the latest technology to build systems that drive our success in the markets. We rely on ingenuity, collaboration and flexibility in our engineering methods and priorities.  When we design our systems, we focus on every layer of the stack. Experts in networking, platform, security, and software work together to build our high performance software solutions.

737.desc: SIG has a job opening for a Windows Administrator (2nd Shift) to join our Platform Delivery team at our Bala Cynwyd headquarters, just outside of Center City Philadelphia. In this role, you will be responsible for executing processes related to server configuration as well as change and release management. Your role will entail building, maintaining and troubleshooting chassis Windows systems and component configurations across SIG’s enterprise environment through the use of third party and internally developed tools. Leveraging your understanding of various Windows OS distributions, registry configurations, and package installations, you will collaborate with our development, engineering, and business teams to validate and verify server requests for hardware and software. As you administer the workflow related to the delivery, deployment and maintenance of this infrastructure, you will also have the opportunity to offer suggestions to improve processes related to your efforts. You will also be involved in reviews of provisioning workflows, audits, and status reporting on server configuration and change management across the environment. This is a tremendous opportunity to gain exposure across technology teams, as well as the business itself, to ensure that this infrastructure is provisioned and maintained to meet SIG’s evolving needs. The shift for this role is 11:00am to 8:00pm.What We’re Looking For:•	BS in Computer Science or Engineering, Information Technology or a similar technical major•	Minimum of two (2) years of Windows systems administration or related work experience required•	Knowledge of Windows server-based operating systems, distributed, web, storage, telecommunication and development environments and processes required•	Knowledge of Dell and HP server hardware preferred•	Experience with scripting a plus; PowerShell preferred•	Must be able to work 11:00am to 8:00pm shiftSIG Perks•	You can use our recently expanded gym for workouts or fitness classes (even at night and on weekends)•	Hang out in our game room that includes golf simulators, pool tables and classic video games•	We’re relaxed – you can wear jeans and sneakers every day and shorts in the summer •	You can visit our fully stocked kitchens for drinks, snacks, and breakfast. Enjoy our catered lunches every day•	Explore Philadelphia using discounts to local restaurants, museums, travel and other attractions•	We want to make your life easier so take advantage of our on-site services including the Wellness Center, barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and more•	Spend time with other SIG employees at social events including a poker tournament and sporting events in PhiladelphiaTo learn more about Technology at SIG, go to www.sig.com/technology.What We Do:SIG is a trading firm that uses the latest technology to build systems that drive our success in the markets. We rely on ingenuity, collaboration and flexibility in our engineering methods and priorities.  When we design our systems, we focus on every layer of the stack. Experts in networking, platform, security, and software work together to build our high performance software solutions.

738.desc: The Quantitative Research team at SIG works with traders and software developers in the development, testing, and implementation of SIG’s proprietary trade strategies. As a Quantitative Research Associate, you will apply considerable mathematical skills in areas of: •	probability and statistics•	stochastic processes •	numerical analysis and optimization of trading derivative models•	developing and implementing computer based trading systems for large-scale trading strategies You will have the opportunity to learn from and work alongside experienced experts in the quantitative research field in an educational environment. Mentorship, classroom experiences, and a specific quantitative research speaker series contribute to the on-going education of quantitative research associates.Required Qualifications•	PhD  or equivalent academic degree required in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field•	Ability to model using large data sets •	Strong programming skills •	Excellent written and verbal communication skills•	Ability to learn quickly and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment•	Experience in at least one of the following: C/C++, C#, Python, R, MatlabPreferred Qualifications•	Working knowledge of derivatives pricing theories and data/time series analysisSIG Perks•	Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm, shorts all summer long•	Food, beverages, and snacks available all day•	Game room with golf simulators, game tables (poker, pool, ping pong, etc.), multicade classics video games, and Play Station/X-Box video area•	A 9,000 square-foot gym with cardio, cross fit and strength machines, plus yoga and indoor cycling classes•	Discounts for dining, entertainment, shopping, travel, and attractions•	Social events including a poker tournament, dinners, and sporting events in Philadelphia•	On-site Wellness Center staffed with a full-time Nurse Practitioner•	On-site services such as barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and ATMApplication Process: In order to apply and learn more about our opportunities, go to www.sig.com/campus.About SIGSIG is a global quantitative trading firm. We commit our own capital to trade equities and derivatives, including options, futures, and ETFs as well as commodities, bonds, and other financial products around the world. SIG is a place where smart, analytical people work together to trade profitably in today’s markets.

739.desc: The quantitative research internship is an opportunity to work alongside SIG’s Quantitative Research department, traders, and technologists that develop, test, and implement our trading strategies. As a quant intern, you will learn the practical and theoretical application of probability, statistics, stochastic modeling, and numerical analysis to quantitative trading strategies. You will join an educational intern program that utilizes internal mentoring, immersion, and classroom learning experiences to strengthen your quantitative and professional skills. Upon completing this internship, you will have a greater understanding of the financial industry, quantitative research applications to trade, and skills necessary to develop tools that capitalize on trading opportunities.Required Qualifications•	Pursing a PhD in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or a related field•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills •	Strong programming skills •	Ability to learn quickly and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentPreferred Qualifications•	Experience in at least one of the following: C/C++, C#, Python, R, MatlabSIG Perks•	Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm, shorts all summer long•	Food, beverages, and snacks available all day•	Game room with golf simulators, game tables (poker, pool, ping pong, etc.), multicade classics video games, and Play Station/X-Box video area•	A 9,000 square-foot gym with cardio, cross fit and strength machines, plus yoga and indoor cycling classes•	Discounts for dining, entertainment, shopping, travel, and attractions•	Social events including a poker tournament, dinners, and sporting events in Philadelphia•	On-site Wellness Center staffed with a full-time Nurse Practitioner•	On-site services such as barber, dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, and ATMApplication Process: In order to apply and learn more about our opportunities, go to www.sig.com/campus.About SIGSIG is a global quantitative trading firm. We commit our own capital to trade equities and derivatives, including options, futures, and ETFs as well as commodities, bonds, and other financial products around the world. SIG is a place where smart, analytical people work together to trade profitably in today’s markets.

740.position: 2016 Paid Summer Internship - MBA Customer Strategy
740.desc: Serious about a career in retail? Get real world experience through Burlington Stores’through our paid internship program and begin your journey into a career in the exciting world of off-price retail.  With 525 plus stores and 28,000 associates, we're always looking for great talent.  Internship positions are located in our Corporate Office in Burlington, New Jersey, a 40-minute commute to Philadelphia.  Our program runs 10 weeks from June through August.You will not only gain valuable experience through your departmental assignment.  You will learn and develop a full understanding of the off-price retail business.  Our interns say our program is “top-notch” because we execute on our promise to “wow” you every day.   Highlights of the program include:- Comprehensive Orientation		 	- Regular interaction with management- Buddy for support and guidance		 	- Group projects led by senior leaders- Leadership Development Seminars		 	- Shadowing days to explore alternative careers- Classroom training, e.g. Retail Math, Excel 		 	- Presentations by key lines of business- Store tours		 	- Interaction with other interns and departments- Group social activities		 	- Business casual environment and associate discountSome of the exciting projects you could be working on if you are selected for our Customer Strategy Internship:- Identify growth and profit improvement opportunities by providing insightful analysis and making compelling recommendations to senior management- Mine corporate data to support the strategic plans and processes related to customers, stores, site locations, capital productivity, merchandising and overall operational performance- Assist with ad hoc and pro forma / “what if “ analyses in support of potential decisions- Assist with research and analysis on internal and external environment and provide business and competitive intelligence and insights- Participate in the development of a scorecard system to measure results- Use statistical techniques to measure the effectiveness and ROI of current practices and various pilots/tests- Maintain ongoing reporting and measurement processes to enhance quality and efficiency of future decision making and monitoring including the use of forward thinking modeling designs and analytical tools

741.desc: About the jobImagine yourself organizing a town hall meeting on solar power. Or imagine releasing a hard-hitting research report on power plant pollution. Or picture yourself building a community coalition around clean water or fracking. Imagine building the organizational power—the funds, the membership, the activist base and so on—that it takes to keep all of this critical work going for the long haul.All of this is what you do as an Environment America fellow. Because this is how we build the support it takes to reduce global warming pollution, create more solar and wind power, spare our parks and forests from fracking, keep our beaches, rivers and streams clean, and protect our wildlife and wild places. Is it easy? No, we’re up against some wily opponents who are incredibly well-funded. Is it rewarding? Absolutely. And given global warming, fracking and all of the tough problems we’re facing right now, can you imagine doing anything more urgent and meaningful?What you’ll do•	Research and write reports: From cataloguing and analyzing sources of carbon pollution in the U.S., to detailing the success of the Clean Water Act, our reports help us to influence public debate and earn media attention for our cause.•	Lobby elected officials: You may discuss strategy with a champion in Congress, or make a convincing case to a legislator who is undecided on a particular vote. You’ll work the “inside game” to complement our outside field operation, where most of our power is derived.•	Build powerful coalitions: You’ll reach out to small businesses, farmers, public health officials, unions, and others to demonstrate broad-based support for our policy goals. •	Generate traditional media and social media attention: From organizing news conferences to writing opinion pieces, to maintaining a presence on Facebook and Twitter for your campaigns, you’ll work to shine a spotlight on our issues. •	Run citizen-outreach campaigns: During your two summers as a fellow, you’ll direct citizen-outreach offices, where you’ll hire and manage a staff of 20 canvassers, raise money, build our membership and help win one of our key campaigns.•	Identify and cultivate donors: You’ll reach out to foundations and major donors and ask them to fund our work to fight global warming, ban fracking, and protect our most spectacular natural areas.Beyond your first two yearsAfter two years as an Environment America fellow, you’ll have learned the ropes, gained invaluable hands-on experience and made a real difference for the environment. You’ll have skills and experience that will set you apart from most other recent college graduates. And you’ll be ready to take on even more responsibility at Environment America, as a program director or a state director for one of our affiliates.QualificationsWe’re seeking candidates committed to fighting for a green future. We look for smarts, leadership experience, top-notch written and verbal skills, and an eagerness to learn. We value experience organizing, including building campus groups.LocationsPositions available in Washington, D.C.; Boston, MA; Denver, COSalary & BenefitsSalary for this position is $25,500 in the first year and $27,000 in the second year. Environment America offers a competitive benefits package. Eligible staff receive health insurance, paid holidays, sick days, and vacation days; and the opportunity to enroll in our college loan assistance and 401(k) programs. We also offer an excellent training program and opportunities for advancement.To Learn More & Applyjobs.environmentamerica.orgEnvironment America is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, age, sex, handicap, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

742.desc: GF55 Partners in New York City is a growing mid-sized firm looking for talented and hardworking Architects at all levels for our Flatiron office. We are seeking highly motivated individuals who can work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Applicants should have a strong desire to contribute, be willing to take on responsibilities, and enjoy having a meaningful role being involved in all aspects of our work. The right candidates should be able to collaborate and communicate effectively with colleagues, clients, consultants, and contractors. Join our team if you are seeking to improve your abilities and challenge your skills. We offer a supportive and yet hardworking environment, where professional growth and development is encouraged. Compensation commensurate with qualifications and experience.The firm is based in NYC with an office in Flatiron, and a branch office in Miami Florida.  We have a general practice with particular expertise in retail, hotel, multi-family and mixed-use projects.Please email your cover letter, resume, and samples of work to info@GF55.com.

743.desc: Dentsu Aegis Network is the first truly global communications network for the digital age. Through its six global network brands – Carat, iProspect, Isobar, Posterscope, Vizeum and the Dentsu agency brand – and supported by its growing multi-market brands including Amnet, Amplifi, Data2Decisions, Dentsu media, mcgarrybowen, Mitchell Communications (PR), psLive and 360i - Dentsu Aegis Network aims to be the global network of choice for clients seeking best-in-class expertise and capabilities in brand, media and digital communications services.Companies within the Dentsu Aegis Network work with a variety of clients including, but not limited to: Burberry, Disney, General Motors, Macy's, Microsoft, Pfizer, Procter & Gamble, Red Bull, Relatvity Media, Smucker's, Staples, The Home Depot, and Sonos.Summer Internships at Dentsu Aegis NetworkDentsu Aegis Network is looking for the next generation of talented digital and media professionals!  We seek individuals that work well in a team-based, fast paced, detail-oriented environment.  Our interns demonstrate a passion for the media industry, are resourceful, and desire an opportunity to participate in advanced media planning, digital marketing, and research projects.Program highlights:	10 weeks, June through August	Receive first-hand agency exposure at one of our offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Detroit, Fort Worth, New York, San Francisco, or Santa Monica	Gain real work experience with a team at Amnet, Carat, iProspect, Posterscope, or Vizeum	Contribute ideas and insights that will benefit our clients	Partner with a Mentor in your assigned department	Attend weekly training sessions	Participate in the Intern Community Service Day	Complete a summer-long media project, presented to senior-level executives	All DAN Internships are paid

744.desc: This team is responsible for designing and implementing accelerated hardware solutions, optimizing performance, and building low latency systems.  As an engineer on our FPGA team, you will use your in depth knowledge of FPGA design and architecture to translate problems into hardware solutions. 745.desc: We continue to expand our network infrastructure and invest heavily in advancing technology. At SIG, you will gain exposure to a large and complex network topology. Our Network Services team is responsible for monitoring, maintaining and providing support for the firm’s global enterprise network.  There is always active collaboration between technology and business teams to coordinate configuration changes, provide root-cause analysis, recommend network optimizations, and participate in firm wide projects including upgrading and implementing new hardware and software. We troubleshoot issues that could include local/wide area networks, OSI Layer 1-3, wireless networks and third-party vendor connections in a multi-vendor environment across multiple Data Center locations. At SIG, you learn the most by doing. With guidance and mentoring from your team, you’ll get hands-on experience beginning on your first day. 746.desc: Reading Health System is seeking a full time CRNP to join our busy Non-Invasive CV program.  NP will work closely with physicians, monitor stress testing, follow patients through to discharge, etc.  Previous experience in a cardiac/cardiac surgical practice is required. Excellent school and robust activities make this an ideal location to raise a family.

748.desc: Stripes Group is a leading boutique growth equity firm that makes $10-100 million investments in technology and consumer businesses. Located in downtown New York with a team comprised of experienced founders and operators, Stripes Group has uniquely positioned itself to successfully invest and help build growth stage companies like Grubhub (Seamless), Refinery 29, GoFundMe, Udemy, and Blue Apron, among others. Our approach pushes the investment team to think and operate like entrepreneurs and work to assist in building remarkable businesses and brands. We lend active support to help build networks, recruit talent, offer M&A advice and support other operational elements critical to rapidly growing companies in dynamic markets that include digital media, online education, healthcare IT, e-Commerce and emerging consumer products.Through our flat structure and enterprising work environment, Summer Analysts are empowered to make an immediate impact on the team’s overall success. As fully integrated members of our investment team, Summer Analysts lead the effort to identify attractive businesses and contact entrepreneurs for investment opportunities. Summer Analysts will build relationships with CEOs and entrepreneurs, research industry segments and present investment theses to the broader team. You will actively participate in partnership meetings by providing insights and feedback as we meet new companies.  With the high level of responsibility entrusted to our Summer Analysts, you will gain the exposure necessary to develop unique quantitative and qualitative skillsets that will jumpstart your career. Responsibilities:•	Identify, contact, and meet with potential investment opportunities•	Research industry segments and discover interesting companies; present compelling opportunities to the Partners and investment team•	Meet with around 15 entrepreneurs and key executives across technology and consumer businesses each week•	Establish domain expertise within technology and consumer segments such as: enterprise software, e-Commerce, mobile gaming, digital media, food & beverage, and many more…•	Build and manage a large network of entrepreneurs, track industry news and trade journals, and attend networking events.To apply, please complete the following steps in order to be considered:•	Submit your resume via our job posting on your school’s online job board or via email (courtney@stripesgroup.com) with the subject line “2016 Stripes Group Summer Analyst Candidate”•	Complete your candidate application via https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/SGsummeranalyst2016 Candidate applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. For more information, please visit www.stripesgroup.com.

749.desc: The D. E. Shaw group seeks an extraordinarily gifted technologist to join a team providing direct technical support to the firm's chairman.  The successful candidate will work closely with our highly skilled IT systems staff and will be responsible for projects involving a wide range of technology.  Responsibilities include (but are not limited to): on-site and off-site support for all technology-related needs of the firm's chairman; researching, testing, and evaluating new technology products; installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of desktops, laptops, and mobile devices; developing custom workflow applications, and new monitoring and administration tools to automate maintenance tasks; and as-needed involvement in firm-wide technology projects not directly related to the chairman. The ideal candidate will have a computer science or engineering degree, extensive knowledge of Windows and/or UNIX environments, and some programming and scripting ability (Python, C#, PowerShell, etc.), as well as excellent verbal and written communication skills.  While we welcome applications from systems administrators with extensive track records, we are looking for exceptional technical ability and problem-solving skills more than specific experience.  Successful candidates will get broad exposure to enterprise technologies and an opportunity to collaborate on large-scale systems engineering projects.   We are seeking an exceptionally well-qualified candidate and are prepared to offer an extremely attractive compensation package.The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. We offer a collegial work environment and high-caliber colleagues from diverse backgrounds—everything from mathematicians and computer scientists to philosophers, musicians, and journalists. Our culture combines some of the best aspects of academia, finance, and technology. We pride ourselves on adhering to the highest standards of ethics and performance, but in our offices you’ll see more flip-flops than suits—we have no dress code, and our meritocratic culture gives employees the opportunity to make significant contributions early on in their careers. If you’re intellectually curious, energized by ambitious goals, and willing to take on a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you.	Interested students should apply directly through our website at: https://www.deshaw.com/recruit/jobs/Ad/UPenn/STCMembers of the D. E. Shaw group do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

750.desc: Connecting Today's Technologists to Tomorrow's OpportunitiesFidelity Investments is seeking the best and brightest minds, with a passion for technology, to join our Summer 2016 Technology Internship Program.  A technology internship at Fidelity will help you develop the technical, professional, and interpersonal skills that will be valuable throughout your career.  Working side by side with the best technologists in the industry, you will do real and meaningful work that has a direct impact on our business and customers.  In addition to real work experience, the Internship Program also provides personal and career development opportunities as well as a robust summer series of events and various networking opportunities across the organization for the duration of the internship assignment.  Here at Fidelity, we invest a significant amount of resources in technology – now let us invest in YOU! Opportunities exist in:  RTP, NC; Westlake, TX; Boston, MA; Smithfield, RI; Merrimack, NH; Covington, KY; Jersey City; NJ; New York; NY, and Salt Lake City, UT. Internship roles include:• Software Engineering:  work within Software Development Lifecycle focused on systems analysis, design, development, testing and support of software applications (Java).  Web application development using HTTP server, Web Services and Open Source technologies (Linux, Struts, Spring MVC, Hibernate and iBatis ORM)• Systems Analysis:  business requirements elicitation and specification and project management duties designing, building, analyzing enhancements for web-based applications.  System design specification including UI design.• Quality Assurance Engineering:  unit Testing, System Integration Testing, Test planning design.  Testing and project management skills using agile and waterfall software development methodologies.• Data Engineering:  Database creation, development, and data manipulation using SQL and PL/SQL (Oracle RDBMS).• Mainframe Development:  utilize Mainframe development technologies including: COBOL, TSO, JCL, DB2, VSAM and DB2 stored procedures.• Technology Infrastructure Engineering:  evaluate, test, and implement technology solutions core to the firm’s ability to provide the best products and services to our customers. Education and Experience• Current enrollment in a B.S. degree program in Computer Science or other IT related degree, or other major with a technical minor/concentration• Matriculating student returning to school in the Fall of 2016 as an undergraduate Skills and Knowledge• Basic foundation in OO design• Understanding of Relational Databases• Experience with relational DB access, SOAP or REST services in Java a plus• Basic SQL and/or UNIX is desirable Company OverviewAt Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want— from the 23 million people investing their life savings, to the 20,000 businesses managing their employee benefits programs, to the10,000 advisors and institutions needing innovative technology solutions to invest their clients’ money. To do this well, as a privately held company, we place a high degree of value in nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to being an employer of choice. For more information about Fidelity Investments, visit https://www.fidelity.com/about-fidelity/overview. For information about working at Fidelity, visit https://jobs.fidelity.com/.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

751.position: Marketing & Business Development Intern – Part Time
751.desc: About Prospect Forum:Prospect Forum is a Philadelphia-based career-consulting venture. Our mission is to empower college and graduate students to take full control of their career path, gain a deep understanding of the current job market, and ultimately achieve their career goals. We're dedicated to the professional success of college and graduate students across.We offer a range of professional services, including resume and cover letter editing, behavioral and technical interview coaching, case study practice, and job application consultations. We organize on-campus career events and workshops, focusing on topics chosen by the student community.Responsibilities:- Devise and implement a marketing campaign that leads to business generation- Research the target market to inform marketing strategy development- Research marketing strategies of other players in the market to provide recommendations that give Prospect Forum a competitive edgeBenefits of this internship:- References and recommendation letter upon successful completion of the internship- Opportunities to add and create value in an organization and solve real problems- Develop and implement your own marketing campaign- Real experience that you can include in your resume and discuss with future, potential employersFor more information about this opportunity, contact harry@prospectforum.com

752.desc: Pop! Promos, a rapidly growing promotional products company, is looking to expand its sales team with the addition of an sales administrative assistant.  This is the perfect opportunity for an administrative professional to explore a career in sales.  The assistant will work with our VP of Midwest Sales, to help to grow sales within the Midwest and our business as a whole.Wanting to shake up the $25 billion promotional products industry, Pop! Promos founders Sterling Wilson and Erin Reilly are continuing to grow and expand their startup in Philadelphia. Pop! Promos was included as a member of the Philadelphia 100 fastest growing companies in 2015.  We specialize in producing custom-made promotional products for both profit and non-profit companies across North America.  Top selling products include sunglasses, touchscreen gloves, and cellphone accessories.Keeping an eye on brand integrity and providing clients with custom solutions are two important aspects to this position.  As a small business, we are seeking out new entrepreneurial team members who want to invest their time in learning the ins and outs of our company to help grow and build our business.This is a full time, entry-level position.  Typically, administrative assistants can expect a promotion to account executive within 12 months based on performance.  The company is rapidly growing and expects to double in size over the same time period.  Our office is a team environment and as such we celebrate milestones with after hours events such as happy hours, bowling and other activities.Primary Duties:• Prospecting for new clients• Processing new orders• Providing clients with product and order information over email and phone• Handling customer service requests from clients• Following up with existing clients• Instructing design team on product design for individual projects• Organizing client purchase orders and entering order information in automated CRM system• Communicating with production team to ensure client orders are delivered on timeEssential Requirements• College Degree with GPA over 3.5• Strong written communication skills• Comfortable talking on the phone• Analytical mindset• Competitive attitude• Team player

753.desc: You are eligible to apply to this position if you are currently a Computer Science major pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree and looking for a software engineering internship in the summer of 2016.MongoDB is seeking Computer Science students with a strong background in CS theory and systems, to join us in building the next revolution in database technology at our New York City headquarters.All of our interns are overseen by one or more of our engineers who act as mentors. You’ll gain practical real world programming experience. Our interns are fully integrated software engineers who spend the summer pushing code, building exciting applications, products, internal tools, and more.Our Software Engineering internship has two tracks:1. Join one of our engineering teams and work alongside an engineer(s) on various tasks. We have over 10 unique engineering teams available to join2. Work on a project or application end to endOur summer program is comprehensive and interactive - you won’t sit behind a desk all day. We have social outings (think team dinners, baseball games, NYC sightseeing, and more) and an intern speaker series where you’ll hear from some of the most significant and important people in tech today. You’ll gain insight into what makes a billion dollar company run. At the end of the summer you’ll be a better software engineer and a more informed citizen of the world.

754.desc: Investment Banking Analyst or AssociateInvestment Banking / M&A in Financial Services:Boutique investment bank seeks professional with 1-4 years of M&A experience. We offer unlimited growth potential as a key part of a busy and highly-regarded firm, and accordingly, many opportunities for expedited professional development.Company Expertise:Greenberg Advisors is the leading investment bank to the Healthcare / Revenue Cycle Management and Accounts Receivable Management industries, and related sectors of Business Process Outsourcing and Specialty Finance. The firm’s primary services are M&A and Capital Raising advisory.Ideal Candidate:We are actively seeking an Analyst or Associate to join our team. Candidates must demonstrate professionalism and client management skills together with strong technical, written and verbal communication skills. As a busy firm, the work is fast paced and intense. The ability to work under tight deadlines, be adaptable and work both independently and as part of a team are essential traits of a successful candidate. The ideal candidate will possess skills in both sales/marketing as well as finance. We want sharp, organized, outgoing, ethical people, who produce high-quality results, and who like being part of a small, collegial team.Responsibilities will reflect experience level, and will include (among others):• Working with the firm's senior deal makers to support and lead various aspects of client engagements, business development, marketing activities and day-to-day operations.• Participating in all aspects of transactions, from pitching clients to closing deals.• Leading the firm’s data expansion efforts to oversee and improve its database of contacts.• Creating offering memoranda and pitch books, financial analysis/modeling, marketing idea creation/execution, participating in conference calls and meetings.• Training and mentoring junior staff and/or interns.• Ensuring first-rate deliverables for internal and external end-users. Attention to detail and the ability to self-edit are critical.Qualifications:• Candidate must have the following experience:         o Analyst: At least 1 year of M&A employment strongly preferred.                  • Candidates with less than 1 year of full-time M&A employment, but that have passed a “Wall Street Prep” or similar course, will be considered.         o Associate: At least 2-3 years of M&A employment.• Articulate, with excellent communication/presentation skills• Attention to detail• Advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint to perform responsibilities• Ability to effectively, and maturely, interact with senior executives and business owners• Personable and upbeat disposition• Team player who is self-motivated to learn and grow quicklyLocation: Rockville, MD (suburb of Washington, DC)Compensation: Base Salary + BonusTo apply, please e-mail a cover letter, résumé, Excel and PowerPoint sample to Brian Greenberg at bgreenberg@greenberg-advisors.com. The PowerPoint sample can cover any topic, but most importantly, it should exhibit the skills that we can expect from the candidate.Only candidates seeking near-term employment and meeting the above criteria should apply.For more information about the firm please visit our website: www.greenberg-advisors.com.

755.desc: Technical.lyBusiness Intern       ABOUT THE POSITIONThe Technical.ly news brand is the Mid-Atlantic’s premiere locally-focused technology news site network, with a national reputation. Based in Philadelphia, we currently operate in 5 exciting markets: Philly, Brooklyn, Baltimore, D.C. and statewide in Delaware. We are best known for our community journalism, our Philly Tech Week and Baltimore Innovation Week event series, and the quarterly events we organize in all of our markets. We are seeking a business intern.This intern will work with Technical.ly business staff to execute its strategic business plan by maintaining and growing existing business and prospecting new business in several markets along the Northeast Corridor. We expect this intern to assist in driving revenues by selling advertising, underwriting and events to local, regional and national brands in technology and related industries.This person ideally has experience in and a willingness to experiment with new media and is interested in supporting and learning from a journalistic enterprise. Plus, as a small, growing startup, we’re probably more fun than your traditional internship.***Expected Responsibilities:-Work closely with Technical.ly staff to execute strategic business plan by reaching out to new and existing partners to share sponsorship and partnership opportunities-Work alongside Technically Media editorial and business staff to develop marketing campaigns and opportunities -Help maintain relationships with sponsors and partners-Provide basic customer support to client base as necessary-Help plan, market and execute events-Work out of University City-based office for 15-20 hours per week***Other information-We offer a modest cash stipend in addition to college credit hour completion. See details below.-Though work location is flexible for this position, the intern will be required to work in the University City-based office at least one to two days per week-Should be available evenings and weekends as required for events***DeadlinesSpring 2016: Starts Jan. 15, ends May 31Stipend: $1,000 total; $500 paid March 1 and $500 paid May 31Deadline for applications: Nov. 10, 2015Summer 2016: Starts June 15, Ends Aug. 15Stipend: $750, $375 paid July 1 and $375 paid Aug. 15Deadline for applications: March 31, 2016Fall 2016: Starts Sep. 1, Ends Dec. 15Stipend: $1,000 total; $500 paid Nov. 1 and $500 paid Dec. 15Deadline for applications: June 30, 2016***InstructionsInterested individuals should contact Brian James Kirk at brian@technical.ly. Please submit a resume, cover letter (with 2-3 references) and examples of your work.ABOUT THE COMPANYTechnical.ly [http://technical.ly] is a network of local technology news and events that cover how technology is making cities better. The publication shines light daily on subject matters that can help encourage job growth and retention, address broadband access and adoption, highlight creative and inspirational digital arts and improve transparency and efficiency in government using technology, while engaging the broad base of people who use technology each day.Founded in Philadelphia in 2009 by three Temple University graduates with backgrounds in journalism, the profitable publication has grown to produce a series of events in the Northeast Corridor, including the widely-publicized Philly Tech Week, which in 2014 welcomed 25,000 people across 100 events, and Baltimore Innovation Week, which in 2014 welcomed 6,000 people across 50 events.Technical.ly is published by Technically Media [technicallymedia.com], a small online publishing startup with 10 full-time employees and a network of contributors.
