765.desc: The goal of our summer internship program is to expose talented candidates to the projects and environment associated with full-time work in quantitative analysis and software development at the D. E. Shaw group. Interns interact with various trading groups and gain valuable work experience while demonstrating their skills on a variety of real-world projects. For quantitative analyst interns, these projects might include applying sophisticated numerical techniques and writing software to develop and analyze statistical models for our computerized financial trading strategies, or researching financial literature to identify new trading ideas and creating simulations to test them. Software development interns work closely with full-time employees to build tools for the analysis of financial instruments as well as to design and deploy real-time, scalable applications for the firm’s highly automated trading activities. Working closely with quants, developers, and other senior staff as mentors, interns can expect an environment conducive to learning. In addition, numerous social events give interns the opportunity to interact with colleagues and learn about the firm as a whole. Successful candidates have traditionally been the top students in their respective math, physics, engineering, computer science, and other technical and quantitative programs.The D. E. Shaw group is a globally prominent investment and technology development firm based in New York City, with offices around the world. 766.desc: Serious about a career in retail? Get real world experience through Burlington Stores’ nationally recognized intern program.  With 550 plus stores, an E-commerce site and 30,000 associates, and growing, we're always looking for great talent.  Corporate Internship positions are located in our Corporate Offices in Florence and Edgewater Park, New Jersey, located between Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Princeton, New Jersey.  Store Management Intern positions are located in the store closest to the student’s home.  Through Burlington Stores’ summer intern experience, you will not only gain knowledge and skills through your departmental assignment, you will gain a full understanding of working in the fun and fast-paced world of off-price retail.  Our comprehensive program provides you the opportunity to work side by side with leaders in the industry.  Our interns proclaim our program to be “top-notch” because we execute on our promise to “wow” you every day.  Highlights of the program include:-Comprehensive Orientation	-Regular interaction with the leadership team-Buddy for support and guidance		-Involvement in Community Service Projects-Leadership Development Seminars		-Shadowing days to explore alternative careers-Classroom training, e.g. Retail Math, Excel 		-Presentations by key lines of business-Store tours		-Interaction with other interns and departments-Group social activities		-Business casual environment & associate discount	Success of our program is measured by the number of interns who receive offers and join us as full-time associates. We are proud to say our results are outstanding. We offer exciting real world experience in the following areas:	 -Buying-Planning and Allocation-Store Management	-E-Commerce/Marketing-Energy Management	 -Finance-Information Technology-Supply Chain Management-Strategy (MBA only)

767.desc: Serious about a career in retail?  Bring your passion for fashion to Burlington by entering our Assistant Buyer Development Program.  If you love working in an environment where no two days are the same and competition to win is what drives you, consider joining one of the largest off price retailers of apparel and home furnishings in the nation.  Our buying and planning and allocation teams work hard to ensure we always have a large selection of quality name brand merchandise at huge savings ready for our customers.  Whether its coats, clothing and shoes for the entire family, fashionable accessories, home decor, and everything for baby, we are always out looking to make the deal that will bring great value to our customers.   With 550 plus stores, an E-commerce site and 30,000 associates, and growing, we're always looking for talent that can drive results.  Corporate positions are located in our Corporate offices in Florence, New Jersey, located between Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Princeton, New Jersey. As you begin your journey as an Assistant Buyer, you will start by going through a hands-on 12-week on-boarding program where you will be trained on the off-price model, technical skills and be exposed to all the resources available to ensure you are successful once placed.  You will be assigned a mentor to help you along the way.   Training includes shadowing buying teams both in the market and in the office, interaction with senior leadership and classroom and on-line courses.  You will also learn about cross functional areas, e.g. Planning & Allocation, Supply Chain, etc. that make an impact on your business.  At the conclusion you are placed in a business area where you will be part of the team that contributes significantly to the achievement of sales and gross margin. Our Merchandising career path is clearly defined and you can look forward to exciting growth opportunities as you develop your merchant skills.Duties may include:  -Select and procure merchandise in conjunction with Buyer in the assigned area of responsibility -Provide operational support to Buyers -Attend market visits to select and negotiate product that meets the customer’s needs and is priced competitively.  -Independently build vendor relationships. Establish a positive relationship in order to effectively influence vendors. This includes heavy interaction with vendors to solve problems and follow-up -Analyze business, including selling reports; to provide recommendations to the buyer -Maintain planned receipt flow on a consistent basis and track when merchandise is being received -Use judgment to make flow issue call outs to buyer when needed -Ensure adherence to scheduled shipping windows and negotiate late shipping discounts

769.desc: JOB DESCRIPTIONThis is an unpaid, remote, part-time internship (10+ hours a week, minimum 2 months) in SWIFT and you will be guided by our VP of engineering from NASA. Depending on performance and commitment, your internship may turn into paid contracts or even full time employment early next year. We are based in San Francisco, CA.PRODUCTBabyNoggin offers parents real time feedback about their baby’s development, so that early attention can be given to any problem areas, based on validated clinical research from elite universities such as Oxford and Berkeley.BabyNoggin is a preventative online tool to monitor and track your baby’s brain development from birth to age one. Within minutes you can screen your baby at the comfort of your home. The app offers an easy and fun way to interact with your baby and track his or her development.WHY US?Interested in helping parents understand their baby development- using modern technology? We are developing a mobile platform based on validated clinical research to guid parents one step at a time to assess their baby's development.Join us to disrupt the the $186 Billion pediatrics market in the US and a team of experts from healthcare VC, BabyCenter, and PwC.

770.desc: Software Development Interns have exceptional software development skills and a quantitative major.  Proficiency with C or C++ on Linux is preferred.  Python is a plus.Five Rings offers an intensive summer internship program for rising seniors and other students entering their last year of study.  The program includes immersion in both hands-on projects and classroom instruction. Five Rings offers a casual atmosphere, flat structure and great benefits.  Our experienced traders and software developers teach new employees extensively, both hands-on and in classroom settings. Our firm is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, and progress can be rapid for those ready to meet the challenges that await them. We look for candidates who learn quickly and are comfortable in such an environment.  Regardless of the position, you must be careful, detail-oriented and possess good communication skills. Successful candidates have typically been top students from elite math, physics, computer science and engineering programs.﻿Five Rings is a proprietary trading firm founded with a vision of combining strategy, innovation and technology to succeed in today’s global markets.  Based in New York, we trade in various domestic and international markets, both established and esoteric.  Five Rings does not depend on clients or outside investors.  Our team constantly seeks new opportunities, analyzes their risks and rewards, and creates strategies and tools to capitalize on them.  The strength of our firm comes from the talent of our people, and our compensation packages reflect this belief. ﻿ Five Rings offers a casual atmosphere, flat structure and great benefits.  Education is a priority.  Our experienced traders and software developers teach new employees extensively, both hands-on and in classroom settings.  Our young firm is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, and progress can be rapid for those ready to meet the challenges that await them.No experience necessary.

773.desc: If you care about the environment and want to make a difference, apply to be a PennEnvironment intern today.All applications must be submitted through our online form: http://jobs.environmentamerica.org/intern.html What do interns with PennEnvironment do?You’ll help us educate and engage citizens on the most critical environmental issues of our time. You’ll help us get our issues into the media, build coalitions, organize events, and lobby decision-makers. Ultimately, you’ll help us build the kind of public support it takes to win our campaigns.Our Campaigns •	We’re doing our part to stop global warming: We took a big step forward when President Obama directed his Environmental Protection Agency to develop standards that would cut carbon pollution from power plants, the nation’s largest contributors to global warming pollution. This historic step won’t be enough to fully solve the problem, but it’s an important start. Unfortunately, one of the most powerful special interests in the world -- the fossil fuel industry -- is standing in the way, at every step. That’s where we come in. We’re working to rally millions of American citizens, along with local elected officials and other powerful voices to back the President’s plan and get it over the finish line.  •	We’re making sure we don’t frack our future: Dirty and dangerous fracking is risking our families’ health, contaminating our water, and turning our treasured landscapes into industrial zones. We know that this especially destructive method of drilling for gas pollutes our air and contributes significantly to global warming. We’re working to offset the outsized influence of the oil and gas industry and keep our public health, environment, and communities protected from fracking’s dangerous impacts. This fall we are launching our new Protect Our Children campaign to defend children -- an especially vulnerable population -- from the worst effects of fracking.•	We’re working to protect our rivers, lakes and streams:  To protect our waterways from pollution and destruction, we need to crack down on factory farm pollution, sewage, and other threats. And we know it won’t be easy because of big opposition from developers, giant agribusiness, and other polluters. We’re working to harness the huge grassroots support for clean water and turn it into the political power we need to have a lasting direct impact on our waterways.Becoming a PennEnvironment internIf you agree that it’s time to solve these big environmental problems, the best thing you can do to get involved is to apply to be a PennEnvironment today. We’re looking for students who care deeply about the environment and are ready to make a difference now. As an intern:o	You’ll learn how to analyze environmental problems, push for smart solutions, and build the public support it takes to win.o	You’ll work side-by-side with one of our advocates to learn the ropes.o	You'll attend briefings and trainings to learn even more about environmental issues and gain organizing skills.And if you’re thinking you might want to make a career out of campaigning to solve big environmental problems like global warming, interning with PennEnvironment is one of the best ways to get started. Not only will you get the training and experience you need, we hire our most talented and committed interns to join our team when they graduate. Our entry-level Campaign Organizer position is a two-year crash course in environmental activism, organizing, advocacy and the type of institution building that can sustain long-term battles. We’re hiring interns in Philadelphia and Pittsburgh. Apply today!All applications must be submitted through our online form: http://jobs.environmentamerica.org/intern.html

774.desc: ClassiCorps is a highly selective three-year program designed for recent college graduates or career changers of all backgrounds seeking to enter the teaching profession. ClassiCorps members begin as salaried teachers and simultaneously earn a fully-subsidized Master's Degree in Teaching at Relay Graduate School of Education, where they learn essential classroom skills and qualify for a permanent New York State certification. ClassiCorps Teachers also receive extensive in-classroom development and training, and quickly become successful members of our faculty. After earning their Master's in Teaching, ClassiCorps members enter their third year as Permanently Certified, Highly Qualified, and highly skilled teachers, receiving an annual salary of at least $70,000.Position SummaryAll our teachers share the undying belief that maximizing student achievement is their primary goal. Our teachers have a razor-sharp focus on the school’s mission and the drive to meet their key responsibilities:-	Leading all scholars to gap-closing academic gains. Scholars must achieve mastery and advanced mastery of grade-level Common Core State Standards to succeed to and through college.-	Establishing and maintaining a “no-excuses,” highly ordered classroom culture where scholars and staff demonstrate respect, responsibility, caring, trustworthiness, fairness, and citizenship.Our teachers work relentlessly to achieve these challenging, mission-critical goals. Successful teachers:-	Study, practice, and execute lessons that lead students to master daily standard-aligned objectives, faithfully using our rigorous, classical curriculum.-	Revise lessons for clarity, rigor and relevance, with guidance from instructional coaches.-	Collect and analyze academic and behavior data to pinpoint scholar needs.-	Collaborate in teams and with coaches to resolve challenges and implement instructional improvements driven by quantitative and qualitative data.-	Proactively seek and implement feedback from team leaders and instructional coaches to improve their practice.Above all, our teachers care deeply about their scholars, who inspire them to achieve life’s greatest joy: doing good work well.CompensationDuring the first two years of the program, ClassiCorps members earn an annual salary of $46,000. Classical Charter Schools also covers the tuition and required expenses for coursework at Relay Graduate School of Education. Upon successful completion of the program, in their third year, ClassiCorps members earn a minimum salary of $70,000. Throughout the program, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401(K) matching.

775.desc: Promotional Products Account Executive Job Description:Brucelli Advertising Co. Inc., a regional distributor of branded promotional products and apparel seeks an experienced account manager in the Philadelphia/Delaware Valley area. This position will require a great deal of new-business development. The ability to cold-call, and build an account base from the ground up will be critical to this individual's success. The account executive will be calling on companies of all sizes, and must be proactive in identifying the decision maker and purchasing authority within each client's organizational structure.A strong background in selling promotional products and apparel in a B2B environment is highly desirable. Lacking that, a background in selling advertising or marketing products will be considered.Compensation for this role will be directly tied to performance, and earning capabilities are uncapped. Brucelli Advertising will provide all of the necessary resources to make this individual successful, but the intrinsic motivation to achieve account growth is an absolute necessity.Required Skills for Promotional Products Account Executive Job:	OUTSIDE SALES 	INTERNET ADVERTISING SALES 	COLD CALLING 	NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
